text: previous research ha shown that relaxation intervention can reduce distress anxiety and depression the exact mechanism that underlie the efficacy of relaxation intervention remain unresolved this study aimed to investigate whether applied relaxation ar lead to change in cortisol secretion and whether these effect mediate fewer symptom due to ar data come from a randomized controlled preventive interventional trial n 277 with elevated tension distress anxiety or depressive symptomatology participant were randomized to an intervention group ig n 139 received ar training or a non interventional control group cg n 138 psychopathological symptom were assessed with das 21 and diagnosis of mental disorder via dia x 5 cortisol wa measured a short term index in saliva six time d for 2 d at pre post and follow up fu assessment and long term index in hair sample once at pre assessment and fu respectively data were analyzed a pre specified secondary analysis of the randomized controlled trial rct on completer basis n 134 cg n 102 ig using multivariable adjusted linear regression model and mediation analysis the das 21 change in the ig v cg with cortisol area under the curve auc a mediator from pre to post assessment total daily salivary cortisol auc decreased more strongly in the ig v cg beta coefficient 13 83 95 confidence interval ci 26 85 to 0 81 but wa rendered non significant when adjusting for pre assessment auc this effect wa not found for the cortisol awakening response car or hair cortisol there wa no evidence for a mediation of cortisol auc these finding provide little support for the idea that cortisol reduction explain the beneficial effect of ar on mental health

the partial n methyl d aspartate receptor agonist d cycloserine may enhance psychological therapy however it exact mechanism of action is still being investigated cognitive bias modification technique allow isolation of cognitive process and thus investigation of how they may be affected by d cycloserine we used a cognitive bias modification paradigm targeting appraisal of a stressful event cognitive bias modification appraisal to investigate whether d cycloserine enhanced the modification of appraisal and whether it caused greater reduction in index of psychopathology participant received either 250 mg of d cycloserine n 19 or placebo n 19 a a stressor task participant recalled a negative life event followed by positive cognitive bias modification appraisal training before and after cognitive bias modification appraisal appraisal and index of psychopathology related to the stressor were assessed cognitive bias modification appraisal successfully modified appraisal but d cycloserine did not affect appraisal post training there were no post training group difference in frequency of intrusion interestingly d cycloserine led to a greater reduction in distress and impact on state mood from recalling the event and lower distress post training wa associated with fewer intrusion therefore d cycloserine may affect emotional reactivity to recalling a negative event when combined with induction of a positive appraisal style but via a mechanism other than enhanced learning of the appraisal style

youth in conflict affected region are exposed to a multitude of traumatic event these individual often witness violence experience it firsthand and in some case become perpetrator the interplay of event shape systematic trauma history that may have unique implication for youth mental health in a cross sectional study conducted in eastern democratic republic of congo drc we interviewed 295 war affected youth 63 4 boy m age 16 70 year including former child soldier n 171 regarding their traumatic experience and mental health using latent class analysis we identified four common trauma history class categorized by a low exposure b medium exposure c high exposure and d high exposure perpetration across the sample gradual increase in trauma load corresponded with increased vulnerability to posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd symptom eta p 2 36 and internalizing problem eta p 2 12 however only youth from the high exposure perpetration class differed significantly from other youth in their level of externalizing problem eta p 2 13 and offending behavior eta p 2 17 a longer time in armed group wa related to a higher risk of both experiencing and perpetrating violence the result indicate that it is not child soldier status per se but the perpetration of violence that reinforces a cycle of violence in conflict affected society by contributing to increased externalizing problem and offending behavior in conflict region integrated approach are needed to address both trauma and externalizing problem of war affected youth

lack of insight and delusional thinking are hallmark of a series of psychological disorder such a psychotic disorder and body dysmorphic disorder bdd the purpose of the present study wa to evaluate the german version of the clinician administered brown assessment of belief scale babs am j psychiatry 1998 155 e102 e108 which consists of 7 item assessing the degree of delusionality in the individual s disorder related belief e g the person behind me is staring at me my nose look disgusting specifically the original babs wa translated and back translated according to established translation guideline and administered in 70 individual diagnosed with bdd internal consistency a well a convergent and divergent validity wa high suggesting that the german version of the babs is a reliable and valid instrument to ass delusional thinking in psychological disorder such a bdd

despite their immense relevance the neurocognitive mechanism underlying real life self control failure scfs are insufficiently understood whereas previous study have shown that scfs were associated with decreased activity in the right inferior frontal gyrus rifg a region involved in cognitive control here we consider the possibility that the reduced implementation of cognitive control in individual with low self control may be due to impaired performance monitoring following a brain a predictor approach we combined experience sampling of daily scfs with functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri in a stroop task in our sample of 118 participant proneness to scf wa reliably predicted by low error related activation of a performance monitoring network comprising anterior mid cingulate cortex presupplementary motor area and anterior insula low posterror rifg activation and reduced posterror slowing remarkably these neural and behavioral measure predicted variability in scfs beyond what wa predicted by self reported trait self control these result suggest that real life scfs may result from deficient performance monitoring leading to reduced recruitment of cognitive control after response that conflict with superordinate goal

objective modern conceptualization suggest the independence of positive and negative mental health construct research of positive construct in psychotherapy is scarce this study analyzed the development of patient strength during psychotherapy and whether pre therapy strength incrementally predict treatment outcome method two hundred and two patient 56 44 female mean age 42 49 treated by 54 therapist underwent cognitive behavioral therapy patient strength in different context a well a psychopathology interpersonal problem and self esteem were assessed at the beginning and end of therapy result strength increased in the context of everyday life evdays d 0 44 p 0 001 and current problem probs d 0 70 p 0 001 strength in the context of previous crisis that were managed successfully crisess did not change however baseline score of crisess were a significant incremental predictor of all outcome conclusion a differentiated assessment of positive construct is useful for outcome prediction and the implementation of strength based intervention

contextual information can modulate the conditioned response to a threat signal conditioned stimulus c fear response are either potentiated or attenuated depending on whether the context is threatening or safe in this study we investigated the influence of context on conditioned fear a well a on generalization of conditioned fear thirty two participant underwent a cue in context learning protocol in virtual reality vr on day 1 acquisition participant received a mild painful electric shock unconditioned stimulus u in one virtual room fear context ctx at the offset of one colored light c but never at the offset of another colored light c in a second room safety context ctx the two light were also presented but not the u successful cue conditioning wa indicated by aversive rating and startle potentiation but not skin conductance response scr to c versus c in ctx and not in ctx on day 2 generalization participant re visited both fear and safety context plus a generalization context g ctx which wa an equal mix of ctx and ctx the two cs were shown again in all three context generalization of conditioned fear wa revealed in affective rating c wa rated more aversive than c in g ctx but not in physiological measure equal startle potentiation to c versus c in all context in sum contextual information modulates the response to a threat signal such that a safety context can inhibit conditioned fear interestingly generalization process also depend on contextual information

social threat detection is important in everyday life study of cortical activity have shown that event related potential erps of motivated attention are modulated during fear conditioning the time course of motivated attention in learning and extinction of fear is however still largely unknown we aimed to study temporal dynamic of learning process in classical fear conditioning to social cue neutral face by selecting an experimental setup that produce large effect on well studied erp component early posterior negativity epn late positive potential lpp stimulus preceding negativity spn and then exploring small consecutive group of trial epn lpp and spn markedly and quickly increased during the acquisition phase in response to the c but not the c these change were visible even at high temporal resolution and vanished completely during extinction moreover some evidence wa found for component difference in extinction learning with difference between c and c extinguishing faster for late a compared to early erp component result demonstrate that fear learning to social cue is a very fast and highly plastic process and conceptually different erps of motivated attention are sensitive to these change at high temporal resolution pointing to specific neurocognitive and affective process of social fear learning

previous literature established a link between major depressive disorder mdd and altered reward processing a well a between empathy and observational reward learning the aim of the present study wa to ass the effect of mdd on the electrophysiological correlate the feedback related negativity frn and the p300 of active and observational reward processing and to relate them to trait cognitive and affective empathy eighteen patient with mdd and 16 healthy control performed an active and an observational probabilistic reward learning task while event related potential were recorded also participant were assessed with regard to self reported cognitive and affective trait empathy relative to healthy control patient with mdd showed overall impaired learning and attenuated frn amplitude irrespective of feedback valence and learning type active v observational but comparable p300 amplitude in the patient group but not in control higher trait perspective taking score were significantly correlated with reduced frn amplitude the pattern of result suggests impaired prediction error processing and a negative effect of higher trait empathy on feedback based learning in patient with mdd

this study examined psychometric property of figure rating scale particularly the effect of ascending silhouette ordering in 153 child 9 to 13 year old two version of collins s 1991 figural rating scale were presented the original scale figure arranged ascendingly and a modified version randomized figure ordering rating of current and ideal figure were elicited and body dissatisfaction wa calculated all child were randomly assigned to one of two subgroup and completed both scale version in a different sequence there were no significant difference in figure selection and body dissatisfaction between the two figure ordering regarding the selection of the current figure result showed that girl are more affected by the silhouette ordering than boy our result suggest that figure rating scale are both valid and reliable whereby correlation coefficient reveal greater stability for ideal figure selection and body dissatisfaction rating when using the scale with ascending figure ordering

abstract background this study aimed to develop a german version of the family expressiveness questionnaire feq halberstadt 1983 1986 which investigates emotional expressiveness within the family context while growing up while a theoretically derived four factor structure wa postulated 2 and 3 scale version have been applied in research method in study 1 n 650 these existing model were tested against each other a confirmatory factor analysis wa conducted for the solution that best fitted the data with half of the sample and result were cross validated in the other half construct validation wa investigated in study 2 n 225 result an acceptable model fit for a three factor solution wa attained in study 1 in study 2 correlation pattern indicated a good convergent and discriminant validity reliability estimate in both study were in an acceptable to excellent range conclusion finding suggest that the feq german version is a psychometrically sound instrument for assessing expressiveness within the family

background and objective attention avoidance of feedback related stimulus is proposed to be associated with and maintain social anxiety however previous research ha mainly focused on comparing the attention bias between two type of stimulus while little is known about attention distribution pattern among positive neutral and negative feedback and non feedback stimulus in individual with high trait social anxiety hsa or low trait social anxiety lsa method the current study assessed eye movement pattern of participant with hsa or lsa during a speech task high anxiety condition or while solely watching audience feedback of the speech low anxiety condition a pre recorded audience who displayed approving neutral or disapproving gesture wa presented a feedback stimulus while neutral facial photo were used a non feedback stimulus result only in the high anxiety condition participant with hsa exhibited longer total fixation on non feedback stimulus compared to those with lsa whereas in the low anxiety condition both group paid more attention to emotional feedback stimulus limitation the final sample size wa modest due to a high suspicion rate of the reality of the audience conclusion these finding suggest that only in highly anxious social situation socially anxious individual lack the attentional preference toward positive feedback that individual with low anxious have

abstract background child with selective mutism sm are consistently unable to speak in certain social situation due to an overlap between sm and social anxiety disorder sad in child similar mechanism could apply to both disorder especially biased attentional processing of threat and fear induced reduced visual exploration referred to a attentive freezing appear promising in sm method a total of n 84 child 8 12 year sm n 28 sad n 28 typical development td n 28 participated in an eye tracking paradigm with video of a social counterpart expressing a question a social evaluation or a neutral statement we investigated gaze behavior towards the social counterpart s eye region and the extent of visual exploration length of scanpath across condition result there were no group difference regarding gaze behavior on the eye region neither gaze behavior with respect to the eye region nor visual exploration were dependent on the video condition compared to child with td child with sm generally showed le visual exploration however child with sad did not conclusion reduced visual exploration might be due to the mechanism of attentive freezing which could be part of an extensive fear response in sm that might also affect speech production intervention that counteract the state of freezing could be promising for the therapy of sm

working memory wm performance decline with age however several study have shown that wm training may lead to performance increase not only in the trained task but also in untrained cognitive transfer task it ha been suggested that transfer effect occur if training task and transfer task share specific processing component that are supposedly processed in the same brain area in the current study we investigated whether single task wm training and training related alteration in neural activity might support performance in a dual task setting thus assessing transfer effect to higher order control process in the context of dual task coordination a sample of older adult age 60 72 wa assigned to either a training or control group the training group participated in 12 session of an adaptive n back training at pre and post measurement a multimodal dual task wa performed in all participant to ass transfer effect this task consisted of two simultaneous delayed match to sample wm task using two different stimulus modality visual and auditory that were performed either in isolation single task or in conjunction dual task a subgroup also participated in functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri during the performance of the n back task before and after training while no transfer to single task performance wa found dual task cost in both the visual modality p 0 05 and the auditory modality p 0 05 decreased at post measurement in the training but not in the control group in the fmri subgroup of the training participant neural activity change in left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc during one back predicted post training auditory dual task cost while neural activity change in right dlpfc during three back predicted visual dual task cost result might indicate an improvement in central executive processing that could facilitate both wm and dual task coordination

anxiety is often characterised by an overestimation of the contingency between concern relevant and aversive stimulus and an amplified aversiveness of such aversive stimulus here we tested whether outcome aversiveness causally enhances contingency estimate twenty four participant were exposed to neutral visual cue which were followed by startle sound the loudness and hence the aversiveness of the cue wa determined by the cue colour while the likelihood of the startle sound always remained constant 50 result indicated an illusory correlation specifically for the cue followed by the most aversive startle sound a reflected in enhanced on line and a posteriori covariation estimate this bias wa positively correlated with state and trait anxiety physiological arousal measured by pupil diameter wa enhanced in response to the most aversive startle sound confirming it distinct processing in conclusion these result suggest that aversive outcome may induce illusory correlation most likely in anxious person and explain previous finding of illusory correlation in anxiety disorder

touch can be highly emotional and depending on the environment it can be perceived a pleasant and comforting or disgusting and dangerous here we studied the impact of context on the processing of tactile stimulus using a functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri paradigm this wa achieved by embedding tactile stimulation in a variable olfactory environment twenty people were scanned with bold fmri while receiving the following stimulus block slow stroking touch civette odor feces like rose odor touch civette and touch rose rating of pleasantness and intensity of tactile stimulus and rating of disgust and intensity of olfactory stimulus were collected the impact of the olfactory context on the processing of touch wa studied using covariance analysis coupling between olfactory processing and somatosensory processing area wa assessed with psychophysiological interaction analysis ppi a subjectively disgusting olfactory environment significantly reduced the perceived pleasantness of touch the touch fmri activation in the secondary somatosensory cortex operculum 1 op1 wa positively correlated with the disgust towards the odor decreased pleasantness of touch wa related to decreased posterior insula activity ppi analysis revealed a significant interaction between the op1 posterior insula and region processing the disgust of odor orbitofrontal cortex and amygdala we conclude that the disgust evaluation of the olfactory environment moderate neural reactivity in somatosensory region by upregulation of the op1 and downregulation of the posterior insula this adaptive regulation of affective touch processing may facilitate adaptive reaction to a potentially harmful stimulus

oral contraceptive oc and endogenous female sex hormone in naturally cycling woman nc are related to a wide range of psychological variable eg cognition and affect little research on social behavior ha been done one study documented a tendency towards more prosocial behavior in nc than oc woman but the underlying neuroendocrine mechanism remain unknown the sex hormone progesterone and estradiol are potential candidate we analyzed social decision making and social behavior in 83 healthy woman 38 oc and 45 nc via the social value orientation svo and in real social interaction within a paradigm adapted from behavioral economics we also measured empathy and collected saliva sample to quantify the basal level of estradiol and progesterone our analysis revealed higher level of prosocial behavior and emotional empathy in nc than in oc woman a finding supported by higher level of prosocial decision in nc than oc woman in the svo regarding the underlying biological mechanism we detected lower progesterone level in oc than nc woman exploratory analysis revealed a negative correlation between progesterone and trust on the trend level we found no correlation between estradiol and behavior our finding provide evidence that oc modulate social behavior and initial indication of a possible modulation by progesterone further research is needed to replicate our finding and extend them to other social behavior

background although chronic depression is associated with lower global functioning and poorer treatment response than episodic depression little is known about the difference between these two form of depression in term of psychological factor thus the present study aimed at differentiating chronic and episodic depression regarding cognitive behavioral and emotional avoidance that have been proposed a important risk factor for depression and promising target for the treatment of depression method thirty patient with early onset chronic depression were compared with 30 patient with episodic depression and 30 healthy never depressed control in term of self reported cognitive behavioral social and non social and emotional avoidance result chronically depressed patient reported more avoidance than healthy control in each of the measure moreover they reported more cognitive nonsocial and behavioral nonsocial a well a behavioral social and emotional avoidance in the form of restricted emotional expression to others than patient with episodic depression this kind of emotional avoidance also separated best between chronically and episodically depressed patient furthermore general emotion avoidance and behavioral social avoidance were positively correlated with level of depression in chronically depressed patient limitation the result are based on self report data and should thus be interpreted with caution additionally the cross sectional design limit any causal conclusion conclusion the finding underscore the relevance of cognitive behavioral and emotional avoidance in differentiating chronic from episodic depression and healthy control and advocate a stronger focus on maladaptive avoidance process in the treatment of chronic depression

judgment of well being is formed on the spot and we know little about it foundation we aimed at examining the role of comparison standard in informing evaluation of well being in a clinical and a nonclinical sample in a semi structured face to face interview individual seeking psychological treatment and healthy control individual rated how they have been feeling in general and relative to specific comparison standard and were each time invited to substantiate their rating independent coder assessed number type direction and specificity of reported comparison when asked to explain why they chose a particular rating of their well being 93 of clinical participant and 61 of nonclinical participant spontaneously reported some type of comparison standard both group reported highest well being rating relative to social and past temporal comparison and lowest relative to prospective temporal comparison furthermore clinical participant engaged in more upward than downward comparison whereas this wa not the case for healthy control participant our finding suggest that evaluation of well being are informed by different comparison type and that individual with clinical complaint use more comparison when evaluating their well being the result encourage further investigation of comparative thinking a an underlying mechanism of judgment of well being and ill being

the perception of pain to noxious stimulus also known a pain sensitivity varies among individual the comprised brain structure and their white matter pathway are complex and elusive here we aimed to investigate whether variation of microstructure of the medial forebrain bundle mfb a tract connecting the basal forebrain with the brain stem is associated with interindividual pain sensitivity we assessed interindividual pain sensitivity a a rating of pain intensity to heat stimulus 45 47 and 48 9 degree c in 38 healthy men age 27 05 5 7 year we also reconstructed the mfb using multitensor tractography from diffusion magnetic resonance imaging dmri and calculated free water corrected dmri measure of fractional anisotropy fa t radial diffusivity rd t and axial diffusivity ad t lower rating of interindividual pain intensity correlated with higher fa t and lower rd t of the mfb a change in fa t and rd t may reflect abnormality in myelination the result might be interpreted a that a lower pain rating is associated with higher degree of myelination of the mfb and could represent an inhibitory pathway of pain our result suggest that alteration of microstructure in the mfb contributes to the interindividual variation of pain perception

background major depressive disorder mdd is characterized by a high risk for relapse and chronic development clinical characteristic such a residual symptom have been shown to negatively affect the long term course of mdd however it is unclear so far how trait repetitive negative thinking rnt a well a cognitive and affective momentary state the latter experienced during daily life affect the long term course of mdd method we followed up 57 remitted depressed rmdd individual six t2 and 36 t3 month after baseline clinical outcome were time to relapse time spent with significant symptom a a marker of chronicity and level of depressive symptom at t2 and t3 predictor assessed at baseline included residual symptom and trait rnt furthermore momentary daily life affect and momentary rumination and their variation over the day were assessed at baseline using ambulatory assessment aa result in multiple model residual symptom and instability of daily life affect at baseline independently predicted a faster time to relapse while chronicity wa significantly predicted by trait rnt multilevel model revealed that depressive symptom level during follow up were predicted by baseline residual symptom level and by instability of daily life rumination both instability feature were linked to a higher number of anamnestic mdd episode conclusion our finding indicate that trait rnt but also affective and cognitive process during daily life impact the longer term course of mdd future longitudinal research on the role of respective aa phenotype a potential transdiagnostic course modifier is warranted

perceptual integration of sensory input from our two nostril ha received little attention in comparison to lateralized input for vision and hearing here we investigated whether a binary odor mixture of eugenol and l carvone smell of clove and caraway would be perceived differently if presented a a mixture in one nostril physical mixture v the same two odorants in separate nostril dichorhinic mixture in parallel we investigated whether the different type of presentation resulted in difference in olfactory event related potential oerp psychophysical rating showed that the dichorhinic mixture were perceived a more intense than the physical mixture a tendency for shift in perceived quality wa also observed in line with these perceptual change the oerp showed a shift in latency and amplitude for early more sensory peak p1 and n1 whereas no significant difference were observed for the later more cognitive peak p2 the result altogether suggest that the peripheral level is a site of interaction between odorants both psychophysical rating and for the first time electrophysiological measurement converge on this conclusion

social exclusion affect mental and physical health the ability to regulate emotional response to social exclusion is therefore essential for our well being a individual difference in detecting bodily signal interoceptive sensitivity is have been associated with the ability of emotion regulation we aimed at exploring whether is foster coping with social exclusion and flexibility in emotion regulation the first study investigated subjective feeling and behavioral affiliation tendency in response to ostracism using a cyberball paradigm sixty nine participant were assessed who differed with respect to is the second study examined habitual emotion regulation process focusing on suppression and reappraisal a well a is in 116 participant main result were that the effect of ostracism on distress and behavioral affiliation tendency were qualified by is being ostracized had le impact on participant with stronger is furthermore study 2 revealed that is wa associated with habitually stronger emotion regulation strategy we conclude that having access to bodily signal help is reducing aversive state provoked by social exclusion probably due to the fact that is is associated with emotion regulation strategy

background and objective dual process model posit that addictive behavior are characterized by strong automatic process that can be assessed with implicit measure the present study investigated the potential of a cognitive bias modification paradigm the approach avoidance task aat for retraining automatic behavioral tendency in cigarette smoking method the study wa set up a an online intervention after completing an online survey 257 smoker were randomly allocated either to one of two experimental condition aat or a waitlist control group participant responded to different picture by pushing or pulling the computer mouse depending on the format of the picture picture in portrait format depicted smoking related item and were associated with pushing picture in landscape format depicted neutral item and were associated with pulling one version of the aat provided individual feedback after each trial whereas the standard version did not after four week participant were re assessed in an online survey result analysis revealed that the standard aat in particular led to a significant reduction in cigarette consumption cigarette dependence and compulsive drive no effect wa found in the control group limitation interpretability of the study is constrained by the fact that no active control condition wa applied conclusion notwithstanding the limitation our finding indicate that the aat might be a feasible instrument to reduce tobacco dependence and can be applied a an online intervention future study should investigate whether the effect of behavior therapy can be augmented when combined with retraining intervention

this is the first study to investigate multiple cognitive bias in adolescence simultaneously to examine whether anxiety and depression are associated with bias in attention and interpretation and whether these bias are able to predict unique variance in self reported level of anxiety and depression a total of 681 adolescent performed a dot probe task dpt an emotional visual search task evst and an interpretation recognition task attention and interpretation bias were significantly correlated with anxiety mixed result were reported with regard to depression evidence wa found for an interpretation bias and for an attention bias a measured with the evst but not with the dpt furthermore interpretation and attention bias predicted unique variance in anxiety and depression score these result indicate that attention and interpretation bias are unique process in anxiety and depression they also suggest that anxiety and depression are partly based on similar underlying cognitive mechanism

this study investigates if anodal and cathodal transcranial direct current stimulation tdcs of area above the motor cortex c3 influence spontaneous motor imagery experienced in the waking resting state a randomized triple blinded design wa used combining neurophysiological technique with tool of quantitative mentation report analysis from cognitive linguistics the result indicate that while spontaneous motor imagery rarely occurs under sham stimulation general and athletic motor imagery classified a athletic discipline is induced by anodal tdcs this insight may have implication beyond basic consciousness research motor imagery and corresponding motor cortical activation have been shown to benefit later motor performance electrophysiological manipulation of motor imagery could in the long run be used for rehabilitative tdcs protocol benefitting temporarily immobile clinical patient who cannot perform specific motor imagery task such a dementia patient infant with developmental and motor disorder and coma patient

anxiety disorder have been linked to a hyperactivated cortico amygdalar circuitry recent finding highlight the amygdala s role in mediating elevated anxiety in obsessive compulsive disorder ocd however modulation of amygdala hyperactivation by attentional distraction an effective emotion regulation strategy in healthy individual ha not yet been examined while undergoing functional magnetic resonance imaging twenty one unmedicated ocd patient and 21 control performed an evaluation and a distraction task during symptom provocation with individually tailored ocd relevant picture to test the specificity of response additional aversive and neutral stimulus were included significant group by picture type interaction were observed within fronto striato limbic circuit including the amygdala in these region patient showed increased bold response during processing of ocd trigger relative to healthy control amygdala hyperactivation wa present across ocd symptom dimension indicating that it represents a common neural correlate during distraction we observed dampening of patient amygdala hyperactivity to ocd relevant stimulus augmented amygdala involvement in patient during symptom provocation present across ocd symptom dimension might constitute a correlate of fear expression in ocd linking it to other anxiety disorder attentional distraction seemed to dampen emotional processing of disorder relevant stimulus via amygdala downregulation the clinical impact of this strategy to manage anxiety in ocd should be further elucidated

the etiology of the irritable bowel syndrome ibs is unexplained biological psychological and social factor must be considered this study examined if difference in hpa axis activity already exist in those who do not yet fulfill ibs criterion i e subthreshold ibs we also investigated whether there were difference between those who reported clinically relevant i e distressing ibs symptom and those who did not thirty six woman were subdivided into three group ibs group subthreshold ibs group control group result showed difference in morning cortisol level u 11 58 p 0 05 with ibs patient showing a lower cortisol response compared to control subthreshold ibs patient were comparable to control regarding endocrine function diurnal cortisol level did not differ between group group comparison between distressed subject and non distressed subject regarding cortisol level did not reach significance the finding of endocrine abnormality at least in a sub set of patient is important since these might be associated with deficient pain processing in ibs

to date there is only scarce evidence for a considerable association of subjective and objective stress measure which might be attributable to method bias e g confounding and or asynchrony of their temporal change to validate different subjective stress measure by a physiological measure of long term stress hair cortisol concentration hcc 37 heterosexual couple n 74 completed a 12 week internet based assessment protocol comprised of a weekly hassle scale whs once per week a perceived stress scale ps once per month and a chronic stress scale tic once after three month partner provided vicarious stress rating when averaged across time self reported whs significantly predicted hcc r 0 27 whereas the ps and tic did not r 0 22 dynamic factor analysis i e state space modelling confirmed that whs wa the most valid indicator of subjective stress explaining up to 16 of the variance in hcc r 0 37 with a time lag of 4 week this temporally delayed effect of subjective stress is consistent with the presumed retrospective character of hcc but also suggests that the majority of variance in hair cortisol is attributable to other cause than subjective stress such a individual disposition to display increased adrenocortical activity

conventional treatment for mood disorder primarily focus on reducing negative affect but little on enhancing positive affect loving kindness meditation lkm is a traditional meditation practice directly oriented toward enhancing unconditional and positive emotional state of kindness towards oneself and others we report here two independent and uncontrolled study carried out at different center one in boston usa n 10 and one in frankfurt germany n 8 to examine the potential therapeutic utility of a brief lkm group intervention for symptom of dysthymia and depression result at both center suggest that lkm wa associated with large sized effect on self reported symptom of depression d 3 33 and 1 90 negative affect d 1 98 and 0 92 and positive affect d 1 63 and 0 94 large effect were also found for clinician reported change in depression rumination and specific positive emotion and moderate effect for change in adaptive emotion regulation strategy the qualitative data analysis provide additional support for the potential clinical utility of the intervention this proof of concept evaluation of lkm a a clinical strategy warrant further investigation

cognitive theory of hypochondriasis hyp suggest that catastrophic misinterpretation of benign body sensation are a core feature for the maintenance of the disorder there is tentative support from an analog sample that the interpretation of illness related information also involves an implicit affective component this is the first study to examine this negative affective evaluation bias implicitly in patient with hyp an adapted version of the affect misattribution procedure amp with illness symptom and neutral prime wa used in 80 patient with hyp and compared to 83 patient with an anxiety disorder ad a well a 90 healthy control cg the hyp group showed significantly more negative affective reaction in illness prime trial compared to both control group a well a more negative implicit evaluation on symptom prime trial compared to the cg significant inverse relationship were observed only between the implicit evaluation of illness word and health anxiety questionnaire thus an implicit negative affective evaluation bias of serious illness rather than symptom is a unique feature of hyp

the hedonic meaning of word affect word recognition a shown by behavioral functional imaging and event related potential erp study however the spatiotemporal dynamic and cognitive function behind are elusive partly due to methodological limitation of previous study here we account for these difficulty by computing combined electro magnetoencephalographic eeg meg source localization technique participant covertly read emotionally high arousing positive and negative noun while eeg and meg were recorded simultaneously combined eeg meg current density reconstruction for the p1 80 120 m p2 150 190 m and epn component 200 300 m were computed using realistic individual head model with a cortical constraint relative to negative word the p1 to positive word predominantly involved language related structure left middle temporal and inferior frontal region and posterior structure related to directed attention occipital and parietal region effect shifted to the right hemisphere in the p2 component by contrast negative word received more activation in the p1 time range only recruiting prefrontal region including the anterior cingulate cortex acc effect in the epn were not statistically significant these finding show that different neuronal network are active when positive versus negative word are processed we account for these effect in term of an emotional tagging of word form during language acquisition these tag then give rise to different processing strategy including enhanced lexical processing of positive word and a very fast language independent alert response to negative word the valence specific recruitment of different network might underlie fast adaptive response to both approach and withdrawal related stimulus be they acquired or biological

self focused attention sfa is considered a cognitive bias that is closely related to depression however it is not yet well understood whether it represents a disorder specific or a trans diagnostic phenomenon and which role the valence of a given context is playing in this regard computerized quantitative text analysis offer an integrative psycho linguistic approach that may help to provide new insight into these complex relationship the relative frequency of first person singular pronoun in natural language is regarded a an objective linguistic marker of sfa here we present two study that examined the association between sfa and symptom of depression and anxiety in two different context positive v negative valence a well a the convergence between pronoun use and self reported aspect of sfa in the first study we found that the use of first person singular pronoun during negative but not during positive memory recall wa positively related to symptom of depression and anxiety in patient with anorexia nervosa with varying level of co morbid depression and anxiety in the second study we found the same pattern of result in non depressed individual in addition use of first person singular pronoun during negative memory recall wa positively related to brooding i e the assumed maladaptive sub component of rumination but not to reflection these finding could not be replicated in two sample of depressed patient however non chronically depressed patient used more first person singular pronoun than healthy control irrespective of context taken together the finding lend partial support to theoretical model that emphasize the effect of context on self focus and consider sfa a a relevant trans diagnostic phenomenon in addition the present finding point to the construct validity of pronoun use a a linguistic marker of maladaptive self focus

experienced rejection rejection sensitivity and borderline trait were examined rejection sensitivity mediated the relation between rejection and borderline trait social support wa identified a additional significant mediator we hypothesize rejection sensitivity to be a crucial factor in the etiology of bpd experience of rejection in childhood play an important role in the etiology of borderline personality disorder bpd additionally individual who report borderline symptom report high level of rejection sensitivity the current study aimed to disentangle the relationship between experience of rejection rejection sensitivity and borderline characteristic therefore we retrospectively assessed experience of parental and peer rejection collected data of self reported rejection sensitivity and social support and prospectively investigated borderline characteristic in a sample of 193 student result indicated that rejection sensitivity fully mediated the previously significant relationship between experience of parental rejection and borderline characteristic whereas peer rejection maintained a significant effect on borderline trait social support wa identified a a protective factor result indicated a crucial role of rejection sensitivity in borderline symptomatology

background multidisciplinary treatment approach are commonly used in specialized psychosocial centre for the treatment of traumatized refugee but empirical evidence for their efficacy is inconsistent objective in order to obtain more evidence on the development of mental health and well being of traumatized refugee who receive multidisciplinary treatment symptom course of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd anxiety depression and somatoform symptom a well a in the subjective quality of life were investigated in the course of a multidisciplinary treatment in addition it wa analysed if sociodemographic variable were predictor for possible change in symptomatology and quality of life method n 76 patient of the outpatient clinic of a psychosocial centre for traumatized refugee receiving regular multidisciplinary treatment were surveyed using standardized questionnaire at three measurement point at the beginning of treatment and after an average of 7 and 14 month of treatment in a single group design result multilevel analysis showed significant improvement of symptom of ptsd p 001 depression p 001 anxiety p 001 and somatoform symptom p 002 a well a of the subjective quality of life p 001 over time among the tested predictor gender age country of origin age wa a significant predictor for the course of somatoform symptom p 05 younger patient showed greater improvement in symptomatology over time than older one conclusion the result suggest that the received multidisciplinary treatment had a positive effect on trauma related symptom a well a on quality of life of traumatized refugee there wa no indication that sociodemographic characteristic predicted the symptom course of the patient except for somatoform symptom younger patient benefitted more from multidisciplinary treatment than older one

the outbreak of covid 19 ha significantly restricted people s everyday life and contributed to enhanced social medium use smu the present study investigated the relationship of burden caused by covid 19 and addictive smu data were assessed in a sample of 550 user of social medium age m sd 27 08 6 74 from germany via online survey in spring 2020 in a moderated mediation analysis the positive association between burden and addictive smu wa significantly mediated by the level of perceived sense of control anxiety symptom significantly moderated the relationship between sense of control and addictive smu specifically the link between both variable wa significant only for medium and high level of anxiety symptom the present finding disclose the mechanism that can contribute to the development of addictive tendency during the pandemic outbreak potential practical implication and way of how the negative consequence of burden caused by covid 19 might be prevented are discussed

background the implementation of evidence based practice ebp in mental health care confers many benefit to patient and research into factor facilitating the implementation of ebp is needed a an important factor affecting the implementation of ebp service provider attitude toward ebp emerged the evidence based practice attitude scale ebpas 36 is an instrument with good psychometric characteristic that measure positive and ambivalent attitude toward ebp however a german version is missing the present study therefore aim to provide a validated german translation of the ebpas 36 method the scale wa translated and back translated a recommended by standard procedure german psychotherapist were recruited to participate in an online survey they provided demographic and professional information completed the ebpas 36 the implementation climate scale ic and the intention scale for provider isp standard item and reliability analysis were conducted construct validity wa evaluated with exploratory efa and confirmatory factor analysis cfa in two subsamples random split convergent validity wa tested by predicting a high positive correlation of the ebpas 36d with two score of attitude of the isp and an interest in ebp score it wa tested whether the ebpas 36d predicts the intention to use ebp result n 599 psychotherapist participated in the study the item analysis showed a mean item difficulty of p i 0 64 a mean inter item correlation of r 0 18 and a mean item total correlation of r itc 0 40 the internal consistency wa very good for the total scale alpha 0 89 and ranged from adequate to very good for the subscales 0 65 0 89 indicating high reliability the original factor structure showed an acceptable model fit rmsea 0 064 90 ci 0 059 0 068 srmr 0 0922 aic 1400 77 confirming the 12 factor structure of the ebpas 36 however a second order factor structure derived by the efa had an even better model fit rmsea 0 057 90 ci 0 052 0 062 srmr 0 0822 aic 1274 56 when the ebpas 36d wa entered in a hierarchical regression model with the criterion intention to use ebp the ebpas 36d contributed significantly to the prediction change in r 2 0 28 p 0 001 over and above gender age and participant report of ever having worked in a university context conclusion the present study confirms good psychometric property and validity of a german version of the ebpas 36 in a sample of psychotherapist

stress may potentiate the chronification of nicotine addiction but the exact mechanism remain elusive we performed an explorative pilot study examining the effect of psychological stress administered via the socially evaluated cold pressor task secpt on implicit approach bias for smoking related cue in smoker in the approach avoidance task aat smoker n 24 were subjected to the stress or control condition of the secpt by using a within subject design consistent with previous finding a strong approach bias for smoking related cue in the aat wa found in smoker exposure to stress did not affect the general bias for smoking related cue in the aat relative to the control condition of the secpt in additional explorative analysis an interaction among carbon monoxide co level in expired air cortisol level and stress on approach bias for smoking related cue wa found higher co level possibly due to recent smoking prior to stress exposure were associated with an approach bias for smoking related cue our result suggest that co level in interaction with stress can modulate implicit automatic processing in the context of nicotine addiction our finding might provide novel cue to how stress influence cigarette craving and smoking behavior

abstract suicidal ideation and behavior are common in those suffering from posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd the present study investigated factor buffering the association between ptsd symptom and suicidal ideation behavior a total of 571 iranian student and 421 german student took part in the investigation social support and positive mental health pmh were considered a resilience factor moderating the association between ptsd symptom and suicide ideation behavior within both sample pmh moderated the impact of ptsd symptom on suicidal ideation behavior in iranian and german student social support moderated the impact of ptsd symptom on suicidal ideation behavior in iranian student only positive mental health and perceived social support seem to confer resilience and should be taken into account when assessing individual for suicide risk

the sexual excitation sexual inhibition inventory for woman and men sesii w m and the sexual excitation scale sexual inhibition scale short form si s sf are two self report questionnaire for assessing sexual excitation se and sexual inhibition si according to the dual control model of sexual response se and si differ between individual and influence the occurrence of sexual arousal in given situation extreme level of se and si are postulated to be associated with sexual difficulty or risky sexual behavior the present study wa designed to ass the psychometric property of the german version of both questionnaire utilizing a large population based sample of 2 708 participant mage 51 19 sd 14 03 overall psychometric evaluation of the two instrument yielded good convergent and discriminant validity and mediocre to good internal consistency the original 30 item version of the sesii w m did not show a sufficient model fit for a 24 item version of the sesii w m partial strong measurement invariance across gender and strong measurement invariance across relationship status age and educational level were established the original structure 14 item 3 factor of the si s sf wa not replicated however a 4 factor model including 13 item showed a good model fit and strong measurement invariance across the before mentioned participant group for both questionnaire partial strong measurement invariance with the original american version of the scale wa found a some factor showed unsatisfactory internal consistency and the factor structure of the original scale could not be replicated score on several se and si factor should be interpreted with caution however most analysis indicated sufficient psychometric quality of the german sesii w m and si s sf and their use can be recommended in german speaking sample more research with diverse sample i e different sexual orientation individual with sexual difficulty is needed to ensure the replicability of the factor solution presented in this study

previous research revealed an automatic behavioral bias in high socially anxious individual hsas although their explicit evaluation of smiling face are positive they show automatic avoidance of these face this is reflected by faster pushing than pulling of smiling face in an approach avoidance task aat heuer et al 2007 the current study addressed the causal role of this avoidance bias for social anxiety to this end we used the aat to train hsas either to approach smiling face or to avoid them we examined whether such an aat training could change hsas automatic avoidance tendency and if yes whether aat effect would generalize to a new approach task with new facial stimulus and to mood and anxiety in a social threat situation a video recorded self presentation we found that hsas trained to approach smiling face did indeed approach female face faster after the training than hsas trained to avoid smiling face moreover approach face training reduced emotional vulnerability it led to more positive mood and lower anxiety after the self presentation than avoid face training these result suggest that automatic approach avoidance tendency have a causal role in social anxiety and that they can be modified by a simple computerized training this may open new avenue in the therapy of social phobia

objective amotivation is a common symptom in various mental disorder including psychotic or depressive disorder effort based decision making ebdm task quantifying amotivation at a behavioral level have been on the rise task performance ha been shown to differentiate patient group from healthy control however finding on indicator of construct validity such a the correlation between different task and between task and self reported observer rated amotivation in clinical and healthy sample have been inconclusive method in a representative community sample n 90 we tested the construct validity of the deck choice task the expenditure for reward task and the balloon task we calculated correlation between the ebdm task and between the ebdm task and self reported amotivation apathy anticipatory pleasure and bi ba result correlation between task were low to moderate 0 198 r 0 358 with the balloon task showing the largest correlation with the other task but no significant correlation between any ebdm task and the self report measure conclusion although different ebdm task are conceptualized to measure the same construct a large part of what each task measure could not be accounted for by the other task moreover the task did not appear to substantially capture what wa measured in established self report instrument for amotivation in our sample which could be interpreted a questioning the construct validity of ebdm task

rationale although there is evidence that impaired executive functioning play a role in addictive behavior the longitudinal relationship between the two remains relatively unknown objective in a prospective longitudinal community study we tested the hypothesis that lower executive functioning is associated with more addictive behavior at one point in time and over time method three hundred and thirty eight individual 19 27 year 59 female from a random community sample were recruited into three group addictive disorder related to substance n 100 or to behavior n 118 or healthy control n 120 at baseline participant completed nine executive function task from which a latent variable of general executive functioning gef wa derived addictive behavior i e quantity and frequency of use and number of dsm 5 criterion met were assessed using standardized clinical interview at baseline and three annual follow ups the trajectory of addictive behavior were examined using latent growth curve modeling result at baseline we found weak to no evidence of an association between gef and addictive behavior we found evidence for an association between a lower gef at baseline and a higher increase in the quantity of use and a smaller decrease in frequency of use over time but no evidence for an association with an increase in the number of dsm 5 criterion met conclusion lower efs appear to lead to a continuing loss of control over use whereas addictive disorder may develop secondarily after a long period of risky use previous etiological model assuming lower ef a a direct vulnerability factor for addictive disorder need to be refined

fear response are typically not limited to the actual threatening stimulus but generalize to other stimulus resembling the threatening stimulus although this fear generalization is generally adaptive fear overgeneralization is maladaptive and assumed to contribute to anxiety disorder despite the clinical relevance of fear over generalization how the extent of fear generalization is modulated remains not well understood based on the known effect of stress on learning and memory we tested here the impact of major stress mediator glucocorticoid and noradrenergic arousal on fear generalization in a laboratory based placebo controlled double blind between subject design 125 healthy participant first underwent a fear conditioning procedure about 24 h later participant received orally either a placebo hydrocortisone the alpha2 adrenoceptor antagonist yohimbine leading to increased noradrenergic stimulation or both drug before a test of fear generalization skin conductance response a well a explicit rating data revealed that yohimbine intake led to enhanced fear memory expression i e an enhanced responding to the c but not to stimulus resembling the c moreover neither enhanced safety learning nor a mere enhancement of perceptual discrimination ability could explain this result in contrast to yohimbine hydrocortisone had no significant effect on fear memory these finding suggest that noradrenergic arousal strengthens fear memory expression and have important implication for mental disorder in which the overgeneralization of conditioned fear is prominent

objective most of the observed association of androgen and sex hormone binding globulin shbg with subclinical cardiovascular disease cvd stem from selected study sample with immunoassay based hormone measurement thus we used a large population based sample with total testosterone tt and androstenedione asd concentration measured by liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry design data of 2140 individual mean age 60 8 year from the cohort study of health in pomerania were assessed at baseline and 5 year follow up method multivariable regression model were implemented to ass cross sectional and longitudinal association of tt free testosterone ft asd shbg and dehydroepiandrosterone sulphate dheas with measure of subclinical cvd including intima medium thickness imt carotid plaque left ventricular mass lvm fractional shortening f relative wall thickness rwt and left ventricular geometry result cross sectional analysis yielded an association of tt with imt in woman beta coefficient per log unit increase 0 02 95 ci 0 007 0 45 and asd with f in both sex men beta coefficient 2 94 95 ci 4 75 1 12 woman beta coefficient 1 64 95 ci 0 55 2 73 in longitudinal analysis dheas wa positively associated with f change beta coefficient 2 34 95 ci 0 59 4 08 in woman shbg wa positively associated with incident plaque q1 v q3 ref beta coefficient 1 35 95 ci 1 04 1 74 in both sex longitudinal analysis showed no consistent association of tt with subclinical cvd conclusion despite several sex specific association of androgen and shbg with subclinical cvd the present representative study for the age group 45 year among men and woman from the general population detected no consistent association in longitudinal analysis

spatially caricatured face were recently shown to benefit face learning schulz et al 2012a moreover spatial information may be particularly important for encoding unfamiliar face but le so for recognizing familiar face kaufmann et al 2013 to directly test the possibility of a major role of reflectance information for the recognition of familiar face we compared effect of selective photorealistic caricaturing in either shape or reflectance on face learning and recognition participant learned 3d photographed face across different viewpoint and different image were presented at learning and test at test performance benefit for both type of caricature were modulated by familiarity benefit for learned face were substantially larger for reflectance caricature whereas benefit for novel face were numerically larger for shape caricature erps confirmed a consistent reduction of the occipitotemporal p200 200 240 m by shape caricaturing whereas the most prominent effect of reflectance caricaturing wa seen in an enhanced posterior n250 240 400 m a component that ha been related to the activation of acquired face representation our result suggest that performance benefit for face learning caused by distinctive spatial versus reflectance information are mediated by different neural process with different timing and support a prominent role of reflectance for the recognition of learned face

the agreement of subjective and genital sexual response also referred to a sexual concordance show substantial variability between woman identifying predictor of sexual arousal and sexual concordance is important to improve our understanding of female sexual response and it relationship to sexual function or dysfunction the aim of this study wa to ass the relevance of sexual excitation and sexual inhibition a predictor of subjective sexual arousal genital arousal and sexual concordance in a laboratory setting sexual arousal wa induced by erotic video stimulus subjective sexual arousal wa assessed continuously during stimulus presentation and genital arousal wa measured with vaginal photoplethysmography data of 58 woman m age 24 95 sd 4 65 were analyzed using multilevel analysis hlm this data analytic technique estimate the within subject association of subjective and genital arousal by controlling for between subject difference an interaction term of sexual excitation and sexual inhibition significantly predicted genital sexual arousal in exploratory analysis two lower order factor of sexual inhibition concern about sexual function and arousal contingency were predictive of sexual concordance further examination of these association might increase our knowledge of female sexual function and deepen our understanding of how sexual excitation and sexual inhibition affect sexual arousal and consequently impact sexual behavior in woman

a single endurance exercise session wa shown to lead to a reduction of pain perception and an elevation of mood we hypothesized that athlete who regularly practice endurance might also induce change in mood and pain processing in expectation of an endurance session we compared the expectation effect of a 2 h run on mood and pain processing to a run free control day rfc fifteen trained runner were assessed with repeated painful and nonpainful pinprick stimulation in a functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri scanner prior to a 2 h run and at rfc pain rating pressure pain stimulus response function and euphoria rating were also assessed there were no mean expectation effect on any of the behavioral measure however highly trained athlete needed more pressure to evoke a pain rating of 46 pre run v rfc but were le euphoric pre run v rfc furthermore analysis of brain activity to painful stimulus applied immediately before the 2 h run compared to rfc revealed increased activation in the medial prefrontal cortex mpfc and reduced activation in posterior insula additionally le trained athlete had reduced activation in posterior insula to painful stimulation pre run v rfc compared to highly trained athlete the result suggest reduced central pain processing in expectation of an endurance run and an association between the amount of the expectation effect and training frequency which differs depending on the stimulus applied

objective brief intervention based on personalized feedback have shown promising result in reducing risky alcohol use among university student we investigated the effect of activating deliberative predecisional or implemental postdecisional mindset on the effectiveness of a standardized brief intervention the assist linked brief intervention this intervention comprises a personalized feedback and a decisional balance exercise we hypothesized that participant in a deliberative mindset should show better outcome related to risk perception and behavior than participant in an implemental mindset method a sample of 257 student provided baseline measure on risk perception readiness to change and alcohol use of those 64 student with risky alcohol use were randomly allocated to one of two mindset induction condition deliberative or implemental mindset thereafter they received the assist linked brief intervention and completed self report questionnaire on change in risk perception alcohol use and readiness to change at post intervention and four week follow up result in contrast to our hypothesis the four week follow up revealed that participant in the implemental mindset consumed significantly le alcohol than participant in a deliberative mindset did the former decreased and the latter increased their alcohol intake resistance to the brief intervention wa stronger in the latter condition however neither deliberative nor implemental mindset participant showed any change in risk perception or in their readiness to change alcohol consumption conclusion these finding suggest that mindset induction is a powerful moderator of the effect of the assist linked brief intervention we argue that systematic research on mindset effect on brief intervention technique aimed to reduce risky alcohol use is highly needed in order to identify the process involved with commitment and resistance being the main candidate

objective eating disorder ed are complex heterogeneous and severe psychiatric syndrome they are highly comorbid with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd which exacerbates the course of illness and impedes treatment however the direct functional relation between ed and ocd symptom remain largely unexplored hence using network analysis we investigated the relationship between ed and ocd at the level of symptom in a heterogeneous clinical sample method we used cross sectional data of 303 treatment seeking patient with clinically relevant ed and ocd pathology we constructed a regularized partial correlation network that featured both ed and ocd symptom a node to determine each symptom s influence we calculated expected influence ei a an index of symptom centrality i e importance bridge symptom i e symptom from one syndromic cluster that have strong connection to symptom of another syndromic cluster were identified by computing bridge expected influence metric result fear of weight gain and dietary restraint were especially important among the ed symptom interference due to obsession wa the key feature of ocd ed and ocd clustered distinctly with few potential bridge between cluster discussion this study underscore the importance of cognitive symptom for both ed and ocd although direct functional link between the two cluster are missing potentially a network incorporating node capturing feature of personality may account for diagnostic comorbidity better than specific symptom of ed or feature of ocd do

an increasing number of orphan in low and middle income country are living in institutional care facility where they experience poor quality of care and ongoing maltreatment to prevent maltreatment we tested the effectiveness and feasibility of the intervention interaction competency with child for caregiver icc c in a two arm cluster randomized controlled trial 203 caregiver 65 5 female m age 36 63 year sd age 12 26 and 356 child 46 1 female m age 9 43 year sd age 1 93 from 24 orphanage in dar e salaam tanzania participated from august to october 2018 baseline and march to april 2019 follow up orphanage were assigned to the intervention or waitlist group caregiver in the intervention group received the icc c intervention to prevent maltreatment through focusing on non violent caregiving strategy the primary outcome wa the change in self reported maltreatment by caregiver conflict tactic scale trial registration clinicaltrials gov nct03594617 20 july 2018 participation in the intervention resulted in a significant reduction in reported maltreatment f 2 0 153 a decrease of positive attitude toward violent discipline f 2 0 248 and an increased level of childcare knowledge f 2 0 220 in the caregiver sample each indicating a moderate effect caregiver training participation did not predict reduced maltreatment reported by child aspect of feasibility including motivation to participate acceptability and integration of the new strategy were evaluated positively the study promise initial effectiveness and feasibility of effort to improve the situation of child in institutional care setting in resource poor country by offering training to care provider

biased processing of disgust related stimulus is increasingly discussed in addition to fear related processing a a maintenance factor for contamination based obsessive compulsive disorder c ocd however the differential impact of fear and disgust on biased processing in c ocd is not yet completely understood because it is difficult to distinguish the two emotion in self report assessment by directly addressing the specific emotion a text paragraph based interpretation bias paradigm wa applied to more implicitly ass emotion for the text based interpretation bias paradigm disgust related fear related disgust fear ambiguous and neutral text paragraph describing everyday life situation were developed and validated in a pre study n 205 fifty nine healthy participant watched either disgust or fear inducing movie and afterwards rated their experienced emotional response to the text paragraph the result show that fear and disgust component of an emotional response to mixed emotional situation are strongly influenced by the situational context and across the level of trait contamination fear people did not differ in their fear experience to everyday situation which wa overall strong but in their disgust experience these finding highlight the strength of situational context on interpretation bias for mixed emotional disorder and the important role of disgust for c ocd

the perceptual self prioritization effect spe refers to an advantage in attending to stimulus associated with the self relative to those associated with another individual in the perceptual matching task arbitrary pairing between oneself and other person and a geometric shape need to be learned apart from the spe this task also produce high matching performance for a close other while cognitive representation of past self are sometimes viewed a resembling that of an intimate other and while there is some evidence that other type of psychological closeness modulate the spe it remains unclear whether such prioritization effect extend to past self previous experiment on this topic required participant to distinguish between different point in time within the same task raising the possibility that potential past self prioritization wa masked by task difficulty in our experiment we addressed this potential confound by presenting n 118 participant with a simpler version of the matching task we re investigated self prioritization in perceptual matching under condition of mental time travel to the past in line with previous evidence we found clear prioritization of present self which wa evident in response time accuracy and the efficiency of practice performance wa consistently poorest for the past self indicating not only a lack of privileged processing but rather a relative de prioritization performance wa not improved by either increased proximity of the time period in question nor by experimenter induced re imagining of the self our result do not support a perceptual prioritization of past self

there is a dearth of measure specifically designed to ass empirically validated mechanism of therapeutic change to fill in this research gap the aim of the current study wa to develop a measure that cover a large variety of empirically validated mechanism of change with corresponding version for the patient and therapist to develop an instrument that is based on several important change process framework we combined two established change mechanism instrument the scale for the multiperspective assessment of general change mechanism in psychotherapy sacip and the scale of the therapeutic alliance revised sta r in our study 457 psychosomatic inpatient completed the sacip and the sta r and diverse outcome measure in early middle and late stage of psychotherapy data analysis were conducted using factor analysis and multilevel modelling the psychometric property of the resulting individual therapy process questionnaire were generally good to excellent a demonstrated by a exploratory factor analysis on both patient and therapist rating b cfa on later measuring time c high internal consistency and d significant outcome predictive effect the parallel form of the itpq deliver opportunity to compare the patient and therapist perspective for a broader range of facet of change mechanism than wa hitherto possible consequently the measure can be applied in future research to more specifically analyse different change mechanism profile in session to session development and outcome prediction key practitioner message this article describes the development of an instrument that measure general mechanism of change in psychotherapy from both the patient and therapist perspective post session item rating from both the patient and therapist can be used a feedback to optimize therapeutic process we provide a detailed discussion of measure developed to evaluate therapeutic change mechanism

background interoceptive accuracy and sensibility are decreased in depressive sample however different study showed that cognitive behavioural therapy cbt and mindfulness intervention are promising approach to improve interoceptive ability based on these finding the study aim to investigate the pre post effect of cbt in a depressive sample additionally we examined the effect of mindfulness based stress reduction mbsr training in the context of cbt method sixty depressive patient were investigated over four week with two condition cbt v cbt mbsr further the change in interoceptive ability interoceptive accuracy and sensibility of the depressive patient were compared to baseline data of healthy control result the depressive patient showed significantly higher level of depression and lower mindfulness and interoceptive ability than healthy control the depressive sample showed a significant decrease in depressive symptom and increased mindfulness and interoceptive ability after cbt lastly depressive patient of the cbt mbsr condition did not differ from those who only received cbt in the level of depression mindfulness or interoceptive ability over the time course discussion this study demonstrates a positive effect of cbt on interoceptive ability in a depressive sample it is shown that the depressive sample did not profit from additional mindfulness training it can be concluded that cbt is an efficient treatment resulting in increased interoceptive ability unexpectedly the combination of cbt and mbsr ha no additional effect on these change future study should investigate the effect of mbsr a a stand alone therapy

interoception describes the mapping of the body s internal landscape and ha been connected to greater intensity of emotional experience the goal of the current study wa to explore the relationship between interoception and emotion face recognition in healthy adolescent the heartbeat perception task wa used to ass interoceptive accuracy iac and participant were asked to recognize different facial expression eeg activity wa recorded providing data for the p100 the n170 and the p300 erp component result indicated high sensitivity to negative affect a well a low accuracy in the recognition of fear and sadness among adolescent high in iac reflected by amplitude modulation in the n170 and the p300 the interpretation of these result focus on the intensity experienced in negative facial emotion modified by iac a well a on emotional valence and arousal these finding emphasize the dynamic integration of body and mind for shaping emotion recognition in adolescence
