context open end of life communication is especially important within the patient family unit of care and can positively affect their medical psychological and relational outcome nevertheless end of life discussion are often perceived a difficult and avoided objective to develop and validate the difficulty in end of life discussion family inventory deold fi to allow a systematic assessment of reason why people shy away from end of life discussion method patient with advanced cancer were recruited and completed the deold fi and measure of avoidance of cancer communication quality of life and distress and the experienced difficulty a well a the occurrence of end of life discussion standard item analysis and an exploratory factor analysis were conducted construct validity wa analysed through association between the deold fi and the aforementioned measure result questionnaire were obtained from 112 participant 53 response rate male 54 mean age 64 9 year range 33 94 in the final 23 item version two factor were extracted emotional burden due to end of life discussion alpha 0 90 and negative attitude towards end of life discussion alpha 0 91 explaining 69 of the variance total scale alpha 0 93 construct validity wa supported by it significant correlation with the reported difficulty in end of life discussion r 0 42 and avoidance of cancer communication r 0 40 to r 0 46 and insignificant correlation with quality of life r 0 11 distress r 0 16 and physical well being r 0 02 those who had already engaged in end of life discussion showed significantly fewer communication barrier conclusion result provide evidence that the deold fi is a valid and reliable instrument for the assessment of difficulty in end of life discussion benefit for clinical practice and research are discussed

background outcome prediction allow to improve psychotherapy and to increase economic benefit the efficient translation into practice requires simple prediction method the present study evaluates the prediction of treatment outcome based on initial distress level method routine data of a university psychotherapy outpatient clinic were used n 3 145 mage 35 8 67 female low versus high distress patient classified by overall psychological distress symptomatology and previous treatment were compared on total reduction in psychopathology early response remission and premature treatment discontinuation using t test and logistic regression response and remission were assessed via relative percentage improvement and absolute measure reliable change index rci result distress level wa inversely related to percentage improvement or 0 62 and remission or 0 34 it wa positively related to total reduction in psychopathology d 0 63 rci response or 2 37 and treatment discontinuation or 2 15 early response and treatment discontinuation partially mediated the relationship between distress level and treatment outcome conclusion treatment success tends to be lower when initial distress is high but this finding appears contingent on the operationalization of treatment outcome the presented classification approach is easy to implement in practice and may be useful in order to counter an excessive workload in psychotherapy trainee

background stressful life event and suicide ideation regularly occur together yet little is known about factor that buffer individual against the development of suicide ideation aim in a long term follow up study design it wa investigated whether positive mental health that is high level of subjective and psychological well being buffer the association between stressful life event and suicide ideation method a total of 126 german student 80 2 female age m 24 29 sd 5 21 were assessed at a baseline evaluation and again 24 month later data were collected using self report questionnaire result linear hierarchical regression analysis wa used to analyze the data positive mental health wa considered to moderate the impact of stressful life event on suicide ideation controlling for age and gender limitation current result are limited to university student conclusion positive mental health interacts with stressful life event such that those with high level of positive mental health show an attenuated increase in suicide ideation at elevated level of stress positive mental health seems to confer resilience and should be focused on in counseling center for student

objective there is a lack of brief rating scale for the reliable assessment of psychotherapeutic skill which do not require intensive rater training and or a high level of expertise thus the objective is to validate a 14 item version of the clinical communication skill scale cc s method using a sample of n 690 video based rating of role play with simulated patient we calculated a confirmatory factor analysis and an exploratory structural equation modeling esem assessed convergent validity determined inter rater reliability and compared these with those who were either psychology student advanced psychotherapy trainee or expert result correlation with other competence rating scale were high r 0 86 0 89 the intraclass correlation ranged between moderate and good icc 2 2 0 65 0 80 with student raters yielding the lowest score the one factor model only marginally replicated the data but the internal consistency were excellent alpha 0 91 95 the esem yielded a two factor solution collaboration and structuring and exploration skill conclusion the cc s is a brief and valid rating scale that reliably ass basic communication skill which is particularly useful for psychotherapy training using standardized role play to ensure good inter rater reliability it is still advisable to employ raters with at least some clinical experience future study should further investigate the one or two factor structure of the instrument

objective addressing the lack of population based data the purpose of this representative study wa to ass sex and age specific association of maternal and paternal rearing behavior with depressiveness and anxiety controlling for sociodemographic and somatic variable method 8 175 subject participating in a population based study completed standardized questionnaire measuring recalled parental rearing behavior and distress result woman recalled their father a more controlling and warmer and their mother a more rejecting than men comparison between age group 60 v 60 year revealed that younger participant recalled more parental control and emotional warmth in addition to sociodemographic and somatic risk factor paternal rejection and maternal control were associated with depressiveness and anxiety both for woman and men or 1 58 1 96 or 1 37 1 66 maternal warmth wa negatively related to distress or 0 66 0 69 conclusion finding suggested sex and age specific difference in recalled maternal and paternal rearing behavior the current result highlighted the important role of recalled parental rearing behavior besides sociodemographic factor and somatic disease for the occurrence of depression and anxiety symptom across the age group

background and objective trauma related rumination ha been suggested to be involved in the maintenance of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd this view ha empirically been supported by extensive evidence using cross sectional prospective and experimental design however it is unclear why trauma survivor engage in rumination despite it negative consequence the current study aimed to explore the hypothesis that low emotion regulation ability underlies trauma related rumination method emotion regulation ability and trauma related rumination were assessed in 93 road traffic accident survivor 2 week post trauma in addition symptom level of ptsd were assessed at 2 week a well a 1 3 and 6 month follow up result emotion regulation ability wa significantly related to trauma related rumination a well a level of ptsd symptom in addition the association between low emotion regulation ability and ptsd wa mediated by rumination conclusion the finding support the view that rumination is used a a dysfunctional emotion regulation strategy by trauma survivor

aim to investigate the degree of mental strain and chronic stress in a german community sample of student with ibs like symptom method and material following an internet based survey about stress this study recruited 176 german university student 23 45 2 48 year 48 3 male with ibs like symptom according to rome iii and 181 student without ibs 23 55 2 82 year 50 3 male and compared them regarding current mental strain scl 90 r and the extend of chronic stress beyond this ibs subtypes ibs severity and health care utilization were assessed result student fulfilling ibs criterion showed significantly elevated value of mental strain and chronic stress nearly 40 of the ibs group versus 20 of the control reached a clinically relevant value on the scl 90 r global severity scale ibs subtypes did not differ in term of mental distress or chronic stress somatization anxiety and the chronic stressor work overload social tension and dissatisfaction with job were most closely connected to ibs symptom severity regarding health care utilization our result show that consulting a physician frequently wa not associated significantly with elevated mental strain or chronic stress but with ibs symptom severity conclusion our data contribute additional evidence to the distinct association between psychological stress and ibs in community sample

healthcare worker hcw are among those most directly affected by the covid 19 pandemic most research with this group ha used ad hoc measure which limit comparability across sample the stress and anxiety to viral epidemic 9 scale save 9 is a nine item scale first developed in korea and ha since been translated into several language we report on data collected from 484 german hcw between november 2020 and march 2021 during the second wave of coronavirus infection we conducted item analysis confirmatory factor analysis on the previously found factor solution of the save 9 examined correlation with established measure of depression generalized anxiety and insomnia and compared score between different group of hcw the psychometric property of the german save 9 were satisfactory and comparable to previous finding from korea and russia correlation with mental health measure were positive a expected we found some significant difference between group of hcw on the save 9 which were consistent with the literature but did not appear on the other mental health measure this suggests that the save 9 tap into specifically work related stress which may make it a helpful instrument in this research area

asking people to provide global judgment or trait report of their affective experience is a standard method for assessing trait affective well being with countless application in the social science trait report reflect numerous influence that generally go unnoticed although state affect is a highly plausible candidate for such influence this source of unwanted variance doe not receive much attention and is usually not controlled for in empirical study using 100 day data from the cogito study we provide direct and strong evidence that trait report of affect depend on how people feel at the time they provide the evaluation i e their affective state for example participant experiencing more positive affect on a specific day relative to their individual mean also provide more positive rating of their global affective experience furthermore we found that current affect influence trait rating in a surprisingly differentiated way those particular facet of affect that are more le prevalent at a certain moment are believed to occur more le often in general we stress the need for repeated observation within individual to estimate state contribution to standard assessment of trait affect to distinguish between state and trait in psychological assessment and to achieve good indicator of affective experience in the social and medical science

cognitive control protects processing of relevant information from interference by irrelevant information the level of this processing selectivity can be flexibly adjusted to different control demand e g frequency of conflict associated with a certain context leading to the formation of specific context control association in the present study we investigated the robustness and transferability of the acquired context control demand to new situation in three experiment we used a version of the context specific proportion congruence cspc paradigm in which each context e g location is associated with a specific conflict frequency determining high and low control demand in a learning phase association between context and control demand were established in a subsequent transfer block stimulus response mapping whole task set or context control demand changed result showed an impressive robustness of context control association a context specific adjustment of control from the learning phase were virtually unaffected by new stimulus and task in the transfer block only a change of the context control demand eliminated the context specific adjustment of control these finding suggest that context control association that have proven to be adaptive in the past are continuously applied despite major change in the task structure a long a the context control association remain the same

the present research aimed to replicate and extend finding of huijding muris lester field and joosse 2011 investigating whether symbolic approach avoidance response can induce implicit and explicit evaluation bias face with a neutral expression were shown on a computer screen and participant were instructed to repeatedly move a manikin towards some face approach and away from other face avoidance an affective priming task and a face rating task were used to ass training compatible difference in implicit and explicit face evaluation respectively result showed that the manikin training wa successful the priming task revealed more positive implicit evaluation of approached than avoided face and approached face were rated more positively than avoided one in the face rating task these finding replicate those of huijding and colleague by demonstrating training effect on explicit evaluation and they extend them by demonstrating effect on implicit evaluation

elevated negative affect is an established link between minor stressor and psychotic symptom le clear is why people with psychosis fail to regulate distressing emotion effectively this study test whether subjective psychophysiological and symptomatic response to stress can be predicted by specific emotion regulation er difficulty participant with psychotic disorder n 35 and healthy control n 28 were assessed for er skill at baseline they were then exposed to a noise versus no stressor on different day during which self reported stress response state paranoia and skin conductance level scl were assessed participant with psychosis showed a stronger increase in self reported stress and scl in response to the stressor than healthy control stronger increase in self reported stress were predicted by a reduced ability to be aware of and tolerate distressing emotion whereas increase in scl were predicted by a reduced ability to be aware of tolerate accept and modify them although paranoid symptom were not significantly affected by the stressor individual variation in paranoid response wa also predicted by a reduced ability to be aware of and tolerate emotion difference in stress response in the sample were no longer significant after controlling for er skill thus intervention that improve er skill could reduce stress sensitivity in psychosis

although body image disturbance play a central role in the development maintenance and relapse of binge eating disorder bed study investigating the neural basis underlying body processing in bed are still missing to address this gap we conducted a preregistered german clinical trial register deutsches register klinischer studien drks registration drks00008107 combined functional magnetic resonance fmri eye tracking study in which 38 woman with bed and 22 healthy control weight matched for overall equivalence processed image of their own body an unfamiliar weight matched body and visually matched nonbody control stimulus while performing a one back task woman with bed responded with higher left fusiform body area fba activity than control during body image processing despite higher level of self reported body dissatisfaction woman with bed did not show overactivation in emotion processing area in response to their own body the eye tracking result indicated that visual attention toward the presented stimulus wa associated with increased activity in the extrastriate body area eba and fba across group our result thus provide evidence for an aberrant neural processing of body image in bed and highlight the importance of controlling for visual attention in future study assessing neuronal body processing psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

background health anxiety ha is defined a the objectively unfounded fear or conviction of suffering from a severe illness predominant attention allocation to illness related information is regarded a a central process in the development and maintenance of ha yet little is known about the neuronal correlate of this attentional bias method an emotional stroop task with body symptom illness and neutral word wa employed to elicit emotional interference in healthy participant with high ha n 12 and low ha n 12 ha during functional magnetic resonance imaging result prolonged reaction time for indicating the color of symptom word and a decrease in rostral anterior cingulate cortex racc activation were seen in ha participant emotional interference effect on the behavioral level were negatively related to racc activity over the whole group group did not differ during the processing of threatening illness word conclusion the result indicate stronger attention allocation toward body symptom word already in subclinical ha this attentional bias appears to be linked to hypoactivity of the racc which impedes effective emotional interference reduction leading instead to a ruminative processing of the stimulus content

abstract adaptive behavior depends on the process of self regulation if self regulation fails maladaptive behavior may start to predominate leading to impulsive action maladaptive habit and compulsive behavior pattern the tendency to develop habitual behavior differs between individual and appears to be associated with different aspect of regulatory control the present study examined association of habitual propensity with self regulation impulsivity and compulsivity elucidating possible underlying functional connection and evaluated the psychometric property of a german version of the creature of habit scale cohs data of two independent community sample wa collected online dynamic connection with measure of regulatory control namely self regulation impulsivity and compulsivity were analyzed using a network approach psychometric analysis were conducted using exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis utilizing a bayesian lasso procedure network analysis revealed that self regulation wa the most central node within the network of dynamic interaction between habitual propensity impulsivity and compulsivity self regulation exclusively had negative association with other measure we replicated and validated the two factorial structure of the cohs our finding provide evidence that habitual propensity is interconnected with measure of regulatory control information gathered using the cohs could be useful in identifying vulnerability and developing tailored therapeutic strategy for psychopathology associated with deficient regulatory control

borderline personality disorder bpd is characterized by severe interpersonal dysfunction with problem in social cognition empathy and social approach although the neuropeptide oxytocin is known to regulate complex social cognition and behavior in healthy individual and clinical population there is still a lack of evidence for a potential beneficial effect of oxytocin administration on social cognition and social approach in bpd fifty one woman with bpd and 51 matched healthy control were randomized to a double blind placebo controlled between subject experimental trial we administered a single dose of 24 iu oxytocin or placebo intranasally prior to a standardized task measuring affective and cognitive empathy and approach motivation all participant were free of hormonal contraception and tested in the mid luteal phase of their menstrual cycle in the placebo condition patient with bpd showed reduced cognitive and affective empathy and le approach behavior motivation than healthy control intranasal oxytocin significantly increased affective empathy and approach motivation in both bpd patient and healthy control compared to placebo more importantly oxytocin administration led to similar score between bpd and healthy control these finding provide the first evidence for a beneficial effect of oxytocin on deficit in affective empathy and approach motivation of bpd our result indicate a beneficial effect of a single dose of oxytocin on affective empathy and approach motivation in woman with bpd adapting their level of social functioning to healthy control future clinical trial will need to investigate the long term effect and effectiveness of oxytocin a an add on treatment for social impairment in bpd

background knowledge of mental distress and resilience factor over the time span from before to after a stressor is important to be able to leverage the most promising resilience factor and promote mental health at the right time to shed light on this topic we designed the resist resilience study study in which we assessed medical student before during and after their yearly exam period exam time is generally a period of notable stress among medical student and it ha been suggested that exam time trigger mental distress objective in this paper we aim to describe the study protocol and to examine whether the exam period indeed induces higher perceived stress and mental distress we also aim to explore whether perceived stress and mental distress coevolve in response to exam method resist is a cohort study in which exam stress function a a within subject natural stress manipulation in this paper we outline the sample n 451 procedure assessed measure including demographic perceived stress mental distress 13 resilience factor and adversity and ethical consideration moreover we conducted a series of latent growth model and bivariate latent change score model to analyze perceived stress and mental distress change over the 3 time point result we found that perceived stress and mental distress increased from the time before the exam to the exam period and decreased after the exam to a lower level than before the exam our finding further suggest that higher mental distress before exam increased the risk of developing more perceived stress during exam higher perceived stress during exam in turn increased the risk of experiencing a le successful or quick recovery of mental distress after exam conclusion a expected the exam period caused a temporary increase in perceived stress and mental distress therefore the resist study lends itself well to exploring resilience factor in response to naturally occurring exam stress such knowledge will eventually help researcher to find out which resilience factor lend themselves best a prevention target and which lend themselves best a treatment target for the mitigation of mental health problem that are triggered or accelerated by natural exam stress the finding from the resist study may therefore inform student support service mental health service and resilience theory

background and objective distressing intrusion are a hallmark of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd dysfunctional appraisal of these symptom may exacerbate the disorder and conversely may lead to further intrusive memory this raise the intriguing possibility that learning to reappraise potential symptom more functionally may protect against such symptom woud holmes postma dalgleish and mackintosh 2012 found that reappraisal training when delivered after an analogue stressful event reduced later intrusive memory and other posttraumatic symptom the present study aimed to investigate whether reappraisal training administered before a stressful event is also beneficial method participant first received positive or negative reappraisal training cbm app training using a series of scripted vignette subsequently participant were exposed to a film with traumatic content effect of the cbm app training procedure were assessed via three distinct outcome measure namely a post training appraisal of novel ambiguous vignette b change score on the post traumatic cognition inventory ptci and c intrusive symptom diary result cbm app training successfully induced training congruent appraisal style moreover those trained positively reported le distress arising from their intrusive memory of the trauma film during the subsequent week than those trained negatively however the induced appraisal bias only partly affected ptci score limitation participant used their own negative event a a reference for the ptci assessment the event may have differed regarding their emotional impact there wa no control group conclusion cbm app training ha also some beneficial effect when applied before a stressful event and may serve a a cognitive prophylaxis against trauma related symptomatology

the negative interpretation of body sensation e g a sign of a severe illness is a crucial cognitive process in pathological health anxiety ha however little is known about the nature and the degree of automaticity of this interpretation bias we applied an implicit association test iat in 20 subject during functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri to investigate behavioral and neural correlate of implicit attitude toward symptom word on the behavioral level body symptom word elicited strong negative implicit association effect a indexed by slowed reaction time when symptom word were paired with the attribute harmless incongruent condition fmri revealed increased activation in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc and posterior parietal cortex for the comparison of incongruent word with control word a well a with a lower significance threshold also in comparison to congruent word moreover activation in the dlpfc posterior parietal cortex nucleus accumbens and cerebellum varied with individual level of ha again in comparison to control word a well a with a lower significance threshold also in comparison to congruent word slowed reaction time a well a increased activation in dorsolateral prefrontal and posterior parietal cortex point to increased inhibitory demand during the incongruent iat condition the positive association between ha severity and neural activity in nucleus accumbens dorsolateral prefrontal and posterior parietal cortex suggests that ha is characterized by both intensified negative implicit attitude and hampered cognitive control mechanism when confronted with body symptom

the current study investigated the association between loneliness and depression symptom a well a vulnerable and grandiose narcissism an online survey wa conducted obtaining a sample of 701 german speaking participant age m sd 24 17 5 64 range 18 58 a positive association between loneliness and the occurrence of depression symptom wa revealed furthermore the link between loneliness and depression symptom wa moderated by both grandiose and vulnerable narcissism the sample consisted of a majority of university student limiting the generalizability of the finding in addition self report were used without obtaining experimental evidence narcissism is identified a a moderator of the relationship between loneliness and depression symptom more specifically both high grandiose narcissism and high vulnerable narcissism enhance the association between loneliness and depression symptom

objective medically unsubstantiated intolerance to food chemical and environmental toxin are common and are frequently discussed in the medium idiopathic environmental intolerance attributed to electromagnetic field iei emf is one such condition and is characterized by symptom that are attributed to exposure to electromagnetic field emf in this experiment we tested whether medium report promote the development of this condition method participant n 147 were randomly assigned to watch a television report about the adverse health effect of wifi n 76 or a control film n 71 after watching their film participant received a sham exposure to a wifi signal 15 min the principal outcome measure wa symptom report following the sham exposure secondary outcome included worry about the health effect of emf attributing symptom to the sham exposure and increase in perceived sensitivity to emf result 82 54 of the 147 participant reported symptom which they attributed to the sham exposure the experimental film increased emf related worry beta 0 19 p 019 post sham exposure symptom among participant with high pre existing anxiety beta 0 22 p 008 the likelihood of symptom being attributed to the sham exposure among people with high anxiety beta 31 p 001 and the likelihood of people who attributed their symptom to the sham exposure believing themselves to be sensitive to emf beta 0 16 p 049 conclusion medium report about the adverse effect of supposedly hazardous substance can increase the likelihood of experiencing symptom following sham exposure and developing an apparent sensitivity to it greater engagement between journalist and scientist is required to counter these negative effect

functional magnetic resonance imaging of body odor is challenging due to methodological obstacle of odor presentation in the scanner and low intensity of body odor hence few imaging study investigated neural response to body odor those differ in design characteristic and have shown varying result evidence on central processing of baby body odor ha been scarce but might be important in order to detect neural correlate of bonding in mother a suitable paradigm for investigating perception of baby body odor ha still to be established we compared neural response to baby body odor in a new to a conventional block design in a sample of ten normosmic mother for the new short design 6 s of continuous odor presentation were followed by 19 s baseline and 13 repetition were performed for the conventional long design 15 s of pulsed odor presentation were followed by 30 s of baseline and eight repetition were performed neural response were observed in brain structure related to basal and higher order olfactory processing such a insula orbitofrontal cortex and amygdala neural response following the short design were significantly higher in comparison to the long design this effect wa based on higher number of repetition but affected olfactory area differently the bold signal in the primary olfactory structure wa enhanced by short and continuous stimulation secondary structure did profit from longer stimulation with many repetition the short design is recommended a a suitable paradigm in order to detect neuronal correlate of baby body odor

in addition to hunger which result from food deprivation fasting or restrained eating food craving is thought to be one of the major factor influencing eating behavior although food craving occurs in healthy human with normal eating behavior research suggests pronounced food craving to be a risk factor for binging food which in turn might cause weight gain and obesity in addition negative mood seems to induce binge eating although the underlying process are not clearly understood to examine these effect on momentary food craving more closely we implemented a food cue reactivity paradigm in 33 normal weight female mean age 25 1 year mean bmi 21 6 mood negative v neutral and state of food deprivation hunger v satiety were varied systematically self rated craving wa significantly higher in hungry compared to sated state moreover in neutral mood high caloric food modulated craving i e hungry and sated participant preferred savory food and sweet food respectively in negative mood this differential effect of savory and sweet item wa absent in summary the state of hunger ha a huge impact on food craving which is further modulated by emotional state future research should consider hunger to be of high relevance for effect investigated in food related paradigm our finding in healthy woman of normal weight support etiological model of disturbed eating behavior and are in line with common intervention targeting eating schedule and mood regulation

background bullying ha regularly been shown to be associated with suicide ideation however so far only a few study have examined the mechanism underlying the relationship between bullying and suicide ideation within a theory of suicide aim the aim of the present study wa to investigate whether thwarted belongingness and perceived burdensomeness mediate the association between bullying and suicide ideation method a total of 267 outpatient 63 3 female m age 37 52 sd age 12 80 completed online measure of bullying suicide ideation thwarted belongingness and perceived burdensomeness result thwarted belongingness a well a perceived burdensomeness fully mediated the association between bullying and suicide ideation controlling for gender and age limitation given the cross sectional nature of the data only hypothetical conclusion on causality can be drawn conclusion our result support the hypothesized and theory derived relation between bullying thwarted belongingness perceived burdensomeness and suicide ideation in anti bullying program it seems to be of particular importance to counter impression of thwarted belongingness and perceived burdensomeness

background and objective dysfunctional expectation are considered to be core feature of various mental disorder clinical observation suggest that people suffering from mental disorder such a major depression tend to maintain dysfunctional expectation despite expectation disconfirming evidence surprisingly this clinically relevant phenomenon ha not yet sufficiently been investigated in empirical study therefore we developed an experimental paradigm to investigate expectation change v maintenance and the first step to test it validity is to apply it in healthy individual method after conducting two pilot study n 28 n 37 the present study systematically examined whether it is possible to change healthy individual n 102 task specific and generalized performance expectation through expectation disconfirming experience using a standardized instruction we initially induced non positive expectation regarding participant ability to successfully work on an unknown test then participant received standardized performance feedback that either confirmed or disconfirmed their expectation before assessing participant expectation again after completing the test for the measure of emotional intelligence result result indicate that expectation disconfirming feedback led to a significant change of both task specific and generalized performance expectation there wa no expectation change in the expectation confirming condition limitation a the present study examined expectation change among healthy individual the next step is to apply this paradigm in a clinical sample and to examine whether expectation change is le likely among people suffering from depression or other mental disorder characterized by dysfunctional expectation conclusion focusing more rigorously on expectation maintenance among people with mental disorder could enable therapist to develop expectation focused intervention aiming at enhancing expectation change

objective deficit in cognitive control are thought to contribute to the maintenance of obesity ob cognitive control is referred to a impulsivity and binge eating disorder bed is characterized by high level of impulsivity the present study sought to elucidate which cognitive control function differentiate between severe ob with and without bed also taking into account hunger a a moderating factor method the study included 48 individual with ob and bed ob bed 48 individual with ob and no bed ob bed and 48 normal weight control nwc hunger wa systematically manipulated participant were instructed to refrain from eating before testing and received either a liquid meal or flavored water then a comprehensive test battery wa administered including a food related go no go task and several subtests from the cantab result there were no difference between the group with regard to food related response inhibition however while manipulating hunger had no impact on performance in the go no go task self reported hunger significantly influenced task performance by increasing inhibition deficit to high caloric stimulus in ob bed with regard to general cognitive control function we found that deficit in attention and impulse control in decision making distinguished ob from nwc while reversal learning and risk taking in decision making appeared to be relevant factor when distinguishing ob bed from ob bed discussion our result indicate that self reported hunger differentially affected food related response inhibition group difference in general cognitive control function were limited to attention reversal learning and decision making future research need to account for other possible moderating factor such a mood food craving or stress

the illness related evaluation of bodily symptom is considered to be an important maintaining factor in somatoform disorder however little is known about context variable that could influence this evaluation process in the current study participant completed three version of the health norm sorting task hnst and evaluated bodily symptom in different context i e different evaluation perspective and time frame of evaluation additionally the three hnst version were presented in different order bodily symptom were evaluated more often a a sign of illness when a specific time frame i e one week wa given however this context effect wa only large when participant had previously evaluated symptom existing without a concrete duration thus previously completed symptom evaluation appear to represent an important frame of reference in term of a cue that make specific context variable salient the result further suggested that these cueing effect might be le relevant for participant with elevated somatic symptom report

this study investigates the influence of moral ingroup versus outgroup behavior on 5 and 6 year old and 8 and 9 year old own moral behavior n 296 after minimal group assignment child in experiment 1 observed adult ingroup or outgroup member engaging in prosocial sharing or antisocial stealing before they themselves had the opportunity to privately donate sticker or take away sticker from others older child shared more than younger child and prosocial model elicited higher sharing surprisingly group membership had no effect experiment 2 investigated the same question using peer model child in the younger age group were significantly influenced by ingroup behavior whereas older child were not affected by group membership additional measure reveal interesting insight into how moral ingroup and outgroup behavior affect intergroup attitude evaluation and choice

background individual with posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd often report intrusive memory that appear to lack the appropriate spatio temporal context objective we examined whether focusing on the spatio temporal context of aversive autobiographical memory reduces negative emotion appraisal and re experiencing symptom method we recruited 109 healthy adult and had them rate emotionality vividness and re experiencing of an aversive autobiographical memory furthermore we assessed automatic association of idiosyncratic memory trigger with the concept past v now and self reported sense of memory closure and distancing to manipulate spatio temporal memory re organization the experimental group n 53 performed a lifeline exercise in virtual reality vr where participant symbolically placed memory trigger along a path representing their own personal life story the control group n 56 completed a non personalized vr task result we found a marked decrease in negative emotion negative appraisal and re experiencing in the following week but on average the lifeline exercise wa not superior to the control condition however those in the lifeline group with stronger trigger past association subsequently exhibited a more pronounced reduction in re experiencing also participant with a higher subjective sense of memory distancing reported le re experiencing conclusion the finding lend tentative support for theoretical assumption about ptsd but the potential causal role of automatic association with spatio temporal information remains to be clarified

abstract how do individual with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd process and respond to image of rotten food or dirty toilet in contrast to other fear related disorder evidence for attentional bias and preferential processing of disorder related stimulus in sample of ocd is mixed to address methodological problem of previous study and to increase validity we used two independent sample of participant with contamination fear and two set of standardized stimulus in an established experimental paradigm in two experiment we compared evaluation and visual processing of contamination fear related cfr stimulus material in individual with high hcf and low lcf contamination fear in experiment 1 we selected cfr stimulus from a database with disgust related image dirti even though the hcf group rated cfr image a being more unpleasant arousing and disgusting we found no indicator of preferential processing larger priming effect or faster response in experiment 2 we selected cfr stimulus from a database with image specifically chosen to evoke symptom related anxiety in ocd patient bocd p again negative evaluation of stimulus did not transfer into enhanced information processing we conclude that early information processing of cfr stimulus is fundamentally different to that of fear related stimulus in anxiety disorder probably because of the triggered disgust response

objective fecal incontinence and constipation are common disorder in childhood the enteric nervous system and the central nervous system are highly interactive along the brain gut axis the interaction is mainly afferent these afferent pathway include center that are involved in the central nervous processing of emotion a the mid posterior insula and the anterior cingulate cortex a previous study revealed altered processing of emotion in child with fecal incontinence the present study replicates these result method in order to analyze the processing of emotion we compared the event related potential of 25 child with fecal incontinence and constipation to those of 15 control child during the presentation of positive negative and neutral picture result child with fecal incontinence and constipation showed altered processing of emotion especially in the parietal and central cortical region conclusion the main study result of the previous study were replicated increasing the certainty and validity of the finding

individual with borderline personality disorder bpd show self regulatory deficit associated with reduced heart rate variability hrv however result on reduced hrv in bpd remain heterogeneous thus encouraging the search for developmental construct explaining this heterogeneity the present study first examined predictor of reduced resting state hrv in bpd namely the interaction between self reported adult attachment insecurity and childhood trauma second we investigated if alteration in resting state hrv are modified by intranasal oxytocin administration a oxytocin may enhance hrv and is implicated in the interaction between childhood trauma and disturbed attachment for the pathogenesis of bpd in a randomized placebo controlled trial 53 unmedicated woman with bpd and 60 healthy control hc self administered either 24 i u of oxytocin or placebo and underwent a 4 min electrocardiogram our result replicate significantly reduced hrv in woman with bpd explained up to 16 by variation in childhood trauma and attachment insecurity at high level of acute attachment insecurity higher level of childhood trauma significantly predicted reduced hrv in bpd however our result do not support a significant effect of oxytocin on mean hrv and no interaction effect emerged including childhood trauma and attachment insecurity our finding highlight a complex interaction between reduced vagal activity and developmental factor in bpd

background post traumatic stress disorder ptsd and substance use disorder suds often co occur in adolescent patient previous research ha shown that these patient differ from sud patient without ptsd in term of their substance use pattern in this study we aimed to test whether substance use in this population is related to an attempt to self medicate ptsd related symptom method german adolescent patient aged 13 18 year at an outpatient clinic for sud treatment n 111 43 female completed a self designed questionnaire on use motif a measure of ptsd related experience and underwent a standardized psychiatric interview including structured substance use question participant were subsequently classified a no traumatic experience note but sud traumatic experience but no current ptsd diagnosis te with sud and ptsd with sud after establishing a self designed motive measurement through exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis we calculated non parametric group difference and a mediation analysis in a linear regression framework result the past year frequency of mdma use wa highest in the ptsd group and lowest in the note group h 2 7 2 p 027 eta 2 058 but no difference were found for frequency of tobacco alcohol cannabis or stimulant use all h 4 9 p 085 eta 2 033 while controlling for sex the three group showed a similar pattern highest in the ptsd group and lowest in the note group for coping score f 103 5 77 p 004 eta 2 101 finally mediation analysis revealed an indirect effect of coping score b 0 61 95 ci 0 29 1 58 p 145 on the association between group membership and mdma use frequency conclusion in adolescent sud patient we found an association of current ptsd and lifetime traumatic experience with higher mdma use that could be partially explained by substance use being motivated by an attempt to cope with mental health symptom this indicates a coping process involved specifically in mdma use compared to the use of other psychoactive substance possibly due to unique psychoactive effect of mdma

despite the high prevalence of comorbid depression in people living with coronary artery disease cad uptake of psychological treatment is generally low this study wa designed to investigate the feasibility of an internet based cognitive behavioral icbt depression intervention for people with cad and depressive symptom method people with cad and depressive symptom phq 9 5 were randomly assigned to the eight module comprising icbt n 18 or waitlist control n 16 measure were taken at baseline t1 and at post treatment eight week after randomization t2 feasibility related outcome were recruitment strategy study attrition intervention dropout satisfaction negative effect a well a the potential of the intervention to affect likely outcome in a future full scale trial depression anxiety quality of life fear of progression data analysis were based on intention to treat principle linear regression model were used to detect between group difference linear mixed model were used to model potential change over time result this trial wa terminated prior to a priori defined sample size ha been reached given low recruitment success a well a high intervention dropout 88 and study attrition 23 on average participant in the intervention group completed m 2 78 sd 3 23 module participant in the waitlist control group barely started one module m 0 82 sd 1 81 the satisfaction with the intervention wa low m 20 6 sd 0 88 participant reported no negative effect attributed to the icbt difference between group with regard to depression anxiety fear of progression and quality of life remained non significant p 0 05 conclusion this trial failed to recruit a sufficient number of participant future work should explore potential pitfall with regard to the reach and persuasiveness of internet intervention for people living with cad the study give important indication for future study with regard to the need for new idea to reach and treat people with cad and depression

self esteem generally regarded a an important indicator of adolescent mental health wa assessed by a self report questionnaire in a school sample of 593 subject who had been assessed at 3 time point over 7 year between 11 and 25 year of age within the zurich psychology and psychopathology study zapps cross lagged panel analysis of the longitudinal data from zapps indicated that self esteem wa predictive of internalizing problem and had an impact on internalizing symptom when the analysis were adjusted for coping behavior efficiency of social network and impact of stressful life event self esteem wa also stable r 37 60 within the observed age range after controlling for prior level of the predicted variable the finding support the impact of self esteem on mental health and indicate the importance of addressing self esteem in prevention and intervention program

dopamine d2 receptor drd2 have been strongly implicated in reward processing of natural stimulus and drug using the approach avoidance task aat we recently demonstrated that smoker show an increased approach bias toward smoking related cue but not toward naturally rewarding stimulus here we examined the contribution of the drd2 taq1b polymorphism to smoker and non smoker responsivity toward smoking versus naturally rewarding stimulus in the aat smoker carrying the minor b1 allele of the drd2 taq1b polymorphism showed reduced approach behavior for food related picture compared to non smoker with the same allele in the group of smoker a higher approach bias toward smoking related compared to food related picture wa found in carrier of the b1 allele this pattern wa not evident in smoker homozygous for the b2 allele in addition smoker with the b1 allele reported fewer attempt to quit smoking relative to smoker homozygous for the b2 allele this is the first study demonstrating that behavioral shift in response to smoking relative to natural reward in smoker are mediated by the drd2 taq1b polymorphism our result indicate a reduced natural reward brain reactivity in smoker with a genetically determined decrease in dopaminergic activity i e reduction of drd2 availability it remains to be determined whether this pattern might be related to a different outcome after psychological cessation intervention i e aat modification paradigm in smoker

background anxious apprehension about feared body symptom is thought to play a crucial role in the development chronicity and treatment of panic disorder pd in this study we therefore aimed to elucidate the role of defensive reactivity to anticipated unpleasant symptom in pd that can contribute to a better understanding of pathomechanisms of pd a well a identification of potential target in pd focused intervention by measuring amygdala dependent potentiation of the startle reflex we aimed to investigate whether 1 patient with pd exhibit a specifically increased defensive reactivity to anticipated unpleasant body symptom and 2 whether clinical severity of panic symptomatology varies with magnitude of defensive activation method defensive mobilization to anticipated threat wa investigated in 73 patient with a primary diagnosis of pd with agoraphobia pda and 52 healthy control subject threat of symptom provocation wa established by a standardized hyperventilation task and contrasted to threat of shock to the forearm of the participant result patient with pda and healthy control subject did not differ in their defensive response during anticipation of shock in contrast patient with severe pda a compared with healthy control subject exhibited increased defensive response mobilization and reported more anxiety and panic symptom during anticipation of feared body symptom moreover startle potentiation during anticipation of hyperventilation covaried with the severity of panic symptomatology conclusion the present finding suggest that increased defensive mobilization during anticipation of body symptom is a neurobiological correlate of severe pda that should be specifically targeted in pd intervention and might be used to monitor treatment success

we investigated how patient with social anxiety disorder sad and patient with borderline personality disorder bpd process an increase in the frequency of social interaction we used an eeg compatible version of the online ball tossing game cyberball to induce an increase in the frequency of social interaction in the first condition each player received the ball equally often inclusion 33 ball reception in the following condition the frequency of the ball reception wa increased overinclusion 45 ball reception the main outcome variable wa the event related potential p2 an indicator for social reward processing moreover positive emotion were assessed twenty eight patient with sad 29 patient with bpd and 28 healthy control hcs participated a expected hcs and patient with bpd but not patient with sad showed an increase in the p2 amplitude from the inclusion to the overinclusion condition contrary to our expectation positive emotion did not change from the inclusion to the overinclusion condition eeg result provide preliminary evidence that patient with bpd and hcs but not patient with sad process an increase in the frequency of social interaction a rewarding

background the covid 19 pandemic is a major life stressor posing serious threat not only to physical but also to mental health to better understand mechanism of vulnerability and identify individual at risk for psychopathological symptom in response to stressor is critical for prevention and intervention the error related negativity ern ha been discussed a a neural risk marker for psychopathology and this study examined it predictive validity for perceived risk stress and psychopathological symptom during the covid 19 pandemic method a total of 113 individual who had participated a healthy control participant in previous electroencephalography study 2014 2019 completed a follow up online survey during the first covid 19 wave in germany association of pre pandemic ern and correct response negativity crn with perceived risk regarding covid 19 infection stress and internalizing symptom during the pandemic were examined using mediation model result pre pandemic ern and crn were associated with increased perceived risk regarding a covid 19 infection via this perceived risk the ern and crn were associated with increased stress during the pandemic furthermore risk perception and stress mediated indirect effect of ern and crn on internalizing psychopathology including anxiety depression and obsessive compulsive symptom while controlling for the effect of pre pandemic symptom level conclusion in summary heightened pre pandemic performance monitoring showed indirect association with increase in psychopathological symptom during the first covid 19 wave via effect on perceived covid 19 risk and stress these result further strengthen the notion of performance monitoring event related potential a transdiagnostic neural risk marker and highlight the relevance of stress a a catalyst for symptom development

background the desire to have child ha been declining globally especially in industrialized nation this study examines the physical health correlate and positive and negative mental health correlate of the wish to have a child across time and in two country method questionnaire data were obtained from large scale university sample of 12 574 participant in germany and china result the wish to have a child child wish is related to positive and negative mental health in china and to a lesser degree in germany child wish is positively related to some aspect of mental and somatic health for chinese woman and men negatively to depression for chinese and german men and chinese woman and positively to stress for german men with generally small effect effect hold when controlling for age partnership status and family affluence most relationship were almost equal between woman and men in both china and germany and between country with the exception of two different path in each gender group that is having a partner is associated with a higher child wish in both chinese and german female student in china older female student are more likely to want to have a child while older female student in germany are le likely to want to have a child neither partnership nor age predict child wish for the next year conclusion in sum chinese student reported feeling more positively about having child when they were happy and healthy with the exception that highly satisfied chinese male report lower child wish in the next year more depressed chinese and german men and chinese woman reported lowered child wish and stressed german men reported more child wish older student reported more chinese or le german child wish depending on country

the delay of gratification dog in child is widely investigated with an experimental procedure originally called the marshmallow test whereas the study on self regulation sr in adolescent and adult usually use self report questionnaire delay discounting dd measure simplify the dog procedure and focus on monetary reward the aim of this study wa to investigate age difference in dog and dd from childhood to old age using a test that is suitable for both child and adult furthermore investigation were conducted on the association between dog dd and two future orientation construct future time perspective ftp and episodic future thinking eft a well a age difference in these construct participant from five age group 9 14 18 25 35 55 65 80 80 participated in the study n 96 while we found no age difference for dog dd wa the lowest i e self control sc wa the highest in young middle adult however it wa the highest i e sc wa the lowest in child and old oldest adult furthermore we found significant age difference for dd and ftp a predicted there were strong correlation between dog and ftp and between dd and ftp but not between dog dd and eft these result indicate that age difference in sr vary across the measure used individual who generally think and act in a future oriented manner have a stronger ability to delay gratification

background transcutaneous vagus nerve stimulation tvns is a promising treatment for acute and chronic pain however experimental study yielded controversial result we examined if tvns reduces the perceived intensity of repetitive painful heat stimulation and temporal summation of pain tsp in healthy volunteer in comparison with placebo and sham stimulation a well a no intervention method in 4 session 90 heat pulse stimulus at individual pain tolerance temperature were applied to the ventral forearm of 49 healthy volunteer 25 woman using a contact heat evoked potential stimulator thermode medoc ramat yishai israel pain intensity wa assessed with verbal rating on a numeric pain scale 0 100 at every tenth heat pulse after the first session in which pain intensity without intervention were evaluated participant completed 3 session in a single blinded randomized crossover manner 1 sham stimulation applied at the earlobe 2 placebo stimulation inactive device or 3 tvns applied at the cymbas concha primary data were analyzed using analysis of variance for repeated measure and t test for paired sample result pain intensity decreased during all intervention a compared to no intervention etap 0 22 p 001 mean difference tvns versus no intervention 9 5 95 confidence interval ci 3 6 15 4 p 001 hypoalgesic effect of tvns wa better than that of placebo and sham in men before the onset of tsp mean difference for tvns versus placebo 6 2 95 ci 0 2 12 1 tvns versus sham 6 2 95 ci 0 2 12 1 p 05 in woman tsp response under tvns wa decreased if compared to no intervention median difference 7 5 95 ci 3 5 15 0 p 003 conclusion tvns placebo and sham stimulation exerted comparable effect under experimental heat pain stimulation only in male participant tvns wa superior to sham and placebo condition in the reduction of heat pain before the onset of tsp

metacognitions and interoceptive sensibility in the perception of premonitory urge in tic disorder across the lifespan abstract objective depending on contextual factor the prevalence of premonitory urge pu in patient with tic disorder td increase with age and varies both intra and interindividually in youth pu correlate with metacognitions in both youth and adult interoceptive sensibility is altered compared to healthy control we examined the relationship between pu tic metacognitions and interoceptive sensibility across the lifespan regarding tic severity method in an online survey 53 participant reported their pu on the premonitory urge for tic scale put and tic severity on the symptom checklist for tic disorder sbb tic we assessed interoceptive sensibility via the body perception questionnaire bpq a and metacognitions regarding tic with the belief about tic scale bat result adult scored higher on the put than youth in youth interoceptive sensibility increased with age interoceptive sensibility correlated with put metacognitions and interoceptive sensibility explained a significant amount of variance in premonitory urge even after controlling for tic severity and age conclusion the presumed cause of age dependent development of pu in youth lie in their neurophysiological maturing process however negative metacognitions and interoceptive ability also play an important role in the development and maintenance of pu and might be of therapeutic use in the treatment of td

in this study we explored intersection between two influential integrative framework in psychotherapy research specifically we analyzed association between stage of change from prochaska s transtheoretical model and general mechanism of change from grawe s psychological therapy in a longitudinal design our central hypothesis which we could derive from theorectical concept of both framework wa a follows experiential change mechanism emotional bond problem actuation and clarification of meaning should be especially relevant in early stage of change precontemplation and contemplation and behavioral change mechanism resource activation mastery and agreement on collaboration should be especially relevant in late stage of change action and maintenance therefore 253 inpatient completed the university of rhode island change assessment short version urica s the scale for the multiperspective assessment of general change mechanism in psychotherapy sacip and diverse outcome measure in early middle and late stage of psychotherapy crosslagged panel analysis and multilevel analysis partially supported our hypothesis and revealed trend for interactive effect between change mechanism and stage of change in outcome prediction more specifically our result suggest that experience of both experiential and behavioral change mechanism predicted increase in the action stage of change contemplation predicted increase in behavioral change mechanism experience clinical implication of these finding are discussed

interoceptive accuracy iac that is the ability to accurately perceive one s own bodily signal is widely assumed to be a trait although experimental manipulation such a stress may affect iac we used structural equation modeling to estimate the reliability of iac and the proportion of individual difference in iac explained by a trait and occasion specific effect of situation and person situation interaction we assessed iac in 59 healthy participant 40 woman m age 23 4 year on three consecutive measurement occasion approximately 1 week apart in a rest and poststress condition using a heartbeat counting and a heartbeat discrimination task the result showed fair temporal stability intraclass correlation coefficient 0 38 and good reliability mdn 63 range 49 83 for both method while around 40 of the variance of a single iac measurement could be explained by a trait approximately 27 wa accounted for by occasion specific effect of situation and person situation interaction these result suggest that iac measure are relatively consistent and that situation and person situation interaction impact iac a measured at a certain point in time an aggregation across at least two measurement is recommended when using iac a a trait variable

within committed relationship a wide range of factor may challenge or facilitate sexual satisfaction the aim of this study wa to clarify which individual partner and partnership related aspect of a sexual relationship are crucial for the prediction of sexual satisfaction the study included data of a representative sample of 964 couple from the general population the actor partner interdependence model wa used to estimate actor and partner effect overall predictor explained 57 of outcome variance actor effect were found for sexual function sexual distress frequency of sexual activity desire discrepancy sexual initiative sexual communication sociosexual orientation masturbation and life satisfaction gender specific partner effect were found for sexual function and sexual distress neither age nor relationship duration were significant predictor to deepen our understanding of sexual satisfaction it is necessary to take quantitative and qualitative aspect of sexual relationship into account and to consider actor partner and relationship related predictor

background one of the main problem of internet delivered intervention for a range of disorder is the high dropout rate yet little is known about the factor associated with this we recently developed and tested a web based 6 session program to enhance motivation to change for woman with anorexia nervosa bulimia nervosa or related subthreshold eating pathology objective the aim of the present study wa to identify predictor of dropout from this web program method a total of 179 woman took part in the study we used survival analysis cox regression to investigate the predictive effect of eating disorder pathology assessed by the eating disorder examination questionnaire ede q depressive mood hopkins symptom checklist motivation to change university of rhode island change assessment scale urica and participant age at dropout to identify predictor we used the least absolute shrinkage and selection operator lasso method result the dropout rate wa 50 8 91 179 and wa equally distributed across the 6 treatment session the lasso analysis revealed that higher score on the shape concern subscale of the ede q a higher frequency of binge eating episode and vomiting a well a higher depression score significantly increased the probability of dropout however we did not find any effect of the urica or age on dropout conclusion woman with more severe eating disorder pathology and depressive mood had a higher likelihood of dropping out from a web based motivational enhancement program intervention such a ours need to address the specific need of woman with more severe eating disorder pathology and depressive mood and offer them additional support to prevent them from prematurely discontinuing treatment

objective the main purpose of the present study wa to evaluate sleep duration for nighttime sleep from early infancy to late adolescence in a german sample to illustrate the developmental course and age specific variability of these variable among subject method a total of 17 641 subject from the kiggs study were evaluated the questionnaire contained question about physical health living circumstance health behavior and risk health supply mental health health related quality of life and sleep kiggs assessed sleep by using parent questionnaire of child aged 0 to 10 year n 9944 and self report of adolescent n 7697 aged 11 to 17 year result total sleep duration decreased from 14 28 hour sd 2 33 at the age 0 0 5 to 9 50 hour sd 0 82 at the age of 10 5 11 above the age of 11 adolescent report a decrease of sleep at night from 9 41 hour sd 1 33 at the age of 11 11 5 to 7 42 sd 1 73 at the age of 17 5 18 year unspecified sleep problem were reported of 19 5 13 0 of the child had difficulty falling asleep difficulty sleeping through the night showed 8 8 of the child whereas 3 0 report both symptom difficulty falling asleep and difficulty sleeping through the night conclusion age specific variability of sleep duration is reported a well a sleep difficulty from infancy to adolescence this is important knowledge for the health care professional who deal with sleep problem in pediatric practice

previous study have demonstrated the effectiveness of face to face stress management program in reducing psychological and endocrine response to acute psychosocial stress exposure with the present pilot study we compare the effect of a brief internet based stress management ibsm intervention versus relaxation training on subjective autonomic and endocrine stress response to a standardized psychosocial laboratory stressor trier social stress test for group tsst g a group of male participant receiving ibsm wa compared to a group receiving progressive muscle relaxation pmr training and a waiting list control group all group underwent the tsst g following a 6 week training waiting period both the ibsm and pmr group reported lower subjective stress level than the control group however the ibsm group exhibited the lowest free salivary cortisol response to the tsst g with significantly lower level than the pmr group the waiting list control group exhibited an intermediate cortisol response these preliminary result suggest that a 6 week internet based stress management program is effective in reducing the subjective stress level and might be associated with an attenuated salivary cortisol response to an acute stressor

stress is associated with the development of mental disorder such a depression and psychosis the ability to regulate emotion is likely to influence how individual respond to and recover from acute stress and may thus be relevant to symptom development to test this we investigated whether self reported emotion regulation predicts the endocrine autonomic affective and symptomatic response to and recovery from a stressor social evaluative stress wa induced by the trier social stress test tsst in n 67 healthy individual 53 7 female m age 29 9 self reported habitual emotion regulation skill were assessed at baseline we measured salivary cortisol heart rate negative affect state depression and state paranoia at three time point pre tsst post tsst and after a 10 min recovery phase repeated measure anova showed all indicator to significantly increase in response to the stressor p 001 and decrease during the recovery phase p 001 except for salivary cortisol which showed a linear increase p 001 the habitual use of maladaptive emotion regulation e g rumination catastrophizing significantly predicted an increased affective and reduced cortisol response adaptive emotion regulation e g acceptance reappraisal wa not predictive of the stress response for any of the indicator neither type of emotion regulation predicted response during the stress recovery phase individual who habitually resort to maladaptive emotion regulation strategy show a stronger affective and a blunted endocrine stress response which may make them vulnerable to mental health problem however further research is needed to identify the full scope of skill required for effective stress regulation before this knowledge can be used to develop effective prevention program

many people surgically alter their physical appearance with the intent of boosting their social and psychological well being however the long term effectiveness of aesthetic surgery on improving well being is unconfirmed the present comparison controlled study examines outcome in a sample of 544 patient who underwent aesthetic surgery surgery group and 264 participant who were interested in aesthetic surgery but did not undergo it comparison group participant were followed 3 6 and 12 month after aesthetic surgery or after contacting the clinic comparison overall the result reveal positive outcome of receiving aesthetic surgery across area including anxiety social phobia depression body dysmorphia goal attainment quality of life life satisfaction attractiveness mental and physical health well being self efficacy and self esteem among those dissatisfied with a particular physical feature and considering aesthetic surgery undergoing surgery appears to result in positive self reported psychological change

alexithymia is associated with deficiency to identify describe and express emotion paucity of fantasy and an externally oriented cognitive style the current study provide evidence that alexithymia is also related to self regulation process and exacerbates effect of ego depletion a state where self regulation resource are reduced due to previous act of self regulation in study 1 ego depletion effect of a handgrip task on pain tolerance were increased by alexithymia in study 2 an emotion suppression task showed stronger effect of ego depletion on a stroop task in participant high rather than low in alexithymia but only after suppression of emotion induced by negative and not positive picture the result imply that alexithymia increase susceptibility to ego depletion effect that consumption of self regulatory resource ha stronger consequence for people high in alexithymia and that they should experience special support in way to replenish self regulation resource

objective deficit in emotion regulation er skill are discussed a a transdiagnostic factor contributing to the development and maintenance of various mental disorder however systematic comparison of a broad range of er skill across diagnostic group that are based on comparable definition and measure of er are still rare method therefore we conducted two study assessing a broad range of er skill with the emotion regulation skill questionnaire in individual meeting criterion for mental disorder n 1 1448 n 2 137 and in a general population sample n 214 result consistent across the two study participant in the clinical sample reported lower general and lower specific er skill than participant in the general population sample also consistent across the two study diagnostic subgroup of the clinical sample differed significantly with regard to general and specific er skill conclusion the study provide evidence that deficit in er are associated with various form of psychopathology however mental disorder seem to differ with regard to how strongly they are linked to er skill

objective evaluation of long term effect of an individualized short term telephone intervention seven session based on a comprehensive cognitive behavioral therapy cbt approach the study goal wa to evaluate the maintenance of intervention effect regarding well being quality of life and health at two year post treatment method participant n 105 were partly randomized after baseline assessment in a two arm study intervention control group usual care depressive symptom were assessed with the german version of the center for epidemiologic study depression scale ce d caregiver physical complaint were measured with the giessener beschwerdebogen gbb 24 and quality of life with the world health organization quality of life bref whoqol bref emotional well being and perceived health status were assessed using thermometer scaling data were analyzed by intention to treat analysis including for those who terminated the intervention prematurely but still delivered data using ancovas result long term intervention effect were found for emotional well being p 0 019 for the subgroup of caregiver who were still caring at home at follow up the intervention led to an increased health status p 0 023 fewer bodily complaint global measure p 0 014 rheumatic pain p 0 027 heart trouble p 0 042 and a higher quality of life overall p 0 044 and subscale environment p 0 030 conclusion the short term cbt intervention via telephone showed long term effect two year after treatment on emotional well being health status bodily complaint and quality of life

background depression and suicidal ideation are important health problem in athlete suffering from pain dysfunctional pain cognition that is pain related thought suppression pt may play an important role in their aetiology thought suppression wa shown to increase depressive mood particularly in highly stressed individual this cross sectional study examines the relationship between pt and stress on depression and suicidal ideation in athlete with pain method a total of 159 athlete with non specific low back pain completed a set of questionnaire to measure pt depression and stress participant were split into group with high and low stress and high and low pt two way anova calculated main effect for pt stress and a pt stress interaction with depressive symptom a dependent subsequently distribution test were calculated investigating if the presence of clinically relevant depression and suicidal ideation is dependent of condition of high low pt and stress result a main effect of stress demonstrated higher depression score in highly stressed athlete further a significant pt stress interaction showed elevated depression score in athlete with high pt and high stress distribution analysis revealed positive association between pt stress and depression with depression being most frequent among athlete with high pt and high stress suicidal ideation wa not significantly associated with pt and only weakly correlated with stress conclusion our finding show that pt is the most common pain response in athlete with pain the result indicate a higher prevalence of depression and elevated depressive symptom in athlete experiencing high stress seemingly more pronounced when highly engaging in pt significance this study contributes to the understanding of depression in athlete with pain suggesting stress and pain related thought suppression to increase symptom and prevalence of depression a athlete often experience acute or chronic pain understanding the impact of pain cognition on health outcome is an important step in the optimization of treatment
