introduction up to 60 of all college student suffer from a poor sleep quality and 7 7 meet all criterion of an insomnia disorder sleep problem have a great impact on the student daily life for example the grade point average due to irregular daytime routine chronotype change side job and exam period they need specialized treatment for improving sleep studieren wie im schlaf swis studying in your sleep is a multicomponent sleep training that combine cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia and hypnotherapy for insomnia to improve student sleep insomnia symptom and nightmare the aim of the present study is to evaluate the acceptance feasibility and the first effect of swis method twenty seven student mean 24 24 standard deviation 3 57 participated in a study of pre post design the acceptance and feasibility were measured with questionnaire in addition the pittsburgh sleep quality index psqi sleep log and actigraphy were implemented further variable encompassed daytime sleepiness sleep related personality trait and cognition about sleep result seventy four percent of the participant reported symptom of an insomnia disorder and 51 9 fulfilled all criterion of an insomnia disorder according to the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder fifth edition correspondingly the student suffered from clinically relevant sleep problem according to the psqi the swis sleep training is a well accepted and feasible program significant improvement were observed in the subjective sleep quality and sleep related personality trait a well a clinical improvement in objective sleep measure discussion finding showed that swis is a feasible program for the treatment of sleep problem in college and university student due to it various effect on sleep and cognitive outcome further evaluation of follow up measurement and additional variable that is cognitive performance and mental health is needed

four study investigated the construct validity of the brief version of the german narcissistic personality inventory 13 g npi 13 study 1 n 603 confirmed the three factor structure of the g npi 13 and it association with the npi 40 and the npi 16 in study 2 n 438 the convergent and discriminant validity of the g npi 13 wa analyzed by investigating it relationship with the big five self esteem and mental health variable depression anxiety stress symptom life satisfaction happiness social support study 3 n 118 provided further support for the convergence between the g npi 13 and the npi 40 by investigating their association with vulnerable narcissism self monitoring and mental health in study 4 n 82 the 1 year test retest reliability three measurement time point of the g npi 13 wa investigated taken together the g npi 13 is a valid reliable and economical instrument for measuring the personality trait narcissism possible practical application and limitation of the g npi 13 are discussed

objective to analyze the independent association of depression and diabetes distress with self management and glycemic outcome in type i t1dm and type 2 diabetes t2dm method six hundred six people with t1dm or t2dm participated in a cross sectional survey including measure of depression phq 9 diabetes distress paid 5 self management behavior dsmq and glycemic outcome hba1c structural equation modeling wa performed to analyze the independent linear association standardized coefficient between these variable result in those with t1dm n 339 both depressive symptom and diabetes distress were associated with lower self management 0 34 p 001 and 0 16 p 007 respectively and thereover indirectly with higher hba1c 0 20 p 001 and 0 10 p 016 respectively direct association with hba1c were not observed in those with t2dm n 267 only depressive symptom were associated with lower self management 0 41 p 001 and thus indirectly with higher hba1c 0 17 p 001 diabetes distress by contrast wa directly associated with higher hba1c 0 20 p 003 but not with self management conclusion the result are consistent with the hypothesis that depression is linked to le optimal diabetes self management thus leading to le optimal glycemic outcome the association were relatively consistent across diabetes type diabetes distress wa additionally associated with higher glycemic level suggesting that people with both depression and diabetes distress might have the least optimal outcome the conclusion are limited by the cross sectional study design self report assessment of behavior and potential bias arising from questionnaire measure further research is needed to support these finding psycinfo database record c 2021 apa all right reserved

several study provided evidence that the amplitude of laser evoked potential leps are modulated by attention however previous report were based on across trial averaging of lep response at the expense of losing information about intertrial variability related to attentional modulation the aim of this study wa to investigate the effect of somatosensory spatial attention on single trial parameter i e amplitude latency and latency jitter of lep component n2 and p2 twelve subject participated in a sustained spatial attention paradigm while noxious laser stimulus left hand and noxious electrical stimulus right hand were sequentially delivered to the dorsum of the respective hand with nonnoxious air puff randomly interspersed within the sequence of noxious stimulus participant were instructed to mentally count all stimulus i e noxious and nonnoxious applied to the attended location laser stimulus presented to the attended hand al elicited larger single trial amplitude of the n2 component compared with unattended laser stimulus uls in contrast single trial amplitude of the p2 component were not significantly affected by spatial attention single trial latency of the n2 and p2 were significantly smaller for al v uls additionally the across trial latency jitter of the n2 component wa reduced for al conversely the latency jitter of the p2 component wa smaller for uls compared with al with the use of single trial analysis the study provided new insight into brain dynamic of leps related to spatial attention our result indicate that single trial parameter of lep component are differentially modulated by spatial attention

resilience a longitudinal study of child with risk factor this study examines the development of child who have grown up with severe early childhood stress a distinction wa made between resilient and maladapted child development on the one hand the aim wa to identify longitudinal protective factor that can contribute to the development of resilience on the other hand we cross sectionally examined in which psychological area resilience manifest itself the sample consists of 343 child who were examined first in early childhood m 4 year and then ten year later in adolescence 24 of the child belonged to the risk group of which 14 showed a resilient and 9 a maladapted development an active temperament higher intelligence and more self control in early childhood proved to be protective factor with medium effect size the proportion of resilience wa increased among migrant cross sectionally we found difference with small and medium effect size in addictive behavior alcohol tobacco and drug use internet dependency overweight and school grade

objective and aim to describe difference in pain location for onset peak and radiation aspect of cluster headache ch attack method and material data were collected for 23 month using a cross sectional online survey composed of 117 question on pain location demographic and clinical feature 5260 datapoints on 44 pain location from 631 respondent were analyzed result during the onset and peak of attack pain is concentrated periorbitally pain location outside the periorbital region were reported more frequently for radiation than for onset and peak of attack dorsal occipital neck shoulder pain wa reported more frequently in connection with onset and radiation than during peak onset 13 versus peak 6 p 0 001 and radiation 22 versus peak 6 p 0 001 there wa no significant difference in dorsal pain frequency for onset 13 v radiation 22 p 0 552 furthermore the frequency with which individual pain location were reported differed significantly for onset peak and radiation in ch conclusion analysis of the pain location data show specific frequency and distribution of pain location for three aspect of ch attack the frequency with which individual pain point were reported differed significantly for onset peak and radiation in general dorsal pain point were reported more frequently for onset and radiation than for peak pain pain location beyond the eye extraorbital point were more frequently reported in connection with radiating pain our finding could serve a a basis for future research correlating ch pain pattern with the outcome of treatment approach

emotion effect in event related brain potential erps have previously been reported for a range of visual stimulus including emotional word picture and facial expression still little is known about the actual comparability of emotion effect across these stimulus class the present study aimed to fill this gap by investigating emotion effect in response to word picture and facial expression using a blocked within subject design furthermore rating of stimulus arousal and valence were collected from an independent sample of participant modulation of early posterior negativity epn and late positive complex lpc were visible for all stimulus domain but showed clear difference particularly in valence processing while emotion effect were limited to positive stimulus for word they were predominant for negative stimulus in picture and facial expression these finding corroborate the notion of a positivity offset for word and a negativity bias for picture and facial expression which wa assumed to be caused by generally lower arousal level of written language interestingly however these assumed difference were not confirmed by arousal rating instead word were rated a overall more positive than picture and facial expression taken together the present result point toward systematic difference in the processing of written word and pictorial stimulus of emotional content not only in term of a valence bias evident in erps but also concerning their emotional evaluation captured by rating of stimulus valence and arousal

acrophobia is characterized by intense fear in height situation virtual reality vr can be used to trigger such phobic fear and vr exposure therapy vret ha proven effective for treatment of phobia although it remains important to further elucidate factor that modulate and mediate the fear response triggered in vr the present study assessed verbal and behavioral fear response triggered by a height simulation in a 5 sided cave automatic virtual environment cave with visual and acoustic simulation and further investigated how fear response are modulated by immersion i e an additional wind simulation and presence i e the feeling to be present in the ve result revealed a high validity for the cave and ve in provoking height related self reported fear and avoidance behavior in accordance with a trait measure of acrophobic fear increasing immersion significantly increased fear response in high height anxious hha participant but did not affect presence nevertheless presence wa found to be an important predictor of fear response we conclude that a cave system can be used to elicit valid fear response which might be further enhanced by immersion manipulation independent from presence these result may help to improve vret efficacy and it transfer to real situation

objective neuropsychological deficit and emotion dysregulation are present in symptomatic and euthymic patient with bipolar disorder however there is little evidence on how cognitive functioning is influenced by emotion what the neural correlate of emotional distraction effect are and whether such deficit are a consequence or a precursor of the disorder the author used functional mri fmri to investigate these question method fmri wa used first to localize the neural network specific to a certain cognitive task mental arithmetic and then to test the effect of emotional distractors on this network euthymic patient with bipolar i disorder n 22 two population at high risk for developing the disorder unaffected first degree relative of individual with bipolar disorder n 17 and healthy participant with hypomanic personality trait n 22 were tested along with three age gender and education matched healthy comparison group n 22 n 17 n 24 respectively result there were no difference in performance or activation in the task network for mental arithmetic however while all participant exhibited slower response when emotional distractors were present this response slowing wa greatly enlarged in bipolar patient similarly task related activation wa generally increased under emotional distraction however bipolar patient exhibited a further increase in right parietal activation that correlated positively with the response slowing effect conclusion the result suggest that emotional dysregulation lead to exacerbated neuropsychological deficit in bipolar patient a evidenced by behavioral slowing and task related hyperactivation the lack of such a deficit in high risk population suggests that it occurs only after disease onset rather than representing a vulnerability marker

political violence is known to cause psychological distress there is a large body of empirical study drawing correlation between war trauma torture and post traumatic stress disorder ptsd however there are few study on the effect of war related trauma among syrian refugee after event following the arab spring uprising between 2010 and 2012 this study examines the association of ptsd symptom with torture and other traumatic event among syrian kurdish refugee living in kurdistan region iraq the experience and ptsd symptom among 91 syrian kurdish refugee in the arbat camp in the sulaymaniyah governorate of the kurdistan region of iraq were assessed using the harvard trauma questionnaire section i iv and v result showed that the estimated level of ptsd symptom were high between 35 and 38 there were no significant gender difference in the occurrence of ptsd symptom however men reported more general traumatic experience than woman there were significant positive correlation between ptsd symptom with traumatic event and torture r 0 500 r 0 366 respectively examining the mental health impact of torture and other traumatic event among refugee ha possible implication for organization managing rehabilitation program for individual who have been exposed to traumatic event

introduction the aim of this study were to identify whether response to paranoid thought distinguish patient with psychotic disorder from people in the population who have paranoid thought occasionally and to identify factor that are associated with and might explain the different way of responding method paranoid thought were assessed in patient diagnosed with a psychotic disorder n 32 and a population control sample n 34 with the paranoia checklist response to paranoid thought were assessed with the reaction to paranoid thought scale rept and social support self efficacy and cognitive insight were assessed a potential correlate of the response to paranoid thought result the patient showed significantly more depressed physical and devaluating response to paranoid thought and employed le normalising response than the control the difference in normalising response were explained by perceived social integration whereas the difference in depressive response were explained by the overall level of depression and partly explained by externality and social integration conclusion maladaptive response to paranoid thought could be relevant to the pathogenesis and maintenance of persecutory delusion intervention aimed at reducing paranoia could benefit from targeting dysfunctional response to paranoid thought and by placing a stronger emphasis on treating depression and improving social integration

abstract suicide belongs to the leading cause of death worldwide the present longitudinal study investigated physical activity for example jogging cycling and positive mental health pmh a potential factor that can reduce the risk of suicide ideation and suicidal behavior data of 223 participant 79 4 woman m age sd age 22 85 4 05 were assessed at two measurement time point over a three year period 2016 first measurement baseline bl 2019 second measurement follow up fu via online survey the result reveal a significant positive relationship between higher physical activity bl and higher pmh bl higher score of both variable were significantly negatively linked to lower suicide related outcome fu moreover the association between higher physical activity bl and lower suicide related outcome fu wa significantly mediated by higher pmh bl the current finding demonstrate that physical activity in combination with pmh can reduce the risk of suicide related outcome fostering physical activity and pmh may be relevant strategy in the prevention of suicide ideation and suicide behavior

background and objective cognitive restructuring and imagery modification for ptsd crim ptsd is a new short intervention it consists of the cognitive restructuring of core trauma related dysfunctional belief about the self and the use of imagery to encourage more functional belief a randomized controlled trial showed that crim wa effective for reducing posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd in survivor of childhood sexual abuse csa when it focused on the feeling of being contaminated for this study crim wa adapted to treat ptsd symptom more generally and after various type of trauma by addressing the patient negative self concept method ten patient with ptsd received two assessment session two treatment session and a booster session the clinician administered ptsd scale cap wa administered prior to and four week after treatment self rating e g the posttraumatic diagnostic scale pd and the posttraumatic cognition inventory ptci were administered at baseline immediately posttreatment and four week after treatment result the participant showed significant improvement in both clinician rated d 2 55 p 0 01 and self reported ptsd symptom d 1 47 p 0 01 one month after treatment 9 patient no longer fully met the diagnostic criterion for ptsd limitation the result are limited by the small sample size and the lack of a control group conclusion this pilot study suggests that addressing the negative self concept of ptsd patient using a combination of cognitive technique and imagery modification can effectively reduce ptsd symptom further research is needed to ass the treatment s effect and stability in a randomized controlled trial

learning is blocked when a stimulus is followed by an outcome that is identical to what wa expected and thus contains no new information this classic blocking effect exemplifies that learning is driven by the predictive value of stimulus which in turn should guide the allocation of attentional resource stress is known to be a powerful modulator of learning and memory however whether stress may affect attentional processing during predictive learning is largely unknown here we combined electroencephalography and eye tracking with an experimental stress manipulation and a fear conditioning paradigm designed to probe the blocking effect to determine if and how stress impact efficient attentional processing during predictive learning participant explicit rating indicated irrespective of stress a blocking effect the control group further showed preferential attentional processing of predictive v unpredictive stimulus reflected in differential fixation duration and a differential n2pc stress abolished this differentiation and led even to sustained attention indicated by higher late positive potential to stimulus with low predictive value moreover stress resulted in an overall increase in the p3b during the blocking phase suggesting increased attentional processing presumably due to impaired access to previously learned association together our result suggest that while control participant paid particular attention to predictive stimulus and reduced attention to unpredictive stimulus in line with the classic blocking effect stress before learning reduced this preferential processing thus the present finding highlight the role of attention allocation for predictive fear learning and suggest that stress may impair efficient information processing against the background of prior experience

the perception of time is a fundamental part of human experience recent research suggests that the experience of time emerges from emotional and interoceptive bodily state a processed in the insular cortex whether there is an interaction between the conscious awareness of interoceptive state and time distortion induced by emotion ha rarely been investigated so far we aimed to address this question by the use of a retrospective time estimation task comparing two group of participant one group had a focus on interoceptive state and one had a focus on exteroceptive information while watching film clip depicting fear amusement and neutral content main result were that attention to interoceptive process significantly affected subjective time experience fear wa accompanied with subjective time dilation that wa more pronounced in the group with interoceptive focus while amusement led to a quicker passage of time which wa also increased by interoceptive focus we conclude that retrospective temporal distortion are directly influenced by attention to bodily response these effect might crucially interact with arousal level sympathetic nervous system activation affecting memory build up might be the decisive factor influencing retrospective time judgment our data substantially extend former research finding underscoring the relevance of interoception for the effect of emotional state on subjective time experience

bias in information processing are attributed an important role in the maintenance of tobacco dependence a these bias are not sufficiently taken into account in current treatment the aim of the present study wa to investigate whether clinical outcome can be improved by combining treatment a usual tau with approach avoidance modification training aamt a two group parallel 1 1 randomized controlled single blind study with adult smoker n 105 wa conducted drks00011406 participant received three session of tau and either six session of aamt or sham training during aamt participant were trained to implicitly avoid all smoking related and to approach all smoking unrelated picture while the contingency wa 50 50 in sham training participant were assessed after the intervention and 6 month later primary outcome wa daily cigarette consumption at follow up participant receiving tau aamt did not show a significantly greater reduction of daily cigarette consumption at follow up compared to tau sham per protocol 95 ci 2 56 4 89 p 608 intention to treat 95 ci 3 11 2 96 p 968 using an implicit aamt v sham a an add on to tau did not improve clinical outcome however no consistent evidence for a change of bias wa found it is important for future research to explore the effectiveness of optimized training version e g explicit instruction pre registration german clinical trial register drks00011406

abstract little is known about mental image cognitive representation with sensory quality in body integrity identity disorder biid this study aimed to determine whether individual with biid experience mental image and if so whether they differ to those experienced by individual with body dysmorphic disorder bdd and healthy control a semi structured interview on mental image and their quality wa delivered to a sample of 22 individual with biid and 19 with bdd and 22 healthy control both the biid n 15 68 2 and bdd n 14 73 7 group reported significantly more mental image than healthy control n 3 13 6 but no difference between the two clinical group were found while mental image in bdd were focused on flawed body part image in biid involved the desired handicap mental image in biid were experienced a le distressing and more sexually arousing compared to bdd no further difference were found between the group e g regarding sensory multimodality dominance of a specific body part although the two group reported a similar frequency of mental image image appear to serve different function across condition clinically it may be necessary to target the positive mental image in biid to improve treatment outcome

objective this study estimate feedback and therapist effect and test the predictive value of therapist and patient attitude toward psychometric feedback for treatment outcome and length method data of 349 outpatient and 44 therapist in private practice were used separate multilevel analysis were conducted to estimate predictor and feedback and therapist effect result around 5 88 of the variability in treatment outcome and 8 89 in treatment length were attributed to therapist there wa no relationship between the average effectiveness of therapist and the average length of their treatment initial impairment early alliance number of diagnosis feedback a well a therapist and patient attitude toward feedback were significant predictor of treatment outcome treatment tended to be longer for patient with a higher number of approved session by the insurance company with higher level of interpersonal distress at intake and for those who developed negatively negative feedback over the course of their treatment conclusion therapist effect on treatment outcome and treatment length in routine care seem to be relevant predictor in the context of feedback study therapist attitude toward and use of feedback a well a patient attitude toward feedback should be further investigated in future research on psychometric feedback

disturbance of attachment represent a clinically significant disorder and seriously impair social behavioural functioning to date there ha been little research and valid diagnostic method are lacking in the present study a german version of the disturbance of attachment interview developed by smyke and zeanah 1999 wa used to ass disturbance of attachment in a sample of foster child and the validity of the translation is investigated furthermore the strength and difficulty questionnaire goodman 1997 wa used to examine the discriminative validity the result show a satisfying reliability and the scale of attachment disorder declare the main of the variance there is a weak association between the disinhibited scale and hyperactivity in the sdq overall the disinhibited disorder can be distinguished from other behaviour pattern regarding the inhibited scale there are association with all sdq scale and the inhibited category seems harder to distinguish from other deviant developmental issue the method is evaluated a a qualified approach to the diagnosis of attachment disorder in the context of a multimethodical approach furthermore the finding suggest further examination of the construct of attachment disturbance

background patient with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd experience abnormally high level of uncertainty and unpredictability is evaluated negatively and not well tolerated the current study examined neural correlate of attentional processing in response to experimentally induced uncertainty in ocd method twenty four ocd patient and 24 healthy control performed a task where neutral and negative picture were preceded by a cue either being predictive certain condition or nonpredictive uncertain condition of subsequent picture valence we examined prepicture anticipatory attention through alpha approximately 8 12 hz suppression and attentional allocation during picture presentation with the p1 n1 p2 n2 and late positive potential lpp of the event related potential additionally we tested how clinical measure related to these attentional marker result subjectively patient overestimated the frequency of negative picture after nonpredictive cue patient but not control showed upper alpha 10 12 hz suppression after nonpredictive and predictive negative cue relative to predictive neutral cue only patient showed increased p2 and decreased n2 amplitude for picture after nonpredictive cue and whereas both group showed increased lpp amplitude for picture after nonpredictive cue this modulation wa more pronounced in ocd during the early lpp 1 000 m in patient p2 and lpp amplitude for negative picture were associated positively with anxiety and negatively with depression conclusion these result suggest that ocd patient process anticipation of inevitable and potential threat similarly and highlight the substantial motivational impact of uncertain event to ocd patient finally the correlation with anxiety implies that anxiety represents the source of hypervigilance during uncertainty resolution

22q11 2 deletion syndrome 22q11ds is a genetic disorder associated with neurodevelopmental anxiety and mood disorder a well a an increased risk for developing psychosis cortisol level and stress reactivity reflect hypothalamic pituitary adrenal hpa axis activity and are believed to be altered in individual that often experience daily life stress depression and psychotic symptom however it is unknown whether individual with 22q11ds display an altered stress reactivity we included 27 adult with 22q11ds mean age 34 1 year 67 female and 24 age and sex matched healthy control hc mean age 39 9 year 71 female into an experience sampling study throughout 6 consecutive day we measured participant subjective stress related to current activity and at the same time collected salivary cortisol sample multilevel regression model were used to analyze cortisol reactivity to activity related stress diurnal cortisol level were significantly lower in the 22q11ds group compared to hcs b 1 03 p 0 001 22q11ds adult displayed significantly attenuated cortisol reactivity to activity related stress compared to hcs b 0 04 p 0 026 post hoc exploratory analysis revealed that these result were independent from 22q11ds psychiatric diagnosis or medication use these result indicate that adult with 22q11ds have lower cortisol level and attenuated cortisol response to daily stress possibly resulting from an increased sensitization of the hpa axis this suggests that alteration in hpa axis functioning previously reported in several psychiatric disorder including post traumatic stress disorder ptsd psychotic disorder and mood disorder also appear to be present in adult with 22q11ds

etiological model highlight the importance of emotion for the emergence of persecutory ideation to increase our understanding of their exacerbation we tested whether this process can be explained by a vicious cycle of negative emotion and persecutory ideation in daily life furthermore we examined whether this process differs in people with and without a psychotic disorder by testing a sample of 34 individual with elevated psychotic experience without a diagnosis subclinical sample and a sample of 33 individual diagnosed with schizophrenia spectrum disorder clinical sample in both sample we applied the experience sampling method for 1 week to acquire repeated measure of sadness fear anger shame and persecutory ideation multilevel model showed that all tested negative emotion were associated with persecutory ideation measured at the same time point p 05 in both sample fear predicted subsequent persecutory ideation p 05 there wa a moderating effect between sample and anger and sample and sadness predicting subsequent persecutory ideation p 05 with these association being stronger in the subclinical sample finally persecutory ideation predicted subsequent fear anger sadness and shame p 05 without a moderating effect of the sample hence the result showed an emotion unspecific rather than an emotion specific vicious cycle of negative emotion and persecutory ideation which possibly contributes to symptom exacerbation and maintenance potential difference in mechanism relating to emotion and persecutory ideation before and after the manifestation of the disorder are discussed psycinfo database record c 2020 apa all right reserved

approximately 15 20 of child experience behavioral and or emotional difficulty evidence based treatment will likely not be sufficient to reduce the prevalence of these difficulty in child and adolescent effective prevention program are therefore also needed to enable family access to support at multiple point across the lifecourse the aim of the current investigation wa to evaluate the 4 year efficacy of the group based triple p positive parenting program a a prevention program administered universally seventeen preschool were randomly assigned to triple p n 11 preschool 186 family or a no parenting intervention control group n 6 preschool 94 family long term efficacy wa analyzed with hierarchical linear model using maternal and paternal self report measure mother and father from the intervention preschool group reported significant reduction in dysfunctional parenting behavior d 0 24 and 0 19 respectively mother also reported a le steep decline from pre to post intervention in positive parenting behavior which wa maintained 4 year later d 0 38 father from intervention preschool reported a delayed le steep decline in positive parenting during the follow up d 0 33 in addition mother from intervention preschool reported immediate improvement in child behavior problem during the program while mother from control preschool did not report this immediate change however with mother from intervention preschool reporting more child behavior problem at baseline the effect disappeared by the fourth year d 0 19 the result support the long term efficacy of the triple p group program a a universal prevention intervention for changing parenting behavior while there wa little evidence for maintenance of change in behavior problem

many person with personality disorder experience psychological distress the international classification of disease 11th revision icd 11 contains a dimensional personality disorder model that comprises personality dysfunctioning 5 maladaptive personality trait domain and a borderline pattern qualifier research on the relation between the icd 11 personality disorder model and psychological distress is sparse particularly it is unclear whether personality dysfunctioning on the one side and the more specific personality trait in icd 11 on the other side incrementally predict psychological distress in addition the incremental validity of the component of the icd 11 personality disorder model beyond the five factor model of normal range personality a a widely accepted personality framework ha not been established in this study we assessed the relation between self report measure of the icd 11 personality disorder model and psychological distress in 2 community sample n sample 1 203 n sample 2 226 except anankastia all icd 11 personality trait domain assessed with the personality inventory for icd 11 and the borderline pattern qualifier assessed with the borderline pattern scale were strongly related to psychological distress in hierarchical regression the personality trait in icd 11 incrementally predicted psychological distress beyond personality dysfunctioning and vice versa in addition the component of the icd 11 personality disorder model were substantially related to psychological distress beyond the corresponding normal range big five personality trait our result demonstrate the criterion related and incremental validity of self report instrument assessing the icd 11 personality disorder model which support their utility for screening and assessment psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

objective we tested whether people with schizophrenia and prominent expressive negative symptom en show reduced facial expression in face to face social interaction and whether this expressive reduction explains negative social evaluation of these person method we compared participant with schizophrenia with high en n 18 with participant with schizophrenia with low en n 30 and with healthy control n 39 participant engaged in an affiliative role play that wa coded for the frequency of positive and negative facial expression and rated for social performance skill and willingness for future interaction with the respective role play partner result participant with schizophrenia with high en showed significantly fewer positive facial expression than those with low en and control and were also rated significantly lower on social performance skill and willingness for future interaction participant with schizophrenia with low en did not differ from control on these measure the group difference in willingness for future interaction wa significantly and independently mediated by the reduced positive facial expression and social performance skill conclusion reduced facial expressiveness in schizophrenia is specifically related to en and ha negative social consequence these finding highlight the need to develop aetiological model and targeted intervention for en and it social consequence

background evidence suggests that maternal anxiety is associated with adverse pregnancy and delivery outcome such a preterm birth vaginal bleeding and low birth weight aim to examine the association of lifetime anxiety disorder and pregnancy related anxiety and complication during pregnancy and delivery study design prospective longitudinal study mari subject n 306 pregnant woman who were investigated repeatedly during the peripartum period outcome measure information on lifetime anxiety disorder wa assessed using a dimensional score lifetime anxiety liability index based on the standardized composite international diagnostic interview for woman cidi v pregnancy related anxiety wa surveyed with the pregnancy and childbirth related fear pcf questionnaire common pregnancy e g vaginal bleeding and delivery complication e g labor induction were assessed via medical record interview and questionnaire result the global test on the association between lifetime anxiety liability and pregnancy complication and on the association between pregnancy related anxiety and pregnancy delivery complication revealed significant association further analysis revealed association of lifetime anxiety liability with preterm labor or 1 6 95 ci 1 2 2 0 a well a pregnancy related anxiety with vaginal bleeding or 1 4 95 ci 1 0 1 8 preterm labor or 1 3 95 ci 1 0 1 7 gestational diabetes or 0 5 95 ci 0 2 0 9 labor induction or 1 5 95 ci 1 1 1 9 and use of labor medication or 1 6 95 ci 1 2 2 0 after adjustment for maternal age maternal body mass index maternal smoking socioeconomic status occupation household income and social support cohabitation the association between pregnancy related anxiety and labor induction a well a use of labor medication remained significant conclusion pregnancy related anxiety should be regularly assessed and if necessary treated during early pregnancy to minimize risk for complication during delivery

objective multiple sclerosis m is characterized by impairment in basic cognitive function such a information processing speed a well a in more complex higher order domain such a social cognition however a these deficit often co occur it ha remained challenging to determine whether they have a specific pathological basis or are driven by shared biology method to identify neural signature of social cognition deficit in m data were analyzed from n 29 patient with relapsing remitting m and n 29 healthy control matched for age sex and education we used neuropsychological assessment of information processing speed attention learning working memory and relevant aspect of social cognition theory of mind emotion recognition er empathy and employed neuroimaging of cns network using resting state functional connectivity result m patient showed significant deficit in verbal learning and memory a well a implicit er performance in these domain wa uncorrelated functional connectivity analysis identified a distinct network characterized by significant association between poorer er and lower connectivity of the fusiform gyrus ffg with the right lateral occipital cortex which also showed lower connectivity in patient compared to control moreover while er wa correlated with m symptom such a fatigue and motor sensory functioning on a behavioral level ffg connectivity signature of social cognition deficit showed no overlap with these symptom conclusion our analysis identify distinct functional connectivity signature of social cognition deficit in m indicating that these alteration may occur independently from those in other neuropsychological function

the covid 19 pandemic is suggested to have a negative impact on mental health to prevent the spread of sars cov 2 government worldwide have implemented different form of public health measure ranging from physical distancing recommendation to stay at home order which have disrupted individual everyday life tremendously however evidence on the association of the covid 19 pandemic and public health measure with mental health are limited so far in this study we investigated the role of sociodemographic and covid 19 related factor for immediate mental health consequence in a nationwide community sample of adult from germany n 4335 specifically we examined the effect of different form and level of restriction resulting from public health measure e g quarantine stay at home order on anxiety and depression symptomatology health anxiety loneliness the occurrence of fearful spell psychosocial distress and life satisfaction we found that higher restriction due to lockdown measure a greater reduction of social contact and greater perceived change in life were associated with higher mental health impairment importantly a subjectively assumed but not an officially announced stay at home order wa associated with poorer mental health our finding underscore the importance of adequate risk communication and targeted mental health recommendation especially for vulnerable group during these challenging time

objective to analyse whether a subjective quality of life qol instrument qlis quality of life in schizophrenia developed on the basis of a large number of open ended interview with schizophrenic patient ha sufficient discriminant and convergent validity to justify it application a a schizophrenia specific qol instrument method the discriminant and convergent validity of the qlis comprising 12 subscales wa analysed in a cross sectional study schizophrenic person n 135 from different care setting were surveyed using the qlis the whoqol bref the swn and 7 point satisfaction item partial correlational analysis and regression analysis controlling for general life satisfaction were conducted comparing the qlis subscales with those of the other instrument result positive correlation coefficient were found among all subscales of the qlis and the other qol instrument whoqol bref from r 0 29 to r 0 72 swn r 0 14 to r 0 83 satisfaction scale r 0 18 to r 0 69 one qlis subscale cognitive functioning wa shown to be empirically redundant r 0 80 to the mental functioning subscale of the swn all other subscales proved to have unique variance the non qlis qol instrument only accounted for substantial amount of variance 20 after controlling for global life satisfaction in the qlis subscales leading a normal life appreciation by others appraisal of accommodation housing and social contact discussion most of the qlis subscales can be regarded a sufficiently distinct from other qol instrument and thus show evidence of discriminant and convergent validity conclusion a subjective qol questionnaire with high content validity can provide additional empirical information about schizophrenic qol not accounted for by other common qol instrument

background and objective patient with schizophrenia reveal impaired decision making strategy causing social financial and health care problem the extent to which deficit in decision making reflect intentional risky choice in schizophrenia is still under debate based on previous study we expected patient with schizophrenia to reveal a riskier performance on the gdt and to make more disadvantageous decision on the igt method in the present study we investigated 38 patient with schizophrenia and 38 matched healthy control subject with two competing paradigm regarding feedback 1 the game of dice task gdt in which the probability of winning or losing are stable and explicitly disclosed to the subject to ass decision making under risk and 2 the iowa gambling task igt which requires subject to infer the probability of winning or losing from feedback to investigate decision making under ambiguity result patient with schizophrenia revealed an overall riskier performance on the gdt although they adjusted their strategy over the course of the gdt they still made significantly more disadvantageous choice than control more positive symptom in patient with schizophrenia indicated by higher pan positive score were associated with riskier choice and le use of negative feedback compared to healthy control they were not impaired in net score but chose more disadvantageous card than control on the first block of the igt limitation effect of medication at the time of testing cannot be ruled out conclusion our finding suggest that patient with schizophrenia make riskier decision and are le able to regulate their decision making to implement advantageous strategy even when the probability of winning or losing are explicitly disclosed the dissociation between performance on the gdt and igt suggests a pronounced impairment of executive function related to the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex

background negative affective state may increase the risk for problematic pornography use underlying neurophysiological mechanism are however not completely understood previous research suggests that the participant emotional state may affect neural processing of sexual stimulus the aim of this study wa to investigate neural correlate of negative affect induced alteration in sexual cue reactivity in healthy men the moderating effect of habitual porn consumption trait sexual motivation and symptom of cybersex addiction were also considered method sixty four healthy men engaged in a sexual cue reactivity task passive viewing of explicit sexual picture and neutral picture depicting scene of social interaction during negative n 32 v neutral affect n 32 induced via tailored feedback on a performance task self reported sexual arousal and event related brain potential indicated cue reactivity and motivated attention symptom of cybersex addiction and trait sexual motivation were assessed with the help of the short internet addiction test adapted to online sexual activity and the trait sexual motivation questionnaire result negative feedback increased negative affect after the performance task while sexual picture compared to neutral picture elicited significantly larger p300 and late positive potential lpp amplitude there wa no general effect of negative feedback on sexual stimulus related p300 and lpp amplitude in the negative feedback group men with higher solitary sexual motivation level showed higher p300 lpp difference amplitude for sexual stimulus compared to men with lower level of solitary sexual motivation the opposite effect wa found in the group with neutral feedback there wa no link to other aspect of trait sexual motivation and symptom of cybersex addiction conclusion result suggest that higher level of solitary sexual motivation may enhance motivated attention toward sexual stimulus among men receiving negative performance feedback other characteristic of sexual behavior and trait provided no exploratory value future study extending onto men suffering from compulsive sexual behavior disorder will have to closer look at the neurophysiological base of why and when some men develop an addictive pornography consumption

we assessed transgenerational effect of maternal traumatic exposure posttraumatic stress symptom and posttraumatic stress disorder on trauma related symptom in cambodian offspring born after the genocidal khmer rouge regime we conducted a randomized cross sectional study n 378 mother from 4 province of the country and one of each of their grown up child were interviewed lifetime traumatic exposure wa determined using a context adapted event list present posttraumatic stress symptom and a potential posttraumatic stress disorder were assessed using the civilian version of the posttraumatic stress disorder checklist we found no indication of transgenerational effect that were directly related to maternal traumatic exposure posttraumatic stress symptom or posttraumatic stress disorder instead a gender specific moderating effect wa found individual traumatic exposure had a stronger effect on posttraumatic stress symptom in daughter the higher the mother s lifetime traumatic exposure there is evidence of an interaction between lifetime traumatic exposure of mother and their offspring that can be interpreted a an increased vulnerability to symptom of posttraumatic stress in daughter the mechanism of transgenerational trauma in the cambodian context require further research a learning from previous conflict will be instructive when addressing the pressing humanitarian need of today s world

background several study have investigated the relationship between emotional attachment to pet and mental health with the majority of study finding a negative relationship between emotional attachment to pet and mental health interestingly attachment to pet differs from attachment to human with study showing that human with an insecure attachment style form a particularly strong emotional attachment to their companion animal human attachment style is also related to mental health with secure attachment being associated with superior mental health building on those finding the current study aimed at exploring the role of attachment to human in the relationship between emotional attachment to pet and mental health method in this cross sectional online survey n 610 we assessed the strength of emotional attachment to pet and attachment to human we further collected pet specific data a well a mental health burden in a sample of german dog owner m age 33 12 92 79 woman we used a mediation model estimating the indirect link between emotional attachment to pet and mental health burden via human attachment and the direct link between emotional attachment to pet and mental health burden simultaneously result we found that attachment to human fully mediated the positive association between emotional attachment to pet and mental health burden a stronger emotional attachment to one s dog wa associated with lower comfort with depending on or trusting in others whereby lower comfort with depending on or trusting in others wa related to higher mental health burden moreover a stronger attachment to one s dog wa also related to a greater fear of being rejected and unloved anxiety which wa in turn associated with a higher mental health burden conclusion our finding suggest that the positive link between emotional attachment to pet and mental health burden is fully accounted for by it shared variance with insecure attachment to human in a sample mostly comprising self identified woman future study need to examine whether strong emotional bond with pet may evolve a a compensatory strategy to buffer difficult childhood bonding experience

executive functioning ef may be important for refugee youth s long term adjustment the current study examined association between factor on different ecological level individual family community and inhibitory control ic working memory wm cognitive flexibility cf and selective attention sa among 226 burundian youth aged between 7 and 15 in three refugee camp multiple regression model revealed positive association between trauma exposure and cf and between posttraumatic stress symptom and sa and wm having more sibling father socioeconomic status and a better father child relationship were related to better ef including higher sa and wm higher level of maltreatment by mother were related to lower ic higher peer support wa related to higher wm being orphaned child s emotional and behavioral problem mother education community violence and the type of camp established v new were not significantly related to child s ef the finding underscore the importance of proximal social factor for child s ef father socioeconomic status and father child relationship quality were positively related to youth s executive skill having more sibling and supportive friend wa related to higher working memory maltreatment by mother wa associated with lower inhibitory control intervention promoting socioeconomic condition and father involvement may foster refugee youth s executive functioning

anticipatory pleasure refers to a state of positive affect in anticipation of future event that ha been found to motivate goal directed behavior previous research ha indicated that patient with negative symptom of psychosis show reduced goal directed behavior because demotivating belief impede anticipatory pleasure this study aim to link demotivating belief and anticipatory pleasure to patient motivation in everyday life using the experience sampling method we examined the motivational process of goal directed activity in the daily life of 35 patient with negative symptom and 36 healthy control we tested whether the mechanism underlying goal directed behavior differs between patient and healthy control and whether demotivating belief interfere with goal directed behavior by impeding anticipatory pleasure multilevel analysis revealed that anticipatory pleasure mediated the association between goal intention and goal directed activity in both group indirect effect 24 30 in the patient group however the association between social goal intention and anticipatory pleasure wa weaker b 0 09 se 0 05 p 01 0 17 0 04 than in the control but this wa not found for goal intention related self care or recreational activites also demotivating belief were more pronounced in the patient sample f 1 70 72 11 p 001 and moderated the effect of goal intention on anticipatory pleasure for social activity in the whole sample b 0 12 se 0 05 p 01 0 20 0 08 our result support the assumption that a set of demotivating belief prevents patient with negative symptom from looking forward to social activity and thus provide a possible psychological explanation for the social withdrawal of patient with negative symptom

introduction dysfunctional appraisal about traumatic event and their sequela are a key mechanism in posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd experimental study have shown that a computerized cognitive training cognitive bias modification for appraisal cbm app can modify dysfunctional appraisal and reduce analogue trauma symptom amongst healthy and subclinical volunteer objective we aimed to test whether cbm app could reduce dysfunctional appraisal related to trauma reaction in ptsd patient and whether this would lead to improvement in ptsd symptom method we compared cbm app to sham training in a parallel arm proof of principle double blind randomized controlled trial amongst 80 ptsd patient admitted to an inpatient clinic both arm comprised a training schedule of 8 session over a 2 week period and were completed a an adjunct to the standard treatment programme result in intention to treat analysis participant receiving cbm app showed a greater reduction in dysfunctional appraisal on a scenario task from pre to posttraining primary outcome assessment compared to those receiving sham training d 1 30 95 ci 0 82 1 80 with between group difference also found on the posttraumatic cognition inventory ptci d 0 85 95 ci 0 39 1 32 and the ptsd checklist for dsm 5 pcl 5 d 0 68 95 ci 0 23 1 14 but not for long term cortisol concentration d 0 25 95 ci 0 28 to 0 78 reduction in dysfunctional appraisal assessed via the scenario task correlated with reduction on the ptci pcl 5 and hair cortisol concentration from pre to posttraining time point conclusion result support dysfunctional appraisal a a modifiable cognitive mechanism and that their proximal modification transfer to downstream ptsd symptom these finding could open new avenue for improving present therapeutic approach

the present study introduces a short screening instrument for the measurement of experienced general daily stressor across different life domain that can be used in large scale study the brief daily stressor screening tool bdsst ass the experience of general daily stressor in eight distinct life domain general daily stressor are indicated for the past 12 month on a five point likert scale the present study evaluates the bdsst in two successive study the first study wa conducted in a representative german sample n 7 849 the second study wa conducted to ass one month retest stability in another representative german sample n 1 294 the bdsst show promising psychometric property it ha a skewed positive distribution internal consistency and stability are acceptable and it one factor structure wa confirmed in a bifactor confirmatory factor analysis the bdsst is a reliable and valid short instrument for the assessment of experienced general daily stressor in large scale study and routine clinical practise for in depth clinical assessment it can be used to identify relevant life domain for further investigation

objective to analyse if the association between depressive symptom and hyperglycaemia is mediated by diabetes self management method 430 people with diabetes 57 7 type 1 42 3 type 2 were cross sectionally assessed using validated self report scale for depressive symptom center for epidemiologic study depression scale ce d and diabetes self management diabetes self management questionnaire dsmq hba 1c wa analysed simultaneously in a central laboratory structural equation modelling wa used to test if the association between depressive symptom and hyperglycaemia hba 1c wa mediated by suboptimal self management in people with type 1 and type 2 diabetes result the hypothesised model of depressive symptom diabetes self management and hyperglycaemia fit the data well for both diabetes type srmr 0 04 tli 0 99 cfi 0 99 rmsea 0 02 for both model in both the type 1 and type 2 diabetes group higher depressive symptom were associated with lower self management p 0 001 and lower self management wa associated with higher hba 1c p 0 001 result indicated that the association between depressive symptom and hyperglycaemia wa significantly mediated by suboptimal diabetes self management in both type 1 and type 2 diabetes patient p 0 001 significant direct association between depressive symptom and hyperglycaemia not mediated by self management could not be observed conclusion this study provides good evidence supporting that depression is linked to hyperglycaemia via suboptimal diabetes self management in both major diabetes type

after traumatic experience intrusive memory can flash back and evoke significant distress here we investigated whether the frequency and severity of intrusion can be reduced by the provision of placebo after the online exposure to the trauma film paradigm healthy participant n 112 received deceptive placebo dp open label placebo olp or no treatment in the dp group participant were led to believe to receive a dopamine modulating drug which wa supposed to disrupt the consolidation of traumatic memory although they in fact received the same placebo tablet a the olp group for one week the result show that the group did not differ in the frequency of intrusive memory after one week however participant receiving olp reported a significantly reduced intensity of intrusion a compared to dp across group negative expectation about the intensity and controllability of intrusion were associated with a higher frequency of intrusion higher distress higher burden and more negative appraisal the result suggest that expectation play an important role in the emergence of intrusive memory and that some of the disabling aspect of intrusive memory can be reduced by placebo this may carry clinical potential because placebo are an accessible cost effective intervention to reduce the risk of intrusive memory

objective to calibrate an item bank of anxiety related question for use in orthopedic patient within a computer adaptive test design this is a psychometric study setting the sample of orthopedic patient wa recruited in two orthopedic rehabilitation clinic in germany subject a total of 474 orthopedic rehabilitation patient were recruited for this study intervention not applicable main measure the main measure is an adapted version of an existing anxiety item pool for cardiovascular rehabilitation patient result the result of the confirmatory factor analysis and mokken analysis confirmed a one factor structure and double monotonicity an anxiety item bank 48 item could be developed and calibrated using rasch analysis it fitted to the rasch model with a non significant item trait interaction chi 2 203 172 59 p 94 and wa free of differential item functioning unidimensionality could be verified and the person separation reliability wa 96 the category threshold parameter varied between 4 72 and 3 16 7 88 logits conclusion the unidimensional anxiety item bank provides the basis for a computer adaptive test to ass a wide range of anxiety in rehabilitation patient with orthopedic disease with very good psychometric characteristic

nightmare are considerably prevalent in the general population and are known to be closely associated with a variety of mental disorder however not much is known about the immediate antecedent and consequence of nightmare therefore we used intensive longitudinal assessment to investigate the night to night within person association between nightmare on the one hand and fear of sleep somatic a well a cognitive pre sleep arousal and sleep quality on the other hand young woman with regular nightmare n 16 maintained a sleep diary for around 30 day upon awaking the participant reported on nightmare and sleep quality during the past night a well a the pre sleep level of arousal and fear of sleep which resulted in 461 observation participant also wore an actigraph which provided objective sleep parameter multilevel modeling showed that higher level of fear of sleep and lower subjective sleep quality were significantly associated with higher level of nightmare distress furthermore we found individual difference in the strength of these association which implies that factor proximate to nightmare may vary across individual pre sleep arousal however did not show expected within person association with nightmare or fear of sleep these finding highlight the crucial role of fear of sleep in the etiology of nightmare and sleep disturbance while pointing to the importance of pursuing individual personalised model that explain heterogeneity in the process of triggering nightmare

distraction of goal oriented performance by a sudden change in the auditory environment is an everyday life experience different type of change can be distracting including a sudden onset of a transient sound and a slight deviation of otherwise regular auditory background stimulation with regard to deviance detection it is assumed that slight change in a continuous sequence of auditory stimulus are detected by a predictive coding mechanism and it ha been demonstrated that this mechanism is capable of distracting ongoing task performance in contrast it is open whether transient detection which doe not rely on predictive coding mechanism can trigger behavioral distraction too in the present study the effect of rare auditory change on visual task performance is tested in an auditory visual cross modal distraction paradigm the rare change are either embedded within a continuous standard stimulation triggering deviance detection or are presented within an otherwise silent situation triggering transient detection in the event related brain potential deviant elicited the mismatch negativity mmn while transient elicited an enhanced n1 component mirroring pre attentive change detection in both condition but on the basis of different neuro cognitive process these sensory component are followed by attention related erp component including the p3a and the reorienting negativity ron this demonstrates that both type of change trigger switch of attention finally distraction of task performance is observable too but the impact of deviant is higher compared to transient these finding suggest different route of distraction allowing for the automatic processing of a wide range of potentially relevant change in the environment a a pre requisite for adaptive behavior

dysfunctional decision making in individual with pathological gambling pgs may result from dominating reward driven process indicated by higher impulsivity in the current study we examined 1 if pgs show specific decision making impairment related to dominating reward driven process rather than to strategic planning deficit and 2 whether these impairment are related to impulsivity nineteen pgs according to dsm iv and 19 matched control subject undertook the cambridge gambling task cgt to ass decision making the delay discounting paradigm ddp a well a the upps impulsive behavior scale measuring urgency premeditation perseverance and sensation seeking were administered a multidimensional measure of impulsivity result revealed that 1 pgs exhibited higher risk seeking and an immediate reward focus in the cgt and in contrast comparable strategic planning to the control group 2 decision making impairment were related to more severe delay discounting and specifically to increased urgency and le premeditation our finding suggest 1 the necessity to disentangle decision making component in order to improve etiological model of pgs and 2 that urgency and premeditation are specifically related to disadvantageous decision making and should be tackled in intervention strategy focusing on emotion tolerance and control strategy

background mental health problem are highly prevalent among college student most student with poor mental health however do not receive professional help internet based self help format may increase the utilization of treatment objective the aim of this randomized controlled trial wa to evaluate the efficacy of an internet based app supported stress management intervention for college student method college student n 150 with elevated level of stress perceived stress scale 4 item version ps 4 8 were randomly assigned to either an internet and mobile based stress intervention group with feedback on demand or a waitlist control group self report data were assessed at baseline posttreatment 7 week and 3 month follow up the primary outcome wa perceived stress posttreatment ps 4 secondary outcome included mental health outcome modifiable risk and protective factor and college related outcome subgroup analysis were conducted in student with clinically relevant symptom of depression center for epidemiological study depression scale 17 result a total of 106 participant 76 8 indicated that they were first time help seeker and 77 3 intervention group 58 75 waitlist control group 58 75 showed clinically relevant depressive symptom at baseline finding indicated significant effect of the intervention compared with the waitlist control group for stress d 0 69 95 ci 0 36 1 02 anxiety d 0 76 95 ci 0 43 1 09 depression d 0 63 95 ci 0 30 0 96 college related productivity d 0 33 95 ci 0 01 0 65 academic work impairment d 0 34 95 ci 0 01 0 66 and other outcome after 7 week posttreatment response rate for stress symptom were significantly higher for the intervention group 69 52 75 compared with the waitlist control group 35 26 75 p 001 number needed to treat 2 89 95 ci 2 01 5 08 at posttest 7 week effect were sustained at 3 month follow up and similar finding emerged in student with symptom of depression conclusion internet and mobile based intervention could be an effective and cost effective approach to reduce consequence of college related stress and might potentially attract student with clinically relevant depression who would not otherwise seek help trial registration german clinical trial register drks00010212 http www drks de drks_web navigate do navigationid trial html trial_id drks00010212 archived by webcite at http www webcitation org 6w55ewhjd

objective attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd is closely linked to the dysregulation of dopaminergic and noradrenergic neurotransmission in the fronto striatal neural network including the anterior cingulate cortex acc and the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc additionally increasing evidence support the involvement of the glutamatergic system in the pathophysiology of adhd impulsivity a core symptom in patient with adhd ha been repeatedly associated with glutamatergic neurotransmission and pharmacological treatment of adhd ha been shown to reduce glutamate level in the prefrontal cortex method we investigated glutamate level in the acc and the dlpfc in 30 adult with adhd and 30 healthy control using single voxel proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy on a 3t scanner result the adhd group showed a significant increase in glutamate in the acc compared to control no significant difference in metabolite were observed in the dlpfc overall glutamate level in the acc were positively correlated with adhd symptomatology especially hyperactivity and impulsivity symptom conclusion increased level of glutamate in the acc which were positively correlated with hyperactivity and impulsivity support the hypothesis that dysfunctional glutamatergic neurotransmission is at least partially responsible for adhd symptomatology modulation of glutamatergic neurotransmission might therefore be a promising avenue for future pharmacological intervention

a growing body of evidence show that the prolonged execution of approach movement towards stimulus and avoidance movement away from them affect their evaluation however there ha been no systematic investigation of such training effect therefore the present study compared approach avoidance training effect on various valenced representation of one neutral experiment 1 n 85 angry experiment 2 n 87 or smiling facial expression experiment 3 n 89 the face stimulus were shown on a computer screen and by mean of a joystick participant pulled half of the face closer positive approach movement and pushed the other half away negative avoidance movement only implicit evaluation of neutral expression were affected by the training procedure the boundary condition of such approach avoidance training effect are discussed

objective the two study aimed to examine implicit affective evaluation of thin ideal and normal weight body shape in woman with anorexia nervosa an taking identification with body shape into account method in study 1 approach avoidance bias for thin ideal and normal weight body wa assessed in 40 woman with an and 40 healthy woman by using an approach avoidance task and female avatar body with a standard face a stimulus in study 2 39 woman with an and 38 healthy woman underwent a similar task but identification with body wa manipulated by presenting body once with the participant s own face and once with another woman s face result in study 1 patient with an did not differ from healthy participant in their automatic approach avoidance tendency towards thin ideal and normal weight body in study 2 no definite approach bias for a thin self and no avoidance bias for thin other woman or for a normal weight self were found however a compared to healthy woman those with an showed a le positive implicit evaluation of thin other woman and an implicit preference for thin body depicted a themselves over thin body depicted a another woman conclusion the finding suggest that intra sexual competition for being slim is increased in an

previous study associated psychopathy in adult with deficit in empathy but these study did not directly compare cognitive and emotional facet of empathy the present study sought to establish whether psychopathy is associated with impairment in emotional empathy among adult offender participant were 90 male offender scoring low n 29 medium n 33 or high n 28 on the psychopathy checklist revised pcl r and n 28 male noncriminal control empathy functioning wa assessed through self report and computerized decision task differentiating between perspective taking cognitive empathy and compassion emotional empathy against expectation level of psychopathy among the offender wa not associated with either emotional or cognitive empathy offender however had lower score for both cognitive and emotional component of empathy functioning than control both facet of empathy showed small but significant positive correlation with education level and social desirability the method employed to ass difference in empathy functioning may not be sensitive enough to ass difference in forensic sample

researcher team around the globe including the project lightspeed are intensively working on vaccine to fight the covid 19 pandemic however the availability of effective vaccine doe not guarantee the vaccination willingness among the population in spring 2021 we investigated the vaccination willingness and it potential predictor in representative online sample in nine country china france germany poland russia spain sweden u k u s of the 9 264 participant 79 9 revealed covid 19 vaccination willingness the highest willingness wa in the u k followed by spain and china the lowest in russia in most country the perception of governmental covid 19 measure a useful and the use of television report a covid 19 information source positively predicted the willingness further factor such a demographic variable mental and physical health status evaluation of governmental communication social medium use and general adherence to covid 19 measure showed a country specific predictive pattern recommendation how to increase the vaccination willingness are provided

the study investigates the influence of medium stereotype on the degree of presumed medium influence on others and the resulting effect for people s own attitude toward a minority we examine how the presumption of negative effect of medium stereotype on others can lead to a correction of one s own attitude toward muslim in an online experiment we test the relationship among medium stereotyping presumed medium effect and attitudinal and behavioral consequence the result show that one s own attitude toward muslim is corrected when people presume a negative influence of medium stereotype about muslim on other people

background there is an increasing body of research supporting the idea that cardiac interoceptive accuracy iac can be improved by training finding concerning the effect of a single yoga session on iac and the related construct emotional experience are sparse the aim of this study wa to examine if a single yoga session increase iac and improves emotional experience method 137 student were randomly assigned to a 20 min yoga session n 47 an endurance session n 46 or an inactive control condition n 44 iac and emotional experience were assessed before and after the session result there were no significant change in iac or positive and negative affect iac at baseline and the change in positive effect were found a predictor for iac after the yoga session conclusion a 20 min yoga session seems to be not applicable to improve iac and emotional experience future study should investigate long term intervention and diverse healthy and clinical population

objective partner of cancer patient are the primary supporter and burdened at the same time support for partner is hitherto scarce and existing offer are rarely used the partnercare online intervention wa specifically developed to address the caregiving partner need this two arm parallel randomized controlled trial rct evaluates the feasibility acceptability and potential efficacy of partnercare method sixty german speaking partner of patient with various cancer entity were randomized into two condition intervention group ig with partnercare n 30 or waitlist control group n 30 participant completed online questionnaire at baseline t0 post treatment t1 and 4 month follow up t2 feasibility and acceptability outcome included dropout rate use and acceptance of partnercare individual user e coach feedback a well a negative effect relevant efficacy outcome were assessed to test for potential intervention effect result recruitment success illustrates demand for and acceptability of partnercare satisfaction with the intervention wa high client satisfaction questionnaire adapted to internet based intervention t1 m 24 66 sd 6 42 and 73 3 of participant completed the intervention study dropout rate wa low t1 17 t2 29 more positive than negative side effect of the intervention were identified and negative one were mainly related to intrapersonal change for efficacy outcome we found effect over time with strongest effect within the ig from t0 to t1 in psychological distress d 0 73 95 ci 0 34 1 12 and anxiety 0 66 0 26 1 04 but no group effect were significant at t1 and t2 conclusion partnercare is feasible acceptable and potentially efficacious based on received feedback partnercare is currently undergoing further development and subsequently efficacy will be investigated in a rct trial registration german clinical trial registration drks00017019 registered on 08 april 2019

background interoception is a multi facetted phenomenon including interoceptive accuracy awareness and sensibility deficit in interoception have been associated with psychological distress however little is known about the course of interoception over time the present study aimed at examining interoception in an ecological momentary assessment ema setting method a seven day smartphone based ema wa conducted in a community sample of sixty one participant age m 24 1 sd 7 00 n 54 female 88 5 to control for potential practice effect of repeated assessment during the ema phase participant were randomly assigned to a control n 30 and an interoception n 31 group the latter wa assessed for interoceptive accuracy awareness and sensibility before and after the ema phase all participant were assessed for interoception in the laboratory result multilevel analysis revealed significant fluctuation for all three interoceptive facet around 50 of variance wa due to within person variability there were only practice effect for the subscale attention regulation measuring interoceptive sensibility conclusion the facet of interoception can be assessed in an ema setting repeated interoceptive assessment do not necessarily lead to an improvement of participant interoceptive ability it could be shown that all interoceptive facet fluctuate which should be considered in future research
