visual saliency map reflecting location that stand out from the background in term of their low level physical feature have proven to be very useful for empirical research on attentional exploration and reliably predict gaze behavior in the present study we tested these prediction for socially relevant stimulus occurring in naturalistic scene using eye tracking we hypothesized that social feature i e human face or body would be processed preferentially over non social feature i e object animal regardless of their low level saliency to challenge this notion we included three task that deliberately addressed non social attribute in agreement with our hypothesis social information especially head wa preferentially attended compared to highly salient image region across all task social information wa never required to solve a task but wa regarded nevertheless more so after completing the task requirement viewing behavior reverted back to that of free viewing with heavy prioritization of social feature additionally initial eye movement reflecting potentially automatic shift of attention were predominantly directed towards head irrespective of top down task demand on these ground we suggest that social stimulus may provide exclusive access to the priority map enabling social attention to override reflexive and controlled attentional process furthermore our result challenge the generalizability of saliency based attention model

background change during psychotherapy often include sudden symptom improvement called sudden gain sg which have been identified a being superior to gradual symptom change with regard to treatment success this study investigates the role of therapist in initiating and or consolidating sg method the analysis are based on a sample of patient n 1937 who were seen by 155 therapist and received individual psychotherapy at a university outpatient clinic first the therapist effect te on sg wa investigated using multilevel modeling mlm second mlm wa used to explore the relative importance of patient and therapist variability in sg a they relate to outcome result the te on sg accounted for 1 8 of variance meaning that therapist are accountable for inter individual difference in their patient likelihood to experience sg furthermore result revealed a significant effect of sg on outcome for both level while therapist difference regarding the consolidation of sg were not significant conclusion the analysis indicated that some therapist are better in facilitating and initiating sg the process of triggering sg seems to be a therapist skill or competence which open up an additional pathway to positive outcome that could be used to improve clinical training

hair cortisol concentration hcc are assumed to reflect integrated long term cortisol level and have been proposed a a promising endocrine marker of chronic psychological stress the current study examined hcc in relation to caregiving burden a well established naturalistic model of chronic stress in human hcc and relevant psychosocial data were examined in 20 caregiver of relative with dementia and 20 non caregiver control matched for age and sex result revealed elevated hcc in dementia caregiver compared to non caregiver control f 1 38 4 4 p 04 etap2 10 further within caregiver a trend for a positive association of hcc with self reported caregiving burden r 43 p 058 and a positive association with depressiveness r 48 p 045 were observed no other association between hcc and subjective measure were seen these finding concur with the notion that hcc sensitively capture endocrine aberration in stress exposed group

background the first wave of the covid 19 pandemic in early 2020 increased mental health problem globally however little is known about mental health problem during a low incidence period of the pandemic without strict public health measure objective we aim to investigate whether covid 19 related risk factor for mental health problem persist beyond lockdown measure we targeted a vulnerable population that is at risk of developing low mental health and assessed their daily dynamic of mood and emotion regulation after a strict lockdown method during a postlockdown period in germany between august 8 2020 and november 1 2020 we conducted an ecological momentary assessment with 131 participant who experienced at least mild covid 19 related distress and loneliness to estimate negative mood inertia we built a lag 1 three level autoregressive model result we found that information exposure and active daily covid 19 case did not have an impact on negative mood amid a postlockdown period however there wa a day to day carryover effect of negative mood in addition worrying about covid 19 feeling restricted by covid 19 and feeling lonely increased negative mood conclusion the mental health of a vulnerable population is still challenged by covid 19 related stressor after the lifting of a strict lockdown this study highlight the need to protect mental health during postpandemic period

background sleep problem are common among university student poor sleep is associated with impaired daily functioning increased risk of psychiatric symptom and somatic complaint such a pain previous result suggest that poor sleep exacerbates pain which in turn negatively affect sleep the purpose of the present study wa to determine prevalence rate comorbidity and role of depression a a factor of moderating the relationship between sleep and physical complaint in german university student sample and method in total 2443 german university student 65 woman completed a web survey self report measure included the pittsburg sleep quality index three module of the patient health questionnaire and a questionnaire on the functional somatic syndrome f result more than one third 36 9 reported poor sleep a assessed by the pittsburgh sleep quality index somatoform syndrome wa identified in 23 5 and the prevalence of any f wa 12 8 self reported sleep quality sleep onset latency sleep disturbance use of sleep medication and daytime dysfunctioning were significant predictor of somatoform syndrome whereas sleep efficiency and sleep duration influenced somatic complaint indirectly moderate correlation were found between stress anxiety somatoform syndrome depression and overall sleep quality the effect of somatic complaint on sleep quality wa associated with the severity of depression anxiety show direct effect on somatization and depression but only indirect association with sleep quality

objective there are many neonatal pain assessment tool available however systematic psychometric comparison between tool are lacking particularly those comparing tool regarding their ability to differentiate between pain and stressful procedure the aim of the present study wa to compare 5 widely used neonatal pain assessment tool neonatal facial coding system revised premature infant pain profile revised neonatal pain agitation and sedation scale neonatal infant pain scale and bernese pain scale neonate material and method two coder applied all pain assessment tool to video of 42 neonate who were videotaped during a pain and a stressful procedure result interrater reliability and relative convergent validity were high and internal consistency good to excellent for all 5 assessment tool all tool discriminated between painful and stressful event tool differed regarding their overall effect size a well a their item effect size behavioral item tended to have larger effect size than physiological one yet effect size of item from one behavioral category differed greatly which may be due to different operationalization of coding scheme discussion given that the tool investigated in the present study appear to be fairly comparable psychometrically aspect of their clinical utility are discussed and way of improvement identified

the present study explored the facebook addiction disorder fad in an inpatient sample in germany of the 112 facebook user 71 4 woman age year m sd 49 43 9 17 who were patient of a psychosomatic rehabilitation clinic with affective disorder and anxiety disorder a most common diagnosis 28 6 reached the critical polythetic cutoff score of fad 0 9 researched the critical monothetic cutoff score and 86 6 had enhanced value of withdrawal symptom due to facebook use the mean level of fad wa significantly higher in inpatient with week depression than in inpatient with moderate depression in the whole sample fad wa significantly positively linked to duration of facebook use and the personality trait narcissism present result provide first evidence of fad in a non student inpatient sample they contribute to the understanding of the development of fad and demonstrate that addictive facebook use may impact person who suffer from mental disorder especially when they have enhanced level of the personality trait narcissism practical application for research and clinical treatment a well a limitation of present result are discussed

background people are constantly preoccupied with how they are doing compared to different standard this preoccupation influence judgment of well being including depression however research on well being comparison is scarce also due to a lack of a measure of multi standard comparison method our research goal were twofold first we validated the comparison standard scale for well being cs w second by drawing on central proposition of the general comparative processing model we examined the association of habitual well being comparison their perceived discrepancy with the standard and engendered affect with depressive symptom and psychological well being in dysphoric participant n 500 the cs w ass habitual social temporal counterfactual and criterion based upward and downward comparison regarding their a frequency b perceived discrepancy and c engendered affect result the finding confirmed the theoretically expected two factor solution representing aversive mostly upward and appetitive mostly downward comparison comparison frequency discrepancy and engendered affect were associated with depression and well being yet aversive comparison displayed higher association with the outcome than appetitive comparison in particular frequency of appetitive comparison wa not significantly correlated to depression in line with our central theory driven hypothesis the relationship between frequency of aversive comparison with depression wa partially mediated by serial effect of comparison discrepancy and affect whereas the relationship with well being wa fully mediated by comparison discrepancy and affect limitation the cross sectional design of the study doe not allow for conclusion of causal relation between the measured variable conclusion the presented framework prof useful in examining significant comparison process in well being and depression

abstract teacher judgment of student characteristic are affected not only by the characteristic in question but also by other factor this article present three study examining whether student achievement influence teacher judgment of their engagement a a proxy for motivation and vice versa first a field study wa conducted with n 52 teacher and n 1135 student structural equation modeling revealed an effect of student achievement on teacher judgment of student engagement and an effect of student engagement on teacher judgment of student achievement above and beyond the association of each student characteristic with teacher judgment of that characteristic these result were then replicated in two experimental study involving a computer simulation of an instructional situation the simulated classroom with n 40 and n 181 teacher candidate respectively the psychological determinant of the effect observed are discussed a are their practical implication

mother can recognize their own child by body odor besides signaling familiarity child s body odor may provide other information relevant to maternal caregiving behavior such a the child s developmental status thus we explored whether mother are able to classify body odor on pre v postpubertal status above chance level in total 164 mother were presented with body odor sample of their own and four unfamiliar sex matched child who varied in age range 0 18 year pubertal status wa measured by a determining the child s steroid hormone level and b parental assessment of the child s developmental stage using the pubertal development scale mother classified developmental status with an accuracy of about 64 maternal assessment were biased toward pre puberty classification wa predicted by perceptual evaluation of the body odor i e intensity and pleasantness and by the child s developmental stage but not by hormone in specific mother with pubertal aged child classified body odor using the child s developmental status whereas mother with younger child only classified body odor using perceptual information i e intensity and pleasantness our data suggests that body odor convey developmental cue but how this developmental information is manifested in body odor remains unclear

background autism spectrum disorder asd is associated with altered face processing and decreased activity in brain region involved in face processing the neuropeptide oxytocin ha been shown to promote face processing and modulate brain activity in healthy adult the present study examined the effect of oxytocin on the neural basis of face processing in adult with asperger syndrome a method a group of 14 individual with a and a group of 14 neurotypical control participant performed a face matching and a house matching task during functional magnetic resonance imaging the effect of a single dose of 24 iu intranasally administered oxytocin were tested in a randomized placebo controlled within subject cross over design result under placebo the a group showed decreased activity in the right amygdala fusiform gyrus and inferior occipital gyrus compared with the control group during face processing after oxytocin treatment right amygdala activity to facial stimulus increased in the a group conclusion these finding indicate that oxytocin increase the saliency of social stimulus and in asd and suggest that oxytocin might promote face processing and eye contact in individual with asd a prerequisite for neurotypical social interaction

purpose occupational e mental health oemh may extend existing instrument for preservation or restoration of health and work ability a a key precondition to efficient implementation this study examined acceptance and person centered barrier to potential uptake of oemh for work related distress in employee with an elevated risk of early retirement method within the framework of the third german sociomedical panel of employee 1829 employee with prior sickness absence payment filled out a self administered questionnaire participant had a mean age of 49 93 year sd 4 06 6 2 indicated prior use of ehealth intervention potential predictor of acceptance of oemh were examined based on the unified theory of acceptance and use of technology utaut extended by work ability mental health ehealth literacy and demographic characteristic result 89 1 n 1579 showed low to moderate acceptance m 2 20 sd 1 05 range 1 5 a path analysis revealed significant positive direct effect of utaut predictor on acceptance performance expectancy 0 48 se 0 02 p 0 001 effort expectancy 0 20 se 0 02 p 0 001 social influence 0 28 se 0 02 p 0 001 online time and frequency of online health information search were further positive direct predictor of acceptance model fit wa good chi 2 7 12 91 p 0 07 rmsea 0 02 cfi 1 00 tli 0 99 srmr 0 01 conclusion attitude towards oemh are rather disadvantageous in the studied risk group implementation of oemh therefore requires a priori education including promotion of awareness favorable attitude regarding efficacy and usability in a collaborative approach

based on finding from cognitive science it ha been theorized that the reduction in motivation and goal directed behavior in people with psychosis could stem from impaired episodic memory in the current meta analysis we investigated this putative functional link between episodic memory deficit and negative symptom we hypothesized that episodic memory deficit in psychosis would be related to negative symptom in general but would be more strongly related to amotivation than to reduced expressivity we included 103 eligible study 13 622 participant in the analysis result revealed significant moderate negative association of episodic memory with negative symptom in general k 103 r 23 z 13 40 p 001 95 ci 26 20 with amotivation k 16 r 18 z 6 6 p 001 95 ci 23 13 and with reduced expressivity k 15 r 18 z 3 30 p 001 95 ci 29 07 these association were not moderated by sociodemographic characteristic positive symptom depression antipsychotic medication or type of negative symptom scale although these finding provide sound evidence for the association between episodic memory deficit and amotivation the rather small magnitude and the unspecific pattern of this relationship also indicate that episodic memory deficit are unlikely to be the only factor relevant to amotivation this implicates that future research should investigate episodic memory in conjunction with other factor that could account for the association of episodic memory deficit and amotivation in psychosis

background representative data about the frequency of child maltreatment is needed in order to estimate the extent of the problem in the wider population a well a to provide the basis for interpretation of frequency rate in clinical sample however previous representative study on the frequency of child maltreatment in germany and other country were limited a they focused on the assessment of physical and sexual abuse whilst emotional form of maltreatment were ignored in addition previous study applied scale that had not been validated against external criterion method in a cross sectional study standardized questionnaire were administered to a representative sample of the german population maltreatment in childhood and adolescence wa assessed using the german version of the childhood trauma questionnaire empirically derived threshold value for the five different type of child maltreatment including emotional maltreatment were applied to determine presence of abuse and neglect result complete data wa available from n 2 500 subject prevalence rate were 13 9 for emotional neglect 10 2 for emotional abuse 12 0 for physical abuse 48 4 for physical neglect and 6 2 for sexual abuse difference between sex were found for the frequency of sexual abuse conclusion although our analysis ha found lower rate of child maltreatment than previous report that used le well validated criterion the result of this study confirm that child abuse with it many different facet is a significant problem in germany

empirical evidence suggests abnormality in the processing of body stimulus in bulimia nervosa bn this study investigated central marker of processing body stimulus by mean of event related potential in bn eeg wa recorded from 20 woman with bn and 20 matched healthy control while watching and evaluating underweight normal and overweight female body picture bulimic evaluated underweight body a le unpleasant and overweight body a bigger and more arousing a higher p2 to overweight stimulus occurred in bn only in contrast to control no n2 increase to underweight body wa observed in bn p3 wa modulated by stimulus category only in healthy control late slow wave to underweight body were more pronounced in both group p2 amplitude to overweight stimulus were correlated with drive for thinness and body dissatisfaction we present novel support for altered perceptual and cognitive affective processing of body image in bn on the subjective and electrophysiological level

background job anxiety a distinguished from trait anxiety is associated with long term sickness absence the prevalence of job anxiety within a working population is not known identifying individual who would benefit from intervention might be useful aim to investigate job anxiety in employee not undergoing treatment for mental health illness firstly by assessing the level of job anxiety and work related avoidance tendency in a working sample and secondly by testing whether job anxiety is distinguishable from trait anxiety method cross sectional survey of a convenience sample obtained through personal contact distribution employee from different professional setting completed an anonymous questionnaire and provided information on their employment status the state trait anxiety inventory stai t wa used to measure trait anxiety and the job anxiety scale jas wa used to ass job state anxiety result there wa a 69 response rate 240 response 188 response were available for analysis of whom 62 were woman there were no employee with high trait anxiety ten employee 5 reported increased job anxiety and of these nine employee reported high tendency of avoidance and workplace absence avoidance wa most often accompanied by the comorbid job anxiety job related social anxiety fear of change at work and fear of existence anticipatory and conditioned job anxiety and panic symptom conclusion in this sample self reported job anxiety appeared a a specific type of anxiety a opposed to trait anxiety in the workplace job anxiety can present a job avoidance and sickness absence and should be distinguished from trait anxiety in practice employer and occupational health practitioner should be aware of those employee prone to sickness absence

anxiety is characterized by anxious anticipation and heightened vigilance to uncertain threat however if threat is not reliably indicated by a specific cue the context in which threat wa previously experienced becomes it best predictor leading to anxiety a suitable mean to induce anxiety experimentally is context conditioning in one context ctx an unpredictable aversive stimulus u is repeatedly presented in contrast to a second context ctx in which no u is ever presented in this eeg study we investigated attentional mechanism during acquisition and extinction learning in 38 participant who underwent a context conditioning protocol flickering video stimulus 32 s clip depicting virtual office representing ctx were used to evoke steady state visual evoked potential ssveps a an index of visuocortical engagement with the context analysis of the electrocortical response suggest a successful induction of the ssvep signal by video presentation in flicker mode furthermore we found clear index of context conditioning and extinction learning on a subjective level while cortical processing of the ctx wa unexpectedly reduced during video presentation the difference between ctx and ctx diminished during extinction learning together these result indicate that the dynamic sensory input of the video presentation lead to disruption in the ssvep signal which is greater for motivationally significant threatening context

purpose orthorexic eating behaviour restrained eating and veganism vegetarianism are food selection strategy sharing several characteristic since there are no study investigating their interrelationship aim of the present study wa to analyse orthorexic and restrained eating behaviour in 1 a sample of vegan and vegetarian and 2 a sample of individual on a diet to lose weight method division of sample according to pre defined criterion in 1 vegan n 114 vegetarian n 63 individual with rare meat consumption n 83 and individual with frequent meat consumption n 91 and in 2 participant on a diet with dietary change n 104 without dietary change n 37 and a control group of individual not on a diet n 258 orthorexic eating behaviour wa assessed with the dusseldorfer orthorexie skala and restrained eating wa assessed with the restraint eating scale result vegan and vegetarian do not differ in orthorexic eating behaviour but both group score higher in orthorexic eating behaviour than individual consuming red meat there are no difference regarding restrained eating individual on a diet with dietary change score higher in both orthorexic and restrained eating than individual without dietary change and individual not on a diet conclusion individual who restrict their eating behaviour either predominantly due to ethical reason or with the intention to lose weight display more orthorexic eating behaviour than individual not limiting their food consumption further research is needed to investigate whether veganism vegetarianism or frequent dieting behaviour serve a risk factor for orthorexia level of evidence level v cross sectional descriptive study

between group comparison are permissible and meaningfully interpretable only if diagnostic instrument are proved to measure the same latent dimension across different group addressing this issue the present study wa carried out to provide a rigorous test of measurement invariance confirmatory factor analysis were used to determine which model solution could best explain memory performance a measured by the wechsler memory scale fourth edition wms iv in a clinical depression sample and in healthy control multigroup confirmatory factor analysis wa conducted to evaluate the evidence for measurement invariance a three factor model solution including the dimension of auditory memory visual memory and visual working memory wa identified to best fit the data in both sample and measurement invariance wa partially satisfied the result supported clinical utility of the wms iv that is auditory and visual memory performance of patient with depressive disorder are interpretable on the basis of the wms iv standardization data however possible difference in visual working memory function between healthy and depressed individual could restrict comparison of the wms iv working memory index

background stress and stress hormone modulate memory formation in various way that are relevant to our understanding of stress related psychopathology such a posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd particular relevance is attributed to efficient memory formation sustained by the hippocampus and parahippocampus this process is thought to reduce the occurrence of intrusion and flashback following trauma but may be negatively affected by acute stress moreover recent evidence suggests that the efficiency of visuo spatial processing and learning based on the hippocampal area is related to ptsd symptom objective the current study investigated the effect of acute stress on spatial configuration learning using a spatial contextual cueing task scct known to heavily rely on structure in the parahippocampus method acute stress wa induced by subjecting participant n 34 to the maastricht acute stress test mast following a counterbalanced within subject approach the effect of stress and the ensuing hormonal i e cortisol activity on subsequent scct performance were compared to scct performance following a no stress control condition result acute stress did not impact scct learning overall but opposing effect emerged for high versus low cortisol responder to the mast learning score following stress were reduced in low cortisol responder while high cortisol responding participant showed improved learning conclusion the effect of stress on spatial configuration learning were moderated by the magnitude of endogenous cortisol secretion these finding suggest a possible mechanism by which cortisol response serve an adaptive function during stress and trauma and this may prove to be a promising route for future research in this area

negative priming np is assumed to indicate the effect of an inhibitory mechanism in selective attention previous study showed inconsistent reduction of the np effect in patient with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd and schizophrenia the aim of the present study wa to relate np alteration in two different np task with specific symptom pattern of ocd and schizophrenia patient twenty eight patient with a diagnosis of ocd 27 patient with schizophrenia and 27 healthy comparison participant performed a spatial and an identity priming task robust np effect were found in the spatial priming task across group and symptom pattern however ocd patient with a predominance of obsessive thought a well a schizophrenia patient with predominantly positive symptom showed no identity np effect whereas ocd patient who primarily presented with compulsive ritual and schizophrenia patient with predominant negative symptom tended to have increased identity np compared to healthy participant it is concluded that obsession a well a positive psychotic symptom are related to identity np deficit possibly reflecting a shared basic cognitive mechanism leading to deficient thought control

a milestone of child development is theory of mind tom the ability to attribute mental state especially belief and desire to other person and to understand that their behavior is guided by mental state the learning process about the mental world also take place in social communication and interaction beginning in infancy infancy is assumed to be a sensitive period for the development of social skill through interaction due to limited self regulatory skill infant depend on sensitive behavior of their caregiver to regulate affective state and physiological arousal and in turn mutually regulated affect allow the infant to gradually acquire the capability to self regulate negative affective state effective and adequate affect regulation is an important prerequisite for environmental interaction and thus for the development of socio emotional skill the present study investigated the relation of self regulatory ability in infancy and later tom in pre school aged child of clinically depressed mother and healthy control the sample comprised of n 55 mother child dyad n 22 diagnosed with postpartum or lifetime depression according to dsm iv and n 33 healthy control mother infant interaction wa videotaped during the face to face still face paradigm at 3 and 42 month postpartum mother were interviewed with the structured clinical interview for dsm iv axis i disorder scid i to evaluate maternal psychopathological status according to dsm iv at the age of m 4 0 year child s tom ability were assessed using content false belief and location false belief task the result of this study show that contrary to our hypothesis maternal depression did not impair the development of child s tom ability per se rather an interaction effect highlight the role of infant s self comforting behavior during mother infant interaction in infancy 3 month postpartum for tom development at pre school age assessed with the maxi task this association wa distinct for female in comparison to male child the result of this longitudinal study shed light on the discussion how maternal depression influence child development and point in the direction that self comforting behavior in infancy can also be seen a a resource

objective although exposure in vivo is considered to be the most effective therapy component in the treatment of agoraphobia ag there is a remarkable lack of it application in psychotherapeutic routine care we examined the severity of anxiety psychological distress comorbidity therapeutic process alliance and sociodemographic status a potential predictor of in vivo exposure method we applied correlational analysis and logistic regression analysis in a sample of n 92 patient main diagnosis ag in an outpatient setting result logistic regression analysis did not yield any significant single predictor whereas a combination of a subset of predictor significantly predicted the application of exposure in vivo in the completer sample r 2 24 p 041 conclusion the application of in vivo exposure may be predicted by a complex pattern of patient characteristic

background despite the prevalence of obsessive compulsive disorder ocd it precise identification remains challenging with the zohar fineberg obsessive compulsive screen zf ocs 5 or 6 item a brief instrument is widely available mainly in english a there is a lack of empirical study on the zf ocs the aim of the present study wa to translate the item into german and investigate the instrument in a nonclinical sample method in two consecutive online survey n 304 and n 51 student participated besides the zf ocs they answered established measure on ocd depression health anxiety general anxiety and health related well being result whereas internal consistency wa low alpha 53 72 omega 55 69 retest reliability r t1 t2 89 at two week wa high a expected we found high correlation with other ocd instrument r 61 convergent validity and significantly weaker correlation with measure of depression r 39 health anxiety r 29 and health related well being r 28 divergent validity nonetheless the correlation with general anxiety were somewhere in between r 52 conclusion due to heterogeneous ocd subtypes the zf ocs asks diverse question which probably resulted in the present internal consistency nevertheless the result on retest reliability and validity were promising a for other ocd instrument divergent validity regarding general anxiety seems problematic to establish even so the zf ocs seems valuable for screening purpose a it is short and easy to administer and may facilitate initiating subsequent clinical assessment further study should determine the instrument s diagnostic accuracy

background and objective social skill training sst intervention ha shown it efficacy to improve social dysfunction in patient with psychosis however the implementation of new skill into patient everyday functioning is difficult to achieve in this study we report result from the application of a virtual reality vr integrated program a an adjunct technique to a brief social skill intervention for patient with schizophrenia it wa predicted that the intervention would improve social cognition and performance of patient a well a generalisation of the learned response into patient s daily life method twelve patient with schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder completed the study they attended sixteen individual one hour session and outcome assessment were conducted at pre treatment post treatment and four month follow up result the result of a series of repeated measure anova revealed significant improvement in negative symptom psychopathology social anxiety and discomfort avoidance and social functioning objective score obtained through the use of the vr program showed a pattern of learning in emotion perception assertive behaviour and time spent in a conversation most of these gain were maintained at four month follow up limitation the reported result are based on a small uncontrolled pilot study although there wa an independent rater for the self reported and informant questionnaire assessment were not blinded conclusion the result showed that the intervention may be effective for improving social dysfunction the use of the vr program contributed to the generalisation of new skill into the patient s everyday functioning

sexual concordance is defined a the association between genital response and self reported sexual arousal though one might predict a strong association between sexual concordance and awareness of other internal physiological sensation termed interoception past research on sexually healthy woman ha not found these different domain to be related the aim of the present study wa to test the association between interoception and sexual concordance in a clinical sample of woman with sexual interest arousal disorder siad fifty two woman with siad completed the multidimensional assessment of interoceptive awareness maia a validated self report measure of interoception and completed a heart beat accuracy test an objective measure of interoception they also participated in a laboratory based assessment of physiological sexual arousal and self reported sexual arousal while viewing an erotic film mental and physiological arousal were correlated at r 0 27 range 0 80 to 0 95 there wa no significant association between sexual concordance and woman s heartrate awareness however five aspect of interoceptive awareness noticing emotional awareness self regulation body listening and trusting were predictive of lower and one aspect not distracting wa predictive of higher sexual concordance we discus the finding in relation to the role of emotion and arousal state in the interoception sexual concordance relationship

the present study wa concerned with cognitive interference and a specific memory bias for eating related stimulus in binge eating disorder bed further objective were to find out under which circumstance such effect would occur and whether they are related with each other and with reported severity of bed symptom a group of woman diagnosed with bed and a matched sample of overweight control completed two paradigm an n back task with lure and a recent probe task the bed group generally experienced more interference in the n back task additionally they revealed selectively increased interference for food item in the recent probe task finding can be reconciled with the view that control function are generally impaired in bed and that there is an additional bias for eating related stimulus both of which were related with reported severity of bed symptom

the interpersonal theory of suicide joiner t e 2005 why people die by suicide harvard university press cambridge postulate that for a serious or lethal suicide attempt one ha to posse a desire to die and the capability to commit suicide the capability is proposed to be acquired over time by repeated experience with painful and provocative event such a self injurious behavior and other experience such a childhood abuse combat exposure physical fight promiscuous sex and playing contact sport up to now experience with painful and provocative event are measured with various version of the painful and provocative event scale ppes however a thorough validation of this assessment instrument is still lacking our study aimed at validating the german version of ppes with two clinical n 424 and one community sample n 532 result support a two factor structure eight item active painful and provocative event four item passive painful and provocative event that wa invariant across the three subsamples nonetheless low factor loading low indicator reliability moderate construct reliability and mixed evidence for construct validity indicate that the ppes in it current form appears to be of limited use the development of a new instrument to ass painful and provocative event seems appropriate

background based on finding indicating increased stress reactivity and prolonged stress recovery in individual with bipolar disorder bd it ha been proposed that emotion regulation er deficit lie at the core of this disorder recent study show an increased use of maladaptive er strategy and a decreased use of adaptive er strategy in bd whether this pattern is merely a correlate of affective episode or might be a stable characteristic of bd however remains to be explored in addition it is unclear whether these deficit in er are specific to people with a history of bd method we examined whether euthymic bd individual differ from healthy control hc and individual with a history of major depressive disorder mdd with respect to the cognitive er strategy they habitually use cerq in response to negative affect the sample consisted of 42 bipolar patient 43 patient with mdd and 39 hc result compared to hc euthymic bd and mdd individual reported increased use of rumination catastrophizing and self blame alongside decreased use of positive reappraisal and putting into perspective no difference were found between bd and mdd group limitation these finding are based on self report reflecting the habitual use of er strategy the use of more objective method and the examination of the spontaneous use of er strategy in euthymic bd would be desirable conclusion deficit in the habitual use of er strategy may characterize bd and mdd individual even outside of an acute episode and thereby play a role in the recurrence of affective disorder

objective peer victimization e g social exclusion ha been shown to be associated with physical health problem such a functional somatic complaint and especially symptom of pain to date no study ha investigated the mechanism underlying this association in clinical pediatric sample the aim of this study wa to evaluate the parasympathetic activity during a social exclusion experience in adolescent with functional abdominal pain fap method twenty adolecents with fap and 21 matched healthy participant were compared regarding parameter of parasympathetic activation before during and after participating in the cyberball game a well established paradigm to induce social exclusion result adolescent with fap showed an increase in parasympathetic activation during both consecutive phase of the cyberball game inclusion a well a exclusion condition whereas the healthy control group remained stable there were no difference in subjective experience of in and exclusion between the group conclusion the parasympathetic activation pattern may indicate altered processing of social stimulus in adolescent with fap

in the current study the influence of age gender and iq on cognitive and emotional empathy in school aged child and adolescent wa examined adopting two behavioural paradigm participant were shown film clip with different scene of social interaction to which they were asked to respond thus 134 child aged seven to 17 year mean age 138 4 month sd 31 66 month were tested for emotion recognition perspective taking and emotional empathy age strongly influenced component of cognitive empathy and explained 33 5 to 39 1 of the variance gender and iq also were significant predictor yet only explained 3 to 5 respectively 8 to 9 of the variance in contrast neither age gender nor iq were related to emotional empathy result suggest developmental maturation of cognitive but not emotional empathy throughout childhood and adolescence to explain variability in emotional empathy additional biological and psychosocial factor need to be studied

emotional stability a indicated by low affect variability and low affective reactivity to daily event for example tends to increase across the adult life span this study investigated a contextual explanation for such age difference relating affect variability and affective reactivity to age group specific life context a sample of 101 younger and 103 older adult reported daily stressor and negative affect across 100 day compared with younger adult older adult a experienced fewer stressor overall b had le heterogeneous stressor profile and c reported that stressor had le impact on daily routine a expected these contextual factor were relevant for interindividual difference in emotional stability multiple regression analysis revealed that reduced affect variability and affective reactivity in older adult were associated with these age group specific life context moreover matching younger and older adult on the contextual factor to explore the effect of context on age group difference further provided support for the partially contextual explanation of age difference in emotional stability matched subgroup of younger and older adult that were comparable on contextual variable were identified affective variability but not affective reactivity wa more similar in the matched subsamples than in the total sample of younger and older adult we conclude that context in which affective experience emerge require more attention when aiming to explain interindividual and age group difference in emotional stability moreover future study need to disentangle the extent to which context interact with active self regulatory process to shape affective experience across adulthood

speech information inherent in face movement is important for understanding what is said in face to face communication individual with autism spectrum disorder asd have difficulty in extracting speech information from face movement a process called visual speech recognition currently it is unknown what dysfunctional brain region or network underlie the visual speech recognition deficit in asd we conducted a functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri study with concurrent eye tracking to investigate visual speech recognition in adult diagnosed with high functioning autism and pairwise matched typically developed control compared to the control group n 17 the asd group n 17 showed decreased blood oxygenation level dependent bold response during visual speech recognition in the right visual area 5 v5 mt and left temporal visual speech area tvsa brain region implicated in visual movement perception the right v5 mt showed positive correlation with visual speech task performance in the asd group but not in the control group psychophysiological interaction analysis ppi revealed that functional connectivity between the left tvsa and the bilateral v5 mt and between the right v5 mt and the left ifg wa lower in the asd than in the control group in contrast response in other speech motor region and their connectivity were on the neurotypical level reduced response and network connectivity of the visual movement region in conjunction with intact speech related mechanism indicate that perceptual mechanism might be at the core of the visual speech recognition deficit in asd communication deficit in asd might at least partly stem from atypical sensory processing and not higher order cognitive processing of socially relevant information

background frequent abdominal pain ap in childhood ha been shown to be associated with elevated experience of stress and with deficit in stress coping but psychophysiological stress reactivity ha been studied rarely method we examined whether child with frequent ap show altered reaction of the parasympathetic nervous system and the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal hpa axis during and following an afternoon laboratory social stress task in comparison to healthy child and child with anxiety disorder twenty four child with frequent ap 18 with functional ap and six with irritable bowel syndrome m 9 9 year and 24 healthy control underwent stressful free speech and arithmetic task twelve child with anxiety disorder served a second comparison sample group were compared regarding parasympathetic reaction and saliva cortisol concentration result we found no difference in parasympathetic withdrawal between the group concerning the hpa axis we detected an attenuated cortisol reactivity in child with ap compared to both other group conclusion this study provides preliminary evidence that childhood ap is not associated with altered parasympathetic withdrawal during stress it seems to be related to a down regulated reactivity of the hpa axis this pattern wa ascertained in comparison to healthy child and also in comparison to child with anxiety disorder significance childhood abdominal pain could be related to down regulated hpa axis reactivity to stress but not to altered parasympathetic reaction child with abdominal pain and child with anxiety disorder exhibit a divergent stress related hpa axis reaction

study on structural abnormality in antisocial individual have reported inconsistent result possibly due to inhomogeneous sample calling for an investigation of brain alteration in psychopathologically stratified subgroup we explored structural difference between antisocial offender with either borderline personality disorder aspd bpd or high psychopathic trait aspd pp and healthy control con using region of interest based and voxel based morphometry approach besides common distinct cluster of reduced gray matter volume within the frontal pole and occipital cortex there wa remarkably little overlap in the regional distribution of brain abnormality in aspd bpd and aspd pp when compared to con specific alteration of aspd bpd were detected in orbitofrontal and ventromedial prefrontal cortex region subserving emotion regulation and reactive aggression and the temporal pole which is involved in the interpretation of other people motif volumetric reduction in aspd pp were most significant in midline cortical area involved in the processing of self referential information and self reflection i e dorsomedial prefrontal cortex posterior cingulate precuneus and recognizing emotion of others postcentral gyrus and could reflect neural correlate of the psychopathic core feature of callousness and poor moral judgment the finding of this first exploratory study therefore may reflect correlate of prominent psychopathological difference between the two criminal offender group which have to be replicated in larger sample

the aim of this study wa to investigate not only preoperative expectation a shown previously but also postoperative expectation of patient predict clinical outcome six month after cardiac surgery furthermore the study sought to examine illness behavior a a possible pathway through which expectation may affect postoperative well being seventy patient scheduled for cardiac surgery were examined one day before surgery 7 10 day after surgery and six month after surgery regression analysis indicated that disability at follow up primary outcome wa significantly predicted by postoperative beta 342 p 008 but not by preoperative expectation beta 213 p 069 similar result were found for the secondary outcome i e quality of life and depressive symptom a bootstrapped mediation analysis showed that although both postoperative expectation and illness behavior had significant unique effect on disability there wa no significant mediation effect while previous study have mainly focused on patient preoperative expectation the present is the first to emphasize the predictive value of patient expectation a few day after surgery pointing to the potential of intervention targeting postoperative expectation however given the non significant result of the mediation analysis it remains unclear how exactly patient expectation affect clinical outcome in cardiac surgery

cognitive theory of anxiety suggest that anxious child interpret negatively only those material specifically related to the content of their anxiety so far there are only a few study available that report on this postulated content specificity of interpretation process across different anxiety disorder in child and most of them focused on social anxiety therefore we examined interpretation bias and it content specificity in a group of clinically anxious child between the age of 6 12 year with various anxiety disorder using an ambiguous scenario task child were asked to finish scenario that were related to either social threat general threat or separation threat in total 105 clinically anxious child 21 control child and their mother were assessed with the adis c p and the spence child s anxiety scale a expected clinically anxious child provided significantly more negative ending to the scenario than control child within the clinically anxious group specific interpretation bias were found interpretation of scenario related to social threat general threat and separation threat were only predicted by the child s self reported level of social anxiety generalized anxiety and separation anxiety respectively these finding support the content specificity hypothesis that clinically anxious child display interpretation bias that are specific to fear relevant stimulus

our ability to infer other individual emotion is central for successful social interaction based on the theory of embodied simulation our mirror neuron system mn provides the essential link between the observed facial configuration of another individual and our inference of the emotion by mean of common neuronal activation however so far it is unknown whether the mn differentiates the valence of facial configuration to increase the precision of our fmri measurement we used an adaptation design which allows insight into whether the same neuronal population is active for subsequent stimulus of facial configuration 76 participant were shown congruent or incongruent consecutive pair of facial configuration expressing fear or happiness significant activation for change in emotional valence from adaptor to target wa revealed in fusiform gyrus superior temporal sulcus amygdala insula inferior parietal lobe and brodmann area 44 in addition activation change wa higher in superior temporal sulcus insula and inferior frontal gyrus for a switch from happiness to fear than for fear to happiness our result suggest an involvement of the mn in valence discrimination and a higher sensitivity of the mn to negative than positive valence these finding point to a role of the mn that go beyond the mere coding of a motor state

cognitive behavioral model of body dysmorphic disorder bdd suggest the disorder is characterized by several interpretive attentional and perceptual bias that contribute to it maintenance or even development in addition the role of aesthetic sensitivity ha been discussed in bdd however previous research examining the ability to identify subtle change in facial feature and geometrical object ha produced mixed result the purpose of the current study wa to further evaluate facial and object discrimination among individual with bdd n 35 individual with a dermatological condition n 35 and mentally healthy control participant n 35 using a facial and object discrimination paradigm assessing the sensitivity for change in symmetry color and size overall the group did not differ with respect to their performance in detecting actual change in facial or object image however there wa a significant group difference when they were presented with a series of unchanged facial but not object image the bdd group rated identical facial image significantly more often a being changed relative to individual without bdd the current result are discussed in light of the existing literature on facial and object discrimination in bdd

background major depressive disorder mdd is highly prevalent and often managed by general practitioner gps gps mostly prescribe medication and show low referral rate to psychotherapy many patient remain untreated blended psychotherapy bpt combine internet based intervention with face to face psychotherapy and could increase treatment access and availability effectively implementing bpt in routine care requires an understanding of professional user perspective and behavior objective this study aim to identify barrier and facilitator perceived by gps in referring patient to bpt explanation for variation in referral rate were examined method semistructured interview were conducted with 12 of 110 gps participating in a german randomized controlled trial rct to investigate barrier to and facilitator for referral to bpt for mdd 10 web based module app based assessment and 6 face to face session the interview guide wa based on the theoretical domain framework the interview were audio recorded and transcribed verbatim and the qualitative content wa analyzed by 2 independent coder intercoder agreement k 0 71 a follow up survey with 12 interviewed gps enabled the validation of emergent theme the difference in the barrier and facilitator identified between group with different characteristic eg gps with high or low referral rate were described correlation between referral and characteristic self rated competence and experience managing depression of the rct gps n 76 were conducted result gps referred few patient to bpt although varied in their referral rate and interviewee referred more than twice a many patient a rct gps interview gps mean 6 34 sd 9 42 rct gps mean 2 65 sd 3 92 a negative correlation wa found between gps referral and their self rated pharmacotherapeutic competence r 73 0 31 p 001 the qualitative finding revealed a total of 19 barrier b and 29 facilitator f at the level of gp b 4 and f 11 patient b 11 and f 9 gp practice b 1 and f 3 and sociopolitical circumstance b 3 and f 6 key barrier stated by all interviewed gps included little knowledge about internet based intervention and patient lack of familiarity with technology internet medium number of statement each k 22 key facilitator were perceived patient suitability e g well educated young k 22 and no conflict with gp s role k 16 the follow up survey showed a very high agreement rate of at least 75 for 71 34 48 of the identified theme descriptive finding indicated difference between gps with low and high referral rate in term of which and how many barrier low mean 9 75 sd 1 83 high mean 10 50 sd 2 38 and facilitator low mean 18 25 sd 4 13 high mean 21 00 sd 3 92 they mentioned conclusion this study provides insight into factor influencing gps referral to bpt a gatekeeper to depression care barrier and facilitator should be considered when designing implementation strategy to enhance referral rate the finding should be interpreted with care because of the small and self selected sample and low response rate

introduction association among sexual excitation sexual inhibition atypical sexual arousal pattern and risky sexual behavior have been reported in study involving men and woman to date longitudinal study have not evaluated the predictive value of these propensity for future sexual behavior in woman aim to investigate association among sexual excitation sexual inhibition atypical sexual arousal pattern and potentially risky sexual behavior in woman method overall 2 214 woman mean age 30 65 year standard deviation 9 91 year participated in a baseline web based survey the 1 and 2 year follow up survey included 396 and 382 participant respectively correlational analysis and multiple linear regression analysis were conducted to analyze the relation between predictor and outcome variable main outcome measure number of partner number of one time sexual encounter and number of partner with whom no condom were used during the 12 month period before each of the three data assessment point result all five lower order factor of sexual excitation showed positive correlation and all three lower order factor of sexual inhibition showed negative correlation with outcome at baseline and follow up atypical sexual arousal pattern the tendency to become aroused in unusual sexual situation and the importance of relationship factor such a trust for sexual arousal were the strongest predictor for sexual behavior at baseline these variable also predicted the number of sexual partner and the number of one night stand at follow up conclusion the finding suggest that increased sexual arousal when experiencing negative mood might be a risk factor for potentially health threatening sexual decision and support the assumption of the dual control model that sexual excitation is positively and sexual inhibition is negatively predictive of risky sexual behavior in woman

while the factor structure of post traumatic stress disorder ptsd symptom ha been investigated among various traumatized population in western and high income country knowledge regarding the validity of factor structure of ptsd among culturally diverse population in low and middle income country is limited the current study examined the factor structure and cultural invariance of ptsd in 521 iraqi and 993 syrian war affected displaced people who were living in the kurdistan region of iraq result from confirmatory factor analysis demonstrated that alternative factor model for ptsd including a new model derived from this population anhedonia and affect model resulted in a better fit than the current dsm v model taken together the result showed that a good fit a well a the measurement invariance of ptsd factor could be obtained by applying the anhedonia and hybrid model this study provides further support for the anhedonia and hybrid model of ptsd and fill an important gap in knowledge about the validity of ptsd symptom cluster among arab and kurdish population

the autocorrelation or inertia of negative affect reflects how much negative emotion carry over from moment to moment and ha been associated with increased depressive symptom in this study we posed three challenge to this association by examining 1 whether emotional inertia is relevant for depressive symptom when assessed on a longer timescale than usual 2 whether inertia is uniquely related to depressive symptom after controlling for perseverative thought and 3 whether inertia is related to depressive symptom over and above the within person association between affect and perseverative thought participant n 101 provided rating of affect and perseverative thought for 100 day depressive symptom were reported before and after the study and again after 2 5 year day to day emotional inertia wa related to depressive symptom over and above trait and state perseverative thought moreover inertia predicted depressive symptom when adjusting for it association with perseverative thought these finding establish the relevance of emotional inertia in depressive symptom independent of perseverative thought

the evaluation of treatment integrity therapist adherence and competence is a necessary condition to ensure the internal and external validity of psychotherapy research however the evaluation process is associated with high cost because therapy session must be rated by experienced clinician it is debatable whether rating session segment is an adequate alternative to rating entire session four judge evaluated treatment integrity i e therapist adherence and competence in 84 randomly selected videotape of cognitive behavioral therapy for major depressive disorder social anxiety disorder and hypochondriasis from three different treatment outcome study in each case two judge provided rating based on entire therapy session and two on session segment only i e the middle third of the entire session interrater reliability of adherence and competence evaluation proved satisfactory for rating based on segment and the level of reliability did not differ from rating based on entire session rating of treatment integrity that were based on entire session and session segment were strongly correlated r 62 for adherence and r 73 for competence the relationship between treatment integrity and outcome wa comparable for rating based on session segment and those based on entire session however significant relationship between therapist competence and therapy outcome were only found in the treatment of social anxiety disorder rating based on segment proved to be adequate for the evaluation of treatment integrity the finding demonstrate that session segment are an adequate and cost effective alternative to entire session for the evaluation of therapist adherence and competence

unconscious stimulus can influence participant motor behavior but also more complex mental process recent research ha gradually extended the limit of effect of unconscious stimulus one field of research where such limit have been proposed is spatial cueing where exogenous automatic shift of attention have been distinguished from endogenous controlled process which govern voluntary shift of attention previous evidence suggests unconscious effect on mechanism of exogenous shift of attention here we applied a cue priming paradigm to a spatial cueing task with arbitrary cue by centrally presenting a masked symmetrical prime before every cue stimulus we found priming effect on response time in target discrimination task with the typical dynamic of cue priming effect experiment 1 and 2 indicating that central symmetrical stimulus which have been associated with endogenous orienting can modulate shift of spatial attention even when they are masked prime cue congruency effect of perceptual dissimilar prime and cue stimulus experiment 3 suggest that these effect cannot be entirely reduced to perceptual repetition priming of cue processing in addition priming effect did not differ between participant with good and poor prime recognition performance consistent with the view that unconscious stimulus feature have access to process of endogenous shift of attention

objective the present study investigates the association between congruence of patient and therapist perception of the therapeutic bond and symptom improvement method bond congruence outcome association were examined on the within and between dyad level for 580 patient mainly depression and anxiety receiving cognitive behavioral therapy symptom change wa assessed on a session to session level a well a from pre to posttreatment for the between dyad analysis the truth and bias model wa applied for the within dyad analysis polynomial regression and response surface analysis were conducted result on the between dyad level higher temporal congruence between patient and therapist bond rating i e their correlation wa associated with better treatment outcome additionally the average discrepancy between therapist and patient bond rating showed a significant quadratic association with treatment outcome a tendency for therapist to moderately rate the bond lower than their patient showed lowest posttreatment symptom score on the within dyad level we found that when patient and therapist rating were in agreement higher bond score were associated with fewer next session symptom for disagreement the result showed that if therapist rated the bond a weak whereas their patient rated it a strong higher subsequent symptom distress wa observed than if patient rated the bond a weak and their therapist rated it a strong conclusion the present study highlight the importance of therapist being vigilant to session to session change in the therapeutic bond to adjust their intervention accordingly psycinfo database record

relief from pain is positively valenced and entail reward like property notably stimulus that became associated with pain relief elicit reward like implicit response too but are explicitly evaluated by human a aversive since the unpredictability of pain make pain more aversive this study examined the hypothesis that the predictability of pain also modulates the valence of relief associated stimulus in two study we presented one conditioned stimulus forwardcs before a painful unconditioned stimulus u another stimulus backwardcs after the painful u and a third stimulus c wa never associated with the u in study 1 forwardcs predicted half of the us while the other half wa delivered unwarned and followed by backwardcs in study 2 all us were predicted by forwardcs and followed by backwardcs in study 1 both forwardcs and backwardcs were rated a negatively valenced and high arousing after conditioning while backwardcs in study 2 acquired positive valence and low arousal startle amplitude wa significantly attenuated to backwardcs compared to forwardcs in study 2 but did not differ among cs in study 1 in summary predictability of aversive event revers the explicit valence of a relief associated stimulus

this study examined whether i brief video aiming to optimise outcome expectation would augment the efficacy of progressive muscle relaxation pmr and ii whether participant characteristic would moderate these effect sixty eight healthy subject randomized to one of three experimental manipulation before undergoing a single pmr session either watched i a video displaying a neutral expert ii a video with a warm expert or iii were part of an active control condition constrained linear mixed model indicated increased relaxation and decreased stress level for all participant after the pmr session the primary outcome wa the change of perceived relaxation stress from pre to post participant with high neuroticism and trait anxiety indicated an augmented pmr s efficacy and increased outcome expectation when watching the warm expert video compared to the control group or the le warm expert brief video displaying an expert aiming to optimise outcome expectation regarding a brief stress reducing psychological intervention may boost or decrease an intervention s efficacy effect may depend on the viewer s personality and the video expert s communication style trial registration the study protocol wa approved by the local ethic committee of the university of marburg germany this study wa registered at www clinicaltrials gov nct03330431

objective the aim of this study wa to study the effect of a short term cognitive behavior therapy on work anxiety and sickness absence in patient with work anxiety method three hundred forty five inpatient who suffered from cardiologic neurological or orthopedic problem and additionally work anxiety were randomly assigned into two different group intervention patient got four session of a group intervention which either focused on cognitive behavior therapy anxiety management work anxiety coping group wag or unspecific recreational activity rg result no difference were found between wag and rg for work anxiety and subjective work ability when looking at patient who were suffering only from work anxiety and no additional mental disorder the duration of sickness absence until 6 month follow up wa shorter in the wag wag 11 week rg 16 week p 0 050 conclusion a short term wag may help return to work in patient with work anxiety a long a there is no comorbid mental disorder

the method of limit mli is an established psychophysical procedure for example for determining thermal threshold the standard mli relies on fixating the thermode at the stimulation site by mean of a strap and requires the participant to terminate the increase in heat by pressing a button this however raise concern regarding safety and task complexity in specific population such a cognitively impaired individual people with high fear of pain or young child 6 year in this study we aimed at developing a simplified version of the commonly used mli for testing heat pain threshold hpt and tolerance hptol and at validating it a a first step in healthy adult heating is terminated by withdrawing the hand from the heat probe thereby ensuring maximum control and safety for validation hpts and hptols were assessed with the novel hand withdrawal method hwm and compared to the standard mli using a within subject design additionally a one potential research area in which the hwm may be used we explored expectancy induced placebo hypoalgesic effect by comparing result of standard mli with those of hwm our data confirm good concordance between the 2 method for none of the outcome significant difference between the 2 method were found perspective in the present study in healthy adult an adapted simplified and safe method of limit wa demonstrated to be equivalent to the standard method of limit this novel behavioral hand withdrawal method seems promising for future investigation of pain sensitivity and placebo effect especially for specific population such a young child

background although internet based and mobile based stress management intervention ismis may be a promising strategy to reach employee suffering from high chronic stress it remains unknown whether participant with high symptom severity of depression or anxiety also benefit from ismis or should be excluded objective this study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of ismis in subgroup with high symptom severity and to test whether baseline symptom severity moderate treatment outcome method data from three randomized controlled trial n 791 were pooled to identify effect modifier and to evaluate efficacy in subgroup with different level of initial symptom severity the outcome perceived stress perceived stress scale ps depression severity center for epidemiological depression scale ce d and anxiety hospital anxiety and depression scale hads symptom severity were assessed at baseline 7 week postassessment and 6 month follow up potential moderator were tested in predicting difference in the change of outcome in multiple moderation analysis simple slope analysis evaluated efficacy of the ismi comparing the intervention group with the waitlist control group in subgroup with low moderate and severe initial symptomology based on mean and sd of the study population in addition subgroup with clinical value of depression ce d 16 and anxiety hads 8 at baseline were explored and response rate rrs 50 symptom reduction and symptom free sf status ce d 16 hads 8 were reported result individual with high stress ps 30 depression ce d 33 anxiety hads 15 and emotional exhaustion mbi 5 6 benefited significantly from the intervention with great reduction of stress d post 0 86 1 16 d fu 0 93 1 35 depression d post 0 69 1 08 d fu 0 91 1 19 and anxiety d post 0 79 1 19 d fu 1 06 1 21 and effect were sustained at 6 month follow up symptom severity moderated treatment outcome a individual with higher symptom severity at baseline benefited significantly more from the intervention than individual with lower symptom severity furthermore 82 9 656 791 of individual had clinical depression value at baseline of which significantly more individual in the intervention group reached at least 50 symptom reduction or fell under clinical cut off rr 29 2 93 318 sf 39 6 126 318 compared with the waitlist control group rr 8 0 27 338 sf 18 6 63 338 at postassessment significantly more individual with clinical anxiety value at baseline hads 8 85 3 675 791 in the intervention group achieved at least 50 symptom reduction or fell under clinical cut off rr 27 7 94 339 sf 39 8 135 339 compared with the wlc rr 4 8 16 336 sf 15 5 52 336 conclusion highly burdened individual benefit greatly from ismis and therefore should not be excluded from participation stress management may be a valid entry point to reach highly burdened individual who otherwise may not seek treatment trial registration 1 german clinical trial register drks00005112 http www drks de drks00005112 archived by webcite at http www webcitation org 6zmizwvda 2 german clinical trial register drks00005384 http www drks de drks00005384 archived by webcite at http www webcitation org 6zmierdtr and 3 german clinical trial register drks00004749 http www drks de drks00004749 archived by webcite at http www webcitation org 6zmijdqpx

background although motivational negative symptom account for reduced functioning and quality of life in individual with psychotic disorder the underlying mechanism are yet not fully understood neuroimaging study suggest that an impaired perception of reward cue could result in a lack of incentive value that then lead to a decrease in goal directed behavior therefore the aim of this study wa to test the effect of increasing the salience of reward cue on goal directed behavior method we recruited a sample of n 30 participant with a psychotic disorder and at least mild negative symptom and n 30 healthy control we used the balloon effort task an effort based decision making paradigm to ass amotivation on a behavioral level we manipulated the salience of reward in the paradigm by highlighting the monetary reward in half of the trial result total effort expenditure did not differ between participant with and without psychotic disorder but participant with psychotic disorder showed a significantly reduced effort allocation to the level of reward the salience of reward manipulation significantly increased effort expenditure both in participant with psychotic disorder and in the healthy control but had no impact on effort allocation conclusion increasing the salience of reward cue promotes goal directed behavior this open up new possibility for intervention addressing amotivation in individual with negative symptom by facilitating the perception of reward cue

background despite the relevance of narcissistic personality disorder npd in clinical setting there is currently no empirical data available regarding the neurobiological correlate of npd in the present study we performed a voxel based morphometric analysis to provide initial insight into local abnormality of gray matter gm volume method structural brain image were obtained from patient with npd n 17 and a sample of healthy control n 17 matched regarding age gender handedness and intelligence group were compared with regard to global brain tissue volume and local abnormality of gm volume region of interest analysis were calculated for the anterior insula result relative to the control group npd patient had smaller gm volume in the left anterior insula independent of group gm volume in the left anterior insula wa positively related to self reported emotional empathy complementary whole brain analysis yielded smaller gm volume in fronto paralimbic brain region comprising the rostral and median cingulate cortex a well a dorsolateral and medial part of the prefrontal cortex conclusion here we provide the first empirical evidence for structural abnormality in fronto paralimbic brain region of patient with npd the result are discussed in the context of npd patient restricted ability for emotional empathy

abstract this article published in gruppe interaktion organisation gio report study result on soft skill and mental work ability in young professional ready to enter the job market the so called soft skill psychological capacity are nowadays an entrance ticket into the modern working world thus the question is to which degree young professional who will soon enter the labor market are fit in their soft skill are physical or mental health problem related with deficit in soft skill which dimension of soft skill are impaired 365 young professional in advanced education from a technical college who will soon enter the labor market were investigated via online questionnaire participant were asked to rate their self perceived capacity level according to mini icf app mental and physical health problem exam and education related anxiety self efficacy and procrastination student with mental health problem had higher exam anxiety and lower study related self efficacy a compared to student without health problem at all or student with physical health problem but procrastination behavior wa similarly present among student with mental health problem and student with physical health problem student with health problem did not report globally weaker capacity level lower level of capacity depend on the type of health problem in student with mental health problem social soft skill were impaired rather than content related capacity physical health problem do not affect the self perceived psychological capacity in conclusion focusing on specific soft skill in training and work adjustment could be fruitful in addition or a an alternative to training of profession specific expertise

body checking bc is defined a behavior aimed at gaining information on body shape size or weight besides it occurrence a a transdiagnostic symptom in eating disorder ed bc is widespread in non clinical population it is associated with body dissatisfaction and the development of body image disturbance and ed male and female differ in term of body dissatisfaction and associated bc strategy however the question of a gender related intensity of negative affect and state body satisfaction a reaction to bc remains open therefore the present experimental study aimed to examine gender difference in affective and evaluative response to bc we tested n 60 woman and n 60 men in a crossover design implementing two experimental condition and one control condition in the negative body checking condition nbc participant received standardized instruction to check negatively valenced body part in the positive body checking condition pbc by contrast participant were asked to check
