positively valenced body part the control condition cbc consisted of playing a computer game before and after checking of one s own body participant rated negative body related affect i e guilt shame and disgust and state body satisfaction the result indicate that both nbc and pbc led to an increase in negative affect for men and woman eating pathology predicted negative affect after checking in nbc for both gender men reported a significantly higher state body satisfaction in all condition whereas only woman showed decreased body satisfaction in nbc these finding suggest that bc of any body part i e positively or negatively valenced lead to increased negative affect for both gender eating pathology significantly influence the affective response to bc for both gender change in state body satisfaction however only occur in female an explanation might be that men generally report higher body satisfaction resulting in a more stable body image female and male with pathological eating behavior seem to be more vulnerable to change in negative affect a negative affect is equally increased after nbc and pbc for both gender bc might play a central role in the maintenance of body image disturbance in male and female

aim real time monitoring of psychotherapeutic process wa recently described a a promising new way of tracking period of change in ongoing treatment this approach generates complex multivariate datasets that have to be presented in an intuitive way for clinician to aid their clinical decision making using network modeling and new approach in centrality analysis we examine bridge node between symptom stress and aspect of the psychotherapeutic process between therapy session intersession process isp method we recorded intersession process a well a depressive and anxiety symptom using daily questionnaire in ten case regularized thresholded intraindividual dynamic network were estimated we applied bridge centrality analysis to identify individual bridge between psychotherapeutic process and symptom in the resulting model case wise interpretation of bridge centrality value are offered result bridge centrality analysis revealed individual bridge node between intersession process and symptom severity strength and direction of bridge varied substantially across individual conclusion given current methodological challenge idiographic network study are feasible and offer important insight for psychotherapy process research in this case we demonstrated how patient deal with period of increased symptom stress in this case we have described how patient deal with their therapy under increased symptom load bridge between psychotherapeutic process and symptom stress are a promising target for monitoring system based on isp future study should examine the clinical utility of network based monitoring and feedback in ongoing therapy in the near future process feedback system based on idiographic model could serve clinician to improve treatment

objective aim of this study is to evaluate the newly developed questionnaire for the assessment of adverse and protective childhood experience apc method reliability convergent a well a criterion validity were assessed in a sample of 128 patient in a hospital setting result the apc showed high to very high reliability for the two main scale and for most of it subscales convergent validity and wa related to depression and attachment insecurity the scale for the assessment of protective childhood experience explained incremental variance regarding validity conclusion the apc is an enhanced instrument for the assessment of adverse childhood experience especially the simultaneous assessment of protective childhood experience can be of particular importance for research and practice

at present little is still known about the link between depression memory and executive functioning this study examined whether there are memory related impairment in depressed patient and whether the size of such deficit depends on the age group and on specific type of cognitive measure memory performance of 215 clinically depressed patient were compared to the data of a matched control sample regression analysis were performed to determine the extent to which executive dysfunction contributed to episodic memory impairment when compared with healthy control significantly lower episodic memory and executive functioning performance were found for depressed patient of all age group effect size appeared to vary across different memory and executive functioning measure the extent to which executive dysfunction could explain episodic memory impairment varied depending on the type of measure examined these finding emphasise the need to consider memory related functioning of depressed patient in the context of therapeutic treatment

social self threat during physical stress such a exposure to the cold pressor test and isometric handgrip test ha been shown to induce activation of the hpa axis in addition to autonomic response however previous research ha suggested that dysfunctional post event processing may play a major role in neuroendocrine reactivity at initial a well a subsequent social stress exposure in the present study we investigated how the interplay of context i e performance feedback with state i e self esteem a well a trait like factor i e ruminative tendency affect stress response to repeated short bout of physical activity on two session 1 week apart 53 participant 27 woman performed an isometric handgrip task for 3 min during which they were exposed to social evaluative threat in addition participant received fake feedback on their performance immediately after the task labeling it a either above positive or below average negative in addition to neuroendocrine cortisol cardiovascular heart rate blood pressure and subjective stress reactivity performance related and social dimension of state self esteem were assessed before and after stress induction substantial increase in cardiovascular parameter were found on both day regardless of feedback condition however positive feedback led to significantly diminished neuroendocrine response on day 1 whereas baseline cortisol on session 2 wa significantly higher in the negative feedback group conversely social self esteem decreased after stress induction on both day only for participant who had received negative feedback change in self esteem reported on day 1 were associated with increased baseline cortisol at the second session while interindividual difference in self reported trait rumination were associated with cortisol reactivity at session 1 taken together the result suggest that effect of social evaluation during short period of physical stress rely on post event processing and might be counteracted by positive appraisal directly after stress exposure post hoc framing in term of success v failure may predict subsequent stress related hormonal effect better than task demand per se which should be considered a a potential moderator in future acute stress research but might also be relevant to many practical application in field ranging from sport performance to health psychology

end of life eol conversation with relative or significant others are often avoided one reason can be negative expectation regarding these conversation the present study wa conducted to develop and initially validate the end of life conversation expectation scale eolc e an exploratory factor analysis n 307 resulted in a 20 item version with three distinct dimension expected own emotional burden alpha 92 expected other person s emotional burden alpha 94 and communication self efficacy alpha 89 the eolc e total score correlated significantly with communication apprehension about death r 62 fear of death r 58 death avoidance r 52 a well a readiness for end of life conversation r 38 and occurrence of previous conversation r 29 result suggest that the eolc e is a reliable and valid instrument to ass death and dying communication expectation this measure ha utility in communication research focusing on optimizing expectation and increasing eol communication

background objective positive mental health pmh ha been shown to confer resilience against suicide ideation however the mechanism underlying the positive effect of pmh on suicide ideation behavior are largely unknown the current study aimed to determine whether positive affect mediates the association between pmh and suicide ideation method a total of 150 adult outpatient 65 3 female age m sd 37 79 13 50 range 18 77 completed measure on pmh positive and negative affect a well a suicide ideation data were collected using self report questionnaire linear hierarchical regression analysis wa used to analyze the data positive affect wa considered to mediate the association between positive mental health and suicide ideation result while positive affect fully mediated the significant negative association between pmh and suicide ideation negative affect did not reveal to be a significant mediator of this relationship conclusion the protective influence of pmh against suicide ideation is due to heightened positive affect if positive mental health translates into positive affect then suicide ideation becomes le likely

background during the khmer rouge kr regime from 1975 to 1979 million of cambodian were confronted with the death or murder of family member the long term psychological consequence of these traumatic loss have not yet been investigated the purpose of this study wa to determine the rate and potential predictor of prolonged grief disorder pgd in survivor of the kr regime method the inventory of complicated grief revised icg r wa administered in a sample of n 775 cambodian in face to face interview who had lost at least one family member during the kr regime symptom of ptsd were assessed with the ptsd checklist civilian version and symptom of depression and anxiety with the hopkins symptom checklist 25 result the prevalence of pgd in the sample wa 14 3 pgd wa moderately associated with symptom of depression anxiety and ptsd the loss of a spouse a child or a parent wa associated with higher symptom severity of pgd than wa the loss of a sibling or distant relative pgd wa predicted by the relationship to the deceased and symptom of depression and ptsd limitation limitation of the study include the non random sampling recruitment the icg r ha not been validated for use in cambodia conclusion the vast majority of cambodian lost family member during the kr regime even three decade later pgd wa prevalent in a substantial proportion of the present sample and related to other psychiatric disorder the result underline the importance of examining pgd in study of war related psychological impairment

people with schizophrenia and negative symptom show diminished net positive emotion in low arousing context diminished positivity offset and co activate positive and negative emotion more frequently increased ambivalence here we investigated whether diminished positivity offset and increased ambivalence covary with negative symptom along the continuum of psychotic symptom we conducted an online study in an ad hoc community sample n 261 participant self reported on psychotic symptom negative symptom depression positive symptom anhedonia and rated positivity negativity and arousal elicited by pleasant unpleasant and neutral stimulus the data were analyzed with multilevel linear model increasing level of all assessed symptom area showed significant association with diminished positivity offset increased ambivalence wa related only to positive symptom our result show that the diminished positivity offset is associated with psychotic symptom in a community sample including but not limited to negative symptom ecological validity and symptom specificity require further investigation

animal assisted therapy ha been proposed a a treatment adjunct for traumatized patient in animal assisted crisis response dog are used directly after a traumatic event to reduce stress and anxiety however to date there are few controlled study investigating the effect of therapy dog on ptsd symptom and to our knowledge there is no study investigating the effect of a therapy dog intervention directly after a traumatic event in this study 60 healthy female participant were randomly assigned to one of three group after exposure to a traumatic film clip trauma film paradigm one group of participant interacted with a friendly dog for 15 min another group of participant watched a film clip showing a person interacting with a friendly dog and the last group wa instructed to relax participant who had interacted with the dog after the film reported lower anxiety level le negative affect and more positive affect after the intervention a compared to the other two group however the participant who interacted with the dog showed a smaller decrease in physiological arousal after the traumatic film clip compared to both other group there were no difference in intrusion symptom between the three group our result show that dog are able to lessen subjectively experienced stress and anxiety after a traumatic stress situation

unconscious stimulus can influence participant motor behavior a well a more complex mental process previous cue priming experiment demonstrated that masked cue can modulate endogenous shift of spatial attention a measured by choice reaction time task here we applied a signal detection task with masked luminance target to determine the source and the scope of effect of masked stimulus target detection performance wa modulated by prime cue congruency indicating that prime cue congruency modulates signal enhancement at early level of target processing these effect however were only found when the prime wa perceptually similar to the cue indicting that prime influence early target processing in an indirect way by facilitating cue processing together with previous research we conclude that masked stimulus can modulate perceptual and post central level of processing finding mark a new limit of the effect of unconscious stimulus which seem to have a smaller scope than conscious stimulus

chronic stress attenuates reproductive behavior in many specie but evidence regarding the impact of acute stress on human sexual arousability is insufficient stressor specific effect might result from divergent role of both stress response system social self threat linked to affiliation oriented coping might also influence sexual responsivity to investigate stress induced modulation of the processing of sexual cue and it relationship with cortisol 58 participant underwent either a predominantly sympathetic stressor 3 min sustained handgrip or similar control procedure in both condition half of the sample wa monitored by an opposite sex person social evaluation pupillary response to erotic nude were recorded and dissociated into fast and slow pca component physically stressed participant showed enhanced slow dilation to explicit picture cortisol level after stress negatively predicted rapid response to opposite sex and marginally explicit stimulus our result suggest that acute sympathetic stress exposure facilitates cognitive sexual processing whereas subsequent hpa axis activation may induce counteracting effect

in biofeedback research the debate on physiological versus psychological learning ha a long tradition and is still relevant today regarding new development of biofeedback for behavior modification analyzing the role of these learning mechanism may help improving the protocol and answer the question whether feedback of physiological function is necessary to modify a target behavior we explored the presence and impact of physiological eeg change versus psychological learning change in somatic self efficacy in a recently developed eeg neurofeedback protocol for binge eating the protocol target a reduction of food cue induced cortical arousal through regulation of eeg high beta activity in an experimental study accompanying a randomized controlled trial pre and post treatment eeg measurement were analyzed in a neurofeedback group n 18 and an active mental imagery control group without physiological feedback n 18 physiological learning in term of eeg high beta reduction only occurred in the neurofeedback group post treatment participant with successfully reduced binge eating episode 50 reduction showed lower eeg high beta activity than unsuccessful participant p 02 after neurofeedback but not after mental imagery further lower eeg high beta activity at post treatment predicted fewer binge eating episode in neurofeedback only in mental imagery somatic self efficacy predicted treatment success instead of eeg activity altogether the result indicate that physiological change serve a a specific treatment mechanism in neurofeedback against binge eating reducing cortical arousal may improve eating behavior and corresponding neurofeedback technique should therefore be considered in future treatment

olfaction moderate human sexual experience and smell disorder patient sometimes spontaneously complain about impairment in their sexual life the aim of the present study wa to systematically investigate the impact of olfactory dysfunction on sexual desire we compared a sample of n 100 n 52 woman aged 23 51 year m 40 1 sd 8 2 outpatient with olfactory disorder to a sample of n 51 healthy control n 32 woman aged 21 63 year m 39 2 sd 13 1 sexual desire wa assessed with a standardized questionnaire and with two additional item asking for quantitative and qualitative change of sexual desire since the onset of olfactory loss in addition subject completed questionnaire about mood and partnership attachment within the patient group 29 of the subject reported decreased sexual desire since the onset of olfactory loss this change wa predicted by depressive symptom and olfactory function qualitative report revealed for instance that the lack of attraction due to the other s body odor impedes partnership intimacy the change of sexual desire wa significantly related to depression and severity of olfactory impairment but not to partnership attachment however in the standardized questionnaire about sexual desire we observed no difference between patient and control to sum up a considerable number of patient state sexual impairment a a concomitant complaint of olfactory dysfunction patient do typically not spontaneously report those intimate problem routine care setting should inform about this common side effect and explicitly ask for sexual life

dog are known to have stress and anxiety reducing effect several study have shown that dog are able to calm people during cognitive and performance stressor recently therapy dog have been proposed a a treatment adjunct for post traumatic stress disorder patient in this study we aimed to investigate whether dog also have anxiety and stress reducing effect during traumatic stressor 80 healthy female participant were randomly assigned to one of four condition they were exposed to a traumatic film clip trauma film paradigm for one group of participant a friendly dog wa present during the film one group of participant wa accompanied by a friendly human another control group watched the film with a toy animal and the last group watched the film clip alone participant that were accompanied by the dog during the film reported lower anxiety rating and le negative affect after the film clip a compared to the toy dog group and the alone group result of the dog group were comparable to the group that wa accompanied by a friendly human there were no difference in physiological stress response between the four condition our result show that dog are able to lessen subjectively experienced stress and anxiety during a traumatic stress situation this effect wa comparable to that of social support by a friendly person implication for ptsd patient are discussed

background the present study aimed to validate the german version of the short defeat and entrapment scale sdes method validity and reliability were established in an online n 480 an outpatient n 277 and an inpatient sample n 296 statistical analysis included confirmatory factor analysis cfa and group difference in defeat and entrapment result for the online and the inpatient sample the cfa indicated a two factor solution whereas for the outpatient sample both one and two factor solution fitted the data equally well scale property for the two factor solution defeat and entrapment subscale were excellent thus further analysis were based on this solution for the online and the outpatient sample suicidal ideators and suicide attempter scored significantly higher in defeat and entrapment than non ideators and non attempter limitation limiting factor of the study were the different measure across the sample and the cross sectional design of the study conclusion though result were partly mixed we found support for a two factor solution of the instrument showing excellent psychometric property in all three sample the two factor solution is further expected to have higher clinical utility than a one factor solution suicidal ideators and suicide attempter in the online and outpatient sample showed higher score in defeat and entrapment than non ideators and non attempter emphasizing these two concept a predictor for suicidal ideation all in all the present study support the general validity and reliability of the sdes however future investigation based on prospective data are warranted

background the covid 19 outbreak in early 2020 wa associated with an immediate increase in mental health problem in a significant percentage of the general population therefore it is crucial to investigate how the covid 19 pandemic a a psychosocial stressor affected the aetiological process of mental disorder previous research ha shown that stress potentiates associative fear learning and analogue symptom of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd and that analogue ptsd symptom can emerge in response to associative learning objective we investigated whether distress in response to the covid 19 outbreak support the development of intrusion and rumination after exposure to a non covid 19 related analogue trauma moreover we examined if these effect are mediated by the strength of associative learning during analogue trauma method 122 undergraduate university student participated in an online experiment between march and july 2020 they completed questionnaire measuring distress and rumination related to the covid 19 outbreak on a subsequent day they went through an associative learning task in which neutral stimulus were paired with the appearance of a highly aversive film clip subjective rating were assessed a indicator of associative learning on the next day participant documented film related intrusion and rumination result covid 19 related distress but not rumination wa associated with post film intrusion and rumination load these effect were mediated by associative learning conclusion the current finding are in line with the assumption that stress enhanced both associative learning and ptsd symptom specifically they indicate that prolonged psychosocial stress like during the covid 19 outbreak is linked to individual difference in memory processing of aversive event further confirmatory research is needed to replicate these result

recent research indicates that angry facial expression are preferentially processed and may facilitate automatic avoidance response especially in socially anxious individual however few study have examined whether this bias also express itself in more complex cognitive process and behavior such a decision making we recently introduced a variation of the iowa gambling task which allowed u to document the influence of task irrelevant emotional cue on rational decision making the present study used a modified gambling task to investigate the impact of angry facial expression on decision making in 38 individual with a wide range of social anxiety participant were to find out which choice were dis advantageous to maximize overall gain to create a decision conflict between approach of reward and avoidance of fear relevant angry face advantageous choice were associated with angry facial expression whereas disadvantageous choice were associated with happy facial expression result indicated that higher social avoidance predicted le advantageous decision in the beginning of the task i e when contingency were still uncertain interaction with specific skin conductance response further clarified that this initial avoidance only occurred in combination with elevated response before choosing an angry facial expression in addition an interaction between high trait anxiety and elevated response to early loss predicted faster learning of an advantageous strategy these effect were independent of intelligence general risky decision making self reported state anxiety and depression thus socially avoidant individual who respond emotionally to angry facial expression are more likely to show avoidance of these face under uncertainty this novel laboratory paradigm may be an appropriate analog for central feature of social anxiety

objective previous research ha yielded evidence of increased attentional processing of negatively valenced body part in woman with anorexia nervosa an especially for those with high depressive symptomatology the present study extended previous research by implementing an experimental mood manipulation method in a within subject design female adolescent with an n 12 and an age matched female control group cg n 12 were given a negative and a positive mood induction at a one week interval after each mood induction participant underwent a 3 min mirror exposure while their eye movement were recorded result after the positive mood induction both an and cg participant displayed longer and more frequent gaze towards their self defined most ugly relative to their self defined most beautiful body part however after the negative mood induction only female with an were characterized by increased attention to their most ugly compared to their most beautiful body part while cg participant attention distribution wa balanced furthermore in the negative but not in the positive mood induction condition gaze frequency and duration towards the most ugly body part wa significantly stronger in the an group relative to the cg discussion the result emphasize the role of negative mood in the maintenance of pathological information processing of the self body this increased body related negativity bias during negative mood may lead to the persistence and aggravation of an patient body image disturbance

violent form of discipline in school continue to be widespread across the globe despite their damaging effect since little is known about factor influencing the extent of violence applied by teacher this study aimed to investigate the influence of teacher stress work satisfaction and personal characteristic on their disciplining style using structural equation modeling association between violent discipline burnout symptom and job perception pressure and difficulty in class reported by 222 teacher from 11 secondary school in tanzania in 2015 were analyzed result indicated a direct association between perceived stress and emotional violent discipline beta 18 p 05 a well a physical violent discipline beta 37 p 001 perceived stress also mediated the association between job perception and both form of violent disciplining the model showed good model fit chi 2 44 n 222 67 47 p 013 cfi 94 tli 91 ifi 94 rmsea 049 90 ci 02 07 pclose 50 srmr 06 our finding suggest that teacher personal perception of their work a well a their stress burden play a role in their disciplining style our finding underline the importance of integrating topic such a stress and coping a well a positive nonviolent discipline measure into the regular teacher s training and in addition to develop and evaluate school based preventative intervention for teacher

this study examined the role of sleep disturbance and insomnia in the context of stress reactivity in adolescence one hundred and thirty five 11 18 year old m age 14 2 year sd 1 9 52 female completed the trier social stress test for child salivary cortisol and subjective stress rating were collected at six time point and heart rate a well a heart rate variability were measured pre during and post stress induction additionally sleep disturbance and insomnia diagnosis were assessed by a self report questionnaire and a sleep interview robust mixed model investigated if adolescent with compared with adolescent without a sleep disturbance and b insomnia differ regarding cortisol heart rate heart rate variability and psychological stress reactivity considering gender effect the result indicated that boy with high sleep disturbance showed higher cortisol activity compared with boy with low sleep disturbance b 0 88 p 0 05 moreover in boy with insomnia heart rate and alpha 1 significantly differ le than in boy without insomnia these finding support the notion of sex difference regarding the association between poor sleep and increased activity of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal axis and a le adaptable autonomic nervous system in boy in response to an experimental social stress task

previous study indicate that participant with eating disorder show an attentional bias for the negatively valenced body part of their own body however the neural basis underlying these process ha not been investigated we conducted a preregistered combined functional mri fmri eye tracking study and presented 35 woman with binge eating disorder bed and 24 weight matched control subject cg with body part image of their own body and a weight matched unknown body after the fmri examination participant rated the attractiveness of the presented body part a expected woman with bed responded with significantly higher insula and amygdala activity when viewing the negatively valenced body part of their own body compared to all other combination however individual with bed did not deviate from the cg in the processing of these stimulus in the ventromedial prefrontal cortex the extrastriate body area or the fusiform body area our result indicate that the negative valued body part carry a particularly strong emotional valence in individual with bed these result further emphasize the relevance of processing bias for negatively valenced body part in the pathology of bed psycinfo database record c 2023 apa all right reserved

introduction self stigma arising from public stigma is a heavy burden for people suffering from mental health problem both public stigma and self stigma encompass the same three element stereotype prejudice and discrimination public stigma ha already been successfully explored by the stereotype content model scm and the behavior from intergroup affect and stereotype bias map however this is not the case for self stigma therefore this is the first study that applies scm and the bias map to self stigma by examining whether the effect of self stereotype on self directed discrimination would be mediated by self directed prejudice in people with mental health problem method within a total sample of n 823 participant who took part in an online survey n 336 people reported mental health problem mental health and self stereotype warmth competence self directed prejudice negative emotion and self directed discrimination active passive self harm were assessed result structural equation modeling supported the hypothesis that the stereotype dimension warmth and competence negatively related to prejudice while stronger prejudice wa associated with more discrimination active passive self harm prejudice fully mediated the relationship between stereotype and discrimination the indirect effect of warmth and competence on active and passive self harm were moderated by competence and warmth discussion implication for further research on self stigma and the usage of scm and bias map are discussed

background attentional bias ab to threat is thought to play a key role in the development and maintenance of posttraumatic stress symptomatology pt empirical evidence though is inconsistent some study report association between ab towards threat and pt other study report association between ab away from threat and pt yet other study fail to find any association we propose that prospective longitudinal study of ab a a dynamic process expressed from moment to moment in time may help to understand these mixed finding and the role of ab in pt method we tested cross sectional and prospective longitudinal association between ab and pt among german soldier from pre to post deployment in afghanistan n 144 ab to threat and positive emotion stimulus angry happy face wa measured using the dot probe task pt wa assessed by the ptsd checklist the number of traumatic experience wa assessed using cidi traumatic experience list for military result we found that ab dynamic i e towards away temporal variability at pre and post deployment with respect to angry and happy face predicted higher level of pt after deployment a a function of number of intermediate traumatic experience traditional aggregated mean bias score did not similarly prospectively predict pt post deployment conclusion finding indicate that ab to emotionally arousing stimulus may play an important function in the development and maintenance of pt we argue that mixed and null finding appear to be due to failure to model the within subject temporal variability in ab expression theoretical empirical and clinical implication of these finding are discussed

background patient with psychotic disorder report to apply more maladaptive and le adaptive emotion regulation er strategy compared to healthy control however few study have used experimental design to investigate the success in er and the result of those at hand are equivocal aim this study investigated whether patient with delusion show problem in downregulating negative affect via cognitive er strategy method patient with schizophrenia spectrum disorder and acute delusion n 78 and healthy control n 41 took part in an er experiment in which they were instructed to downregulate anxiety and sadness via three er strategy reappraisal distraction acceptance or not to regulate their emotion control condition er success wa measured a the change in subjective emotion intensity and physiological indicator skin conductance and heart rate from before to after regulation and wa analyzed with mixed repeated measure anova result we found a significant effect of the er strategy in the sense that the subjective emotion intensity wa significantly lower after applying the reappraisal and distraction strategy than after the just view condition p s 001 this effect wa not found for the acceptance strategy p 060 there wa no er strategy time group interaction effect f 4 918 575 416 0 778 p 564 n 2 partial 0 007 in all condition skin conductance decreased from pre to post regulation p 001 conclusion our result indicate that patient with acute delusion can successfully apply cognitive er strategy before pursuing the relevant clinical implication of this finding further research is needed to explore the role that the type of instruction ha on er success and the extent to which the finding can be generalized to real life setting

objective to ass child s body concept about anatomy and physiology of the urinary tract child drew picture responding to the question where do you believe urine come from subject and method a total of 152 child in three group were examined 81 child were out patient of these 36 child were being seen for the first time and 45 child had previously undergone bladder and bowel group training they were compared to 71 continent control child were given a body silhouette in which they drew their view of the urinary tract result half of the child 52 6 drew a bladder and other organ nearly 43 drew a tube or other anatomically incorrect picture significant difference were found for group and age child who had undergone the group training more often drew a bladder and other organ 80 correct picture and picture of bladder and other organ were more common from child aged 11 16 year conclusion child have subjective concept of the urinary tract which do not follow actual anatomy and physiology for medical intervention a well a any training programme it is essential to understand these concept and provide instruction in a child centred and developmentally adequate way

the experience of socially aversive event is proposed to be a critical etiological factor in the development of social anxiety symptom even though the experience itself is also common among healthy individual rather than the event itself accompanying factor such a maladaptive processing might be associated with higher level of social anxiety symptom one hundred seventy four individual participated in this online survey comprising questionnaire regarding social anxiety symptom and retrospective report concerning maladaptive processing of the worst socially aversive event structural equation modelling wa used to analyze the hypothesized mediation of maladaptive processing and fear of negative evaluation by intrusive re experiencing and social phobic belief the positive association between retrospectively evaluated maladaptive processing after the worst socially aversive event and fear of negative evaluation wa mediated by social phobic belief but not by intrusive re experiencing these result point towards the relevance of further investigating processing strategy after socially aversive event a a potential influencing factor for sad development trial registration the trial wa registered at the german clinical trial register drks00021502 on june 3 rd 2020 supplementary information the online version contains supplementary material available at 10 1007 s12144 022 02805 9

imitation of facial expression engages the putative human mirror neuron system a well a the insula and the amygdala a part of the limbic system the specific function of the latter two region during emotional action is still under debate the current study investigated brain response during imitation of positive in comparison to non emotional facial expression difference in brain activation of the amygdala and insula were additionally examined during observation and execution of facial expression participant imitated executed and observed happy and non emotional facial expression a well a neutral face during imitation higher right hemispheric activation emerged in the happy compared to the non emotional condition in the right anterior insula and the right amygdala in addition to the pre supplementary motor area middle temporal gyrus and the inferior frontal gyrus region of interest analysis revealed that the right insula wa more strongly recruited by i imitation and execution than by observation of facial expression that ii the insula wa significantly stronger activated by happy than by non emotional facial expression during observation and imitation and that iii the activation difference in the right amygdala between happy and non emotional facial expression were increased during imitation and execution in comparison to sole observation we suggest that the insula and the amygdala contribute specifically to the happy emotional connotation of the facial expression depending on the task the pattern of the insula activity might reflect increased bodily awareness during active execution compared to passive observation and during visual processing of the happy compared to non emotional facial expression the activation specific for the happy facial expression of the amygdala during motor task but not in the observation condition might reflect increased autonomic activity or feedback from facial muscle to the amygdala

rationale the way in which the tendency to fear somatic arousal sensation anxiety sensitivity in interaction with the created expectation regarding arousal induction might affect defensive responding to a symptom provocation challenge is not yet understood objective the present study investigated the effect of anxiety sensitivity on autonomic arousal startle eyeblink response and reported arousal and alertness to expected v unexpected caffeine consumption method to create a match mismatch of expected and experienced arousal high and low anxiety sensitive participant received caffeine v no drug either mixed in coffee expectation of arousal induction or in bitter lemon soda no expectation of arousal induction on four separate occasion autonomic arousal heart rate skin conductance level respiration end tidal co2 minute ventilation defensive reflex response startle eyeblink and reported arousal and alertness were recorded prior to immediately and 30 min after beverage ingestion result caffeine increased ventilation autonomic arousal and startle response magnitude both group showed comparable level of autonomic and respiratory response the startle eyeblink response were decreased when caffeine induced arousal occurred unexpectedly e g after administering caffeine in bitter lemon this effect wa more accentuated in high anxiety sensitive person moreover in high anxiety sensitive person the expectation of arousal coffee consumption led to higher subjective alertness when administering caffeine and increased arousal even if no drug wa consumed conclusion unexpected symptom provocation lead to increased attention allocation toward feared arousal sensation in high anxiety sensitive person this finding broadens our understanding of modulatory mechanism in defensive responding to bodily symptom

objective to examine the role of emotion regulation and it relationship to mental and physical health in patient with heart failure hf method patient hospitalized with hf were screened for depressive symptom with the two item patient health questionnaire phq 2 and classified a screen positive if endorsing 1 item and otherwise a screen negative one month after hospital discharge the emotion regulation questionnaire erq wa administered to ass suppression and reappraisal a emotion regulation strategy in all participant who completed the erq n 394 all cause rehospitalization and depressive symptom using the phq 9 were assessed at 1 3 and 6 month after hospital discharge result overall phq 9 score decreased by 6 month 0 13 point month p 003 and although suppression showed a small association with depression neither strategy modulated the slope of the decline in depressive symptom multivariable adjusted cox model showed that reappraisal and suppression were not related to all cause rehospitalization in the entire cohort however increasing reappraisal reduced rehospitalization risk by 24 for screen positive patient n 311 hr 0 76 p 02 but increased it by 94 in screen negative patient n 83 hr 1 94 p 009 conclusion suppression and reappraisal showed specific and divergent association in patient with hf suppression may relate to depressive symptom reappraisal wa associated with rehospitalization but differently for patient with a positive v negative depression screen further study are needed to examine whether emotion regulation skill training can improve mental and physical health in depressed patient with hf or ameliorate depression in those at risk

practitioner lack guidance on how to support discontinuation of psychotropic medication an understanding of what constitutes discontinuation success that encompasses the patient perspective could advance knowledge in this clinically relevant area here we report the development and validation of a scale to ass subjective discontinuation success participant who attempted discontinuing antidepressant and or antipsychotic during the past 5 year n 396 completed a questionnaire on subjective discontinuation success discontinuation success scale ds developed in consultation with people with lived experience of discontinuation construct validity wa tested by exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis criterion validity wa tested by assessing ds score association with objective success i e full cessation reduced dose in combination with scoring above a predefined criterion on the well being index factor analysis yielded a three dimensional scale reflecting subjective discontinuation success positive effect and negative effect of discontinuation a 24 item ds demonstrated sufficient model fit for the participant discontinuing antidepressant or antipsychotic respectively significant association with objective success and well being were found participant who had achieved full cessation and scored high on well being reached the highest ds score the ds is a viable tool for future research aimed at identifying predictor of discontinuation success in order to inform recommendation related to discontinuation

the present study tested a theoretically derived link between rumination and depressive symptom through behavioural avoidance and reduced motive satisfaction a a key aspect of positive reinforcement rumination behavioural avoidance motive satisfaction and level of depression were assessed via self report measure in a clinical sample of 160 patient with major depressive disorder path analysis based mediation analysis wa used to estimate the direct and indirect effect a proposed by the theoretical model operating in serial behavioural avoidance and motive satisfaction partially mediated the association between rumination and depressive symptom irrespective of gender medication and co morbid anxiety disorder this is the first study investigating the association between behavioural avoidance rumination and depression in a clinical sample of depressed patient the finding are in line with an understanding of rumination in depression a also serving an avoidance function key practitioner message rumination avoidance motive satisfaction and level of depressive symptom were examined in a clinical sample of 160 outpatient with major depressive disorder path analysis based mediation analysis revealed that operating in serial avoidance and motive satisfaction partially mediated the link between rumination and level of depressive symptom finding support an understanding of rumination in depression a serving an avoidance function

background picky or fussy eating is common in early childhood and associated with a decreased preference for a variety of food the aim of the current study wa to test experimentally which sensory food feature influence food acceptance which in turn is an indication for fussy eating in young child 32 48 month another aim wa to evaluate if the behavioural measurement of food acceptance is related to parental report of their child s fussy eating behaviour parental feeding style and child s bmi method in a repeated measure design three sensory feature were manipulated separately i e colour texture and taste while keeping the other two feature constant the baseline measurement consisted of a well liked yoghurt which wa presented before each manipulation variant the number of spoon that child n 32 consumed from each variant were registered a behavioural indication for food acceptance parental report of child s eating behaviour and parental feeding style and child s bmi were also measured result the manipulation of food texture caused a significant decrease in intake colour and taste manipulation of the yoghurt did not affect child s intake parental report of child s fussy eating behaviour and parental feeding style were not related to the behavioural observation of food acceptance the behavioural measurement of food acceptance and parental account of fussy eating were not related to child s bmi conclusion food texture but not taste or colour alternation affected food acceptance at least when consuming variation of a well liked yoghurt this knowledge is important for further research on picky eating intervention parental report of fussy eating did not concur with the behavioural observation of food acceptance further research is warranted to test whether these finding generalize to other food type

psychopathy is characterized by a lack of empathy callousness and a range of severe antisocial behavior a deficit to accurately process social cue which ha been widely documented in psychopathic population is assumed to underlie their pathological development impaired attention to socially salient cue such a the eye of an interaction partner is a possible mechanism compromising the development of social cognition preliminary evidence from static facial stimulus suggests that psychopathy is indeed linked to reduced eye gaze however no study to date ha investigated whether these mechanism apply to naturalistic interaction this study is the first to examine pattern of visual attention during live social interaction and their association with symptom cluster of psychopathy eye contact wa assessed in a sample of incarcerated offender n 30 during semistructured face to face interaction with a mobile eye tracking headset and analyzed using a novel automated area of interest e g eye region labeling technique the interaction included an exchange on neutral predetermined topic and included a condition in which the participant were active talking and passive listening the data reveal that across both listening and talking condition higher affective psychopathy is a significant predictor of reduced eye contact listening r 39 talking r 43 the present finding are in line with previous research suggesting impaired attention to social cue in psychopathy this study is the first to document these deficit in naturalistic live social interaction and therefore provides important evidence for their relevance to real life behavior psycinfo database record c 2020 apa all right reserved

behavioral tendency in the approach avoidance task aat have mostly been assessed using a joystick a a response device in recent year other hardware device such a tablet smartphones and computer mouse have also been used however it remains unclear whether different response device yield similar result and show comparable psychometric property the aim of the present study wa to ass approach bias towards chocolate with different response device and to compare their reliability and validity forty five individual with regular chocolate consumption completed three different aats joystick computer mouse touchscreen each comprised of two block in the compatible block of trial chocolate related picture had to be pulled near while object related picture had to be pushed away in the incompatible block of trial instruction were reversed preregistered analysis revealed that participant were faster to pull than to push chocolate related picture relative to object related picture indicating an approach bias for chocolate with no significant difference between response device correlation among the three response device were low to medium exploratory analysis revealed that approach bias were moderated by block order such that bias were only present and associated with craving joystick aat only when the incongruent block wa completed first internal consistency of the bias score ranged between r sb 0 67 0 76 result of the present study point to the existence of an approach bias to chocolate regardless of response device albeit each task seems to measure a different aspect of it order effect point to specific temporal dynamic in the acquisition of stimulus response e g chocolate pull mapping that require further study

background adolescent patient with a substance use disorder sud often fulfil the criterion for a co occurring post traumatic stress disorder ptsd however it is not clear if these dual diagnosed adolescent present with unique level of substance use and how their substance use relates to ptsd symptom cluster objective to investigate substance use in adolescent with co occurring ptsd and sud additionally we explored how the use of specific substance is related to specific ptsd symptom cluster method we recruited n 121 german adolescent sud patient in three group no history of traumatic event te n 35 te but not ptsd n 48 probable ptsd n 38 all group were administered a trauma questionnaire and were asked to report their past month substance use result adolescent with probable ptsd and sud report a higher frequency of mdma use than adolescent with no ptsd and no te ptsd v note u 510 5 p 016 ptsd v te u 710 0 p 010 the use of mdma wa more frequent in adolescent with avoidance symptom x 2 1 6 0 p 014 participant report using substance at a younger age ptsd v note u 372 0 p 001 ptsd v te u 653 5 p 022 and ptsd symptom onset wa on average 2 2 year earlier than first mdma use t 26 2 89 p 008 conclusion adolescent sud patient with probable ptsd are more likely to use mdma than sud patient without ptsd the use of mdma wa associated with reported avoidance symptom the first age of mdma use is initiated after ptsd onset it is unclear whether the association of mdma use with avoidance symptom is due to effort to reduce these symptom or a result of regular mdma use

background different type of maltreatment emotional physical and sexual lead to distortion in emotion and attention processing the present study investigated whether the experience of peer victimization in childhood and adolescence ha an additional influence on attention processing in adulthood method two non clinical sample consisting of individual with different level of experience of maltreatment were recruited in an evaluative conditioning task image of face with neutral emotional expression were either associated with short video of intense negative statement or associated with neutral video subsequently these face were used a stimulus in an emotional stroop task a well a a dot probe task result in both task hierarchical regression analysis revealed that retrospective report of relational peer victimization made an incremental contribution to the prediction of attentional bias beyond child maltreatment in the emotional stroop task emotional abuse wa the strongest predictor for an attentional bias showing delayed response to negatively associated face while peer victimization wa associated with faster response to negatively associated face in the dot probe task relational peer victimization wa the strongest predictor for an attentional bias when the attentional bias wa examined in more detail though peer victimization did not show incremental contribution although emotional abuse remained the strongest predictor for facilitated attention toward negatively associated neutral face conclusion experience of peer victimization leave additional cognitive scar beyond effect of childhood maltreatment by caregiver it is likely that attentional bias in the aftermath of victimization put individual at risk for the development of psychopathology

objective this study examined the prevalence of sleep disturbance and mental strain in student from two european country luxembourg and germany method a total of 2831 student took part in an online survey with 2777 student from germany and 184 student from luxembourg sleep disturbance were assessed with the pittsburgh sleep quality index and the epworth sleepiness scale and aspect of mental strain using the patient health questionnaire the social interactive anxiety scale the self efficacy questionnaire and the test anxiety questionnaire in addition we also assessed student chronotypes result across the whole sample mean score on the sleep questionnaire were above the cut off for clinically relevant sleep problem indicating an increased prevalence of sleep disturbance in student from both country sleep quality wa impaired in 42 8 and 17 9 showed clinically relevant score overall 25 5 reported elevated depression and 13 3 social phobia symptom while 45 indicated elevated stress level sleep quality daytime sleepiness chronotype depression score stress level test anxiety and self efficacy differed significantly between men and woman but there were no difference between country conclusion sleep disturbance and mental strain in student are common with the current result replicating previous finding student from luxembourg and germany are affected equally

background food addiction ha been widely researched in past year however there is a debate on the mechanism underlying addictive eating and a better understanding of the process associated to these behavior is needed previous study have found characteristic psychological correlate of food addiction such a high negative urgency emotion regulation difficulty and low self directedness in different sample of adult with addictive eating pattern still it seems difficult to disentangle effect independent from general eating disorder psychopathology therefore this study aimed to test a comprehensive model under control of eating disorder severity in order to find independent predictor of food addiction method 315 patient with eating disorder diagnosis on the binge eating spectrum were assessed in personality emotion regulation negative urgency eating disorder symptomatology and food addiction by self report hypothesis driven structural equation modeling wa conducted to test the comprehensive model result the only independent predictor found for food addiction wa negative urgency while self directedness and emotion regulation predicted negative urgency and were highly related to eating disorder symptomatology but not to food addiction conclusion altogether the model suggests that low self directedness and difficulty in emotion regulation are related to higher eating disorder symptomatology in general those patient who in addition to these trait tend to act impulsively when in negative mood state are at risk for developing addictive eating pattern urgency based treatment are therefore recommended for this subgroup of patient

background since the syrian civil war began in march 2011 more than half of the syrian population wa forced to escape from their home and more than 5 million of them fled their country the aim of the present study is to estimate the psychological consequence of this conflict among the refugee population who fled to iraq method in 2017 a team of locally trained psychologist and social worker interviewed 494 married couple 988 individual who were syrian kurdish refugee in the kurdistan region of iraq validated kurdish kurmanji and arabic version of post traumatic stress disorder ptsd checklist for dsm 5 and depression section of hopkins symptom checklist 25 were used for assessing ptsd and depression symptom result almost all of the participant 98 5 had experienced at least one traumatic event and 86 3 of them experienced three or more traumatic event type the prevalence of probable ptsd wa about 60 gender length of time in the camp area in which participant were grown up and the number of traumatic event type were significant predictor for the presence of ptsd symptom approximately the same rate of participant 59 4 experienced probable depression which wa associated with gender age time spent in the camp and the number of traumatic event type conclusion ptsd and depression are prevalent among refugee exposed to traumatic event and various variable play important role the pattern of risk factor in this population is consistent with finding from war affected population in other region and should be considered for intervention within this population and more broadly

background childhood maltreatment cm compromise resilience against stress and trauma throughout life therefore it could present a major risk factor for the health of frequently trauma exposed professional such a emergency medical service em personnel objective we investigated whether em personnel s history of cm increased their risk for mental and physical stress symptom after occupational trauma exposure participant and setting data from 103 german em personnel age mdn qd 26 00 8 50 year were collected a part of a cross sectional survey distributed among employee of the regional german red cross em division response rate 46 6 the sample corresponded well to the division s entire staff in term of socio anagraphic characteristic method cm and occupational trauma exposure a well a posttraumatic depressive and somatic symptom were assessed with self report questionnaire result moderation analysis indicated stronger positive association between occupational trauma exposure and the severity of posttraumatic beta 30 p 001 depressive beta 20 p 026 and somatic symptom beta 18 p 059 among em personnel who reported a higher exposure to cm conclusion our study provides initial evidence that cm could increase the em personnel s vulnerability to the detrimental consequence of critical incident on duty future research is needed i to replicate and generalize our observation on various trauma exposed profession a well a ii to develop preventive measure for targeting the mediating and protective factor which influence the relationship between cm and the negative consequence of occupational trauma exposure

background defeat and entrapment have been highlighted in the development of suicidal ideation within the integrated motivational volitional model of suicidal behavior research suggests that entrapment ha to be differentiated into internal and external entrapment the aim of this study wa to investigate the association between defeat internal external entrapment and suicidal ideation within and prospectively over measurement method a sample of 308 psychiatric inpatient 53 female aged 18 to 81 year m 36 92 sd 14 30 wa assessed for the four construct after admission to a psychiatric ward and six nine and twelve month later multilevel analysis were conducted to examine association result defeat wa associated with a change in internal and external entrapment defeat predicted a change in internal entrapment over time defeat and internal but not external entrapment were associated with a change in suicidal ideation internal entrapment wa able to predict suicidal ideation internal entrapment and defeat predicted a change in suicidal ideation over time conclusion result highlight the importance to distinguish between internal and external entrapment and their specific association with suicidal ideation perception of internal entrapment are of central relevance when experiencing suicidal ideation and should be considered in clinical practice

affective style appear to be relevant to the development of psychopathology especially anxiety disorder the aim of the current study wa to investigate change in affective style in patient with panic disorder and specific phobia a a result of undergoing cognitive behavioral therapy and to identify a possible link between certain affective style and remission the sample consisted of outpatient n 101 suffering from panic disorder specific phobia or agoraphobia who completed the affective style questionnaire asq before and after therapy a well a at a 6 month follow up assessment multivariate analysis of variance were conducted to test for change due to therapy logistic regression analysis were calculated to test for the impact of affective style on remission from anxiety disorder and hierarchical regression analysis were calculated to examine the association between change in affective style and symptom reduction result indicated significant increase on the asq subscales adjusting and tolerating after therapy concealing did not decrease significantly after therapy in addition higher score on adjusting significantly predicted remission from anxiety disorder finally we found a significant association between increase on the adjusting scale and the reduction of anxiety symptom

anxiety problem among young child are highly prevalent and related to family factor such a parenting behavior or parental psychological health the current pilot study examined the effectiveness of the non specific short term behavioral hypnotherapeutic parent training tipe in treating abnormal childhood anxiety childhood anxiety parenting behavior parenting sense of competence and psychological stress of the parent were measured at three point in time pretest posttest 3 month follow up obtained data wa compared to a waiting list control condition after participating parent of the treatment condition reported le dysfunctional parenting behavior le psychological stress and higher parenting sense of competence their child were significantly le anxious these effect were stable after three month family of the waiting list control condition however showed no significant change we conclude that a general behavioral hypnotherapeutic parent training positively affect the course of childhood anxiety problem

background and objective the fast detection of and response to threatening stimulus is an important task of the human visual and motor system and is especially challenging when stimulus are ambiguous this study investigates the perception evaluation and fast response to ambiguous natural spider stimulus in spider fearful and non anxious participant method stimulus were created by gradually morphing natural image of spider and non spider a crab a starfish a bunch of key and a flower in study 1 participant rated the image on perceptual and emotional dimension and responded to them in a response priming task to measure rapid information processing in study 2 result were validated and extended in a different paradigm by using a go no go task result a expected spider fearful participant showed an interpretative bias for ambiguous stimulus i e perceived them a more similar to spider and rated spider like stimulus a more unpleasant arousing and disgusting in study 1 spider stimulus were preferentially processed in spider fearful participant a observed in faster response to spider target however response were not different to comparison participant for ambiguous stimulus study 2 suggests that this finding can be explained by difference in stimulus duration limitation no participant with positive attitude towards spider or a second fearful comparison group were included conclusion we suggest that these finding can be explained by the nature of the applied task that tap into early phase of visual processing thereby relying on feedforward mediated low spatial frequency information extracted via the fast subcortical path to the amygdala

objective up to 29 of the working population suffer from chronic mental disorder and work disability a different profession pose different psychological capacity demand one core aspect for describing work disability is psychological capacity limitation the distribution of capacity limitation in patient with chronic mental disorder cmd from different professional field is unknown a well a their relation with sick leave objective are there different work ability limitation in cmd patient working in different profession method 263 cmd patient from different profession were investigated cross sectionally in a thorough medical and psychological assessment by a trained psychosomatic study physician besides cmd diagnostic mini and subjective work ability limitation imet an observer rating on capacity limitation wa conducted with mini icf app result no relevant difference in perceived work ability limitation were found between the profession difference of capacity limitation were better explained by psychopathology than by profession but capacity limitation were differently related with sick leave in different profession and there are difference in sick leave duration conclusion the variance of capacity limitation wa explained by psychopathology the variance of sick leave duration wa explained by profession similar capacity limitation are associated differently with sick leave in different profession different professional field may have different tolerance towards the same capacity limitation therefore similar capacity limitation are more or le strongly associated with sick leave in different profession

musculoskeletal symptom are increased in farmer whereas the prevalence of chronified pain is unknown online intervention based on acceptance and commitment therapy act have shown encouraging result in the general population representing a promising approach for reducing pain interference in green profession i e farmer forester gardener we conducted a pragmatic rct comparing a guided act based online intervention to enhanced treatment a usual in entrepreneur contributing spouse family member and pensioner in green profession with chronic pain cpg grade ii 6 month recruitment wa terminated prematurely after 2 5 year at n 89 of planned n 286 assessment were conducted at 9 week t1 6 month t2 and 12 month t3 post randomization the primary outcome wa pain interference t1 the secondary outcome encompassed pain health and intervention related variable no treatment effect for reduction of pain interference wa found at t1 beta 0 16 95 ci 0 64 0 32 p 0 256 improvement in cognitive fusion pain acceptance anxiety perceived stress and quality of life were found only at t3 intervention satisfaction a well a therapeutic and technological alliance were moderate and uptake and adherence were low result are restricted by low statistical power due to recruitment issue high study attrition and low intervention adherence standing in contrast to previous study further research is warranted regarding the use of act based online intervention for chronic pain in this occupational group trial registration german clinical trial registration drks00014619 registered 16 april 2018

indecisiveness the subjective inability to make satisfying decision is an individual difference trait that may impede effective action mechanism underlying indecisiveness are largely unknown in four study we tested the prediction that indicator of evaluation difficulty were associated with indecisiveness in simple evaluation across study indecisiveness wa measured via self report while evaluation difficulty were derived behaviorally from three indicator difficulty distinguishing between similar evaluation object i e standard deviation of evaluation rating evaluation duration reaction time and implicit evaluation evaluative priming effect using familiar everyday object study 1 n 151 wa based on attractiveness evaluation of portrait study 2a n 201 and 2b n 211 used chocolate a evaluation object and manipulated to what extent the evaluation were equivalent to a decision in study 3 n 80 evaluation were measured implicitly through evaluative priming using food picture contrary to our prediction indecisiveness showed no reliable association to any indicator of evaluation difficulty regardless of type of evaluation object equivalence of evaluation and decision and whether evaluation difficulty wa based on explicit or implicit evaluation all null finding were supported by bayes factor these counterintuitive result are a first step toward investigating evaluation process a potential mechanism underlying indecisiveness showing that for both explicit and implicit measurement indecisiveness is not characterized by difficulty when evaluating familiar everyday object

background previous experience with illness and traumatic experience are considered a important risk factor for the development of health anxiety and hypochondriasis however empirical research is insufficient and lack adequate comparison group objective therefore we sought to determine whether experience with illness and traumatic experience are really specific risk factor for hypochondriasis method in the current study patient with the diagnosis of hypochondriasis n 80 patient with a primary anxiety disorder n 80 and healthy control n 83 were investigated regarding their previous experience with illness self and other and traumatic childhood experience result we found that patient with hypochondriasis reported a higher level of experience with illness and with traumatic childhood experience than healthy control however no difference were found between patient with hypochondriasis and those with an anxiety disorder regarding their level of experience with illness and traumatic experience conclusion previous experience with illness and traumatic childhood experience did not prove to be specific risk factor for the development of hypochondriasis the importance of both experience with illness and traumatic experience a risk factor a considered in the diagnostic and statistical manual and in established cognitive behavioral model doe not seem to be supported empirically further research should therefore also consider other potential risk factor discussed in the literature

many people experience high burden by the outbreak of the coronavirus disease covid 19 and it consequence for health and everyday life the present cross national study investigated potential factor that can reduce the burden by covid 19 in china and germany cross sectional and longitudinal china n 474 baseline bl 2015 follow up fu 2020 germany n 359 bl 2019 fu 2020 data on physical activity e g jogging bl fu positive mental health pmh bl fu and burden by covid 19 fu were collected via online survey in both country physical activity wa positively associated with pmh and both variable were negatively related to burden by covid 19 furthermore pmh mediated the link between physical activity and burden the mediation model wa significant when physical activity and pmh were assessed at the bl while burden wa measured at the fu and it wa also significant when all variable were assessed at the fu the present finding reveal that physical activity in combination with pmh can reduce the experience of burden by covid 19 conscious fostering of physical activity and pmh is supported a an effective strategy to reduce the negative impact of the pandemic outbreak on mental and physical health additional benefit such a increased adherence to governmental measure around covid 19 are discussed

previous research ha documented altered autonomic nervous system an reactivity to laboratory based social stress task in child with social anxiety disorder sad it is unclear however whether these alteration are caused by the unfamiliar and possibly threatening lab environment or whether they generalize to other more representative context sympathetic and parasympathetic autonomic functioning wa assessed in the home minimizing environmental threat during a supine baseline phase and two physical activation phase orthostatic stress stair stepping in child 9 13 year with sad n 27 and healthy control child n 27 relative to control child with sad showed tonic autonomic hyperarousal a indicated by higher heart rate and electrodermal activity during the supine baseline phase further there wa evidence for stronger cardiac and vascular sympathetic reactivity t wave amplitude pulse wave transit time to moderate physical activation in child with sad higher autonomic arousal during rest wa related to measure of trait social anxiety and general psychopathology group did not differ on parasympathetic parameter our result extend previous laboratory finding and provide the first evidence for alteration in child with sad during basal autonomic regulation and in the absence of explicit social evaluative threat they may further help to clarify conflicting study result from previous laboratory study the finding underline the importance of psychophysiological assessment using different environment and task to elucidate the physiological base of sad

background regulatory problem such a excessive cry sleeping and feeding difficulty in infancy are some of the earliest precursor of later mental health difficulty emerging throughout the lifespan in the present study the inter rater reliability and acceptance of a structured computer assisted diagnostic interview for regulatory problem baby dip wa investigated method using a community sample 132 mother of infant aged between 3 and 18 month mean age 10 month were interviewed with the baby dip regarding current and former combined lifetime regulatory problem severity of the symptom wa also rated the interview were conducted face to face at a psychology department at the university 51 5 the mother s home 23 5 or via telephone 25 0 inter rater reliability wa assessed with cohen s kappa k a sample of 48 mother and their interviewer filled in acceptance questionnaire after the interview result good to excellent inter rater reliability on the level of current and lifetime regulatory problem k 0 77 0 98 were found high inter rater agreement wa also found for rating of severity icc 0 86 0 97 participant and interviewer overall acceptance rating of the computer assisted interview were favourable acceptance score did not differ between interview that revealed one or more clinically relevant regulatory problem s compared to those that revealed no regulatory problem conclusion the baby dip wa found to be a reliable instrument for the assessment of current and lifetime problem in cry and sleeping behaviour the computer assisted version of the baby dip wa well accepted by interviewer and mother the baby dip appears to be well suited for research and clinical use to identify infant regulatory problem

the peritraumatic cognitive process of mental defeat the complete loss of inner resistance ha been identified a a key predictor of ptsd yet most evidence on cognitive risk factor stem from industrialized country where survivor typically report few trauma research from postconflict setting indicates that individual difference decrease with accumulating traumatic experience a almost everybody develops ptsd at extreme level of trauma load would this leave le room for the impact of cognitive process in a sample of 227 ugandan rebel war survivor we investigated whether mental defeat influence trauma related psychopathology in regression model accounting for cumulative trauma exposure we found strong main effect of mental defeat on lifetime ptsd risk current ptsd severity and dissociative symptom but no mental defeat trauma load interaction effect our result indicate that peritraumatic mental defeat is central to understand individual difference in psychological reaction after single traumatic event a well a multiple traumatization
