the predominant focus in attachment research on trait like individual difference ha overshadowed investigation of the way in which working model of attachment represent dynamic interpersonally responsive socio affective system intensive longitudinal design extend previous work by evaluating to what extent attachment varies over social interaction and the functional process that underlie it fluctuation we examined momentary activation of attachment orientation in the stream of people daily life and how those pattern were linked to interpersonal behavior based on an event contingent ambulatory 7 day assessment protocol n 263 3 971 interaction operationalized using contemporary integrative interpersonal theory we examined whether contextually activated working model accounted for pattern of interpersonal anti complementarity our analysis revealed that the situational activation of working model varied a a function of interpersonal perception of warmth which were linked to greater state security and lower level of anxious or avoidant expectation these reactivity pattern in turn accounted for interpersonal complementarity avoidant attachment wa linked to diminished and secure attachment to enhanced expression of warmth the analysis were robust even when controlling for momentary positive and negative affect and closeness of the relationship attachment expectation wax and wane across daily social interaction and such fluctuation are reflective primarily of a process in which perception of others warmth activate secure attachment expectation and lower insecure one supplementary information the online version contains supplementary material available at 10 1007 s42761 022 00117 6

change in the olfactory environment have a rather poor chance of being detected aim of the present study wa to determine whether the same cued or different uncued odor can generally be detected at short inter stimulus interval isi below 2 5 s furthermore we investigated whether inhibition of return an attentional phenomenon facilitating the detection of new stimulus at longer isi is present in the domain of olfaction thirteen normosmic people 3 men 10 woman age range 19 27 year mean age 23 year participated stimulation wa performed using air dilution olfactometry with 2 odor phenylethylalcohol and hydrogen disulfide reaction time to target stimulus wa assessed in cued and uncued condition at isi of 1 1 5 2 and 2 5 s there wa a significant main effect of isi indicating that odor presented only 1 s apart are missed frequently uncued presentation facilitated detection at short isi implying that change of the olfactory environment are detected better than presentation of the same odor again effect in relation to olfactory inhibition of return on the other hand are not supported by our result this suggests that attention work different for the olfactory system compared with the visual and auditory system

although salient stimulus are known to modulate startle eye blink response and one s own face is considered of particular salience effect of facial self resemblance on startle responsiveness have not been systematically investigated for the present study picture from the face database rated a neutral were digitally morphed to resemble the participant n 37 face to varying degree 25 50 75 perceptually matched geometrical shape served a a control condition at soas of either 300ms or 3000ms after picture onset startle response were elicited by white noise 50ms 105db and recorded at the orbicularis oculus via emg prior to the experiment self reported mood wa assessed by mean of the panas relative to non face stimulus the presentation of face reduced startle magnitude at short but not long lead interval furthermore for probe presented at a soa of 300ms a linear decrease in startle magnitude with higher level of self resemblance wa observed presumably reflecting higher salience of the self face the startle modulating effect of self resembling face during longer lead interval wa moderated by the participant current mood negative affect predicted stronger pattern of attenuation which might be interpreted a an increase in self focus resulting from more negative mood

daily stress positively predicts addictive social medium use smu three month later during covid 19 lockdown online social support mediates the link between daily stress and addictive smu physical activity moderate the link between online social support and addictive smu physical activity before covid 19 outbreak can contribute to le addictive smu during the pandemic people who experience high level of daily stress often resort to intensive social medium use smu in the short term this can contribute to relief and positive emotion however in the longer term intensive online activity can foster addictive tendency the present longitudinal study investigated the association between daily stress and addictive smu data were assessed in a sample of 211 social medium user m age sd age 22 50 5 00 from germany via online survey at two measurement time point in winter 2020 baseline bl and three month later in spring 2020 during the first covid 19 lockdown follow up fu in moderated mediation analysis the positive relationship between daily stress bl and addictive smu bl and fu wa significantly mediated by the level of perceived online social support bl physical activity bl e g jogging and cycling significantly moderated the relationship between online social support bl and addictive smu bl and fu specifically the association between both variable wa significant for medium and low frequency of physical activity but not for high frequency the mostly female and relatively young sample composition limit the generalizability of the present finding no experimental manipulation of the potential predictor of addictive smu wa introduced limiting the causal interpretation of the current result the current finding disclose mechanism that could reduce the risk of addictive smu specifically a conscious increase of physical activity could prevent the transformation of positive emotion evoked by the perception of online social support into addictive tendency

objective low social status ha been linked to cardiovascular disease subjective social status ss which represents one s perceived position in a social hierarchy ha been suggested to predict health outcome beyond objective measure of socioeconomic status the present study examined if lower ss is related to reduced nocturnal blood pressure bp dipping a risk factor for cardiovascular disease method in this cross sectional study a community sample of 53 healthy adult underwent 24 h ambulatory bp monitoring all participant provided information on ss and objective measure of socioeconomic status i e education occupation and income ss wa measured in comparison to others in the country national ss a well a in comparison to one s social environment local ss using the german version of the macarthur scale result analysis found that participant with low local ss exhibited attenuated nocturnal diastolic blood pressure dipping beta 0 29 95 ci 0 01 0 57 p 043 and mean arterial pressure dipping beta 0 29 95 ci 0 01 0 57 p 041 these association remained significant after adjusting for objective socioeconomic status no significant association between national ss and cardiovascular measure were observed conclusion in conclusion one s perceived social position in the social environment i e local ss is associated with nocturnal bp dipping therefore local ss may be an important psychosocial factor linking social inequality and cardiovascular health

it is a widely held view that human have control over their food choice and consumption however research also suggests that eating behavior is often triggered by contextual cue and guided by automaticities and habit interestingly the dichotomy between automatic and controlled processing ha recently been challenged suggesting that they may be intertwined in a large female sample n 567 we investigated the hypothesis that task based and self reported measure of automatic and controlled processing would interact and impact self reported eating behavior result analyzed via structural equation modeling suggest that automatic but not controlled processing during a modified flanker task including a context specific proportion congruent cspc manipulation wa inversely associated with self reported self control the influence of self control on unhealthy eating behavior i e uncontrolled and emotional eating heightened consumption of fat and sugar wa only indirect via habitual behavior which itself had a strong direct impact unhealthy eating wa further associated with real life outcome e g body mass index bmi our finding suggest that eating behavior may indeed be guided primarily by automaticities and habit whereas self control might facilitate this association having self control over eating might therefore be most effective by avoiding contextual cue eliciting undesired automatic behavior and establishing habit that serve long term goal

objective bulimia nervosa bn and binge eating disorder bed are associated with poorly controlled approach behavior toward food resulting in binge eating approach bias modification abm may reduce these automatic action tendency i e approach bias toward food and may thus decrease binge eating and related symptom method a total of 56 patient with bn bed participated in this double blind randomized controlled trial rct comparing real and sham abm the real abm condition adopted an implicit learning paradigm in which participant were trained to show avoidance behavior in response to food cue participant in the sham condition used a similar task but were not trained to avoid food cue both condition comprised 10 training session within 4 week result participant in both group experienced significant reduction in binge eating eating disorder symptom trait food craving and food cue reactivity real abm tended to result in greater reduction in eating disorder symptom than sham abm food intake approach bias and attention bias toward food did not change discussion this is the first rct on abm in eating disorder the finding provide limited support for the efficacy of abm in bn bed and pose question regarding it active ingredient and it usefulness a a stand alone treatment for eating disorder

sexually explicit material sem is increasingly used in western society one reason for this high usage might be the rewarding property of sem demonstrated in many brain imaging study showing an activation of the reward system during the presentation of sem it is not yet well understood why woman use sem to a remarkably lesser extent than men maybe men react stronger to stimulus so called sem cue which signal the presentation of sem and are therefore more vulnerable to use sem than woman therefore the present study aimed at investigating the sex specific neural correlate towards sem and sem cue we were further interested in whether person characteristic a trait sexual motivation extent of sem use in the last month and age at onset of goal oriented sem use affect the neural response to sem and sem cue the trial of the fmri experiment consisted of an expectation phase with sem or neutral cue and a presentation phase with sem or neutral stimulus respectively analysis showed that the reward circuitry wa activated by sem but also by sem cue there were some sex difference in hemodynamic response to sem during the presentation phase but not during the expectation phase to sem cue in any of the region of interest the influence of the investigated person characteristic wa only small if existent the result suggest that sex specific cue processing cannot explain sex difference in the use of sem

background while homesickness in refugee is a recurring theme in clinical practice respective research in this population is scarce the utrecht homesickness scale uhs allows distinguishing between certain aspect of homesickness namely genuine separation distress like missing family and friend or yearning for home on the one side and problem regarding adjustment to the new situation on the other so far the instrument wa applied mainly in sample of university student and never in refugee objective we aimed to explore homesickness in a refugee population and it association with mental health symptom and migration related factor in addition we wanted to evaluate the uhs s factor structure in a sample other than student method individual from different country n 99 seeking asylum in germany were assessed for homesickness migration related variable e g number of loss and stage of the asylum proceeding and mental health symptom symptom of depression posttraumatic stress and prolonged grief after exploratory factor analysis standardized mean factor score were fed into subsequent correlational and regression analysis to identify the most prominent predictor of homesickness score result the participant showed substantial level of homesickness we found a three factor solution that implied distinct factor regarding 1 adjustment difficulty and loneliness 2 rumination about home and 3 missing family and or friend the total homesickness score wa associated with mental health but regression analysis with the three mean factor score showed differential association with mental health and migration related variable while adjustment difficulty and loneliness were besides time since arrival in germany associated with mental health problem depressive and posttraumatic stress symptom ruminating about home wa predicted by migration related variable number of loss and asylum status for the factor score regarding missing family and or friend the regression model wa not significant conclusion the assessment of homesickness in refugee population is feasible and of clinical importance especially when distinguishing between separation distress and difficulty with adjusting to the new situation

mimicry is an important interpersonal behavior for initiating and maintaining relationship by observing the same participant n 139 in multiple dyadic interaction 618 data point in a round robin design we disentangled the extent to which mimicry is due to a the mimicker s general tendency to mimic imitativity b the mimickee s general tendency to evoke mimicry imitatability and c the unique dyadic relationship between the mimicker and the mimickee we explored how these mimicry component affected liking and metaperceptions of liking i e metaliking employing social relation model we found substantial interindividual difference in imitativity which predicted popularity however we found only small interindividual difference in imitatability we found support for our proposition that mimicry is a substantially dyadic construct explained mostly by the unique relationship between two people finally we explored the link between dyadic mimicry and liking and we found that a person s initial liking of his or her interaction partner led to mimicry which in turn increased the partner s liking of the mimicker

background skin picking disorder spd is a new diagnosis with limited information available about trigger of picking episode itch can be induced via audio visual stimulus and the effect of contagious itch is stronger for those affected by atopic dermatitis we examined if picking related visual stimulus can trigger the urge to pick skin in self reported spd we compared itch and the urge to pick in a sample of ad and or spd affected to control without either method urge to pick skin and or scratch when viewing 24 itch related picking related or neutral online picture wa assessed in adult female who self report skin picking spd only n 147 and or atopic dermatitis ad only n 47 ad spd n 46 a well a in skin healthy control hc n 361 result all participant reported a stronger urge to pick for picking related picture compared to neutral content f 1 597 533 96 p 001 etap2 472 and more itch for itch related picture compared to neutral stimulus f 1 597 518 73 p 001 etap2 465 spd all spd only ad spd reported stronger urge to pick for picking related v other stimulus compared to the ad only and hc group p 001 etap2 047 likewise ad all ad only ad spd reported significantly stronger itching for itch related v other stimulus compared to spd only and hc p 001 etap2 019 conclusion analog to visual provocation of itch the urge to pick can be triggered by visual stimulus treatment for spd and ad may profit from addressing visual stimulus

psychologist with their expertise in statistic and regarding human perception and behavior can contribute valuable insight to the development of innovative and useful artificial intelligence ai system therefore we need to raise attention and curiosity for ai and foster the willingness to engage with it among psychology student this requires identifying approach to integrate a general understanding of ai technology into formal psychological training and education this study investigated to what extent psychology student currently accept and use ai and what affect their perception and usage therefore an ai acceptance model based on established technology acceptance model wa developed and tested in a sample of 218 psychology student an acceptable fit with the data wa found for an adapted version perceived usefulness and ease of use were most predictive for the student attitude towards ai attitude itself a well a perceived usefulness social norm and perceived knowledge were predictor for the intention to use ai in summary we identified relevant factor for designing ai training approach in psychology curriculum in this way possible restraint regarding the use of ai can be reduced and it beneficial opportunity exploited in psychological context

abstract although research examining the association between problematic smartphone use and mental health ha grown recently there is a lack of study investigating possible association with physical somatic symptom moreover many study are based on student sample from north america and china limiting their generalizability the current study aimed to examine problematic smartphone use in a broad sample of german adult an online survey comprising demographic question problematic smartphone use scale and somatic symptom inventory a well a depression anxiety stress and sleep quality scale wa completed by 930 participant problematic smartphone user reported longer usage per day more interruption to activity to check their smartphones and higher score for stress depression anxiety sleep disturbance and somatic symptom than did unproblematic user in comparison both group allocated similar proportion of time to various application the result showed small to moderate bivariate association between problematic smartphone use and indicator of mental health and somatic symptom while a multivariate analysis highlighted the importance of perceived stress since mental health and somatic symptom are associated with problematic smartphone use future study should investigate the causal direction of the association found

there is evidence that training addicted participant to implicitly avoid disorder related stimulus by using a training version of the approach avoidance task aat result in reduced substance consumption i e approach bias modification appbm the aim of the present web based study wa to investigate the feasibility and effectiveness of appbm in reducing gambling related symptom a self selected sample of participant with problem pathological slot machine gambling completed an online survey and received either appbm or sham training final n 131 attrition during study participation wa high 66 in both condition slot machine related and neutral picture were presented within the appbm condition all slot machine related picture had to be pushed and all neutral picture had to be pulled whereas in the sham condition the contingency wa 50 50 eight week after baseline participant were re assessed both group showed a similar reduction in gambling related symptom finding are at odds with the hypothesis claiming that only contingency training yield beneficial effect however it cannot be ruled out that effect result from other factor unrelated to training such a expectancy effect we think this study hold valuable information how to conduct larger trial in the future and may prove helpful to improve training and it delivery

background patient with depression tend to process negative information with regard to the self i e self referential processing a better understanding of the neural underpinnings of self referential processing in patient with depression is clinically important a it can inform on potential treatment target method this fmri study sought to study the neural correlate of self referential processing in patient with chronic major depressive disorder cmdd n 17 and non patient control n 18 using a passive processing paradigm stimulus consisted of positive negative negative depression related and neutral personality trait word or non word participant were instructed to indicate whether a presented word wa an existing word or a non word while undergoing an fmri scan participant also completed an explicit and an implicit measure of positive and negative self association outside the scanner result non patient control had relatively increased activity in the medial prefrontal cortex mpfc during processing of negative depression related v neutral word whereas patient with cmdd had relatively decreased activity non patient control had relatively increased dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc activity during processing of positive v neutral word whereas patient with cmdd had relatively decreased activity explicit but not implicit self association with depression related word were associated with neural activity in the mpfc and the dlpfc limitation the study did not include a clinical control group and therefore the specificity of finding remains unknown conclusion the distinct neural processing of emotional self relevant stimulus in the mpfc and the dlpfc in patient with cmdd might represent an emotional blunting response towards negative self relevant stimulus

twelve month suicidal ideation is about 10 11 5 in chinese university student medical student have lower depression symptom than student of other discipline medical student have higher positive mental health pmh than other student over 84 of student report complete mental health high pmh low psychopathology student worldwide are at marked risk of suicidal ideation behavior depression and low positive mental health pmh medical student are suspected to be a particularly burdened group on this background the aim of the present study wa to determine prevalence rate of suicidal ideation behavior depression and pmh among chinese medical student compared to student from other discipline a total of 2 695 chinese student 41 2 woman age m 18 86 sd 60 range 18 21 including 461 medical student filled out self report measure on suicidal ideation behavior depression and pmh twelve month suicidal ideation wa reported by 10 2 of the medical student and by 11 5 of the other student medical student had significantly lower level of depression symptom and significantly higher level of pmh than student from other discipline complete mental health according to the dual factor model of mental health wa reported by more than 84 of the total sample data were assessed by a self report survey that is prone to social desirability student in the present study displayed high rate of complete mental health although the survey wa conducted in the midst of the corona pandemic no evidence wa found that medical student are particularly stressed

background mobile health apps mha have the potential to improve health care the commercial mha market is rapidly growing but the content and quality of available mha are unknown instrument for the assessment of the quality and content of mha are highly needed the mobile application rating scale mar is one of the most widely used tool to evaluate the quality of mha only few validation study investigated it metric quality no study ha evaluated the construct validity and concurrent validity objective this study evaluates the construct validity concurrent validity reliability and objectivity of the mar method data wa pooled from 15 international app quality review to evaluate the metric property of the mar the mar measure app quality across four dimension engagement functionality aesthetic and information quality construct validity wa evaluated by assessing related competing confirmatory model by confirmatory factor analysis cfa non centrality rmsea incremental cfi tli and residual srmr fit index were used to evaluate the goodness of fit a a measure of concurrent validity the correlation to another quality assessment tool enlight were investigated reliability wa determined using omega objectivity wa assessed by intra class correlation result in total mar rating from 1 299 mha covering 15 different health domain were included confirmatory factor analysis confirmed a bifactor model with a general factor and a factor for each dimension rmsea 0 074 tli 0 922 cfi 0 940 srmr 0 059 reliability wa good to excellent omega 0 79 to 0 93 objectivity wa high icc 0 82 mar correlated with enlight p 05 conclusion the metric evaluation of the mar demonstrated it suitability for the quality assessment a such the mar could be used to make the quality of mha transparent to health care stakeholder and patient future study could extend the present finding by investigating the re test reliability and predictive validity of the mar

background and objective due to the corona pandemic psychotherapist are confronted with new professional challenge regarding the patient care to be provided the question of risk and protective factor for maintaining well being during the pandemic appears relevant to prevent negative long term consequence such a burnout this is the first study investigating the influence of coping and self care strategy on the psychological distress of psychotherapist in germany during the corona pandemic method from april to june 2020 155 psychotherapist completed an online questionnaire additionally to job related change stress level symptom of burnout and well being were assessed furthermore the influence of active and passive coping strategy a well a of different area of self care e g professional support cognitive awareness for work related stress and work life balance on psychological burden wa examined result psychotherapist worked an average of 1 22 hour le per week during the pandemic than before on average 38 of treatment were delivered via video therapy avoidant coping strategy were associated with increased stress level which predicted higher burnout score and lower well being in contrast a good work life balance a good daily balance at work and active coping had a positive effect contrary to expectation cognitive awareness for work related stress wa related to lower well being discussion work life balance can serve a a preventive strategy to reduce stress during the corona pandemic and thereby reduce the risk for burnout and improve well being avoidant coping strategy on the other hand are a risk factor for increased stress level during pandemic and promote burnout and lower well being conclusion this study contributes to our knowledge regarding preventive measure to prevent stress and to maintain the well being of psychotherapist in order to contribute to ongoing high quality patient care during the pandemic

positive mental health pmh defined a the presence of general emotional psychological and social well being is an important factor of general mental health to allow for valid comparison of pmh across different group of interest measurement invariant instrument are needed the present study tested the measurement invariance of the nine item positive mental health scale pmh scale across eight country i e france germany poland russia spain sweden the united kingdom and the united state a well a across gender and age group population based online panel survey were conducted n per country 1 000 the pmh scale showed good to excellent internal consistency a well a unidimensionality in all subsamples convergent validity wa supported by positive correlation with the perceived social support questionnaire f sozu k 6 discriminant validity wa shown be negative correlation with the subscales of the depression anxiety stress scale 21 das 21 the pmh scale showed scalar measurement invariance across country gender and age group comparison of latent mean showed small to medium group difference with highest level of pmh found in the french and u american sample a well in participant between 45 and 54 year of age lowest level of pmh were found in russian participant gender difference in pmh were negligible the pmh scale can be used to meaningfully compare the level of pmh across the eight investigated country woman and men a well a younger and older individual psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

a new algorithmic approach to personality prototyping based on big five trait wa applied to a large representative and longitudinal german dataset n 22 820 including behavior personality and health correlate we applied three different clustering technique latent profile analysis the k mean method and spectral clustering algorithm the resulting cluster center i e the personality prototype were evaluated using a large number of internal and external validity criterion including health locus of control self esteem impulsivity risk taking and wellbeing the best fitting prototypical personality profile were labeled according to their euclidean distance to averaged personality type profile identified in a review of previous study on personality type this procedure yielded a five cluster solution resilient overcontroller undercontroller reserved and vulnerable resilient reliability and construct validity could be confirmed we discus wether personality type could comprise a bridge between personality and clinical psychology a well a between developmental psychology and resilience research

prevalence rate for mental health problem are higher when an individual s socioeconomic status s is low but the underlying mechanism are not clearly understood we investigated association between education a indicator for s and depressive symptom a well a positive mental health pmh moreover we hypothesized that low education is associated with a lack of psychosocial resource and more daily hassle which in turn mediate the relationship between education and mental health in a german representative sample n 7937 we cross sectionally first examined whether a person s educational level wa associated with depressive symptom and pmh educational level wa defined a the highest academic qualification achieved second we investigated whether also sense of control resilience delay of gratification cultural activity and daily hassle followed gradient along the educational level third we investigated whether they mediated the relationship between education and mental health result showed that depressive symptom measured by item from the das 42 depression subscale were more prevalent for person with a low educational level pmh operationalized by the positive mental health scale wa equally distributed and all psychosocial characteristic followed the gradient of educational level in addition the group with a high school diploma wa particularly burdened structural equation modeling indicated that the association between education and mental health were mediated by all psychosocial characteristic and daily hassle apart from the delay of gratification in the group with the lowest educational level the model fit index for depressive symptom and pmh were acceptable chi2 10007 243 627 cfi 0 869 rmsea 0 04 90 ci 0 04 0 04 srmr 0 05 and chi2 12779 968 741 cfi 0 86 rmsea 0 05 90 ci 0 05 0 05 srmr 0 05 respectively the effect size p m refers to the proportion of the total effect that is mediated by one or more variable m and the effect size of all indirect effect in the model for depressive symptom wa p m 80 and for pmh it wa p m 68 the result support our hypothesis that low education is associated with le psychosocial resource which in turn serve together with daily hassle a pathway between education and depressive symptom a well a pmh building on these finding longitudinal study are necessary to investigate causality

successful avoidance of a threatening event may negatively reinforce the behavior due to activation of brain structure involved in reward processing here we further investigated the learning related property of avoidance using feedback related negativity frn the frn is modulated by violation of an intended outcome prediction error pe that is the bigger the difference between intended and actual outcome the larger the frn amplitude is twenty eight participant underwent an operant conditioning paradigm in which a behavior button press allowed them to avoid a painful electric shock during two learning block participant could avoid an electric shock in 80 of the trial by pressing one button avoidance button or by not pressing another button punishment button after learning participant underwent two test block which were identical to the learning one except that no shock were delivered participant pressed the avoidance button more often than the punishment button importantly response frequency increased throughout the learning block but it did not decrease during the test block indicating impaired extinction and or habit formation in line with a pe account frn amplitude to negative feedback after correct response i e unexpected punishment wa significantly larger than to positive feedback i e expected omission of punishment and it increased throughout the block highly anxious individual showed equal frn amplitude to negative and positive feedback suggesting impaired discrimination these result confirm the role of negative reinforcement in motivating behavior and learning and reveal important difference between high and low anxious individual in the processing of prediction error

a number of previous study ha shown that oxytocin ot promotes facial emotion recognition and enhances eye gaze to facial stimulus in human other study report valence specific effect of ot supporting the proposed prosocial role of ot in social interaction in the present study we tested the hypothesis whether ot might selectively enhance eye gaze to positive approach related but not to negative threat related social cue in a placebo controlled double blind between subject design we assessed the effect of intranasal ot administration 24 iu in 62 healthy male volunteer on eye gaze toward the eye of neutral positive happy and negative angry facial expression compared with placebo in order to capture the dynamic of facial expression we used video sequence showing neutral face gradually displaying a specific emotion in line with previous study ot increased eye gaze toward neutral facial expression moreover under ot treatment eye gaze remained increased when the face showed a happy facial expression but in contrast decreased when the face displayed an angry expression these result support the notion that ot differentially modulates visual attention toward social signal of positive approach and threat and thereby contributes to the modulation of non verbal interpersonal communication

in the course of elementary school child start to develop an academic self concept reflecting their motivation thought and feeling about a specific domain for the domain of mathematics gender difference can emerge which are characterized by a le pronounced math self concept for girl however study are rather sparse regarding the early year of elementary school education hence the point in time when such gender difference emerge yet remains a matter of debate in our study we found that the math self concept of elementary school child n 81 declined from first to second grade while no difference in math achievement were observed between girl and boy it became apparent that girl math self concept wa already le pronounced than the math self concept of boy in the first year of elementary school our finding emphasize the importance of considering such gender difference even at the beginning of school education

individual with anxiety disorder typically avoid fear relevant stimulus even if they miss potential reward however few study have accounted for such cost of fear related avoidance in doing so in this study 51 spider fearful and 49 non fearful participant completed the spider gambling task our modification of the iowa gambling task to investigate whether fear relevant stimulus trigger avoidant decision in the presence of potential reward in one version advantageous choice were associated with picture of spider whereas the same picture were associated with disadvantageous choice in another version fearful participant generally avoided choice associated with picture of spider which resulted in lower overall gain in the version with advantageous spider deck although this relative avoidance wa sustained fearful participant progressively approach more advantageous spider choice these finding demonstrate that phobic fear result in irrational avoidant decision which can result in considerable cost potential long term reward for approach may however diminish absolute avoidance behavior

once reactivated previously consolidated memory destabilize and have to be reconsolidated to persist a process that might be altered non invasively by interfering learning immediately after reactivation here we investigated the influence of interference on brain correlate of reactivated episodic memory for emotional and neutral scene using event related potential erps to selectively target emotional memory we applied a new reactivation method rapid serial visual presentation rsvp rsvp lead to enhanced implicit processing pop out of the most salient memory making them vulnerable to disruption in line interference after reactivation of previously encoded picture disrupted recollection particularly for emotional event furthermore memory impairment were reflected in a reduced centro parietal erp old new difference during retrieval of emotional picture these result provide neural evidence that emotional episodic memory in human can be selectively altered through behavioral interference after reactivation a finding with further clinical implication for the treatment of anxiety disorder

purpose adhd is regarded a a neurodevelopmental disorder associated with deficit in executive function ef the presence of these deficit is associated with increased symptom severity however so far there is little knowledge whether deficit in efs relate to a reduced health related quality of life hrqol in child with adhd method hence n 100 child with a confirmed adhd diagnosis were compared with a non case group n 100 with regard to their hrqol 6 12 year old the clinical group wa divided into adhd specific drug treatment intake drug treatment n 42 no drug treatment n 58 or deficit in ef n 29 no deficit in ef n 71 result child with adhd without medication reported a significantly worse hrqol than healthy child d 72 when controlled for age and sex even if they were treated with drug treatment they reported a lower hrqol than the non case group in the area family d 53 drug treatment of adhd lead to a significant difference in hrqol in school area d 39 child with adhd and ef problem reported impairment in the social context of hrqol compared to healthy child d 51 to 70 in addition a significant negative association between set shifting and hrqol in child with adhd without drug treatment wa demonstrated r 27 to r 35 conclusion by assessing the hrqol an impairment in the functioning of child with adhd can be detected which is essential for the diagnosis furthermore executive problem have an influence on the social sphere which should be clarified and improved in therapy with the involvement of parent

background hyperconsolidation of aversive association and poor extinction learning have been hypothesized to be crucial in the acquisition of pathological fear previous animal and human research point to the potential role of the catecholaminergic system particularly noradrenaline and dopamine in acquiring emotional memory here we investigated in a between participant design with 3 group whether the noradrenergic alpha 2 adrenoreceptor antagonist yohimbine and the dopaminergic d2 receptor antagonist sulpiride modulate long term fear conditioning and extinction in human method fifty five healthy male student were recruited the final sample consisted of n 51 participant who were explicitly aware of the contingency between conditioned stimulus c and unconditioned stimulus after fear acquisition the participant were then randomly assigned to 1 of the 3 group and received either yohimbine 10 mg n 17 sulpiride 200 mg n 16 or placebo n 18 between fear acquisition and extinction recall of conditioned non extinguished c v c and extinguished fear extinguished c v c wa assessed 1 day later and a 64 channel electroencephalogram wa recorded result the yohimbine group showed increased salivary alpha amylase activity confirming a successful manipulation of central noradrenergic release elevated fear conditioned bradycardia and larger differential amplitude of the n170 and late positive potential component in the event related brain potential indicated that yohimbine treatment compared with a placebo and sulpiride enhanced fear recall during day 2 conclusion these result suggest that yohimbine potentiates cardiac and central electrophysiological signature of fear memory consolidation they thereby elucidate the key role of noradrenaline in strengthening the consolidation of conditioned fear association which may be a key mechanism in the etiology of fear related disorder

sharing imaging data and comparing them across different psychological task is becoming increasingly possible a the open science movement advance such cross paradigm integration ha the potential to identify commonality in finding that neighboring area of study thought to be paradigm specific however even the integration of research from closely related paradigm such a aversive and appetitive classical conditioning is rare even though qualitative comparison already hint at how similar the fear network and reward network may be we aimed to validate these theory by taking a multivariate approach to ass commonality across paradigm empirically specifically we quantified the similarity of an aversive conditioning pattern derived from meta analysis to appetitive conditioning fmri data we tested pattern expression in three independent appetitive conditioning study with 29 76 and 38 participant each during fmri scanning participant in each cohort performed an appetitive conditioning task in which a c wa repeatedly rewarded with money and a c wa never rewarded the aversive pattern wa highly similar to appetitive c c contrast map across sample and variation of the appetitive conditioning paradigm moreover the pattern distinguished the c from the c with above chance accuracy in every sample these finding provide robust empirical evidence for an underlying neural system common to appetitive and aversive learning we believe that this approach provides a way to empirically integrate the steadily growing body of fmri finding across paradigm

background prolonged grief disorder pgd is a distinct syndrome that follows bereavement it is different from other mental disorder and is characterized by symptom such a yearning for the bereaved or intense emotional pain or distress violent loss is one major risk factor for the development of pgd objective pgd ha been studied in different population mostly in small sample with only a few of them being representative although research highlighted that traumatic experience paired with challenge related to migration make refugee particularly vulnerable to pgd pgd ha only rarely been studied in refugee thus this article a examines the prevalence of pgd in female refugee in germany according to the criterion proposed by prigerson and colleague in 2009 and b associate pgd with other common psychopathology e g anxiety depression somatization and trauma method a total of 106 female refugee were assessed for bereavement and pgd of these 106 individual 85 were interviewed using the prolonged grief disorder scale pg 13 symptom of anxiety and depression were assessed by the hopkins symptom checklist 25 hscl 25 somatization wa assessed by the somatization subscale of the symptom checklist 90 scl 90 and the number of witnessed and experienced trauma wa assessed by the posttraumatic diagnostic scale pd htq result ninety of the 106 participant had experienced bereavement and among those 9 41 met criterion for pgd the most frequent pgd symptom were bitterness longing or yearning for the bereaved and lack of acceptance of the loss furthermore grief symptom were significantly associated with symptom of depression anxiety somatization and the number of experienced traumatic event conclusion the pgd prevalence rate found corresponds with previous study demonstrating that prevalence rate for pgd are especially high in refugee high prevalence rate of bereavement a well a pgd highlight the need for assessment and specifically tailored treatment of pgd in refugee pgd go along with significant psychopathology which further emphasizes the need for treatment

error processing is increasingly examined using the error related negativity ern and error positivity pe event related potential erps that demonstrate trait like property and excellent reliability the current study focus on construct validity by applying a multitrait multimethod approach treating error related erps i e ern pe and the difference between error minus correct referred to a δern and δpe respectively a trait measured across multiple task i e flanker stroop and go nogo result suggest convergent validity of these erps ranging between 62 and 64 for δern value were somewhat smaller for ern range 33 43 pe range 37 49 and δpe range 30 37 further the correlation for ern and pe are higher within component across task than between different component suggesting discriminant validity in conclusion the present study revealed evidence for convergent and discriminant validity of error related erps further supporting the use of these component a psychophysiological trait marker

forced migration is one of the major challenge currently facing the international community many refugee have been affected by traumatic experience at home and during their flight putting them at a heightened risk of developing trauma related disorder the new version of the international classification of disease icd 11 introduced two sibling disorder posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd and complex ptsd cptsd so far little is known about risk and protective factor in refugee that are specifically associated with the disturbance in self organization dso characteristic of cptsd in this study we aimed to investigate the association between ptsd and dso symptom and traumatic experience postmigration difficulty and social support in a culturally diverse sample of refugee who resettled in switzerland a total of 94 refugee 85 1 male m age 31 60 year sd 10 14 range 18 61 year participated in this study trained assessor performed either guided questionnaire assessment or structured interview in our advice and help seeking sample 32 9 of individual suffered from ptsd and 21 3 from cptsd after controlling for potential gender difference we found positive association between ptsd symptom and trauma exposure beta 22 a well a between dso symptom and postmigration living difficulty beta 42 and lack of social support beta 22 our finding support the notion that it is highly important to consider differential association among ptsd and dso symptom and risk and protective factor to gain a deeper understanding of the trauma related problem refugee face

the present investigation is the first to analyse change in implicit and explicit self esteem following cognitive therapy ct and psychodynamic therapy pdt in social anxiety disorder sad we assessed a sub sample of patient with sad n 27 per treatment group n 12 waitlist condition in the course of a randomized controlled trial prior to and following individual treatment or wait assessment with an implicit association test and the rosenberg self esteem scale both ct and pdt consisted of 25 session treatment were effective in enhancing implicit and explicit self esteem in ct and pdt change in explicit self esteem were associated with sad symptom change no such relationship were found in implicit self esteem the result seem to indicate that both ct and pdt are effective in establishing a positive implicit and explicit self esteem in sad the differential relationship of change in implicit and explicit self esteem to treatment effect on social phobic symptom are discussed

background and objective cognitive model of obsessive compulsive disorder ocd highlight the role of cognitive bias for the development of the disorder one of these bias an inflated sense of responsibility ha been associated with higher anger score and latent aggression on self report scale especially in patient with compulsive checking validity of self report assessment is however compromised by inaccuracy social desirability and low metacognitive awareness of trait and behavior in patient the aim of the present study wa to extend the research on latent aggression in individual with ocd by using an indirect implicit measure of aggression method fifty eight patient with ocd and 25 healthy control were assessed with an aggressiveness implicit association test iat which is a reaction time task that ass the strength of association between the concept of aggressiveness and me compared to others result contrary to our expectation ocd patient with checking symptom showed a more peaceful implicit self concept than healthy control this result wa corroborated by negative correlation between checking symptom and implicit aggressiveness in the ocd sample limitation no self report measure on aggression or anger were included in the study conclusion in comparison to previous research using self report measure our study indicates that implicit aspect of aggression do indeed differ from controlled aspect in patient with checking compulsion future research is necessary to better understand the role of aggressiveness in ocd and to derive implication for therapy

background study in immigrant youth have suggested difference in parenting pattern by immigration status knowledge of variation in recalled parenting pattern and it distinctive impact on mental health in adult immigrant however is limited therefore the purpose of the current study wa to investigate similarity and difference in recalled maternal and paternal rearing behavior and it association with depressiveness in adult 1st generation immigrant compared to non immigrant method seven hundred and forty three 1st generation immigrant m 57 4 sd 10 1 year and 6518 non immigrant m 60 3 sd 10 7 year participated in a population based study regarding country of origin the largest subgroup were immigrant from eastern europe former su and arabic islamic country all participant completed the ultra short version of the recalled parental rearing behavior questionnaire and the phq 9 assessing depressiveness multiple linear regression with depressiveness a outcome variable were analyzed separately for each facet of parental rearing behavior adjusting for socio demographic and migration related variable result in addition to difference in depressiveness and socioeconomic status 1st generation immigrant recalled both their mother and father a more controlling and overprotecting than non immigrant parental emotional warmth wa negatively associated with depressiveness across all group the relationship between parental control respectively parental rejection and depressiveness however varied in direction and severity between the group conclusion the result support the notion that parental warmth is a universal protective factor against depressiveness whereas the impact of parental control on mental health might be more culturally influenced analysis point to the importance of considering the unique contribution of father rearing behavior on mental health particularly in immigrant sample

for adult loyalty to the group is highly valued yet little is known about how child evaluate loyalty we investigated child s attitude about loyalty in a third party context in the first experiment 4 and 5 year old watched a video of two group competing two member of the losing group then spoke the disloyal individual said she wanted to win and therefore would join the other group the loyal individual said she also wanted to win but would stay with her group child were then asked five forced choice question about these two individual niceness trustworthiness morality and deservingness of a reward the 5 year old preferred the loyal person across all question result for the 4 year old were considerably weaker but in the same direction the second experiment investigated the direction of the effect in 5 year old in this experiment child answered question about either a loyal individual a disloyal individual or a neutral individual child rated both the loyal and neutral individual more positively than the disloyal individual across a number of measure thus whereas disloyal behavior is evaluated unfavorably by child loyal behavior is the expected norm these result suggest that at least from 5 year of age child understand that belonging to a group entail certain commitment this mark an important step in their own ability to negotiate belonging and become trustworthy and reliable member of their social group

this study investigated the link between experience of daily stress depression symptom and the facebook addiction disorder fad in germany and in the united state in sample from both country german sample n 531 u s sample n 909 daily stress wa positively associated with fad depression symptom significantly positively moderated this positive relationship thus current finding demonstrate that depressed individual who often tend to intensively use facebook to escape from daily stress and to find relief and social support are at enhanced risk to develop fad which reinforces their negative symptom therefore intervention for depressed individual should include alternative strategy to cope with daily stressor

the present study examines the interplay between cognitive deficit and emotional context in obsessive compulsive disorder ocd and social phobia sp specifically this study examines whether the inflexible use of efficient learning strategy in an emotional context underlies impairment in probabilistic classification learning pcl in ocd and whether pcl impairment are specific to ocd twenty three participant with ocd 30 participant with sp and 30 healthy control completed a neutral and an ocd specific pcl task ocd participant failed to adopt efficient learning strategy and showed fewer beneficial strategy switch than control only in an ocd specific context but not in a neutral context additionally ocd participant did not show any explicit memory impairment number of beneficial strategy switch in the ocd specific task mediated the difference in pcl performance between ocd and control participant individual with sp were impaired in both pcl task in contrast to neuropsychological model postulating general cognitive impairment in ocd the present finding suggest that it is the interaction between cognition and emotion that is impaired in ocd specifically activated disorder specific fear may impair the flexible adoption of efficient learning strategy and compromise otherwise unimpaired pcl impairment in pcl are not specific to ocd

decoding someone s facial expression provides insight into his or her emotional experience recently automatic facial coding afc software ha been developed to provide measurement of emotional facial expression previous study provided first evidence for the sensitivity of such system to detect facial response in study participant in the present experiment we set out to generalise these result to affective response a they can occur in variable social interaction thus we presented facial expression happy neutral angry and instructed participant n 64 to either actively mimic to look at them passively n 21 or to inhibit their own facial reaction n 22 a video stream for afc and an electromyogram emg of the zygomaticus and corrugator muscle were registered continuously in the mimicking condition both afc and emg differentiated well between facial expression in response to the different emotional picture in the passive viewing and in the inhibition condition afc did not detect change in facial expression whereas emg wa still highly sensitive although only emg is sensitive when participant intend to conceal their facial reaction these data extend previous finding that automatic facial coding is a promising tool for the detection of intense facial reaction

background and objective interpretation bias are hypothesized to maintain body dysmorphic disorder bdd although their existence and malleability have been investigated in clinical study their causal status in the maintenance of bdd remains unclear this study examined the effect of a single session appearance related interpretation bias training cbm i on bias index and stress reactivity i e distress appearance dissatisfaction self esteem perceived physical attractiveness exploring the causality predicted in cognitive behavioral model method we used a modified version of the word sentence association paradigm wsap assessing explicit i e decision rate and more implicit interpretation bias component i e reaction time mentally healthy student n 112 were randomized to training condition enhancing positive interpretation pattern pt v negative interpretation pattern nt v a no feedback control condition cc stress reactivity wa assessed during the cyberball paradigm result the pt showed a pre post increase in adaptive bias pattern regarding decision and a differential pre post decrease in reaction time for the rejection of negative interpretation compared to the other group there were no condition congruent post training difference in stress reactivity however residual interpretation bias change wa significantly correlated with state distress self esteem and appearance dissatisfaction during stressor exposure limitation limitation pertaining to sample characteristic training and assessment overlap and stressor task design are discussed conclusion finding suggest that appearance related interpretation bias is modifiable both explicitly and more implicitly via cbm i in a mentally healthy sample the causal status of interpretation bias in bdd maintenance warrant further investigation

background enhanced self focused attention play a central role in the maintenance and treatment of social anxiety and is targeted in contemporary cognitive behavioral therapy actual development use virtual reality vr for behavioral training however no vr attention training combining exposure to public speaking with shifting attention from self focus to external focus ha been investigated and no experimental evidence exists on different kind of external cue a target of attention therefore we investigated the effect of an attention training during public speaking in vr and examined differential effect of an external focus on nonsocial v social stimulus method in this randomized controlled study highly socially anxious participant were instructed to focus on either object or the audience within a virtual speech task we assessed the pre post effect on affective reaction self perception and attentional process during public speaking a well a general social anxiety using subjective physiological and eye tracking measure repeated measure analysis of variance anova were calculated to detect change from pretest to posttest over both group and time x group interaction effect result within the analysis sample n 41 anxiety during public speaking and fear of negative evaluation significantly decreased with no significant difference between group no significant time effect but a significant time x group effect wa found for the looking time proportion on the audience member head follow up test confirmed a significant increase in the social focus group and a significant decrease in the nonsocial focus group for all other variable except external focus and fear of public speaking significant improvement were found over both group further significant time x group effect were found for positive affect during public speaking with a significant increase in the social focus and no significant change in the nonsocial focus group conclusion our finding suggest that attention training to reduce self focus can be successfully conducted in vr both training version showed positive short term effect in the highly socially anxious with particular advantage of an external social focus concerning eye contact to the audience and positive affect further research should investigate whether social focus is even more advantageous long term and if reinterpretation of dysfunctional belief could be achieved by not avoiding social cue

background while most clinical aggression questionnaire focus on the assessment of active aggression the recently developed test of passive aggression tpa ass both self directed tpa sd and other directed passive aggression tpa od reliability and factorial validity of the tpa have been demonstrated in a clinical sample while previous evaluation of convergent and discriminant validity were limited to student sample the current study aimed at addressing this gap by demonstrating convergent and discriminant validity of the tpa in an outpatient sample method eighty two patient admitted to an outpatient psychotherapy unit at saarland university germany participated in the preregistered study with an assessment of self reported passive aggression impulsivity anger expression self compassion self esteem and auto aggressive mindset analysis used regression model with robust maximum likelihood estimation result self directed passive aggression showed a significant association with self compassion auto aggressive mindset self esteem and internal anger expression supporting the convergent validity of tpa sd result on discriminant validity of tpa sd were heterogenous at the first sight revealing small association of self directed passive aggression with anger control but medium association with impulsivity however exploratory analysis showed that the medium association with impulsivity wa driven by the non behavioral impulsivity dimension inattention and that both behavioral impulsivity dimension motor impulsivity and unplanned behavior demonstrated only weak association with tpa sd validity of tpa od wa not supported by the current study conclusion our finding provide evidence for the validity of the tpa sd to outpatient sample future study will need to analyze construct validity based on a nomological network using larger and more diverse sample

background and object several study have shown that physical exercise such a walking ha effect on depression these study have focused on increasing intensity and amount of physical activity in the present study we investigated whether not only the intensity but also the style of physical activity affect depression related process method using an unobtrusive biofeedback technique we manipulated participant 39 undergraduate to change their walking pattern to either reflect the characteristic of depressed patient or a particularly happy walking style the intensity of walking i e walking speed wa held constant across condition during walking participant first encoded and later recalled a series of emotionally loaded term result the difference between recalled positive and recalled negative word wa much lower in participant who adopted a depressed walking style a compared to participant who walked a if they were happy limitation the effect of gait manipulation were investigated in a non clinical group of undergraduate conclusion the observed change in memory bias support the idea that beyond the intensity of walking the style of walking ha effect on the vulnerability to depression

background communicating a diagnosis is highly important yet complex especially in the context of cancer and mental disorder the aim wa to explore the communication style of an oncologist v psychotherapist in an online study method patient n 136 65 cancer 71 depression were randomly assigned to watch a standardized video vignette with one of two communication style empathic v unempathic outcome measure of affectivity information recall communication skill empathy and trust were applied result regardless of diagnosis empathic communication wa associated with the perception of a significantly more empathic p 0 001 etapartial2 0 08 and trustworthy practitioner p 0 014 etapartial2 0 04 with better communication skill p 0 013 etapartial2 0 05 cancer patient reported a larger decrease in positive affect p 0 001 etapartial2 0 15 and a larger increase in negative affect p 0 001 etapartial2 0 14 from pre to post video than depressive patient highly relevant information wa recalled better in both group p 0 001 d 0 61 1 06 conclusion the result highlight the importance of empathy while communicating both a diagnosis of cancer and a mental disorder further research should focus on the communication of a mental disorder in association with cancer

the interpersonal theory of suicidal behavior proposes that fearlessness of death and physical pain insensitivity is a necessary requisite for self inflicted lethal self harm repeated experience with painful and provocative event are supposed to cause an incremental increase in acquired capability the present study examined whether playing a first person shooter game in contrast to a first person racing game increase pain tolerance a dimension of the acquired capability construct and risk taking behavior a risk factor for developing acquired capability n 81 male participant were randomly assigned to either play an action shooter or a racing game before engaging in a game on risk taking behavior and performing a cold pressor task cpt participant exhibited higher pain tolerance after playing an action shooter game than after playing a racing game furthermore playing an action shooter wa generally associated with heightened risk taking behavior group difference were not attributable to the effect of the different type of game on self reported mood and arousal overall these result indicate that action shooter gaming alters pain tolerance and risk taking behavior therefore it may well be that long term consumption of violent video game increase a person s capability to enact lethal self harm

background although research suggests that social rejection expectation play a crucial role in the development and maintenance of depressive symptom it is not clear whether such expectation are a risk factor for depression or rather a consequence thereof the present study addressed this issue by investigating the time lagged bi directional effect of social rejection expectation and depressive symptom method in an online survey participant n 347 completed measure of social rejection expectation depressive symptom interpersonal competency and perceived social support at baseline and 2 month later the relationship between the variable were examined using path model and cross lagged path analysis result cross lagged path analysis provided evidence for a substantial positive effect of social rejection expectation at baseline on depressive symptom at follow up in addition to the reverse effect a mediator analysis indicated that neither interpersonal competency nor perceived social support mediated these bi directional effect conclusion the current result demonstrate that social rejection expectation and depressive symptom bi directionally predict each other thus social rejection expectation appears to be both a risk factor for and a symptom of depression in order to prevent a vicious circle of social rejection expectation and depressive symptom we recommend the early detection and treatment of social rejection expectation moreover social rejection expectation should be specifically addressed in cognitive behavioural treatment of depression

background interoceptive deficit have been found to be associated with suicidal ideation and behavior however an objective measure of interoceptive accuracy ha not been investigated in participant with suicide ideation by now this study aimed at investigating interoceptive accuracy and sensibility in person with and without suicide ideation si while controlling for severity of depressive symptom method ninety five participant age m 34 8 sd 11 6 n 56 female 58 9 n 51 patient with a major depressive disorder and n 44 healthy participant were assessed for interoceptive accuracy and sensibility depression and si result twenty five participant 26 reported si they showed interoceptive accuracy comparable to person without si t 81 p 422 but significantly lower interoceptive sensibility after controlling for severity of depressive symptom in a hierarchical linear regression analysis most association between interoceptive sensibility and si disappeared conclusion result suggest that suicide ideators do not lack the ability to perceive their own bodily signal but they feel le able to use them in a way that is advantageous for them difference between suicide ideators and non ideators appear to be largely driven by depressive symptom depression bias

in the current study we assessed character strength in individual with autism spectrum disorder asd n 32 and neurotypical control n 32 using the value in action inventory via is peterson and seligman 2004 and explored association with level of satisfaction with life swl the most frequently endorsed signature strength i e five top ranked strength within an individual s strength ranking were emotional humour love and interpersonal strength kindness fairness in the control group the most frequently endorsed signature strength in the asd group were intellectual strength open mindedness creativity love of learning interpersonal and emotional strength had however the highest positive association with swl in the asd group

the child s sleep comic is a standardized self report questionnaire for assessing insomnia in child age 5 11 year the goal of the present study is to introduce a revised version of this measure and to present psychometrics and a cut off score therefore the revised child s sleep comic the sleep self report the child s sleep habit questionnaire and the child behavior checklist were applied to a sample of 393 child and their parent of the parent who participated voluntarily a subsample n 176 wa interviewed on the phone to diagnose their child with sleep disorder according to the international classification of sleep disorder if applicable the result indicated that the child s sleep comic is a reliable self rating instrument for diagnosing childhood insomnia internal consistency wa alpha 0 83 and convergent and divergent validity were adequate the child friendly format can foster a good therapeutic relationship and thus establish the basis for successful intervention

while prior work ha demonstrated that fear conditioning change the neural representation of previously neutral stimulus it remains unknown to what extent this new representation abstract away from specific fear and which brain area are involved therein to investigate this question we sought commonality between experimentally induced fear via electric shock and pre existing phobia using functional mri we tested the effect of fear conditioning picture of dog in 21 spider fearful participant across three phase baseline post conditioning and extinction considering phobic stimulus a a reference point for the state of fear allowed u to examine whether fear conditioning render information pattern of previously neutral stimulus more similar to those of phobic stimulus we trained a classification algorithm to discriminate information pattern of neutral stimulus rat and phobic stimulus and then tested the algorithm on information pattern from the conditioned stimulus dog performing this cross decoding analysis at each experimental phase revealed brain region in which dog were classified a rat during baseline a spider following conditioning and again a rat after extinction a follow up analysis showed that change in visual perception information cannot explain the changing classification performance these result demonstrate a common neural representation for processing fear eliciting information either pre existing or acquired by classical conditioning

background aim we investigated the link between maternal bonding maternal anxiety disorder and infant self comforting behavior furthermore we looked at the moderating role of infant gender and age method our sample n 69 comprised 28 mother with an anxiety disorder according to dsm iv criterion and 41 control each with their 2 5 to 8 month old infant 41 female and 28 male infant behavior were recorded during the face to face still face paradigm maternal bonding wa assessed by the postpartum bonding questionnaire result conditional process analysis revealed that lower maternal bonding partially mediated between maternal anxiety disorder and increased self comforting behavior but only in older female infant over 5 5 month of age however considering maternal anxiety disorder without the influence of bonding older female infant over 5 5 month of age showed decreased rate of self comforting behavior while younger male infant under 3 month of age showed increased rate in the case of maternal anxiety disorder conclusion the result suggest that older female infant over 5 5 month of age are more sensitive to lower maternal bonding in the context of maternal anxiety disorder furthermore result suggest a different use of self directed regulation strategy for male and female infant of mother with anxiety disorder and low bonding depending on infant age the result are discussed in the light of gender specific developmental trajectory

the present experimental study compared the impact of a total abstinence from smartphone use and of a reduction of daily smartphone use by 1 hr on well being and healthy lifestyle participant n total 619 were smartphone user in germany the first experimental group n 200 waived smartphone use for 7 day the second experimental group n 226 reduced it daily use by 1 hr and the control group n 193 used smartphone a usual variable of smartphone use time intensity problematic tendency life satisfaction depressive symptom anxiety symptom physical activity and smoking behavior were assessed via online survey at four measurement time point baseline postintervention 1 and 4 month after postintervention both intervention reduced smartphone use intensity problematic use tendency depressive and anxiety symptom in both group life satisfaction and physical activity increased most effect were stronger and remained more stable over 4 month in the reduction group than in the abstinence group moreover in the reduction group only the number of daily smoked cigarette decreased thus le time spent on the smartphone lead to more well being and a healthier lifestyle a complete smartphone abstinence is not necessary program that focus on the increase of well being and a healthier lifestyle could benefit from the integration of controlled reduction of smartphone use a potential sweet spot of smartphone use is discussed psycinfo database record c 2023 apa all right reserved

suppressing unwanted memory can impair their later recall recent work show that this forgetting is achieved by at least two mechanism supported by distinct neural system thought substitution and direct suppression benoit anderson 2012 here we examined whether direct suppression thought to be achieved by down regulation of hippocampal activity can disrupt memory of aversive scene and if so whether this disruption is linked to people s perception of their ability to control intrusive thought we presented participant with strong naturalistic reminder to aversive scene and asked them to either covertly retrieve or directly suppress the associated scene later participant were cued with the reminder and asked to recall the scene in detail direct suppression reduced recall probability of the scene and also reduced the number of detail recalled even when scene were remembered deficit in recall arose for minor detail but also for detail central to each scene s gist participant with higher self perceived control ability over intrusive thought showed greater forgetting than did those reporting lower level of control these finding suggest that inhibitory process underlying direct suppression can disrupt retention of aversive visual memory and link those process to individual difference in control over intrusive thought in everyday life these finding reinforce the possibility that inhibition may be le efficient in people likely to acquire posttraumatic stress disorder in the wake of a traumatic experience

high ambivalence over the expression of emotion aee ha consistently been associated with high level of depression in previous research however there is a lack of study examining this construct and it association in a clinical sample of patient with major depressive disorder mdd therefore the present study compared 76 mdd with 77 non depressed control nc regarding aee a expected mdd reported greater aee a compared to nd furthermore level of aee and level of depression were positively correlated in the mdd group these finding extend previous work and underline the importance of aee a a central construct in depression targeting aee in treatment of depression may help to modify maladaptive interpersonal pattern of emotional expression
