background maternal depression and anxiety disorder are risk factor for the development of internalizing disorder in offspring maternal attachment ha been discussed a one factor accounting for transmission the aim of this study wa to investigate child internalizing behavior at preschool age on a symptomatic and behavioral level and possible link to maternal mental health over time and maternal attachment style insecurity in a sample of postpartum depressed and anxious mother sampling and method child internalizing behavior at preschool age wa rated by the child behavior checklist cbcl the caregiver teacher report form c trf and during a mother child free play situation we focused on child responsiveness a it ha been linked to child internalizing behavior maternal attachment style insecurity wa tested to mediate the link between maternal mental health assessed postpartum and at preschool age with the structured clinical interview for dsm iv axis i disorder scid i and child internalizing behavior child responsiveness of the overall sample n 58 28 woman were diagnosed with postpartum depression and or anxiety disorder according to dsm iv and 30 were healthy control data were collected 3 9 month after delivery and at preschool age mean 4 6 year result at preschool age child of postpartum depressed and anxious mother were rated significantly higher on child internalizing behavior by mother father and additional caregiver compared to the control group child internalizing behavior rated by mother wa influenced by current psychiatric symptom maternal attachment style insecurity did not mediate this link during interaction child in the clinical group displayed significantly le child responsiveness compared to the control group maternal attachment style insecurity mediated the relationship between maternal mental health over time and child responsiveness conclusion the result emphasize the need for intervention focusing on mother child interaction and maternal attachment

the purpose of this study wa to adapt the leadership scale for sport l chelladurai amp saleh 1980 to physical education pe class for measuring teacher behavior by taking consideration of the perspective of student and teacher we moreover examined the influence of teacher behavior and the perceived teacher student congruence on the satisfaction of student two cross sectional study an online survey with pe teacher and a school study where student responded to a questionnaire assessing student perception and the preferred teacher behavior and teacher fill in a self description form regarding their own behavior participant for study 1 were 527 pe teacher 254 female and 273 male aged 21 64 year m 42 11 sd 11 21 participant in study 2 were 1452 student 625 female 798 male and 29 unstated aged 9 17 year m 13 31 sd 1 49 and 18 pe teacher 8 female and 10 male age 28 60 year m 49 87 sd 14 99 confirmatory factor analysis and the reliability coefficient supported the view that the l is adequate for usage in pe hierarchical regression analysis demonstrated that teacher behavior influence the satisfaction of student moreover perceived teacher student congruence had a positive effect on student satisfaction the finding support the assumption that the l is a suitable instrument for an application in pe teacher should be concerned with their student perception of their preferred teaching behavior in order to adapt to their need and to foster their satisfaction with and interest in pe

two adaptation of the implicit association task were used to ass implicit anxiety iat anxiety and implicit health attitude iat hypochondriasis in patient with hypochondriasis n 58 and anxiety patient n 71 explicit anxiety and health attitude were assessed using questionnaire the analysis of several multitrait multimethod model indicated that the low correlation between explicit and implicit measure of health attitude is due to the substantial methodological difference between the iat and the self report questionnaire patient with hypochondriasis displayed significantly more dysfunctional explicit and implicit health attitude than anxiety patient but no difference were found regarding explicit and implicit anxiety the study demonstrates the specificity of explicit and implicit dysfunctional health attitude among patient with hypochondriasis

absence of an adequate reason for anxiety is a criterion for pathological anxiety however the presence of danger or fear provoking stimulus may even be a risk factor for anxiety and doe not exclude that there is additionally pathological anxiety too the question is to what degree can heart related anxiety be explained by the severity of illness or trait anxiety two hundred and nine patient 37 8 woman from a cardiology inpatient unit completed the heart anxiety questionnaire progression anxiety questionnaire job anxiety scale and the state trait anxiety inventory the severity of cardiac illness wa rated by the treating cardiologist using the multidimensional severity of morbidity rating time absent from work due to sickness wa assessed a an indicator for illness related impairment heart anxiety wa significantly related to progression anxiety and to a lesser extent trait anxiety and indicator of subjective symptom of somatic illness no association wa found with medical rating for prognosis multimorbidity or reduction in life expectancy heart related anxiety is a symptom of an anxiety disorder although partially dependent on subjective suffering it cannot be explained by the severity of medical illness treatment of health related anxiety should focus on how to cope with subjective symptom of illness

impaired safety learning ha been proposed asa risk factor for anxiety disorder but safety can be indicated by either threat absence or threat termination i e relief here we investigated the role of trait anxiety for both kind of safety learning ninety one participant underwent an acquisition phase during which one shape threat c predicted a painful electric shock unconditioned stimulus u one shape relief c followed the u and one shape absence c became never associated with the u in a following extinction phase the three cue were presented again plus a control shape control c we found successful threat conditioning a threat c wa rated a more aversive negative arousing anxiogenic and associated with u than the other cue and it elicited startle potentiation a well asa larger skin conductance response scr safety cue were rated equally positive and non anxiogenic but still lower than control c whereas physiologically relief c elicited stronger appetitive response startle attenuation and low scr than absence c interestingly an increase in trait anxiety wa associated with a decrease in the difference between absence c and threat c response reflected in contingency rating during extinction a well a stronger fear startle response to absence c in sum physiological response but not rating triggered by a relief signal compared to a threat absence signal indicated that the former is more appetitive than the latter strikingly trait anxiety specifically mediated learning of threat absence but not of threat termination indicating that high trait anxious individual experience relief normally but have deficit in identifying signal of threat absence

background the interpersonal theory of suicide ipts is one of the most intensively researched contemporary theory on the development of suicidal ideation and behaviour however there is a lack of carefully conducted prospective study aim to evaluate the main prediction of the ipts regarding the importance of perceived burdensomeness thwarted belongingness and capability for suicide in predicting future suicide attempt in a prospective design method psychiatric in patient n 308 53 6 n 165 female mean age 36 82 year s d 14 30 range 18 81 admitted for severe suicidal ideation n 145 47 1 or a suicide attempt completed self report measure of thwarted belongingness perceived burdensomeness capability for suicide hopelessness depression and suicidal ideation a well a interview on suicide intent and suicide attempt and were followed up for 12 month logistic regression and receiver operating characteristic roc analysis were conducted result the interaction of perceived burdensomeness thwarted belongingness and capability for suicide wa not predictive of future suicide attempt but perceived burdensomeness showed a significant main effect z 3 49 p 0 01 or 2 34 95 ci 1 59 3 58 and moderate performance in screening for future suicide attempt area under the curve auc 0 729 p 0 01 conclusion the result challenge the theoretical validity of the ipts and it clinical utility at least within the methodological limitation of the current study yet finding underscore the importance of perceived burdensomeness in understanding suicidal ideation and behaviour

background infatuation and lovesickness are widespread and significant experience in adolescence le is known about the connection between infatuation lovesickness and sleep the few study examining the link between infatuation and sleep quality show inconsistent result the link between lovesickness and sleep a well a the link between infatuation lovesickness and dream ha not been investigated yet the aim of this study wa to examine whether infatuation and lovesickness are linked to sleep quality and dream in adolescent method a self assessment online questionnaire wa constructed to ass adolescent infatuation lovesickness sleep quality and dream in total data of 630 adolescent and young adult 150 male 480 female aged 16 21 were analyzed in this study result infatuation did not relate to overall sleep quality and dream sleep disturbance a a component of overall sleep quality were more frequent in infatuated adolescent adolescent currently suffering from lovesickness reported a significantly lower sleep quality more negative dream and nightmare furthermore nightmare influenced them more strongly the next day conclusion the association between infatuation lovesickness and sleep provide evidence for the far reaching effect of infatuation and lovesickness in adolescent life the fact that lovesickness lead to lower sleep quality and more negative dream should be integrated in new approach of insomnia treatment

this study cross culturally investigated resilience and social support a possible protective factor for mental health the value of depression anxiety and stress symptom resilience and social support were collected from german n 4433 russian n 3774 and chinese student n 4982 the sample were split two third v one third to cross validate the result in all sample resilience and social support were significantly negatively associated with depression anxiety and stress symptom while in germany those association were stronger for social support in russia and in china stronger association were found for resilience furthermore in all sample resilience wa found to mediate the association between social support and the negative mental health variable significantly in conclusion resilience and social support are universal interrelated protective factor for mental health independently of historical cultural social and geographical condition of a country

adolescent still lack knowledge about depression and it treatment a a result depressed adolescent are confronted with stigma that are barrier to treatment seeking study in adult demonstrated that depression literacy can be increased by educational material we developed an information booklet on depression specifically addressing adolescent aged 13 to 17 for the first time it wa examined whether knowledge about depression in youth can be enhanced by reading an educational leaflet the information booklet wa evaluated in 628 german ninth grader m 15 1 year 58 boy in a pre postfollow up design using study specific questionnaire knowledge about seven topic on depression wa assessed key subject were symptom and treatment of depression a well a suicidality in addition student evaluated the booklet s layout content and utility power analysis of the pre post follow up comparison yielded effect size of knowledge enhancement between eta 2 0 07 medium and 0 56 large for all topic of the booklet the largest effect size were found for the topic symptom and antidepressant sub analysis on school type and gender showed the highest increase in knowledge in well educated student and in girl the participating youth assessed the booklet positively regarding all category with a mean overallrating of 2 15 on a scale from 1 very good to 6 fail although student baseline knowledge about depression wa good girl and boy of all school type significantly increased depression literacy thus the booklet can help reducing stigma and treatment barrier in adolescent

only the minority of youth exposed to traumatic event receive mental health care a trauma informed clinical service are lacking or are poorly accessible in order to bridge this gap the outpatient trauma clinic otc wa founded an easily accessible early short time intervention with onward referral to follow up treatment this report present the otc s interventional approach and first outcome data using a retrospective naturalistic design we analyzed trauma and intervention related data of the sample n 377 55 4 female mean age 10 95 sd 4 69 following drop out analysis predictor for treatment outcome were identified by logistic regression the majority 81 9 wa suffering from posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd or adjustment disorder around one forth dropped out of treatment these case showed higher avoidance symptom at presentation in 91 psychological symptom improved experience of multiple traumatic event wa the strongest predictor for poor treatment outcome b 0 823 se 0 313 or 0 439 95 ci 0 238 0 811 around two third were connected to follow up treatment the otc realized a high retention rate initial improvement of symptom and referral to subsequent longer term psychotherapeutic treatment in the majority further dissemination of comparable early intervention model is needed in order to improve mental health care for this vulnerable group

recent finding show benefit for learning and subsequent recognition of face caricatured in shape or texture but there is little evidence on whether this caricature learning advantage generalizes to recognition of veridical counterpart at test moreover it ha been reported that there is a relatively higher contribution of texture information at the expense of shape information for familiar compared to unfamiliar face recognition the aim of this study wa to examine whether veridical face are recognized better when they were learned a caricature compared to when they were learned a veridicals what we call a caricature generalization benefit photorealistic facial stimulus derived from a 3 d camera system were caricatured selectively in either shape or texture by 50 face were learned across different image either a veridicals shape caricature or texture caricature at test all learned and novel face were presented a previously unseen frontal veridicals and participant performed an old new task we assessed accuracy reaction time and face sensitive event related potential erps face learned a caricature were recognized more accurately than face learned a veridicals at learning n250 and lpc were largest for shape caricature suggesting encoding advantage of distinctive facial shape at test lpc wa largest for face that had been learned a texture caricature indicating the importance of texture for familiar face recognition overall our finding demonstrate that caricature learning advantage can generalize to and importantly improve recognition of veridical version of face

background behavioral approach are central to the preventive treatment of migraine but empirical evidence regarding efficacy and effectiveness is still sparse this study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a newly developed migraine specific integrative cognitive behavioral therapy program micbt combining several approach trigger and stress management coping with fear of attack relaxation training by comparing it with a single behavioral approach relaxation training rlx a an active control group and a waiting list control group wlc method in a three armed open label randomized controlled trial 121 adult with migraine were assigned to either micbt rlx or wlc the outpatient group therapy micbt or rlx consisted of seven session each 90 min participant who completed the wlc were subsequently randomized to one of the two treatment group primary outcome were headache day headache related disability emotional distress and self efficacy the baseline wa compared to post treatment and followed by assessment 4 and 12 month post treatment to compare micbt and rlx result mixed model analysis intention to treat sample 106 participant showed significantly stronger pre post improvement in self efficacy assessed by the headache management self efficacy scale hmse g sf in both treatment group compared to the wlc mean difference at post micbt 4 67 0 55 8 78 p 0 027 rlx 4 42 0 38 to 8 46 p 0 032 whereas no other significant between group difference were observed the follow up analysis revealed significant within group improvement from baseline to 12 month follow up in all four primary outcome for both treatment however between group effect micbt v rlx were not significant at follow up conclusion the micbt ha no better treatment effect compared to rlx in migraine prophylaxis both treatment effectively increase patient self efficacy trial registration german clinical trial register www drks de drks id drks00011111

background deficient cognitive control over emotional distraction is a central characteristic of major depressive disorder mdd hypoactivation of the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc ha been linked with this deficit in this study we aimed to enhance the activity of the dlpfc in mdd patient by anodal transcranial direct current stimulation tdcs and thus ameliorate cognitive control method in a double blinded balanced randomized sham controlled crossover trial we determined the effect of a single session tdcs to the left dlpfc on the cognitive control in 22 mdd patient and 22 healthy control subject to ass the cognitive control we used a delayed response working memory task with picture of varying content emotional v neutral presented during the delay period result emotional picture presented during the delay period impaired accuracy and response time of patient with mdd indicating an attentional bias for emotional stimulus anodal tdcs to the dlpfc wa associated with an enhanced working memory performance both in patient and control subject specifically in subject with mdd the attentional bias wa completely abolished by anodal tdcs conclusion the present study demonstrates that anodal tdcs applied to the left dlpfc improves deficient cognitive control in mdd based on these data tdcs might be suitable to support the effect of behavioral training to enhance cognitive control in mdd

objective odor are powerful emotional stimulus influencing mood attention and behavior here we examined if odor change the perception of pleasant touch in line with the warning function of the olfactory system we proposed that especially unpleasant odor will reduce touch pleasantness presumably through a disgust related mechanism method forty five healthy participant mean age 23 3 3years sd 24 female were presented to slow 3 cm s and fast 30 cm s brush stroking delivered by a robot to the forearm touch pleasantness under the influence of an unpleasant odor civette smelling like feces and an intensity matched pleasant odor rose wa compared to an odorless control condition in a pilot study with 30 participant mean age 25 9 6 year 21 female the odor were matched according to their intensity and we studied the influence of disgust sensitivity on the perception of 4 different odor quality result the unpleasant odor decreased touch pleasantness for both stroking velocity compared to the odorless control p 0 005 whereas the rose odor did not change touch pleasantness significantly disgust sensitivity wa correlated with the modulation of touch pleasantness the pilot study revealed a significant correlation between disgust sensitivity and the perception of the unpleasant odor quality r 0 56 p 0 007 but not with any of the other odor conclusion unpleasant odor are powerful in modulating touch pleasantness and disgust might be a moderating variable

background patient with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd exhibit difficulty in multiple attentional function although high heritability rate suggest a strong genetic impact aetiological pathway from gene and environmental factor to the adhd phenotype are not well understood tracking the time course of deviant task processing using event related electrophysiological brain activity should characterize the impact of familiality on the sequence of cognitive function from preparation to response control in adhd method preparation and response control were assessed using behavioural and electrophysiological parameter of two version of a cued continuous performance test with varying attentional load in boy with adhd combined type n 97 their non affected sibling n 27 and control child without a family history of adhd n 43 result child with adhd and non affected sibling showed more variable performance and made more omission error than control the preparatory cue p3 and contingent negative variation cnv following cue were reduced in both adhd child and their non affected sibling compared with control the nogo p3 wa diminished in adhd compared with control whilst non affected sibling were located intermediate but did not differ from both other group no clear familiality effect were found for the go p3 better task performance wa further associated with higher cnv and p3 amplitude conclusion impairment in performance and electrophysiological parameter reflecting preparatory process and to some extend also for inhibitory response control especially under high attentional load appeared to be familially driven in adhd and may thus constitute functionally relevant endophenotypes for the disorder

purpose informing patient about treatment side effect increase the occurrence and intensity of side effect since the obligatory informed consent procedure in drug treatment requires transparency and nocebo research suggests that the informed consent of a drug lead to an increased occurrence of the mentioned side effect the aim of this proof of concept study wa to determine the effect of two different framing of informed consent on the occurrence intensity and perceived threat of side effect method healthy male participant n 80 were randomized to one of two framing group the positive framing group wa informed that the common side effect dizziness wa a sign that the drug had started to work while the neutral framing group wa told that dizziness is an unpleasant but well known side effect side effect were measured after the administration of metoprolol an antihypertensive agent post hoc moderator analysis investigated the effect of pre existing negative belief about the general harm of medication on the framing manipulation result metoprolol specific drug attributed side effect were rated significantly le threatening in the positive framing group the between group effect size cohen s d wa small d 0 38 p 0 049 exploratory post hoc moderator analysis suggest that participant who believed that medication is a source of harmful effect benefited from positive framing compared to neutral framing of drug attributed side effect conclusion positive framing wa partially effective in decreasing specific side effect measure particularly among participant with a tendency to believe that medicine is harmful informed consent procedure should therefore be personalized focusing on patient with negative treatment belief

the clinician administered ptsd scale cap is a widely used diagnostic interview for posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd following fundamental modification in the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder fifth edition dsm 5 the cap had to be revised this study examined the psychometric property internal consistency interrater reliability convergent and discriminant validity and structural validity of the german version of the cap 5 in a trauma exposed sample n 223 with ptsd n 51 without ptsd the result demonstrated high internal consistency alpha 65 93 and high interrater reliability icc 81 89 with regard to convergent and discriminant validity we found high correlation between the cap severity score and both the posttraumatic diagnostic scale sum score r 87 and the beck depression inventory total score r 72 regarding the underlying factor structure the hybrid model demonstrated the best fit followed by the anhedonia model however we encountered some nonpositive estimate for the correlation of the latent variable factor for both model the model with the best fit without methodological problem wa the externalizing behavior model but the result also supported the dsm 5 model overall the result demonstrate that the german version of the cap 5 is a psychometrically sound measure

background nocebo effect including nocebo hyperalgesia are a common phenomenon in clinical routine with manifold negative consequence both explicit expectation and learning by conditioning are known to induce nocebo effect but the specific role of conditioning remains unclear because conditioning is rarely implemented independent of verbal suggestion further although pain is a multidimensional phenomenon nocebo effect are usually assessed in subjective rating only neglecting e g behavioral aspect the aim of this study wa to test whether nocebo hyperalgesia can be learned by conditioning without explicit expectation to ass nocebo effect in different response channel and to exploratively ass whether contingency awareness is a necessary condition for conditioned nocebo hyperalgesia method twenty one healthy volunteer were classically conditioned using painful and non painful heat stimulus that followed two different cue the conditioned nocebo effect wa assessed by subjective rating of perceived stimulation intensity on a visual analog scale and a behavioral discrimination task assessing sensitization and habituation in response to the same stimulation following the two cue result result show a conditioned nocebo effect indicated by the subjective intensity rating conditioned effect were also seen in the behavioral response but paradoxically behavioral response indicated decreased perception after conditioning but only for subject successfully conditioned a indicated by the subjective rating explorative analysis suggested that awareness of the contingency and the different cue wa not necessary for successful conditioning conclusion nocebo effect can be learned without inducing additional explicit expectation the dissociation between the two response channel possibly representing the conditioned and a compensatory response highlight the importance of considering different outcome in nocebo response to fully understand underlying mechanism the present result challenge the role of explicit expectation in conditioned nocebo effect and are relevant with implication in clinical context e g when transient adverse effect become conditioned

schizophrenia is considered a brain disease with a quite heterogeneous clinical presentation study in schizophrenia have yielded a wide array of correlation between structural and functional brain change and clinical and cognitive symptom reduction of grey matter volume gmv in the prefrontal and temporal cortex have been described which are crucial for the development of positive and negative symptom and impaired working memory wm association between gmv reduction and positive and negative symptom a well a wm impairment were assessed in schizophrenia patient symptomatology in 34 wm in 26 and compared to healthy control 36 total wm in 26 gmv wa determined by voxel based morphometry and it relation to positive and negative symptom a well a wm performance wa assessed in schizophrenia patient reduction of gmv were evident in anterior cingulate cortex ventrolateral prefrontal cortex vlpfc superior temporal cortex and insula gmv reduction in the superior temporal gyrus stg were associated with positive symptom severity a well a wm impairment furthermore the absolute gmv of vlpfc wa strongly related to negative symptom these predicted wm performance a well a processing speed the present result support the assumption of two distinct pathomechanisms responsible for impaired wm in schizophrenia 1 gmv reduction in the vlpfc predict the severity of negative symptom increased negative symptom in turn are associated with a slowing down of processing speed and predict an impaired wm 2 gmv reduction in the temporal and mediofrontal cortex are involved in the development of positive symptom and impair wm performance too

background this study investigated whether postpartum anxiety disorder is associated to altered pattern of infant a well a maternal engagement in a face to face still face interaction ffsf sampling and method n 39 woman with postpartum dsm iv anxiety disorder and n 48 healthy mother were videotaped during a ffsf with their infant m 4 1 month result infant of the clinical group showed significantly le positive engagement during the play episode than infant of control this result depended on infant sex male control demonstrated more positive interaction than male of anxious mother there wa no such effect for female infant who engaged significantly le positively during the play episode than male and did not change their positive engagement during the ffsf these finding imply pronounced interactive positivity and early vulnerability to maternal anxiety symptom in male infant only the infant of the control showed the still face effect they also protested significantly more during the still face while the clinical infant protest increased significantly during the reunion woman of both group did not differ in their interaction maternal intrusiveness wa associated to infant protest in the course of the ffsf conclusion result suggest that mother infant intervention should consider affect regulation and infant sex specific characteristic in anxious mother infant dyad

background a significant proportion of patient with affective and psychotic disorder show a marked reduction in goal directed behaviour which is also reflected in the behavioural outcome of effort based decision making paradigm the factor underlying this reduction are not yet fully understood reward salience and reward expectancy have been discussed a factor that potentially influence approach behaviour the aim of this study wa thus to test their effect on behaviour in an effort based decision making paradigm method in two study with community sample we applied a modified version of the balloon task in study 1 we manipulated reward salience in a within subject design n 32 by highlighting the monetary reward in study 2 we manipulated reward expectancy in a between subject design n 72 by adding five practice trial with either positive or negative feedback prior to the task result the salience of reward manipulation significantly increased effort expenditure and the allocation of effort to the level of reward whereas the reward expectancy manipulation did not conclusion the finding that increasing the salience of reward increase motivated behaviour in an effort based decision making paradigm offer promising possibility for intervention in disorder characterised by motivational deficit such asaffective and psychotic disorder

depressed mood is associated with making negatively biased interpretation of ambiguous everyday event experimental modification towards a more optimistic interpretation ha become a focus of recent research however to date no measure exist that have been tested with respect to their psychometric property that justify repeated administration to capture change we aimed to develop and evaluate a pragmatic assessment instrument consisting of a 30 item questionnaire long version and two 15 item parallel short version a and b item were generated a ambiguous sentence reflecting three relevant content area based on beck s cognitive triad the sentence were rated for pleasantness and this emotional appraisal task indicates the emotional valence of the interpretation due to the intention to develop a parallel test version item twin were generated all three version of the instrument were found to be structurally stable internally consistent and valid in line with beck s cognitive triad in depression confirmatory factor analysis determined a three factor solution i e self experience and future significant correlation were found between all scale and depressive mood the two short version represent the same underlying construct share identical psychometric property and posse high parallel test reliability this study is the first to evaluate and confirm the factorial validity a well a the parallel test reliability of an interpretation bias measure it is suitable to measure bias modification and ha therefore great potential for research and clinical practice

background internet based cognitive behavioral therapy icbt ha proven to be an effective treatment in improving patient ability to cope with tinnitus however some patient prefer face to face therapy to icbt and a few study have shown considerable dropout rate if the treatment is not guided this render it important to identify factor that contribute to the commencement and continuation of icbt program aim because treatment motivation and expectation are important factor in psychological treatment the aim of our study wa to investigate what lead tinnitus patient to seek out icbt what help them to keep up with the treatment and what if any impact these factor have on dropout rate and treatment outcome method 112 tinnitus patient taking part in icbt for tinnitus responded to symptom related questionnaire at three point in time pre treatment post treatment and one year follow up and to a questionnaire consisting of open ended question about their treatment motivation and expectation before beginning treatment data were analyzed using qualitative content analysis and the result were used to divide the participant into group the treatment outcome of these group were compared using t test chi 2 test and both one factorial and mixed anova result four main category emerged a factor conducive to starting treatment 1 target participant wanted to address 2 circumstance that led to participation 3 attitude towards the treatment and 4 training feature participant identified six facilitator for continuing the treatment success training individual attitude hope evidence and support naming specific tinnitus associated problem a target wa associated with greater improvement from pre treatment to 1 year follow up describing an active involvement in the treatment wa related to increased improvement from post treatment to follow up conclusion there are several motivational factor that tinnitus patient consider relevant for beginning and continuing icbt particularly focusing on specific target that do not involve the tinnitus itself and encouraging participant to take an active role in treatment may increase treatment effectiveness however further hypothesis guided research is necessary to confirm our explorative result

background to date most research on aggression in mental disorder focused on active aggressive behavior and found self directed and other directed active aggression to be a symptom and risk factor of psychopathology on the other hand passive aggressive behavior ha been investigated le frequently and only in research on psychodynamic defense mechanism personality disorder and dysfunctional self control process this small number of study primarily reflects a lack of a reliable and valid clinical assessment of passive aggressive behavior to address this gap we developed the test of passive aggression tpa a 24 item self rating scale for the assessment of self directed and other directed passive aggressive behavior method study 1 examined the internal consistency and factorial validity of the tpa in an inpatient sample n 307 study 2 investigated the retest reliability internal consistency and construct validity active aggression personality trait impulsivity of the tpa in a student sample n 180 result in line with our hypothesis exploratory structural equation modeling revealed an acceptable to good fit of a bi factorial structure of the tpa chi square df ratio 1 98 rmsr 0 05 fit off 0 96 both tpa scale showed good to excellent internal consistency alpha 0 83 0 90 and 4 week retest reliability r tt 0 86 correlation with well established aggression scale measure of personality and impulsivity support discriminant and convergent validity of the tpa conclusion the tpa is a reliable and valid instrument for the assessment of self directed and other directed passive aggressive behavior

many anti stigma campaign emphasize biogenetic cause to convey that schizophrenia is an illness like others a growing body of study show that although biogenetic explanation reduce blame they tend to reinforce prognostic pessimism and harsher treatment of people with schizophrenia in contrast psychosocial explanation attenuate prognostic pessimism and perceived otherness but seem le suitable to reduce blame we hypothesized that a vulnerability stress model that combine biogenetic and psychosocial explanation would yield clearer stigma reducing effect than the mono causal model in an online experiment 416 participant from the general population randomly received either a vulnerability stress biogenetic psychosocial or control intervention which consisted of information text and video presentation of a case example causal belief stereotype and desired social distance were assessed by self report baseline causal belief were weakly associated with stereotype the vulnerability stress intervention did not reduce stigma more effectively than the biogenetic or psychosocial intervention and wa le effective in reducing perceived blame than the biogenetic intervention compared to the control intervention no intervention showed significant stigma reducing effect but the psychosocial and vulnerability stress condition both increased blame we found no evidence for vulnerability stress explanation a a mean to reduce stigma we propose further research to identify more effective way to tackle stigma

in the domain of working memory wm a sigmoid shaped relationship between wm load and brain activation pattern ha been demonstrated in younger adult it ha been suggested that age related alteration of this pattern are associated with change in neural efficiency and capacity at the same time wm training study have shown that some older adult are able to increase their wm performance through training in this study functional magnetic resonance imaging during an n back wm task at different wm load level wa applied to compare blood oxygen level dependent bold response between younger and older participant and to predict gain in wm performance after a subsequent 12 session wm training procedure in older adult we show that increased neural efficiency and capacity a reflected by more youth like brain response pattern in region of interest of the frontoparietal wm network were associated with better behavioral training outcome beyond the effect of age sex education gray matter volume and baseline wm performance furthermore at low difficulty level decrease in bold response were found after wm training result indicate that both neural efficiency i e decreased activation at comparable performance level and capacity i e increasing activation with increasing wm load of a wm related network predict plasticity of the wm system whereas wm training may specifically increase neural efficiency in older adult

uncertainty about future threat ha been found to be associated with an overestimation of threat probability and is hypothesized to elicit additional allocation of attention we used event related potential to examine uncertainty related dynamic in attentional allocation exploiting brain potential high temporal resolution and sensitivity to attention thirty participant performed a picture viewing task in which cue indicated the subsequent picture valence a certain neutral and a certain aversive cue accurately predicted subsequent picture valence whereas an uncertain cue did not participant overestimated the effective frequency of aversive picture following the uncertain cue both during and after the task signifying expectancy and covariation bias and they tended to express lower subjective valence for aversive picture presented after the uncertain cue picture elicited increased p2 and lpp amplitude when their valence could not be predicted from the cue for the lpp this effect wa more pronounced in response to neutral picture uncertainty appears to enhance the engagement of early phasic and sustained attention for uncertainly cued target thus defensive motivation related to uncertainty about future threat elicits specific attentional dynamic implicating prioritization at various processing stage especially for nonthreatening stimulus that tend to violate expectation

maternal depression pose a risk for the developing mother infant relationship similarly maternal insecure attachment style may limit the ability to adequately connect with the newborn during the postpartum period the aim of this study wa to investigate the effect of maternal depression and insecure attachment insecure and dual disorganized on maternal bonding in a sample of n 34 woman with depression according to dsm iv and n 59 healthy woman maternal depression wa assessed 3 to 4 month postpartum with the structured clinical interview for dsm iv axis i disorder scid i bonding with the postpartum bonding questionnaire and maternal attachment style with the attachment style interview woman with current and lifetime depression a well a woman with dual disorganized attachment style reported lower bonding explorative analysis revealed that depression partially mediated the link between dual disorganized attachment style and bonding with a medium sized mediation effect the combination of maternal depression and dual disorganized attachment style may pose a special risk constellation for the developing mother infant bond that should be addressed in prevention and early intervention program

the objective wa to examine the efficacy of applied relaxation ar a indicated preventive intervention to reduce psychopathological symptom and prevent incident mental disorder in a parallel group randomized controlled trial n 277 adult with elevated tension distress anxiety or depressive symptomatology depression anxiety stress scale das 21 but no 12 month dsm 5 diagnosis of any mental disorder assessed via standardized interview dia x 5 were randomized to an intervention group ig n 139 receiving group based ar training or an assessment only control group cg n 138 self report questionnaire at baseline post immediately after the 10 week intervention or a similar time frame in cg and 12 month follow up included the das 21 a primary outcome measure of intervention efficacy incident subthreshold and threshold mental disorder were assessed via dia x 5 at 12 month follow up a primary outcome of prevention efficacy intervention and prevention effect were examined on an intent to treat basis with missing data replaced using chained multiple imputation mixed model analysis revealed accelerated symptom improvement in ig versus cg with a medium baseline to post between group effect size d 0 59 95 ci 0 36 0 82 logistic regression analysis revealed a significantly lower incidence rate for sub threshold mental disorder until 12 month follow up in ig 34 7 versus cg 49 3 odds ratio 0 54 95 ci 0 31 0 92 risk ratio 0 70 95 ci 0 51 0 96 risk difference 0 15 95 ci 0 28 to 0 02 group based ar a a promising indicative preventive intervention should be tested in long term study and relative to a credible alternative intervention to assure that the intervention effect are not entirely due to demand characteristic expectancy or non specific effect

abstract learning mechanism may serve a a framework for understanding the formation of paranoia specifically if paranoid thought after social stressor produce a short term benefit for coping e g downregulating arousal the encountered negative reinforcement could lead to their excessive application and subsequently to long term maladaptive conviction the trier social stress test wa utilized in healthy participant to examine this putative benefit participant rated paranoia at baseline and after the stressor subjective stress level negative affect heart rate and heart rate variability were assessed in the following rest phase n 59 semipartial correlation showed that participant who responded with larger increase in paranoia were characterized by a lower heart rate in the subsequent rest phase no association were found with heart rate variability or psychological measure thus paranoid thinking in healthy individual could be an adaptive mean for reestablishing some aspect of physiological homeostasis after a social stressor but further research is needed

the differential relation between the emotion regulation strategy cognitive reappraisal and expressive suppression and suicidality in a mixed inpatient sample n 232 69 4 female of a german psychotherapeutic hospital were examined patient filled in the emotion regulation questionnaire and item on suicidal ideation and desire a structural equation model fitted the data rmsea 044 cfi 96 and revealed that expressive suppression significantly predicted increased suicidal ideation moderation analysis showed that result were independent from a current depressive episode potential implication for psychotherapeutic treatment of suicidality are discussed

abstract objective current treatment for chronic depression have focused on reducing interpersonal problem and negative affect but paid little attention to promoting prosocial motivation and positive affect following this treatment focus the objective of the present study wa to examine whether the combination of metta loving kindness group meditation and subsequent tailored individual therapy focusing on kindness towards oneself and others metta based therapy mbt show greater improvement in depressive symptom than a wait list control group in patient with chronic depression method forty eight patient with dsm 5 persistent depressive disorder were randomly assigned to mbt or a wait list control condition outcome wa assessed after group meditation after subsequent individual therapy and at 6 month follow up the primary outcome measure wa an independent blind rating of depressive symptom at post test secondary outcome included change in self reported depression behavioral activation rumination social functioning mindfulness compassion and clinician rated emotion regulation result mixed design analysis showed significant difference between mbt and wlc in change from pre to post test in clinician rated and self rated depression behavioral activation rumination social functioning mindfulness and emotion regulation most of the change occurred during group meditation and were associated with large effect size improvement were maintained at 6 month follow up conclusion the result provide preliminary support for the effectiveness of mbt in treating chronic depression trial registration isrctn isrctn97264476

background to slow down the spread of the covid 19 pandemic government of many country introduced various behavioral measure starting march 2020 the measure included domestic quarantine not leaving home for infected or potentially infected people due to the need for social distancing online activity increased in spring 2020 this could foster the risk for addictive social medium use smu the present study investigated tendency of addictive smu and their relationship with depression anxiety and stress symptom specifically among individual who stayed in domestic quarantine due to covid 19 in germany and lithuania method in germany n 529 quarantine group n 157 non quarantine group n 372 and in lithuania n 325 quarantine group n 54 non quarantine group n 271 data were assessed via online survey in spring 2020 result in both country person in quarantine had higher level of addictive smu depression anxiety and stress symptom than individual who were not in quarantine the difference wa significant only for addictive smu in the german sample the significant positive correlation between addictive smu and symptom of depression anxiety and stress were stronger in both quarantine group than in the non quarantine group limitation the mostly female young and well educated composition of both investigated sample limit generalizability of the current finding conclusion result reveal first evidence that the use of social medium during domestic covid 19 quarantine might contribute to the increase of addictive tendency and negatively impact well being alternative way of daily routine during the quarantine are discussed

rat are able to lateralize odor this ability involves specialized neuron in the orbitofrontal cortex which are able to process the left right and bilateral presentation of stimulus however it is not clear whether this function is preserved in human human are in general not able to differentiate whether a selective olfactory stimulant ha been applied to the left or right nostril however exception have been reported following a screening of 152 individual with an olfactory lateralization test we identified 19 who could lateralize odor above chance level 15 of these lateralizers underwent olfactory fmri scanning in a block design and were compared to 15 control matched for age and sex distribution a a result both group showed comparable activation of olfactory eloquent brain area however subject with lateralization ability had a significantly enhanced activation of cerebral trigeminal processing area somatosensory cortex intraparietal sulcus in contrast to control lateralizers furthermore exhibited no suppression in the area of the trigeminal principal sensory nucleus an exploratory study with an olfactory change detection paradigm furthermore showed that lateralizers oriented faster towards change in the olfactory environment taken together our study suggests that the trigeminal system is activated to a higher degree by the odorous stimulus in the group of lateralizers we conclude that human are not able to lateralize odor based on the olfactory input alone but vary in the degree to which the trigeminal system is recruited

background methamphetamine ma use ha been shown to be associated with deficit in impulsivity verbal learning and working memory additionally methamphetamine use disorder mud is related to various brain change especially in adolescent user who might be more vulnerable to detrimental effect on brain development however little is known about the relationship between adolescent ma use and cognitive impairment this cross sectional study aim to explore how the presence of a mud in adolescent is related to impairment of verbal memory inhibition and alertness method n 18 psychiatric outpatient with mud were matched in term of depressivity age and gender to n 18 adolescent with other substance use disorder suds a well a n 18 control without suds we compared these three group on the verbal learning and memory task vlmt and the alertness and go nogo subtests of the test of attentional performance tap additionally spearman s rank order correlation coefficient were calculated to investigate whether cognitive functioning wa directly associated with frequency of past year ma use result the three group differed significantly in their verbal learning performance h 2 11 7 p 003 eta p 2 19 but not in short term memory inhibition cued recall or alertness post hoc test revealed significant difference in verbal learning between the ma using group and the control group without a sud u 56 5 p 001 eta p 2 31 frequency of past year ma use correlated negatively with short term memory rho 25 p 01 and verbal learning rho 41 p 01 no other cognitive variable correlated significantly with ma use frequency significant p value were considered significant after bonferroni correction conclusion adolescent mud outpatient with regular ma use show specific impairment in verbal learning performance but not in other basal cognitive function when compared to adolescent without a mud verbal learning and short term memory performance is negatively associated with the frequency of ma use future research should apply longitudinal design to investigate long term effect of methamphetamine and reversibility of these effect on cognitive functioning

objective attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd rating scale such a the conners rating scale cr are valuable adjunct for diagnosis since they offer parent teacher and self rating of child susceptible for adhd even though the scale are widely used internationally cross cultural comparability ha rarely been verified and culture and language invariance have only been presumed the conners 3 r rating scale are the updated version of the cr though hardly any study report the psychometric property apart from the result published in the test edition itself to our knowledge there are no study on the various adaptation of the conners 3 r in other language method the german translation of the conners 3 r were completed by 745 child 953 parent and 741 teacher child s age range 6 18 year mean 11 74 year of age exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis on content scale item were conducted to obtain the factor structure for the german version and to replicate the factor structure of the original american model cronbach s alpha wa calculated to establish internal consistency result the exploratory analysis for the german model resulted in factor structure globally different from the american model though confirmatory analysis revealed very good model fi t with highly satisfying cronbach s alpha we were able to provide empirical evidence for the subscale inattention which had only hypothetically been derived by conners 2008 conclusion even though the exploratory analysis resulted in different factor structure the confirmatory analysis have such excellent psychometric property that use of the german adaptation of the conners 3 r is justifi ed in international multicenter study

mother can recognize the odor of their baby and typically adore this odor in line with this observation infant body odor activate reward related brain area in the mother in some mother child dyad however the mutual bond is impaired and mother have trouble engaging in interaction with their child we aimed to examine how mother with bonding difficulty perceive their child s body odor in total 75 mother of baby aged 0 12 month were examined twenty five of those were recruited in a psychosomatic day hospital ward which is specialized for mother child bonding disorder fifty age matched healthy woman and their baby served a control body odor sample of each baby were collected from bodysuits in a highly standardized procedure thereafter each mother rated the sample of her own and two other infant in a blind and randomized design in addition general olfactory function in term of threshold and identification ability wa tested and the mother reported the bonding to her baby in a standardized questionnaire healthy mother showed a clear preference of their own compared to odor of other infant s while mother with bonding difficulty did not furthermore the degree of preference wa negatively correlated to self reported bonding difficulty mother with bonding difficulty could not identify their own infant s odor above chance while control mother could both group did not differ in general olfactory function we assume that reduced close body contact and interaction time associated with bonding difficulty may lead to reduced exposure and hinder the recognition of the infantile body odor within a vicious cycle a reduced hedonic experience smelling their own baby may prevent woman from deliberately approaching the baby thus the positive and bond building consequence of bodily and sensory interaction cannot unfold a the baby s odor is normally perceived a very pleasant and rewarding the conscious perception of the infantile body odor may be an additive therapeutic approach for mother with bonding difficulty

objective the interpersonal psychological theory of suicidal behavior posit that 2 proximal causal and interactive risk factor must be present for someone to desire suicide perceived burdensomeness and thwarted belongingness the purpose of the present study wa to evaluate the predictive power of these 2 risk factor in a prospective study method a total of 231 adult outpatient age mean 38 1 standard deviation 12 3 undergoing cognitive behavioral therapy took part in a pretreatment and a midtreatment assessment after the 10th therapy session result perceived burdensomeness thwarted belongingness and the interaction between these 2 risk factor did not add incremental variance to the prediction of midtreatment suicide ideation after controlling for age gender depression hopelessness impulsivity lifetime suicide attempt and pretreatment suicide ideation the best predictor of midtreatment suicide ideation wa pretreatment suicide ideation conclusion result offer only limited support to the assumption of the interpersonal theory of suicide

the study aimed at constructing a reliable and valid post session questionnaire measuring general change mechanism of psychotherapy with correspondent version for patient and therapist perspective therefore 253 inpatient in early middle and late stage of psychotherapy completed the newly developed scale for the multiperspective assessment of general change mechanism in psychotherapy sacip and diverse outcome measure the psychometric quality of the sacip were excellent a shown by a exploratory factor analysis on patient and therapist rating b confirmatory factor analysis on later measuring time and c high internal consistency supporting construct validity the sacip predicted outcome a shown by correlational analysis and mixed effect modeling patient evaluation of change mechanism were better predictor of outcome than the corresponding therapist evaluation

alteration in frontal and parietal neural activation during working memory task performance have been suggested a a candidate endophenotype of obsessive compulsive disorder ocd in study involving first degree relative however the direct link between genetic risk for ocd and neuro functional alteration during working memory performance ha not been investigated to date thus the aim of the current functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri study wa to test the direct association between polygenic risk for ocd and neural activity during the performance of a numeric n back task with four working memory load condition in 128 participant including patient with ocd unaffected first degree relative of ocd patient and healthy control behavioral result show a significant performance deficit at high working memory load in both patient with ocd and first degree relative p 0 05 a whole brain analysis of the fmri data indicated decreased neural activity in bilateral inferior parietal lobule and dorsolateral prefrontal cortex in both patient and relative most importantly ocd polygenic risk score predicted neural activity in orbitofrontal cortex result indicate that genetic risk for ocd can partly explain alteration in brain response during working memory performance supporting the notion of a neuro functional endophenotype for ocd

a stimulus conditioned stimulus c associated with an appetitive unconditioned stimulus u acquires positive property and elicits appetitive conditioned response cr such associative learning ha been examined extensively in animal with food a the u and result are used to explain psychopathology e g substance related disorder or obesity human study on appetitive conditioning exist too but we still know little about generalization process understanding these process may explain why stimulus not associated with a drug for instance can elicit craving forty seven hungry participant underwent an appetitive conditioning protocol during which one of two circle with different diameter c became associated with an appetitive u chocolate or salty pretzel according to participant preference but never the other circle c during generalization u were delivered twice and the two c were presented again plus four circle generalization stimulus g with gradually increasing diameter from c to c we found successful appetitive conditioning a reflected in appetitive subjective rating positive valence higher contingency and physiological response startle attenuation and larger skin conductance response to c versus c and importantly both measure confirmed generalization a indicated by generalization gradient small change in c u contingency during generalization may have weakened generalization process on the physiological level considering that appetitive conditioned response can be generalized to non u associated stimulus a next important step would be to investigate risk factor that mediate overgeneralization

abstract model of chronic somatic symptom assume that abnormality in interoception are related to the development and maintenance of symptom distress different model however disagree on the exact nature of the assumed abnormality cognitive behavioral model stress a hypervigilant cognitive style predicting higher interoceptive accuracy whereas predictive processing model assume a le detailed sensory processing predicting lower interoceptive accuracy this study aimed at testing the relationship between interoception and symptom perception using structural equation modeling association between cardiac interoception and symptom perception were tested in a sample of student n 316 and a second heterogeneous sample n 340 including 63 patient with either pathological health anxiety or a somatoform disorder according to dsm iv stronger sensory symptom perception in the cardiorespiratory system were associated with lower interoceptive accuracy in sample 2 the finding are more in line with the predictive processing approach suggesting le detailed and more biased interoception being associated with chronic somatic symptom distress

objective the study investigates the association between somatosensory amplification and the reporting of side effect it establishes a german version of the somatosensory amplification scale and examines it psychometric property in a representative sample of the german population method sample size wa 2 469 with 51 taking any medication participant answered the somatosensory amplification scale generic assessment of side effect scale and indicated whether they were taking any medication and the type of medication correlational analysis and binary logistic regression were performed result when examining a subsample reporting both medication intake and general bodily symptom participant higher in somatosensory amplification rated more of their general bodily symptom a medication attributed side effect however somatosensory amplification score were not associated with the intake of any type of medication in the overall sample higher somatosensory amplification score were associated with an increased report of bodily symptom additionally participant with higher somatosensory amplification reported intake of a greater number of different medication the psychometric property of the translated scale were good and previously established association of somatosensory amplification with demographic variable age sex were replicated conclusion result suggest a possible attributional bias concomitant to somatosensory amplification which in turn may increase the reporting of side effect after medication intake

cognitive factor play an important role in the etiology and maintenance of sexual difficulty to date research ha mostly relied on self report measure to ass negative cognition related to low sexual function to overcome the limitation of self report questionnaire a series of open ended ambiguous sexual scenario were developed and presented to participant n 600 m age 34 2 year who were asked to generate an ending by entering a continuation for each scenario valence of completed scenario wa rated by the participant and scenario ending were coded by two independent raters on three dimension namely reference to sexual problem sexual communication and the use of sexually explicit language sexual function wa assessed with the female sexual function index and the international index of erectile function multiple regression analysis were performed to ass whether the scenario based task wa associated with sexual function above and beyond other predictor e g sexual distress individual with lower sexual function rated the completed scenario more negatively and their ending included more reference to problem related to low sexual function in woman with low sexual function fewer ending included sexual communication with a partner or sexually explicit language our finding suggest that individual with low sexual function appraise ambiguous sexual situation more negatively than other individual future study may investigate whether such bias can be experimentally manipulated and whether change in cognitive bias may in turn lead to improvement in sexual function

objective little is known about the personal factor that increase vulnerability to job related stress and burnout among psychologist in training this study wa based on a large international sample and aimed to explore the role of early maladaptive schema em in predicting vulnerability to burnout a well a attendant effect on short term physical health in clinical and counseling postgraduate psychology trainee method an online quantitative cross sectional survey method design wa used to collect self report data that measured burnout em and physical health from 1 297 trainee result only the unrelenting standard u schema predicted high burnout among trainee the most commonly endorsed physical health symptom were back and neck pain and tiredness and were more severe for those experiencing high burnout conclusion the current study contributes to our understanding of the role of the u em in the evolution of burnout in trainee and ha implication for the development of self awareness training program for this population

posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd is characterized by sleep impairment and nightmare a pleasant odor presented during sleep affect the emotional tone of dream without inducing arousal we investigated whether sleep pattern in ptsd can be improved via nocturnal olfactory stimulation participant were 40 inpatient with ptsd n 35 woman age range 20 59 year who completed a randomized patient blind placebo controlled trial baseline measurement for 5 consecutive night wa followed by a 5 night experimental intervention or placebo trial during the intervention patient received nocturnal stimulation with a pleasant odor odor condition or clean air placebo condition via an olfactometer that delivered inspiration triggered stimulus in a nasal tube or via an odorized nasal clip after each night the patient completed standardized questionnaire that assessed sleep parameter and dream content each night sleep efficiency sleep onset latency and wakefulness after sleep onset were monitored with a motion biosensor baseline assessment revealed that ptsd severity wa associated with poorer sleep outcome an interaction effect showed that nocturnal odorization affected dream intensity post hoc test revealed an improvement in the group that used the nasal clip a compared to baseline d 0 68 no negative effect were observed after odorization with the nasal clip considering the limited sample size the study indicates that nocturnal olfactory stimulation may serve a a low cost concomitant intervention to improve sleep quality in ptsd

purpose side effect consist of drug specific and non specific symptom both component are based on bodily sensation that a person perceives after taking a drug and subsequently attribute to the drug we suggest that somatosensory amplification ssa may explain a proportion of inter individual difference in report of side effect that cannot be accounted for by drug specific safety profile this hypothesis wa investigated in hypertensive patient starting a new pharmacotherapy method this longitudinal study included 50 patient 66 woman aged 55 14 year with a diagnosis of primary hypertension patient completed the somatosensory amplification scale ssa started to take their new medication and recorded side effect on a daily basis for 4 week result after controlling for age gender number of pill taken and previous personal and family experience with medication side effect in the regression analysis ssa score remained a significant predictor of reported side effect over the entire study period week 1 and 2 beta 621 p 001 week 3 and 4 beta 493 p 003 in a subsample comprising patient taking the four most commonly used drug regime ssa wa a significant predictor of side effect even when controlling for type of medication conclusion in this sample of patient undergoing anti hypertensive pharmacotherapy higher ssa score predicted increased report of medication side effect to account for this tendency and to improve compliance with medication regime this group may require special education about the nocebo phenomenon

evidence suggests that asymmetry in frontal electrical activity predicts response to aversive experience such that higher left sided activity might dampen response to trauma reminder we measured frontal asymmetry at rest and during viewing of a trauma film and assessed startle response to film reminder image to explore potential moderator we compared two film study 1 n 64 and modulated reappraisal study 2 n 72 a expected left frontal activation during film viewing predicted dampened response in individual who viewed a staged road accident however this effect tended to be reversed when a genocide documentary wa used in study 2 all participant viewed the genocide film left frontal activity at rest again predicted higher startle response while reappraisal did not moderate the effect thus the type of trauma film play a crucial role in the effect of frontal asymmetry which warrant further critical investigation

background medically unexplained symptom are the hallmark of somatoform disorder and functional somatic syndrome purpose although medically unexplained symptom represent a common phenomenon both in the general population a well a in medical setting the exact latent structure of somatic symptom remains largely unclear method we examined the latent structure of medically unexplained symptom by mean of the patient health questionnaire 15 phq 15 questionnaire i e a popular symptom checklist and provide support for the construct validity of our model the data were analyzed using confirmatory factor analysis in a general population sample study 1 n 414 and in a sample of primary care patient study 2 n 308 we compared four different latent structure model of medically unexplained symptom a general factor model a correlated group factor model a hierarchical model and a bifactor model result in study 1 a bifactor model with one general factor and four independent specific symptom factor i e gastrointestinal pain fatigue and cardiopulmonary symptom showed the best model fit this bifactor model wa confirmed in the primary care sample study 2 additionally the model explained 59 of the variance of the irritable bowel syndrome ibs in this structural equation model both the general factor 14 a well a the gastrointestinal symptom factor 42 significantly predicted the ibs conclusion the finding of both study help to clarify the latent structure of somatic symptom in the phq 15 the bifactor model outperformed alternative model and demonstrated external validity in predicting ibs

objective fear of cancer recurrence or progress is strongly related to death anxiety da in cancer patient but due to lack of conceptualization and measurement method the relationship wa not analyzed quantitatively before the aim of the present study wa to investigate the conceptual relationship of both construct with da expected to be the general construct method cancer patient n 121 participated in an online study they provided information on socio demographical medical and psychological measure including da and fear of cancer recurrence or progression fop q sf relation of construct wa assessed using a two step process confirming individual construct structure with confirmatory factor analysis including correlation of construct and modification of measurement model followed by structural equation modeling and comparison of structure model for best model fit result the measurement model wa modified to include three residual correlation within and between construct comparison of structure model supported a bifactor structure with da a general factor and fear of recurrence or progression a group factor sbchi 2 173 207 74 p 0 05 sb 1 538 relative chi 2 1 2 rrmsea 0 05 0 01 0 07 p 0 05 srmr 0 07 cfi 0 94 aic 7543 60 conclusion da can be interpreted a general factor to fear of cancer recurrence or progression psychological intervention to reduce emotional burden of cancer patient need to focus additionally on existential threat and individual fear regarding da

background the process through which social support exerts it influence in daily life are not well understood arguably it salutary effect a an environmental variable might be construed a shared effect of personality method to test this possibility we investigated the unique and shared effect of personality and social support on daily stressor exposure social conflict task strain and on the within person association of stressor exposure with perceived stress a community sample of n 391 adult completed an ambulatory assessment protocol for two 2 day period with fixed hourly interval spread across 16 hr result consistent with our preregistered hypothesis multilevel structural equation model returned that both personality and perceived social support predicted daily stressor exposure and moderated within person effect of daily stressor on perceived stress in contrast to our hypothesis received social support had no effect on daily stress process when extraversion neuroticism and social support were added a joint predictor neuroticism and extraversion were related to stressor exposure and further moderated the within person link between stressor exposure and stress experience while perceived social support had an incremental beneficial effect on social conflict exposure and stress appraisal conclusion social support doe not increment the well established relationship between neuroticism or extraversion and stress reactivity

abstract background diminished facial expressiveness is a consistent finding in schizophrenia which appears to be most pronounced for positive facial expression ie smiling a an affiliative signal smiling ha the potential to be a behavioral marker of negative symptom and could be associated with functional outcome however most study investigated facial expression in people with schizophrenia in nonaffiliative context and rarely in face to face interaction furthermore only few study have looked at the social consequence of reduced facial expressiveness we hypothesized that people with schizophrenia in an affiliative face to face interaction 1 would display le smiling than control and that 2 low expressive patient compared to high expressive patient would exhibit more negative symptom lower social competence and receive more negative social evaluation method the sample consisted of 52 patient with a schizophrenia spectrum disorder and 39 healthy control all participant engaged in an affiliative role play with a study confederate independent set of raters then coded these interaction for the amount of smiling using the facial expression coding system face kring sloan 2007 social competence and desire for future interaction with the participant moreover in the patient sample we assessed psychotic symptom depressive symptom and social role functioning with structured interview we performed a median split within the patient sample distinguishing low and high expressive patient with respect to amount of smiling and tested for difference between the resulting group on all dependent measure we also tested for difference between the 2 patient group and control where measure were available result compared to control participant with a schizophrenia spectrum disorder exhibited significantly lower level of smiling d 0 56 significantly lower social competence d 0 68 and were evaluated a le desirable for future interaction d 0 58 however only participant in the low but not in the high expressive patient group differed from control on these 3 variable low expressive patient differed from high expressive patient with respect to negative symptom d 0 72 social functioning d 0 63 social competence d 0 66 and desire for future interaction d 0 80 no difference between the 2 patient group were found on other symptom dimension eg positive disorganized depression any sample characteristic and medication dose conclusion our finding corroborate emerging evidence suggesting that diminished smiling behavior in schizophrenia is a behavioral substrate of negative symptom in face to face interaction and indicative of negative functional outcome our result highlight the need for developing treatment that foster affiliative interaction skill in schizophrenia

model of social anxiety disorder sad stress the relevance of physiological arousal so far limited research ha been conducted in child with sad in experimental stress design thus examining autonomic arousal child with and without sad completed a standardized social stressor trier social stress test for child c tsst c pre existing difference to healthy control hc were expected to decrease after receiving cognitive behavior therapy cbt child with sad n 64 and hc child n 55 completed a tsst c child with sad participated in a second tsst c after either cognitive behavioral treatment or a waitlist control period wlc a expected child with sad showed blunted heart rate reactivity compared to hc child further child with sad had elevated level of tonic sympathetic arousal a indexed by skin conductance level compared to hc child with sad showed lower parasympathetic arousal during the baseline compared to hc child receiving treatment did not differ from child in the wlc condition in a repeated social stress test psychophysiological difference between child with sad and hc child could be confirmed a indicated by previous research the lack of physiological effect of the intervention a an experimental manipulation might be related to slower change in physiology compared to e g cognition
