despite growing evidence on effect of parenthood on social understanding little is known about the influence of parenthood on theory of mind tom the capacity to infer mental and affective state of others it is also unclear whether any possible effect of parenthood on tom would generalise to inferring state of adult or are specific to child we investigated neural activation in mother and woman without child while they predicted action intention from child and adult face region of interest analysis showed stronger activation in mother in the bilateral posterior cingulate cortex precuneus tom related area and insulae emotion related area whole brain analysis revealed that mother compared to non mother more strongly activated area including the left angular gyrus and the ventral prefrontal cortex but le strongly activated the right supramarginal gyrus and the dorsal prefrontal cortex these difference were not specific to child stimulus but occurred in response to both adult and child stimulus and might indicate that mother and non mother employ different strategy to infer action intention from affective face whether these general difference in affective tom between mother and non mother are due to biological or experience related change should be subject of further investigation

background emotion regulation play a critical role in the development and maintenance of psychological disorder le is known about the association of affective style and psychopathology the 20 item affective style questionnaire asq ha been validated in nonclinical sample the american and german validation study resulted in a three factor structure concealing adjusting and tolerating the present study aimed to investigate three aspect 1 the validation of the asq within a clinical sample 2 the examination of possible difference in affective style between patient suffering from affective versus anxiety disorder and 3 the association of affective style and anxiety depression and stress symptom method overall 917 patient receiving cognitive behavioral therapy at an outpatient clinic participated in this study 550 participant were female all data were collected before the beginning of treatment result confirmatory factor analysis revealed the same three factor structure found in the previous western sample cfi 0 90 rmsea 0 06 concealing alpha 0 81 adjusting alpha 0 71 and tolerating alpha 0 70 significantly lower score in the asq subscale adjusting were found in patient suffering from affective disorder than patient suffering from anxiety disorder the result of the regression analysis showed that the asq adjusting and concealing behavior seem to play a more important role than the erq reappraisal and suppression for depression anxiety and stress among clinical population limitation a number of limitation must be taken into consideration while evaluating the present study first and foremost the clinical data were based on primary diagnosis we did not ascertain comorbid diagnosis this distinction may be important since affective and anxiety disorder are often linked to each other in addition we only used data collected before the beginning of psychotherapeutic treatment and were therefore not able to analyze change in affective style during and after intervention furthermore all data were based on self reported information of patient we did not implement either a therapeutic rating of affective style or physiological measure for instance arousal which could have shown whether the used strategy successfully reduce negative emotion future research should address this question another limitation is the fact that we concentrated on the main category of mental disorder and therefore did not subdivide patient with affective and anxiety disorder in term of their concrete diagnosis this is of special importance because there might also be difference in affective style within the main category

diagnosis and treatment of breast cancer is a very emotionally aversive and stressful life event which can lead to impaired cognitive functioning and mental health breast cancer survivor responding with repressive emotion regulation strategy often show le adaptive coping and adverse outcome we investigated cognitive functioning and neural correlate of emotion processing using erps self report measure of depression anxiety and fatigue a well a hair cortisol a an index of chronic stress were assessed twenty breast cancer survivor bcs and 31 carefully matched healthy control participated in the study after neuropsychological testing and subjective assessment participant viewed 30 neutral 30 unpleasant and 30 pleasant picture and erps were recorded recognition memory wa tested 1 week later bcs reported stronger complaint about cognitive impairment and more symptom of depression anxiety and fatigue moreover they showed elevated hair cortisol level except for verbal memory cognitive functioning wa predominantly in the normative range recognition memory performance wa decreased in cancer survivor especially for emotional content in erps survivor showed smaller late positive potential amplitude for unpleasant picture relative to control in a later time window which may indicate le elaborative processing of this material taken together we found cognitive impairment in bcs in verbal memory impaired emotional picture memory accuracy and reduced neural activity when breast cancer survivor were confronted with unpleasant material further study and larger sample size however are needed to evaluate the relationship between altered emotion processing and reduced memory in bcs in order to develop new treatment strategy

objective the current study examined experimentally whether a manipulated attention bias for food cue increase craving chocolate intake and motivation to search for hidden chocolate method to test the effect of attention for food on subsequent chocolate intake attention for chocolate wa experimentally modified by instructing participant to look at chocolate stimulus attend chocolate group or at non food stimulus attend shoe group during a novel attention bias modification task antisaccade task chocolate consumption change in craving and search time for hidden chocolate were assessed eye movement recording were used to monitor the accuracy during the experimental attention modification task a possible moderator of effect regression analysis were conducted to test the effect of attention modification and modification accuracy on chocolate intake craving and motivation to search for hidden chocolate result result showed that participant with higher accuracy 1 sd ate more chocolate when they had to attend to chocolate and ate le chocolate when they had to attend to non food stimulus in contrast for participant with lower accuracy 1 sd the result were exactly reversed no effect of the experimental attention modification on craving or search time for hidden chocolate were found limitation we used chocolate a food stimulus so it remains unclear how our finding generalize to other type of food conclusion these finding demonstrate further evidence for a link between attention for food and food intake and provide an indication about the direction of this relationship

abstract convergent evidence support a crucial role for dysfunctional appraisal in the development and maintenance of post traumatic stress disorder ptsd however most research in this area ha used self report measure assessing only explicit form of such negative cognition the relevance of their more automatically activated counterpart a assumed by cognitive model remains relatively unexplored the current study aimed to further our understanding of the potential utility of measuring automatic dysfunctional association in the context of posttraumatic stress the relationship between score on two different implicit association test iats and posttraumatic stress symptom wa investigated in a sample of adult n 279 who reported having experienced a potentially traumatic negative life event participant completed the two iats one assessing self traumatized association the other self vulnerable association a self report measure of dysfunctional appraisal and measure of posttraumatic stress symptom and other aspect of psychopathology online score indicating higher level of dysfunctional association on both iats were associated with higher level of posttraumatic stress symptom only score on the iat measuring self vulnerable association and not the iat measuring self traumatized association continued to show an association with posttraumatic stress symptom after controlling for explicit dysfunctional appraisal overall the result indicate the value of investigating ptsd relevant automatic association to further develop our understanding of cognitive process implicated in posttraumatic stress

the covid 19 outbreak strongly restricted daily activity creating a risk factor for negative affect and depression this study assessed the immediate effect of a behavioural activation ba intervention on positive pa and negative na state affect we expected depression and anxiety to function a moderator reducing the intervention effect in a quasi experimental online study 3624 german speaking participant evaluated a list of rewarding activity between 9 april and 26 april 2020 a subsample of 2561 71 additionally engaged in an imagination task depression anxiety socioeconomic variable and covid 19 related burden were assessed a moderator there wa an increase in pa total sample d 13 subsample d 27 and a decrease in na total sample d 0 68 subsample d 0 71 all p 001 the effect rose with higher level of depression and anxiety all p 001 furthermore living with family enhanced the effect on na while additionally having to take care of child reduced them an easy to use intervention prompting ba could improve state mood during lockdown participant with higher depression and anxiety benefit more implication for the prevention of mental health problem during a pandemic are discussed

among patient with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd 65 85 manifest another psychiatric disorder concomitantly or at some other time point during their life ocd is highly heritable a are many of it comorbidities a possible genetic heterogeneity of ocd in relation to it comorbid condition however ha not yet been exhaustively explored we used a framework of different approach to study the genetic relationship of ocd with three commonly observed comorbidities namely major depressive disorder mdd attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd and autism spectrum disorder asd first using publicly available summary statistic from large scale genome wide association study we compared genetic correlation pattern for ocd mdd adhd and asd with 861 somatic and mental health phenotype secondly we examined how polygenic risk score pr of eight trait that showed heterogeneous correlation pattern with ocd mdd adhd and asd partitioned across comorbid subgroup in ocd using independent unpublished data from the lundbeck foundation initiative for integrative psychiatric research ipsych the comorbid subgroup comprised of patient with only ocd n 366 ocd and mdd n 1 052 ocd and adhd n 443 ocd and asd n 388 and ocd with more than 1 comorbidity n 429 we found that pr of all trait but bmi were significantly associated with ocd across all subgroup neuroticism p 1 19 x 10 32 bipolar disorder p 7 51 x 10 8 anorexia nervosa p 3 52 x 10 20 age at first birth p 9 38 x 10 5 educational attainment p 1 56 x 10 4 ocd p 1 87 x 10 6 insomnia p 2 61 x 10 5 bmi p 0 15 for age at first birth educational attainment and insomnia pr estimate significantly differed across comorbid subgroup p 2 29 x 10 4 p 1 63 x 10 4 and p 0 045 respectively especially for anorexia nervosa age at first birth educational attainment insomnia and neuroticism the correlation pattern that emerged from genetic correlation analysis of ocd mdd adhd and asd were mirrored in the pr association with the respective comorbid ocd group dissecting the polygenic architecture we found both quantitative and qualitative polygenic heterogeneity across ocd comorbid subgroup

background emotional eating is associated with overeating and the development of obesity yet empirical evidence for individual trait difference in emotional eating and cognitive mechanism that contribute to eating during sad mood remain equivocal aim the aim of this study wa to test if attention bias for food moderate the effect of self reported emotional eating during sad mood v neutral mood on actual food intake it wa expected that emotional eating is predictive of elevated attention for food and higher food intake after an experimentally induced sad mood and that attentional maintenance on food predicts food intake during a sad versus a neutral mood method participant n 85 were randomly assigned to one of the two experimental mood induction condition sad neutral attentional bias for high caloric food were measured by eye tracking during a visual probe task with pictorial food and neutral stimulus self reported emotional eating wa assessed with the dutch eating behavior questionnaire debq and ad libitum food intake wa tested by a disguised food offer result hierarchical multivariate regression modeling showed that self reported emotional eating did not account for change in attention allocation for food or food intake in either condition yet attention maintenance on food cue wa significantly related to increased intake specifically in the neutral condition but not in the sad mood condition discussion the current finding show that self reported emotional eating based on the debq might not validly predict who overeats when sad at least not in a laboratory setting with healthy woman result further suggest that attention maintenance on food relates to eating motivation when in a neutral affective state and might therefore be a cognitive mechanism contributing to increased food intake in general but maybe not during sad mood

previous research on autonomic characteristic of social anxiety in child and adolescent ha produced highly inconsistent result which may partially be due to task difference and a limited breadth of autonomic measurement here we investigated a sample of high hsa and low socially anxious lsa child aged 10 12 year before during and after a standardized evaluated speech task while acquiring a broad set of autonomic and experiential measure during baseline we found evidence for tonically higher sympathetic autonomic activity in hsa child indicated by higher low frequency heart rate variability lf and a trend for higher lf to high frequency heart rate variability ratio lf hf in response to the speech task hsa child showed blunted cardiac responding evidenced by slower increase and delayed recovery of heart rate and a similar significant trend on lf hf value self reported anxiety by contrast showed enhanced reactivity from baseline to anticipation in the hsa compared to the lsa group the result suggest a restricted cardiac flexibility in hsa child and illustrate that broad autonomic assessment during a well structured naturalistic task may improve our understanding of the autonomic physiology of socially anxious child the result have implication for current theory of social anxiety

a computer based emotional competence inventory for preschooler and school aged child mekki wa developed to ass five component of emotional competence emotion vocabulary emotion identification situational visual auditory emotion understanding emotion expression and emotion regulation validity reliability and factor structure were examined in a community sample of 313 preschooler and school aged child 164 boy 145 girl 4 n a age 4 11 year m 6 35 year sd 1 85 item statistic and cronbach s alpha were calculated for the subscales the unidimensionality of the subscales wa additionally tested via item response theory or confirmatory factor analysis internal consistency alpha wa overall satisfactory at 0 82 though the consistency of the visual and auditory emotion identification subscales were lower unidimensionality wa demonstrated for all subscales except emotion understanding result provide support for the use of the mekki in research and clinical setting to ass emotional competence

the qlis quality of life in schizophrenia is a disease specific questionnaire with high content validity and sound psychometric property it comprises 54 item related to 12 subscales however it use in survey or clinical study is limited due to it length our aim wa to develop and validate a short form of the qlis four step were taken to develop the short form qlis sf using sample from the clinical analysis of the treatment of schizophrenia study 1 a model with second order scale wa developed using exploratory factor analysis 2 the resulting model wa tested in an independent sample using confirmative factor analysis cfa 3 based on this model item were selected on ground of distributional property content review and item loading 4 the resulting short form wa validated independently through cfa result three second order scale were constructed illness related quality of life social life and global subjective well being cfa of the new theoretical model resulted in a cfi of 0 67 and absolute fit index of cmin df 2 55 rmsea 0 08 srmr 0 09 we selected 13 item that showed good statistical property and good fit of content to subscale fit of the underlying theoretical model with the 13 item wa satisfactory cfi 0 95 cmin df 2 23 rmsea 0 06 srmr 0 04 composite reliability score for the three subscales were above 0 70 the qlis sf showed adequate model fit and reliability it offer a novel well founded opportunity to ass quality of life in person with schizophrenia in situation in which the application of the long version is not considered possible disclosure of interest the author have not supplied their declaration of competing interest

the early processing of visual sexual stimulus show sign of automaticity moreover there is evidence for sex specific pattern in cognitive and physiological responding to erotica however little is known about the time course of rapid pupillary response to sexual stimulus and their correspondence with other measure of autonomic activity in woman and men to study pupil dilation a an implicit measure of sexual arousal at various stage of picture processing we presented 35 heterosexual participant with picture showing either erotic couple or single male female erotic nude contrasted with people involved in everyday situation brightness adjusted grayscale picture were shown for a duration of 2 500 m within the central visual field alternating with perceptually matched patch left pupil diameter wa recorded at 500 hz using a video based eye tracker skin conductance and heart rate were coregistered and correlated with latent component of pupil dilation dissociated by temporal pca whereas stimulus evoked change in pupil size indicated virtually no initial constriction a rapid effect of appetence emerged dilation to erotica within 500 m response at early stage of processing were remarkably consistent across both sex in contrast later phase of pupil dilation subjective rating and skin conductance response showed a sex specific pattern moreover evidence for an association of early onset pupil dilation and heart rate acceleration wa found suggestive of parasympathetic inhibition whereas the late component wa mainly related to sympathetically mediated skin conductance taken together our result indicate that different temporal component of pupil response to erotic stimulus may reflect divergent underlying neural mechanism

in patient with anxiety and or respiratory disease body sensation particularly from the respiratory system may increase in intensity and aversiveness and thus lead into defensive action e g escape or panic the process however that might contribute to the culmination of symptom and the switch into defensive action have not been well understood yet the current study aimed at evaluating an experimental paradigm to characterize the dynamic of defensive mobilization to body sensation increasing in intensity and aversiveness person reporting low and high suffocation fear sf n 69 were exposed to increasingly unpleasant feeling of dyspnea induced by inspiratory resistive load and a breathing occlusion requiring voluntary breath holding respiratory response were assessed along with subjective report of anxiety and panic symptom presentation of respiratory load with increasing physical resistance led to increasingly unpleasant feeling of dyspnea twenty eight participant terminated the exposure prematurely at least once when dyspnea wa severe high compared to low sf person exhibited an increased respiratory rate that wa accompanied by report of more intense panic symptom premature termination of exposure were preceded by a surge in anxiety breathing frequency and mouth pressure and a decrease in tidal volume we successfully established an experimental paradigm to ass change in defensive responding with increasing intensity of an interoceptive threat the current data foster our understanding of behavioral expression pattern observed in patient with anxiety and or respiratory disease and the process involved in the culmination of bodily sensation and anxiety into panic

the outbreak of covid 19 caused high psychological burden for many people some people tend to excessive social medium use smu to escape the negative emotion which can foster addictive tendency the present study investigated positive mental health pmh and mindfulness a protective factor that could reduce the risk for addictive smu data of 1 049 participant from germany were assessed via online survey in autumn 2021 the current result reveal a positive relationship between covid 19 burden and addictive smu both were negatively linked to pmh and mindfulness in a moderated mediation analysis the relationship between covid 19 burden and addictive smu wa mediated by pmh mindfulness moderated the association between pmh and addictive smu the covid 19 situation can be burdensome and contribute to dysfunctional coping strategy such a addictive smu however pmh and mindfulness serve a protective factor the protective effect of mindfulness could be especially important for person with low pmh

background previous research suggests that bipolar disorder bd is characterized by deficit in cognitive control cc impaired cc ha been found in high risk sample and is associated with the maintenance of bd symptom it remains unclear however whether bd is characterized by a general deficit in cc or by a deficit that is specifically related to the processing of emotional material method the sample consisted of 42 remitted bipolar patient and 39 healthy control hc we examined whether bd individual display impaired cc when confronted with negative a well a positive material using an arithmetic inhibition task that required inhibition of pictorial stimulus material result whereas both group showed difficulty in exerting cc over negative material only bd individual exhibited deficient cc over positive material limitation even though we intended the negative and positive picture in the arithmetic inhibition task to be similarly arousing participant in the current study rated the negative compared to the positive picture a more arousing conclusion bd is associated with impaired cc when processing emotional especially positive stimulus even when patient are in remission possible implication of this deficit especially for emotion regulation are discussed

individual difference in general cognitive ability i e intelligence have been linked to individual variation in the modular organization of functional brain network however these analysis have been limited to static time averaged connectivity and have not yet addressed whether dynamic change in the configuration of brain network relate to general intelligence here we used multiband functional mri resting state data n 281 and estimated subject specific time varying functional connectivity network modularity optimization wa applied to determine individual time variant module partition and to ass fluctuation in modularity across time we show that higher intelligence indexed by an established composite measure the wechsler abbreviated scale of intelligence wasi is associated with higher temporal stability lower temporal variability of brain network modularity post hoc analysis reveal that subject with higher intelligence score engage in fewer period of extremely high modularity which are characterized by greater disconnection of task positive from task negative network further we show that brain region of the dorsal attention network contribute most to the observed effect in sum our study suggests that investigating the temporal dynamic of functional brain network topology contributes to our understanding of the neural base of general cognitive ability

testosterone ha been linked to alteration in the activity of emotion neurocircuitry including amygdala orbitofrontal cortex ofc and insula and diminished functional amygdala prefrontal coupling such association have only ever been studied using acute measure of testosterone thus little is known about respective relationship with long term testosterone secretion here we examine association between hair testosterone concentration htc an index of long term cumulative testosterone level and neural reactivity during an emotional passive viewing task using functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri forty six men viewed negative positive and neutral picture in the mri htcs were assessed from 2 cm hair segment the emotional paradigm elicited neural activation in the amygdala insula and ofc htcs were associated with increased reactivity to negative picture in the insula and increased reactivity to positive picture in the ofc we show an association of long term testosterone level with increased emotional reactivity in the brain these result suggest a heightened emotional vigilance in individual with high trait testosterone level

objective according to the bio psycho social health model of the who chronic illness should not only be described at the level of symptom but in respect to capacity limitation method patient with common mental disorder n 1143 n 808 employed n 581 workplace problem were investigated concerning their self rated capacity mini icf app s result employed patient reported better capacity than unemployed patient among the employed patient those without workplace problem reported better capacity than those with workplace problem different type of workplace problem were related with specific capacity level for example problem with bullying or conflict were associated with lower interactional capacity assertiveness group integration dyadic relation whereas patient with over taxation problem perceived lower level of flexibility competency structuring of task proactivity and endurance conclusion the capacity self rating mini icf app s can depict differentiated capacity profile that may be indicative for specific type of workplace problem

background work anxiety is a potentially disabling mental health problem which can cause long term sickness absence in many case patient do not openly report their anxiety and tend to give externalizing explanation of inner problem therefore people with work anxiety may perceive their workplace more negatively than those without such anxiety aim to investigate the relation between subjective work description and work anxiety method work anxiety wa investigated with a standardized interview in a sample of employed psychosomatic rehabilitation inpatient suffering from common mental disorder we assessed their subjective perception and evaluation of workplace condition with the short questionnaire for job analysis kfza and compared their result with those from a sample of employee in the general population result there were 148 inpatient participant and 8015 general population control patient with work anxiety described their workplace significantly more negatively than patient without work anxiety and employee in the general population with no difference in workplace description between psychosomatic patient without work anxiety and the general population sample the type of complaint about work condition wa related to the specific type of work anxiety conclusion report about workplace burden can be indicative of work anxiety and should prompt further in depth assessment the content of complaint about work condition may point to the type of underlying work anxiety

despite the distracting effect of emotional stimulus on concurrent task performance human are able to uphold goal directed behavior here we investigated the hypothesis that this effect is due to the enhanced recruitment of task specific neural resource in a two step functional magnetic resonance imaging study we first localized those area involved in mental arithmetic by contrasting arithmetic problem with a number detection task the resulting activation map were then used a mask in a second experiment that compared the effect of neutral and emotional distracter image on mental arithmetic we found increased response time in the emotional distracter condition accompanied by enhanced activation in task specific area including superior parietal cortex dorsolateral and dorsomedial prefrontal cortex this activation increase correlated with larger behavioral impairment through emotional distraction similar error rate in both condition indicate that cognitive task performance is preserved through enhanced recruitment of task specific neural resource when emotional distracter stimulus are present

the integrated motivational volitional imv model of suicide posit that perceived burdensomeness and thwarted belongingness moderate the association between perception of entrapment and suicide ideation however the proposed moderation is yet to be tested possible moderator effect were investigated in an online sample n 480 74 female m age 28 5 sd age 11 1 entrapment and perceived burdensomeness predicted suicide ideation however neither perceived burdensomeness nor thwarted belongingness moderated the association between entrapment and suicide ideation the present result do not support a key assumption of the imv model nonetheless they underscore the importance of perceived burdensomeness and entrapment in the prediction of suicide ideation

recent model of eating disorder emphasize the importance of ruminative thinking in the occurrence of unhealthy eating behavior hence the aim of the current study wa to examine the influence of induced rumination and distraction on the desire to engage in eating related symptom in anorexia an and bulimia nervosa bn after a sadness induction either a ruminative or distractive emotion regulation style wa encouraged in woman with an n 38 bn n 37 and non eating disordered control cg n 36 at baseline and after the emotion regulation induction feeling of sadness desire to abstain from eating dta and desire to binge dtb were assessed main result reveal that rumination led to a significant increase of dta in the an group and of dtb in patient with bn in the cg dta significantly decreased after distraction although there were significant increase in subjective sadness in the rumination condition no change were found in the distraction condition the result suggest that rumination in response to sadness ha a detrimental effect on eating related symptom in eating disorder

electrophysiological study in rodent allow recording neural activity during threat with high temporal and spatial precision although fmri ha helped translate insight about the anatomy of underlying brain circuit to human the temporal dynamic of neural fear process remain opaque and require eeg to date study on electrophysiological brain signal in human have helped to elucidate underlying perceptual and attentional process but have widely ignored how fear memory trace evolve over time the low signal to noise ratio of eeg demand aggregation across high number of trial which will wash out transient neurobiological process that are induced by learning and prone to habituation here our goal wa to unravel the plasticity and temporal emergence of eeg response during fear conditioning to this end we developed a new sequential set fear conditioning paradigm that comprises three successive acquisition and extinction phase each with a novel c c set each set consists of two different neutral face on different background color which serve a c and c respectively thereby this design provides sufficient trial for eeg analysis while tripling the relative amount of trial that tap into more transient neurobiological process consistent with prior study on erp component data driven topographic eeg analysis revealed that erp amplitude were potentiated during time period from 33 60 m 108 200 m and 468 820 m indicating that fear conditioning prioritizes early sensory processing in the brain but also facilitates neural responding during later attentional and evaluative stage importantly averaging across the three c c set allowed u to probe the temporal evolution of neural process response during each of the three time window gradually increased from early to late fear conditioning while long latency 460 730 m electrocortical response diminished throughout fear extinction our novel paradigm demonstrates how short mid and long latency eeg response change during fear conditioning and extinction finding that enlighten the learning curve of neurophysiological response to threat in human

background and aim the use of pornography while unproblematic for the majority can grow into addiction like behavior which in it extreme form is labeled a compulsive sexual behavioral disorder in the icd 11 who 2018 the aim of this study wa to investigate the addiction specific reactivity to cue in order to better understand underlying mechanism in the development of this disorder method we have used an optimized sexual incentive delay task to study brain activity in reward associated brain area during an anticipation phase with cue predicting pornographic video control video or no video and a corresponding delivery phase in healthy men correlation to indicator of problematic pornography use the time spent on pornography use and trait sexual motivation were analyzed result the result of 74 men showed that reward related brain area amygdala dorsal cingulate cortex orbitofrontal cortex nucleus accumbens thalamus putamen caudate nucleus and insula were significantly more activated by both the pornographic video and the pornographic cue than by control video and control cue respectively however we found no relationship between these activation and indicator of problematic pornography use time spent on pornography use or with trait sexual motivation discussion and conclusion the activity in reward related brain area to both visual sexual stimulus a well a cue indicates that optimization of the sexual incentive delay task wa successful presumably association between reward related brain activity and indicator for problematic or pathological pornography use might only occur in sample with increased level and not in a rather healthy sample used in the present study

positive and negative mental health are independent but correlated concept yet it is unknown whether positive mental health doe co occur with suicide ideation the present study aimed to determine the proportion of patient who have positive mental health a well a suicide ideation inpatient n 100 and outpatient n 182 completed self report measure of positive mental health suicide ideation and lifetime suicide attempt eleven outpatient 6 and ten inpatient 10 with suicide ideation reported moderate to high level of positive mental health lifetime suicide attempt were le likely in inpatient who suffered from suicide ideation in the presence of positive mental health positive mental health doe co occur with suicide ideation and should be considered a a protective factor in suicide risk assessment

in psychotherapy research the measurement of treatment process and outcome are predominantly based on self report however given new technological development other potential source can be considered to improve measurement in a feasibility study we examined whether ecological momentary assessment ema using digital phenotyping stress level can be a valuable tool to investigate change process during cognitive behavioral therapy cbt seven outpatient undergoing psychological treatment were assessed using ema continuous stress level heart rate variability were assessed via fitness tracker garmin every 3 min over a 2 week time period 6 720 measurement per patient time varying change point autoregressive tvcp ar model were employed to detect both gradual and abrupt change in stress level result for seven case example indicate differential pattern of change process in stress more precisely inertia of stress level changed gradually over time in one of the participant whereas the other participant showed both gradual and abrupt change this feasibility study demonstrates that intensive longitudinal assessment enriched by digitally assessed stress level have the potential to investigate intra and interindividual difference in treatment change process and their relation to treatment outcome further implementation issue and implication for future research and development using digital phenotyping are discussed

a distorted body image and pronounced body dissatisfaction are hallmark of anorexia nervosa an that typically result in dietary restraint and compensatory behaviour cognitive bias such a negative interpretation bias are considered key maintaining factor of these maladaptive cognition and behaviour however little attention ha been paid to empirical test whether negative interpretation bias exists in an and to what degree it is associated with symptom severity participant in the present study were 40 woman with an and 40 healthy woman with no history of an eating disorder body related negative interpretation bias i e a tendency to interpret ambiguous information about the own body in a negative way wa measured by a scrambled sentence task patient with an showed a stronger body related negative interpretation bias than healthy control within both group negative interpretation bias correlated strongly and positively with an symptom severity and these effect were not moderated by level of depressive symptom the finding support the idea that biased interpretation of body related information is associated with the specific psychopathology of an targeted computerised intervention e g interpretation bias modification may help to alter these dysfunctional cognitive schema that lie at the heart of an

abstract background chronically stressed people often suffer from anxiety and depressive mood hypnosis is a technique that can induce a relaxation response and reduce negative stress symptom objective this explorative study investigated the impact of a single relaxation hypnosis session on stress related psychological symptom method 47 suggestible stressed individual 87 female were randomized to a hypnosis group n 23 20 minute hypnosis or a control group n 24 20 minute scientific documentary before and after the intervention we assessed perceived stress negative affect anxiety and depressive mood result after the hypnosis intervention depressive mood d 0 36 and state anxiety d 1 00 decreased while negative affect remained stable d 0 04 perceived stress wa reduced in both group conclusion a single relaxation hypnosis session decreased stress related symptom in chronically stressed individual our result substantiated the stress alleviating effect of hypnosis

background visual attention to sexual stimulus is an important mean to facilitate sexual arousal and is thereby relevant for healthy sexual functioning experimental study suggest that sexual dysfunction is associated with le attention toward sexual stimulus aim the goal of this study wa to use an eye tracking based free viewing paradigm to investigate whether woman in the clinical range of sexual function attend to a genital area in visual sexual stimulus differently than woman with subclinical sexual function or those with normal sexual functioning method toward this goal 69 woman m age 27 77 sd 8 00 range 19 54 with clinical n 30 subclinical n 23 and normal n 16 level of sexual functioning watched a series of 10 picture depicting heterosexual couple during vaginal intercourse while their eye movement were recorded each picture wa presented twice once with a distracting object eg a to do list or household appliance present in the picture and once without for 8 second each outcome 5 eye tracking measure indicative of different aspect of initial and sustained attention were analyzed result a hypothesized 3 out of 5 eye tracking measure ie first fixation duration number of first fixation and total fixation duration indicated that woman in the clinical group attended le to the genital area in the picture than woman with normal sexual functioning for 2 index ie first fixation duration and total fixation duration woman with subclinical v normal sexual functioning also attended le to the genital area in contrast to our hypothesis the presence of a distracting object did not influence attention to the genital area in either of the sexual function group clinical implication this study provides further evidence of the role of attentional bias in sexual dysfunction in woman strength and limitation eye tracking methodology allows for a continuous measurement of visual attention this is one of the first study using this methodology to ass difference in visual attention in woman with and without sexual dysfunction however the cross sectional nature of this study prevents causal interpretation of finding conclusion future study should use experimental paradigm to determine the causal role of visual attention for the development or maintenance of sexual dysfunction velten j milani s margraf j et al visual attention to sexual stimulus in woman with clinical subclinical and normal sexual functioning an eye tracking study j sex med 2021 18 144 155

the development of eating disorder is associated with a body related attentional bias although eating disorder are especially prevalent in adolescence so far no study ha analyzed gaze pattern and state body image in response to viewing one s own body in youth to fill this gap the present study aimed to examine a body related attentional bias and state body satisfaction in adolescent with various form of eating disorder girl with anorexia nervosa restrictive type an r n 30 anorexia nervosa binge eating purging type an bp n 26 bulimia nervosa bn n 22 clinical control with anxiety disorder n 20 and healthy control n 43 looked at photograph of their own and a peer s body while their spontaneous eye movement were recorded after stimulus presentation state body satisfaction and individual attractiveness rating for area of the presented stimulus were assessed an analysis of variance revealed that participant of all subgroup showed an attentive preference for unattractive area of one s own body girl with an r attended significantly longer to unattractive body area than both control group and significantly shorter to attractive body area than healthy control state body dissatisfaction wa more prominent in all eating disorder subgroup with significantly lower score in bn compared to an r in general the higher the state body dissatisfaction the stronger wa the deficit orientation on one s own body the attentional bias towards unattractive body area which is most pronounced in an r indicates that intervention aiming to modify distorted attention might be promising in the prevention and treatment of eating disorder in adolescence

this study examines student use of self regulated motor learning strategy related to a congruent or incongruent teacher student fit constellation of perceived and preferred teaching behavior in a cross sectional study in german grammar school 1452 student and 18 physical education teacher participated the result of the study indicate that student apply more self regulated motor learning strategy in specific fit constellation in addition when the teacher self perception of teaching behavior exceeds the respective perception and preference of the student this overregulation impairs the satisfaction with and interest in physical education a well a self regulated motor learning

introduction the present study investigated mechanism that may contribute to the enhanced risk of narcissistic individual to develop facebook addiction method in a sample of 449 facebook user age m sd 31 07 9 52 range 18 65 the personality trait narcissism facebook flow intensity of facebook use and facebook addiction were assessed by an online survey result in a moderated mediation analysis the positive relationship between narcissism and facebook addiction wa positively mediated by the level of flow experienced on facebook intensity of facebook use moderated the positive association between facebook flow and facebook addiction conclusion excessive facebook use may cause psychological dependence narcissistic individual are at enhanced risk for this form of dependence that is fostered by experience of flow during facebook use and intensity of facebook use current result should be taken into account when assessing individual at risk for pathological facebook use and when planning specific intervention to deal with it

background the substantial number of young refugee who have arrived in europe since 2015 requires rapid screening to identify those in need of treatment however translated version of screening measure are not always available necessitating the support of interpreter the child and adolescent trauma screen cat is a validated questionnaire for posttraumatic stress symptom here we report on the psychometric property of the cat in a sample of young refugee a a function of interpreter involvement method a total of n 145 m age 16 8 sd 1 54 93 male were assessed with the cat with half of the screening conducted with and half without interpreter post hoc analysis included calculating internal consistency using cronbach s alpha we used confirmative factor analysis to investigate the factor structure result the cat total scale showed good reliability alpha 0 84 difference in psychometric property between the interpreter v the no interpreter group were minor and tended to be in favor of the interpreter group result of a confirmatory factor analysis were acceptable after the exclusion of item with low item scale correlation conclusion the sample and the administration of the assessment represent the situation of young refugee in germany where resource are low and translated version not always available the cat may be a helpful screening tool for clinician working with young refugee even when administered with an interpreter limitation include the post hoc design of the analysis without randomization of participant and the lack of a third comparison group using translated questionnaire version

background and objective efficacious intervention soon after trauma exposure to prevent posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd are scarce evidence suggests that post trauma reminder cue to reactivate trauma memory followed by a cognitive visuospatial task such a tetri reduce later intrusive image furthermore study indicate that aerobic exercise may reduce ptsd symptom the present study aimed to test whether playing tetri without prior reminder cue after an experimental trauma limit the development of analogue symptom and to compare tetri to aerobic exercise which could plausibly alter cognitive affective processing of the trauma a well method participant n 71 watched a distressing film and were randomly assigned to either playing tetri cycling or remaining sedentary for 25 min without prior reminder cue intrusive image and co occurring distress were recorded in a diary during the following week after one week participant completed a recognition test to ass voluntary memory of the film result neither tetri nor exercise without prior memory reactivation reduced intrusive image and associated distress nor impeded voluntary memory compared to the control condition there were no effect of physical fitness level at baseline or voluntary exercise during the subsequent week on analogue symptom limitation although participant were instructed to record intrusion a they occurred in diary they did not receive additional reminder throughout the follow up period conclusion our finding suggest that neither a single bout of aerobic exercise nor playing tetri without prior memory reactivation after an analogue trauma reduces stress symptom potential explanation and clinical implication are discussed

a reliable diagnosis of adult attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd is challenging a many of the symptom of adhd resemble symptom of other disorder adhd is associated with gambling disorder and obesity showing overlap of about 20 with each diagnosis it is important for clinical practice to differentiate between condition displaying similar symptom via established diagnostic instrument applying the lightgbm algorithm in machine learning we were able to differentiate subject with adhd obesity problematic gambling and a control group using all 26 item of the conners adult adhd rating scale caars s s with a global accuracy of 80 precision positive predictive value ranged between 78 gambling and 92 obesity recall sensitivity between 58 for obesity and 87 for adhd model with the best 5 and best 10 item resulted in le satisfactory fit the caars s seems to be a promising instrument to be applied in clinical practice also for multiclassifying disorder displaying symptom resembling adhd

relevance understanding patient informational need and adapting drug related information are the prerequisite for a contextualized informed consent current information practice might rather harm by inducing nocebo effect objective to investigate whether informing about the nocebo effect using a short information sheet affect patient need for information about antidepressant method a total of 97 patient taking recently prescribed antidepressant 4 month intake were recruited over the internet and randomized to receiving either a one page written information about the nocebo effect or a control text about the history of antidepressant after experimental manipulation informational need about the side effect and mechanism of antidepressant were assessed with 3 and 7 item on categorical and 5 point likert scale group difference in informational need were calculated with chi square test and anova result patient received antidepressant for depression 84 5 and or anxiety disorder 42 3 three participant 6 0 of the nocebo group reported previous knowledge of the nocebo effect after the experimental manipulation participant in the nocebo group reported a reduced desire for receiving full side effect information x 4 97 2 12 714 cramer s v 0 362 p 0 013 and agreed more frequently to the usefulness of withholding information about possible side effect x 4 97 2 14 878 cramer s v 0 392 p 0 005 furthermore they desired more information about the mechanism of antidepressant f 6 373 p 0 013 partial eta 2 0 063 and specifically non pharmacological mechanism such a the role of positive expectation f 16 857 p 0 001 partial eta 2 0 151 conclusion learning about the nocebo effect can alter patient informational need toward desiring le information about the potential side effect of antidepressant and more information about general mechanism such a expectation the beneficial effect of including nocebo information into contextualized informed consent should be studied clinically concerning more functional information seeking behavior which may ultimately lead to improved treatment outcome such a better adherence and reduced side effect burden

background model of anxiety disorder and the rationale of exposure therapy et are grounded on classical fear conditioning yet it is unclear whether lower fear rating of conditioned safety versus threat cue and corresponding neural marker of safety learning and or fear inhibition assessed before treatment would predict better outcome of behavioral exposure method sixty six patient with spider phobia completed pre treatment clinical and experimental fear conditioning assessment one session of virtual reality et a post treatment clinical assessment and a 6 month follow up assessment tilted gabor grating served a conditioned stimulus c that were either paired c or remained unpaired c with an aversive phobia related and phobia unrelated unconditioned stimulus ucs c c difference in fear rating and magnetoencephalographic event related field erfs were related to percentual symptom reduction from pre to post treatment a assessed via spider phobia questionnaire spq behavioral avoidance test bat and remission status at 6 month follow up result we observed no association between pre treatment c c difference in fear rating and any treatment outcome c c difference in source estimation of erfs revealed that higher c activity in bilateral dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc wa related with spq and bat reduction association between c c difference and treatment outcome were also observed in left ventromedial prefrontal cortex vmpfc region which additionally revealed association with the follow up remission status conclusion result provide initial evidence that neural pre treatment c c difference may hold predictive information regarding outcome of behavioral exposure our finding highlight a key role of neural response to safety cue with potentially inhibitory effect on affect generating structure during fear conditioning

excessive anxiety and avoidance during provocation of body symptom are core feature of anxiety related disorder and might contribute to the development and maintenance of these disorder previous study examined psychological anxiety sensitivity fear of suffocation and trait anxiety and biobehavioral breath holding time predictor of reported anxiety during symptom provocation however the role of these predictor on avoidance of feared body symptom remains unclear therefore the present work aimed at investigating the main and interactive effect of psychological and biobehavioral variable in predicting avoidance during provocation of dyspnea that successively increased in severity 28 of 69 participant prematurely terminated the provocation sequence thus preventing further progression of symptom provocation logistic regression revealed that higher anxiety sensitivity and lower breath holding time were significantly associated with avoidance during exposure suffocation fear and trait anxiety were not related to avoidance moreover there wa a significant interaction between breath holding time and anxiety sensitivity in predicting avoidance participant with a lower breath holding time showed more avoidance behavior when reporting high a compared to low anxiety sensitivity the data suggest that anxiety sensitivity and breath holding time increase the risk to show avoidance and thus might contribute to the development and maintenance of anxiety related disorder

disgust extinction is an important mechanism relevant for the treatment of psychiatric disorder however only a few study have investigated disgust extinction moreover because disgust sensitivity d is considered a a relevant factor for learning process this study also investigated the potential relationship between d and disgust extinction learning the aim of this study wa to explore the neuronal correlate of disgust extinction a well a change in skin conductance response scrs and evaluative conditioning twenty subject were exposed to a differential extinction paradigm in which a previous conditioned and now unreinforced stimulus conditioned stimulus c wa compared to a second stimulus c which wa previously not associated with the unconditioned stimulus ucs extinction learning wa measured on three different response level bold response scrs and evaluative conditioning regarding evaluative conditioning the c wa rated a more unpleasant than the c interestingly significantly increased amygdala response and scrs toward to the c were observed finally a negative trend wa found between d score and bold response of the prefrontal cortex the present finding showed a dissociation of different response level the increased c response could be explained by the assumption that the increased amygdala activity may reflect a safety learning signal during the first extinction trial and the subjective focus may therefore shift from the c to the c the correlation finding support previous study postulating that d hamper extinction process the present result point toward dissociation between the response level in context of extinction process

abstract social medium site are overflowing with million of selfies because people increasingly share what they do and who they are with the rest of the world we examined whether self expression based on selfies elicit enhanced consensual and accurate interpersonal perception compared to commonly employed laboratory condition perceived narcissism wa relatively higher and conscientiousness lower when rating were based on selfies this effect did not extend to the accuracy of rating across all condition unacquainted observer agreed with each other and their rating were correlated with a criterion measure of target personality except for agreeableness and self esteem accuracy correlation were somewhat higher when rating were based on selfies randomization based exploratory lens model analysis were conducted to bolster the interpretation of our result

objective cognitive behavioral model postulate that selective attention play an important role in the maintenance of body dysmorphic disorder bdd it is suggested that individual with bdd overfocus on perceived defect in their appearance which may contribute to the excessive preoccupation with their appearance method the present study used eye tracking to examine visual selective attention in individual with bdd n 19 a compared to individual with bulimia nervosa bn n 21 and healthy control hcs n 21 participant completed interview questionnaire rating scale and an eye tracking task eye movement were recorded while participant viewed photograph of their own face and attractive a well a unattractive other face result eye tracking data showed that bdd and bn participant focused le on their self rated most attractive facial part than hcs scanning pattern in own and other face showed that bdd and bn participant paid a much attention to attractive a to unattractive feature in their own face whereas they focused more on attractive feature in attractive other face hcs paid more attention to attractive feature in their own face and did the same in attractive other face conclusion result indicate an attentional bias in bdd and bn participant manifesting itself in a neglect of positive feature compared to hcs perceptual retraining may be an important aspect to focus on in therapy in order to overcome the neglect of positive facial aspect future research should aim to disentangle attentional process in bdd by examining the time course of attentional processing

background exposure therapy involves exposure to feared stimulus and is considered to be the gold standard treatment for anxiety disorder while it application in virtual reality vr ha been very successful for phobic disorder the effect of exposure to virtual social stimulus in social anxiety disorder are heterogeneous this difference ha been linked to demand on realism and presence particularly social presence a a pre requisite in evoking emotional experience in virtual social interaction so far however the influence of social presence on emotional experience in social interaction with virtual agent remains unknown objective we investigated the relationship between realism and social presence and the moderating effect of social presence on the relationship between agent behavior and experienced emotion in virtual social interaction method healthy participant n 51 faced virtual agent showing supportive and dismissive behavior in two virtual environment short interaction and oral presentation at first participant performed five block of short one on one interaction with virtual agent two male and two female agent per block secondly participant gave five presentation in front of an audience of 16 agent in each scenario agent behavior wa a within subject factor resulting in one block of neutral two block of negative and two block of positive agent behavior rating of agent behavior valence and realism experience valence and arousal and presence physical and social were collected after every block moderator effect were investigated using mixed linear model with random intercept correlation were analyzed via repeated measure correlation result rating of valence of agent behavior showed reliable relationship with experienced valence and le reliable relationship with experienced arousal these relationship were moderated by social presence in the presentation scenario result for the interaction scenario were weaker but potentially promising for experimental study variation in social presence and realism over time were correlated but social presence proved a more reliable moderator conclusion our finding emphasize the role of social presence for emotional experience in response to specific agent behavior in virtual social interaction while these finding should be replicated with experimental design and in clinical sample variability in social presence might account for heterogeneity in efficacy of virtual exposure to treat social anxiety disorder

aim to 1 determine diabetes patient acceptance of internet based intervention ibis for depression to 2 examine the effectiveness of an acceptance facilitating intervention afi and to 3 explore subgroup specific effect method 141 diabetes patient from two inpatient rehabilitation unit and one outpatient clinic in germany were randomly allocated to an intervention ig and a no intervention control group cg the ig received an afi consisting of a personal information session before filling out a questionnaire on patient acceptance of ibis predictor of acceptance performance expectancy effort expectancy social influence facilitating condition and internet anxiety a well a sociodemographic depression related and diabetes related variable the cg filled out the questionnaire immediately patient acceptance of ibis wa measured with a four item scale sum score ranging from 4 to 20 result the cg showed a low 50 7 to medium 40 8 acceptance with only 8 5 of all diabetes patient reporting a high acceptance of ibis for depression the afi had no significant effect on acceptance ig m 10 55 sd 4 69 n 70 kg m 9 65 sd 4 27 n 71 d 0 20 95 ci 0 13 0 53 and the predictor of acceptance yet subgroup analysis yielded a trend for depressed diabetes related distressed female and younger 59 participant and for those who do not frequently use the internet to profit from the afi conclusion diabetes patient show a rather low acceptance toward ibis for depression finding indicate that the afi is likely to be effective in the subgroup of depressed diabetes related distressed female or younger diabetes patient but not in the whole target population hence afis might need to be tailored to the specific need of subpopulation

objective to examine whether symptom of depression or anxiety predict glycaemia and incident diabetes complication four year later and whether diabetes self care behaviour mediate these association in adult with type 1 diabetes t1dm method data of 205 adult with t1dm from the 2011 and 2015 diabetes mile australia survey were analysed variable of interest were baseline depression and anxiety phq 8 and gad 7 respectively symptom hba 1c and incident complication at four year follow up and self care behaviour at both time point longitudinal association were analysed using structural equation modelling result forty two participant 20 6 reported incident complication baseline depressive symptom predicted higher hba 1c at follow up indirectly via le optimal self care at follow up beta 0 19 p 0 011 baseline anxiety wa not independently associated with hba 1c or self care at follow up p 0 64 neither depressive nor anxiety symptom predicted incident complication although depressive symptom were associated with le optimal self care at baseline beta 0 67 p 0 001 and this predicted microvascular complication beta 0 38 p 0 044 however the indirect association via self care wa not significant beta 0 25 p 0 067 limitation participant were self selected all study variable were assessed using self report measure and adjusting for baseline hba 1c wa not possible conclusion depressive symptom predicted suboptimal self care behaviour and glycaemic outcome four year later while anxiety symptom did not the finding suggest that tailored diabetes care should take the potential impact of comorbid depression into consideration to help people improve their diabetes self care and achieve best possible health outcome

background current treatment of obesity often fail to consider gender and psychological aspect which are essential for weight loss and weight maintenance the aim of our study wa to analyze subjective illness representation sir of adult with obesity according to the common sense self regulation model csm by assessing their association with weight related variable and gender method data wa collected via online self assessment between april 2017 and march 2018 sir were operationalized by the revised illness perception questionnaire ipq r and illness outcome according to the csm were defined a bmi eating behaviour physical wellbeing bodyweight satisfaction and shape concern the sample consisted of 427 adult m 42 2 year sd 10 9 82 female with obesity bmi m 42 3 kg m 2 sd 9 0 student s t test and multiple hierarchical regression analysis were conducted with the control variable age and bmi and subjective illness representation and gender a independent variable result the explanation of outcome variance wa moderate to high 21 43 except for restraint eating behaviour 10 subjective illness representation showed several significant association with weight related variable especially timeline and emotional representation female gender wa significantly associated with more restraint eating behaviour f 1 400 4 19 p 0 001 and female had unfavourable value of the weight related variable a well a a more cyclic t 425 3 68 p 0 001 and more emotional representation t 100 5 17 p 0 001 of their obesity conclusion the result of this study indicate that gender and subjective illness representation especially the emotional representation play an important role for weight related variable therefore the assessment of sir may constitute an economic tool to identify specific individual deficit of self regulation

anxiety patient overgeneralize fear response possibly because they cannot distinguish between cue never been associated with a threat i e safe and threat associated cue however a context and not cue are discussed a the relevant trigger for prolonged anxiety response characterizing many anxiety disorder we speculated that it is rather overgeneralization of contextual anxiety which constitutes a risk factor for anxiety disorder to this end we investigated generalization of conditioned contextual anxiety and explored modulatory effect of anxiety sensitivity a risk factor for anxiety disorder fifty five participant underwent context conditioning in a virtual reality paradigm on day 1 acquisition participant received unpredictable mildly painful electric stimulus unconditioned stimulus u in one virtual office anxiety context ctx but never in a second office safety context ctx successful acquisition of conditioned anxiety wa indicated by aversive rating and defensive physiological response i e scr to ctx v ctx on day 2 generalization participant re visited both the anxiety and the safety context plus three generalization context g ctx which were gradually dissimilar to ctx from 75 to 25 generalization of conditioned anxiety wa evident for rating but le clear for physiological response the observed dissociation between generalization of verbal and physiological response suggests that these response depend on two distinct context representation likely elemental and contextual representation importantly anxiety sensitivity wa positively correlated with the generalization of reported contextual anxiety thus this study demonstrates generalization gradient for conditioned contextual anxiety and that anxiety sensitivity facilitates such generalization process suggesting the importance of generalization of contextual anxiety for the development of anxiety disorder

general intelligence is a psychological construct that capture in a single metric the overall level of behavioural and cognitive performance in an individual while previous research ha attempted to localise intelligence in circumscribed brain region more recent work focus on functional interaction between region however even though brain network are characterised by substantial modularity it is unclear whether and how the brain s modular organisation is associated with general intelligence modelling subject specific brain network graph from functional mri resting state data n 309 we found that intelligence wa not associated with global modularity feature e g number or size of module or the whole brain proportion of different node type e g connector hub or provincial hub in contrast we observed characteristic association between intelligence and node specific measure of within and between module connectivity particularly in frontal and parietal brain region that have previously been linked to intelligence we propose that the connectivity profile of these region may shape intelligence relevant aspect of information processing our data demonstrate that not only region specific difference in brain structure and function but also the network topological embedding of fronto parietal a well a other cortical and subcortical brain region is related to individual difference in higher cognitive ability i e intelligence

abstract background research on emotion regulation and paranoid ideation ha mostly focused on isolated regulation strategy and ha remained largely inconclusive according to the emotion regulation model by berking and whitley in affect regulation training springer new york 2014 successful modification or acceptance tolerance of emotion requires an adequate comprehension awareness clarity understanding of emotion and adequate self support method building on this model we investigated whether comprehension and self support strengthen the negative association between modification and acceptance tolerance and paranoid ideation in study 1 we examined the hypothesis cross sectionally based on questionnaire data from a combined sample n 125 consisting of people with a psychotic disorder people at risk of developing psychosis and healthy control in study 2 we examined the same hypothesis longitudinally by employing the experience sampling method in people with clinically relevant psychopathology below diagnostic threshold n 138 result in study 1 the association between modification and paranoid ideation wa not moderated by comprehension or self support however comprehension and self support moderated the association between acceptance tolerance and paranoid ideation in study 2 the interaction effect between comprehension and acceptance tolerance on paranoid ideation wa confirmed conclusion the result indicate that comprehending and accepting tolerating emotion could be protective against paranoid ideation

although much research ha shown that mindfulness based intervention mbis can reduce psychological stress it is le clear if effect generalize to everyday social situation which range among the largest stress trigger furthermore mechanism of mbis have not been fully established emotion regulation er ha been suggested a one key mechanism yet the role of cognitive reappraisal and acceptance strategy is still under debate to address these question a neuroimaging based randomized controlled trial rct wa performed n 68 comparing mindfulness based stress reduction mbsr with a reading listening intervention read using a novel dyadic paradigm for self and other emotion regulation under stress a primary outcome on behavior and brain level and established empathy measure clinicatrials gov nct03035669 compared to read mbsr led to self reported stress reduction through both cognitive reappraisal and acceptance only when regulating self and not when regulating others distress in addition mbsr led to increased brain activation over time for regulating own parietal cortex and others precuneus tpj emotion through cognitive reappraisal and acceptance albeit this effect wa also seen for the reading intervention for regulating own stress via reappraisal brain change did not scale with subjective stress reduction and amount of meditation practice more distant generalization effect of mbsr on socio emotional functioning cognitive empathy and compassion could also not be shown this study identified both cognitive reappraisal and acceptance a two er mechanism of mbsr but indicates that effect do not extend to social setting

the present study investigated the link between daily stress social support facebook use and facebook addiction disorder fad two variety of social support were considered according to the communication channel offline and online in a sample of 309 facebook user age m sd 23 76 4 06 range 18 56 daily stress wa positively related to the intensity of facebook use and to tendency towards facebook addiction the link between daily stress and intensity of facebook use wa negatively moderated by perceived offline social support indicating that individual who received low level of support offline were particularly likely to increase their facebook use at higher level of daily stress perceived online social support partly mediated the positive relationship between facebook use intensity and tendency towards fad it is remarkable that facebook use intensity is systematically related to both positive i e receiving online social support and negative i e building up fad consequence thereby individual who receive high level of social support online tend to be at risk for tendency towards fad thus while offline social support might protect mental health online support might influence it negatively this should be considered when assessing individual at risk for obsessive facebook use and when planning intervention to deal with fad

background although gender play a pivotal role in the psychological adaptation of immigrant youth it association with acculturation strategy and mental health among 1st generation immigrant adolescent are still scarce and inconsistent therefore the purpose of the current study wa to investigate gender related difference in acculturation pattern and their association with mental health internalizing and externalizing problem method self reported data of immigrant adolescent n 440 aged between 12 and 19 year m 16 2 sd 1 6 wa collected in a representative german school survey fifty one percent of the sample were female n 224 almost half of the sample wa born in the former soviet union followed by poland 9 3 sociodemographic variable acculturation strategy and internalizing a well a externalizing problem were assessed by questionnaire result confirmatory factor analysis supported the four dimensional model of acculturation style assimilation integration separation and marginalization whereas girl more often showed an integration pattern boy scored higher on the separation and marginalization scale after adjusting for age and educational level regression analysis revealed for both gender that marginalization wa associated with more internalizing problem separation wa related to more externalizing problem conclusion 1st generation adolescent experiencing a lack of belongingness to german society socio economic and educational disadvantage might be particularly vulnerable to mental distress finding are discussed in term of gender related differential socialization process in context of immigration

objective obesity prevalence among child is high and knowledge on cognitive factor that contribute to child s reactivity to the obesogenic food environment could help to design effective treatment and prevention campaign empirical study in adult suggest that attention bias for food could be a risk factor for overeating accordingly the current study tested if child with obesity have an elevated attention bias for food when compared to healthy weight child another aim wa to explore whether attention bias for food predicted weight change after 3 and 6 month in obese child method obese child n 34 were recruited from an intervention program and tested prior to the start of this intervention healthy weight child n 36 were recruited from local school first attention bias for food were compared between child with obesity n 30 and matched healthy weight child n 30 second regression analysis were conducted to test if food related attention bias predicted weight change after 3 and 6 month in child with obesity following a weight loss lifestyle intervention result result showed that obese child did not differ from healthy weight child in their attention bias to food yet automatically directing attention toward food i e initial orientation bias wa related to a reduced weight loss r 2 14 p 032 after 6 month in child with obesity discussion high palatable food is a salient stimulus for all child irrespective of their weight status however automatically directing attention to food cue might facilitate further weight gain in child with obesity

background and objective previous study have shown that human particularly those with high level of spider fear show automatic avoidance of spider however most task used in these study employ symbolic approach avoidance movement instead of naturalistic movement method the current study employed a touchscreen based approach avoidance task in which 86 female participant made hand and arm movement that mimic the real life touching grasping and moving of spider using a large touchscreen they had to reach for picture of spider and neutral object leaf touch them and drag them either away from themselves or towards themselves to draw attention to stimulus content picture of butterfly were used in additional nogo trial they required participant to not move their hand result avoidance of spider wa observed in both the pre movement time time to lift the hand from a starting position and the grabbing time time to reach the picture and this avoidance wa larger for more spider fearful participant the dragging time time to swipe the picture however revealed a relative spider approach tendency compared to leaf participant were faster to drag spider closer than to swipe them away limitation we discus potential reason for this mixed pattern of result including the low reliability of the dragging time conclusion we recommend the use of touchscreen for the assessment of approach avoidance tendency and we suggest avenue for further research
