the covid 19 pandemic can be characterized a a chronic stressor affecting the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal hpa axis indexed by glucocorticoid e g cortisol we investigated whether salivary cortisol level is increased during a lockdown and whether a lockdown condition affect the association between loneliness specific covid 19 related stressor and salivary cortisol level we conducted a smartphone based ecological momentary assessment ema study with 280 participant in germany who experienced at least mild loneliness and distress amid covid 19 from august 2020 to march 2021 we measured their momentary loneliness and covid related stressor including worry information seeking behavior and feeling of restriction during no lockdown or lockdown stage amid covid 19 their salivary cortisol wa measured 4 time on the last day of a 7 day ema study we found a significant increase in salivary cortisol level during lockdown compared to no lockdown lockdown stage wa found to moderate the relationship between momentary loneliness and salivary cortisol level i e loneliness wa positively related to cortisol level specifically during lockdown mechanism explaining the effect of forced social isolation on the association between loneliness and salivary cortisol need to be investigated in future study

objective cognitive behavioral therapy cbt ha been shown to be effective in treating hypochondriasis however there are doubt regarding the long term effectiveness of cbt for hypochondriasis in particular for follow up period longer than 1 year the aim of the present study wa to evaluate the long term effectiveness of cognitive therapy ct and exposure therapy et for the treatment of hypochondriasis method seventy five patient with a diagnosis of hypochondriasis who were previously treated with ct or et were contacted 3 year after treatment fifty 67 patient participated and were interviewed by an independent and blinded diagnostician using standardized interview result we found further improvement after therapy in primary outcome measure d 37 general functioning d 38 and reduced doctor visit d 30 during the naturalistic follow up period at the 3 year follow up 72 of the patient no longer fulfilled the diagnosis of hypochondriasis based on the main outcome measure we found response rate of 76 and remission rate of 68 at follow up only 4 of patient were taking antidepressant medication additional psychological treatment wa utilized by 18 of the patient during the follow up period only 8 because of health anxiety we found no overall difference between ct and et only a trend for a greater deterioration rate in ct 13 in comparison to et 0 wa found conclusion our result suggest that 2 3 of the patient with hypochondriasis were remitted in the long term thus remission rate after cbt were twice a high a in untreated sample psycinfo database record

background rumination is a risk factor for the development and maintenance of depressive symptom and represents an important target for the treatment of depression in the present study we aimed to examine whether rumination can be reduced when participant are led to believe that they would receive medication that would prevent them from ruminating method in healthy participant n 91 an initial dysphoric state wa induced via mood suggestive music and autobiographic recall subsequently participant were randomly assigned to one of two group an experimental group that received a deceptive active placebo via intranasal application accompanied by expectancy enhancing instruction v a no treatment control group then rumination wa induced via a rumination activating task the primary outcome wa current rumination experienced sadness wa considered a secondary outcome result consistent with the hypothesis participant receiving the placebo reported a significantly lower increase in current rumination d 0 57 and a higher decrease in sadness d 0 69 after the experimental induction than the control group limitation the external validity of this study might be limited due to the highly educated student sample conclusion the result suggest that rumination process a well a experienced sadness can be positively influenced by placebo treatment to evaluate it clinical potential placebo induced expectancy effect in rumination research should be further examined particularly with clinically depressed patient also the result imply that clinician might consider the effect of expectation on patient rumination tendency for example by explicitly addressing patient expectation about rumination mood and the treatment in general

background and objective high level of rejection sensitivity are assumed to be the result of early and prolonged experience of rejection aim of this study wa to investigate autobiographical memory of rejection in clinical sample high in rejection sensitivity borderline personality disorder bpd and major depressive disorder mdd and to identify group difference in the quality of the memory method memory of rejection were retrieved using an adapted version of the autobiographical memory test amt five positive cue word five cue word referring to rejection specificity of memory and linguistic word usage wa analyzed in 30 patient with bpd 27 patient with mdd and 30 healthy control result patient with bpd retrieved le specific memory compared to the healthy control group whereas patient with mdd did not differ from control in this regard the group difference wa no longer significant when controlling for rejection sensitivity linguistic analysis indicated that compared to both other group patient with bpd showed a higher self focus used more anger related word referred more frequently to social environment and rated memory of rejection a more relevant for today s life limitation clinical symptom were not assessed in the control group moreover the written form of the amt might reduce the total number of specific memory conclusion the level of rejection sensitivity influenced the specificity of the retrieved memory analysis of linguistic style revealed specific linguistic pattern in bpd compared to non clinical a well a depressed participant

introduction many study have investigated the latent structure of the dsm 5 criterion for posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd however most research on this topic wa based on self report data we aimed to investigate the latent structure of ptsd based on a clinical interview the clinician administered ptsd scale cap 5 method a clinical sample of 345 participant took part in this multi centre study participant were assessed with the cap 5 and the posttraumatic stress disorder checklist pcl 5 we evaluated eight competing model of dsm 5 ptsd symptom and three competing model of icd 11 ptsd symptom result the internal consistency of the cap 5 wa replicated in cfas the anhedonia model emerged a the best fitting model within all tested dsm 5 model however when compared with the anhedonia model the non nested icd 11 model a a le complex three factor solution showed better model fit index discussion we discus the finding in the context of earlier empirical finding a well a theoretical model of ptsd

background a number of observational tool are available to ass pain in cognitively impaired older adult however none of them can yet be regarded a a gold standard an international research initiative ha created a meta tool compiling the facial vocalization and body movement item of the majority of available tool objective of this study wa to investigate the pain specificity and the validity of these item method n 34 older adult with or without cognitive impairment were videotaped in three different condition one reference two painful condition in their nursing home they were further asked to self report their pain in each condition the occurrence of non verbal behaviour wa coded a present or absent using the item of the meta tool result the majority of non verbal behaviour wa not pain sensitive a they occurred le than three time across participant and condition of the remaining item two facial item pained expression and raising upper lip one vocalization item using pain related word and one body movement item guarding were found to be pain specific and valid one additional item the vocalization item gasping wa pain specific but not associated with pain self report and three additional item the facial item frowning and narrowing eye and the vocalization item mumbling were correlated with pain self report but did not help to separate pain from non pain condition conclusion systematic evaluation of item of existing observational pain assessment tool under naturalistic condition seems a promising approach in the process of further investigating and improving tool significance only few item stemming from observational pain assessment tool were found to be pain sensitive and specific a well a valid in this study the investigation of existing tool not only on tool but additionally on item level can provide helpful insight and thereby can help to improve the original tool and establish a gold standard for nonverbal pain assessment in older adult with cognitive impairment

objective disturbance in emotional process are commonly reported in patient with a somatic symptom disorder ssd although emotion usually occur in social interaction little is known about interpersonal emotion dynamic of ssd patient during their actual emotional encounter this study examined physiological coherence linkage between ssd patient and their partner and in healthy couple during their emotional interaction secondarily we explored group level relationship between participant and their partner subjective affect method twenty nine romantic couple 16 healthy and 13 ssd patient couple underwent a dyadic conversation task with neutral and anger eliciting topic followed by a guided relaxation partner cutaneous facial temperature wa recorded simultaneously by functional infrared thermal imaging immediately after each condition participant reported on their pain intensity self affect and perceived partner affect result emotional condition and having a partner with an ssd significantly affected coherence amplitude on the forehead f 2 54 4 95 p 011 and nose tip temperature f 2 54 3 75 p 030 from baseline to anger condition coherence amplitude significantly increased in the patient couple whereas it decreased in the healthy couple correlation change between partner subjective affect comparably accompanied the change in physiological coherence in healthy and patient couple conclusion inability to reduce emotional interdependence in sympathetic activity and subjective affect during a mutual conflict observed in ssd patient couple seems to capture emotion co dysregulation intervention should frame patient emotional experience a embodied and social functional infrared thermal imaging confirms to be an ecological and reliable method for examining autonomic change in interpersonal context registration page http osf io 8eyjr

common model propose that the internalization of societal beauty ideal influence disordered eating behavior and muscularity oriented behavior via body image concern however previous study addressing these pathway have been mainly cross sectional and primarily included female sample we investigated these pathway prospectively in male and female adolescent and young adult examining two pathway a weight shape pathway linking thin ideal internalization weight shape concern and restrained eating and a muscularity pathway linking athletic ideal internalization muscularity concern and muscularity oriented behavior across three time point 973 participant from the german general population were assessed although the hypothesized pathway could not be supported in their complete temporal sequence several hypothesized pathway occurred across two time point among others weight shape concern predicted restrained eating and the athletic ideal played a prominent role in the prediction of muscularity oriented behavior in both gender

over one billion people use facebook a a platform for social interaction and self presentation making it one of the most popular online site the aim of the present study wa to investigate difference in various personality trait and mental health variable between facebook user and people who do not use this platform the data of 945 participant 790 facebook user 155 facebook non user were collected result indicate that facebook user score significantly higher on narcissism self esteem and extraversion than facebook non user furthermore they have significantly higher value of social support life satisfaction and subjective happiness facebook non user have marginally significantly higher value of depression symptom than facebook user in both group extraversion self esteem happiness life satisfaction resilience and social support on the one hand and depression anxiety and stress symptom on the other hand are negatively correlated neuroticism is positively associated with depression anxiety and stress symptom however significant difference exist between facebook user and facebook non user regarding some association of personality trait and mental health variable compared to facebook non user the present result indicate that facebook user have higher value of certain personality trait and positive variable protecting mental health these finding are of particular interest considering the high importance of social online platform in the daily life of many people

background this study aimed to determine the psychometric property of the compulsive exercise test cet among an adult sample of patient with eating disorder method three hundred and fifty six patient and 360 non clinical control woman completed the cet and the eating disorder examination questionnaire ede q result a confirmatory factor analysis revealed that the clinical data showed a moderate fit to the previously published five factor model derived from a community sample taranis l touyz s meyer c eur eat disord rev 19 256 268 2011 the clinical group scored significantly higher than the non clinical group on four of the five cet subscales and logistic regression analysis revealed that the cet could successfully discriminate between the two group a receiver operating curve analysis revealed that a cut off score of 15 on the cet resulted in acceptable value of both sensitivity and specificity conclusion the cet appears to have a factor structure that is acceptable for use with an adult sample of patient with eating disorder it can identify compulsive exercise among patient with eating disorder and a cut off score of 15 is acceptable a indicating an appropriate cut off point

introduction the aim of the present study wa to investigate the effect of mindfulness based cognitive therapy mbct on suicidal ideation in an open label randomised controlled trial of patient with residual depressive symptom furthermore this study aimed at examining whether an effect of mbct on suicidal ideation wa dependent on a reduction in depression severity worry and rumination or an increase in mindfulness method one hundred and thirty participant were randomised to a treatment arm treatment a usual plus mbct or a wait list arm change in depression change in worry change in rumination and change in mindfulness were entered a covariates in a repeated measure anova in order to ass to what degree mbct induced change in suicidal ideation were independent from change in these parameter result there wa a significant groupxtime pre v post interaction on suicidal ideation indicating a significant reduction of suicidal ideation in the mbct group but not in the control group the interaction remained significant after addition of the above covariates change in worry wa the only covariate associated with change in suicidal ideation causing a moderate reduction in the interaction effect size conclusion the result suggest that mbct may affect suicidal ideation in patient with residual depressive symptom and that this effect may be mediated in part by participant enhanced capacity to distance themselves from worrying thought

the extent of the attentional blink effect on detection rate in rapid serial visual presentation is modulated by the emotionality of the stimulus emotionally salient stimulus are detected more often even if presented in the attentional blink period and elicit an enlarged p3 response which ha been interpreted a enhanced consolidation this effect correlate with individual difference in trait affectivity such a anxiety or dysphoria here we ask if it is also related to the capacity to detect emotion in others i e to interpersonal social trait we therefore presented emotional and neutral image depicting social scene a target in an attentional blink design and measured detection rate and event related potential in addition we recorded self report of empathy a measured by the interpersonal reactivity index the result show enhanced performance for emotional stimulus and increased p3 amplitude which correlated with individual difference in empathy the data suggest that self reported empathy go along with enhanced processing of emotion in social stimulus even under stimulus condition that are suboptimal for conscious target detection

the aim of the present study wa to examine the association between self esteem motive satisfaction and body weight in acute acan and recovered recan inpatient with anorexia nervosa an and in healthy control both acan and recan showed lower level of self esteem a compared with healthy control but did not differ from each other in acan decreased body weight wa associated with increased self esteem satisfaction of an achievement motive but not satisfaction of a superiority motive mediated this association no such correlation could be observed in the other group this is the first study to show an often assumed association between decreased body weight and increased self esteem in an patient these preliminary result strengthen the assumption that low body weight may foster self esteem in patient with acan mainly through the satisfaction of an achievement motive key practitioner message self esteem should be focused very early in the treatment of an since weight gain may deprive the patient of an important source of self esteem treatment intervention should be attuned to underlying motif of threatened self esteem in an patient the enhancement of self esteem via weight loss seems to be rather fuelled by the satisfaction of an achievement motive than by the satisfaction of a superiority motive specific training to improve self esteem in an patient seem to be promising a an add on to regular treatment

emotion can modulate the encoding and recollection of personal event in the present study we investigated the effect of different emotional state pleasant neutral or anxious on episodic memory formation in a virtual reality vr setting emotional state were induced by pleasant neutral or anxiety inducing movie clip prior to the presentation of specific event in a vr scenario episodic memory performance of healthy participant in whom an anxious emotional state had been induced wa inferior to those of the neutral and pleasant condition in the anxious condition participant were particularly impaired regarding their memory for the location of event a correlational analysis indicated that high level of negative arousal were associated with poor memory for the temporal and spatial context of event in contrast high level of happiness were associated with better memory for the spatial context of event our data provide evidence that emotional arousal can modulate memory for what happened where and when

the psychometric property and clinical utility of the separation anxiety avoidance inventory child and parent version saai c p were examined in two study the aim of the saai a self and parent report measure is to evaluate the avoidance relating to separation anxiety disorder sad situation in the first study a school sample of 384 child and their parent n 279 participated in the second study 102 child with sad and 35 child with other anxiety disorder ad were investigated in addition 93 parent of child with sad and 35 parent of child with other ad participated a two factor structure wa confirmed by confirmatory factor analysis the saai c and saai p demonstrated good internal consistency test retest reliability a well a construct and discriminant validity furthermore the saai wa sensitive to treatment change the parent child agreement wa substantial overall these result provide support for the use of the saai c p version in clinical and research setting

objective it ha been postulated that patient with heart failure have a high risk of ventricular arrhythmia and sudden cardiac death resulting from anxiety induced autonomic arousal in the prospective and multicenter diast chf diagnostic trial on prevalence and clinical course of diastolic dysfunction and heart failure study we therefore tested the hypothesis that adrenomedullin adm a well established predictor for cardiovascular outcome is associated with self rated anxiety symptom in patient at risk of suffering from or actually with overt heart failure participant and measure study participant with risk factor for diastolic dysfunction were requested to complete the hospital anxiety and depression scale hads and plasma mid regional pro adrenomedullin mr proadm concentration were measured result in bivariate analysis we found significantly lower plasma mr proadm level in patient with elevated hads anxiety score above the clinically relevant cut off level of 11 n 118 536pmol l interquartile range iqr 449 626 a compared to non anxious study participant n 1 292 573pmol l iqr 486 702 p 0 001 a set of multivariate model adjusted for potential confounders confirmed the negative association between self rated anxiety symptom and plasma mr proadm in similar model no significant association wa detected between hads depression score and mr proadm conclusion the inverse relationship between plasma mr proadm and anxiety observed in patient with cardiovascular risk factor support a previous experimental study using a mutant mouse line with a brain specific loss of adm expression which displayed hyperactive and over anxious behavior further experimental and clinical study are warranted to test the hypothesis that also in human adm act a a neuromodulator with anxiolytic property

background recent research ha identified high level of child maltreatment and harsh parenting in post war society which have had detrimental effect on child s development future expectation are an important aspect of adolescent development particularly in the challenging context of post war society where social instability and violence are prevalent to date however the link between child maltreatment and adolescent future expectation remains understudied objective by applying a socio ecological perspective this study aimed to investigate risk internalizing symptom and protective factor community integration linking experience of harsh parenting with adolescent future expectation participant and setting data wa collected from n 199 northern ugandan adolescent 40 2 female m age 14 56 year with structured interview method serial mediation analysis were calculated with child maltreatment a the predictor future expectation a the outcome and internalizing symptom a well a community integration a mediating variable result result of the mediation model r 2 22 f 5193 10 54 p 001 total effect b 0 28 p 005 revealed a direct effect of child maltreatment on future expectation effect size 20 95 bootstrap ci 0 40 01 a well a an indirect effect of child maltreatment via internalizing symptom and community integration on future expectation effect size of 07 95 bootstrap ci 0 14 0 01 conclusion child maltreatment wa found to be linked to negative future expectation among northern ugandan adolescent and both internalizing symptom a well a community integration played mediating role in the association intervention should take psychopathology and community factor into account

abstract presently there is no instrument to support the diagnosis of driving fear and it severity to enable a reliable and valid diagnosis the 5 item german language instrument for fear of driving ifd wa developed the item by dsm 5 criterion for a specific phobia measure the emotional cognitive and physiological component of driving fear a well a the degree of avoidance and impairment the present paper comprises two study that describe the development of the ifd and it psychometric property in study 1 the ifd wa administered to 810 non clinical participant in an online survey and demonstrated good reliability and construct validity in study 2 fifty four people with a clinical diagnosis including clinically relevant driving fear completed the ifd and a clinical interview the ifd demonstrated good sensitivity and specificity and a cut off score resulted in 95 sensitivity and 97 specificity while the finding are preliminary and further study with larger sample are needed the ifd is a promising screening instrument for driving fear and it severity

negative body related feedback is associated with increased body dissatisfaction the english language version of the feedback on physical appearance scale fopas is an instrument to ass verbal and non verbal body related feedback but a german language version ha not been validated yet the aim of this study wa to evaluate the psychometric property of it german language version in a sample of adolescent with eating disorder n 88 and in a sample of adolescent n 123 and woman n 228 without eating disorder confirmatory factor analysis showed a moderate model fit from the english language original study all sample showed acceptable internal consistency the retest reliability wa also mostly acceptable significant positive correlation with questionnaire on eating disorder symptom criterion validity teasing convergent validity a well a the expected negative correlation with self esteem indicated good validity in addition the fopas wa able to differentiate between adolescent with and without eating disorder to sum up the german language fopas appears to be suitable to ass verbal and non verbal body related feedback in research and practice

interoception is impaired in different psychiatric disorder and is also associated with emotion only one study could show a higher interoceptive accuracy iacc in patient with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd based on the predictive coding system we assume contrary result indicating a decreased iacc in patient with ocd so far there is no study investigating the effect of cognitive behavioral therapy on iacc in patient with ocd therefore we hypothesize that patient with ocd improve their iacc during the time course of therapy compared to healthy control twenty six patient with ocd from the psychosomatic clinic in windach were examined in the time course of cognitive behavioral therapy they were compared to 26 matched healthy control iacc via the heartbeat perception task a well a questionnaire data ocd depression and anxiety symptom were assessed result showed that iacc ocd depression and anxiety symptom were attenuated in patient with ocd patient recovered in the time course of therapy regarding ocd depression and anxiety symptom interoceptive deficit did not change in the time course of cognitive behavioral therapy we demonstrated that iacc is affected in patient with ocd and this deficit doe not change during the time course of a standardized therapy future study should investigate whether an inaccuracy in perceiving one s bodily signal constitutes a risk factor for relapse further it could be examined if iacc can be increased via self and body focus intervention in patient with ocd

background and objective the underlying mechanism of symptom change in schema therapy st for chronic major depressive disorder cmdd have not been studied the aim of this study wa to explore the impact of two potentially important mechanism of symptom change maladaptive schema proxied by negative idiosyncratic core belief and the therapeutic alliance method we drew data from a single case series of st for cmdd patient with cmdd n 20 received on average 78 repeated weekly assessment over a course of up to 65 individual session of st focusing on repeated assessment within individual we used mixed regression to test whether change in core belief and therapeutic alliance preceded followed or occurred concurrently with change in depressive symptom result change in core belief did not precede but were concurrently related to change in symptom repeated goal and task agreement rating specific aspect of alliance of the same session completed on separate day were at least in part associated with concurrent change in symptom limitation by design this study had a small sample size and no control group conclusion contrary to what would be expected based on theory our finding suggest that change in core belief doe not precede change in symptom instead change in these variable occurs concurrently moreover alliance rating seem to be at least in part colored by change in current mood state

therapy differentiation is a crucial component of psychotherapy research it refers to whether inspected treatment differ from one another in the history of psychoanalysis the differentiation between psychodynamic and analytic psychotherapy wa often discussed but seldom inspected empirically in this study we propose a set of item which should in theory offer the possibility to differentiate between psychodynamic and analytic psychotherapy on session level we inspect these item using therapist self report concerning n 295 case of different psychodynamic and analytic therapy result of an exploratory factor analysis and subsequent inspection of the psychodynamic and analytic item in different form of therapy strengthen the usability of these item for differentiating between psychodynamic and analytic therapy however further study using different perspective e g observer rating are essential the presented item are a promising step towards the development of an instrument for treatment differentiation which could later be used in treatment comparison study

aim elimination disorder are common in typically developing child only few study have addressed elimination disorder in person with intellectual disability id and even fewer study in those with specific syndrome the aim of the study wa to investigate the rate of elimination disorder and behavioral symptom in person with prader willi pws and fragile x syndrome fxs in a large sample method three hundred fifty seven person with pws or fxs were recruited through parent self help group a questionnaire regarding elimination symptom a well a the child behavior checklist cbcl young adult behavior checklist yabcl were filled out by parent or caregiver result the sample included 191 person with pws 54 5 male with a mean age of 20 0 year and 166 person with fxs 92 2 male with a mean age of 15 4 year person with fxs were significantly more often affected by elimination disorder 29 3 of person with pws and 48 8 of person with fxs had at least one elimination disorder person with fxs also had more often duo 29 5 v 12 0 and fi 28 9 v 12 6 rate of ne were similar in both group 22 0 in pws v 28 9 in fxs young adult with pws had more behavioral symptom in the clinical range 70 8 v 48 3 incontinence and behavioral symptom were significantly associated in person with fxs conclusion ne duo and fi are very common in person with fxs and pws and are associated with other behavioral symptom in person with fxs they persist into adulthood early assessment and treatment are recommended

background high rate of maltreatment and low caregiving quality in institutional care setting have been identified in various low and middle income country many study have focused on child living in institution objective this study investigates the prevalence of maltreatment caregiver specific orphanage context factor and their relation to maltreatment of orphan from the caregiver perspective participant and setting in this cross sectional study 227 caregiver 67 female with a mean age of 36 84 year sd age 12 89 of 24 childcare centre in dar e salaam tanzania participated method the primary outcome wa the maltreatment of child assessed through structured interview of caregiver further information on individual like work related stress and structural variable working condition wa gathered result caregiver work under extreme and exhausting condition with very high caregiver child ratio low salary and almost no possibility to recover result also showed significant difference in the maltreatment level and structural and individual factor e g payment and day of entitlement between the orphanage caregiver s positive attitude towards violence ƒ 2 attitude 0 19 and difficulty in the relationship with child ƒ 2 relationship 0 05 significantly predicted maltreatment with moderate and small effect conclusion the overall poor working condition highlight the urgent need to reduce the caregiver burden in addition to this addressing caregiver positive attitude and improving their interaction competency with child may be a starting point to prevent maltreatment of child further investigation of structural factor contributing to maltreatment is essential to develop recommendation for the improvement and re organization of childcare institution

research investigating maternal bonding and parenting stress in the course of postpartum depression is lacking aim of the study wa to investigate the development and potential mediation of both construct in the course of postpartum depression n 31 mother with postpartum depression according to dsm iv and n 32 healthy control completed the german version of the postpartum bonding questionnaire and the parenting stress index at two measuring time acute depression t1 and remission t2 at t1 the clinical group reported lower bonding and higher parenting stress bonding wa found to partially mediate the link between maternal diagnosis and parenting stress furthermore the clinical group reported lower bonding and higher parenting stress averaged over both measurement time however at t2 the clinical group still differed from the control even though they improved in bonding and reported le parenting stress a significant increase of bonding wa also observed in the control group maternal bonding seems to buffer the negative impact of postpartum depression on parenting stress the result emphasize the need for intervention focusing on maternal bonding and mother infant interaction in order to prevent impairment of the mother child relationship

importance suicidal behavior is a leading cause of death among adolescent and young adult in light of the ideation to action framework the delineation of frequency and temporal characteristic of such behavior during this developmental period is crucial objective to provide lifetime and 12 month prevalence estimate of suicidal behavior including ideation plan and attempt in adolescent and young adult of the general population and to provide information about age at onset temporal characteristic of suicidal behavior including duration number of year between onset and last occurrence and frequency number of episode and transition pattern across suicidal behavior design setting and participant a cross sectional epidemiological study wa conducted in a random community sample of 1180 adolescent and young adult aged 14 to 21 year assessed in 2015 to 2016 in dresden germany data analysis wa performed from october 2018 to march 2019 main outcome and measure lifetime and 12 month suicidal behavior ideation plan and attempt were assessed with a standardized diagnostic interview munich composite international diagnostic interview by trained clinical interviewer the onset frequency and duration of suicidal behavior were assessed by questionnaire result of the 1180 participant 495 male weighted percentage 51 7 mean sd age 17 9 2 3 year 130 participant 10 7 95 ci 9 0 12 8 65 participant 5 0 95 ci 3 9 6 5 and 41 participant 3 4 95 ci 2 4 4 7 reported lifetime suicidal ideation plan and attempt respectively any lifetime suicidal behavior wa reported by 138 participant 11 5 95 ci 9 7 13 7 age specific cumulative incidence estimate indicated an increase in suicidal behavior during adolescence starting at age 10 year 1 increasing slightly until the age of 12 year 2 2 and then increasing sharply thereafter until age 20 year 13 5 there were different pattern among female and male participant for ideation plan and attempt with an overall higher incidence among female participant for ideation hazard ratio 1 51 95 ci 1 02 2 22 p 04 for plan hazard ratio 3 31 95 ci 1 72 6 36 p 001 and among those older than 14 year for attempt hazard ratio 3 07 95 ci 1 11 8 49 p 03 of those with suicidal ideation 66 0 reported persistent or recurrent ideation over more than 1 year with 75 0 reporting more than 1 episode of the participant with lifetime suicidal ideation 47 0 reported a suicide plan and 23 9 reported a suicide attempt the transition to suicide plan or attempt occurred mainly in the year of onset of suicidal ideation or plan of those who transitioned 74 9 transitioned from ideation to plan 71 2 transitioned from ideation to attempt and 85 4 transitioned from plan to attempt in the same year conclusion and relevance there is an urgent public health need for timely identification of suicidal behavior in adolescent and young adult to terminate persistent or recurrent suicidal tendency and to interrupt the ideation to action transition

adult of three age group 18 27 39 45 and 59 66 year performed an auditory duration discrimination task with short 200 m or long 400 m sinusoidal tone performance wa highly accurate and reaction time were on the same level in all group indicating no difference in auditory duration processing task irrelevant rare change of the frequency of the stimulus were introduced to check whether the subject firstly were distracted by change in the environment while focusing on the task relevant information indicated by prolonged response and secondly could re focus on the relevant task after distraction the result show that a distraction effect is present in all group importantly the 59 66 year group showed a behavioral distraction effect nearly twice a high a the other group the event related brain potential erps show mismatch negativity mmn p3a and reorienting negativity ron elicited by deviant which are present in all group aging effect on these erp component were observable in all three component but a revealed a weak significant effect for the mmn only taken together the behavioral and erp result suggest that the function of balancing the processing of task irrelevant change in the stimulation while focusing on task relevant information is effective during adulthood until the 7th decade of life

objective recent research ha shown that placebo can be effective even if they are openly prescribed to participant yet it is unclear how such open label placebo olps compare to deceptive placebo dp and what the mechanism of action are in this study we therefore compared 2 version of olp to dp and no treatment nt material and method using a standard heat pain paradigm 117 healthy volunteer underwent a baseline and a posttreatment pain assessment with the exception of nt all group received an inert placebo cream after the first assessment olp wa administered by either evoking positive expectancy or by raising hope for placebo analgesia thus distinguishing for the first time conceptually between expectancy and hope in experimental pain research the primary outcome wa pre post change in pain tolerance result increase in pain tolerance wa larger in the 3 treatment group compared with nt whereas the treatment group did not differ from each other further result showed that participant receiving dp reported a large reduction of subjective pain intensity and unpleasantness whereas no such reduction wa found for the 2 olp group the 2 olp version did not differ in term of their analgesic effect discussion the study provided evidence for traditional placebo analgesia on the basis of deception for olp we found that olp indeed increased pain tolerance however participant receiving olp were reluctant to report any subjective analgesic effect combined with previous study the present finding suggest that the effect of olp are weaker in healthy volunteer than in clinical sample

background deficit in inhibitory control seem to promote habit behavior and therefore play an important role in the development and maintenance of addictive disease although several training approach have been suggested there is a considerable lack of knowledge about the best way to improve inhibitory control based on a literature review regarding shortcoming of existing training an individualized adaptive inhibitory control training wa developed we aimed to ass feasibility and acceptance of this training and to provide preliminary result on it efficacy regarding inhibitory control and binge drinking method sixty one individual 30 female with binge drinking behavior were randomly allocated to either an experimental group receiving three session of the inhibitory control training or a waitlist control group receiving no training before and after the training the participant performed a go nogo task to ass inhibitory control commission error and false reaction time completed a questionnaire on drinking related self control and reported drinking behavior result although the training wa feasible and accepted by participant it did not affect self control over drinking inhibitory control or drinking behavior the relationship between session number and false reaction time wa linear for alcohol stimulus but squared for neutral stimulus conclusion although our finding have to be interpreted in the light of some shortcoming they demonstrate that further research is needed to enhance our understanding of how to improve inhibitory control and which factor might moderate this process

objective in a predictive processing perspective symptom perception result from an integration of preexisting information in memory with sensory input physical symptom can therefore reflect the relative predominance of either sensory input or preexisting information in this study we used the thermal grill illusion tgi which applies interlaced warm and cool temperature to the skin to create a paradoxical heat pain experience assuming that the tgi compared with single temperature stimulation relies more importantly on an active integration process of the brain to create this paradoxical sensation we tested the hypothesis whether a manipulation of the expectation during tgi would have more impact than during single temperature stimulation method sixty four participant received different temperature combination 16 16 degree c 40 40 degree c 16 40 degree c with neutral positive placebo and negative nocebo instruction subjective stimulus intensity wa rated and neuroticism and absorption openness to absorbing and self altering experience served a potential moderating factor result the tgi condition wa rated highest overall negative instruction increased p 001 d 0 58 whereas positive instruction did not significantly change the tgi intensity perception versus neutral p 144 d 0 19 in the tgi condition increased modulation of pain wa observed with higher neuroticism beta 0 33 p 005 and absorption beta 0 30 p 010 conclusion whereas negative instruction induced a nocebo effect no placebo effect emerged after positive instruction the finding are in line with the predictive processing model of symptom perception for participant with higher level of neuroticism and absorption

background physical activity pa is associated with positive health outcome whereas physical inactivity is related to an increased risk for various health issue including obesity and cardiovascular disease previous research indicates that interindividual difference in the perception of bodily process interoceptive sensitivity is interact with the degree of pa in adult whether there is a similar relationship between pa and is in child ha not been investigated yet therefore the aim of this study wa to investigate the interaction between is and pa during physical performance task and in everyday situation method is wa assessed using a heartbeat perception task in a sample of 49 child within the health promotion program join the healthy boat which is implemented in several primary school in the southwest of germany pa wa examined using a physical performance task assessing the distance covered during a standardized 6 min run in a subsample of 21 child everyday pa wa measured by a multi sensor device actiheart camntech cambridge uk during five consecutive day with more than 10 h of daily data collection result child with higher is performed better in the physical performance task additionally based on energy expenditure defined a metabolic equivalent is wa positively correlated with the extent of light pa level in the morning and afternoon conclusion our finding reveal that is interacts positively with the degree of pa in child supporting the idea that interoception is important for the self regulation of health related behavior

background and objective when avoiding threat conflict with approaching reward balanced response to threat and reward information is required to guide functional behavior elevated threat avoidance characterizes anxious psychopathology however little is known about the mutual impact of threat and reward information on approach avoidance behavior and it link to anxiety method high trait anxious and low anxious individual n 74 repeatedly choose between two option a threat high reward option wa linked to two outcome a varying chance to receive an aversive stimulus and a varying high reward a safe low reward option wa linked to absence of the aversive stimulus and a low reward result avoidance of the threat high reward option increased with increasing threat despite threat low anxious individual increasingly approached the threat high reward option when reward increased high compared to low anxious individual showed elevated avoidance but only in the presence of high competing reward limitation future research should examine boundary condition by manipulating type and motivational value of appetitive and aversive outcome e g food a primary reinforcer conclusion these finding suggest that a weaker impact of reward competing with threat contributes to elevated threat avoidance in anxious psychopathology costly avoidance may thus be a factor involved in anxious psychopathology

background objective the outbreak of covid 19 and the lack of vaccine made extraordinary action such a social distancing necessary while some individual experience the restriction on daily life a a heavy burden others adapt to the situation and try to make the best of it the present longitudinal study investigated the extent and predictor of the burden induced by the outbreak of covid 19 in germany method data were assessed in october 2019 using the das 21 and the pmh scale and in march 2020 adding a six item measure of burden and a 2 item rating of sense of control result in a sample of 436 participant about 28 stayed in self quarantine 22 person had relevant symptom and one person wa positively tested for covid 19 most participant experienced medium to high level of burden but tried to make the best of it stress symptom in 2019 predicted a higher level of burden and pmh predicted a lower level of burden in march 2020 remarkably depression and anxiety symptom did not significantly predict burden the protective effect of pmh and the negative impact of stress symptom were mediated by perceived sense of control conclusion the result emphasize the protective effect of pmh in extraordinary situation such a the current outbreak of covid 19

many university student use mobile phone during study task for unrelated activity it is known that using social networking while studying reduces the learning performance the objective of the present study wa to investigate whether using smartphone game during a lecture reduces the learning performance and whether this is influenced by receiving push notification ninety three student were randomized to three condition in two gaming condition g participant played a custom made gaming app 20 s at 2 min interval while watching a video mimicking a lecture in one subgroup gn the game app sent push notification in the other gn no notification were sent participant in the control group c watched the lecture without playing subsequently participant answered multiple choice question and estimated their own quiz performance comparing the quiz score and subjective performance estimate of the three group showed that the learning performance in gn wa lower than in c d 0 51 no other difference were observed participant subjective performance estimation remained unaffected by the experimental condition possible implication of the divergence of the subjective estimate and objective performance are discussed a well a limitation such a the low complexity of the game used and the short lecture duration not reflective of typical lecture playing an easy smartphone game with push notification during a lecture reduced learning performance subjective performance remained unaffected by experimental condition and were no indicator of objective performance without push notification no negative effect on learning performance due to parallel play of a smartphone game were found

previous research indicates that acute stress around the time of learning facilitates attention and memory for emotionally salient information despite accumulating evidence for these acute stress effect le is known about the role of chronic stress in the present study we therefore tested emotional and neutral scene processing and later recognition memory in female participant using hair cortisol concentration a a biological marker for chronic stress event related potential recorded during picture viewing indicated enhanced late positive potential lpps for emotional relative to neutral content these brain potential varied a a function of long term hair cortisol level hair cortisol level were positively related to overall lpp amplitude result from recognition memory testing one week after encoding revealed better memory for emotional relative to neutral scene hair cortisol level however were related to poorer memory accuracy taken together our result indicate that chronic stress enhanced attentional processing during encoding of new stimulus and impaired later recognition memory result are discussed with regard to putatively opposite effect of chronic stress on certain brain region e g amygdala and hippocampus

the present study investigated measurement invariance across gender on the german wechsler intelligence scale for child fifth edition wisc v the higher order model that wa preferred by the test publisher wa tested on a population representative german sample of 1 411 child and adolescent aged between 6 and 16 year confirmatory factor analysis were conducted to test for measurement invariance a soon a partial scalar invariance could be established by freeing nonequivalent subtest intercept result demonstrated that 11 out of 15 subtest score have the same meaning for male and female child these finding support interpretable comparison of the wisc v test score between male and female but only in due consideration of partial scalar invariance and with respect to the underlying factor structure despite this however result did not support the overall structural validity of the higher order model thus replacing the former perceptual reasoning factor by fluid reasoning and visual spatial may be considered inappropriate due to the redundancy of the fri a a separate factor result also indicated that the wisc v provides stronger measurement of general intelligence full scale iq than measurement of cognitive subdomains wisc v index interpretative emphasis should thus be placed on the full scale iq rather than the wisc v index

background increase in emotional distress in response to the global outbreak of the sars cov 2 covid 19 pandemic have been reported so far little is known about how anxiety response in specific everyday public life situation have been affected method self reported anxiety in selected public situation which are relevant in the covid 19 pandemic wa investigated in non representative sample from the community n 352 and patient undergoing psychotherapy n 228 situational anxiety in each situation wa rated on a 5 point likert scale 0 no anxiety at all to 4 very strong anxiety situational anxiety during the pandemic wa compared with retrospectively reported situational anxiety before the pandemic direct change and with anxiety level in a matched sample assessed before the pandemic n 100 indirect change result in the community and patient sample indirect and direct change analysis demonstrated an increase in anxiety in relevant public situation but not in control situation average anxiety level during the pandemic were moderate but 5 28 of participant reported high to very high level of anxiety in specific situation interestingly the direct increase in anxiety level wa higher in the community sample patient reported higher anxiety level than the community sample before but not during the pandemic finally a higher increase in situational anxiety wa associated with a higher perceived danger of covid 19 a higher perceived likelihood of contracting covid 19 and stronger symptom of general anxiety and stress conclusion preliminary finding demonstrate an increase in anxiety in public situation during the covid 19 pandemic in a community and a patient sample moderate anxiety may facilitate compliance with public safety measure however high anxiety level may result in persistent impairment and should be monitored during the pandemic

purpose to compare orthorexic eating behavior in a sample of adult with and without self reported allergy and food intolerance method n 52 individual with and n 102 individual without self reported allergy and food intolerance 80 with medical diagnosis in total 74 6 female 23 7 male age m 28 13 sd 11 96 year completed an online survey with the dusseldorf orthorexia scale and answered several question regarding their allergy intolerance result the group did not differ in their orthorexic eating behavior in the sample of individual with allergy intolerance orthorexic eating behavior correlated with the perceived severity of the allergic symptom and the number of consequence that the allergy had for eating behavior conclusion in line with previous finding orthorexic eating behavior doe not seem to be elevated in individual with allergy intolerance however focusing on a healthy diet despite adverse food reaction and experiencing a number of allergy related consequence for one s eating behavior might be associated with orthorexic eating behavior level of evidence iii case control analytic study

background while study with survivor of single traumatic experience highlight individual response variation following trauma research from conflict region show that almost everyone develops posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd if trauma exposure reach extreme level therefore evaluating the effect of cumulative trauma exposure is of utmost importance in study investigating risk factor for ptsd yet little research ha been devoted to evaluate how this important environmental risk factor can be best quantified method we investigated the retest reliability and predictive validity of different trauma measure in a sample of 227 ugandan rebel war survivor trauma exposure wa modeled a the number of traumatic event type experienced or a a score considering traumatic event frequency in addition we investigated whether age at trauma exposure can be reliably measured and improves ptsd risk prediction result all trauma measure showed good reliability while prediction of lifetime ptsd wa most accurate from the number of different traumatic event type experienced inclusion of event frequency slightly improved the prediction of current ptsd conclusion a assessing the number of traumatic event experienced is the least stressful and time consuming assessment and lead to the best prediction of lifetime ptsd we recommend this measure for research on ptsd etiology

objective appearance related interpretation bias is postulated to play a role in the maintenance of body dissatisfaction bd a risk factor for body dysmorphic disorder bdd and eating disorder ed cognitive bias modification for interpretation cbm i ha been shown to reduce maladaptive interpretation bias and symptom in various emotional disorder this study investigated the acceptability and efficacy of an easily disseminable web based cbm i program for bd method individual with high bd n 318 were randomized to a multi session cbm i sentence word association paradigm swap with feedback v control swap without feedback versus waitlist condition interpretation bias bd and associated symptom were assessed at baseline and post intervention symptom were monitored up to 1 week and 4 week follow up we further investigated transference effect to stress reactivity a predicted by cognitive behavioral model at post intervention result appearance related cbm i led to a differential pre post increase in adaptive interpretation pattern particularly for appearance related and social situation d 0 65 1 18 both cbm i and control training reduced bd bdd symptom severity and depression however cbm i v control and waitlist improved appearance related quality of life d 0 51 self esteem d 0 52 and maladaptive appearance related belief d 0 47 state stress reactivity wa overall reduced in the cbm i condition v waitlist intervention effect largely held stable up to follow ups treatment satisfaction wa comparable to other cbm i study with low rate of adverse reaction discussion these finding support assumption of cognitive behavioral model for bd bdd and ed and suggest that web based cbm i is an efficacious and acceptable intervention option

background while it is well known that posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd is characterized by heterogeneous symptom cluster little is known about predominant typology of ptsd symptom in older adult method latent profile analysis lpas were employed to evaluate predominant typology of ptsd symptom in a sample of 164 treatment seeking older adult with childhood war related trauma multinomial logistic regression were conducted to evaluate predictor of class membership result lpas revealed that a 3 class solution best fit the data these included an intermediate disturbance class 50 0 and two pervasive disturbance class which differed with respect to severity of avoidance symptom pervasive disturbance low avoidance 33 5 pervasive disturbance high avoidance 16 5 a greater number of traumatic event predicted membership in the pervasive disturbance class the pervasive disturbance low avoidance class had a higher level of education than the pervasive disturbance high avoidance class compared to the intermediate disturbance class the pervasive disturbance class had the highest level of depression anxiety and somatization symptom conclusion these result suggest that ptsd in treatment seeking older adult may be characterized by three predominant typology which are differentiated by overall severity and avoidance symptom lifetime trauma burden education level and comorbid depression anxiety and somatization symptom these result underscore the importance of considering heterogeneity in the phenotypic presentation of ptsd in assessment and treatment approach for this disorder in older adult

reliability and validity of the opd conflict questionnaire in an inpatient treatment sample objective unconscious conflict are a major part of psychodynamic diagnostics benecke et al 2018 developed the opd conflict questionnaire opd cq to ass unconscious conflict according to the operationalized psychodynamic diagnostics opd via self report we inspected it reliability and validity in a large inpatient sample with a focus on correlation with symptomatic burden interpersonal problem and structural level method n 2083 patient completed questionnaire at the beginning of their inpatient stay in the fachklinikum tiefenbrunn between 2017 and 2020 we calculated internal consistency of the opd cq scale and partial correlation of the opd cq scale with different instrument result internal consistency were only partly satisfying for eight of 13 scale we found significant partial correlation of the conflict with symptom severity and interpersonal problem which were in line with expectation however structural level correlated with more conflict than we expected conclusion due to the low internal consistency of some scale we recommend a revision of the opd cq still the found correlation show the potential of the opd cq a a screening instrument for patient in inpatient treatment

abstract this study investigated whether foster parent report of their dyadic coping competency differ from biological parent whether there are difference with regard to the temporal association between maternal and paternal dyadic coping in the two sample and whether parental dyadic coping competency predict future mental health problem in child a total of 94 foster child and 157 child living in their biological family both sample aged 2 7 year a well a their foster parent were assessed three time over a 12 month period the mother and father dyadic coping competency were assessed using the dyadic coping inventory dci child psychopathology wa assessed using the child behavior checklist cbcl and a standardized clinical interview kinder dip both mainly based on maternal report foster parent reported better dyadic coping competency across the three assessment than did biological parent there were no significant difference with regard to the temporal association between mother and father report over time between the two sample cross lagged panel model yielded a high within person stability across the three assessment for both mother and father actor effect a well a some significant interpersonal effect primarily from paternal to maternal dyadic coping partner effect in contrast to the expectation mother and father dyadic coping did not predict child mental health problem at the third assessment the result make an important contribution to the research on dyadic coping and on how child mental health problem affect parental dyadic coping competency and vice versa

objective adolescent with substance use disorder sud frequently report traumatic event te and symptom of post traumatic stress disorder ptsd this study aimed to ass whether lifetime prevalence rate of te and ptsd are related to sud severity in adolescent psychiatric patient method we analyzed n 114 self report of treatment seeking german adolescent aged 12 to 18 year who visited a specialized sud outpatient unit standardized questionnaire were applied to ass sud severity the number of te and dsm iv ptsd criterion result patient fulfilling ptsd criterion 28 of the total sample had a higher drug use disorder identification test dudit score compared to non ptsd patient with te p 001 and compared to adolescent without te or ptsd p 003 additionally sud severity wa positively associated with the number of te and the number of intrusion hyperarousal and avoidance symptom all r 33 to 48 all p 01 discussion adolescent patient with sud reported 3 time higher rate of te and a 5 time higher prevalence of ptsd following te than the general adolescent population adolescent sud patient with ptsd reported more severe substance use problem than patient without ptsd regardless of previous te longitudinal study are needed in order to investigate the temporal relationship between te ptsd and sud

objective there is promising evidence that mindfulness based intervention are effective in reducing the symptom of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd however until now study have often lacked a full clinical ptsd assessment and intervention are often administered in addition to other intervention this study examined the feasibility of mindfulness based stress reduction mbsr a a standalone intervention in patient with ptsd who have experienced mixed traumatic event method fourteen patient participated in 8 week of mbsr the patient were assessed prior to treatment post treatment and at a 1 month follow up through self rating e g the davidson trauma scale and the clinician administered ptsd scale to determine the effect of the intervention furthermore after the intervention the patient participated in qualitative interview regarding their experience with mbsr and their idea for future improvement result nine patient finished the program and these patient considered the exercise to be applicable and helpful in the clinician administered ptsd scale we found large effect regarding the reduction of ptsd symptom among completers cohen s d 1 2 in the davidson trauma scale the effect size were somewhat lower cohen s d 0 6 but nevertheless confirmed the efficacy of mbsr in reducing ptsd symptom in the qualitative interview the patient reported an augmentation of wellbeing and improvement regarding the handling of difficult situation and more distance from the traumatic event conclusion despite the large effect the high dropout rate and the result of the post treatment interview suggest that the intervention should be better adapted to the need of ptsd patient e g by giving more information regarding the exercise and by including shorter exercise to manage acute distress

a stress is relevant to the formation of paranoia maladaptive behavioral and physiological stress regulation is discussed a a crucial indicator of vulnerability this is supported by research linking psychosis to the tendency to make le use of functional and more use of dysfunctional emotion regulation strategy er and with a lower vagally mediated heart rate variability hrv however it remains unclear whether er serf a a mediator between resting state hrv on the one hand and subjective stress level and paranoia on the other and whether this is specific to paranoia a compared to depression we used an experience sampling method during seven day to repeatedly ass the experience of stress usage of er strategy paranoia und depression 9 day in a sample with subclinical positive symptom n 32 resting state hrv wa measured during a 5min interval in the laboratory data wa analyzed by multi level model higher resting state hrv wa predictive of lower stress level and of using more functional er strategy reappraisal acceptance in daily life but did not predict the use of dysfunctional strategy rumination suppression or paranoia the association between resting state hrv and stress wa mediated by the usage of functional er le functional and more dysfunctional er were linked to higher level of stress paranoia and depression our study highlight that deficit in er represent a link between psychophysiological and phenomenological aspect of paranoia but also of depression this encourages to further investigate transdiagnostic prevention and therapy program aiming to improve er and to increase hrv

return of fear is a serious problem in exposure based treatment of anxiety disorder renewal of the fear response may occur when re encountering the conditioned stimulus within a novel context finding in rodent underpin the hippocampus role in conditioned fear renewal in novel context but it ha yet to be investigated in human forty six healthy men took part in a 2 day context dependent cued fear conditioning paradigm with fear acquisition extinction learning day 1 and extinction recall in the acquisition extinction and a novel context one day later conditioned evaluative skin conductance response scrs and blood oxygen level dependent response served a dependent variable context dependent fear renewal wa reflected in stronger conditioned scrs in the acquisition context individual with a higher renewal of conditioned scrs showed stronger activation of the fear circuit hippocampal activation distinguished conditioned responding in the novel compared with the extinction context individual with a stronger renewal of conditioned scrs in the novel context showed increased effective connectivity of hippocampal activation focus with structure in the fear and extinction network these result outline the pivotal role of the hippocampus and it connectivity in conditioned fear renewal in a novel context in human and might have important implication for exposure therapy in anxiety disorder

during emotion perception context is an important source of information whether contextual cue from modality other than vision or audition influence the perception of social emotional information ha not been investigated thus the present study aimed at testing emotion perception and regulation in response to fearful facial expression presented in the context of chemosensory stimulus derived from sweat of anxious individual in group of high hsa and low socially anxious lsa participant we recorded the startle reflex experiment i and analysed event related potential erps experiment ii while they viewed anxious facial expression in the context of chemosensory anxiety signal and chemosensory control stimulus result revealed that n1 p1 and n170 amplitude were larger while late positive potential lpp activity wa smaller for facial expression presented in the context of the anxiety and the chemosensory control stimulus a compared to facial expression without a chemosensory context furthermore hsa participant were highly sensitive to the contextual anxiety signal they showed enhanced motivated attention allocation lpp study ii a well a larger startle response toward face in the context of chemosensory anxiety signal than did lsa participant study i chemosensory context had no effect on emotion regulation and both lsa and hsa participant showed effective emotion regulation study i and ii in conclusion both anxiety and chemosensory sport context stimulus enhanced early attention allocation and structural encoding but diminished motivated attention allocation to the facial expression the current result show that visual and chemosensory information is integrated on virtually all level of stimulus processing and that socially anxious individual might be especially sensitive to chemosensory contextual social information

sleep disturbance is associated with elevated suicidal ideation and negative affect to date however no study ha investigated the temporal relationship between sleep and suicidality among those diagnosed with borderline personality disorder bpd this preregistered http osf io 4vugk study tested whether nightly sleep self reported sleep duration sleep onset latency and subjective sleep quality represents a within person short term risk factor for affective dysregulation and increase in suicide risk from day to day a well a whether between person difference in sleep negative affect and suicidality were associated we used a 21 day ecological momentary assessment protocol in a sample of 153 people diagnosed with bpd 105 of which had a history of serious suicide attempt and 52 healthy control n 4076 day we found a within person association between worse subjective sleep quality and greater next day negative affect at the between person level we found positive relationship between sleep latency and suicidal ideation and a negative association between subjective sleep quality and negative affect bpd severity did not significantly moderate the strength of any within person association although bpd wa positively associated with average level of suicidal ideation sleep latency and negative affect and negatively related to subjective sleep quality these finding suggest that the association of sleep with suicidal ideation and bpd exists largely at the between person rather than the within person level disturbed sleep therefore seems to largely coincide rather than specifically contribute to the exacerbation of suicidal crisis in bpd psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

social influence are important modulators of pain experimental study demonstrated analgesic effect of explicit social support a digital health care gain importance this study investigated influence of social support by virtual character and their perceived agency in virtual reality on pain in a within subject design participant experienced painful heat stimulus in vr either a virtual character provided verbal support prior to the pain stimulus or not support v no support condition in addition participant were instructed that a real human avatar condition or a computer script virtual agent controlled the virtual character however in both condition the virtual character wa computer controlled main outcome measure were pain rating and physiological pain response virtual verbal support affected physiological response in term of stress buffering but not pain rating the agency manipulation wa successful a the avatar yielded higher rating of perceived human likeness helpfulness and realism compared to the virtual agent however agency of the character did not affect pain response this study revealed that virtual verbal support positively influence physiological pain response independently of perceived agency the finding have important clinical implication a virtual interaction and digital health intervention are increasingly relevant for pain treatment participant felt more present in the virtual world with a virtual character social support by a virtual character buffered physiological reaction pain rating were not affected by social support provided of virtual character the perceived agency of the virtual character did not affect pain response

introduction cognitive behavioural therapy for psychosis cbtp ha been repeatedly shown to ameliorate psychotic symptom however so far we have little understanding of the mechanism of change in cbtp in this study we tested whether improved cognitive and behavioural effort to manage taxing external or internal demand coping constitute a mechanism of change in cbtp method using data from a published trial for a secondary analysis we tested whether the continuous symptomatic improvement of patient n 57 who received up to 45 session of cbtp and completed weekly self assessment of symptom suspiciousness individualised positive and negative symptom and individualised symptom of depression wa mediated by preceding improvement in self assessed coping using multilevel analysis a reverse model in which symptom improvement predicted improved coping wa also tested result continuous improvement in suspiciousness negative symptom and depression over the course of cbtp wa preceded by improvement in coping improvement in suspiciousness or positive symptom did not predict subsequent improvement in coping whereas improvement in negative symptom and depression predicted subsequent improvement in coping conclusion coping constitutes a mechanism of change albeit to a different extent for different symptom cluster further research need to explore how best to utilise this mechanism and optimise it integration with other active ingredient of cbtp to maximise therapeutic gain

background the world health organization recently proposed significant change to the posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd diagnostic criterion in the 11th edition of the international classification of disease icd 11 objective the present study investigated the impact of these change in two different post conflict sample method prevalence and rate of concurrent depression and anxiety socio demographic characteristic and indicator of clinical severity according to icd 11 in 1 075 cambodian and 453 colombian civilian exposed to civil war and genocide were compared to those according to the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder fourth edition dsm iv result result indicated significantly lower prevalence rate under the icd 11 proposal 8 1 cambodian sample and 44 4 colombian sample compared to the dsm iv 11 2 cambodian sample and 55 0 colombian sample participant meeting a ptsd diagnosis only under the icd 11 proposal had significantly lower rate of concurrent depression and a lower concurrent total score depression and anxiety compared to participant meeting only dsm iv diagnostic criterion there were no significant difference in socio demographic characteristic and indicator of clinical severity between these two group conclusion the lower prevalence of ptsd according to the icd 11 proposal in our sample of person exposed to a high number of traumatic event may counter criticism of previous ptsd classification to overuse the ptsd diagnosis in population exposed to extreme stressor also another goal to better distinguish ptsd from comorbid disorder could be supported with our data

depression and suicide ideation co occur regularly the present study investigated whether religious belief i e trust in higher guidance buffer the association between depression and suicide ideation a total of 427 participant n 93 inpatient n 334 online sample completed measure of suicide ideation trust in higher guidance and depression trust in higher guidance moderated the impact of depression on suicide ideation trust in higher guidance seems to confer resilience and should be taken into account when assessing individual for suicide risk

background intrusive image of appearance play an important role in the maintenance of body dysmorphic disorder bdd and are often linked to negative autobiographical experience however to date there is no study examining the use and efficacy of imagery rescripting in bdd method this study investigated imagery rescripting in six patient with bdd using a single case series a b design the intervention consisted of two treatment session t1 t2 bdd and depressive symptom were evaluated prior to t1 post t2 and two week after intervention fu using the yale brown obsessive compulsive scale for bdd bdd ybocs the body dysmorphic symptom inventory and the beck depression inventory result at post treatment significant reduction in negative affect distress vividness and encapsulated belief associated with image and memory a well a an increased control were observed for five of six patient these were maintained or decreased at two week follow up score on the bdd ybocs indicated a significant 26 improvement in bdd severity at follow up for the whole group considering response a a 30 reduction in bdd ybocs score four of six patient were classified a treatment responder at follow up significant improvement in bdd and depressive symptom were observed for the whole group limitation the small sample size and the lack of a control group limit the generalizability of our result conclusion the finding indicate the potential efficacy of imagery rescripting and highlight the need for further controlled trial imagery rescripting should be considered a a treatment technique within the cognitive framework of bdd
