many study have emphasized the role of natural resource in the onset and duration of armed conflict due to it characteristic narcotic are considered to be one of the most influential resource however the dynamic of how this particular commodity is linked to conflict is still not well understood most scholar have focused on the revenue aspect of narcotic and only a few have mentioned the micro level aspect i e the effect of drug intake and alcohol consumption on combatant behavior during conflict with the help of a dataset based on 224 interview held with former combatant in the democratic republic of the congo we examined this latter dynamic our analysis show after controlling for armed group level and individual level variable that drug intake and alcohol consumption boost the number of violent action perpetrated by combatant

objective posttraumatic mental disorder may occur with different affect quality best known is posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd a conditioned anxiety reaction with intrusion another event related mental disorder is posttraumatic embitterment pted characterized by affect of embitterment and thought of revenge occurring after an event deeply hurting basic belief knowing about associated disability is important for treatment and sociomedical decision this is the first study to explore work disability in patient with ptsd pted and not event related common mental disorder cmd method in this observational study 101 soldier 85 men 31 year 50 experienced expedition abroad with different mental disorder were investigated concerning common mental disorder mini and accompanying work capacity impairment mini icf app interview were conducted by a state licensed psychotherapist with expertise in sociomedical description of work capacity impairment patient with ptsd pted and other cmd were compared concerning their degree and pattern of work capacity impairment result ptsd patient n 23 were more strongly impaired in mobility a compared to patient with other cmd n 64 or pted patient with pted n 14 were more impaired in interactional capacity contact with others group integration a compared to patient with other cmd or ptsd conclusion ptsd patient need support to improve mobility in work relevant traffic situation apart from this they are not specifically more or le impaired than patient with other cmd pted patient should get attention concerning their interactional problem a these may disturb esprit de corp which is an essential requirement for service in the armed force psycinfo database record

importance the structural abnormality in the brain that accurately differentiate unipolar depression ud and bipolar depression bd remain unidentified objective first to investigate and compare morphometric change in ud and bd and to replicate the finding at 2 independent neuroimaging site second to differentiate ud and bd using multivariate pattern classification technique design setting and participant in a 2 center cross sectional study structural gray matter data were obtained at 2 independent site pittsburgh pennsylvania and munster germany using 3 t magnetic resonance imaging voxel based morphometry wa used to compare local gray and white matter volume and a novel pattern classification approach wa used to discriminate between ud and bd while training the classifier at one imaging site and testing in an independent sample at the other site the pittsburgh sample of participant wa recruited from the western psychiatric institute and clinic at the university of pittsburgh from 2008 to 2012 the munster sample wa recruited from the department of psychiatry at the university of munster from 2010 to 2012 equally divided between the 2 site were 58 currently depressed patient with bipolar i disorder 58 age and sex matched unipolar depressed patient and 58 matched healthy control main outcome and measure magnetic resonance imaging wa used to detect structural difference between group morphometric analysis were applied using voxel based morphometry pattern classification technique were used for a multivariate approach result at both site individual with bd showed reduced gray matter volume in the hippocampal formation and the amygdala relative to individual with ud montreal neurological institute coordinate x 22 y 1 z 20 k 1938 voxels t 4 75 whereas individual with ud showed reduced gray matter volume in the anterior cingulate gyrus compared with individual with bd montreal neurological institute coordinate x 8 y 32 z 3 k 979 voxels t 6 37 all corrected p 05 reduction in white matter volume within the cerebellum and hippocampus were found in individual with bd pattern classification yielded up to 79 3 accuracy p 001 by differentiating the 2 depressed group training and testing the classifier at one site and up to 69 0 accuracy p 001 training the classifier at one imaging site pittsburgh and testing it at the other independent sample munster medication load did not alter the pattern of result conclusion and relevance individual with ud and those with bd are differentiated by structural abnormality in neural region supporting emotion processing neuroimaging and multivariate pattern classification technique are promising tool to differentiate ud from bd and show promise a future diagnostic aid

our study addressed distinct aspect of social problem solving in 28 hospitalized patient with major depressive disorder mdd and 28 matched healthy control three scenario based test assessed the ability to infer the mental state of story character in difficult interpersonal situation the capacity to freely generate good strategy for dealing with such situation and the ability to identify the best solution among le optimal alternative also standard test assessing attention memory executive function and trait empathy were administered compared to control mdd patient showed impaired interpretation of other people sarcastic remark but not of the mental state underlying other people action furthermore mdd patient generated fewer strategy that were socially sensitive and practically effective at the same time or at least only socially sensitive overall while the free generation of adequate strategy for difficult social situation wa impaired recognition of optimal solution among alternative wa spared in mdd patient higher generation score were associated with higher trait empathy and cognitive flexibility score we suggest that this specific pattern of impairment ought to be considered in the development of therapy addressing impaired social skill in mdd

background the neuropeptide oxytocin ot ha positive effect on the processing of emotional stimulus such a facial expression to date research ha focused primarily on condition of overt visual attention method we investigated whether a single intranasal dose of ot 24 iu would modulate the allocation of attentional resource towards positive and negative facial expression using a dot probe paradigm in a sample of 69 healthy men attentional capacity for these facial cue wa limited by presentation time 100 or 500 m in addition we controlled for overt visual attention by recording eye movement using a remote eye tracker result reaction time rts in the dot probe paradigm revealed a pronounced shift of attention towards happy facial expression presented for 100 m after ot administration whereas there were no ot induced effect for longer presentation time 500 m the result could not be attributed to modulation of overt visual attention a no substance effect on gaze towards the facial target were observed conclusion the result suggest that ot increased covert attention to happy face thereby supporting the hypothesis that ot modulates early attentional process that might promote prosocial behavior

early life maltreatment elm is the major single risk factor for impairment in social functioning and mental health in adulthood one of the most prevalent and most rapidly increasing form of elm is emotional neglect according to bio behavioral synchrony assumption the oxytocin and attachment system play an important mediating role in the interplay between emotional neglect and social dysfunctioning therefore the aim of the present study wa to investigate whether fear and avoidance of social functioning two important and highly prevalent facet of social dysfunctioning in adulthood are shaped by emotional neglect plasma oxytocin level and attachment representation we assessed emotional neglect a well a other form of elm with the childhood trauma questionnaire current attachment representation with the adult attachment projective picture system and fear and avoidance of social situation with the liebowitz social anxiety scale in a population based sample of n 121 men and woman furthermore 4 9 ml blood sample were drawn from each participant to ass peripheral plasma oxytocin level applying a sequential mediation model result revealed that emotional neglect wa associated with lower plasma oxytocin level which in turn were associated with insecure attachment representation which were related to elevated fear and avoidance of social situation a 1 d 21 b 2 f 3 117 20 84 p 001 plasma oxytocin and current attachment representation hence fully and sequentially mediate the effect of emotional neglect on social fear and avoidance two important facet of adult social dysfunctioning confirming bio behavioral synchrony assumption

background relationship quality and sleep quality influenced physiological and psychological health therefore the aim of the present study wa to determine a possible connection between relationship satisfaction and sleep quality and to test a theoretical model of sleep quality a related to relationship and psychological well being method fifty one heterosexual cohabitating couple between 24 and 70 year old participated the relationship quality wa measured by the german short version of relationship questionnaire to determine the sleep quality the pittsburgh sleep quality index and a two week sleep diary were implemented to gather information about psychological well being especially depression and anxiety the german symptom checklist wa used result sleep quality wa measured by the pittsburgh sleep quality index and relationship quality correlated significantly negative in addition the study found a positive correlation between sleep duration and relationship quality in a multiple regression model fighting and mental strain explained 38 of variance of sleep quality depression anxiety and relationship quality showed no further improvement of the model these finding suggested that relationship quality constructive partnership behavior and mental strain played an essential role in sleep quality

research suggested that maternal anxiety disorder might be related to infant behavioral inhibition this study investigated whether maternal postpartum anxiety disorder is associated with infant temperament more precisely infant distress to novelty an early predictor of behavioral inhibition difference in the latter were analyzed in a german sample by comparing n 38 healthy mother infant dyad to n 44 dyad comprised of mother diagnosed with a dsm iv anxiety disorder infant age ranged from 2 83 to 7 97 month infant temperament wa measured by mean of the infant behavior questionnaire mother were screened for postpartum anxiety disorder using the structured clinical interview for dsm iv disorder severity of anxiety wa measured by self reported questionnaire anxiety cognition questionnaire body sensation questionnaire and mobility inventory infant salivary cortisol reaction when being confronted with a socio emotional stressor face to face still face paradigm wa assessed to validate infant distress a mann whitney u analysis suggested that infant of mother with an anxiety disorder show more distress to novelty than infant of healthy mother furthermore data reveal a positive spearman s rho correlation between infant distress to novelty and maternal avoidance behavior mobility inventory a strong correlation between infant cortisol reactivity and reported distress to novelty validated the maternal evaluation of infant temperament in our sample result suggest a possible approach to promote infant development by encouraging mother with anxiety symptom to encounter feared stimulus

the objective of this study wa to test a time efficient screening instrument to ass clinically relevant and everyday life e g economic political personal anxiety furthermore factor influencing these anxiety correlation between clinical and everyday anxiety and for the first time anxiety during different stage of life were assessed in a representative sample of the general population n 2229 around 30 of the respondent manifested at least one disorder specific key symptom within 1 year woman men 8 reported severe anxiety symptom two third of respondent reported minor everyday anxiety and 5 were strongly impaired whereby person with severe clinical symptom were more frequently affected a variety of potential influencing factor could be identified these include in addition to socioeconomic status gender general health risk taking and leisure behavior also some up to now little investigated possible protective factor such a everyday life mental activity the observed effect are rather small which however given the heterogeneity of the general population seems plausible although the correlative design of the study doe not allow direct causal conclusion it can however serve a a starting point for experimental intervention study in the future together with time series from repeated representative survey we expect these data to provide a better understanding of the process that underlie everyday life and clinical anxiety

objective the purpose of this study wa to examine the impact of age and weight status on adolescent body dissatisfaction and it change over 20 month in a gender comparing design the influence of body image concern on eating concern wa also investigated method in a prospective study 675 male and female adolescent aged 12 16 were assessed using self report questionnaire on weight shape muscularity and eating concern height and weight measurement were taken by trained personnel data were analyzed using structural equation modeling result analysis of latent mean revealed more pronounced weight shape concern in female than male and more pronounced muscularity concern in male than female weight shape concern increased in female over time whereas muscularity concern remained stable in both gender baseline level of weight shape concern could be predicted by age and weight status in female and by weight status in male the only predictor of change in weight shape concern wa weight status in male baseline level of muscularity concern could be predicted by age in female and by weight status in male similar effect were found for change in muscularity concern in both gender increase in weight shape and muscularity concern were associated with more pronounced eating concern discussion the result confirm gender difference in distinctive facet of body image concern and it prediction the relevance of increase in body image concern in adolescent is underlined by it association with eating concern in both gender further explanatory variable for change in body dissatisfaction should be examined in future study c 2016 wiley periodical inc int j eat disord 2017 50 139 147

background the typical mode of assessment in study on intersession process isp in psychotherapy is using cross sectional or weekly measurement daily dynamic of intersession process have not yet been studied method intersession process data from 22 ambulatory psychotherapy case were collected in a naturalistic study with high temporal resolution resulting in a total of 1026 daily measurement multilevel vector autoregressive var modelling wa applied to discover the temporal course and causal influence among intersession process centrality analysis wa applied to discover unique function of various intersession process variable result a group level network structure wa discovered offering first insight on the role of different intersession process during psychotherapy centrality analysis revealed unique role for various aspect of the intersession process temporal distance from the last session had only weak influence on the isp conclusion using short daily measure the unique role of various aspect of the isp were uncovered some aspect of the isp like recalling session content or reflection on future session content are facilitator of overall isp intensity other aspect like thought on payment or appointment or negative treatment related emotion are likely to suppress isp

abstract visual motion stimulus can induce the perception of self motion in stationary observer known a vection in the present study we investigated the sensory processing underlying vection by measuring the human event related brain potential erps elicited by the movement onset of a visual stimulus we presented participant a visual stimulus consisting of alternating black and white vertical bar that moved in horizontal direction creating the sensation of vection the stimulus wa presented on a screen that wa divided into a central and a surrounding peripheral visual area both area moved independently from each other resulting in four different movement pattern the peripheral and the central stimulus moved in the same or opposite direction or one of the two visual area of the stimulus moved while the other remained stable in addition two different stimulus type varying with respect to the bar width narrow v wide were used participant were presented with these stimulus in two phase of the experiment during eeg recording only short phase 2 5 3 5 m of visual motion were applied in a separate rating phase visual motion wa presented for 45 s in this phase vection onset intensity and duration were verbally recorded overall the visual stimulation generated vection with different intensity i e weakest vection with sole central stimulus movement stimulus type did not affect vection in the erps stimulus onset elicited parieto occipital p2 and n2 component the amplitude of the erp component differed significantly between the four movement pattern irrespective of stimulus type however they did not fully align with the subjective vection rating since the erps are associated with early sensory processing preceding vection we argue that the erps mirror the contribution of sensory cortical process to vection rather than the subjective sensation of vection per se

disgust cause specific reaction pattern observable in mimic response and body reaction most research on disgust deal with visual stimulus however picture may cause another disgust experience than sound odor or tactile stimulus therefore disgust experience evoked by four different sensory channel wa compared a total of 119 participant received 3 different disgusting and one control stimulus each presented through the visual auditory tactile and olfactory channel rating of evoked disgust a well a response of the autonomic nervous system heart rate skin conductance level systolic blood pressure were recorded and the effect of stimulus labeling and of repeated presentation wa analyzed rating suggested that disgust could be evoked through all sens they were highest for visual stimulus however autonomic reaction toward disgusting stimulus differed according to the channel of presentation in contrast to the other olfactory disgust stimulus provoked a strong decrease of systolic blood pressure additionally labeling enhanced disgust rating and autonomic reaction for olfactory and tactile but not for visual and auditory stimulus repeated presentation indicated that participant s disgust rating diminishes to all but olfactory disgust stimulus taken together we argue that the sensory channel through which a disgust reaction is evoked matter

fear extinction is a central model for the treatment of anxiety disorder initial research ha reported that the single presentation of a conditioned stimulus prior to extinction learning can permanently block the return of fear however only few study have explored this issue and could not always replicate the finding the present study examined human fear extinction using a four day design on the first day two neutral stimulus were paired with electrical stimulation ucs while a third stimulus c wa not twenty four hour later one conditioned stimulus c rem and the c were reminded once 10 min before extinction learning while the other conditioned stimulus c non rem wa not presented prior to extinction learning all stimulus were presented during extinction learning and during two re extinction session 24 h and 6 month after extinction learning without reinforcement blood oxygen level dependent bold response and skin conductance response scrs to both c and the c were explored during acquisition extinction and in both re extinction session regarding scrs the result showed that a single presentation of a conditioned stimulus did not block the return of fear during re extinction fear recovery during re extinction 24 h and 6 month after extinction learning wa observed for both c compared with the c with no difference between c rem and c non rem regarding bold response no significant difference between c rem and c non rem were found in region of interest roi analysis amygdala ventromedial prefrontal cortex during extinction learning and both re extinction session whole brain analysis showed increased bold response to the c non rem a compared to the c rem in several region e g middle frontal gyrus during extinction learning and re extinction 24 h after extinction learning the present finding suggest that the effect of preventing the return of fear by disrupting reconsolidation seems to be a more labile phenomenon than previously assumed possible boundary condition and implication are discussed

the need for intervention strategy aiming to reduce teacher use of violent discipline method ha been expressed repeatedly especially for country where this practice is socially and legally accepted nevertheless initial target for intervention are not clearly identified a factor contributing to teacher use of violence are still understudied in the present study we examined the interplay between teacher own experience of violence their attitude current stress and their use of violent discipline in a representative sample of 173 tanzanian primary school teacher 53 7 female m age 38 1 year sd age 10 using structural equation modeling our model showed good model fit chi 2 48 n 173 78 058 p 004 cfi 962 tli 948 rmsea 060 90 ci 034 084 pclose 233 srmr 048 result indicated direct association between positive attitude toward violent discipline beta 41 stress beta 23 and teacher own experience of violence beta 21 with teacher use of violence teacher own experience of violence were significantly associated with positive attitude beta 39 and these significantly mediated the association between teacher own experience of violence and their use of violent discipline beta 23 our finding underscore the relevance of past experience societal norm and current working condition in understanding teacher violence against student intervention aiming to reduce teacher use of violent discipline may focus on stress management societal norm personal belief on violent discipline and how teacher own previous experience of violence may influence teacher s disciplining behavior

behavioral measure such a the wearing of facemasks and maintaining of distance to other people have been central in fighting the covid 19 pandemic and will continue to be important in curbing it spread we therefore investigated their perceived usefulness adherence and their predictor in representative online sample in eight country france germany poland russia spain sweden u k u s of the 7 658 participant 77 4 rated governmental measure highest germany lowest france a useful and 91 7 reported adherence to them adherence wa lowest in russia and poland where people felt particularly left alone and not well supported and in the u s and sweden where government showed ambivalent attitude towards the measure the highest adherence wa reported in country with very high mortality u k spain france or very positively perceived government communication germany female gender higher age belonging to a risk group being affected physically and mentally perception of governmental communication a guided by the interest of people feeling of being well informed and the level of positive mental health positively predicted both outcome while being affected economically negatively predicted both outcome country specific result are considered in the light of the protection motivation theory and the theory of planned behavior together with potential way to improve active participation of the population overall we recommend the government and authority to stress that each individual can contribute to the control of the covid 19 situation by adherence to the measure in the public communication moreover they should emphasize the risk of unconscious infection of older individual by younger people a well a the importance of physical activity for the protection of mental and physical health especially during the pandemic

background research ha shown that negative expectation in major depressive disorder mdd often persist despite positive disconfirming experience to explain this phenomenon the concept of cognitive immunization ha been introduced that is individual with mdd reappraise disconfirming positive evidence in such a way that negative expectation are maintained in this study we examined whether it is possible to inhibit cognitive immunization to facilitate expectation update method we examined 113 people with mdd being treated in an inpatient psychosomatic hospital using a previously validated paradigm participant worked on a standardized performance test we examined change in negative performance related expectation after positive expectation disconfirming feedback one experimental group received additional information increasing the value of the positive feedback information another group wa instructed to recall the feedback after completing the task recall in a third group participant attention wa shifted to potential expectation disconfirming feedback attention in addition a control group underwent the standard procedure of the paradigm result the result showed significant group difference in the change in generalized performance expectation with the largest change in participant from the information group all experimental group had lower value for cognitive immunization than the control group limitation given that this proof of concept study wa the first to examine strategy to inhibit cognitive immunization the finding need to be replicated in future study conclusion the present study confirms that cognitive immunization in mdd can be inhibited thus facilitating adjusting negative expectation the most promising result were found for the information group providing information to emphasize the relevance of expectation disconfirming information

introduction the neurobiological mechanism behind panic disorder with agoraphobia pd ag are not completely explored the functional a t single nucleotide polymorphism snp rs324981 in the neuropeptide s receptor gene npsr1 ha repeatedly been associated with panic disorder and might partly drive function respectively dysfunction of the neural fear network we aimed to investigate whether the npsr1 t risk allele wa associated with malfunctioning in a fronto limbic network during the anticipation and perception of agoraphobia specific stimulus method 121 patient with pd ag and 77 healthy control hc underwent functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri using the disorder specific westphal paradigm it consists of neutral and agoraphobia specific picture half of the picture were cued to induce anticipatory anxiety result risk allele carrier showed significantly higher amygdala activation during the perception of agoraphobia specific stimulus than a a homozygote a linear group x genotype interaction during the perception of agoraphobia specific stimulus showed a strong trend towards significance patient with the one or two t allele displayed the highest and hc with the a a genotype the lowest activation in the inferior orbitofrontal cortex iofc discussion the study demonstrates an association of the npsr1rs324981 genotype and the perception of agoraphobia specific stimulus these result support the assumption of a fronto limbic dysfunction a an intermediate phenotype of pd ag

background heightened impulsivity ha been suggested a a possible risk factor for bipolar disorder bd however study on high risk population are scarce and have mainly focused on individual with a genetic risk the present study investigated two high risk sample for bd with regard to several aspect of the impulsivity construct method unaffected relative of bd patient genetically defined high risk group n 29 and participant scoring high on the hypomanic personality scale psychometrically defined high risk sample n 25 were being compared to respective control group n 27 and n 25 using a multi method approach participant were accessed on the barratt impulsiveness scale 11 bi 11 trait impulsivity the stop signal task response inhibition and the cambridge gambling task impulsive behavior in decision making process result both high risk group reported heightened impulsivity on the bi 11 a well a impulsive decision making whereas no significant group difference in response inhibition were observed limitation limitation were the lack in specificity of the result for bd and the cross sectional study design which doe not allow conclusion about the influence of impulsivity on the development of or resilience for bd in risk group conclusion our finding support the assumption that increased trait impulsivity and impulsive decision making are a vulnerability marker for and an endophenotype of bd

introduction trait sexual motivation defines a psychological construct that reflects the long lasting degree of motivation for sexual activity which is assumed to be the result of biological and sociocultural influence with this definition it share commonality with other sexuality related construct like sexual desire sexual drive sexual need and sexual compulsivity aim the trait sexual motivation questionnaire tsmq wa developed in order to measure trait sexual motivation with it different facet method several step were conducted first item were composed assessing sexual desire the effort made to gain sex a well a specific sexual behavior factor analysis of the data of a first sample n 256 wa conducted second the factor solution wa verified by a confirmatory factor analysis in a second sample n 498 and construct validity wa demonstrated third the temporal stability of the tsmq wa tested in a third study n 59 main outcome measure questionnaire data result the exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis revealed that trait sexual motivation is best characterized by four subscales solitary sexuality importance of sex seeking sexual encounter and comparison with others it could be shown that the test quality of the questionnaire is high most importantly for the trait concept the retest reliability after 1 year wa r 0 87 conclusion our result indicate that the tsmq is indeed a suitable tool for measuring long lasting sexual motivation with high test quality and high construct validity a future differentiation between trait and state sexual motivation might be helpful for clinical a well a forensic research

the present study wa designed to examine the effect of training in positive interpretation in clinically anxious child a total of 87 child between 7 and 12 year of age were randomly assigned to either a positive cognitive bias modification training for interpretation cmb i or a neutral training training included 15 session in a two week period child with an interpretation bias prior to training in the positive training group showed a significant reduction in interpretation bias on the social threat scenario after training but not child in the neutral training group no effect on interpretation bias were found for the general threat scenario or the non threat scenario furthermore child in the positive training did not self report lower anxiety than child in the neutral training group however mother and father reported a significant reduction in social anxiety in their child after positive training but not after neutral training this study demonstrated that clinically anxious child with a prior interpretation bias can be trained away from negative social interpretation bias and there is some evidence that this corresponds to reduction in social anxiety this study also highlight the importance of using specific training stimulus

background objective depression and suicide ideation regularly occur together yet little is known about factor that buffer individual against the development of suicide ideation the present study investigated whether positive mental health buffer the association between depression and suicide ideation in a longitudinal study design method a total of 207 german student 70 3 female age m 26 04 sd 5 33 were assessed at a baseline evaluation and again twelve month later data were collected using self report questionnaire linear hierarchical regression analysis wa used to analyze the data positive mental health wa considered to moderate the impact of depression on suicide ideation controlling for age and gender result positive mental health wa shown to moderate the impact of depression on suicide ideation in those student who reported higher level of positive mental health depression severity showed no association with suicide ideation over time conclusion positive mental health seems to confer resilience and should be taken into account when assessing individual for suicide risk

stress is known to be a trigger for binge eating in individual with binge eating disorder bed however the influence of stressful situation on bed patient body image is le understood our study objective wa to gain insight into the effect of inducing psychosocial stress on body dissatisfaction in woman with bed overweight woman with bed n 29 and without an eating disorder control group cg n 38 underwent the trier social stress test for group tsst g stress and a nonstressful control task tsst g no stress additionally to test for the influence of body salience participant were either exposed or not exposed to a mirror participant repeatedly rated their current body dissatisfaction and psychological distress simultaneously biological stress reactivity wa measured using salivary cortisol and alpha amylase saa participant responded to tsst g stress with significantly higher psychological and biological stress compared to the tsst g control task the psychological distress response wa significantly greater in woman with bed than the cg a hypothesized exposure to acute socioevaluative stress led to exacerbated body dissatisfaction in the bed group only the finding of the present study suggest that acute socioevaluative stress may play an influential role in bed patient body dissatisfaction body image program might benefit from targeting stress management or coping skill in patient with bed psycinfo database record

background heightened sensitivity towards reward and insensitivity towards disadvantageous consequence may constitute a driving factor underlying unrestricted food intake and consequent weight gain in people with overweight and obesity therefore the present study applied a behavioral economics approach to investigate the potential contribution of poor reward related decision making to unsuccessful long term weight loss maintenance i e weight cycling based on previous research it wa expected that successful long term weight loss maintainer would show a better performance in a gambling task than their le successful counterpart method reward related decision making wa assessed post hoc using the game of dice task in a total of 33 overweight and obese woman who had either a successfully maintained initial weight loss of at least 10 of their body weight over one year or b had regained weight until at least their initial body weight prior to weight reduction i e showed weight cycling result the group did not differ in term of age current body weight magnitude of initial weight reduction educational level and global intelligence level a hypothesized however the group of successful long term weight loss maintainer performed significantly better i e showed le impulsive more advantageous choice in the game of dice task than their le successful counterpart conclusion the finding suggest that poor reward related decision making is associated with weight cycling which is considered a key concern in weight loss treatment for overweight and obesity furthermore the finding speak in favor of specific psychological intervention that are designed to bolster reward related decision making

background the present study aimed at investigating whether resting vagally mediated heart rate variability hrv a a trait like biomarker of cognitive inhibitory control capacity is related to suicide ideation in a sample without suicide attempt history method thirty seven healthy student participated voluntarily 18 to 34 year m 24 5 sd 4 1 73 0 female time and frequency measure of hrv were derived from an electrocardiogram that wa recorded using einthoven s triangle lead ii participant filled in the rasch based depression screening and four question concerning lifetime suicide ideation si bivariate pearson s and partial controlling for depression severity correlation coefficient were calculated between si and measure of vagally mediated hrv result a significant correlation between the ln10 transformed high frequency band of resting vagally mediated hrv and si wa found r 33 p 05 correlation did not change substantially when controlling for depression mean heart rate a a time domain measure also significantly correlated with si while controlling for depression r 36 p 05 a trend correlation between si and root mean square of successive difference between interbeat interval emerged limitation si wa assessed with a composite score of four item measuring si future study should consider using more comprehensive assessment instrument conclusion the relation between resting vagally mediated hrv and suicide ideation may be interpreted a indicating that reduced inhibitory cognitive control capacity may be a risk factor for suicidality it may act already early in the suicidal process before suicidal behavior develops and should be further investigated a potentially clinically important physiological predictor of suicidality

objective the conners adult adhd rating scale caars ass symptom specific to adult that are frequently used and have been translated into german the current study test the factor structure of the caars in a large sample of german adult with adhd and compare the mean of the caars subscales with those of healthy german control method caars were completed by 466 participant with adhd and 851 healthy control participant confirmatory factor analysis wa used to establish model fit with the american original comparison between participant with adhd and healthy control and influence of gender age and degree of education were analyzed result confirmatory factor analysis showed a very good fit with the model for the american original difference between adhd participant and healthy control on all conners adult adhd rating scale self report caars s subscales were substantial and significant conclusion the factor structure of the original american model wa successfully replicated in this sample of adult german adhd participant

model posit problematic binge watching to involve a vicious circle of low motivation for alternative activity low sensitivity for the consequence of neglected goal and low self control a such simultaneously impaired feedback and inhibitory functioning might contribute to binge watching we tested the hypothesis that blunted feedback related brain activity is coupled with attenuated inhibitory brain activity in binge watcher high n 32 and non binge watcher n 31 performed go nogo inhibition and stop signal stopping task and a flanker paradigm with performance feedback during electroencephalography we examined how neural correlate of inhibition and stopping were associated with outcome processing in each group we assessed the temporospatial relationship using a single trial regression approach high binge watcher but not non binge watcher who differentiated le between gain and loss at the neural level feedback p3b also recruited le brain activity during both inhibition and stopping inhibition p3 and stopping p3 exploratory analysis suggested that these relationship were most prominent in high binge watcher with high loss of control over watching main effect of the group in performance or eeg did not emerge these result suggest a potentially problematic interaction between outcome and inhibitory function in binge watcher insensitivity to behavioral consequence along with inhibitory impairment may also confer a long term risk for compulsive watching our multi modal approach may be particularly suited to detect such an underlying risk marker

delay aversion dav is thought to be a crucial factor in the manifestation of impulsive behavior in patient with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd the imposition of delay is predicted to elicit negative emotional reaction in adhd the present study offer a multimodal approach to the investigation of dav twelve adult patient with adhd and 12 matched healthy control were tested on a new task with several level of anticipated delay during functional magnet resonance imaging fmri behavioral measure of delay discounting dav and delay frustration were collected skin conductance and finger pulse rate were assessed result indicated a group difference in response to change in delay in the right amygdala for control participant activity decreased with longer delay whereas activity tended to increase for adhd patient the degree of amygdala increase wa correlated with the degree of behavioral dav within the adhd group patient also exhibited increased emotional arousal on physiological measure these result support the notion of an exacerbated negative emotional state during the anticipation and processing of delay in adhd

bullying victimization is associated with adverse mental health consequence while bully suffer few or no adverse consequence in western society yet the universality of these consequence across western and eastern culture is unknown the current study investigated retrospective bullying experience in primary and secondary school and it effect on adult mental health depression anxiety stress lifetime suicidal behavior positive mental health life satisfaction social support self efficacy and sense of control in 5 012 chinese and 1 935 german university student school bullying victimization wa far le frequently recalled by the chinese sample 6 2 12 6 than the german sample 29 3 37 0 but victim had similar adverse mental health in both country in germany bully and not involved had equally good mental health whereas bully in china had poor mental health comparable to victim bullying victimization ha similar adverse effect on mental health across country however compared to the german student the prevalence of school bullying is significantly lower and bully are also more likely to suffer mental health problem in adulthood in chinese student the difference of reason for and consequence of being bully are discussed and may have important implication for evolutionary theory and intervention of bullying

abstract this cross national study investigated the extent of social medium use smu a a source of information about covid 19 and it relationship with the experienced burden caused by the pandemic representative data from eight country france germany poland russia spain sweden the uk the usa were collected online end of may to the beginning of june 2020 of the overall 8 302 participant 48 1 frequently used social medium sm a a covid 19 information source range 31 8 in germany to 65 4 in poland in the overall sample and in all country specific sample regression analysis revealed the experienced burden caused by covid 19 to be positively associated with smu and stress symptom furthermore stress symptom partly mediated the relationship between smu and the burden the result emphasize the significant association between the use of sm a a source of information individual emotional state and behavior during the pandemic a well a the significance of conscious and accurate use of sm specifically during the covid 19 outbreak

most current research investigating traumatic stress is focused on it effect at the individual level utilizing the implicit assumption that trauma related disorder are mutually independent within family and community however there is reason to assume that trauma related symptom within couple are influenced by each partner s risk factor and symptom using the actor partner interdependence model this study aimed to test whether symptom of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd and depression were predicted by participant partner s exposure to traumatic event over and above the influence of the participant s own experience for this purpose we interviewed 687 heterosexual married iraqi and syrian couple in iraq s kurdistan region who had been forcefully displaced we assessed symptom of ptsd and depression using locally validated scale nearly all participant 98 8 reported exposure to at least one traumatic event with husband reporting exposure to a higher number of traumatic event than wife d 0 48 p 001 more than half of the participant met the criterion for a probable ptsd 61 1 or major depressive disorder diagnosis 60 4 within couple significant actor effect of experienced trauma exposure on personal ptsd and depressive symptom were observed for both husband and wife further there were significant partner effect of wife traumatic experience on husband ptsd and depressive symptom a well a of husband traumatic experience on wife ptsd and depressive symptom the finding argue for the interdependence of trauma related symptom within dyad in a dual trauma context suggesting the presence of intracouple transmission of trauma related symptom

objective our aim wa to establish whether exposure a specialized tailored treatment for chronic low back pain ha any advantage over cognitive behavioral therapy cbt among individual with high fear avoidance level second we planned to compare short and long version of exposure third we aimed to investigate whether exposure can be delivered in an outpatient psychological setting method a total of 88 caucasian participant 55 woman were randomized to three different psychological treatment condition exposure long exposure short and cbt all participant were suffering from chronic pain and elevated level of pain related anxiety and disability the primary outcome were disability assessed using two different questionnaire qbpds and pdi and average pain intensity secondary outcome included pain related anxiety psychological flexibility coping strategy and depression assessment took place at pretreatment midtreatment posttreatment and 6 month follow up result exposure wa more effective than cbt at reducing movement related disability assessed with the qbpds exposure and cbt did not differ in reduction of pain intensity or disability assessed using the pdi exposure short outperformed exposure long after 10 session meaning that individual improved faster when they were offered fewer session exposure could be safely delivered in the psychological setting concerning secondary outcome exposure led to greater improvement in psychological flexibility relative to cbt cbt wa more effective than exposure at enhancing coping strategy in exposure significantly more participant dropped out conclusion although being more challenging to patient exposure is an effective treatment which can be delivered in a psychological treatment setting and should be offered a a short term treatment psycinfo database record

rumination ha been shown to be positively associated with suicide ideation yet only few study have attempted to explain potential mediator of this association perception of entrapment are a core component of recent psychological model of suicidality and might mediate the relationship between rumination and suicide ideation possible mediator effect were investigated in an online sample n 142 and a clinical sample n 226 of adult receiving outpatient psychotherapy result demonstrated that perception of entrapment fully mediated the association between ruminative thinking and suicide ideation however the reverse relationship where the association between entrapment and suicide ideation is mediated by ruminative thinking wa not supported these finding suggest that the relationship between rumination and suicide ideation is explained by perception of entrapment theoretical and clinical implication are discussed copyright c 2015 john wiley son ltd key practitioner message ruminative thinking and perception of entrapment are associated with suicidal ideation and suicidal behavior perception of entrapment fully mediate the association between ruminative thinking and suicide ideation clinically it could be useful to incorporate perception of entrapment into the psychosocial risk assessment of person contemplating suicide

virtual reality exposure therapy vret ha been shown to be effective in treatment of anxiety disorder yet there is lack of research on the extent to which interaction between the individual and virtual human can be successfully implanted to increase level of anxiety for therapeutic purpose this proof of concept pilot study aimed at examining level of the sense of presence and anxiety during exposure to virtual environment involving social interaction with virtual human and using different virtual reality display a non clinical sample of 38 participant wa randomly assigned to either a head mounted display hmd with motion tracker and sterescopic view condition or a one screen projection based virtual reality display condition participant in both condition engaged in free speech dialogue with virtual human controlled by research assistant it wa hypothesized that exposure to virtual social interaction will elicit moderate level of sense of presence and anxiety in both group further it wa expected that participant in the hmd condition will report higher score of sense of presence and anxiety than participant in the one screen projection based display condition result revealed that in both condition virtual social interaction were associated with moderate level of sense of presence and anxiety additionally participant in the hmd condition reported significantly higher level of presence than those in the one screen projection based display condition p 001 however contrary to the expectation neither the average level of anxiety nor the highest level of anxiety during exposure to social virtual environment differed between the group p 97 and p 75 respectively the finding suggest that virtual social interaction can be successfully applied in vret to enhance sense of presence and anxiety furthermore our result indicate that one screen projection based display can successfully activate level of anxiety in social virtual environment the outcome can prove helpful in using low cost projection based virtual reality environment for treating individual with social phobia

impulsivity is a core characteristic of pathological gambling pg even though the underlying structure and disorder specificity is unclear this study aimed to explore different dimension of impulsivity in a clinical sample including pg furthermore we aimed to test which alteration of the impulsivity related dimension are disorder specific for pg participant were individual diagnosed with pg n 51 and two group also characterized by various impulsive behavior an alcohol dependence ad n 45 and a gilles de la tourette syndrome gts n 49 group a healthy control hc n 53 group wa recruited a comparison group a comprehensive assessment wa used including impulsivity related and antipodal parameter of the stop signal task stroop task tower of london task card playing task iowa gambling task and the barratt impulsiveness scale 11 principal axis factor analysis revealed four impulsivity related dimension that were labeled self reported impulsivity prepotent response impulsivity choice impulsivity and motor impulsivity the pg group scored significantly higher on all four dimension compared to the hc group in contrast the pg group did not differ on any of the dimension from the ad or the gts group except for choice impulsivity where the pg group exhibited higher factor score compared to the gts group altogether pg is associated with generally heightened impulsivity profile compared to a hc group which may be further used for intervention strategy however heightened score in the impulsivity dimension are not disorder specific for pg further research on shared or different underlying mechanism of these overlapping impulsivity impairment is necessary

group intervention can have negative effect for patient with anxiety disorder stimulus which provoke side effect may be the group setting the content or the interaction between the participant in the group this study is the first to report negative effect from a cognitive behavioral group intervention in comparison with an unspecific recreational group for anxiety patient 107 patient with work related anxiety disorder were randomized to either a cognitive behavioral group therapy work coping group wg or an unspecific group encounter aimed at increasing recreational activity recreational group rg patient completed the unwanted event in group therapy scale ue g scale in the work coping group 41 9 of the patient reported at least one relevant side effect a compared to 28 9 in the recreational group these included an increase in the perception of anxiety and work problem feeling of exposure to criticism and the development of negative view on group therapy a such this is the first randomized controlled therapy study in anxiety patient to systematically investigate side effect work coping group intervention have despite their useful main effect specific negative effect when compared with group encounter group psychotherapist or group moderator should be aware of the potential side effect in anxiety patient

in the face of the worldwide coviv 19 pandemic refugee represent a particularly vulnerable group with respect to access to health care and information regarding preventive behavior in an online survey the perceived vulnerability to disease scale self reported change in preventive and risk behavior knowledge about covid 19 and psychopathological symptom phq 4 were assessed the convenience sample consisted of n 76 refugee n 45 arabic speaking n 31 farsi speaking refugee and n 76 german control matched with respect to age and sex refugee reported a significantly larger fear of infection significantly le knowledge about covid 19 and a higher frequency of maladaptive behavior a compared to the control group this study show that refugee are more vulnerable to fear of infection and maladaptive behavior than control culturally adapted easily accessible education about covid 19 may be beneficial in improving knowledge and preventive behavior related to covid 19

there is growing evidence that even milder form of maternal stress or anxiety during pregnancy affect the fetus causing possible long term consequence for infant and child development the mechanism through which prenatal maternal stress may affect the unborn are not yet entirely clarified due to limited self regulatory skill after birth infant depend on sensitive behavior of their parent to regulate affective state and physiological arousal dyadic affect regulation ha been linked to various developmental pattern up to adolescence and thereby represents a key element of early social relationship aim of the study wa to evaluate possible long term consequence of emotional stress during pregnancy and postpartum anxiety disorder a well a infant postpartum cortisol reactivity on mother child interaction at pre school age the sample comprised of n 63 mother infant dyad at study entry n 28 diagnosed with postpartum anxiety disorder according to the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder iv dsm iv n 35 were healthy control mother were interviewed with the structured clinical interview for dsm iv disorder at an average infant age of m 4 1 month and filled out a questionnaire regarding emotional stress during pregnancy further they were videotaped during the face to face still face paradigm ffsf a widely used mild socio emotional stressor for infant to determine infant stress reactivity infant salivary cortisol wa collected before immediately after and 20 min after the ffsf missing value were estimated by multiple imputation at the age of m 5 3 year mother child interaction wa re assessed in a follow up sample of n 30 dyad via a free play situation moreover dimensional measure for anxiety were assessed mother in the clinical group reported significantly higher stress score than the control group infant stress reactivity in the early postpartum period and maternal anxiety symptom at the 5 year follow up assessment were significantly associated with dyadic interaction quality at pre school age even though maternal stress during pregnancy did not directly predict mother child interaction quality at pre school age it wa significantly correlated with infant cortisol reactivity during postpartum period nevertheless caution should be taken when interpreting the result considering the small sample size

objective attunement is a novel measure of nonverbal synchrony reflecting the duration of the present moment shared by two interaction partner this study examined it association with early change in outpatient psychotherapy method automated video analysis based on motion energy analysis mea and cross correlation of the movement time series of patient and therapist wa conducted to calculate movement synchrony for n 161 outpatient movement based attunement wa defined a the range of connected time lag with significant synchrony latent change class in the hscl 11 were identified with growth mixture modeling gmm and predicted by pre treatment covariates and attunement using multilevel multinomial regression result gmm identified four latent class high impairment no change class 1 high impairment early response class 2 moderate impairment class 3 and low impairment class 4 class 2 showed the strongest attunement the largest early response and the best outcome stronger attunement wa associated with a higher likelihood of membership in class 2 b 0 313 p 007 class 3 b 0 251 p 033 and class 4 b 0 275 p 043 compared to class 1 for highly impaired patient the probability of no early change class 1 decreased and the probability of early response class 2 increased a a function of attunement conclusion among patient with high impairment stronger patient therapist attunement wa associated with early response which predicted a better treatment outcome video based assessment of attunement might provide new information for therapist not available from self report questionnaire and support therapist in their clinical decision making

this study present finding regarding violence among emerging street youth violent group in musoma tanzania using a total sample of 94 m 20 02 year sd 4 05 respondent purposefully selected from four violent group specific objective included examining the variation in violence involvement among the violent group establishing the level of relationship between individual parent s and the level of violent behaviour among the member of the violent group and examining to determine if individual parent s is a significant predictor of the development of violence among member of the violent group finding revealed higher level of involvement in violent behaviour among group m 70 85 sd 11 14 the anova result indicated a statistical significant difference f 3 90 6 035 p 0 001 in the mean score of the level of involvement in violent behaviour among the violent group comprised of member drawn from different socio economic status the contribution of parent socio economic status s on individual s violent behaviour measured by multiple regression analysis wa weak r² 112 p 161 thus parent s is a weak and non statistical significant predictor for individual s involvement in violence and violent act thus immediate intervention programme such a establishment of rehabilitation centre and counselling service is recommended

it is unclear whether post traumatic stress disorder symptom and report of traumatic childhood experience decline during substance withdrawal a convenience sample of 34 inpatient of the psychiatric university clinic in basel wa recruited and general psychopathological and trauma related symptom were assessed with the brief symptom checklist post traumatic stress diagnostic scale and childhood trauma questionnaire in the 1st and 3rd week of substance use treatment the average age of the sample wa 41 9 sd 9 1 year and 26 5 were female hyperarousal mt1 4 51 versus mt2 3 61 z 2 38 p 017 and avoidance symptom mt1 6 24 versus mt2 4 27 z 2 59 p 010 declined significantly but re experiencing symptom mt1 4 00 versus mt2 3 45 z 50 p 617 did not post traumatic stress disorder assessment according to the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder 4th edition criterion remained constant for 28 of 34 patient likewise self reported childhood trauma experience decreased yet the number of elevated subscale score remained stable post traumatic stress disorder symptom are not adequately treated by substance withdrawal alone trauma specific diagnostics can be initiated with sufficient quality a early a the first week of withdrawal treatment

background and objective attentional bias ab for trauma related stimulus have been examined in many study assessing different trauma sample in emotional stroop task est blocked and single trial format are used almost interchangeably in clinical research there is reason to believe that different design yield different result and ass different process which however ha been hardly examined in study furthermore there is a dearth of information about ab in older trauma survivor with posttraumatic stress symptom method older adult with n 20 and without ptsd symptom n 26 a well a non traumatized control n 21 completed an est in which word were presented both blocked and randomized result analysis revealed that individual with ptsd symptom showed ab for trauma and depression related word however mode of administration did not significantly influence reaction time limitation the emotional stroop task cannot disentangle the underlying cognitive mechanism i e facilitation interference avoidance conclusion ptsd symptom in older trauma survivor are associated with ab overall participant with ptsd symptom did not show greater impairment of cognitive control in comparison to both control group result also illustrate that methodological difference between task version need to be considered more thoroughly

the neuropeptide oxytocin ha recently been shown to enhance eye gaze and emotion recognition in healthy men here we report a randomized double blind placebo controlled trial that examined the neural and behavioral effect of a single dose of intranasal oxytocin on emotion recognition in individual with asperger syndrome a a clinical condition characterized by impaired eye gaze and facial emotion recognition using functional magnetic resonance imaging we examined whether oxytocin would enhance emotion recognition from facial section of the eye v the mouth region and modulate regional activity in brain area associated with face perception in both adult with a and a neurotypical control group intranasal administration of the neuropeptide oxytocin improved performance in a facial emotion recognition task in individual with a this wa linked to increased left amygdala reactivity in response to facial stimulus and increased activity in the neural network involved in social cognition our data suggest that the amygdala together with functionally associated cortical area mediate the positive effect of oxytocin on social cognitive functioning in a

individual with body dysmorphic disorder bdd often lack insight into the nature of their perceived appearance flaw that are slight if they exist at all despite the generally held assumption that insight fluctuates over time within individual with bdd it temporal instability and associated feature remain unstudied we examined insight a a multidimensional contextually embedded and dynamic factor using ecological momentary assessment ema further assessing affect and self esteem a potentially associated state thirty individual with bdd and 30 mentally healthy control hcs completed 6 day of ema m 8 54 assessment per day n 3075 assessment in total multilevel analysis revealed substantial intraindividual fluctuation of insight dimension across 30 min to hour that were more pronounced for individual with bdd than for hcs poorer insight correlated with higher negative affect lower positive affect and lower self esteem at concurrent time point in the bdd group considering all predictor at the same time point poorer insight wa characterized by lower self esteem and partly negative affect in the bdd group across time self esteem and insight influenced each other reciprocally with comparatively stronger effect for the prediction of poorer insight by previously lower self esteem these finding demonstrate that insight is a highly variable phenomenon in bdd further suggesting a clinically and etiologically relevant link between self esteem and insight in symptom maintenance psycinfo database record c 2021 apa all right reserved

objective the aim of this study wa to evaluate the efficacy of an internet based treatment for genito pelvic pain penetration disorder gpppd which adversely affect woman s sexuality and is associated with reduced well being and mental health comorbidities method two hundred woman with gpppd no penetrative intercourse 6 month were randomly allocated to the intervention group ig or a waitlist control group wcg the intervention included eight module and one booster session and wa delivered through an ehealth platform participant were supported by an ecoach regarding treatment adherence the primary outcome wa intercourse penetration behavior online assessment were scheduled at baseline t1 after session 8 12 week t2 and 6 month t3 after randomization intention to treat analysis were reported result significantly more participant 31 00 n 31 100 in the ig were able to have sexual intercourse at t2 compared to those in the wcg 13 00 n 13 100 chi 2 1 9 44 p 01 at t3 still more participant in the ig had sexual intercourse 29 compared to those in the wcg 20 but the group no longer differed significantly chi 2 1 2 19 p 19 genital pain painful and noncoital penetration behavior and negative penetration related cognition significantly improved with medium to large effect at t2 d 0 66 1 25 and small to large effect at t3 d 0 23 1 32 whereas fear of sexuality overall sexual functioning trait anxiety and well being improved with small to medium effect t2 d 0 20 0 49 t3 d 0 23 0 46 in the ig compared to the wcg on average participant completed 79 of the intervention conclusion internet based treatment ha been shown to be effective for gpppd symptom and could therefore be a promising treatment modality psycinfo database record c 2021 apa all right reserved

objective the aim of the study were to 1 validate the difficulty in emotion regulation scale ders in a sample of spanish adult with and without eating disorder and 2 explore the role of emotion regulation difficulty in eating disorder ed including it mediating role in the relation between key personality trait and ed severity method one hundred and thirty four patient 121 female mean age 29 year with anorexia nervosa n 30 bulimia nervosa n 54 binge eating n 20 or other specified feeding or eating disorder n 30 and 74 healthy control participant 51 female mean age 21 year reported on general psychopathology ed severity personality trait and difficulty in emotion regulation exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis were conducted to examine the psychometrics of the ders in this spanish sample aim 1 additionally to examine the role of emotion regulation difficulty in ed aim 2 difference in emotion regulation difficulty across eating disorder subgroup were examined and structural equation modeling wa used to explore the interrelation among emotion regulation personality trait and eating disorder severity result result support the validity and reliability of the ders within this spanish adult sample and suggest that this measure ha a similar factor structure in this sample a in the original sample moreover emotion regulation difficulty were found to differ a a function of eating disorder subtype and to mediate the relation between two specific personality trait i e high harm avoidance and low self directedness and ed severity conclusion personality trait of high harm avoidance and low self directedness may increase vulnerability to ed pathology indirectly through emotion regulation difficulty

aberrant salience may explain hasty decision making and psychotic symptom in schizophrenia in healthy individual final decision in probabilistic reasoning task are related to nucleus accumbens nacc activation however research investigating the nacc in social decision making is missing our study aimed at investigating the role of the nacc for social decision making and it link to aberrant salience attribution 47 healthy individual completed a novel social jumping to conclusion jtc fmri paradigm showing morphed face simultaneously expressing fear and happiness participant decided on the current emotion after each picture and on the general emotion of series of face nacc activation wa stronger during final decision than in previous trial without a decision particularly in fear rather than happiness series a jtc bias wa associated with higher nacc activation for last fearful but not last happy face apparently mechanism underlying probabilistic reasoning are also relevant for social decision making the pattern of nacc activation suggests salience not reward drive the final decision based on these finding we hypothesize that aberrant salience might also explain social cognitive deficit in schizophrenia

abstract objective loving kindness meditation lkm ha been shown to improve wellbeing and positive emotion in clinical and non clinical population the main goal of the present study wa to examine whether lkm might be an effective intervention to promote positive mental health using the positive mental health scale pmh and to decrease depression anxiety and stress in university student method the sample n 110 consisted of university student in germany one half of them n 55 underwent lkm intervention they were compared with a matched control group n 55 which did not receive treatment all participant completed positive and negative mental health measure at baseline and 1 year follow up assessment lkm participant additionally completed the same measure before and after treatment multiple analysis of variance were conducted to test for short and long term effect of lkm on positive and negative mental health measure result a significant short term effect of lkm on anxiety and pmh wa found long term analysis revealed a significant decrease of depression anxiety and stress for lkm completers and a significant increase of depression anxiety and stress for the control group conclusion the result suggest that lkm enhances mental health in university student

model of social anxiety disorder sad describe shortfall in child social performance whereas empirically child often show a deficit only in subjective and not objective performance we examined social performance in relation to possible change before and after cognitive behavior therapy cbt including social skill training and to an objective parameter vocal arousal child with sad were expected to subjectively judge their behavior a le competent than healthy control hc child despite a lack of objective difference child receiving cbt were expected to show a change in subjective and objective social performance in comparison to child waiting for treatment exploratory correlation analysis were used to disentangle the relation between social performance and vocal arousal one hundred and nineteen child 64 with and 55 without sad aged 9 13 year completed a trier social stress test tsst child with sad participated in a second tsst after cbt or waiting performance wa assessed by self report and by blinded observer vocal arousal wa analyzed by audio recording child with sad were objectively assessed a more socially competent than hc child subjectively child with sad showed lower social performance cbt showed no effect on subjective or objective performance rating vocal arousal did not correlate with social performance result need to be considered carefully a psychometric problem appeared that had not been considered in previous study the surprising lack of cbt effect suggests a need to focus on cognition surrounding social performance further social skill training should not be a standard sad treatment component but used only if necessary

objective the personalized advantage index pai is a method to guide treatment selection by investigating which of two or more treatment is optimal for a given individual recently it wa shown that on average twice weekly session of psychotherapy for depression lead to better outcome compared to once weekly session the present study applied the pai method to ass if subgroup of patient may have a differential response to psychotherapy frequency method data came from a clinical trial n 200 randomizing depressed patient into different session frequency weekly session versus twice weekly session machine learning technique were used to select pretreatment variable and develop a multivariable prediction model that calculated each patient s pai difference in observed depression post treatment score beck depression inventory ii bdi ii were tested between patient that received their pai indicated versus non indicated session frequency between group effect size cohen s d were reported result we identified prognostic indicator generally associated with lower post treatment bdi ii regardless of treatment assignment in addition we identified specific demographic and psychometric feature associated with differential response to weekly versus twice weekly therapy session observed post treatment bdi ii score were significantly different between individual receiving the pai indicated versus non indicated session frequency d 37 conclusion although a higher session frequency is more effective on average different session frequency seem beneficial for different patient future study should externally validate these finding before they can be generalized to other setting psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

abstract physical activity ha regularly been demonstrated to be a protective factor against stressful experience the present study investigated whether physical activity buffer the association between daily stress and facebook addiction disorder fad over a period of one year first measurement time point t1 october 2016 second measurement time point t2 october 2017 in a sample of 122 german facebook user 82 8 woman age at t1 m 21 70 sd 3 67 range 17 38 physical activity at t1 mediated the significant positive relationship between chronic daily stress at t1 and fad at t2 total effect p 036 direct effect p 164 furthermore at t2 fad wa significantly negatively associated with positive mental health i e high level of emotional social and psychological well being the current study provides first longitudinal result of possible risk associated with and potential protective factor of fad these result demonstrated that this addictive behavior is positively related to chronic daily stress and negatively related to physical activity practical application for future study and limitation of the present result are discussed

purpose to analyze body dissatisfaction in relation to orthorexic eating behavior in a sample of young female to further investigate characteristic feature of orthorexic eating behavior and it association with other eating disorder method n 197 young female age m 29 59 sd 10 85 year completed an online survey with the following questionnaire the dusseldorf orthorexia scale to measure orthorexic eating behavior the eating disorder inventory 2 edi 2 measuring psychopathological aspect of disordered eating behavior the dresden body image questionnaire dkb 35 to measure five component of body image and the body shape questionnaire bsq measuring body dissatisfaction result in the total sample pearson correlation revealed that orthorexic eating behavior wa positively associated with drive for thinness and body dissatisfaction an independent sample t test revealed that female with elevated level of orthorexic eating behavior n 35 displayed higher level of drive for thinness and body dissatisfaction and lower level of self acceptance in comparison to a randomized sample from the remaining female with low level of orthorexic eating behavior n 35 according to a multiple regression analysis drive for thinness and body dissatisfaction measured by the bsq served a positive predictor for orthorexic eating behavior whereas bulimia and body dissatisfaction measured by the edi 2 served a negative predictor conclusion result reveal that orthorexic eating behavior is more closely related to psychopathological aspect of other eating disorder than previously assumed body dissatisfaction a another major feature of orthorexia nervosa should be taken into account in future study level of evidence iii case control analytic study

objective the objective wa to investigate the pragmatic effectiveness of face to face cognitive behavioral therapy f2f cbt for family caregiver of people with dementia pwd implemented in a routine care setting relative to usual care in a quasi experimental study method participant indicating that attendance of f2f cbt wa possible were assigned to f2f cbt n 49 f2f cbt consisted of 12 session over 6 month effect were evaluated at posttest and 6 month follow up on a variety of outcome relative to usual care cg n 134 result at posttest f2f cbt yielded significantly fewer symptom of depression d 0 37 better emotional well being d 0 64 and better coping with the care situation d 0 52 than cg at 6 month follow up the effect on emotional well being wa retained d 0 44 and social relationship were rated significantly better in f2f cbt than cg d 0 34 conclusion f2f cbt proved to be effective in supporting family caregiver of pwd however only relatively few caregiver were able to regularly attend face to face session clinical implication cbt seems particularly suitable for supporting family caregiver of pwd in coping with the complex psychological burden delivery via telephone or internet could be a necessary alternative to f2f cbt for reducing barrier to participation
