background in two experimental study we tested the hypothesis that negative mood would hinder the revision of negative belief in response to unexpectedly positive information in depression whereas positive mood wa expected to enhance belief updating method in study 1 n 101 we used a subclinical sample to compare the film based induction of sad v happy mood with a distraction control group subsequently participant underwent a well established paradigm to examine intra individual change in performance related expectation after unexpectedly positive performance feedback in study 2 we applied the belief updating task from study 1 to an inpatient sample n 81 and induced sad v happy mood via film clip v recall of autobiographic event result the result of study 1 showed no significant group difference in belief updating the severity of depressive symptom wa a negative predictor of belief revision though and there wa a non significant trend suggesting that the presence of sad mood hindered belief updating in the subgroup of participant with a diagnosed depressive episode study 2 revealed that participant updated their expectation significantly le in line with positive feedback when they underwent the induction of negative mood prior to feedback relative to positive mood conclusion by indicating that the presence of negative mood can hinder the revision of negative belief in clinically depressed people our finding suggest that learning from new experience can be hampered if state negative mood is activated thus intervention relying on learning from novel positive experience should aim at reducing state negative mood in depression

objective machine learning model predicting treatment outcome for individual patient may yield high clinical utility however few study tested the utility of easy to acquire and low cost sociodemographic and clinical data in previous work we reported significant prediction still insufficient for immediate clinical use in a sample with broad diagnostic spectrum we here examined whether prediction will improve in a diagnostically more homogeneous yet large and naturalistic obsessive compulsive disorder ocd sample method we used sociodemographic and clinical data routinely acquired during cbt treatment of n 533 ocd subject in a specialized outpatient clinic result remission wa predicted with 65 p 0 001 balanced accuracy on unseen data for the best model higher ocd symptom severity predicted non remission while higher age of onset of first ocd symptom and higher socioeconomic status predicted remission for dimensional change prediction achieved r 0 31 p 0 001 between predicted and actual value conclusion the comparison with our previous work suggests that prediction within a diagnostically homogeneous sample here ocd are not per se superior to a more diverse sample including several diagnostic group using refined psychological predictor associated with disorder etiology and maintenance or adding further data modality a neuroimaging or ecological momentary assessment are promising in order to further increase prediction accuracy

aim nocturnal enuresis ne and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd are common in childhood we analysed the central processing of emotion in child with ne adhd ne adhd and control method we examined 13 child with ne 13 with adhd 14 with ne adhd and 14 control acoustic evoked potential were recorded using standardised methodology for the event related potential positive negative and neutral picture were presented and time interval of 250 450 450 650 and 650 850 msec evaluated hypothesis were tested with repeated measure analysis of variance result in the frontal region child with ne showed more intense response to positive and negative picture than control measured with event related potential viewing positive picture child with ne adhd differed from child with adhd in the central and parietal and for all type of stimulus in the parietal region child with ne adhd elicited the strongest response child with adhd did not differ from control there wa an unspecific interaction effect of the acoustic evoked potential in child with ne compared to the control conclusion child with ne processed emotion differently from child with adhd and control child with ne adhd processed emotion the most intense displaying interaction effect of the central nervous system that cannot be explained by each disorder alone

automatic facial coding afc is a novel research tool to automatically analyze emotional facial expression afc can classify emotional expression with high accuracy in standardized picture inventory of intensively posed and prototypical expression however classification of facial expression of untrained study participant is more error prone this discrepancy requires a direct comparison between these two source of facial expression to this end 70 untrained participant were asked to express joy anger surprise sadness disgust and fear in a typical laboratory setting recorded video were scored with a well established afc software facereader noldus information technology these were compared with afc measure of standardized picture from 70 trained actor i e standardized inventory we report the probability estimate of specific emotion category and in addition action unit au profile for each emotion based on this we used a novel machine learning approach to determine the relevant au for each emotion separately for both datasets first misclassification wa more frequent for some emotion of untrained participant second au intensity were generally lower in picture of untrained participant compared to standardized picture for all emotion third although profile of relevant au overlapped substantially across the two data set there were also substantial difference in their au profile this research provides evidence that the application of afc is not limited to standardized facial expression inventory but can also be used to code facial expression of untrained participant in a typical laboratory setting

introduction emotion regulation play an important role in the development and treatment of depression the present study investigated whether the emotion regulation strategy expressive suppression e and cognitive reappraisal cr change in the course of cognitive behavior therapy cbt of depressive inpatient furthermore it also examined whether change in cr and e correlated with positive treatment outcome method forty four inpatient from a psychotherapeutic hospital who suffered from a depressive disorder mean age 36 4 year standard deviation 13 4 year 63 6 female filled in the emotion regulation questionnaire and the beck depression inventory at admission and discharge to detect change in emotion regulation and depression across treatment data were analyzed using multivariate analysis of variance manova for repeated measure effect size and spearman correlation a p value of 0 05 wa considered statistically significant result depression severity f 1 10 42 p 0 003 eta 2 0 22 and cr f 1 4 71 p 0 04 eta 2 0 11 changed significantly across cbt treatment e remained virtually stable post treatment score of cr were also positively correlated with reduction in depressive symptom across treatment rho 0 30 p 0 05 conclusion the result suggest that cbt affect emotion regulation in depressive inpatient only for cr and that higher post treatment score in cr were related to greater reduction in depressive symptom across treatment

according to the transdiagnostic perspective psychological disorder share common cognitive process involved in their pathogenesis one dysfunctional belief that ha been found to be associated with several psychological disorder including major depressive disorder mdd and obsessive compulsive disorder ocd is perfectionism perfectionism comprises two factor namely perfectionistic striving and perfectionistic concern this study aim to replicate and extend previous research in several way we aimed to ass similarity between the two disorder using bayesian statistic furthermore a dysfunctional belief are assumed to not be fully accessible by introspection we included an indirect measure perfectionism single category implicit association task sc iat the sc iat and a self report measure of perfectionism fmps wa used in patient with mdd n 55 ocd n 55 and in healthy control n 64 in replication of previous finding patient with mdd and ocd differed from healthy control regarding self reported perfectionism score furthermore bayesian statistic showed that the two patient group did not differ regarding perfectionistic striving and only showed difference on perfectionistic concern when the doubt about action subscale which is also closely related to symptom of ocd wa included contrary to our expectation the sc iat did not discriminate group in conclusion these result give further evidence that self reported perfectionism may serve a a relevant transdiagnostic process more study are needed to ass implicit facet of perfectionism

interoception refers to the detection and perception of signal from the inner body deficit in this domain have been linked to psychopathology prompting the search for strategy to improve this ability preliminary study have shown that interoception could be enhanced through the manipulation of subjective feeling of power we tested the effect of adopting powerful posture on different facet of interoception firstly we measured the impact of a single power posing session on interoceptive ability in 41 healthy female then the same participant were randomly assigned to two condition daily power posing practice v no practice after one week the condition alternated interoceptive accuracy measured by the heartbeat tracking task interoceptive sensibility measured by the body perception questionnaire bpq and confidence rating a well a subjective feeling of power were assessed at baseline after a single power posing session and after one week of training a single power posing session significantly increased individual interoceptive accuracy also power posing reduced individual score on the bpq after one week of daily practice and increased subjective feeling of power after one session and one week of daily practice these finding suggest that adopting powerful posture ha the potential to increase interoceptive accuracy a well a subjective feeling of power and to reduce interoceptive sensibility measured by questionnaire

although the generalization of fear to stimulus resembling a threatening stimulus is an adaptive mechanism fear overgeneralization is maladaptive and thought to play a key role in anxiety related disorder since there is typically a delay between an initial fear experience and a situation in which fear over generalization may occur we assessed delayed fear generalization and it neural signature moreover a stress is known to affect fear learning we further tested whether acute stress modulates fear generalization therefore we conducted a two day fear generalization study with initial fear acquisition on day 1 and a fear generalization test after a 24 hr delay in the mri scanner prior to fear generalization testing participant were exposed to a stressor or a control manipulation our behavioral data showed the expected generalization of fear at a neural level fear generalization wa accompanied by increased fear signaling for stimulus that resembled the conditioned stimulus in the bilateral insula and frontal operculum whereas activity declined in frontal hippocampal and temporal region including the ventromedial prefrontal cortex a stimulus became more similar to the conditioned stimulus importantly stress did not modulate fear generalization neither on a behavioral nor on a neural level interestingly in an explorative comparison to two other study that used the same paradigm but tested generalization immediately after acquisition we observed increased fear generalization in the delayed relative to the immediate generalization test in sum our result suggest that stress leaf fear generalization and it neural signature unaffected but that a temporal delay might increase the extent to which fear response are generalized to stimulus resembling the threatening stimulus

abstract the present study investigated problematic social medium use smu in lithuania and in germany in two student sample lithuania n 1640 germany n 727 problematic smu flow experienced during smu life satisfaction depression anxiety and stress symptom were assessed by online survey latent class analysis resulted in a four group classification of participant due to their level of problematic smu characteristic low symptom low withdrawal high withdrawal and high symptom the proportion of participant in the low symptom group wa significantly higher in germany than in lithuania in contrast significantly more lithuanian participant belonged to both withdrawal group no significant country difference were found for the composition of the high symptom group in both country a series of structural equation model showed that the level of flow depression anxiety and stress symptom wa the highest in the high symptom group and the lowest in the low symptom group life satisfaction revealed the reversed result pattern the current finding show that student from lithuania and germany can be grouped considering their problematic smu level individual in the four group differ due to their level of mental health especially member of the high symptom group might benefit from external controlling strategy of their time spent on sm while member of the withdrawal group are suggested to train their smu self control

background the detrimental impact of child maltreatment on child and adolescent academic achievement and later socioeconomic wellbeing is well known however it is still unclear 1 whether maltreatment is actually linked to youth s long and short term memory deficit and 2 whether potential impairment are due to maltreatment per se or related psychopathology objective based on the attentional control theory we investigated a mediational model in which maltreatment would be related to psychopathology internalizing symptom posttraumatic stress symptom posttraumatic cognition which would in turn be related to impaired memory functioning participant and setting we drew on a sample of 155 burundian refugee youth aged 11 to 15 currently living in refugee camp in tanzania and at high risk of experiencing ongoing maltreatment by parent method youth reported on their experience of maltreatment and psychopathology in structured clinical interview and completed visuospatial memory task involving a short term and a working memory component corsi block tapping test and delayed recall from long term memory rey osterrieth complex figure result structural equation modeling showed that psychopathology mediated the association between increased maltreatment and reduced working memory capacity beta 0 07 p 02 with a trend towards mediation for short term memory beta 0 05 p 06 higher level of maltreatment but not psychopathology were directly linked to long term memory deficit beta 0 20 p 02 conclusion preventive effort targeting maltreatment and intervention focusing on related psychopathology are needed to counter memory deficit and their potential negative implication for academic and socioeconomic outcome

purpose self rated health srh is a powerful predictor of health related outcome such a morbidity and mortality aim of the current study wa to examine the role of comorbidity well being functional health and physical limitation a possible predictor of srh in diabetes and chronic heart failure chf method three large sample with person suffering from diabetes n 974 chf n 955 or both disease combined n 934 were analyzed longitudinally over the course of 4 month to test the mediating effect of comorbidity well being functional health and physical limitation in association with former and future srh multiple mediator model were applied result across all group emotional well being wa a consistent and powerful determinant of srh the effect of functional health and physical limitation on srh were also significant but varied between diagnostic group the number of comorbid disease did not predict srh conclusion emotional well being and physical health appraisal were strong predictor of srh thus srh may be improved by influencing well being and physical health appraisal via targeted intervention

woman show a substantial variability in their genital and subjective response to sexual stimulus the level of agreement between these two aspect of response is termed sexual concordance and ha been increasingly investigated because of it implication for understanding model of sexual response and a a potential endpoint in clinical trial of treatment to improve woman s sexual dysfunction however interpreting change in sexual concordance may be problematic because to date it still is unclear how repeated testing itself influence sexual concordance in woman we are aware of only one study that evaluated temporal stability of concordance in woman and it found no evidence of stability however time stability would be necessary for arguing that concordance is a stable individual difference the main goal of this study wa to investigate the test retest reliability of sexual concordance in a sample of 30 woman with sexual difficulty using hierarchical linear modeling we found that sexual concordance wa not influenced by repeated testing 12 week later but showed test retest reliability suggesting temporal stability our finding support the hypothesis that sexual concordance is a relatively stable individual difference and that change in sexual concordance after treatment or experimental condition could therefore be attributed to effect of those condition

attention to sexual stimulus is a prerequisite to process such stimulus a sexually meaningful and is an important mean to facilitate sexual arousal attending to sexual cue is crucial for healthy sexual functioning study suggest that sexual dysfunction is associated with le attention towards sexual stimulus the goal of this study wa to use an eye tracking based free viewing paradigm to investigate whether woman with sexual dysfunction visually attend to the genital area in dynamic sexual stimulus i e erotic video differently than woman with subclinical sexual function or those with typical sexual functioning a total of 69 woman m age 27 77 sd 8 00 with clinical n 30 subclinical n 23 and typical n 16 level of sexual functioning watched four 1 min video clip depicting heterosexual couple engaging in vaginal intercourse or cunnilingus while the total fixation duration on the genital area a well a their subjective and genital sexual arousal were recorded a hypothesized the clinical group fixated on the genital area le than woman with typical sexual functioning a longer total fixation duration on the genital area wa followed by increase in subjective arousal and genital arousal the relationship between attention and arousal wa not moderated by sexual functioning group this study provides first evidence of the role of sustained visual attention for facilitating sexual arousal in woman with and without sexual dysfunction

despite it relevance for health and education the neurocognitive mechanism of real life self control is largely unknown while recent research revealed a prominent role of the ventromedial prefrontal cortex in the computation of an integrative value signal the contribution and relevance of other brain region for real life self control remains unclear to investigate neural correlate of decision in line with long term consequence and to ass the potential of brain decoding method for the individual prediction of real life self control we combined functional magnetic resonance imaging during preference decision making with ecological momentary assessment of daily self control in a large community sample n 266 decision in line with long term consequence were associated with increased activity in bilateral angular gyrus and precuneus region involved in different form of perspective taking such a imagining one s own future and the perspective of others applying multivariate pattern analysis to the same cluster revealed that individual pattern of activity predicted the probability of real life self control brain activation are discussed in relation to episodic future thinking and mentalizing a potential mechanism mediating real life self control

research increasingly ass momentary change in paranoia in order to elucidate causal mechanism observed or manipulated change in postulated causal factor should result in fluctuation in state paranoid ideation previous study often employed a state adapted paranoia checklist freeman et al 2005 to measure state paranoia this study examined whether the paranoia checklist or subset of it item are appropriate for this purpose thirteen study n 860 were subjected to meta analysis of each paranoia checklist item we selected item based on 1 whether they showed pre to post change in the expected direction and 2 whether this effect wa larger in experimental v control condition all resulting item selection were cross validated on a hold out sample n 1893 finally we explored how much variation in paranoia wa captured by the state adapted version in a brief ambulatory assessment study n 32 a thirteen item state paranoia checklist a well a a five item and a three item brief state paranoia checklist were extracted cross validation revealed better model fit and increased sensitivity to change multilevel analysis indicated 25 30 of the variance in the brief state paranoia checklist to be due to intra individual daily fluctuation in paranoia our analysis produced reliable and valid revised scale increase in change sensitivity indicate that future assessment of state paranoia in experimental and ambulatory assessment study can be optimized by using the revised scale

abstract given the large discrepancy between prevalence rate of mental disorder in adolescent and actual treatment rate there is a need to understand what prevents this age group from seeking psychotherapy we assessed the barrier to seeking psychotherapy in this age group including their attitude toward people with a mental disorder using a convergent parallel mixed method design participant were 288 adolescent aged 12 21 year m 16 8 year sd 2 3 37 identified a male 63 a female and 0 a nonbinary qualitative data were obtained with open ended question on barrier to initiating psychotherapy and attitude toward people with a mental disorder barrier to seeking psychotherapy and information about psychotherapy were assessed with a questionnaire using a quantitative design the qualitative assessment revealed a the main barrier fear of a negative interaction with a psychotherapist fear of being confronted with their own emotion self stigma and fear of public stigma further lack of accessibility lack of trust in the therapist a desire for social distance from and a negative attitude toward people with a mental disorder were associated with a decreased intention to initiate psychotherapy previous positive experience with a psychotherapist wa a facilitator of seeking psychotherapy we found gender difference with higher desire for social distance and higher optimism bias score a well a poorer mental health knowledge for participant identifying a male integrating result from both approach result in further information for the improvement of prevention program and intervention to lower barrier to seeking psychotherapy gender difference indicate a need for gender role specific intervention

stress is discussed a a risk factor in the manifestation and maintenance of functional somatic f symptom however there is a lack of evidence regarding the effect of cognitive behavioral stress management training cbsm on f symptom and the potentially mediating role of the neuroendocrine system this study aim to examine stress related psychological and neuroendocrine change after receiving a brief cbsm in individual with f symptom forty three participant of both sex who reported at least one current f symptom were analyzed treatment group tg n 21 waitlist control group wcg n 22 using mixed model number of symptom psychological stress and salivary cortisol level were assessed at pretreatment posttreatment and 6 month later mixed model analysis did not reveal significant difference between the tg and the wcg regarding number of f symptom p 0 05 psychological stress measure p 0 05 or the cortisol awakening response car p 0 05 the tg presented lower diurnal cortisol level at pretreatment posttreatment and 6 month later p 0 05 we did not find significant beneficial effect that were specific to cbsm further research should be undertaken to investigate the effect of cbsm on real life stress or laboratory stressor in subject with f symptom moreover learning cognitive restructuring and establishing new coping strategy into everyday life might require more time this study is a first step in filling the gap in understanding the influence of cbsm a a brief intervention on psychological and biological aspect of stress in participant with f symptom and will hopefully inform larger trial of cbsm for f symptom

parental mental disorder increase the risk for insecure attachment in child however the quality of caregiver infant interaction play a key role in the development of infant attachment dyadic interaction is frequently investigated via global scale which are too rough to uncover micro temporal mechanism prior research found that the latency to reparation of uncoordinated dyadic state is associated with infant behavioral and neuroendocrine regulation we investigated the hypothesis that this interactive mechanism is critical in predicting secure v insecure attachment quality in infancy we also assessed the predictive quality of infant attachment regarding neuroendocrine reactivity later in childhood a subsample of n 58 dyad n 22 mother with anxiety disorder n 36 control from a larger study were analyzed at 3 8 month postpartum maternal anxiety disorder were diagnosed via a structured clinical interview a well a dyadic interaction during the face to face still face ffsf wa observed and coded on a micro temporal scale infant attachment quality wa assessed with the strange situation paradigm at 12 24 month of age in an overlapping subsample of n 39 n 13 mother with anxiety disorder n 26 control we assessed child cortisol reactivity at 5 to 6 year of age generalized linear modeling revealed that longer latency to interactive reparation during the reunion episode of the ffsf a well a maternal diagnosis at 3 8 month of age predict insecure attachment in child aged 12 24 month cox regression demonstrated that dyad with infant who developed insecure attachment at 12 24 month of age were 48 le likely to achieve an interactive reparation at 3 8 month of age mixed model revealed that compared to securely attached child child who had developed an insecure attachment at 12 24 month of age had an increased cortisol reactivity at 5 to 6 year of age during free play the result confirm the hypothesis that the development of attachment is affected by experienced micro temporal interactive pattern besides diagnostic category they also showed that infant of mother with postpartum anxiety disorder have a more than fivefold increased risk of developing an insecure attachment than the infant of the control group moreover result imply that these pattern may influence neurohormonal regulation even in preschool aged child

the cognitive model of depression assumes that depressive symptom are influenced by dysfunctional cognition to further specify this model the present study aimed to examine the influence of different type of cognition on depressive symptom i e situational expectation and global cognition it wa hypothesized that situational expectation predict depressive symptom beyond global cognition the present study examined a clinical n 91 and a healthy sample n 80 using longitudinal data with a baseline assessment and a follow up five month later although the study wa not designed a an interventional trial participant from the clinical study received non manualized cognitive behavioral treatment after the baseline assessment we examined situational expectation intermediate belief dispositional optimism and generalized expectancy for negative mood regulation a predictor of depressive symptom hypothesis were tested using multiple hierarchical linear regression analysis result indicate that although there were significant correlation between the cognitive factor and depressive symptom in both sample neither global cognition nor situational expectation significantly predicted depressive symptom at the five month follow up the present study could contrary to the hypothesis not provide evidence for a significant impact of cognitive vulnerability on depressive symptom presumably due to high drop out rate at follow up limitation of the study and direction for future research are critically discussed situational and global cognition were examined a predictor of depressive symptom in a healthy and a clinical sample cognitive factor were correlated with depressive symptom however in both sample depressive symptom at follow up were not predicted by cognitive factor situational and global cognition were examined a predictor of depressive symptom in a healthy and a clinical sample cognitive factor were correlated with depressive symptom however in both sample depressive symptom at follow up were not predicted by cognitive factor

analysing the relationship between gender and memory and examining the effect of age on the overall memory related functioning are the ongoing goal of psychological research the present study examined gender and age group difference in episodic memory with respect to the type of task in addition these subgroup difference were also analysed in visual working memory a sample of 366 woman and 330 men aged between 16 and 69 year of age participated in the current study result indicate that woman outperformed men on auditory memory task whereas male adolescent and older male adult showed higher level performance on visual episodic and visual working memory measure however the size of gender linked effect varied somewhat across age group furthermore result partly support a declining performance on episodic memory and visual working memory measure with increasing age although age related loss in episodic memory could not be explained by a decreasing verbal and visuospatial ability with age woman s advantage in auditory episodic memory could be explained by their advantage in verbal ability men s higher level visual episodic memory performance wa found to result from their advantage in visuospatial ability finally possible methodological biological and cognitive explanation for the current finding are discussed

brain directed treatment technique such a neurofeedback have recently been proposed a adjunct in the treatment of eating disorder to improve therapeutic outcome in line with this recommendation a cue exposure eeg neurofeedback protocol wa developed the present study aimed at the evaluation of the specific efficacy of neurofeedback to reduce subjective binge eating in a female subthreshold sample a total of 75 subject were randomized to eeg neurofeedback mental imagery with a comparable treatment set up or a waitlist group at post treatment only eeg neurofeedback led to a reduced frequency of binge eating p 015 g 0 65 the effect remained stable to a 3 month follow up eeg neurofeedback further showed particular beneficial effect on perceived stress and dietary self efficacy difference in outcome did not arise from divergent treatment expectation because eeg neurofeedback showed a specific efficacy it may be a promising brain directed approach that should be tested a a treatment adjunct in clinical group with binge eating copyright c 2016 john wiley son ltd and eating disorder association

abstract social anxiety disorder sad and more generally social fear are common in young people although avoidance behavior are known to be an important maintaining factor of social anxiety little is known about the severity and occurrence of avoidance behavior in young people from the general population hampering approach for early identification and intervention symptom syndrome and diagnosis of dsm 5 mental disorder including sad were assessed in a random population based sample of 14 21 year old n 1 180 from dresden germany in 2015 2016 using a standardized diagnostic interview dia x 5 d cidi an adapted version of the liebowitz social anxiety scale wa used to ascertain the extent of social fear and avoidance diagnostic criterion for lifetime sad were met by n 82 participant resulting in a weighted lifetime prevalence of 6 6 social anxiety wa predominantly reported for test situation and when speaking or performing in front of others avoidance wa most prevalent in the latter situation on average anxiety and avoidance first occurred at age 11 and 12 respectively with avoidance occurring in most case either at about the same age a anxiety or slightly later in the total sample lifetime prevalence for most dsm 5 disorder increased with the severity of social anxiety and avoidance result underline the need for preventive or early intervention effort especially regarding test anxiety and fear and avoidance of speaking in front of others these situation are particularly relevant in youth avoidance behavior may also be discussed a diagnostic marker for early case identification

background childhood adversity especially emotional abuse emotional neglect and peer victimization are considered to be crucial risk factor for social anxiety disorder sad we investigated whether particular form of retrospectively recalled childhood adversity are specifically associated with sad in adulthood or whether we find similar link in other anxiety or depressive disorder method prevalence of adversity assessed with the childhood trauma questionnaire ctq and a questionnaire of stressful social experience fbs were determined in n 1091 outpatient adversity severity among patient with sad only n 25 specific phobia only n 18 and generalized anxiety disorder only n 19 were compared difference between patient with anxiety disorder only n 62 and depressive disorder only n 239 a well a between sad with comorbid depressive disorder n 143 and sad only were tested result none of the adversity type were found to be specifically associated with sad and severity did not differ among anxiety disorder but patient with depressive disorder reported more severe emotional abuse physical abuse and sexual abuse than patient with anxiety disorder sad patient with a comorbid depressive disorder also reported more severe adversity across all type compared to sad only conclusion finding indicate that particular form of recalled childhood adversity are not specifically associated with sad in adulthood previously established link with sad may be better explained by comorbid depressive symptom

the co occurrence of depression and envy is both plausible and empirically established however little is known about the mechanism underlying this correlation an account is proposed according to which low self esteem in depressed individual lead to upward social comparison and thus make envy more likely this effect should frequently occur in online social network like facebook because they allow for easy impression management and hence provide high comparison standard in a quasi experimental online study depressed and nondepressed participant indicated their self esteem and were then presented with specifically set up facebook profile that were either attractive or unattractive participant were asked to compare themselves to the profile owner and to report their resulting feeling of inferiority and envy depressed participant were more envious especially after seeing the attractive profile envy wa associated with higher self reported inferiority and also correlated negatively with self esteem the connection between depression and envy is demonstrated with an experimental elicitation of envy for the first time the result strongly suggest that low self esteem and consequent feeling of inferiority play a crucial role in depressed individual elevated level of envy practical implication and limitation are discussed

this study investigates enhanced visuomotor processing of phobic compared to fear relevant and neutral stimulus we used a response priming design to measure rapid automatic motor activation by natural image spider snake mushroom and flower in spider fearful snake fearful and control participant we found strong priming effect in all task and condition however result showed marked difference between group most importantly in the group of spider fearful individual spider picture had a strong and specific influence on even the fastest motor response phobic prime entailed the largest priming effect and phobic target accelerated response both effect indicating speeded response activation by phobic image in snake fearful participant this processing enhancement for phobic material wa le pronounced and extended to both snake and spider image we conclude that spider phobia lead to enhanced processing capacity for phobic image we argue that this is enabled by long term perceptual learning process

background exposure and response prevention is effective and recommended a the first choice for treating obsessive compulsive disorder ocd it mechanism of action are rarely studied but two major theory make distinct assumption while the emotional processing theory assumes that treatment effect are associated with habituation within and between exposure session the inhibitory learning approach highlight the acquisition of additional association implying alternative mechanism like expectancy violation the present study aimed to investigate whether process variable derived from both theory predict short term outcome method in a university outpatient unit 110 patient 63 female with ocd received manual based cognitive behavioral therapy with high standardization of the first two exposure session specifically therapist repeated the first exposure session identically and assessed subjective unit of distress a well a expectancy rating in the course of exposure session based on these data individual score for habituation and distress related expectancy violation were calculated and used for prediction of both percentage change on the yale brown obsessive compulsive scale y bocs and remission status after 20 therapy session result in a multiple regression model for percentage change within session habituation during the first exposure wa a significant predictor while in a logistic regression predicting remission status distress related expectancy violation during the first exposure revealed significance a path model further supported these finding conclusion the result represent first evidence for distress related expectancy violation and confirm preliminary finding for habituation suggesting that both process contribute to treatment benefit of exposure in ocd and both mechanism appear to be independent

overeating episode despite of intention to control weight are a common problem among woman recurring episode of overeating and dietary failure have been reported to result in higher body mass index and to induce severe distress even in non clinical group based on finding from physiological research on eating behavior and craving a well a previous biofeedback study we derived a cue exposure based eeg neurofeedback protocol to target overeating episode the treatment wa evaluated in a randomized controlled trial comparing a neurofeedback group nfg n 14 with a waiting list control group wlg n 13 in a sub clinical sample of female restrained eater at post treatment the number of weekly overeating episode and subsequent distress were significantly reduced in the nfg compared to the wlg p 01 r 50 in a 3 month follow up effect in the nfg remained stable a secondary outcome perceived dieting success wa enhanced after the treatment at follow up additional beneficial effect on trait food craving were observed altogether we found preliminary evidence for the cue exposure neurofeedback against overeating episode in female restrained eater although specific effect and underlying mechanism still have to be explored in future research

this study investigates the proposition that micro level experience in the realm of stress e g daily stress exposure are among the building block of maladjustment in particular depression data were collected with experience sampling method and in the lab a sample of 202 student who had just entered university participated in a three wave longitudinal study october 2012 october 2013 each wave consisted of the assessment of depressive symptom and the examination of stressful experience in daily life by mean of experience sampling 70 occasion per wave cross lagged panel model revealed that the perceived intensity of daily stressor stressed and depressed feeling in daily life a well a depressed reaction to daily stressor predict an increase in future depressive symptom in young female but not male other cross lagged effect particularly from depressive symptom to stressful experience in daily life were not significant finding are in line with the stress exposure model

background the perceived stress scale cohen j health soc behav 24 385 96 1983 is a widely and well established self report scale measuring perceived stress however the german version of the ps 10 ha not yet been validated thus the purpose of this representative study were to psychometrically evaluate the ps 10 and to provide norm value for the german population method the ps 10 and standardized scale of depression anxiety fatigue procrastination and life satisfaction were administered to a representative randomly selected german community sample consisting of 1315 female and 1148 male participant in the age range from 14 to 90 year result the result demonstrated a good internal consistency and construct validity perceived stress wa consistently associated with depression anxiety fatigue procrastination and reduced life satisfaction confirmatory factor analysis revealed a bi dimensional structure with two related latent factor regarding demographic variable woman reported a higher level of stress than men perceived stress decreased with higher education income and employment status older and married participant felt le stressed than younger and unmarried participant conclusion the ps 10 is a reliable valid and economic instrument for assessing perceived stress a psychological stress is associated with an increased risk of disease identifying subpopulation with higher level of stress is essential due to the dependency of the perceived stress level on demographic variable particularly age and sex differentiated norm value are needed which are provided in this paper

avoidance is a transdiagnostic symptom of clinical anxiety and it reduction a major focus of cognitive behavioral treatment this study examined the instrumental extinction of goal directed avoidance by mean of incentive verbal instruction and social observation and their influence on fear extinction participant acquired conditioned fear and instrumental avoidance response n 160 in four randomized group the reduction of avoidance by incentive for non avoidance instruction to refrain from avoidance and social observation of non avoidance wa compared to no intervention before removing the aversive outcome conditioned fear when avoidance became unavailable subsequently wa tested incentive instruction and observation all reduced avoidance better than no intervention however with different degree and influence on conditioned fear incentive and instruction strongly reduced avoidance despite high level of fear i e fear opposite action this initiated fear extinction thereby reducing conditioned fear when avoidance became unavailable social observation directly reduced conditioned fear presumably because it conveyed additional information about the absence of the aversive outcome however observation only moderately reduced avoidance and resulted in higher fear when avoidance became unavailable the effect of social observation may depend on the nuance of the demonstrator s behavior the clear effect of incentive and instruction provide support for clinical intervention to reduce avoidance during exposure therapy and can serve a experimental model for their controlled investigation

child maltreatment is known to engender negative emotional and behavioral consequence although neglect is the most frequent form of maltreatment it ha thus far only received little attention especially when looking at low resource country the current study investigated possible association between neglect and internalizing and externalizing problem a neglect and abuse often co occur the latter wa controlled for in total 409 tanzanian primary school student 52 boy m 10 5 year range 6 15 participated in the cross sectional study structured clinical interview were conducted assessing maltreatment internalizing problem and externalizing problem overall 31 n 128 of the child reported at least one type of physical neglect and 31 n 127 of emotional neglect using structural equation modeling we found a significant association between neglect and internalizing beta 0 59 p lt 01 and externalizing problem beta 0 35 p lt 05 however these association could only be detected in younger child age 6 9 whereas in older child age 10 15 mental health problem were significantly related to violence and abuse our finding suggest that the current age may influence the association between maltreatment type and the development of internalizing and or externalizing problem

aim patient reported outcome such a health related quality of life hrqol are main treatment goal for heart failure hf and therefore endpoint in multinational therapy trial however little is known about country specific difference in hrqol and in treatment associated hrqol improvement the present work sought to examine those question method and result we analysed data from the cardiac insufficiency bisoprolol study in elderly cibis eld trial in which patient from central and south eastern europe completed the hrqol questionnaire sf 36 at baseline and the end of a 12 week beta blocker up titration follow up 416 patient from serbia mean age 72 21 year 69 nyha class i ii 27 4 woman and 114 from germany mean age 73 64 year 78 9 nyha class i ii 47 4 woman were included controlling for clinical variable the change in mental hrqol from baseline to follow up wa modulated by country serbian patient m baseline 37 85 v m follow up 40 99 t 526 5 34 p 001 reported a stronger increase than german m baseline 37 66 v m follow up 38 23 t 526 0 68 n for physical hrqol we observed a main effect of country m serbia 39 28 v m germany 35 29 t 526 4 24 p 001 conclusion we observed significant difference in hf patient from germany and serbia and country specific difference between serbian and german patient in mean physical hrqol change in mental hrqol were modulated by country those result may reflect psychological sociocultural aetiological difference or regional difference in phenotype prevalence more importantly they suggest that future multinational trial should consider such aspect when designing a trial in order to avoid uncertainty aligned to data interpretation and to improve subsequent treatment optimisation

both cognitive stressor such a mental arithmetic task and physical stressor such a the cold pressor test cp are among the most widely employed tool in acute stress research and there is growing evidence for a high degree of stimulus response specificity rather than uniformity in the human stress response however little is known about potential synergistic or interfering effect during concurrent administration while cognitive task have been hypothesized to attenuate pain perception during cp they are also thought to enhance physiological reactivity conversely physical stress might interfere with effective stress induction by cognitive challenge to address these question 56 participant underwent either the cp 3 min ice water immersion of foot or a warm water control condition in half of the sample the paced auditory serial addition task pasat wa performed simultaneously fully crossed intervention salivary cortisol cardiovascular parameter and subjective rating a well a voice pitch f0 were assessed result show that cortisol response self reported pain and subjective arousal were mainly driven by cold exposure which also led to increased f0 the pasat incrementally enhanced cardiovascular reaction but did not affect pain rating nor cortisol response to the cp however intra individual concordance between elevated blood pressure and other reactivity measure wa enhanced by pasat administration during the cp importantly performance decrement in the mental arithmetic task were not associated with diminished stress response in conclusion our result speak against any strong interference when administering cognitive and painful physical stressor simultaneously pointing rather to specific additive effect particularly regarding cardiovascular reactivity

background functional gastrointestinal disorder fgid are defined by a combination of chronic or recurrent gastrointestinal symptom prevalence rate of fgid are high symptom are associated with distress and sufferer show high stress level however the current diagnostic criterion do not consider subjective distress elicited by the symptom thus potentially leading to overestimated prevalence rate the aim of this study wa to explore the reduction in prevalence rate when distress is considered in the diagnostic criterion method in this web based study fgid were diagnosed using the rome ii criterion prevalence rate with and without subjective distress elicited by the symptom were computed additionally stress level and stress reactivity were assessed result prevalence rate of fgid in our sample were similar to those in other study however when considering the distress criterion on average a decrease of 38 51 wa found in the prevalence rate of fgid sufferer who were subjectively distressed by their symptom reported significantly higher stress level than non distressed subject all p 0 001 conclusion the consideration of a criterion of subjective distress in the diagnosis of fgid ha consequence for actual prevalence rate of fgid distressed subject differ markedly from non distressed subject in term of their stress level the inclusion of a distress criterion in the ongoing development of diagnostic criterion for fgid is therefore warranted

objective although cognitive behavioral treatment approach for post traumatic stress disorder ptsd exist only a small proportion of older adult seek psychological treatment alternative treatment approach are thus needed to fill the gap between provision and use of psychological intervention this study aimed to investigate the efficacy and feasibility of an internet based therapist guided cognitive behavioral therapy internet based cbt for older individual with ptsd symptom method patient with clinically meaningful i e subsyndromal or greater ptsd symptom were randomly assigned to a 6 week treatment group of therapist guided internet based cbt n 47 treatment group or a wait list group n 47 wl the treatment group wa assessed pre and post treatment a well a at 3 6 and 12 month follow ups result linear mixed effect analysis showed a significant interaction between group treatment versus wl and time pre versus post for ptsd symptom with a moderate between group effect size in favor of the treatment group d 0 42 effect in the treatment group were maintained up to the 12 month follow up finding indicate a significant interaction group x time for quality of life d 0 39 and self efficacy d 0 38 with regard to the feasibility attrition rate wa very low in both group treatment group 12 8 wl 6 4 and working alliance wa very high conclusion result suggest that therapist guided internet based cbt is associated with a substantial reduction in ptsd symptom and increase in resource related variable in older adult with subsyndromal ptsd this internet based intervention may offer a promising option in a stepped care approach for older trauma affected person who may otherwise not pursue mental health treatment

background next to the dose dependent effect of trauma load female sex represents a well established risk factor for ptsd exposure to particularly toxic traumatic event type different coping style and biological risk factor are frequently listed a potential cause for the increased ptsd vulnerability in female nevertheless sex difference have not been consistently observed in all study population objective to investigate sex difference in ptsd risk in post conflict population from different country while considering trauma load method in civilian post conflict sample from northern uganda n 1665 rwanda n 433 syria n 974 and sri lanka n 165 we investigated sex difference in ptsd risk while taking trauma load into account ptsd and trauma load were assessed using standardized diagnostic interview potential sex difference in ptsd risk were analysed by logistic regression analysis considering trauma load result across all sample male reported more traumatic event than female both sex predominantly reported war related traumatic event without considering trauma load sex effect in ptsd risk were only detected in the syrian sample when taking trauma load into account evidence for an increased ptsd vulnerability in female wa found in the syrian sample and to a much lesser extent in the northern ugandan sample conclusion in contrast to the literature we did not find evidence for a general increased ptsd vulnerability in female the dose response effect of trauma load wa a much stronger predictor of ptsd risk than sex across all sample

suicide related outcome increased among young adult in the last decade excessive use of social medium wa hypothesized to contribute to this development this longitudinal study aimed to investigate whether facebook addiction disorder fad predicts suicide related outcome and whether positive mental health pmh buffer this effect data of 209 german facebook user m age sd age 23 01 4 45 were assessed at two measurement time point over a 1 year period first measurement t1 and second measurement t2 through online survey fad wa measured with the bergen facebook addiction scale pmh wa assessed with the pmh scale and suicide related outcome were measured with the suicidal behavior questionnaire revised the significant positive association between fad t1 and suicide related outcome t2 wa significantly negatively mediated by pmh t1 these result demonstrate that addictive facebook use may enhance the risk of suicide related outcome however pmh contributes to the reduction of this risk therefore addictive facebook use and pmh should be taken into account when assessing individual for suicide of risk

to prevent caregiver from the development of stress related health impairment effective intervention are still needed this presentation focused on the evaluation of a telephone intervention for family caregiver of people with dementia in germany the individual intervention 12 session in 6 month each 50 minute us cognitive behavioural therapy adapted to specific problem of the caregiver the intervention aim to improve well being quality of life and to reduce body complaint and depressive symptom a randomized controlled trial n 322 primary family caregiver wa conducted and the intervention wa implemented by cognitive behavioural therapist compared with caregiver in the control condition caregiver who received tele tandem demonstrated significantly greater improvement in well being depressive symptom ce d body complaint gbb 24 and quality of life who qol bref at post treatment measurement regarding the achievement of caregiver individual goal result showed that 77 achieved complete goal attainment finding support the acceptability and effectiveness of the tele tandem intervention

objective the hedonic value of odor is reflected in chemosensory evoked potential with more salient unpleasant odor being processed differently from pleasant odor however it is not known if this effect is stable over time it wa examined if chemosensory evoked potential towards pleasant and unpleasant odor change with repeated presentation method 42 participant received two pleasant peach and pea and one unpleasant h2s intensity matched odor in a block design intensity and pleasantness were rated after each presentation subjective rating a well a n1 and p2 of the first stimulus of each block were compared with the two following stimulus of each block result early and late component of the chemosensory evoked potential had shorter latency in response to the unpleasant h2s compared to pea and peach pleasantness rating for h2s increased with repeated presentation but were far below neutral even for the third stimulus in a row in line with this for h2s only the p2 amplitude diminished with repeated presentation conclusion we assume that unpleasant stimulus catch more attention first hand however repeated presentation lead to reduced emotional salience of unpleasant stimulus only which is mirrored in a decrease of neuronal activation

background altered ventral striatal vst activation to reward expectancy is a well established intermediate phenotype for psychiatric disorder specifically schizophrenia sz preclinical research suggests that striatal alteration are related to a reduced inhibition by the hippocampal formation but it role in human transdiagnostic reward network dysfunction is not well understood method we performed functional magnetic resonance imaging during reward processing in 728 individual including healthy control subject n 396 patient sz n 46 bipolar disorder n 45 major depressive disorder n 60 and unaffected first degree relative sz n 46 bipolar disorder n 50 major depressive disorder n 85 we assessed disorder specific difference in functional vst hippocampus coupling and transdiagnostic association with dimensional measure of positive negative and cognitive symptom we also probed the genetic underpinning using polygenic risk score for sz in a subset of healthy participant n 295 result functional vst hippocampus coupling wa 1 reduced in patient with sz and bipolar disorder p fwe 05 small volume corrected svc 2 associated transdiagnostically to dimensional measure of positive p fwe 01 svc and cognitive p fwe 02 svc but not negative p fwe 05 svc symptom and 3 reduced in first degree relative of patient with sz p fwe 017 svc and linked to the genetic risk for sz in healthy participant p 035 conclusion we provide evidence that reduced vst hippocampus coupling during reward processing is an endophenotype for sz linked to positive and cognitive symptom supporting current preclinical model of the emergence of psychosis moreover our data indicate that vst hippocampus coupling is familial and linked to polygenic score for sz supporting the use of this measure a an intermediate phenotype for psychotic disorder

nightmare are a well known phenomenon the content of aversive dream seems to be ubiquitous in dream nevertheless a dream containing aversive content doe not necessarily have to be a nightmare we hypothesize that nightmare are rather caused by a more negative appraisal of the content of aversive dream than by the dream content itself to investigate this question n 99 participant kept dream diary over 28 consecutive day an experimental group included person with frequent nightmare and a control group of person without nightmare violent dream content and emotion during the dream were analyzed by the dreamer themselves and a well a by four external raters regarding violent dream content in non nightmare dream report the external raters usually agreed with the dreamer rating however there wa significant disagreement regarding the nightmare report furthermore external raters significantly rated the dream a le positive than the dreamer did and external raters rated the nightmare report a more negative than the dreamer themselves did taken together the result support the hypothesis that the classification of a dream a a nightmare doe not only depend on it content but also on other factor this suggests that the dreamer rating of a dream a a nightmare are based on more factor than dream content gender difference in dream content have been studied quite extensively the present study focused on two dream characteristic the ratio of male and female dream character and the occurrence of weapon and clothes in dream a sample of 1612 diary dream reported by 425 participant wa analyzed using external rating by a blind judge whereas the gender difference regarding the ratio of male and female dream character wa not significant men reported more weapon dream but dream with reference to clothing le often which is in line with previous research the explorative analysis indicated that some of the big five personality dimension might be associated with these dream characteristic e g extraverted men s dream included more female character compared to the dream of introverted men research thus far and this study indicate that waking life preoccupation with clothes medium showing weapon waking life social contact etc strongly affect these dream characteristic but study explicitly measuring and correlating waking life experience and dream content are still missing according to the threat simulation theory tst dreaming ha developed and wa maintained during evolution because it function of rehearsing threat is essential for survival the present study analyzed 1612 diary dream reported by 425 participant mainly psychology student the study result indicate that threat play an important role in dream and thus support the idea that dreaming might have a function of rehearsing problematic or threatening situation comparing the present result to previous finding show a considerably large variability regarding the number of threat per dream the proportion of minor threat and the reality of threat a neuroticism and openness to experience were related to the number of threat per dream future research should investigate inter individual difference in waking life which might help explain the variability regarding the dream threat characteristic

several study have linked the covid 19 pandemic to unfavorable mental health outcome however we know little about long term change in mental health due to the pandemic so far here we used longitudinal data from a general population sample of 1388 adult from germany who were initially assessed between april and may 2020 i e at the beginning of the covid 19 pandemic in germany and prospectively followed up after 6 n 1082 and 12 month n 945 depressive and anxiety symptom a well a loneliness did not change from baseline to 6 month follow up while anxiety symptom did not change in the long run depressive symptom and loneliness increased and life satisfaction decreased from baseline to 12 month follow up moreover vulnerable group such a younger individual or those with a history of mental disorder exhibited an overall higher level of psychopathological symptom across all assessment wave our finding suggest a deterioration in mental health during the course of the covid 19 pandemic which emphasizes the importance to implement targeted health promotion to prevent a further symptom escalation especially in vulnerable group

introduction there is neither strong evidence on effective treatment for patient with chronic back pain cbp and depressive disorder nor sufficiently available mental health care offer objective the aim is to ass the effectiveness of internet and mobile based intervention imi a a scalable approach for treating depression in a routine care setting method this is an observer masked multicenter pragmatic randomized controlled trial with a randomization ratio of 1 1 patient with cbp and diagnosed depressive disorder mild to moderate severity were recruited from 82 orthopedic rehabilitation clinic across germany the intervention group ig received a guided depression imi tailored to cbp next to treatment a usual tau including medication while the control group cg received tau the primary outcome wa observer masked clinician rated hamilton depression severity 9 week follow up the secondary outcome were further depression outcome pain related outcome health related quality of life and work capacity biostatistician blinded analysis using regression model were conducted by intention to treat and per protocol analysis result between october 2015 and july 2017 we randomly assigned 210 participant ig n 105 cg n 105 mostly with only a mild pain intensity but substantial pain disability no statistically significant difference in depression severity between ig and cg wa observed at the 9 week follow up beta 0 19 95 ci 0 43 to 0 05 explorative secondary depression 4 9 and pain related 4 6 outcome were in part significant p 0 05 health related quality of life wa significantly higher in the ig no difference were found in work capacity conclusion the result indicate that an imi for patient with cbp and depression in a routine care setting ha limited impact on depression benefit in pain and health related outcome suggest that an imi might still be a useful measure to improve routine care

pain perception and the ability to modulate arising pain vary tremendously between individual it ha been shown that endurance athlete posse higher pain tolerance threshold and a greater effect of conditioned pain modulation than nonathletes both indicating a more efficient system of endogenous pain inhibition the aim of the present study wa to focus on the neural mechanism of pain processing in endurance athlete that have not been investigated yet therefore we analyzed the pain processing of 18 male athlete and 19 healthy male nonathletes using functional magnetic resonance imaging we found lower pain rating in endurance athlete compared to nonathletes to physically identical painful stimulation furthermore brain activation of athlete versus nonathletes during painful heat stimulation revealed reduced activation in several brain region that are typically activated by nociceptive stimulation this included the thalamus primary and secondary somatosensory cortex insula anterior cingulate cortex midcingulate cortex dorsolateral prefrontal cortex and brain stem b functional connectivity analysis revealed stronger network during painful heat stimulation in athlete between the analyzed brain region except for connection with the b that showed reduced functional connectivity in athlete post hoc correlation analysis revealed association of the subject s fitness level and the brain activation strength subject s fitness level and functional connectivity and brain activation strength and functional connectivity together our result demonstrate for the first time that endurance athlete do not only differ in behavioral variable compared to nonathletes but also in the neural processing of pain elicited by noxious heat

the approach withdrawal model of hemispheric activation suggests that left frontal cortical area mediate approach while right frontal cortical area mediate withdrawal motivation within this framework the present study investigates the association of frontal cortical asymmetry with attentional and emotional response toward approach and withdrawal related emotional stimulus resting frontal asymmetry wa measured from 43 student before they passively viewed negative neutral and positive emotional picture the startle reflex skin conductance response and subjective rating of valence and arousal were assessed to quantify emotional responding while attention wa assessed with erps we also assessed frontal asymmetry in response to the picture result indicated that relatively stronger right frontal cortical activation wa associated with increased n1 amplitude and more negative subjective emotional evaluation of all stimulus furthermore enhanced right frontal asymmetry state and trait wa associated with diminished emotional modulation of the late positive potential in contrast no association of frontal asymmetry with defensive reflex physiology or activation of sympathetic nervous system activity wa found the current data suggest dissociable influence of resting frontal brain asymmetry on attentional and physiological processing of withdrawal and approach related stimulus that is asymmetrical frontal cortical brain activation might not modulate approach withdrawal related motor response and sympathetic arousal directly but instead enhances allocation of attentional resource to subjectively significant stimulus the result are discussed in term of their potential importance for emotion perception in anxiety disorder and their contribution to the understanding of frontal asymmetry

introduction depression is a common and serious complication of diabetes treatment approach addressing the specific demand of affected patient are scarce objective the aim of this work wa to test whether a stepped care approach for patient with diabetes and depression and or diabetes distress yield greater depression reduction than treatment a usual method two hundred and sixty patient with diabetes and elevated depressive symptom ce d 16 and or elevated diabetes distress paid 40 were randomized to stepped care for depression or diabetes treatment a usual the primary outcome wa the rate of meaningful depression reduction at the 12 month follow up according to the hamd score 9 or reduction by 50 secondary outcome were change in depression score hamd ce d diabetes distress paid diabetes acceptance aadq well being who 5 quality of life eq 5d sf 36 self care behavior sdsca dsmq hba1c and biomarkers of inflammation result one hundred and thirty one individual were assigned to stepped care and 129 to treatment a usual overall 15 4 were lost to follow up meaningful depression reduction wa observed in 80 2 versus 51 2 in stepped care versus treatment a usual p 0 001 intention to treat analysis of the secondary measure the hamd 3 2 p 0 001 who 5 1 5 p 0 007 and aadq 1 0 p 0 008 displayed significant treatment effect while effect on ce d 2 3 p 0 065 paid 3 5 p 0 109 and sdsca 0 20 p 0 081 were not significantly different both group showed comparable change in eq 5d sf 36 dsmq hba1c and biomarkers of inflammation all p 0 19 conclusion the stepped care approach improved depression well being and acceptance the result support that increasing treatment intensity on demand is effective and can help provide more optimal treatment the inclusion of diabetes specific intervention may be beneficial for patient with diabetes and elevated depression

although body image disturbance are not a diagnostic criterion of the binge eating disorder bed intervention study yield evidence of it importance in the maintenance of the disorder therefore the aim of the present study wa to experimentally test the influence of body related schema in the occurrence of appetite in individual with bed after collecting baseline saliva woman with bed and weight matched control cg were either given a food exposure fe or mirror exposure me while participant salivary reaction wa assessed once more in addition participant repeatedly rated their actual desire to binge dtb and emotion main result reveal a significant salivation and dtb increase in the fe compared to the baseline condition in both group however only in bed participant salivation and dtb increase were significantly higher in the me compared to the baseline condition the result support the importance of body image for the maintenance of bed

abstract background negative affect reliably predicts paranoid thought previous study point to the importance of emotion regulation for paranoid thought but have not yet focused on effect of acute increase and variability in strategy use method we conducted an experience sampling study for one week in a subclinical sample acute increase in the intensity of strategy use from one measurement point until the next between strategy variability i e standard deviation between all strategy at one measurement point and within strategy variability i e standard deviation of each strategy over one day were analyzed for effect on negative affect and paranoid thought result multi level model indicated that acute increase in acceptance and reappraisal are associated with le negative affect acute increase in acceptance but not in reappraisal were related to le paranoid thought in contrast acute increase in rumination and suppression were associated with more negative affect and paranoid thought between and within strategy variability were no significant predictor conclusion acute increase in the intensity of but not variability in emotion regulation strategy are related to negative affect and paranoid thought in daily life future study are needed to examine whether improving emotion regulation lead to sustainable reduction in symptom

dysfunctional cognitive process and maladaptive interpersonal pattern have been postulated to maintain body dysmorphic disorder bdd the present trial evaluated ct for bdd ct bdd which includes module targeting maladaptive cognitive processing in bdd a well a element of schema therapy related to interpersonal problem we investigated whether a ct bdd is effective a compared with a wait list wl group at week 12 b outcome of ct bdd is maintained at posttreatment and 3 and 6 month follow up and c whether change in shame and insight mediate change in bdd symptom severity forty adult with bdd were randomized to 36 week immediate ct bdd n 21 or to 12 week wl n 19 at week 12 immediate ct bdd wa significantly superior to wl in clinician rated bdd symptom severity insight self reported bdd symptom shame depression general symptomatology and life satisfaction change in outcome were associated with moderate to large effect size at week 12 reduction in shame and increase in insight separately mediated change in bdd symptom severity during treatment at week 12 from baseline to posttreatment significant improvement occurred within ct bdd in clinician rated symptom severity insight depression global functioning self reported bdd symptom shame depression general symptomatology and life satisfaction at posttreatment improvement were associated with large effect size and were maintained at 3 and 6 month follow up preliminary result support the efficacy of ct bdd addressing interpersonal problem in addition to cognitive dysfunction may increase the benefit of cbt for bdd patient

nightmare are a substantial burden for sleep quality previous study have shown that traumatic experience can increase the probability of nightmare and also waking life distress can enhance this effect there is evidence that the intensity of negative dream emotion is more responsible for rating a dream a a nightmare than threatening dream content however there is still a lack of research concerning effect on nightmare distress we hypothesise that traumatic childhood experience such a emotional abuse obtained by the childhood trauma questionnaire critical life event obtained by the social readjustment rating scale and threatening dream content are associated with nightmare distress a sample of n 103 participant kept a dream diary over 28 consecutive day about 60 of the sample were frequent nightmare dreamer the participant recorded their violent dream content and dream emotion in their diary to predict nightmare distress regression model were constructed nightmare distress wa measured with the nightmare distress questionnaire result showed that emotional abuse in childhood and critical life event predicted nightmare distress moreover violent dream content were associated with nightmare distress but after we controlled for nightmare frequency and the intensity of negative dream emotion the significant impact of violent dream content decreased the result suggest that the emotional appraisal of a dream ha a substantial influence on nightmare in addition to traumatic childhood experience and critical life event

human functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri and electroencephalography eeg study a well a animal study indicate that the amygdala and frontomedial brain region are critically involved in conditioned fear and that frontomedial oscillation in the theta range 4 8 hz may support communication between these brain region however few study have used a multimodal approach to probe interaction among these key region in human here our goal wa to bridge the gap between prior human fmri eeg and animal finding using simultaneous eeg fmri recording 24 h after fear conditioning and extinction conditioned stimulus presented c e c e and not presented during extinction c n c n were compared to identify effect specific to extinction versus fear recall differential c v c electrodermal frontomedial theta eeg and amygdala response fmri were reduced for extinguished versus nonextinguished stimulus importantly effect on theta power covaried with effect on amygdala activation fear and extinction recall a indicated by theta explained 60 of the variance for the analogous effect in the right amygdala our finding show for the first time the interplay of amygdala and frontomedial theta activity during fear and extinction recall in human and provide insight into neural circuit consistently linked with top down amygdala modulation in rodent

previous study suggest that patient suffering from bulimia nervosa bn have difficulty in perceiving internal bodily signal mostly assessed by self report questionnaire whether interoception is in this case attenuated or not remains an open question therefore interoceptive process were examined in twenty three patient with current bn and were compared to healthy participant we investigated interoceptive accuracy iac assessed by the heartbeat detection task and interoceptive awareness ia assessed by the eating disorder inventory 2 patient with bn and healthy participant did not differ in term of iac when controlling for bmi depression and anxiety whereas ia among bn patient wa found to have decreased although iac and ia were not related among control we observed an inverse correlation in bn suggesting that an abnormal overlap between these two level of interoceptive signal processing is present in bn the current study introduces a new perspective concerning the role of interoceptive process in bn and generates further question regarding the therapeutic utility of method targeting the interaction between different level of interoception in the treatment of bn
