background research on the effectiveness of treatment for subthreshold depression sd is still scarce the aim of the study wa to evaluate the efficacy of a web based guided self help intervention get on mood enhancer in the treatment of sd method participant with sd n 406 recruited from the general population via a large health insurance company were randomly allocated to a web based cognitive behavioural intervention or to enhanced care a usual the primary outcome wa the reduction in depressive symptom severity a measured with the center for epidemiological study depression scale at post treatment and at 6 month follow up result participant in the intervention group showed a significantly greater pre post reduction in depressive symptom severity d 1 06 95 ci 0 86 1 27 compared to the control condition d 0 29 95 ci 0 10 0 49 the corresponding between group effect size wa d 0 69 95 ci 0 49 0 89 at 6 month follow up the effect wa reduced to d 0 28 95 ci 0 09 0 48 but wa still statistically significant f1 403 9 240 p 0 003 conclusion this study lends support to the idea that problem solving coupled with behavioural activation is an effective treatment for sd in addition the delivery of this intervention over the internet might be a promising strategy for the dissemination of psychological intervention for sd on a large scale

background and objective cognitive theory of fear suggest that bias in interpretation are content specific fearful child should only interpret material negatively if they are specifically related to the content of their fear so far there are only a few study available that report on this postulated content specificity of interpretation process in childhood fear the goal of this study wa to examine interpretation bias and it content specificity in child with varying level of generalized anxiety disorder gad symptom method in an auditory interpretation task ait two word that differ by one phoneme are acoustically blended so that one can hear only one of the word in the current ait we included gad related blend negatively valenced fear related blend and positive blend multiple choice n 371 or open ended n 295 response were collected from 666 nonclinical child between 7 and 13 year of age result child with higher level of self reported gad showed significantly more negative interpretation of ambiguous gad related blend in the multiple choice version than child with lower level of gad there were no difference when interpreting the other ambiguous blend this result wa not found with the open ended version limitation effect were relatively small some gad stimulus were sub optimal and the task wa administered in a classroom setting even though we ensured that all child were able to hear all word clearly this may have impacted the result conclusion the finding only partly support the idea that fearful child display cognitive bias specific for fear relevant stimulus and more research is needed to replicate the result and test the usability of the ait
over the last few decade reflective functioning rf ha become an important construct for the understanding and treatment of several patient group while rf ha been well studied in adult sample

background during the khmer rouge regime in cambodia about a quarter of the population died resulting in many individual losing close relative still today many individual are suffering from the psychological consequence of these loss which might also affect the process of reconciliation within the cambodian society the aim of this paper is therefore to investigate the association between symptom of prolonged grief and attitude toward reconciliation method a sample of 775 survivor of the khmer rouge regime who lost relative during the conflict were interviewed about their loss and traumatic event prolonged grief pg complicated grief assessment self report cga sr posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd checklist civilian version and attitude toward reconciliation readiness to reconcile inventory rri result a higher symptom severity of pg wa significantly associated with readiness to reconcile even when controlling for other relevant variable beta 0 22 p 001 person who met caseness criterion for pg were significantly le ready to reconcile t 773 5 47 p 001 than person who did not meet caseness for pg conclusion pg seems to be a relevant mental health correlate of attitude toward reconciliation the result of the current study underline the importance of also considering pg with regard to the reconciliation process in cambodia and possibly also in other post conflict region

trauma survivor with post traumatic stress disorder ptsd frequently experience intrusive trauma memory associated with a feeling of nowness information processing model of ptsd ascribe these symptom to an insufficient integration of memory with their spatio temporal context in the past turning them into powerful stressor here we tested the idea that automatic association of trauma reminder with the present or the past predict intrusive memory we instructed 96 healthy participant to view two different traumatic film participant then underwent a computerized training that established implicit contingency between film reminder picture with the verbal response now or past to increase and reduce intrusion respectively the training successfully altered implicit spatio temporal association for film reminder stimulus on a subsequent implicit association test iat there were no additional transfer effect for tense usage during a free recall task after one week and for the development of intrusion symptom one week diary retrospective questionnaire however participant who associated one film more strongly with the present and the other with the past consistently reported relatively more intrusive memory related to the former film thus our result lend support to information processing model of ptsd and warrant further investigation of the causal role of implicit association with spatio temporal information

defensive system activation promotes heightened perception of threat signal and excessive attention to threat signal ha been discussed a a contributory factor in the etiology of anxiety disorder however a mechanistic account of attentional modulation during fear relevant process especially during fear generalization remains elusive to test the hypothesis that social fear generalization prompt sharpened tuning in the visuocortical representation of social threat cue 67 healthy participant underwent differential fear conditioning followed by a generalization test in which participant viewed face varying in similarity with the threat associated face we found that generalization of social threat sharpens visuocortical tuning of social threat cue whereas rating of fearfulness showed generalization linearly decreasing with decreasing similarity to the threat associated face moreover individual who reported greater anxiety in social situation also showed heightened sharpened tuning of visuocortical neuron to facial identity cue indicating the behavioral relevance of visuocortical tuning during generalization learning

background interpreter in the care of refugee work in various different setting qualitative study suggest that interpreter are confronted with a variety of demand depending on the context in which they work which may in turn influence their wellbeing to date no larger scale study ha investigated difference between work setting regarding interpreter work related characteristic or wellbeing objective the aim of this study wa to compare the work related characteristic and possible change in the wellbeing of interpreter between four main work setting psychotherapy counselling medical setting and authority in the care of refugee method interpreter in refugee care were recruited for a nationwide online survey in germany with two measurement time point participant provided socio demographic data and answered question about the working condition in their respective main work setting in addition psychological distress brief symptom inventory bsi 18 work related exhaustion copenhagen burnout inventory cbi and compassion satisfaction professional quality of life proqol were assessed result overall 158 interpreter were included at t1 of whom 63 were also included at t2 significantly more traumatic content wa interpreted in counselling setting and psychotherapy than in medical and authority setting h 3 26 09 p 001 the highest proportion of interpreter with an interpreting degree worked in the authority setting fisher s exact test p 002 significant difference between the four setting were found for psychological distress kruskal wallis test h 3 12 02 p 01 and work related exhaustion kruskal wallis test h 3 8 10 p 04 but not for compassion satisfaction conclusion the presented result indicate difference regarding working condition psychological distress and work related exhaustion between different work setting of interpreter future study may explore each setting in greater detail and include a larger sample size to reach a better understanding of the relationship between setting specific challenge and interpreter wellbeing

background an attentional bias to health threat stimulus is assumed to represent the primary pathogenetic factor for the development and maintenance of pathological health anxiety pha formerly termed hypochondriasis however little is known about the neural basis of this attentional bias in individual with pha method a group of patient with pha a group of depressed patient and a healthy control group completed an emotional stroop task with health threat body symptom and illness word and neutral control word while undergoing functional mri result we included 33 patient with pha 28 depressed patient and 31 control in our analysis a reflected in reaction time patient with pha showed a significantly stronger attentional bias to health threat word than both control group in addition patient with pha showed increased amygdala and rostral anterior cingulate cortex activation for body symptom but not for illness word moreover only in patient with pha amygdala activation in response to symptom word wa positively associated with higher arousal and more negative valence rating of the body symptom word material limitation a control group of patient with an anxiety disorder but without pha would have helped to define the specificity of the result for pha conclusion the attentional bias observed in patient with pha is associated with hyperactivation in response to body symptom word in brain region that are crucial for an arousal related fear response e g the amygdala and for resolving emotional interference e g the rostral anterior cingulate cortex the finding have important implication for the nosological classification of pha and suggest the application of innovative exposure based intervention for the treatment of pha

growing evidence support a continuum model of psychosis with mild psychotic symptom being frequently experienced by the general population moreover believing in the continuum model correlate with le stigmatization of schizophrenia this study explores whether continuum belief are a valid construct and develops a continuum belief scale first expert generated item were reduced to a candidate scale study 1 n 95 one dimensionality wa tested using confirmatory factor analysis study 2 n 363 convergent validity wa tested with a previous continuum belief scale essentialist belief and stigmatization study 2 while self reported psychotic experience i e frequency and conviction served to test discriminant validity study 3 n 229 a nine item questionnaire that ass continuum belief about schizophrenia symptom showed acceptable to good psychometric value high correlation with a previous continuum belief scale and small correlation with essentialist belief stereotype and desired social distance no correlation with psychotic experience were found thus continuum belief can be considered a valid construct the construed cbq r asks about symptom rather than the abstract category schizophrenia which may increase understandability of the scale validation confirms previous study and highlight the difference between continuum belief and personal psychotic experience

borderline personality disorder bpd is characterized by impairment in the cognitive control of negative information these impairment in cognitive control are presumably due to blunted activity of the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc along with enhanced activation of the limbic system however the impact of an excitatory stimulation of the dlpfc still need to be elucidated in the present study we therefore assigned 50 patient with bpd and 50 healthy control to receive either anodal or sham stimulation of the right dlpfc in a double blind randomized between subject design participant performed a delayed working memory task with a distracter period during which a grey background screen or neutral or negative stimulus were presented this experimental paradigm wa first evaluated in a pilot study with 18 patient with bpd and 19 healthy control in both study patient with bpd showed an impairment of cognitive control when negative distracters were presented in the delay period of a working memory task however excitatory stimulation of the right dlpfc did not ameliorate cognitive control of negative stimulus in bpd which raise question about the specific role of the right dlpfc for the understanding of bpd psychopathology methodological limitation are discussed

adverse learning experience play a significant role in the etiology of anxiety disorder however not all individual experiencing negative event develop heightened anxiety this is possibly due to individual difference in the regulation of negative emotion associated with these negative event cognitive reappraisal is defined a reinterpreting an emotion eliciting situation in a way that change it emotional impact a more frequent use of cognitive reappraisal in daily life ha been shown to be more adaptive however no study to date examined the association of dispositional cognitive reappraisal with emotional learning in order to elucidate individual difference in negative emotional response towards aversive event the goal of this functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri study wa to investigate the association of dispositional cognitive reappraisal with subjective electrodermal and neural correlate of fear acquisition and extinction data of 41 healthy individual who participated in a socially relevant differential conditioning paradigm acquisition and extinction learning day 1 extinction recall day 2 were acquired dispositional cognitive reappraisal wa negatively associated with right insula and hippocampus activation during acquisition furthermore the reduction of self reported conditioned fear during extinction learning a well a reduced insula and enhanced rostral anterior cingulate cortex activation during extinction learning wa related to cognitive reappraisal in addition reduced recovery of conditioned arousal reduced anterior cingulate and dorsomedial prefrontal cortex activation and enhanced ventromedial prefrontal cortex activation during extinction recall wa observed in individual with higher cognitive reappraisal score the result indicate that dispositional cognitive reappraisal modulates subjective and neural correlate of fear conditioning probably leading to reduced acquisition and stronger extinction learning and recall these result point to the important role of dispositional cognitive reappraisal in the development and modification of conditioned emotional response and might further improve our understanding of anxiety disorder

subjective social status ss predicts health outcome above and beyond objective measure of social status both objective and subjective measure of social status are strongly related with depression cognitive mechanism such a depressive cognition rumination and a negative cognitive style are seen a both concomitant and antecedent to depression this experiment examined the causal role of ss in developing depressive thinking participant were randomly assigned to a low and a high status group and followed a manipulation procedure targeting their ss depressive thinking wa subsequently assessed by depressive cognition stress reactive state rumination and negative cognitive style low status participant exhibited higher level of depressive cognition and rumination compared to their high status counterpart but both group did not differ regarding their cognitive style finding support the causal nature of the relationship between ss and depressive thinking several mechanism of how low ss may lead to depression are discussed

nonsuicidal self injury nssi is a prevalent and impairing condition that wa newly included in dsm 5 in the section iii criterion for further research difficulty in emotion regulation play an important role in the development and maintenance of nssi this study investigated the emotion regulation in female adolescent with nssi according to dsm 5 n 55 clinical control adolescent with mental disorder without nssi n 30 and nonclinical control adolescent n 58 using self report questionnaire and interview a expected result indicated that adolescent with nssi have significantly more difficulty in emotion regulation compared to healthy control in addition adolescent with nssi reported also significantly more difficulty in impulse control lack of emotional clarity difficulty engaging in goal directed behavior and limited access to emotion regulation strategy compared to nonclinical and clinical control adolescent with nssi felt significantly more often sadness compared to clinical control d 0 66 and compared to other emotion adolescent with nssi indicated significantly le often happiness compared to nonclinical control d 1 83 result support that adolescent with nssi have difficulty in emotion regulation and that these difficulty are even more pronounced than in adolescent with other mental disorder clinical implication will be discussed

we examined the role of baseline patient characteristic a predictor of outcome end state functioning response and remission and attrition for cognitive therapy ct in social anxiety disorder sad beyond socio demographic and clinical variable such a symptom severity and comorbidity status previously neglected patient characteristic e g personality self esteem shame interpersonal problem and attachment style were analysed method data came from the ct arm of a multicentre rct with n 244 patient having dsm iv sad ct wa conducted according to the manual by clark and well severity of sad wa assessed at baseline and end of treatment with the liebowitz social anxiety scale lsas multiple linear regression analysis and logistic regression analysis were applied result up to 37 of the post treatment variance lsas could be explained by all pre treatment variable combined symptom severity baseline lsas wa consistently negatively associated with end state functioning and remission but not with response number of comorbid diagnosis wa negatively associated with end state functioning and response but not with remission self esteem wa positively associated with higher end state functioning and more shame with better response attrition could not be significantly predicted conclusion the result indicate that the initial probability for treatment success mainly depends on severity of disorder and comorbid condition while other psychological variable are of minor importance at least on a nomothetic level this stand in contrast with effort to arrive at an empirical based foundation for differential indication and argues to search for more potent moderator of therapeutic change rather on the process level key practitioner message personality self esteem shame attachment style and interpersonal problem do not or only marginally moderate the effect of intervention in ct of social phobia symptom severity and comorbid diagnosis might affect treatment outcome negatively beyond these two factor most patient share a similar likelihood of treatment success when treated according to the manual by clark and well copyright c 2014 john wiley son ltd

aim we investigate reason for persistent medication refusal in schizophrenia spectrum disorder and test whether factor that speak for a rational decision such a negative experience with medication or low symptom distress predict medication refusal even after taking difference in insight into account method we included 45 participant with schizophrenia spectrum disorder of which 20 had refused antipsychotic medication for at least three month and assessed reason for taking or not taking medication labeling condition a mental disorder insight experience with the previous treatment symptom and symptom distress positive and negative consequence and experience of psychosis causal belief therapeutic relationship with previous clinician and attitude towards medication result group did not differ in symptom severity but medication refusers reported significantly le insight le satisfaction with their most recent psychiatrist and with previous medication and more negative belief about harmful effect of medication they also felt le informed about medication after controlling for insight the perceived helpfulness of the previous treating psychiatrist or 0 30 z 5 58 p 0 018 and of previous medication or 0 27 z 6 87 p 0 009 and feeling insufficiently informed about medication or 0 53 z 3 85 p 0 050 significantly predicted medication discontinuation conclusion building rapport with patient with a different view of the nature of their condition and encouraging informed decision on medication are likely to improve medication adherence however the finding also suggest that refusing medication after a phase of initial adherence is also the consequence of negative experience with medication and could result from weighing the pro against the con

fear of driving is common in clinical practice while it treatment program are understudied this is the first randomized controlled trial to evaluate a newly developed protocol for cognitive behavior therapy cbt for driving fear compared with a wait list and to use specific assessment scale 34 participant 30 woman 4 men in an outpatient psychotherapy clinic were randomly allocated to either 18 session of cbt or a wait list n 17 each after treatment cbt wa significantly more efficacious than the wait list with large effect size on the instrument for fear of driving ifd cohen s d 2 58 and on the driving cognition questionnaire dcq cohen s d 2 14 driving fear is a condition treatable by cbt and the suggested protocol is safe feasible and acceptable further study with larger sample and active control e g virtual reality therapy are required to draw generalizable conclusion on effect size

background post stroke depression psd is the most frequent mental disorder after stroke affecting about 30 of stroke survivor despite extensive research little is known about the influence of general self efficacy gse on psd we investigated the effect of gse on depression six month post stroke while controlling for established risk factor method eighty eight patient from two rehabilitation center with first ever ischemic stroke were assessed around 8 week and 6 month after stroke baseline assessment included demographic variable gse scale physical disability barthel index stroke severity modified nih scale pre stroke mental illness cognitive status mini mental state test social support f sozu questionnaire and depressiveness geriatric depression scale gd follow up assessment included dsm iv depression gd and gse the influence of each risk factor on psd wa analyzed by binary hierarchical regression result baseline depressiveness or 1 41 p 01 and social support or 95 p 03 predicted psd decreasing gse wa associated with high baseline gse r 51 p 01 and influenced later psd or 1 39 p 01 limitation patient range of impairment may have been limited a sufficient speech comprehension and capacity for interview participation were required causal relationship between decreasing gse and increasing gd cannot be assumed based on correlation discussion decreasing gse wa linked to psd especially in patient with high baseline gse this effect may be due to dissatisfaction with recovery following high expectation early depressive symptom and low social support predicted psd early screening for depressive symptom and focusing on self efficacy might help to prevent later depression

the monitoring of one s own action allows human to adjust to a changing and complex world previous neuroscientific research found overactive action monitoring and increased sensitivity to error to be associated with anxiety and it is assumed to contribute to the development and maintenance of anxiety symptom a largely shared decomposition of anxiety differentiates two dimension anxious apprehension i e worry and anxious arousal i e physiological hyperarousal alteration in neural correlate of error monitoring have been more closely linked to anxious apprehension compared to anxious arousal this study examined the relationship between anxiety dimension and electrophysiological correlate of action monitoring i e error related negativity ern and correct response negativity crn a total of 135 non clinical participant performed a flanker task while their electroencephalogram wa recorded we recruited participant with converging and diverging anxiety dimension profile i e above or below median in anxious apprehension and anxious arousal or above median in one and below in the other dimension this grouping strategy facilitates disentangling possible interaction and allows the investigation of the isolated effect of each anxiety dimension regression analysis did not reveal a significant main or interaction effect of anxiety dimension on ern or crn irrespective of gender in addition bayesian statistical analyzes yielded evidence for the absence of an association between both anxiety dimension and ern and crn altogether our result suggest that the association of anxiety dimension particularly anxious apprehension and action monitoring might be smaller in non clinical sample a previous study indicate

aim this study examined the factorial and criterion validity of the community assessment of psychic experience cape we compared the validity of the original three dimensional model and a recently proposed multidimensional model in which positive symptom are subdivided into the subfactors hallucination bizarre experience paranoia grandiosity and magical thinking and negative symptom are subdivided into social withdrawal affective flattening and avolition method eleven community n 934 and three patient sample n 112 were combined and the proposed model were tested using confirmatory factor analysis criterion validity wa calculated based on self report measure for depression and paranoia a well a observer based rating for positive and negative symptom result the multidimensional model showed better relative quality aic bic than the original three dimensional model of the cape but both model showed acceptable absolute model fit rmsea srmr the criterion validity wa good for the positive symptom scale and negative symptom subfactors social withdrawal and affective flattening conclusion factorial validity wa found for the three dimensional and multidimensional model for the cape the multidimensional model however show better comparative fit and promising result in regard to criterion validity thus we recommend a hierarchical multidimensional structure of positive and negative symptom for future use of the cape

the neuropeptide oxytocin is involved in social cognition and interaction across specie and play a crucial role in the regulation of affiliative behavior oxytocin level in cerebrospinal fluid csf but also in plasma or urine have been shown to be negatively associated with childhood trauma aggressive behavior and suicide attempt recently an altered activity of the oxytocin system ha been discussed to play a prominent role in borderline personality disorder bpd which is thought to be closely related to traumatic experience in childhood and is characterized by para suicidal behavior a well a aggressive outburst in the present study we compared plasma oxytocin level of woman with and without bpd in the follicular phase and assessed the relationship between oxytocin concentration and childhood trauma woman diagnosed with bpd had significantly reduced oxytocin concentration even after controlling for estrogen progesterone and contraceptive intake in addition plasma oxytocin correlated negatively with experience of childhood trauma in particular with emotional neglect and abuse the result of mediation analysis do not support a model of oxytocin being a prominent mediator in the link between childhood trauma and bpd thus the finding indicate dysregulations in the oxytocin system of patient diagnosed with bpd with more longitudinal research being necessary to disentangle the relationship between childhood adversity oxytocin system and psychopathology

the aim of this pilot study wa to document the effect of a group schema cognitive behavioral therapy intervention scbt g van vreeswijk broersen 2006 on global symptomatic distress in young adult with personality disorder or personality disorder feature we also sought to determine the stability of maladaptive schema schema mode and coping response throughout treatment a well a relation among these variable with improvement in symptomatic distress during treatment twenty six young adult mean age 22 5 year range 18 29 year with a primary diagnosis of a dsm iv cluster b or cluster c personality disorder or with personality disorder feature participated in the 20 session scbt g protocol global symptomatic distress decreased substantially from pre treatment to post treatment d 0 81 maladaptive schema schema mode and dysfunctional coping response decreased with medium to large effect size d s 0 56 and 0 98 respectively however decrease in maladaptive schema wa not significant after controlling for symptomatic distress adaptive schema mode increased slightly d 0 40 throughout treatment baseline level of maladaptive schema predicted symptomatic distress concurrently and at mid treatment but not at post treatment our finding provide preliminary evidence that scbt g might be an effective treatment for young adult with personality disorder or personality disorder feature in term of improvement in global symptomatic distress and underlying vulnerability

objective the development and improvement of therapeutic competency are central aim in psychotherapy training however little is known about which training intervention are suitable for the improvement of competency method in the current pilot study the efficacy of feedback regarding therapeutic competency wa investigated in cognitive behavioural therapy cbt totally 19 trainee therapist and 19 patient were allocated randomly to a competence feedback group cfg or control group cg two experienced clinician and feedback provider who were blind to the treatment condition independently evaluated therapeutic competency on the cognitive therapy scale at five treatment time i e at session 1 5 9 13 and 17 whereas cfg and cg included regular supervision only therapist in the cfg additionally received written qualitative and quantitative feedback regarding their demonstrated competency in conducting cbt during treatment result we found a significant time x group interaction effect eta 2 09 which indicates a larger competence increase in the cfg in comparison to the cg conclusion competence feedback wa demonstrated to be suitable for the improvement of therapeutic competency in cbt these finding may have important implication for psychotherapy training clinical practice and psychotherapy research however further research is necessary to ensure the replicability and generalizability of the finding

objective to investigate behavioral inhibition in individual with binge eating disorder bed compared with overweight and obese individual without bed no bed method participant with bed n 31 and the weight matched no bed group n 29 completed an inhibitory control task stop signal task sst with food and neutral stimulus result the bed group needed more time to stop an ongoing response a indicated by increased stop signal reaction time ssrt relative to the no bed group additionally compared with the no bed group the bed group displayed more difficulty inhibiting response elicited by food stimulus the deficit in behavioral response inhibition were also found to be related to the severity of reported symptom discussion there is a general deficit in late stage behavioral inhibition in bed and this may be particularly pronounced in the context of food stimulus

although study on social anxiety and alcohol related problem are numerous the exact nature of the relationship remains unclear in the present study we investigate how the motive to drink due to social anxiety is associated with hazardous alcohol use over and above habitual alcohol use social anxiety and alcohol outcome expectancy we also examine which factor define the motive to drink due to social anxiety and clarify the impact of the type of social situation drinking due to social anxiety habitual alcohol use and gender but not social anxiety were associated with hazardous alcohol use social anxiety increased the motive to drink due to social anxiety but fear of cognitive performance deficit after drinking reduced it alcohol wa used to reduce anxiety more frequently in situation where intake of alcohol is deemed socially acceptable these finding suggest that the motive drinking due to social anxiety not social anxiety per se is related to hazardous alcohol use the motive is weakened by the expectation of alcohol induced cognitive deficit a well a by the type of social situation in which alcohol is to be used

background many orphan in east africa are living in institutional care facility where they experience poor quality of care and ongoing maltreatment we report on the extension of a cluster randomized controlled trial aiming to replicate and show sustainability of previous found effect and to discover long term effect of the intervention interaction competency with child for caregiver icc c 12 month after the intervention s conclusion method conducting a robust 2x3 analysis of variance we investigated the change over time in the waitlist orphanage n 75 62 7 female mage 37 63 year sdage 11 81 which participated in the intervention after first follow up and in the initial intervention orphanage n 81 61 7 female mage 38 73 year sdage 11 94 result the caregiver in the waitlist orphanage reported le reported level of maltreatment d 0 09 fewer positive attitude towards violent discipline d 0 44 and increased childcare knowledge d 1 26 three month after intervention replicating our finding of the initial intervention condition in addition these effect were maintained in the intervention orphanage 12 month post intervention furthermore we found long term improvement in negative caregiver child relationship d 0 83 caregiver stress level d 0 98 and their mental health problem d 0 61 conclusion the replication and maintenance of the intervention effect and first hint to additional long term effect substantiates the effectiveness of icc c a long a alternative care cannot be provided for all child in need brief caregiver training can make an important contribution to enlarge the opportunity for many child trial registration clinicaltrials gov nct03594617 registered on 20 july 2018

background in several conflict worldwide child are recruited a fighter in irregular force these child need to be reintegrated into the society after the conflict however concurrent to various reservation in the community the reintegration of former child soldier is challenged by the fact that many of the affected child were indoctrinated by the armed group and traumatized through war event even several year after the defeat of the terrorist organization isi in iraq systematic effort towards the reintegration of child who had been recruited by isi are notably absent method we conducted clinical interview with a sample of n 59 adolescent and young adult who were incarcerated for terrorism in the prison of the kurdistan region of iraq to ass level and type of trauma exposure ptsd depression readiness to reintegrate and ongoing identification with isi result we found high level of ptsd and depression that were associated with trauma exposure the subjective readiness to reintegrate into the community wa associated with trauma exposure and wa mediated by depression even after controlling for the influence of ongoing identification with the armed group conclusion the study indicates that trauma related mental ill health should be considered in effort to reintegrate young former terrorist

aim to appraise the diabetes self management questionnaire dsmq s measurement of diabetes self management a a statistical predictor of glycaemic control relative to the widely used sdsca method 248 patient with type 1 diabetes and 182 patient with type 2 diabetes were cross sectionally assessed using the two self report measure of diabetes self management dsmq and sdsca the scale were used a competing predictor of hba1c we developed a structural equation model of self management a measured by the dsmq and analysed the amount of variation explained in hba1c an analogue model wa developed for the sdsca result the structural equation model of self management and glycaemic control showed very good fit to the data the dsmq s measurement of self management showed association with hba1c of 0 53 for type 1 and 0 46 for type 2 diabetes both p 0 001 explaining 21 and 28 of variation in glycaemic control respectively the sdsca s measurement showed association with hba1c of 0 14 p 0 030 for type 1 and 0 31 p 0 003 for type 2 diabetes explaining 2 and 10 of glycaemic variation predictive power for glycaemic control wa significantly higher for the dsmq p 0 001 conclusion this study support the dsmq a the preferred tool when analysing self reported behavioural problem related to reduced glycaemic control the scale may be useful for clinical assessment of patient with suboptimal diabetes outcome or research on factor affecting association between self management behaviour and glycaemic control

objective to determine the treatment effect of psychodynamic therapy for adolescent in comparison to normative developmental progression in two group without treatment healthy adolescent and adolescent with juvenile diabetes research design and method in a 3 wave longitudinal study n 531 adolescent n 303 treated adolescent n 119 healthy n 109 with diabetes and their parent filled out psychopathology questionnaire youth self report ysr and child behaviour checklist cbcl growth curve modeling gcm wa used to examine within person change in psychopathology while controlling for stable between person difference result gcm analysis revealed significant within person reduction in patient ysr and cbcl d 1 02 1 99 at the end of treatment when accounted for the control group developmental progression d 14 94 patient within person change remained significantly higher d 48 82 in all three group parent rated the severity of psychopathology significantly lower and within person change significantly higher than the adolescent him herself conclusion psychodynamic therapy led to a significant symptom reduction in treated adolescent and wa superior to development related symptom change occurring in the two control group hence clinically relevant symptom in adolescent do not grow out but require psychotherapeutic treatment difference between adolescent and their parent in the evaluation of symptom severity and change require attention in psychotherapy treatment and research

background fundamental question regarding the nature and function of attentional bias ab to threat in the etiology of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd remain unanswered we tested the temporal interplay between trauma exposure dysregulated attentional processing of threatening information pre and post trauma and the development of posttraumatic intrusion method response time to trauma related threat trauma unrelated threat a well a to trauma related but typically emotionally neutral stimulus wa assessed using the dot probe task before and one week after watching a violent movie scene that served a a trauma analogue ab wa analyzed a a dynamic process by mean of a recently developed approach indexing momentary fluctuation of ab toward and away from emotional stimulus posttraumatic intrusion were measured daily over the week following analogue trauma exposure result we found that key feature of ab dynamic to trauma related stimulus at post but not pre trauma exposure were associated with posttraumatic intrusion notably these post trauma exposure effect were specific to biased attentional processing of trauma related but not threatening stimulus unrelated to the traumatic event in line with a growing body of finding pre and post trauma exposure traditional aggregated mean ab score were not similarly associated with posttraumatic intrusion conclusion we conclude that one mechanism through which trauma exposure may contribute to the development of ptsd is through it dysregulation of attentional processing of trauma event related cue future work may focus on delineating the developmental course through which attentional dysregulation post trauma and posttraumatic intrusion unfold and interact

abstract background disease burden and unsatisfactory treatment outcome call for innovation in treatment of depression prospective mental imagery i e future directed voluntary imagery based thought about potentially rewarding activity may offer a mechanistically informed intervention that target deficit in reward processing a core clinical feature of depression we propose that the previously described impact of prospective mental imagery on motivation for everyday activity is facilitated by affective forecasting i e prediction about an individual s emotional response to the imagined activity method participant n 120 self nominated six activity to engage in over the following week and were randomized to either 1 an affective forecasting imagery condition n 40 2 a neutral process imagery condition n 40 or 3 a no imagery control condition n 40 result a predicted increase in motivation rating from pre to post experimental manipulation were significantly higher following affective forecasting imagery compared to both neutral process imagery d 0 62 and no imagery d 0 91 contrary to prediction the number of activity participant engaged in did not differ between condition conclusion result provide initial evidence for a potentially important role of affective forecasting in prospective mental imagery we discus how these finding can inform future research aiming to harness prospective mental imagery s potential for clinical application

background individual with anorexia nervosa an are often thought to show heightened self control and increased ability to inhibit desire in addition to inhibitory self control antecedent focused strategy e g cognitive reconstrual the re evaluation of tempting situation might contribute to disorder maintenance and enable disorder typical maladaptive behavior method over a period of 14 day 40 acutely underweight young female patient with anorexia nervosa an and 40 healthy control hc participant reported their affect and behavior in self control situation via ecological momentary assessment during inpatient treatment an and everyday life hc data were analyzed via hierarchical analysis linear and logistic modeling result conflict strength had a significantly lower impact on self control success in an compared to hc while an and hc did not generally differ in the number or strength of self control conflict or in the percentage of self control success an reported self controlled behavior to be le dependent on conflict strength conclusion while patient with an were not generally more successful at self control they appeared to resolve self control conflict more effectively these finding suggest that the magnitude of self control conflict ha comparatively little impact on individual with an possibly due to the use of antecedent focused strategy if confirmed cognitive behavioral therapy might focus on and help patient to exploit these alternative self control strategy in the battle against their illness

background cognitive function decline in parallel to the decrease in glomerular filtration rate best epitomized by the markedly reduced cerebral performance in patient undergoing maintenance haemodialysis chronic kidney disease stage 5 dialysis ckd5d aside from structural permanent damage there seems to be a reversible part of low cognitive performance the potential effect of a single dialysis session on cognitive function remains still elusive the aim of the study wa to ass cognitive function using a widespread test battery and avoiding excluding effect of circadian variation method twenty eight medically stable ckd5d patient age 54 9 13 2 year dialysis vintage 46 2 51 0 month at two tertiary care centre with outpatient dialysis unit were enrolled cognitive testing wa always performed twice within 24 h 1 h prior to haemodialysis t1pre dialysis a well a 19 h after the end of dialysis t2post dialysis including assessment of memory attention and concentration executive functioning word fluency and psychomotor speed by using a well validated neuropsychological test battery patient were randomized into two group one group wa examined before t1pre dialysis and after t2post dialysis dialysis session 1 the other group wa first examined the day after dialysis session 1 t2post dialysis and then before dialysis session 2 t1pre dialysis in order to exclude potential learning effect twenty age matched subject with normal excretory renal function were used for comparison result neuropsychological testing found that the ckd5d performed significantly worse on measure of alertness attention working memory logical and visual memory word fluency and executive function compared with non ckd subject no difference in short term memory selective attention a well a problem solving and planning were found between ckd5d patient and non ckd subject a single haemodialysis session led to a significant improvement in logical rivermead behaviour memory test story p 0 001 and visual memory rey osterrieth complex figure test rcft memory quotient p 0 001 psychomotor speed trail making test tmt b p 0 020 activity planning executive function rcft copy point deduction p 0 001 and concentration tmt a p 0 001 conclusion our data demonstrate improvement in memory function executive function and psychomotor ability after a single dialysis session pointing to a reversible component of low cognitive performance in ckd5d

objective patient and spouse use various support strategy to deal with cancer and it associated burden support can be perceived within the dyad perceived dyadic coping pdc or from others perceived social support ps the present study investigates the association of pdc and ps with depression and anxiety symptom experienced by hematooncological dyad method a total of 330 hematooncological dyad participated in the study dyadic coping inventory dci including perceived stress communication and four pdc strategy supportive negative delegated common enriched social support instrument essi and patient health questionnaire 4 phq 4 are used for assessment to take nonindependence of patient s and spouse s variable into account data are analyzed with the actor partner interdependence model apim result hematological cancer patient and their spouse reported a similar level of depression and anxiety symptom perceived negative dyadic coping dc wa adversely related with both patient s and spouse s outcome all p 0 01 and perceived positive dc wa adversely related with depression symptom in both and anxiety symptom in spouse all p 0 05 more ps wa associated with le depression and anxiety symptom in both all p 0 05 and spouse s ps b 0 04 p 0 05 wa significantly associated with patient s depression symptom conclusion this study highlight the association between perceived negative dc perceived positive dc and ps with depression and anxiety symptom focus should be on enhancement of ps especially in spouse a they experience a comparable amount of psychosocial distress and have considerable impact on the patient s wellbeing

olfactory function influence social behavior for instance olfaction seems to play a key role in mate choice and help detecting emotion in other people in a previous study we showed that people who were born without a sense of smell exhibit enhanced social insecurity based on the comment to this article we decided to have a closer look to whether the absence of the sense of smell affect men and woman differently under this focus questionnaire data of 32 patient diagnosed with isolated congenital anosmia 10 men 22 woman and 36 age matched healthy control 15 men 21 woman wa reanalyzed in result men and woman without a sense of smell reported enhanced social insecurity but with different consequence men who were born without a sense of smell exhibit a strongly reduced number of sexual relationship and woman are affected such that they feel le secure about their partner this emphasizes the importance of the sense of smell for intimate relationship

lt b gt lt i gt background lt i gt lt b gt oxytocin might promote favorable psychotherapy outcome by strengthening the therapeutic alliance it involvement in psychotherapeutic process especially regarding the therapeutic alliance need further investigation lt b gt lt i gt patient and method lt i gt lt b gt blood oxytocin of 35 male german armed force service member who were seeking treatment for posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd wa analyzed before the onset of a 5 week internet based trauma focused psychotherapy we investigated whether oxytocin influenced patient rating of the therapeutic alliance component agreement on collaboration and emotional bond assessed during and after treatment we further explored oxytocin s impact on general change mechanism of psychotherapy and on psychotherapy expectation and evaluation lt b gt lt i gt result lt i gt lt b gt oxytocin had no significant impact on early agreement on collaboration which significantly predicted psychotherapy outcome early emotional bond wa not predicted by oxytocin and wa not predictive for psychotherapy outcome descriptive analysis showed that patient with higher pretreatment oxytocin concentration provided higher rating of general change mechanism of psychotherapy on a descriptive level the association between psychotherapy expectation and evaluation and oxytocin were mixed lt b gt lt i gt discussion and conclusion lt i gt lt b gt we found positive effect of higher pretreatment oxytocin concentration in ptsd patient this descriptive study is limited by it small sample size and need replication in larger independent sample however result indicate possible benefit of oxytocin on trauma focused psychotherapy

self efficacy ha been proposed a an important element of a successful cognitive behavioral treatment cbt positive change in perceived self efficacy have been linked to an improved adaptive emotional and behavioral responding in the context of anxiety provoking situation furthermore a positive influence of increased self efficacy on cognitive function ha been confirmed the present study examined the effect of verbal persuasion on perceived self efficacy and fear extinction healthy participant were subjected to a standardized differential fear conditioning paradigm after fear acquisition half of the participant received a verbal persuasion aimed at increasing perceived self efficacy the extinction of fear wa assessed immediately thereafter on both the implicit and explicit level our result suggest that an increased perceived self efficacy wa associated with enhanced extinction evidenced on the psychophysiological level and accompanied by more pronounced decrement in conditioned negative valence change in extinction were not due to a decrease in overall emotional reactivity to conditioned stimulus c in addition debriefing participant about the false positive feedback did not affect the processing of already extinguished conditioned response during a subsequent continued extinction phase our result suggest that positive change in perceived self efficacy can be beneficial for emotional learning finding are discussed with respect to strategy aimed at increasing extinction learning in the course of exposure based treatment

background previous experimental research on testosterone t and psychological trait is inconclusive thus we performed the first large scale observational study of the association between t and dispositional optimism pessimism method we used prospective data from 6 493 primary care patient 3 840 woman of the detect study diabetes cardiovascular risk evaluation target and essential data for commitment of treatment including repeated immunoassay based measurement of serum t and optimism pessimism assessed by the revised life orientation test lot r cross sectional and longitudinal association of baseline t and one year change in t with optimism and pessimism were investigated using age and multivariable adjusted regression model result cross sectional analysis showed no association of t with optimism or pessimism in both sex longitudinal analysis also showed no association of baseline t with optimism or pessimism at four year follow up multivariable analysis of total lot r score yielded similarly non significant result beta coefficient per unit change in t for men 0 01 95 ci 0 24 0 22 woman 0 08 0 03 0 20 furthermore change in t wa not related to optimism or pessimism at four year follow up conclusion the present observational study of a large scale prospective sample showed no association of t with optimism or pessimism integrating further experimental and interventional evidence from alternative methodological approach would strengthen this conclusion and establish stronger evidence about the potential hormonal basis of psychological trait

background the high place phenomenon that is a sudden urge to jump when in a high place is an experience known to many people that ha rarely been studied the present study aimed to ass the prevalence of the high place phenomenon in a non clinical and a clinical german sample furthermore clinical correlate of the experience were assessed method the study sample comprised 276 participant 67 female m age 32 08 sd age 10 73 who took part in an online assessment and 94 patient 73 4 female m age 49 26 sd age 13 32 suffering from clinically relevant fear of flying participant filled out questionnaire on experience with the high place phenomenon depression anxiety suicide ideation and anxiety sensitivity result the high place phenomenon wa known to nearly 60 of the online sample and to 45 of the patient sample suicide ideation a well a anxiety sensitivity were positively associated with experience with the high place phenomenon in the online sample depression anxiety and suicide ideation were unrelated to experience with the phenomenon in the patient sample conclusion the high place phenomenon is commonly reported by lifetime current suicide ideators however it is also a common experience in individual who have never suffered from suicide ideation it is therefore cautioned not to interpret such experience a an expression of a hidden death wish

objective fear of eye gaze and avoidance of eye contact are core feature of social anxiety disorder sad to measure self reported fear and avoidance of eye gaze the gaze anxiety rating scale gar ha been developed and validated in recent year in it english version the main objective of the present study were to psychometrically evaluate the german translation of the gar concerning it reliability factorial structure and validity method three sample of participant were enrolled in the study 1 a non patient sample n 353 completed the gar and a set of trait questionnaire to ass internal consistency test retest reliability factorial structure and concurrent and divergent validity 2 a sample of patient with sad n 33 wa compared to a healthy control group n 30 regarding their score on the gar and the trait measure result the german gar fear and avoidance scale exhibited excellent internal consistency and high stability over 2 and 4 month a did the original version the english version s factorial structure wa replicated yielding two category of situation 1 everyday situation and 2 situation involving high evaluative threat gar fear and avoidance displayed convergent validity with trait measure of social anxiety and were markedly higher in patient with gsad than in healthy control fear and avoidance of eye contact in situation involving high level of evaluative threat related more closely to social anxiety than to gaze anxiety in everyday situation conclusion the german version of the gar ha demonstrated reliability and validity similar to the original version and is thus well suited to capture fear and avoidance of eye contact in different social situation a a valid self report measure of social anxiety and related disorder in the social domain for use in both clinical practice and research

background previous research indicates that body image disturbance is transmitted from mother to daughter via modeling of maternal body related behavior and attitude indirect transmission and via maternal body related feedback direct transmission so far the transmission of body related attentional bias which according to cognitive behavioral theory play a prominent role in the development and maintenance of eating disorder ha not been analyzed the current eye tracking study applied the concept of direct and indirect transmission to body related attentional bias by examining body related viewing pattern on self and other picture within mother daughter dyad method eye movement of n 82 participant n 41 healthy female adolescent mean age 15 82 year sd 1 80 and their mother mean age 47 78 year sd 4 52 were recorded while looking at whole body picture of themselves and a control peer based on fixation on self defined attractive and unattractive body area visual attention bias score were calculated for mother and daughter representing the pattern of body related attention allocation based on mother fixation on their own daughter s and the adolescent peer s body a second visual attention bias score wa calculated reflecting the mother viewing pattern on their own daughter result analysis of variance revealed an attentional bias for self defined unattractive body area in adolescent the girl visual attention bias score correlated significantly with their mother bias score indicating indirect transmission and with their mother second bias score indicating direct transmission moreover the girl bias score correlated significantly with negative body related feedback from their mother conclusion female adolescent show a deficit oriented attentional bias for one s own and a peer s body the correlated body related attention pattern imply that attentional bias might be transmitted directly and indirectly from mother to daughter result underline the potential relevance of maternal influence for the development of body image disturbance in girl and suggest specific family based approach for the prevention and treatment of eating disorder

abstract in slow open group a well a therapy of le than ten session each group session hold importance patient therapist and co therapist have different perspective and may gain different experience from a group session this study investigates the perspective of patient therapist and co therapist on alliance new insight and therapist technique in the same group session do the three actor perceive these group aspect similarly or differently which group aspect are related with the outcome coping one hundred and forty nine session of a cognitive behaviour therapy group have been investigated patient therapist and co therapist gave rating on their perceived alliance group topic and insight a well a therapist technique competency concerning new insight there wa concordance between patient and co therapist r 211 p lt 05 concerning alliance there wa a concordance between patient and therapist r 327 p lt 01 therapist focusing on alliance building wa associated with lower patient outcome in term of work coping β 391 the quality of therapeutic technique wa the same in group with higher and lower outcome patient perception of whether they felt good in the group session wa explanative for session outcome while therapist perception and context condition supervision number of participant wa not patient therapist and co therapist have different perspective on the same group therapy session patient perception are associated with session outcome a lower session outcome must not be associated with a poor technique performance of the therapist therapist should not only be aware of alliance building and correct technical performance but they must also be aware of patient perception of the group process and outcome key learning aim the present research is the first evaluation of group session aspect and session outcome in rehabilitation patient with work anxiety in slow open group we will learn 1 whether patient therapist and co therapist perception of the same group session are similar or different 2 whether group session that result in worse outcome are different from group session resulting in a better outcome 3 which aspect of the group session are predictive for a better outcome

1 background research ha shown that it is important to examine depressive symptom in the light of the mereology the ratio between one symptom and the whole disorder the goal of this study wa to examine change in the symptom interrelation of patient undergoing cognitive behavioral therapy treatment cbt via network analysis 2 method outpatient with depressive symptom n 401 were assessed with the beck depression inventory three time pretreatment after 12 session and post treatment during cbt gaussian graphical model were used to estimate the relationship among symptom 3 result the severity of depressive symptom significantly decreased over the course of therapy but connectivity in the network significantly increased community of symptom changed during treatment the most central and predictable symptom wa worthlessness at baseline and after 12 session and loss of energy and self dislike at post treatment 4 conclusion the result indicate that the severity of depressive symptom decreased during cognitive behavior therapy while network connectivity increased furthermore the association among symptom and their centrality changed during the course of therapy future study may investigate individual difference and their impact on the planning of psychotherapeutic treatment

mid adolescence is a critical time for the development of stress related disorder and it is associated with significant social vulnerability however little is known about normative neural process accompanying psychosocial stress at this time previous research found that emotion regulation strategy critically influence the relationship between stress and the development of psychiatric symptom during adolescence using functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri we examined neural response to acute stress and analyzed whether the tendency to use adaptive or maladaptive emotion regulation strategy is related to neural and autonomic stress response result show large linear activation increase from low to medium to high stress level mainly in medial prefrontal insulae and temporal area caudate and subgenual anterior cingulate cortex neural area related to reward and affective valuation showed linearly decreasing activation in line with our hypothesis the current adolescent neural stress profile resembled social rejection and wa characterized by pronounced activation in insula angular and temporal cortex moreover result point to an intriguing role of the anterior temporal gyrus stress related activity in the anterior temporal gyrus wa positively related to maladaptive regulation strategy and stress induced autonomic activity maladaptive coping might increase the social threat and reappraisal load of a stressor relating to higher stress sensitivity of anterior temporal cortex

psychological model of panic disorder postulate that interpretation of ambiguous material a threatening is an important maintaining factor for the disorder however demonstration of whether such a bias predicts onset of panic disorder are missing in the present study we used data from the dresden prediction study in which a epidemiologic sample of young german woman wa tested at two time point approximately 17 month apart allowing the study of biased interpretation a a potential risk factor at time point one participant completed an interpretation questionnaire including two type of ambiguous scenario panic related and general threat related analysis revealed that a panic related interpretation bias predicted onset of panic disorder even after controlling for two established risk factor anxiety sensitivity and fear of bodily sensation this is the first prospective study demonstrating the incremental validity of interpretation bias a a predictor of panic disorder onset

objective functional abdominal pain ap is a prevalent issue in childhood and adolescence the contribution of psychosocial factor in the development and maintenance of this health problem is rather unclear and experimental study about underlying mechanism are lacking this study investigates whether experimentally induced social exclusion decrease sensory and pain threshold in child suffering from ap subject twenty child adolescent with ap and 22 healthy control method child adolescent participated in the cyberball paradigm which affect an experience of social exclusion thermal sensory and pain threshold were measured before and after cyberball result child adolescent with ap showed a divergent reaction regarding their sensory threshold after social exclusion the control group exhibited a tendency toward a decreased sensory threshold whereas the ap group remained stable concerning the pain threshold no effect of social exclusion could be identified the increase of both threshold numbing after cyberball wa positively correlated with symptom of mental health issue conclusion this is the first study to investigate change in sensory and pain threshold following painful social interaction in a sample of child adolescent with a chronic pain condition result suggest that ap and control child differ in their reaction of sensory threshold which might indicate an altered processing of social exclusion replication and further methodological improvement are needed

posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd is characterised by dysfunctional appraisal of the trauma and it consequence including one s own symptom experimental study have shown that cognitive bias modification appraisal cbm app training can reduce dysfunctional interpretation and analog trauma symptom one important question is how to enhance the effect of cbm app following work suggesting that sleep ha beneficial effect on consolidation process and can thus improve learning the present study investigated whether a brief period of sleep i e a nap enhances the effect of cbm app all participant watched a stressful movie a an analogue trauma induction after that participant received either positive or negative cbm app training within each training half of the participant then had a 90 minute nap or watched a neutral movie result showed that the cbm training induced training congruent appraisal sleep did not enhance this effect participant who slept however experienced fewer intrusive memory of the analogue trauma but this effect wa independent of the cbm condition these result provide valuable information about the effect of sleep during a 90 minute nap period on encoding of analogue trauma and emotional learning in the context of appraisal and highlight the importance of sleep a a focus for continued research

the patient reported outcome measurement information system promis r initiative ha developed and evaluated a set of publicly available efficient and flexible measure of patient reported outcome in different health domain including mental health the objective of this study wa to translate the promis depression item bank into german and evaluate the psychometric property of the translated item item were translated using forward and backward translation and cognitive interview distribution characteristic unidimensionality rasch model fit reliability construct validity and internal responsiveness were investigated in a sample of 234 patient in in patient psychosomatic rehabilitation center in germany the translated item showed good psychometric property the distribution characteristic were satisfactory and the sufficient unidimensionality wa obtained by fitting a bifactor model the construct validity wa demonstrated and it wa reliable and wa shown to detect clinically significant change the translated item can be recommended for the assessment of depression future study should examine the generalizability of the result

although ptsd is associated with both emotion regulation er difficulty and persistent difficulty experiencing positive emotion research concerning positive er in ptsd is still scarce we aimed to clarify whether ptsd patient show dysfunctional response to positive emotion and whether positive er is associated with ptsd symptom severity ptsd patient n 59 were compared to healthy control hc n 58 with respect to their self reported regulation of positive and negative emotion we used the response to positive affect questionnaire to ass positive er and the difficulty in emotion regulation scale and response style questionnaire to ass negative er ptsd patient showed deficient negative a well a deficient positive er a compared to hc both dampening of positive emotion a well a positive rumination were associated with self reported symptom severity furthermore dampening contributed to the prediction of ptsd symptom severity beyond depressive symptom and negative rumination this study support and expands previous finding of dysfunctional positive er in ptsd further research is needed to clarify whether deficit in positive er contribute to the onset and maintenance of ptsd if so therapeutic approach should aim to help ptsd patient build up adequate skill to handle positive emotion in ptsd

resistant avoidance behavior play a crucial role in the maintenance of anxiety disorder and are therefore central target of therapeutic intervention in the present study the development of avoidance behavior wa investigated in 24 healthy participant who repeatedly prematurely terminated the exposure to increasing interoceptive threat i e the feeling of dyspnea induced by increasing inspiratory resistive load that were followed by the ultimate threat a short breathing occlusion physiological response and subjective anxiety preceding termination were compared to matched interval of a matched control group n 24 who completed the exposure initially participant terminated during the ultimate threat i e during occlusion this first termination wa preceded by a strong surge in autonomic arousal and reported anxiety startle reflex and the p3 component of event related brain potential to startle probe were strongly inhibited indicating preparation for defensive action with repetitive termination individual successively terminated earlier avoiding exposure to the occlusion this avoidant behavior wa accompanied by alleviated autonomic arousal a compared to the first termination in addition no indication of physiological response preparation wa found implying that the avoidance behavior wa performed in a rather habitual way matched control did not show any indication of a defensive response surge in the matched interval in matched control no change in physiological response pattern were detected while anxiety level increased with repetition the present result shed new light on our understanding of the motivational basis of avoidance behavior and may help to refine etiological model behavioral analysis and therapeutic strategy in treating anxiety disorder

adolescent with nonsuicidal self injury nssi have been described a having considerable impairment in social interaction and social difficulty are often a trigger for nssi however little is known about how adolescent with nssi disorder process facial expression of emotion we investigated the recognition of facial expression of emotion in 47 adolescent with nssi disorder 28 clinical control without nssi and 51 nonclinical control following a neutral or a sad mood induction participant were presented with a dynamic facial expression that slowly changed from neutral to full intensity happiness sadness anger disgust fear or neutral closed open mouth recognition of facial expression wa measured by the intensity of the expression at which participant could accurately identify the facial expression no group difference in the recognition of facial expression were found all group required comparable stage of emotional expressivity to correctly recognize emotion and there were no significant difference in accuracy result indicate no mood effect on recognition or accuracy valence and arousal rating of stimulus indicated that compared to the nonclinical control group but not to clinical control the adolescent with nssi disorder rated the stimulus a significantly more unpleasant and arousing

objective patient with somatic symptom disorder ssd often receive targeted intervention only after a long duration of illness moreover the reported effect size of intervention for ssd are small therefore improvement and evaluation of intervention are needed preliminary evidence suggests autonomic imbalance for example lower heart rate variability hrv in ssd hrv biofeedback hrv bf a a method for self regulation show initial positive effect in chronic pain and functional syndrome the aim of this study wa to evaluate the efficacy of a brief hrv bf intervention for ssd method of a total of 50 participant with ssd diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder fifth edition who were recruited and randomly assigned to four session of hrv bf n 25 or autogenic training at n 25 49 participant were analyzed female 77 6 mean standard deviation age 45 3 14 4 year the primary outcome were somatic symptom severity screening for somatoform disorder numeric rating scale and hrv secondary outcome were psychological characteristic of ssd e g the somatic symptom disorder 12 scale health concern emotion regulation the data were collected before and after intervention and were analyzed with repeated measure analysis of variance and post hoc t test result symptom severity improved after both hrv bf and at standard deviation of the nn interval and psychological symptom improved significantly more strongly in the hrv bf than in the at group e g standard deviation of the nn interval etap2 interaction 0 10 p 047 conclusion the improvement in somatic symptom but specifically in cognitive affective symptom and autonomic regulation suggest that hrv bf with only four session is a potentially useful intervention option for ssd thus adding this short hrv bf intervention to existing psychological treatment for ssd may be promising trial registration german clinical trial register identifier drks00017099 http www drks de

recent model on the development and maintenance of eating disorder propose negative emotion to be important precursor for the occurrence of eating disorder symptomatology in fact previous research on bulimia nervosa bn and binge eating disorder provides evidence that negative emotion are an antecedent condition for binge eating however there is a lack of research examining the influence of negative emotion on restrictive eating and exercising in individual with anorexia nervosa an in an experimental study woman with an n 39 and bn n 34 a well a a non eating disordered control group cg n 34 watched a sadness inducing film clip before and after the film clip participant rated their current desire to engage in dietary restriction dtr and desire to exercise dte main result reveal that dtr significantly increased after the film clip in woman with an only while dte decreased over time in all group result are in line with the notion that negative emotion have a prominent influence on the core eating pathology in an

the core feature of separation anxiety is excessive distress when faced with actual or perceived separation from people to whom the individual ha a strong emotional attachment so far little is known about the neurobiological underpinnings of separation anxiety therefore we investigated functional amygdala responsiveness and functional connectivity during threat related emotion processing and structural grey matter volume imaging marker associated with separation anxiety a measured with the relationship scale questionnaire in a large sample of healthy adult from the munster neuroimaging cohort n 320 we used a robust emotional face matching task and acquired high resolution structural image for morphometric analysis using voxel based morphometry the main result were positive association of separation anxiety score with amygdala reactivity to emotional face a well a increased amygdala grey matter volume a functional connectivity analysis revealed positive association between separation anxiety and functional coupling of the amygdala with area involved in visual process and attention including several occipital and somatosensory area taken together the result suggest a higher emotional involvement in subject with separation anxiety while watching negative facial expression and potentially secondary neuro structural adaptive process these result could help to understand and treat adult separation anxiety

adaptive behavior critically depends on performance monitoring pm the ability to monitor action outcome and the need to adapt behavior pm related brain activity ha been linked to guiding decision about whether action adaptation is warranted the present study examined whether pm related brain activity in a flanker task a measured by electroencephalography eeg wa associated with adaptive behavior in daily life specifically we were interested in the employment of self control operationalized a self control failure scfs and measured using ecological momentary assessment analysis were conducted using an adaptive elastic net regression to predict scfs from eeg in a sample of 131 participant the model wa fit using within subject averaged response locked eeg activity at each electrode and time point within an epoch surrounding the response we found that higher amplitude of the error related negativity ern were related to fewer scfs this suggests that lower error related activity may relate to lower recruitment of interventive self control in daily life altered cognitive control process like pm have been proposed a underlying mechanism for various mental disorder understanding how alteration in pm relate to regulatory control might therefore aid in delineating how these alteration contribute to different psychopathology
