background increased neural error signal have been observed in obsessive compulsive disorder ocd anxiety disorder and inconsistently in depression reduced neural error signal have been observed in substance use disorder sud thus alteration in error monitoring are proposed a a transdiagnostic endophenotype to strengthen this notion data from unaffected individual with a family history for the respective disorder are needed method the error related negativity ern a a neural indicator of error monitoring wa measured during a flanker task from 117 ocd patient 50 unaffected first degree relative of ocd patient and 130 healthy comparison participant family history information indicated that 76 healthy control were free of a family history for psychopathology whereas the remaining had first degree relative with depression n 28 anxiety n 27 and or sud n 27 result increased ern amplitude were found in ocd patient and unaffected first degree relative of ocd patient in addition unaffected first degree relative of individual with anxiety disorder were also characterized by increased ern amplitude whereas relative of individual with sud showed reduced amplitude conclusion alteration in neural error signal in unaffected first degree relative with a family history of ocd anxiety or sud support the utility of the ern a a transdiagnostic endophenotype reduced neural error signal may indicate vulnerability for under controlled behavior and risk for substance use whereas a harm or error avoidant response style and vulnerability for ocd and anxiety appears to be associated with increased ern this add to finding suggesting a common neurobiological substrate across psychiatric disorder involving the anterior cingulate cortex and deficit in cognitive control

the purpose of the study wa to contrast first panic attack pa of patient with panic disorder pd with v without agoraphobia and to explore difference between first pa leading to the development of pd and those that remain isolated data were drawn from a community survey n 2259 including 88 isolated pa and 75 pd case an additional sample of 234 pd patient wa recruited in a clinical setting a standardized interview assessed the symptom of the first pa context of it occurrence and subsequent coping attempt person who developed pd reported more severe first pa more medical service utilization and exposure limiting coping attempt than those with isolated pa the context of the first pa did not differ between pd and isolated pa pd with agoraphobia wa specifically associated with greater symptom severity and occurrence of first attack in public future research should validate these finding using a longitudinal approach

background and aim individual with high level of negative mental health often tend to use the social platform facebook to escape from daily stress they are at risk to develop an emotional bond to facebook linked to a need to stay permanently online the current work investigated addictive use of facebook and it conceptual framework in clinical context method in a longitudinal study design duration of daily use of facebook addictive facebook use depressiveness insomnia and positive mental health pmh were assessed in a sample of 349 inpatient m age sd age 50 13 9 41 of a psychosomatic rehabilitation clinic in germany over a period of on average 6 week result regression analysis revealed that duration of daily facebook use at the first measurement time point t1 served a significant positive predictor of addictive facebook use at the second measurement time point t2 addictive facebook use t1 significantly positively predicted depressiveness and insomnia t2 it prediction of pmh t2 wa significantly negative mediation analysis showed that pmh t1 partially mediated the association between addictive facebook use t1 and depressiveness t2 and fully mediated the relationship between addictive facebook use t1 and insomnia t2 discussion and conclusion current longitudinal result indicate that addictive facebook use might negatively impact the recovery process of inpatient thus it might be relevant to ass and consider addictive facebook use in the clinical context therapeutic intervention are suggested to focus on the enhancement of inpatient pmh level which may buffer the negative effect of problematic facebook use

background difficulty in the ability to adapt belief in the face of new information are associated with psychosis and it central symptom paranoia a cognitive process and psychotic symptom are both known to be sensitive to stress the present study investigated the exact association between stress adapting of belief reversal learning rl bias against disconfirmatory evidence bade and jumping to conclusion jtc and paranoia we hypothesized that paranoia would increase under stress and that difficulty in adapting of belief would mediate or moderate the link between stress and paranoia furthermore we hypothesized that the investigated effect would be strongest in the group of individual diagnosed with a psychotic disorder method we exposed 155 participant 38 diagnosed with a psychotic disorder 40 individual with attenuated psychotic symptom 39 clinical control diagnosed with an obsessive compulsive disorder and 38 healthy control to a control condition and a stress condition in which we assessed their level of paranoia and their ability to adapt belief we applied multilevel model to analyze the data result paranoia wa higher in the stress condition than in the control condition b 1 142 s e 0 338 t 150 3 381 p 0 001 rl bade and jtc did not differ between condition and did not mediate or moderate the association between stress and paranoia all p 0 05 conclusion the result support the assumption that stress trigger paranoia however the link between stress and paranoia doe not seem to be affected by the ability to adapt belief

background the assessment of therapeutic adherence and competence is essential to understand mechanism that contribute to treatment outcome nevertheless their assessment is often neglected in psychotherapy research aim objective to develop an adherence and a treatment specific competence rating scale for dialectical behaviour therapy for posttraumatic stress disorder dbt ptsd and to examine their psychometric property global cognitive behavioural therapeutic competence and disorder specific therapeutic competence were assessed using already existing scale to confirm their psychometric property in our sample of patient with ptsd and emotion regulation difficulty method two rating scale were developed using an inductive procedure 155 videotaped therapy session from a multicenter randomised controlled trial were rated by trained raters using these scale 40 randomly chosen videotape involving eleven therapist and fourteen patient were doubly rated by two raters result both the adherence scale patient level icc 98 alpha s 65 alpha p 75 and the treatment specific competence scale patient level icc 98 alpha s 78 alpha p 82 for dbt ptsd showed excellent interrater and good reliability on the patient level content validity including relevance and appropriateness of all item wa confirmed by expert in dbt ptsd for the new treatment specific competence scale conclusion our result indicate that both scale are reliable instrument they will be useful to examine possible effect of adherence and treatment specific competence on dbt ptsd treatment outcome

men have been frequently found to perform more accurately than woman in mental rotation task however men and woman also differ with regard to the habitual use of emotion regulation strategy particularly with regard to expressive suppression i e the suppression of emotional expression in behavior a emotional suppression is more often used by men emotion regulation strategy might be a variable modulating gender difference in mental rotation performance the present study therefore examined the influence of gender and emotion regulation strategy on mental rotation performance accuracy and feedback processing twenty eight men and 28 woman matched for relevant demographic variable performed mental rotation task of varying difficulty over a prolonged time emotional feedback wa given immediately after each trial result showed that woman reported to use expressive suppression le frequently than men woman made more error in the mental rotation task than men confirming earlier demonstration of gender difference furthermore woman were more impaired by the negative feedback a indicated by the increased likelihood of subsequent error compared with men task performance of woman not habitually using expressive suppression wa most inferior and most strongly influenced by failure feedback compared with men woman using expressive suppression more habitually did not significantly differ in mental rotation accuracy and feedback processing from men hence expressive suppression reduces gender difference in mental rotation accuracy by improving cognitive performance following failure feedback

background and objective there is a large body of evidence demonstrating that alcohol abuse and misuse is characterized by alcohol related interpretation bias ibs the present study tested whether alcohol related ibs can be trained and whether this ha an effect on alcohol related association and drinking behavior a newly developed alcohol cognitive bias modification interpretation cbm i training wa employed the potential moderating effect of executive control on cbm i training effect wa tested method participant were hazardously male drinking student a classical stroop wa used to ass level of executive control half of the sample wa trained to interpret ambiguous alcohol related scenario in an alcohol related manner alcohol training group whereas the other half wa trained to interpret ambiguous alcohol related scenario in a neutral manner neutral training group a single target implicit association test stiat wa used to test whether the training would generalize to implicit alcohol related association target word alcohol attribute positive v neutral to test the training s effect on drinking behavior a bogus taste test and a one week follow up measure assessing participant s real life drinking behavior were used result the cbm i training wa partly successful when presented with novel ambiguous alcohol related scenario participant of the alcohol training group interpreted these scenario a more alcohol related after the training however there wa no reduction in alcohol related ibs in the neutral training group result of the stiat demonstrated that both training group showed stronger positive than neutral alcohol related association however there were no between group difference in alcohol related association moreover the cbm i training s effect wa not moderated by level of executive control finally no group difference were found on level of alcohol consumption bogus taste test and at one week follow up limitation the neutral training might have been operationalized sub optimally a multi session training might have resulted in stronger effect conclusion these finding are the first to show that alcohol related ibs can be trained however the training effect only partly generalized so more research is needed to advance our understanding of alcohol cbm i effect

in order to identify cause and trigger of hallucination that can inform therapy reliable valid and change sensitive instrument to ass hallucinatory experience in the subclinical and clinical range are needed we developed and validated a novel scale the continuum of auditory hallucination state assessment cahsa to be used for repeated assessment of the subclinical factor vivid imagination intrusive thought and perceptual sensitivity a well a auditory hallucination after selecting item for the four factor in a first test sample n 84 we tested factorial validity using cfa and criterion validity with self reported psychosis like experience n 534 finally within subject variation of cahsa score over 14 day and time lagged association between it factor were explored n 85 a 9 item cahsa wa selected that showed good factorial validity criterion validity and substantial valid within subject variation time lagged regression showed that vivid imagination perceptual sensitivity and intrusive thought precede auditory hallucination in sum the cahsa validly measure fluctuation along the continuum of auditory hallucination is sensitive to change and well suited for experimental study repeated measurement and longitudinal research

background suicide ideation is common in young woman the present study investigated factor associated with the remission of suicidal thought in a representative sample of woman aged 18 24 year method a total of 1389 woman were interviewed at a baseline assessment and again 17 month later social support satisfaction with life self efficacy and positive mental health were considered a predictor of remission of suicidal thought controlling for severity of psychopathology result remission of suicidal thought wa experienced by 67 4 of the respondent whereas 32 6 continued to have suicide ideation at both assessment in multiple logistic regression analysis social support and positive mental health emerged a significant predictor of remission severity of psychopathology did not predict the course of suicide ideation limitation suicide ideation wa assessed only with the respective item of the beck depression inventory conclusion protective factor especially social support and positive mental health outperform psychopathology in predicting the course of suicide ideation

the expanded version of the inventory of depression and anxiety symptom ida ii is a 99 item self report measure containing 18 nonoverlapping dimensional scale assessing symptom of depression anxiety and mania the aim of this study wa to develop and validate a german adaptation of the ida ii participant from a community sample n 1 054 completed the ida ii german version in addition part of the sample n 550 completed a series of additional measure of depression patient health questionnaire 9 who five well being index symptom checklist 90 revised short version and anxiety disorder generalized anxiety disorder scale 7 fear of negative evaluation scale 5 dimensional obsessive compulsive scale the international trauma questionnaire we conducted item level confirmatory factor analysis cfa separately for the 15 nonsaturated ida ii scale which confirmed unidimensionality mcdonald s omega indicated good internal consistency omega 8 of all symptom scale except euphoria omega 751 and ordering omega 728 a cfa of the ida ii scale based on exploratory result by watson et al 2012 confirmed a three factor model of distress obsession fear and positive mood correlational analysis with additional symptom measure supported the convergent and discriminant validity of the ida ii scale the ida ii german version allows for a reliable assessment of the severity of depression anxiety and bipolar symptom and is one of the first clinical measure for german speaking sample that is consistent with the hierarchical taxonomy of psychopathology hitop psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

aim during the covid 19 pandemic the risk for nurse mental health ha rapidly increased the two main goal of this study were the examination of 1 the psychological burden and 2 of suicidal ideation and it associated risk factor one year after the covid 19 pandemic begun design this wa a cross sectional online survey method n 1311 nurse 96 9 female aged 18 63 year m 30 96 sd 8 48 were assessed for various symptom of psychological burden suicidal ideation and behaviour and it risk factor result almost half of participant 41 5 reported heightened level of depressive symptom 691 52 7 reported a medium to high risk for burnout one fifth of participant 21 7 reported suicidal ideation in the past 4 week the direct contact to people with covid 19 wa not related to the extent of the psychological burden depression agitation perceived burdensomeness and previous suicide attempt were associated with suicidal ideation

background and aim since alcohol use disorder are among the most prevalent and destructive mental disorder it is critical to address factor contributing to their development and maintenance drinking motif are relevant driving factor for consumption identifying group of drinker with similar motivation may help to specialize intervention component and make treatment more effective and efficient we aimed to identify and describe distinct motive type of drinker in dependent male from two diverse culture uganda and germany and to explore potential difference and similarity in addiction related measure moreover we investigated specific link between motive type and childhood maltreatment traumatic experience and symptom of comorbid psychopathology method to determine distinct drinking motive type we conducted latent class analysis concerning drinking motif drinking motive scale in sample of treatment seeking alcohol dependent men n 75 subsequently we compared the identified motive type concerning their alcohol consumption and alcohol related symptom alcohol use disorder identification test history of childhood maltreatment childhood trauma questionnaire trauma exposure violence war and abduction exposure scale psychopathology posttraumatic stress diagnostic scale depression section of the hopkins symptom checklist and brief symptom inventory and deficit in emotion regulation difficulty in emotion regulation scale result we found two congruent drinking motive type in both context reward oriented drinking motif like the generation of positive feeling and enhancing performance were endorsed almost equally by both motive type whereas high relief motive endorsement characterized one group but not the other the relief motive type drank to overcome aversive feeling withdrawal and daily hassle and wa characterized by higher adversity in general emotional maltreatment in childhood and psychopathological symptom were reported to a significantly greater extent by relief drinker effect size of comparison ranging from r 0 25 to r 0 48 however the motive type did not differ significantly on alcohol consumption or alcohol related symptom and traumatic experience apart from childhood maltreatment conclusion the chronology of addiction development and pattern of drinking motivation seem to be similar across culture i e that motive targeting intervention might be applicable cross culturally addressing comorbid symptomatology should be a key treatment component for relief drinker whereas finding alternative for the creation of positive feeling and way to counteract boredom and inactivity should be a general treatment element

abstract sex difference in personality were found to be larger in more developed and more gender equal society however the study that report this effect either have methodological shortcoming or do not take into account possible underlying effect of ecological variable here a large multinational n 867 782 dataset of personality profile wa used to examine sex difference in big five facet score for 50 country gender difference were related to estimate of ecological stress a well a socio cultural variable using a regularized partial correlation approach the unique association of those correlate with sex difference were isolated sex difference were large median mahalanobis d 1 97 and varied substantially across country range 1 49 to 2 48 global sex difference are larger in more developed country with higher food availability le pathogen prevalence higher gender equality and an individualistic culture after controlling for confounds only cultural individualism historic pathogen prevalence and food availability remained sex difference in personality are uniquely correlated to ecological stress previously reported correlation between greater sex difference and socio cultural liberalism could be due to confounding by influence of ecological stress

a central innovation in the international classification of disease 11th revision icd 11 is a dimensional personality disorder model differentiating five personality trait domain the personality inventory for icd 11 picd is a frequently used measure to ass these component of the icd 11 personality disorder model conceptually the icd 11 personality trait domain correspond to trait domain from the five factor model ffm of personality however empirically it is unclear how the picd scale align with the ffm in this questionnaire study with 480 german community adult we assessed the joint factor structure of the picd trait domain scale and the ffm personality facet assessed with the big five inventory 2 bfi 2 a principal axis factor analysis revealed a joint five factorial structure the picd trait domain scale and the bfi 2 facet scale of the respectively corresponding ffm trait domain were almost perfectly aligned including a bipolar anankastia disinhibition factor along the conscientiousness dimension facet of openness to experience formed a fifth factor separate from the picd scale together these finding demonstrate structural correspondence of the picd trait domain scale and the respective bfi 2 facet scale mirroring conceptual analogy between the icd 11 and ffm personality model psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

posttraumatic stress pt indicates a continuous stress response that persists though threat to life had been experienced in the past however threat to life are frequently ongoing for these context the concept of continuous traumatic stress ct ha been put forward based on structured clinical interview with congolese refugee n 226 this study investigated the ct concept and whether it can be distinguished from pt we found that current exposure to violence correlated positively with concern about it recurrence in the ct group r 46 an ancova indicated that higher intrusion symptom severity in the pt group no symptom reduction under safe condition wa explained by higher lifetime trauma exposure η 2 125 in context of continuous trauma exposure symptom like response may be regarded a appropriate response to realistic danger in these context the possibility that symptom change are a response to real threat should be considered to avoid overestimation of ptsd prevalence

background digital technology have become a common starting point for health related information seeking web or app based symptom checker aim to provide rapid and accurate condition suggestion and triage advice but have not yet been investigated for mental disorder in routine health care setting objective this study aim to test the diagnostic performance of a widely available symptom checker in the context of formal diagnosis of mental disorder when compared with therapist diagnosis based on structured clinical interview method adult patient from an outpatient psychotherapy clinic used the app based symptom checker ada check your health ada ada health gmbh at intake accuracy wa assessed a the agreement of the first and 1 of the first 5 condition suggestion of ada with at least one of the interview based therapist diagnosis in addition sensitivity specificity and interrater reliability gwet first order agreement coefficient ac1 were calculated for the 3 most prevalent disorder category self reported usability assessed using the system usability scale and acceptance of ada assessed using an adapted feedback questionnaire were evaluated result a total of 49 patient 30 49 61 woman mean age 33 41 sd 12 79 year were included in this study across all patient the interview based diagnosis matched ada s first condition suggestion in 51 25 49 95 ci 37 5 64 4 of case and 1 of the first 5 condition suggestion in 69 34 49 95 ci 55 4 80 6 of case within the main disorder category the accuracy of ada s first condition suggestion wa 0 82 for somatoform and associated disorder 0 65 for affective disorder and 0 53 for anxiety disorder interrater reliability ranged from low ac1 0 15 for anxiety disorder to good ac1 0 76 for somatoform and associated disorder the usability of ada wa rated a high in the system usability scale mean 81 51 sd 11 82 score range 0 100 approximately 71 35 49 of participant would have preferred a face to face over an app based diagnostic conclusion overall our finding suggest that a widely available symptom checker used in the formal diagnosis of mental disorder could provide clinician with a list of condition suggestion with moderate to good accuracy however diagnostic performance wa heterogeneous between disorder category and included low interrater reliability although symptom checker have some potential to complement the diagnostic process a a screening tool the diagnostic performance should be tested in larger sample and in comparison with further diagnostic instrument

engaging in service learning ha been linked to multiple positive outcome in student such a an increase in self efficacy effect have been found on both general and domain specific self efficacy research on service learning ha indicated that feedback and gender had an impact on the increase in self efficacy though finding are mixed the present study aimed to determine how service learning experience at a university can be optimally designed to boost college student self efficacy while examining the effect of feedback and gender on general and teaching self efficacy over 2 year 267 bachelor s student in psychology mage 23 08 year sd 3 61 80 5 female conducted modularized prevention program in the context of mental health at primary and secondary school student rated their general and teaching self efficacy before t1 during t2 and after t3 conducting the program the result indicate a positive effect of engaging in service learning on student general d 0 30 and teaching d 0 68 self efficacy from t1 to t3 with significant increase only in female student and after receiving feedback engaging in service learning reduced gender specific difference in self efficacy feedback increased general and teaching self efficacy female student seemed to benefit more than male student

impaired social cognition ha been associated with interpersonal problem and with the development of and relapse into alcohol abuse in the present study self reported trait empathy decoding of complex mental state and cognitive and affective mental state reasoning were assessed in alcohol dependent participant and the association with executive function and psychopathological characteristic wa investigated twenty recently detoxified alcohol dependent patient and 20 matched healthy control were assessed with an abbreviated german version of the interpersonal reactivity index the revised reading the mind in the eye test the faux pa story test the trail making test and the letter number sequencing test patient were impaired relative to control with regard to mental state decoding on the eye test and showed reduced faux pa detection and impaired mental state reasoning reflected by lower faux pa understanding and faux pa empathy score there were no group difference regarding self reported trait empathy performance on the sociocognitive measure wa related to executive functioning and the severity of depressive symptom although self report measure might not always reliably detect impairment of social cognition behavioural measure suggest pronounced impairment of mental state decoding and mental state reasoning in association with alcohol dependence finding ought to be incorporated into current treatment strategy

the psychosocial environment is pivotal for the adjustment to traumatic experience yet the role of social cognition in the development of post traumatic stress disorder ptsd remains obscure we theorize that comparison with other trauma survivor reporting high or low level of stress related symptomatology might attenuate or amplify the development of ptsd depending on perceived similarity with the standard 90 healthy participant viewed traumatic footage and read ostensible testimonial from a fellow participant from a similar background reporting high level of ptsd symptom i e a similar vulnerable social comparator low distress similar resilient or by a demographically dissimilar person reporting low distress different resilient a separate no comparison group n 30 served to gauge the presence of assimilative responding relative to similar vulnerable comparison a similar resilient comparator tended to attenuate acute negative affect but this did not translate to a similar effect on seven day intrusive memory here the similar vulnerable group tended to report fewer intrusive memory compared to control indicating a contrastive response taken together we provide preliminary evidence that social comparison modulates the adjustment to adversity whereby acute affect and intrusion development may be influenced differentially

study of human fear learning suggest that a reliable discrimination between safe and threatening stimulus is important for survival and mental health in the current study we applied the subsequent memory paradigm in order to identify neurophysiological correlate of successful threat and safety learning we recorded event related potential while participant incidentally learned association between multiple neutral face and an aversive outcome unconditioned stimulus u conditioned stimulus c or no outcome nous c we found that an enhanced late positive potential lpp to both c and c during learning predicted subsequent memory a quadratic relationship between lpp and confidence in memory indicates a possible role in both correct and false fear memory importantly the p300 to the omission of the u following c wa enhanced for remembered c while there wa a positive correlation between p300 amplitude to both u occurrence and omission and individual memory performance a following re exposure phase indicated that memory wa indeed related to subjective fear of the c c these result highlight the importance of cognitive resource allocation to both threat and safety for the acquisition of fear and suggest a potential role of the p300 to u omission a an electrophysiological marker of successful safety learning

maladaptive response to negative affective stimulus are pervasive including clinically ill and healthy people and men and woman respond differently at neural and hormonal level inspired by the research domain criterion initiative we used a transdiagnostic approach to investigate the impact of sex and dysphoric mood on neural hormonal response to negative affective stimulus participant included 99 individual with major depressive disorder psychosis and healthy control functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri wa complemented with real time acquisition of hypothalamo pituitary adrenal hpa and gonadal hpg hormone fmri data were analyzed in spm8 and task related connectivity wa assessed using generalized psychophysiological interaction across all participant elevated cortisol response predicted lower brain activity in orbitofrontal cortex and hypothalamus amygdala connectivity in those with worse dysphoric mood elevated cortisol response predicted lower activity in hypothalamus and hippocampus in woman elevated cortisol response wa associated with lower activity in medial prefrontal cortex and low hypothalamo hippocampal connectivity in woman with high dysphoric mood elevated cortisol response wa associated with low hypothalamo hippocampal connectivity there were no interaction with diagnosis or medication there wa limited power to correct for multiple comparison across total number of roi and connectivity target cortisol response were relatively low we conclude that the pathophysiology in neural hormonal response to negative affective stimulus is shared across healthy and clinical population and varies a a function of sex and dysphoric mood our finding may contribute to the development of hormonal adjunctive therapeutic that are sex dependent underscoring the importance of one s sex to precision medicine

are spider evolutionarily relevant threat cue that capture attention automatically and preattentively also in non fearful person previous study concerning this question did not examine response to unexpected spider stimulus although this is an ecologically valid situation therefore we conducted an inattentional blindness ib experiment while unselected participant n 120 were focusing their attention on a visual discrimination task suddenly a spider or a flower image appeared the rate of reported detection were not enhanced for spider image and fear of spider had no moderating influence on ib rate however spider picture in general elicited greater skin conductance response than flower picture and this difference wa also observed for picture that were not reported afterward moreover eye movement data revealed that the spider stimulus wa initially fixated more often than the flower stimulus in sum our finding imply that enhanced reaction to unexpected spider image are independent of fear level and include early engagement process awareness of a spider picture doe not seem to be a prerequisite for elevated arousal

background removal of the olfactory bulb ob lead to depression like behavior in rodent a link between depression and olfactory function is also established in human we hypothesized that the human ob volume relates to depressive state and tested whether such a potential coherence is moderated by structural alteration in other brain region method eighty three participant 32 patient with major depression and 51 matched healthy control underwent structural mr scanning individual ob volume were compared between patient and control and the impact of depression and comorbidity wa analyzed with multiple regression analysis whole brain voxel based morphometry revealed structure co varying with both depressive state and ob volume result the ob volume of patient wa significantly reduced and this reduction averaged out at 17 compared to the control the ob volume wa correlated to the volume of the insula superior temporal cortex and amygdala the independent variable of depression beta 37 age beta 25 and gender beta 40 explained the individual ob volume variation r 2 37 the correlation between ob volume and depression wa moderated by volumetric reduction in a cluster including the insula and superior temporal gyrus stg conclusion the ob volume relates to depression in human and to the volume of structure which are critical for salience detection we assume that a reduced ob volume cause diminished neural olfactory input which facilitates volume reduction in the insula and stg the ob volume may hence constitute a factor of vulnerability to depression olfactory based deep brain stimulation is discussed a a future therapeutic approach

background and aim internet gaming disorder igd is associated with impaired inhibitory control and more impulsive decision making however it remains unclear whether these association are cross sectional or predictive we aimed to test the hypothesis that lower inhibitory control and more impulsive decision making correlate with are predicted by and predict more time spent on gaming and higher igd severity method a stratified convenience sample of 70 male participant 18 21 year wa recruited to achieve broad data variability for hour spent on gaming and igd severity in three annual assessment t1 t2 t3 we measured gaming behaviour and igd severity using the video game dependency scale csas ii both gaming related measure were correlate t1 predictor t2 or outcome t3 of inhibitory control and decision making which were assessed at t2 using a go no go task and an intertemporal choice task respectively result higher igd severity at t1 predicted more impulsive decision making at t2 beta 0 45 95 ci 0 14 0 76 lower inhibitory control at t2 predicted more hour spent on gaming at t3 beta 0 13 95 ci 0 25 to 0 02 we found weak or no evidence for the other association discussion and conclusion lower inhibitory control predicts more time spent gaming possibly due to insufficient top down regulation of the behaviour impulsive decision making is rather a consequence of igd than a predictor which may be due to altered reward learning one dimensional etiological assumption about the relationship between neurocognitive impairment and igd seem not to be appropriate for the complexity of the disorder

the human olfactory bulb ob is the first relay station of the olfactory pathway and may have the potential for postnatal neurogenesis in early childhood in animal chronic stress affect the ob and olfactory functioning for human it ha been shown that major depressive disorder is accompanied by reduced ob volume and reduced olfactory function however it is not clear if major stress in childhood development also affect olfactory functioning and ob volume in human ob volume wa measured and olfactory function wa tested in 17 depressive patient with and 10 without a history of severe childhood maltreatment cm cm patient exhibited a significantly reduced olfactory threshold and identification ability the ob volume of the cm patient wa significantly reduced to 80 of the non cm patient in conclusion postnatal neurogenesis might be by reduced in cm which may affect olfactory function of the brain in later life alternatively a reduced ob volume may enhance psychological vulnerability in the presence of adverse childhood condition although other area not analyzed in this study may also be involved

several theory of hypnosis assume that response to hypnotic suggestion are implemented through top down modulation via a frontoparietal network that is involved in monitoring and cognitive control the current study addressed this issue re analyzing previously published event related potential erp n1 p2 and p3b amplitude and combined it with source reconstruction and connectivity analysis method erp data were obtained from participant engaged in a visual oddball paradigm composed of target standard and distractor stimulus during a hypnosis hyp and a control con condition in both condition participant were asked to count the rare target presented on a video screen during hyp participant received suggestion that a wooden board in front of their eye would obstruct their view of the screen the result showed that participant counting accuracy wa significantly impaired during hyp compared to con erp component in the n1 and p2 window revealed no amplitude difference between con and hyp at sensor level in contrast p3b amplitude in response to target stimulus were significantly reduced during hyp compared to con source analysis of the p3b amplitude in response to target indicated that hyp wa associated with reduced source activity in occipital and parietal brain area related to stimulus categorization and attention we further explored how these brain source interacted by computing time frequency effective connectivity between electrode that best represented frontal parietal and occipital source this analysis revealed reduced directed information flow from parietal attentional to frontal executive source during processing of target stimulus these result provide preliminary evidence that hypnotic suggestion of a visual blockade are associated with a disruption of the coupling within the frontoparietal network implicated in top down control

background efficient prevention of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd need to target individual with an increased risk for adverse outcome after trauma prognostic or prescriptive biological marker assessed early posttrauma may inform personalized treatment recommendation objective to test prognostic and prescriptive effect of early posttraumatic autonomic and endocrine marker on ptsd symptom development method autonomic and endocrine marker were assessed within 12 day posttrauma and before treatment initiation within a randomized placebo controlled trial investigating repeated oxytocin administration a preventive intervention for ptsd linear mixed effect model were used to test the effect of heart rate variability resting cortisol morning cortisol and cortisol awakening response car cortisol suppression by dexamethasone and resting oxytocin on ptsd symptom 1 5 3 and 6 month posttrauma in men n 54 woman using hormonal contraception n 27 and cycling woman n 19 result we found significant prognostic effect of resting oxytocin and cortisol suppression in woman using hormonal contraception higher oxytocin wa associated with higher ptsd symptom across follow up stronger cortisol suppression by dexamethasone reflecting increased glucocorticoid receptor feedback sensitivity wa associated with lower ptsd symptom across follow up in men but with higher symptom at 1 5 month in woman using hormonal contraception these effect were independent of treatment condition no further significant prognostic or prescriptive effect were detected conclusion our exploratory study indicates that resting oxytocin and glucocorticoid receptor feedback sensitivity early posttrauma are associated with subsequent ptsd symptom severity notably prognostic effect depended on sex and hormonal contraception use emphasizing the necessity to consider these factor in biomedical ptsd research

background the international classification of disease 11th revision icd 11 personality disorder model comprises among other element five maladaptive personality trait domain negative affectivity detachment dissociality disinhibition anankastia recently the personality inventory for icd 11 picd ha emerged a one of the most widely used measure of these icd 11 personality trait domain method the current study contributed to the validation of the picd validation by exploring it stability and predictive link with psychological distress over 6 month in a sample of 206 german community adult result the picd trait domain scale displayed strong differential all r 80 and absolute stability all d 09 additionally picd negative affectivity predicted depression anxiety and stress and picd detachment predicted depression over 6 month beyond baseline conclusion in sum this study demonstrated the stability of the picd trait domain score supporting their utility for capturing relatively stable trait a described in the icd 11 additionally we provided the first evidence for the predictive validity of some of the picd trait domain score

emergency medical service em personnel frequently encounter emotionally stressful or even traumatic incident in their line of duty in this study a checklist of emotionally stressful event for the german em wa introduced a mixed method approach wa used to identify mission event that were critical for the development of mental and physical stress symptom data were collected in a cross sectional sample of 102 em employee a quantitative content analysis of the participant worst experience on duty indicated traumatic mission to be a concatenation of two to five emotionally stressful event rescue mission were experienced a traumatic if i em personnel became victim of attack or threat ii certain circumstance caused them to give up their professional detachment from patient iii em personnel perceived the overall mission a exceptionally tragic in subsequent correlation analysis the corresponding checklist item showed consistent positive association with the post traumatic depressive and physical stress symptom among the study cohort within the exploratory regression the sum score of critical on duty exposure contributed incrementally to the prediction of mental and physical stress symptom when non work related trauma exposure and perceived social support were also considered finding point toward the importance of considering the cumulative burden of critical incident for the long term health of em personnel future research is needed to investigate how on duty trauma affect the social support em personnel received from their work and personal relationship

background across psychopathology trauma exposed individual suffer from difficulty in inhibiting emotion and regulating attention in trauma exposed individual without psychopathology only subtle alteration of neural activity involved in regulating emotion have been reported it remains unclear how these neural system react to demanding environment when acute non traumatic but ordinary stress serf to perturbate the system moreover association with subthreshold clinical symptom are poorly understood method the present fmri study investigated response inhibition of emotional face before and after psychosocial stress situation specifically it compared 25 woman mean age 31 5 9 7 year who had suffered severe early life trauma but who did not have a history of or current psychiatric disorder with 25 age and education matched trauma naive woman result under stress response inhibition related to fearful face wa reduced in both group compared to control trauma exposed woman showed decreased left inferior frontal gyrus ifg activation under stress when inhibiting response to fearful face while activation of the right anterior insula wa slightly increased also group differed in brain behaviour correlation whereas stress induced false alarm rate on fearful stimulus negatively correlated with stress induced ifg signal in control in trauma exposed participant they positively correlated with stress induced insula activation conclusion neural facilitation of emotion inhibition during stress appears to be altered in trauma exposed woman even without a history of or current psychopathology decreased activation of the ifg in concert with heightened bottom up salience of fear related cue may increase vulnerability to stress related disease

the peak end memory bias ha been well documented for the retrospective evaluation of pain it describes that the retrospective evaluation of pain is largely based on the discomfort experienced at the most intense point peak and at the end of the episode this is notable because it mean that longer episode with a better ending can be remembered a le aversive than shorter one this is even if the former had the same peak in painfulness and an overall longer duration of pain until now this bias ha not been studied in the domain of anxiety despite the high relevance of variable level of anxiety in the treatment of anxiety disorder therefore we set out to replicate the original study but with an induction of variable level of anxiety of 64 woman half watched a clip from a horror movie which ended at the most frightening moment the other half watched an extended version of this clip with a moderately frightening ending afterward all participant were asked to rate the global anxiety which wa elicited by the video when the film ended at the most frightening moment participant retrospectively reported more anxiety than participant who watched the extended version this is the first study to document that the peak end bias can be found in the domain of anxiety these finding require replication and extension to a treatment context to evaluate it implication for exposure therapy

physiological stress response vary a a function of adverse childhood experience however previous study concentrate on familial source of childhood adversity potential long term effect of peer victimization on physiology and affective response are le known this study examined cardiac facial muscular and experiential response to social evaluative stimulus in ninety four healthy subject with various degree of experienced peer victimization in a social conditioning task peer victimization wa associated with similarly attenuated cardiac and facial muscular response to negative and neutral stimulus while differentiated physiological response to negative and neutral stimulus were found in subject without peer victimization overall increased rating of arousal valence and disapproval for negative compared to neutral stimulus were found contrary to the physiological response peer victimization wa associated with more negative rating of negative stimulus one month after acquisition the result suggest that the physiological and experiential reactivity towards both negative and neutral social stimulus is affected by the experience of peer victimization peer victimization cause generalized autonomic dysregulation and memory recall bias during social learning impeding adequate response preparation to social stressor

objective physical activity and healthy eating seem to be protective against experiencing stress and negative affect a well a increase positive affect at the same time previous study showed that people reduce salutogenic behaviour such a physical activity and healthy eating in the face of stress and negative affect while increasing such behaviour in the context of positive affect due to daily fluctuation of these behaviour the present study examined these relationship in daily life using ecological momentary assessment ema design and method fifty one university student responded to six daily prompt during 7 day via smartphone based ema item examined stress emotional experience physical activity duration and healthy eating result higher stress and negative affect a well a lower positive affect were related to a reduction in subsequent physical activity higher physical activity level in turn were associated with le subsequent stress and negative affect a well a more positive affect no such effect for stress and affect on healthy eating or vice versa were found conclusion engaging in physical activity is related to better mood and le stress negative affect over the next several hour in daily life prevention effort therefore may benefit by focusing on promoting physical activity particularly when stress negative affect is high to break the cycle of inactivity stress and negative affect potential effect of healthy eating might be more subtle and characterized by interindividual difference or state effect statement of contribution what is already known on this subject physical activity can reduce stress a well a negative emotion and can enhance positive emotion people tend to eat le healthy food during stressful time and healthy eating can increase general health physical activity and healthy eating have been mostly assessed separately and through retrospective method what doe this study add this is an ema study investigating bidirectional effect of stress emotion and salutogenic behaviour after physical activity people felt le stressed negative and more positive feeling better and le stressed resulted in more physical activity healthy eating wa not associated with stress or emotion level and vice versa

background selective mutism sm ha been conceptualized a an extreme variant of social anxiety disorder sad in which the failure to speak function a an avoidance mechanism leading to a reduction of intense fear arousal however psychophysiological study in child with sm are scarce and physiological mechanism underlying the failure to speak are largely unknown in contrast child with sad are characterized by a combination of a chronically elevated physiological arousal and a blunted physiological fear response to social stress due to the large overlap between sm and sad similar mechanism might apply to both disorder while difference might explain why child with sm fail to speak the aim of our study is to investigate psychophysiological mechanism of the failure to speak in child with sm method we assessed in a total of n 96 child 8 12 year sm n 31 sad n 32 typical development td n 33 resting baseline arousal in absence of social threat and the course of physiological fear response in two social stress paradigm differing in term of whether the child are expected to speak verbal task or not nonverbal task result child with sm were characterized by increased tonic arousal compared to the other two group and by a more inflexible stress response in the nonverbal but not in the verbal task compared to td child further analysis revealed that child with sm who did not speak during the verbal task already demonstrated reduced arousal in anticipation of the verbal task conclusion the increased tonic arousal generalized to non social situation in sm could indicate a long term alteration of the autonomic nervous system furthermore the differential physiological stress response may indicate that silence act a a maladaptive compensatory mechanism reducing stress in verbal social situation which doe not function in nonverbal situation our finding support the idea that the failure to speak might function a an avoidance mechanism which is already active in anticipation of a verbal situation treatment of sm should take into account that child with sm may suffer from chronically elevated stress level and that different mechanism might operate in verbal and nonverbal social situation

background and objective disturbed body perception is a common characteristic of patient with posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd after childhood sexual abuse csa we examined the extent to which biased information processing of body related stimulus wa related to csa method patient with ptsd after csa ptsd group n 61 were compared to healthy control hc group n 30 the ptsd group wa subdivided into patient with comorbid borderline personality disorder bpd ptsd group and patient without bpd ptsd group we used an emotional stroop task est with body related word to ass biased information processing result only patient in the ptsd group but not in the ptsd group showed a significantly stronger attentional bias to body related word compared to the hc group p 009 limitation recruitment in in patient setting might have led to a non representative sample of ptsd patient the ptsd patient were not characterized regarding anything other than the mentioned mental disorder potentially the body related word may have been associated with offender body area but not with the patient conclusion we found that patient with ptsd and comorbid bpd had a stronger attentional bias towards body related stimulus in comparison to other group this suggests that the observed attentional bias is a product of csa combined with the emotion regulation difficulty characteristic of bpd future study should test whether directly targeting body related abnormality in information processing can improve existing treatment for patient with csa and bpd

return to work self efficacy rtw se is an important predictor of the duration until employee return to work after a sickness related absence the aim of the present validation study wa to investigate the psychometric property of the german rtw se scale data were obtained from three independent sample of employee who were in outpatient care due to mental disorder or musculoskeletal disease n 1 301 n 2 103 n 3 104 confirmatory factor analysis showed an inadequate fit for a one factor solution and an acceptable fit for a two factor model that distinguished by item wording direction to test whether the two factor represent substantively different dimension of the construct or rather a statistical item wording effect two subscales were formed based on item wording direction a the subscales were not differentially associated with external measure the one factor solution may be considered appropriate the scale showed good to excellent internal consistency value over time and across sample had low retest reliability index and indicated construct validity based on moderate to high association with cognitive and disease related variable the result further demonstrated the scale s sensitivity to change the rtw se baseline score predicted physical performance and pain related psychological impairment after orthopedic rehabilitation in multiple regression analysis rtw se remained a significant predictor of pain related psychological impairment but not physical performance partially demonstrating the predictive validity of the scale the german version of the rtw se scale demonstrated satisfactory result regarding it validity and reliability

several line of research have examined whether people with depressive symptom have deficit in social cognitive ability such a emotional reasoning skill while many depressed people report having such deficit it is le clear whether depressive symptom are related to actual objective performance deficit we examined the relationship between emotional reasoning skill a assessed with the temint and depressive symptom i e bdi ii in a mini meta analysis of 11 study with data from 1503 participant with varying level of depression from healthy people to clinical sample with severely depressed people using a random effect approach we found a small but significant correlation between depressive symptom and temint performance mean r z 0 065 indicating that depressive symptom were associated with higher emotional reasoning skill these finding suggest that depression is unrelated to deficit in emotional reasoning though assessed with only one test if anything depressive symptom are associated with improved performance in the temint the current result point to a discrepancy between depressed people s self evaluation of their ability a shown in previous research and their actual performance our finding also have practical implication a they suggest that clinician may focus on modifying depressed people s negative view of themselves rather than on improving their skill objective to examine the association of depression and emotional reasoning skill depression wa not related to deficit in emotional reasoning skill n 1503 conclusion people with depression may systematically underestimate their ability clinician may focus on improving depressed people s self view rather than skill

dispositional optimism ha been related to positive physical and mental health outcome increased positive mood rating and cognition about the future in order to determine the causal relation between optimism and mood and cognition optimism should be manipulated experimentally the current study tested the effect of a best possible self mental imagery exercise on affect and mood rating and dysfunctional cognition following a sad mood induction in undergraduate student n 40 participant in the experimental condition wrote about their best possible self in the future for 15 min and engaged in a mental imagery task about their best possible self in the future for 5 min in order to experimentally induce optimism participant in the control condition wrote about a typical day for 15 min and engaged in mental imagery about a typical day for 5 min we assessed affect mood and dysfunctional cognition before and after the experimental manipulation participant in the experimental condition had higher positive mood rating and higher positive affect compared to participant in the control condition participant in the control condition reported decreased dysfunctional cognition whereas dysfunctional cognition in the experimental group remained unchanged future study should replicate these finding in clinical group with more profound level of negative affect and dysfunctional cognition

background in population affected by mass disaster such a armed conflict and displacement child are at risk of developing mental ill health in particular post traumatic stress disorder ptsd valid and reliable screening instrument are needed to ass the severity of ptsd symptom among child and to identify individual in need of treatment method in the context of an ongoing war in the middle east we developed the kid pin a a semi structured interview for ptsd symptom that can be administered by trained paraprofessional to achieve a culturally and contextually appropriate instrument the development wa based on open ended interview with affected child and involved both local and international expert using the kid pin and instrument for construct associated with ptsd 332 iraqi and syrian displaced child were interviewed a subset of the sample n 86 participated in validation interview based on expert applying the clinician administered ptsd scale for dsm 5 child adolescent version cap ca 5 result the kid pin demonstrated excellent internal consistency cronbach s alpha 0 94 with good convergent validity confirmatory factor analysis of the kid pin showed an acceptable fit with the dsm 5 and other common model the best fit wa reached with the hybrid model receiver operating characteristic analysis indicated that the cut off score of 28 or higher on the kid pin is the optimum cut off for a probable ptsd diagnosis conclusion the utility of the newly developed kid pin a a screening instrument for ptsd in child is supported by the measure s high internal consistency and good convergent and structural validity a well a it diagnostic accuracy

background difficulty with performance and brain activity related to attentional orienting cue p3 cognitive or response preparation cue cnv and inhibitory response control nogo p3 during task tapping executive function are familial in adhd and may represent endophenotypes the aim of this study wa to clarify the impact of dopamine receptor d4 drd4 and dopamine transporter dat1 gene polymorphism on these process in adhd and control child method behavioural and electrophysiological parameter from cued continuous performance test with low and high attentional load were assessed in boy with adhd combined type n 94 and control without family history of adhd n 31 both group were split for the presence of at least one drd4 7 repeat allele and the dat1 10 6 haplotype result child with adhd showed diminished performance and lower cue p3 cnv and nogo p3 amplitude child with drd4 7r showed similar performance problem and lower cue p3 and cnv but nogo p3 wa not reduced child with the dat1 10 6 haplotype had no difficulty with performance or cue p3 and cnv but contrary to expectation increased nogo p3 there were no genotype by adhd interaction conclusion this study detected specific effect of drd4 7r on performance and brain activity related to attentional orienting and response preparation while dat1 10 6 wa associated with elevated brain activity related to inhibitory response control which potentially compensates increased impulsivity a these genotype effect were additive to the impact of adhd the current result indicate that drd4 and dat1 polymorphism are functionally relevant risk factor for adhd and presumably other disorder sharing these endophenotypes

parenting during the covid 19 pandemic is highly challenging with parent having to meet various demand simultaneously an increase in adverse childhood experience ace ha been widely predicted but empirical evidence is still scarce this study aimed to 1 generate representative data on pandemic related stress parental stress general stress parental subjective and mental health and the occurrence of ace 2 identify risk factor for an increase in ace and 3 provide qualitative data on parent experience a representative survey wa conducted in germany in august 2020 with 1024 parent of underage child m age 41 70 50 9 female more than 50 of parent reported being stressed by social distancing and the closure of school and childcare facility parental stress increased significantly during the pandemic d 0 21 subgroup of parent also reported very high level of depressive symptom 12 3 and anxiety 9 7 up to one third of the sample reported ace in the child s lifetime in this group 29 1 reported an increase in child witnessing domestic violence during the pandemic and 42 2 an increase verbal emotional abuse these family were characterized by higher parental stress job loss and younger parent and child age positive aspect of the pandemic related primarily to personal or family life e g slower pace of life increase in family time while some parent coped well a particularly negative pattern wa observed in a subgroup of family that experienced an increase in ace parental stress emerged a important target point for intervention addressing the negative sequela of the pandemic

mindfulness based intervention are effective at improving symptom of sexual dysfunction in woman the mechanism by which mindfulness improves sexual function are le clear the main objective of our study wa to investigate the impact of a mindfulness task on sexual response in woman forty one woman mean age 27 2 sd 5 6 participated in two laboratory session that each included two erotic film and one attention task that were presented in counterbalanced order both attention task consisted of a six minute audio recording of either a modified body scan focusing on genital arousal sensation mindfulness condition or a visualization exercise subjective and genital sexual arousal were measured continuously during stimulus presentation the mindfulness task led to greater subjective and lower genital arousal the agreement of subjective and genital sexual arousal i e concordance wa greater in the mindfulness condition trait mindfulness wa related to lower sexual arousal but also greater sexual concordance in woman mindfulness based intervention that encourage woman to focus on physical arousal sensation in the here and now may be associated with woman s improved sexual function by enhancing feeling of sexual arousal during sexual activity and by increasing concordance between subjective and genital sexual arousal

depression is highly prevalent among university student internet based intervention have been found to be effective in addressing depressive symptom but it is open if this also applies to intervention directed at academic stress it is also largely unclear if the technique employed in such program provide significant additional benefit when controlling for non specific intervention effect a sample of n 200 student with elevated level of depression ce d 16 of a large distance learning university were randomly assigned to either an internet and app based stress intervention group ig n 100 or an active control group cg n 100 receiving an internet based psychoeducational program of equal length self report data wa assessed at baseline post treatment 7 week and three month follow up the primary outcome wa depression ce d post treatment secondary outcome included mental health outcome modifiable risk factor and academic outcome we found significant between group effect on depressive symptom severity d 0 36 95 ci 0 08 0 64 a well a behavioral activation d 0 61 95 ci 0 30 0 91 perceived stress d 0 45 95 ci 0 18 0 73 anxiety d 0 35 95 ci 0 03 0 67 and other secondary outcome post treatment effect on depression were sustained at three month follow up response rate for depressive symptom were significantly higher in the ig 26 than the cg 14 at post test chi 2 4 5 p 0 04 but not at three month follow up p 0 454 we also found significant effect on relevant academic outcome including work impairment follow up d 0 36 work output post treatment d 0 27 and work cutback follow up d 0 36 the intervention wa more effective for depressive symptom compared to the cg and so controlling for unspecific intervention effect this suggests that specific technique of the intervention may provide significant additional benefit on depressive symptom trial registration german clinical trial registration drks drks00011800 http www drks de drks_web navigate do navigationid trial html trial_id drks00011800

appetitive conditioning is considered a central mechanism for the vulnerability to psychiatric disorder however the investigation of individual difference that are related to altered appetitive learning ha been almost neglected so far the aim of this study wa to investigate the link between neuroticism and appetitive conditioning process 79 subject participated in a differential conditioning procedure in which a conditioned stimulus c wa paired with a reward money after a fast behavioral response while a second conditioned stimulus c wa never followed by a reward irrespective of the behavioral response a a main result neuroticism correlated negatively with the underlying neural process of appetitive conditioning in female but not in male in detail higher level of neuroticism were associated with decreased neural response in the left p 001 and right amygdala p 011 left p 063 and right p 019 nucleus accumbens and left p 002 and right p 021 orbitofrontal cortex all result are family wise error corrected the present result support previous finding which also showed an inverse sex specific effect in the context of neuroticism and emotional processing in female in addition the finding suggest that neuroticism is not solely linked to increased amygdala sensitivity during the processing of negative stimulus but also to decreased neural response when processing rewarding stimulus possible explanation for the sex difference and implication are discussed

background although the borderline personality disorder severity index version iv bpdsi iv ha already been used in several study psychometric property are only known from two developing study sampling and method to examine item characteristic reliability and validity indicator a large sample including subject with borderline personality disorder n 163 a mixed psychiatric group n 58 and a healthy control group n 43 were interviewed with the german version of the structured clinical interview for dsm iv personality disorder scid ii a well a the bpdsi iv result the index for interrater reliability a well a internal consistency of the bpdsi iv were excellent to good the total score and the subscales of the bpdsi iv discriminated between diagnostic subgroup a expected it subscales were associated with the score in the scid ii and applied self rating measure conclusion in a subsequent version subscales might have to be adapted to the proposed trait of the borderline type in dsm v

abstract background boredom during learning activity ha the potential of impeding attention motivation learning and eventually achievement yet research focusing on it possible antecedent seems to have received le attention especially within the physic domain based on assumption of the control value theory of achievement emotion cvtae this study aimed at examining gender difference and structural relationship between student reported perceived teacher autonomy support ptas cognitive appraisal self efficacy and task value and learning related boredom in physic a sample of 375 56 female randomly selected 9 th grade student mean age 15 03 year sd 1 02 from five secondary school in masaka district of uganda took part in the study result data collected from student self report using standardised instrument revealed that higher level of ptas self efficacy and task value were significantly associated with lower level of boredom during physic learning female reported significantly greater task value for learning physic than the male self efficacy β 10 p lt 05 and task value β 09 p lt 01 partially mediated the relationship between ptas and boredom ptas showed significant direct negative contribution to boredom β 34 p lt 001 conclusion these finding provide support for theory and practice about the importance of promoting autonomy among student by adjusting instructional behaviour among teacher of physic teacher autonomy supportive behaviour influence formation of student belief about ability subjective value and learning related boredom in physic implication and suggestion for further research are also discussed in this paper

abstract how do person who expect perfection from others experience and behave in daily life situation to address this question we investigated the relation of other oriented perfectionism with the big five personality trait the big five personality state i e self reported short term behavior and perceived situation characteristic using experience sampling method esm on the first day of the study participant n 176 completed measure of other oriented perfectionism and the big five personality trait at random time point over the next 7 day participant completed real time situation report containing the big five personality state and the diamond situation characteristic other oriented perfectionism wa negatively related to state and trait agreeableness additionally other oriented perfectionism wa associated with the perception of daily life situation a low in duty positivity and sociality several relation of other oriented perfectionism with personality state were moderated by situation characteristic our study confirms disagreeable behavior a a core characteristic of other oriented perfectionism additionally other oriented perfectionist hold somewhat unfavorable view of their daily life situation the moderating effect of situation characteristic on the relation between other oriented perfectionism and personality state might explain why other oriented perfectionism display low and inconsistent relation with other trait level measure

severe health anxiety constitutes a disabling and costly clinical condition the multidimensional inventory of hypochondriacal trait miht represents an innovative instrument that wa developed according to cognitive behavioral cognitive perceptual interpersonal and trait model of hypochondriasis we aimed at evaluating the psychometric property of the miht in a sample of patient with the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder 4th ed diagnosis of hypochondriasis using confirmatory factor analysis cfa the postulated four factor structure of the miht wa found in a first cfa in patient with hypochondriasis n 178 and in a second cfa based on a mixed sample with other somatoform disorder n 27 panic disorder n 25 and healthy control n 31 added to the original group of patient with hypochondriasis n 178 in term of specificity patient with hypochondriasis showed larger score on all four miht subscales i e affective cognitive behavioral and perceptual compared to all other group analysis of convergent and discriminant validity revealed promising result concerning the miht affective and perceptual scale but also point to certain problematic issue concerning the miht cognitive and behavioral scale the finding suggest that the proposed structure of the miht is valid also in patient with hypochondriasis and demonstrate the specificity of the four hypochondriacal trait assessed in the miht

background the posttraumatic stress disorder checklist pcl is a valid and reliable self report measure for the assessment of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd recently the pcl wa updated according to the dsm 5 criterion for ptsd so far only a few study have examined the psychometric property of the pcl 5 and all of these are restricted to population living in industrialized country the aim of this study wa to determine the psychometric property and diagnostic utility of the pcl 5 a a screening instrument for war affected displaced kurdish and arab population the specific goal wa to determine a contextually valid cut off score for a probable diagnosis of ptsd method the pcl 5 wa translated into arabic and two kurdish dialect trained interviewer administered these translation a assisted self report to 206 adult living in camp for displaced people in iraq together with depression and war exposure instrument two week later 98 randomly chosen subject were reassessed by expert clinical psychologist in the absence of a gold standard instrument with proven validity in this context the expert interviewer applied the pcl 5 item in the form of a clinical interview and used a dsm 5 algorithm to determine a diagnosis of ptsd receiver operator characteristic roc were performed to determine a valid cutoff score result the internal consistency of the pcl 5 wa high alpha 85 and the instrument showed an adequate convergent validity using the cut off score of 23 the pcl 5 achieved the optimal balance of sensitivity and specificity area under the curve 82 p 001 sensitivity 82 specificity 70 conclusion given that the comparison of the two assessment included both a re test interval and validation by different interviewer our result indicate that the pcl 5 can be recommended a an assessment and screening instrument for kurdish and arab population

when considering developmental psychology three concept stand out 1 resilience the resistance to stress 2 coping the strategy used to reduce stress and 3 sense of belonging the connectedness towards peer although all three concept are important for a child s development the academic literature lack research on the interrelation and interplay between them this study employed network analysis to investigate the interplay between resilience coping and sense of belonging in child three hundred and seventy three child aged 10 12 51 boy 49 girl completed a pen and paper survey including the resiliency scale for child and adolescent rsca coping orientation to problem experienced brief cope and pisa sense of belonging scale result revealed resilience to be associated with both coping and sense of belonging yet weaker association emerged between coping and sense of belonging three striking node pattern of high interconnectedness were revealed that further deepen our understanding of the interplay between these concept implication for research and practice and limitation of the current study are discussed

perception and evaluation of facial expression are known to be heavily modulated by emotional feature of contextual information such contextual effect however might also be driven by non emotional aspect of contextual information an interaction of emotional and non emotional factor and by the observer inherent trait therefore we sought to ass whether contextual information about self reference in addition to information about valence influence the evaluation and neural processing of neutral face furthermore we investigated whether social anxiety moderate these effect in the present functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri study participant viewed neutral facial expression preceded by a contextual sentence conveying either positive or negative evaluation about the participant or about somebody else contextual influence were reflected in rating and fmri measure with strong effect of self reference on brain activity in the medial prefrontal cortex and right fusiform gyrus additionally social anxiety strongly affected the response to face conveying negative self related evaluation a revealed by the participant rating pattern and brain activity in cortical midline structure and region of interest in the left and right middle frontal gyrus these result suggest that face perception and processing are highly individual process influenced by emotional and non emotional aspect of contextual information and further modulated by individual personality trait
