hemispheric asymmetry play an important role in multiple cerebral function asymmetry in prefrontal cortex pfc function have been suggested to regulate emotional processing in that right hemispheric dominance bias towards negative affect whereas left pfc dominance favor positive affect this study used transcranial magnetic stimulation to test the causal role of prefrontal asymmetry in the processing of emotional stimulus to experimentally induce hemispheric asymmetry 21 healthy volunteer underwent two separate session of inhibitory continuous theta burst stimulation ctbs to the left versus right dorsolateral prefrontal cortex each stimulation wa followed by magnetoencephalographic meg recording of event related field elicited by visually presented emotional word in a silent reading task and a subsequent behavioral emotion categorization task the asymmetry manipulation influenced valence processing of word in early mid latency and late time interval in right occipitotemporal and parietal brain region left sided ctbs inducing right hemispheric dominance consistently resulted in enhanced brain response to negative word while right sided ctbs inducing left hemispheric dominance enhanced response to positive word on a behavioral level right hemispheric dominance resulted in more categorization match of negative compared to positive word while left hemispheric dominance resulted in reverse effect these result provide direct evidence that bottom up valence processing is influenced by prefrontal hemispheric asymmetry

background personal practice pp is an integral component of many psychotherapy training programme it aim to promote personal and professional growth and is often conducted in a group format g pp group cohesion is one of the most researched mechanism in group psychotherapy but ha rarely been studied in the context of g pp aim and method this exploratory study examines the association between cohesion satisfaction with g pp it impact on personal and professional development and theoretical orientation in a sample of n 329 german psychotherapy trainee cohesion wa assessed with the group questionnaire gq d positive bonding positive working negative relationship result overall participant reported high level of all outcome variable positive bonding wa the strongest predictor of satisfaction with g pp beta 0 46 p 001 while trainee in cognitive behaviour therapy reported significantly better cohesion score d 0 31 trainee in psychodynamic therapy reported significantly higher satisfaction with g pp and it impact on their development d 0 30 conclusion group cohesion appears to be an important factor in g pp that should be actively promoted by group leader however longitudinal study design are needed to better understand the emergence of cohesion in g pp a well a potential moderating factor

background and objective numerous study have investigated drinking motif and alcohol related interpretation bias ibs separately however le is known about the relationship between them therefore the present study examined whether coping and enhancement drinking motif were specifically related to negative and positive alcohol related ibs respectively furthermore it wa investigated whether such bias predict future drinking especially in individual with low level of executive control ec method participant were male and female university student the drinking motif questionnaire revised dmq r cooper 1994 wa administered to measure participant drinking motif to measure alcohol related ibs an adapted version of the encoding recognition task ert wa used during the ert participant were asked to read ambiguous alcohol related scenario in a subsequent recognition phase participant interpreted these scenario a classical stroop wa applied to ass level of ec result coping motif but not enhancement motif were a unique predictor of the tendency to interpret negatively valenced ambiguous alcohol relevant situation in an alcohol related manner this relationship wa significant even when controlling for other relevant predictor neither coping nor enhancement motif were predictive of positive alcohol related ibs concerning the prediction of prospective drinking result showed that particularly the negative alcohol related ib predicted prospective drinking however ec did not moderate the prediction of prospective drinking by either positive or negative interpretation bias limitation the alcohol ert might not be the most optimal paradigm for assessing implicit alcohol related ibs conclusion the present result emphasize the role of negative affect in the context of drinking motif and alcohol related ibs follow up study are needed to test the robustness of these finding and to further explore the general interplay between drinking motif and alcohol related ibs

background and hypothesis heightened stress level in individual with psychosis psy are associated with psychotic symptom occurrence and may be partially attributed to well established deficit in resting state heart rate variability hrv and emotion regulation in healthy participant resting state hrv and self reported emotion regulation skill have been linked to recovery after a stressor however it is unclear whether stress recovery is altered in psy thus we compared the autonomic and subjective recovery of psy to healthy control hc and investigated the predictive value of resting state hrv and emotion regulation skill study design we assessed resting state hrv and self reported emotion regulation one week prior to a combined physical and cognitive stress induction after the stress exposure we assessed the autonomic decrease in heart rate hr increase in hrv and subjective decrease in subjective stress and negative affect recovery in psy n 50 and hc n 50 over 60 min study result repeated measure anova revealed the expected interaction of time x group for subjective stress but not negative affect or autonomic stress resting state hrv predicted recovery of hr and emotion regulation skill predicted recovery of hrv but not of the other parameter conclusion although subjective stress recovery wa delayed in psy the absence of autonomic recovery deficit suggests that a prolonged stress response may not contribute to heightened stress level to the expected extent improving resting state hrv and emotion regulation may support autonomic recovery but further investigation is required to test the impact of such improvement on psychotic symptom

in the present study we examined a german sample to determine whether anxiety symptom during pregnancy had an impact on the duration and method of childbirth data of n 88 woman recruited at the heidelberg university hospital were used in the analysis prepartum anxiety symptom were assessed with the state trait anxiety inventory stai general anxiety and the pregnancy related anxiety questionnaire praq r pregnancy specific anxiety obstetric outcome wa taken from birth record and operationalized by two parameter the total duration of birth dilation and fetal expulsion and the incidence of pregnancy or birth related intervention ventouse planned and unplanned cesarean section the data show that childbirth specific anxiety assessed by the praq r is an important predictor of total birth duration in contrast general anxiety measured by the stai had no effect the incidence of birth intervention wa explained by parity anxiety however had no predictive value in addition to medical factor childbirth specific anxiety during pregnancy play an important role in the process of childbirth the finding of the present study point to the need of implementing psychological intervention to reduce childbirth specific anxiety and thereby positively influencing birth outcome

regulation of craving roc is a promising method of intervention in addiction and ha received attention in event related potential erp research investigating the late positive potential lpp however in the face of previously unaligned behavioral and lpp result the present work aimed to take a first step toward more valid electrocortical marker of roc twenty seven smoker 16 female abstinent from smoking for 3 h prior to testing viewed smoking related picture while eeg wa recorded during picture viewing participant were asked to either imagine the short term benefit now condition or long term negative consequence later condition of smoking or engage in an arithmetic task distract condition after each picture participant indicated picture related subjective craving in addition to analyzing classic erps we employed single trial multiple robust regression within subject to relate eeg activity at each time point and electrode to trial wise craving rating craving wa lower in the later and distract than the now condition lpp amplitude 300 1000 m at centro parietal electrode were lower in the distract but not the later compared to the now condition trial wise craving wa captured between 500 and 1100 m and around 2400 m at central midline and left site for distract and associated with a very brief and local signal 900 m at c3 for later this replicates the mismatch between self reported craving and lpp single trial result suggest that the correlate of roc are not entirely compatible with the focus on centro parietal slow wave i e the lpp and that different strategy of roc are characterized by distinct electrocortical marker

the visual hemifields contain processing resource that are substantially independent across a handful of task such a object tracking and extraction of visual statistic we add a new task to this category the ability to control ambiguous apparent motion participant viewed two simultaneous and identical dot quartet animation 300ms frame where each could be perceived a undergoing either vertical or horizontal motion the default percept of such dual animation is to see both quartet move in the same manner and careful mental control is needed to perceive them a moving differently each trial began with a cue for mental control see this quartet moving vertically and that quartet moving horizontally the dependent measure wa the amount of proximity based help making dot closer either vertically or horizontally that a participant needed to add using the method of adjustment before they were confident that they could robustly perceive the cued motion pattern differently across the two quartet this threshold level of needed help wa lower when the quartet straddled the hemifield boundary in the lower visual field mean aspect ratio of 1 1 2 compared to when the quartet were contained entirely within the left or right quadrant of the lower visual field mean aspect ratio of 1 1 3 p 0 05 with eccentricity controlled between condition we speculate that the separate resource that underlie this benefit for apparent motion share root with the resource that bring hemifield benefit for object tracking task more efficient deployment of multiple attentional spotlight across the hemifield boundary meeting abstract presented at v 2015

context although exposure to supraphysiological level of glucocorticoid is known to contribute to the development of the metabolic syndrome mets the importance of physiological variation in basal cortisol secretion is le clear this issue can be addressed by using hair cortisol analysis which for the first time allows the assessment of long term integrated hormone level objective and design we used the analysis of cortisol in hair hairf to examine association of long term cortisol level with prevalence of mets and individual cardiometabolic parameter in a large occupational cohort in additional exploratory analysis we also studied cardiometabolic association with hair cortisone level participant participant included 1258 employee of a large aerospace company aged 16 64 year 84 8 male who partook in a voluntary health assessment main outcome measure the first 3 cm of scalp near hair were analyzed for glucocorticoid concentration using liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry relevant cardiometabolic risk factor were assessed and mets wa diagnosed according to 2009 international task force criterion result a higher prevalence of mets wa seen in individual falling into the third odds ratio 1 71 95 confidence interval 1 08 2 69 or fourth hairf quartile odds ratio 2 42 95 confidence interval 1 55 3 75 compared with the first quartile in fully adjusted analysis hairf also showed positive association with weight related anthropometric measure body mass index waist to hip ratio waist circumference and glycated hemoglobin the exploratory analysis of hair cortisone also indicated relevant association with cardiometabolic parameter conclusion normal physiological difference in long term cortisol secretion a assessed in hair show relevant relationship with mets and individual cardiometabolic parameter

objective overactive performance monitoring a measured by the error related negativity in the event related brain potential represents one of the most robust psychophysiological alteration in obsessive compulsive disorder ocd it ha been proposed a an endophenotype for ocd because it is heritable and more prevalent in family of ocd patient consistent with this notion it is also independent of symptom profile and symptom severity in cross sectional study longitudinally it ha been shown to be state independent in pediatric patient with ocd the purpose of the present study wa to investigate the state dependency of error monitoring by examining adult ocd patient before and after symptom reduction through cognitive behavioral therapy cbt method error related and correct related negativity a electrophysiological indicator of performance monitoring were recorded from 45 ocd patient and 39 healthy comparison subject while performing a flanker task patient were assessed before starting and after completing a standard 30 session cbt including exposure and response prevention and healthy comparison subject were tested after a comparable time interval result pretreatment patient with ocd were characterized by enhanced error related and correct related negativity compared with healthy comparison subject this difference persisted after treatment when symptom were substantially reduced there wa no significant correlation between symptom improvement and change in performance monitoring and no difference in performance monitoring between treatment responder and nonresponders conclusion this is the first longitudinal study in adult ocd patient showing stability of enhanced error monitoring following successful symptom reduction through cbt it support the hypothesis that overactive performance monitoring is an endophenotype that indicates vulnerability for ocd

numerous study have identified attentional bias and processing enhancement for fear relevant stimulus in individual with specific phobia however this ha not been conclusively shown in blood injury injection bii phobia which ha rarely been investigated even though it ha feature distinct from all other specific phobia the present study aim to fill that gap and compare the time course of visuomotor processing of phobic stimulus i e picture of small injury in bii fearful n 19 and non anxious control participant n 23 by using a response priming paradigm in bii fearful participant phobic stimulus produced larger priming effect and lower response time compared to neutral stimulus whereas non anxious control participant showed no such difference because these effect are fully present in the fastest response they indicate an enhancement in early visuomotor processing of injury picture in bii fearful participant these result are comparable to the enhanced processing of phobic stimulus in other specific phobia i e spider phobia

according to the incentive motivation model sexual desire doe not occur spontaneously but can be triggered by sexual stimulus and stem from one s experience of sexual arousal until now research into responsive sexual desire ha been challenged by the lack of measure capturing desire that emerges following sexual arousal the aim of this study wa to validate the 18 item report of behavior and feeling desire rbf d scale in a sample of 291 woman m age 22 41 sd 5 82 with varying degree of sexual desire item on the rbf d were selected to reflect 5 aspect of responsive sexual desire sexual activity with a primary partner sexual desire for a primary partner sexual activity with other person sexual desire for other person and autoerotic activity a 5 factor solution wa confirmed via exploratory structural equation modeling internal consistency of 4 out of 5 factor wa good convergent validity wa established via small to medium association of the rbf d factor with other measure of sexual desire low and nonsignificant correlation with depression and sexual inhibition supported the discriminant validity the rbf d is a valid and reliable measure that can be useful in clinical and research setting where assessment of responsive sexual desire and behavior is needed

research suggests that trauma is associated with the development of psychotic experience such a paranoia via affective process however the empirical evidence on the exact mechanism is limited and it is unclear which aspect of trauma are relevant here we tested whether self reported frequency of trauma recurring trauma age and type of trauma are predictive of later threat belief in daily life and which role affective process self reported negative affect and autonomic arousal play in this association we tested two often postulated mechanism mediation with affective process in everyday life explaining the association between trauma and threat belief and moderation with trauma strengthening the association between affective process and threat belief in everyday life trauma wa assessed at baseline with the trauma history questionnaire in 67 individual with attenuated symptom of psychosis we then applied the experience sampling method during 24 h to ass negative affect heart rate and threat belief multilevel analysis showed that negative affect p 0 001 and heart rate p 0 05 were predictive of subsequent threat belief there wa no significant mediation effect from any trauma characteristic to threat belief via negative affect and heart rate trauma frequency p 0 001 age at first trauma p 0 001 a well a the presence of physical trauma p 0 001 moderated the path from negative affect to subsequent threat belief our finding indicate that more frequent trauma trauma at young age and physical trauma strengthen the association from negative affect to threat belief and could be relevant to determining the extent of vulnerability to psychosis

negative outcome expectation of psychological treatment predict unfavorable treatment outcome therefore therapist should approach negative outcome expectation and ideally transform them into more positive outcome expectation in this study we investigated the therapist s interpersonal behavior to optimize the modification of negative outcome expectation after inducing negative expectation in an online experiment we presented different video of therapist patient interaction to violate the induced negative outcome expectation we kept the expectation violating information constant and manipulated the therapist s warmth and competence result confirmed a significant influence of the therapist s warmth and competence on expectation violation which led to the most positive outcome expectation when the therapist wa both warm and competent in contrast to former correlational analysis our experimental study confirms the causal role of the therapist s interpersonal behavior and it impact on changing patient negative outcome expectation on the basis of these finding more powerful approach to optimize critical outcome expectation can be developed

study suggest that frontal alpha asymmetry is closely linked to psychological adjustment following stressful experience such that more left sided frontal activation during symptom provocation might predict lower level of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd here we tested whether frontal asymmetry at rest and during exposure to neutral positive negative and trauma related image would be associated with ptsd and particularly with characteristic reexperiencing symptom symptom were assessed in trauma victim with n 24 and without ptsd n 15 using both retrospective measure and 1 week ambulatory assessment with a diary and a smartphone while resting frontal asymmetry wa unrelated to all retrospective measure left sided activation in response to the negative picture correlated with lower level of psychopathology left sided activation in the trauma related picture condition wa more specifically associated with le emotionally intense intrusion and response to viewing the picture even when corrected for other symptom of psychopathology these effect tended to increase when participant with possible overreporting tendency were removed from the analysis moreover trauma victim without ptsd i e relatively more resilient individual displayed higher left sided frontal activation in response to the negative picture also when compared with a third group of healthy trauma free individual n 15 our finding suggest that state dependent change in frontal asymmetry could serve a a biological marker of ptsd symptom and could eventually be used for diagnostic purpose or a a target for neuromodulation intervention future study should establish whether this marker can serve a an early predictor of psychopathology in recently traumatized individual

objective the objective wa to evaluate whether conners 3 conners 3rd edition rating of adhd symptom are robust to distortion by cultural variation when applied to child with migration background living in germany method from 2010 to 2011 conners 3 data self rating parent rating and teacher rating of 243 child with turkish migration background aged 6 to 16 year were collected in various german school allocation of item to latent factor wa tested with confirmatory analysis reliability and validity of resulting factor wa calculated and influence of acculturation gender and age on rating modality wa examined result confirmatory factor analysis showed high model fit for all rating modality resulting scale had good reliability and validity there wa a small influence of acculturation on parent rating of oppositional defiant disorder but not on adhd core symptom conclusion conners 3 rating seem to be robust against influence of cultural variation their german translation can be utilized for child with turkish migration background without limitation

purpose to analyse the relation of illness anxiety dysfunctional cognition characteristic of somatic symptom disorder and orthorexic eating behaviour in a non clinical sample method n 445 participant n 363 female completed an online survey with the following questionnaire the dusseldorf orthorexia scale to measure orthorexic eating behaviour the attitude towards body and health questionnaire to ass dysfunctional cognition concerning the perception and interpretation of bodily sensation and the multidimensional inventory of hypochondriacal trait to measure illness anxiety result in the total sample orthorexic eating behaviour wa associated with the aforementioned variable to a very low extent however individual with high level of orthorexic eating behaviour n 19 displayed significantly higher level of health habit and of perception of autonomic sensation a well a higher level of hypochondriacal worry and absorption than individual with low level of orthorexic eating behaviour n 19 conclusion orthorexic eating behaviour is associated to some characteristic feature of illness anxiety and dysfunctional cognition characteristic of somatic symptom disorder future study should investigate whether illness anxiety serf a a risk factor for the development of orthorexic eating behaviour level of evidence iii case control analytic study

acquired fear response often generalize from conditioned stimulus c towards perceptually similar but harmless generalization stimulus g knowledge on similarity between c and g may be explicit or implicit employing behavioral measure and whole head magnetoencephalography we here investigated the neurocognitive mechanism underpinning implicit fear generalization twenty nine participant underwent a classical conditioning procedure in which 32 different face were either paired with an aversive scream 16 c or remained unpaired 16 c c and c face systematically differed from each other regarding their ratio of eye distance and mouth width high versus low value on this threat related feature tf implicitly predicted the presence or absence of the aversive scream in pre and post conditioning phase all c and 32 novel g face were presented 16 g face shared the tf of the 16 c face while 16 g face shared the tf of the 16 c face behavioral test confirmed that participant were fully unaware of tf u contingency c compared to c face revealed higher unpleasantness arousal and u expectancy rating a generalization of these behavioral fear response to g compared to g face wa observed by trend only source estimation of event related field showed stronger neural response to both c and g compared to c and g in anterior temporal 100 m and temporo occipital 150 m 553 587 m ventral brain region reverse effect were found in dorsal frontal area 100 m 173 203 m 257 290 m neural data also revealed selectively enhanced response to c but not g stimulus in occipital region 110 167 m 330 413 m indicating perceptual discrimination our data suggest that the prioritized perceptual analysis of threat associated conditioned face in ventral network rapidly generalizes to novel face sharing threat related feature this generalization process occurs in absence of contingency awareness and may thus contribute to implicit attentional bias the coexisting perceptual discrimination suggests that fear generalization is not a mere consequence of insufficient stimulus discrimination but rather an active integrative process

in classical conditioning an initially neutral stimulus conditioned stimulus c becomes associated with a biologically salient event unconditioned stimulus u which might be pain aversive conditioning or food appetitive conditioning after a few association the c is able to initiate either defensive or consummatory response respectively contrary to aversive conditioning appetitive conditioning is rarely investigated in human although it importance for normal and pathological behavior e g obesity addiction is undeniable the present study intent to translate animal finding on appetitive conditioning to human using food a an u thirty three participant were investigated between 8 and 10 am without breakfast in order to assure that they felt hungry during two acquisition phase one geometrical shape avcs predicted an aversive u painful electric shock another shape appcs predicted an appetitive u chocolate or salty pretzel according to the participant preference and a third shape c predicted neither u in a extinction phase these three shape plus a novel shape new were presented again without u delivery valence and arousal rating a well a startle and skin conductance scr response were collected a learning index we found successful aversive and appetitive conditioning on the one hand the avcs wa rated a more negative and more arousing than the c and induced startle potentiation and enhanced scr on the other hand the appcs wa rated more positive than the c and induced startle attenuation and larger scr in summary we successfully confirmed animal finding in hungry human by demonstrating appetitive learning and normal aversive learning

a substantial proportion of suicide attempt seem to be realized in a sudden manner however it is unclear how suicide attempter showing a rapid transition from the decision to die to acting differ from suicide attempter showing a slower transition regarding their suicidal history the main aim of this study wa to determine the proportion of suicide attempter who reported a rapid transition 5 10 180 min between their decision to die and their actual attempt furthermore attempter group v 5 v 10 and v 180 min were compared regarding suicidal history ideation plan and number of lifetime a well a 12 month suicide attempt a well a depression hopelessness and trait impulsivity in total 118 inpatient 62 7 female age m 38 71 sd 14 71 hospitalized due to a recent suicide attempt were assessed using structured clinical interview measure assessing suicidal history and self report instrument thirty six percent reported a time period of 5 min 44 a time period of 10 min and 73 a time period of 180 min between their decision to die and their attempt participant with a rapid transition 5 10 180 min did not differ from participant with a slower transition 5 10 180 min regarding suicidal history depression hopelessness and trait impulsivity taken together a rapid transition seems common but nevertheless rapidly realized suicide attempt cannot necessarily be characterized a impulsive

body dysmorphic disorder bdd is characterized by perceived appearance related defect often tied to aspect of the face or head e g acne deficit in decoding emotional expression have been examined in several psychological disorder including bdd previous research indicates that bdd is associated with impaired facial emotion recognition particularly in situation that involve the bdd sufferer him herself the purpose of this study wa to further evaluate the ability to read other people s emotion among 31 individual with bdd and 31 mentally healthy control we applied the reading the mind in the eye task in which participant are presented with a series of pair of eye one at a time and are asked to identify the emotion that describes the stimulus best the group did not differ with respect to decoding other people s emotion by looking into their eye finding are discussed in light of previous research examining emotion recognition in bdd

the present study tested the impact of experimentally manipulated perceived availability of chocolate on attention for chocolate stimulus momentary state craving for chocolate and consumption of chocolate in healthy weight female student it wa hypothesized that eating forbiddance would be related to attentional avoidance thus diminished attention focus on food cue in an attempt to prevent oneself from processing food cue and that eating motivation would be related to attentional approach thus maintained attentional focus on food cue high chronic chocolate cravers n 40 and low cravers n 40 participated in one of four perceived availability context required to eat forbidden to eat individual choice to eat and 50 chance to eat following a brief chocolate exposure attention for chocolate wa measured using eye tracking momentary craving from self report and the consumption of chocolate wa assessed from direct observation the perceived availability of chocolate did not significantly influence attention allocation for chocolate stimulus momentary craving or chocolate intake high chocolate cravers reported significantly higher momentary craving for chocolate d 1 29 p 001 and showed longer initial duration of gaze on chocolate than low cravers d 0 63 p 01 in contrast participant who indicated during the manipulation check that they would not have permitted themselves to eat chocolate irrespective of the availability instruction they received showed significantly le craving d 0 96 p 01 and reduced total dwell time for chocolate stimulus than participant who permitted themselves to eat chocolate d 0 53 p 05 thus this study provides evidence that attention bias for food stimulus reflect inter individual difference in eating motivation such a chronic chocolate craving and self endorsed eating permission

risk of infection is elevated in patient with schizophrenia predicting their occurrence is essential a infection in this group of patient are associated with prolonged hospital admission and increased mortality the objective of the current investigation wa to identify the potential risk factor of major infection after diagnosis with schizophrenia this national prospective observational cohort study included 7788 people with schizophrenia born in denmark between 1975 and 1990 socio demographic psychiatric and health related data were obtained from danish national register the cox regression model wa used for data analysis crude and adjusted hazard ratio hr with 95 confidence interval 95 ci are presented the most significant risk factor associated with the development of major infection included young age female gender medical comorbidity and substance abuse a history of treatment with antipsychotic preceding the diagnosis wa negatively associated with such morbidity this study report several factor that might increase the risk of infection in individual with schizophrenia early intervention towards infection should be considered in the subpopulation of schizophrenia patient who are at increased risk of infection

enhanced fear response to cue which were not associated with the threat but share perceptual characteristic with the threat signal indicate generalization of conditioned fear here we investigated for the first time generalization process in contextual fear conditioning thirty two participant were guided through two virtual office acquisition phase mildly painful electric shock unconditioned stimulus u were unpredictably delivered in one office anxiety context ctx but never in the other office safety context ctx during the generalization test participant were guided through ctx ctx and the generalization context g ctx which contained feature of both the ctx and the ctx but no u wa delivered we found successful contextual fear conditioning i e the ctx compared to the ctx elicited potentiated startle response and wa rated with more negative valence higher arousal and higher anxiety importantly implicit and explicit response dissociated in the generalization test thus participant rated the g ctx a more arousing and anxiogenic than the ctx indicating anxiety generalization but they showed enhanced startle response to the ctx only while the g ctx and the ctx did not differ in summary healthy participant on an explicit level responded to the generalization context like to the anxiety context but on an implicit level responded to the generalization context like to the safety context possibly this dissociation suggests distinct and specific generalization process underlying contextual fear

objective previous research ha found increasing evidence for difficulty in emotion recognition ability era and social cognition in anorexia nervosa an and recent model consider these factor to contribute to the development and maintenance of the disorder however there is a lack of experimental study testing this hypothesis therefore the present proof of concept study examined whether era can be improved by a single session of a computerized training in an and whether this ha short term effect on eating disorder symptom method forty inpatient 22 20 7 15 year with an were randomly assigned to receive a single session of computerized training of era tera or a sham training training the recognition of different type of cloud era self reported eating disorder symptom and body mass index bmi were assessed within 3 day before and after training result after training both group showed improved era reduced self reported eating disorder symptom and an increased bmi a compared to patient in the control group patient who received tera showed greater improvement in era and self reported eating disorder symptom discussion era can be effectively trained in patient with an moreover short term improvement in self reported eating disorder symptom provide tentative support for the hypothesis that difficulty in era contribute to the maintenance of an and that specific training of era hold promise a an additional component in an treatment future study are needed to replicate these finding in larger sample and to investigate long term effect and transfer into real world setting

background few study have examined the relation between anxiety disorder in the postpartum period and cognitive a well a language development in infancy aim this longitudinal study investigated whether anxiety disorder in the postpartum period is linked to infant development at twelve month a closer look wa also taken at a possible link between maternal interaction and infant development study design subject were videotaped during a face to face still face interaction with their infant m 4 0 month specific maternal anxiety symptom were measured by self report questionnaire anxiety cognition questionnaire acq body sensation questionnaire bsq mobility inventory mi to check for a connection with infant development the bayley scale of infant and toddler development iii bayley iii were used to ass infant language and cognitive development at one year of age subject n 34 mother with anxiety disorder scid i dsm iv and n 47 healthy mother with their infant outcome measure infant performance on bayley iii language and cognitive scale result infant of mother with anxiety disorder yielded significantly lower language score than infant of control no significant group difference were found regarding infant cognitive development exploratory analysis revealed the vital role of maternal avoidance accompanied in infant language and cognitive development maternal neutral engagement which lack positive affect and vocalisation turned out a the strongest negative predictor of cognitive development maternal anxiety cognition and joint activity in mother infant interaction were the strongest predictor of infant language performance conclusion result underline the importance to also consider the interaction behaviour of woman with anxiety disorder to prevent adverse infant development

in the current study we test for the specificity of deficit in fear acquisition and extinction for the anxiety disorder spectrum we compared fear acquisition and fear extinction learning between a group of patient with either an anxiety disorder n 93 or depression n 103 attending for treatment in our outpatient center and a sample of healthy control participant n 60 to ass the specificity of the predictive validity of extinction learning and safety learning for the outcome of exposure based treatment patient additionally underwent disorder specific cognitive behavior therapy cbt we found only very little evidence for difference in safety or extinction learning between healthy control and patient with anxiety disorder or depression using both a group based categorical analytic approach a well a a trans diagnostic dimensional analytic approach on the contrary for anxiety patient only more favorable extinction learning and more favorable safety learning wa associated with more favorable treatment outcome in sum this specific prediction of treatment outcome in anxiety patient confirms and extends current theoretical model of exposure based treatment for anxiety disorder but doe not support the notion of general extinction learning deficit in the anxiety disorder spectrum

the study assessed the diagnostic validity of the diagnostic behavioral assessment for autism spectrum disorder revised dibas r 19 item screening scale based on rating by caregiver in a clinical sample of 381 adult with id analysis revealed a sensitivity of 0 82 and a specificity of 0 67 in the overall sample 70 3 agreement sensitivity 0 79 and specificity 0 84 were balanced in individual with mild to moderate id 83 3 agreement while specificity wa lower in individual with severe to profound id sensitivity 0 83 specificity 0 34 51 agreement the level of id a well a it interaction with asd explained a significant proportion of the variance in the dibas r score the dibas r is an adequate screening tool especially in individual with mild to moderate id

background psychological flexibility is considered a fundamental aspect of health it includes six interrelated facet 1 cognitive defusion 2 acceptance 3 contact with the present moment 4 self a context 5 value and 6 committed action to gain further insight into psychological flexibility and it effect on health reliable and valid instrument to ass all facet are needed committed action is one facet that is understudied a long and short version of a validated measure caq and caq 8 have been developed in english currently there are no german version of the caq aim of this study is to validate german language version of these in a chronic pain population method the caq instruction and item were translated and evaluated in a chronic pain population n 181 confirmatory factor analysis and mokken scale analysis were conducted to evaluate the german questionnaire correlation with health outcome including quality of life sf 12 physical and emotional functioning mpi bpi phq 9 gad 7 pain intensity and with other facet of psychological flexibility cpaq fah ii were investigated for convergent validity purpose scale reliability wa assessed by the alpha m lambda 2 lcrc and omega coefficient result a bifactor model consisting of one general factor and two methodological factor emerged from the analysis criterion for reliability and validity were met medium to strong correlation to health outcome and other facet of psychological flexibility were found result were similar to the original english version conclusion the present study present a valid and reliable instrument to investigate committed action in german population future study could expand the present finding by evaluating the german caq version in non pain population the role of committed action and the wider psychological flexibility model in pain and other condition deserves further investigation

background fear generalization is pivotal for the survival promoting avoidance of potential danger but if too pronounced it promotes pathological anxiety similar to adult patient with anxiety disorder healthy child tend to show overgeneralized fear response objective this study aim to investigate neuro developmental aspect of fear generalization in adolescence a critical age for the development of anxiety disorder method we compared healthy adolescent 14 17 year with healthy adult 19 34 year regarding their fear response towards tilted gabor grating conditioned stimulus c and slightly differently titled generalization stimulus g in the conditioning phase c were paired c or remained unpaired c with an aversive stimulus unconditioned stimulus u in the test phase behavioral peripheral and neural response to c and g were captured by fear and ucs expectancy rating a perceptual discrimination task pupil dilation and source estimation of event related magnetic field result closely resembling adult adolescent showed robust generalization gradient of fear rating pupil dilation and estimated neural source activity however in the ucs expectancy rating adolescent revealed shallower generalization gradient indicating overgeneralization moreover adolescent showed stronger visual cortical activity after a compared to before conditioning to all stimulus conclusion various aspect of fear learning and generalization appear to be mature in healthy adolescent yet cognitive aspect might show a slower course of development

experience sampling method esm study have found an association between daily stress and paranoid symptom but it is uncertain whether these finding generalize to physiological indicator of stress moreover the temporality of the association and it moderating factor require further research here we investigate whether physiological and self rated daily stress predict subsequent paranoid symptom and analyze the role of emotion regulation a a putative moderator we applied esm during 24 h to repeatedly ass heart rate self rated stress and subclinical paranoia in a sample of 67 psychosis prone individual a measured with community assessment for psychotic experience cape adaptive and maladaptive emotion regulation wa assessed at baseline with the emotion regulation skill questionnaire ersq e and the cognitive emotion regulation questionnaire cerq linear mixed model were used to analyze the data heart rate b 0 004 p 0 05 and self rated stress b 0 238 p 0 001 predicted subsequent paranoia the reverse effect paranoia a a predictor of subsequent heart rate b 0 230 p 0 615 or self rated stress b 0 009 p 0 751 wa non significant maladaptive emotion regulation wa a significant predictor of paranoia b 0 740 p 0 01 and moderated the path from self rated stress to paranoia b 0 188 p 0 05 but not the path from heart rate to paranoia b 0 005 p 0 09 our finding suggest a one way temporal link between daily stress and paranoia and highlight the importance of emotion regulation a a vulnerability factor relevant to this process

background brain reserve i e the ability of the brain to tolerate age and disease related change in a way that cognitive function is still maintained is assumed to be based on the lifelong training of various ability the motivational reserve in alzheimer s morea is a longitudinal study that aim to examine motivational process a a protective factor in mild alzheimer s dementia ad and mild cognitive impairment mci this paper present the result of motivational variable frequency of diagnosis and prediction of global cognition a well a depression in a one year longitudinal study method the sample consists of 64 subject with mci and 47 subject with mild ad at baseline at baseline the physical neurological examination standard clinical assessment neuropsychological testing and assessment of motivational variable were performed at follow up fu one year later neuropsychological testing including cognition functional ability behavioral and affective symptom and global clinical assessment of severity have been repeated result ad case have lower motivational capacity a measured with a midlife motivation related occupational score and informant reported present motivational process but do not differ with regard to delay of gratification dog and self reported motivational process dog and delay discounting dd were relatively stable during the measurement interval however 20 of the mci case converted to mild ad at fu and 17 of the mild ad case converted to moderate ad the rate of depression of alzheimer s disease wa 9 at baseline and 21 at fu and the rate of apathy wa 7 and 14 respectively global cognition at fu wa mainly predicted by baseline global cognition but also by one of the motivational variable scenario test depression at fu wa predicted mainly by two motivational variable self reported and informant reported motivational process conclusion this research might inform motivation related strategy for prevention and early intervention with older people or people at risk for ad

subjective chronic tinnitus is a condition that is common in most population whereas many individual tend to habituate to tinnitus over time for some their attention seems pathologically drawn towards the sensation for this subgroup of individual with severe tinnitus dysfunctional executive attention ha been suggested to be implicated in the failure to habituate however since most previous study have used attention test with low validity and specificity in this assessment there is a need for further corroborating study in the present study the attention network test wa used to compare mainly the efficiency of executive attention between a group of individual with chronic tinnitus tg n 33 and a healthy control group cg n 37 the result showed that individual with chronic tinnitus compared to the cg did not present with a specific impairment in executive control of attention nor in any of the other two attention domain these finding are discussed in relation to the sampling characteristic in this study which might have led to the sample being more homogenous and high functioning than sample in tinnitus study generally overall this study suggests that tinnitus and executive control of attention impairment might not be directly related and that the latter might not necessarily be associated with the maintenance of the condition

background pathological avoidance is a transdiagnostic characteristic of anxiety disorder avoidance conditioning re emerged a a translational model to examine mechanism and treatment of avoidance however it validity for anxiety disorder remains unclear method this study tested for altered avoidance in patient with anxiety disorder compared to matched control n 40 group using instrumental conditioning assessing low cost avoidance avoiding a single aversive outcome and costly avoidance avoidance conflicted with gaining reward autonomic arousal and threat expectancy were assessed a indicator of conditioned fear association with dimensional symptom severity were examined result patient and control showed frequent low cost avoidance without group difference control subsequently inhibited avoidance to gain reward which wa amplified when aversive outcome discontinued in contrast patient failed to reduce avoidance when aversive and positive outcome competed elevated costly avoidance and showed limited reduction when aversive outcome discontinued persistent costly avoidance interestingly elevated costly avoidance wa not linked to higher conditioned fear in patient moreover individual data revealed a bimodal distribution of costly avoidance some patient showed persistent avoidance others showed little to no avoidance persistent versus low avoiders did not differ in other task related variable response to gain and loss in absence of threat sociodemographic data or clinical characteristic conclusion finding suggest that anxious psychopathology is associated with a deficit to inhibit avoidance in presence of competing positive outcome this offer novel perspective for research on mechanism and treatment of anxiety disorder

objective evidence of long term stability for positive mental health effect of internet based intervention ibis for depression prevention is still scarce we evaluate long term effectiveness of a depression prevention program in green profession i e agriculture horticulture forestry method this pragmatic rct n 360 compare a tailored ibi program to enhanced treatment a usual tau in green profession with at least subthreshold depression phq 5 intervention group ig received one of six ibis shown previously to efficaciously reduce depressive symptom we report 6 and 12 month follow up measure for depression mental health and intervention related outcome intention to treat and per protocol regression analysis were conducted for each measurement point and complemented by latent growth modeling result after 6 month depression severity beta 0 30 95 ci 0 52 0 07 insomnia beta 0 22 95 ci 0 41 0 02 pain associated disability beta 0 26 95 ci 0 48 0 04 and quality of life beta 0 29 95 ci 0 13 0 45 in ig were superior to tau onset of possible depression wa not reduced after 12 month no intervention effect were found longitudinal modeling confirmed group effect attenuating over 12 month for most outcome after 12 month 55 56 of ig had completed at least 80 of their ibi conclusion stability of intervention effect along with intervention adherence wa restricted measure enhancing long term effectiveness of ibis for depression health promotion are indicated in green profession trial registration german clinical trial registration drks00014000 registered 09 april 2018

background and objective one of the central assumption of cognitive model of panic disorder pd is that automatic panic related association are a core feature of pd however empirical finding are mixed and inconsistent rendering it difficult to evaluate the role of panic related association adequately particularly in relation to the relevant theory the present study aimed to further advance our understanding of automatic association in pd and therefore applied a paradigm novel in this context namely an extrinsic affective simon task east method participant involved treatment seeking unmedicated panic patient n 45 and healthy control n 38 the east wa applied prior to treatment it included the following stimulus a target panic related bodily sensation and agoraphobia related situation and a attribute pleasant versus unpleasant fear related word result contrary to our expectation panic patient did not show stronger negative than positive automatic association for either panic related symptom or agoraphobia related situation compared to healthy control moreover east effect did not correlate with panic related self report measure limitation although the present study involved patient who were actively seeking treatment panic related association might not have been activated sufficiently hence a brief activation procedure e g hyperventilation might have been needed to optimize the assessment condition conclusion the present finding do not support contemporary theory of panic related association therefore follow up work is needed to disentangle their functional and operational property more thoroughly

posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd involves elevated level of cellular oxidative stress which jeopardizes the integrity of essential cell compartment previously we demonstrated higher level of dna lesion in peripheral blood mononuclear cell pbmcs in ptsd retaining vital level of dna integrity requires cell to mobilize compensatory effort in elevating their dna repair capacity accordingly we hypothesized to find increased expression rate of the dna repair gene x ray repair cross complementing 1 xrcc1 poly adp ribose polymerase 1 parp1 and polymerase beta polbeta in pbmcs of ptsd patient a compared to control leading to functionally relevant change in dna repair kinetics in a cohort of 14 refugee with ptsd and 15 without ptsd we found significantly higher xrcc1 expression in ptsd patient than control u 161 0 p 0 009 cohen s r 0 49 and positive correlation between the severity of ptsd symptom and the expression of xrcc1 r s 0 57 p 0 002 and parp1 r s 0 43 p 0 022 higher xrcc1 f 2 39 p 0 010 eta 2 p 0 10 and parp1 f 2 15 p 0 022 eta 2 p 0 09 expression accounted for slower repair of experimentally x ray irradiation induced dna damage highlighting the possible physiological relevance of altered dna repair gene expression in ptsd our study provides first evidence for a compensatory regulation of dna repair mechanism in ptsd we discus the implication of increased dna damage and altered dna repair mechanism in immune senescence premature aging and increased physical morbidity in ptsd

the ability to mentally imagine the performance of automatic movement ha been well established being employed in sport and physiotherapy a a tool for motor learning and rehabilitation this is probably mediated by engagement of the same brain area a during real motor performance here we investigated the effect of hypnotic trance on the cerebral activation pattern engaged in motor imagery in 16 healthy right handed subject using fmri motor imagery a compared with rest wa related to activation in the left medial frontal area presma sma prefrontal and frontal area putamen and inferior parietal area when compared with performance of the same movement motor imagery resulted in activation of the left middle frontal cortex precuneus and posterior cingulate under hypnotic trance there wa one extra activation in the left thalamus which occurred specifically in the motor imagery condition the regional beta index were highly correlated among the area of the cortical subcortical motor network our data accord with the notion that hypnotic trance enhances the motor control circuit engaged in motor imagery by modulating the gating function of the thalamus

background suicide rate are high in borderline personality disorder bpd where interpersonal problem trigger intense affective dysregulation and impulse to act on suicidal thought to date however no study ha examined how interpersonal stressor contribute to momentary within person link among affect and impulsivity with suicidal ideation si and how those link vary over time in people s daily life method a total of 153 individual diagnosed with bpd and 52 healthy control completed a 21 day ecological momentary assessment protocol of these 153 individual with bpd 105 had a history of suicide attempt multilevel structural equation modeling wa used to examine dynamic link among interpersonal perception affect state impulsivity and suicidal intent result aggregated across interaction lower perceived warmth in others wa associated with si this direct relationship however did not extend to momentary within person association instead interpersonal conflict were linked to si indirectly via greater negative affect and lower positive affect while a robust within person link between interpersonal perception and impulsivity emerged impulsivity did not account for the relationship between interpersonal perception and si conclusion this intensive longitudinal study illustrates momentary interpersonal signature of an emerging suicidal crisis among people with bpd at high risk for suicide interpersonal trigger initiate a cascade of affective dysregulation which in turn give rise to si

most people adapt to bereavement over time for a minority the grief persists and may lead to a prolonged grief disorder pgd identifying griever at risk of pgd may enable specific prevention measure the present study examined the extent to which the subjective unexpectedness of the death predicted grief outcome above and beyond known sociodemographic and objective loss related variable in a sample drawn from a population representative investigation in our sample n 2 531 811 participant m age 55 1 17 8 year 59 2 woman had experienced the loss of a significant person six or more month ago participant provided demographic and loss related information perception of the unexpectedness of the death and completed the prolonged grief disorder 13 9 pg 13 9 the pg 13 9 wa used to determine pgd caseness a binary logistic regression investigated predictor of pgd caseness and a linear regression predictor of grief severity ancovas compared pgd symptom between the group who had experienced an expected v unexpected loss while controlling for the relationship to the deceased and time since loss the loss of a child or 23 66 95 ci 6 03 68 28 or a partner or 5 32 95 ci 1 79 15 83 the time since loss or 0 99 95 ci 0 99 1 00 and the unexpectedness of the death or 3 58 95 ci 1 70 7 69 were significant predictor of pgd caseness nagelkerke s r 2 0 25 and grief severity participant who had experienced the loss a unexpected v expected reported higher score on all pgd symptom unexpectedness of the death emerged a significant risk factor for pgd even after controlling for demographic and other loss related variable while our finding replicate previous research on the importance of the relationship to the deceased a a risk factor for pgd they also highlight the importance of assessing the subjective unexpectedness of a death and may help to identify risk group who can profit from preventive intervention

background only a minority of people suffering from depression receive adequate treatment psychological online intervention poi could help bridge existing treatment gap and augment the effectiveness of current treatment apart from effectiveness user acceptance of poi must be achieved if such intervention are to be broadly implemented in existing health care valid measurement tool examining attitude towards poi are lacking therefore we examined the dimensionality of attitude towards poi developed a novel questionnaire the attitude towards psychological online intervention questionnaire apoi and gathered data to examine it reliability method we recruited a sample of 1004 adult with mild to moderate depressive symptom from a range of source we constructed a set of 35 item based on literature review a well a expert and patient query the initial item were subjected to an exploratory factor analysis efa in a randomly selected subsample a final set of 16 item wa subjected to a confirmatory factor analysis cfa to cross validate the factor structure in a separate subsample result the efa revealed four dimension scepticism and perception of risk confidence in effectiveness technologization threat and anonymity benefit the model fit in the cfa wa excellent relating to all applied index chi 2 105 816 p 651 srmr 042 rmsea 013 cfi 994 and the apoi total scale showed acceptable to good internal consistency conclusion further research with the apoi might facilitate the development and dissemination of poi and ultimately help improve the quality of care for people experiencing depressive symptom

objective in 2013 a novel material smarttrack r wa introduced to replace the previous material used for invisalign r aligners we conducted this study to test how this transition wa accepted by patient during ongoing invisalign r treatment method we surveyed a total of 72 patient 68 woman 32 men mean age 29 3 9 2 year who had worn the new material for a mean of 6 month they completed a questionnaire with 25 item that compared both material in term of pain pressure upon insertion comfort mucosal irritation phonetics discoloration and taste result on a numerical rating scale nrs ranging from 0 to 10 the new aligner material wa rated by the respondent to cause significantly p 0 001 le maximum pain than the old material 2 8 v 3 8 significant reduction were obtained for duration of pain p 0 001 and duration of pressure 2 5 v 1 9 day p 0 001 upon insertion of the aligners over 90 of the respondent indicated le or equal pain during eating felt that the new material offered a tighter fit and provided more favorable rating for impairment durability and discoloration improved comfort wa reported by 50 of the respondent conclusion the new material wa favorably rated by the patient and showed significant reduction in pain intensity pain duration and pressure upon insertion important clinical parameter like overall comfort and impairment also were improved the clinical effectiveness of the new material remains to be investigated

introduction while identity problem and materialistic value endorsement have been described a predisposing factor for buying shopping disorder bsd in the literature little empirical data are available on the role of socially undesirable personality feature that may contribute to financial misconduct and manipulative interpersonal behavior in bsd the dark triad of personality refers to such offensive yet non pathological personality trait and ha been applied to addictive behavior in the past the aim of the present study wa to investigate whether the dark triad dimension machiavellianism subclinical narcissism and subclinical psychopathy predict symptom of bsd above and beyond identity confusion and materialism or moderate the relationship between materialism and symptom of bsd method the participant comprised a convenience sample n 272 72 4 woman aged between 18 and 67 year assessment included standard questionnaire for bsd identity problem materialism and the dark triad of personality result zero order correlation indicate a weak association between bsd and the dark triad dimension machiavellianism and narcissism but not psychopathy result of a moderated regression analysis with bsd symptom a a dependent variable revealed significant main effect for materialism female gender and a significant narcissism by materialism effect after accounting for identity confusion synthesis and the single dark triad trait conclusion the finding suggest that individual with bsd attempt to address their narcissistic deficit via materialistic possession this assumption warrant further investigation in a clinical sample

background a routinely collected big data set wa analyzed to determine the effectiveness of naturalistic inpatient treatment and to identify predictor of treatment outcome and discontinuation method the sample included 878 patient with borderline personality disorder who received non manualized dialectic behavioral therapy in a psychosomatic clinic effect size hedge s g were calculated to determine effectiveness a bootstrap enhanced regularized regression with 91 potential predictor wa used to identify stable predictor of residualized symptom and functional change and treatment discontinuation result were validated in a holdout sample and repeated cross validation result effect size were small to medium g 0 28 0 51 positive symptom related outcome wa predicted by low affect regulation skill and no previous outpatient psychotherapy lower age absence of work disability high emotional and physical role limitation and low bodily pain were associated with greater improvement in functional outcome higher education and comorbid recurrent depressive disorder were the main predictor of treatment completion the predictive quality of the model varied with the best being found for symptom related outcome r 2 18 conclusion while the exploratory process of variable selection replicates previous finding the validation result suggest that tailoring treatment to the individual patient might not be based solely on sociodemographic clinical and psychological baseline data

background recent study demonstrate substantial effect of deceptive placebo on experimentally induced sadness even on autonomic activity whether deception is necessary remains to be elucidated we investigated the effect of an open label placebo olp treatment i e an openly administered placebo delivered with a convincing rationale for it sadness protecting effect method eighty four healthy female were randomized to an olp group or a no treatment control group all participant received the same detailed information about the olp effect only the olp group received an olp nasal spray before and after the olp intervention participant underwent a sad mood induction procedure combining self deprecating statement velten s method and sad music sadness wa assessed by the positive and negative affect schedule panas x autonomic activity wa measured continuously result participant in the olp group reported a significantly attenuated increase in sadness upon mood induction and le sadness after induction compared to the control group d 0 79 regardless of intervention heart rate decreased during mood induction with a more pronounced deceleration in the second mood induction limitation generalizability is limited due to the selective sample and the reliance on an experimentally controlled mood induction conclusion olp treatment had a beneficial effect on perceived sadness at least at the subjective level hence deception may not necessarily be required for placebo to modulate experienced sad mood investigating the beneficial effect of olp in sub clinical sample would seem a promising and required next step towards a clinical use of placebo associated positive treatment expectation

introduction the goal of the present study wa to identify the prospective relation between weight shape and muscularity concern and emotional problem in adolescent method self report data of 966 german male and female adolescent were analyzed in a cross lagged panel design result analysis of latent mean revealed significant correlation between weight shape concern and emotional problem a well a between muscularity concern and emotional problem in both gender moreover weight shape concern predicted emotional problem prospectively but only in girl regarding muscularity concern we could not find any prospective relation with emotional problem in boy or girl from the general population conclusion it is assumed that a appearance is highly relevant for the self concept in girl concern about the look might promote emotional problem thus weight shape concern should be addressed in the prevention of emotional problem in adolescent girl whereas further research is necessary investigating the contribution of muscularity concern in this context

resilience factor rf help prevent mental health problem after childhood adversity ca rf are known to be related but it is currently unknown how their interrelation facilitate mental health here we used network analysis to examine the interrelation between ten rf in 14 year old adolescent exposed ca n 638 and not exposed to ca no ca n 501 we found that the degree to which rf are assumed to enhance each other is higher in the no ca compared to the ca group upon correction for general distress level the global rf connectivity also differed between the two group more specifically in the no ca network almost all rf were positively interrelated and thus may enhance each other whereas in the ca network some rf were negatively interrelated and thus may hamper each other moreover the ca group showed more direct connection between the rf and current distress therefore ca seems to influence how rf relate to each other and to current distress potentially leading to a dysfunctional rf system translational research could explore whether intervening on negative rf interrelation so that they turn positive and rf can enhance each other may alter rf mental distress relation resulting in a lower risk for subsequent mental health problem

aim measurement tool to evaluate self management behavior are useful for diabetes research and clinical practice the diabetes self management questionnaire dsmq wa introduced in 2013 and ha become a widely used tool this article present a revised and updated version dsmq r and evaluates it property in assessing self management practice in type 1 diabetes t1d and type 2 diabetes t2d method the dsmq r is a multidimensional questionnaire with 27 item regarding essential self management practice for t1d and t2d including diabetes adjusted eating glucose testing monitoring medication taking physical activity and cooperation with the diabetes team for the revised form the original item were partially amended and the wording wa updated eleven item were newly added the tool wa applied a part of health related survey in five clinical study two cross sectional three prospective including a total of 1 447 people with t1d and t2d using this data base clinimetric property were rigorously tested result the analysis showed high internal and retest reliability coefficient for the total scale and moderate to high coefficient for the subscales reliability coefficient for scale including the new item were consistently higher correlation with convergent criterion and related variable supported validity responsiveness wa supported by significant short to medium term change in prospective study significant association with glycemic outcome were observed for dsmq r assessed medication taking glucose monitoring and eating behavior conclusion the result support good clinimetric property of the dsmq r the tool can be useful for research and clinical practice and may facilitate the identification of improvable self management practice in individual

academia ha been facing a mental health crisis particularly affecting early career researcher ecrs moreover the covid 19 pandemic posed an unprecedented burden on the mental health of many individual therefore we cross sectionally investigated how doctoral researcher n 222 evaluate their mental health status and satisfaction with their phd training before and during the pandemic a compared to self reported retrospective evaluation about the pre pandemic state we found decreased satisfaction with phd training and overall well being the whole sample exhibited high level of personal and work related burnout a fifth indicated clinically meaningful level of depressive symptom and almost 25 experienced severe loneliness when exploring predictor of depression anxiety and burnout we identified low satisfaction with phd training a the most prominent predictor for poor mental health suggesting a link between the doctoral work and their mental health status female v male and doctoral researcher in individual doctorate v structured phd program reported higher symptom of burnout our study replicates previous finding of poor mental health in doctoral researcher and indicates further decrease of mental wellbeing under the influence of the pandemic systematic adjustment in academia are required to improve the mental health of ecrs

background childhood maltreatment ha been associated with reduced hippocampal volume in healthy individual whereas social support a protective factor ha been positively associated with hippocampal volume in this study we investigated how social support is associated with hippocampal volume in healthy people with previous experience of childhood maltreatment method we separated a sample of 446 healthy participant into 2 group using the childhood trauma questionnaire 265 people without maltreatment and 181 people with maltreatment we measured perceived social support using a short version of the social support questionnaire we examined hippocampal volume using automated segmentation freesurfer we conducted a social support x group analysis of covariance on hippocampal volume controlling for age sex total intracranial volume site and verbal intelligence result our analysis revealed significantly lower left hippocampal volume in people with maltreatment left f1 432 5 686 p 0 018 right f1 433 3 371 p 0 07 but no main effect of social support emerged however we did find a significant social support x group interaction for left hippocampal volume left f1 432 5 712 p 0 017 right f1 433 3 480 p 0 06 in people without maltreatment we observed a trend toward a positive association between social support and hippocampal volume in contrast social support wa negatively associated with hippocampal volume in people with maltreatment limitation because of the correlative nature of our study we could not infer causal relationship between social support maltreatment and hippocampal volume conclusion our result point to a complex dynamic between environmental risk protective factor and brain structure in line with previous evidence suggesting a detrimental effect of maltreatment on hippocampal development

recent study on reward based decision making in the presence of anxiety related stimulus demonstrated that approach avoidance conflict can be assessed under controlled laboratory condition however the clinical relevance of these decision conflict ha not been demonstrated to this end the present study investigated avoidant decision in treatment seeking individual with social anxiety disorder sad in a gambling task advantageous choice to maximize gain were associated with task irrelevant angry face and disadvantageous choice with happy face the clinical relevance of avoidant decision for in vivo anxiety in a social stress situation public speaking were examined n 44 in a subsample n 20 the predictive value for a reduction of avoidance following behavioral therapy wa also evaluated result indicated a close link between more frequent avoidant decision and elevated in vivo anxiety moreover individual who showed a deficit in the goal directed adjustment of their decision also showed higher and sustained distress during the social stressor and reported le decrease of avoidance following treatment the finding highlight the importance of an avoidant decision making style for the experience of acute distress and the maintenance of avoidance in sad assessing avoidant decision making may help to predict the response to behavioral treatment

the aim of the present proof of concept study wa to test a novel cognitive bias modification cbm programme in an analogue sample of people with subclinical bulimic eating disorder ed psychopathology thirty participant with high level of trait food craving were trained to make avoidance movement in response to visual food stimulus in an implicit learning paradigm the intervention comprised ten 15 minute session over a 5 week course at baseline participant showed approach and attentional bias towards high caloric palatable food that were both significantly reduced and turned into avoidance bias after the training participant also reported pronounced reduction in both trait and cue elicited food craving and in ed symptom a well the overall evaluation of the training by the participant wa positive the specific cbm programme tested in this pilot trial promise to be an effective and feasible way to alter automatic action tendency towards food in people suffering from bulimic ed psychopathology

abstract pathological worrying is of high transdiagnostic relevance and is related to maladaptive emotion regulation process dysfunctional emotion regulation and it underlying neural mechanism might contribute to the maintenance of fear over time therefore this functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri study aim at investigating the association of trait worry with neural correlate of emotion regulation twenty six healthy female were instructed to passively look at aversive picture to distract themselves with a neutral thought or to down and up regulate negative feeling via cognitive reappraisal in response to repeatedly presented aversive picture trait worry wa not related to cognitive reappraisal but to distraction which lead to a greater reduction of self reported negative feeling and insula activation in individual with higher trait worry the current study indicates that the neural mechanism underlying distraction seem to be altered in pathological worrying and may prevent adaptive emotional processing of aversive stimulus leading to the maintenance of fear

a indicated by previous research aging is associated with a decline in working memory wm functioning related to alteration in fronto parietal neural activation at the same time previous study showed that wm training in older adult may improve the performance in the trained task training effect and more importantly also in untrained wm task transfer effect however neural correlate of these transfer effect that would improve understanding of it underlying mechanism have not been shown in older participant a yet in this study we investigated blood oxygen level dependent bold signal change during n back performance and an untrained delayed recognition sternberg task following 12sessions 45min each of adaptive n back training in older adult the sternberg task used in this study allowed to test for neural training effect independent of specific task affordances of the trained task and to separate maintenance from updating process thirty two healthy older participant 60 75years were assigned either to an n back training or a no contact control group before t1 and after t2 training waiting period both the n back task and the sternberg task were conducted while bold signal wa measured using functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri in all participant in addition neuropsychological test were performed outside the scanner wm performance improved with training and behavioral transfer to test measuring executive function processing speed and fluid intelligence wa found in the training group bold signal in the right lateral middle frontal gyrus caudal superior frontal sulcus brodmann area ba 6 8 decreased in both the trained n back and the updating condition of the untrained sternberg task at t2 compared to the control group fmri finding indicate a training related increase in processing efficiency of wm network potentially related to the process of wm updating performance gain in untrained task suggest that transfer to other cognitive task remains possible in aging
