background even though there is an increasing number of study on the efficacy of internet based intervention ibi for depression experimental trial on the benefit of added guidance by clinician are scarce and inconsistent this study compared the efficacy of semistandardized feedback provided by psychologist with fully standardized feedback in ibi method participant with mild to moderate depression n 1 089 66 female from the client pool of a health insurance company participated in a cognitive behavioral ibi targeting depression over 6 week individual were randomized to weekly semistandardized e mail feedback from psychologist individual counseling ic or to automated standardized feedback where a psychologist could be contacted on demand cod the content and task were identical across condition the primary outcome wa depression secondary outcome included anxiety rumination and well being outcome were assessed before and after the intervention and 3 6 and 12 month later change in outcome were evaluated using latent change score modeling result both intervention yielded large pre post effect on depression beck depression inventory ii dic 1 53 dcod 1 37 patient health questionnaire 9 dic 1 20 dcod 1 04 a well a significant improvement of all other outcome measure the effect remained significant after 3 6 and 12 month the group differed with regard to attrition ic 17 3 cod 25 8 p 0 001 between group effect were statistically nonsignificant across outcome and measurement occasion conclusion adding semistandardized guidance in ibi for depression did not prove to be more effective than fully standardized feedback on primary and secondary outcome but it had positive effect on attrition

the perception of disgust is a powerful but yet puzzling emotion aiming at the prevention of potential microbial pathogen and being directly linked to olfactory processing in it neurophysiological pathway via the anterior insular cortex in sample of healthy participant with a natural variation in olfactory function we investigated the relation between olfactory sensitivity and disgust perception a total of 123 healthy individual were surveyed with a disgust sensitivity questionnaire olfactory threshold wa assessed in all participant using the sniffin stick additionally tactile 2 point discrimination threshold wa tested in a subgroup of the participant a a controlling factor for the specificity of the relationship between olfactory sensitivity and disgust only in men a significant relation between disgust rating and olfactory threshold wa observed men with high olfactory sensitivity reported a high level of disgust a female participant while men with low olfactory sensitivity reported significantly lower disgust than woman there wa no such relation for tactile sensitivity investigating sensory subscales of the disgust questionnaire olfactory sensitivity wa related to olfactory and tactile but not to visual disgust rating in conclusion there is a specific relation between the level of disgust and olfactory sensitivity in men who generally present lower value of disgust than woman when disgust rating are low there seems to be an additional merit in the ability to perceive subtle olfactory stimulus thus high olfactory sensitivity may facilitate the perception of potential pathogenic threat and contribute to the evolutionary function of disgust a disease avoidance mechanism

background adherence to anti covid 19 rule is important to slow down the pandemic spread the present study investigated potential predictor of the adherence method data of 1 247 participant from germany age m sd 22 99 6 18 were assessed via online survey in autumn and winter 2020 the focus of the data collection wa on adherence to anti covid 19 rule sense of control psychological burden and source of covid 19 information result in moderated mediation analysis the positive relationship between sense of control and adherence to anti covid 19 rule wa significantly mediated by the level of psychological burden experienced by the covid 19 situation the source of covid 19 information significantly moderated the negative association between burden and adherence specifically the higher the use of social medium e g facebook twitter and the lower the use of official governmental site and of television report the closer the link between high burden and low adherence limitation due to the cross sectional study design the present finding allow only hypothetical assumption of causality conclusion the present result disclose potential mechanism that could contribute to the adherence to anti covid 19 rule they emphasize the role of the covid 19 information source for the adherence level potential way of how the level of adherence could be enhanced are discussed

introduction an increase of suicidal thinking within the covid 19 pandemic ha been postulated yet direct comparison with pre covid 19 rate are missing method the present study investigated whether level and rate of suicidal ideation have changed between 2016 and 2020 data of n 664 university student five cohort 2016 n 105 2017 n 117 2018 n 108 2019 n 154 2020 n 180 were collected by online survey result the rate of student suffering from suicidal ideation wa twice a high in 2020 than in previous year furthermore level of suicidal thinking and of depression were higher in 2020 than in 2019 and 2016 limitation the sample size of the current study wa rather modest and suicide ideation wa assessed with a single item only conclusion the rate of student suffering from suicidal ideation wa twice a high in 2020 than in previous year help line and online counselling should be promoted to the public and the possibility of telepsychotherapy for suicidal people should be used and expanded

abstract background the market for energy drink ha grown quickly over the past 20 year while the physiological and psychological effect of different ingredient have been studied the influence of energy drink on interoceptive process is unclear anxiety ha been associated with amplified interoceptive functioning suggesting potentially exaggerated reaction to energy drink aim investigate the effect of energy drink consumption and anxiety sensitivity a a well a their possible interaction on cardiorespiratory dimension of interoception method thirty nine healthy student consumed an energy drink via a placebo controlled counterbalanced crossover design cardiac and respiratory interoceptive accuracy iacc interoceptive sensibility is and interoceptive evaluation ie were assessed heartbeat evoked potential heps were analyzed to evaluate neural processing of the heartbeat result consumption of one energy drink did not influence iacc is or ie however high a subject reported reduced interoceptive confidence after energy drink intake while hep amplitude did not differ depending on the type of drink high a subject showed reduced heps overall compared to low a subject heart rate wa significantly lower following energy drink consumption a compared to the placebo condition limitation the sample size wa small energy dosage low and physiological parameter should be assessed in more detail conclusion energy drink consumption wa associated with an interoceptive bias in high a individual suggesting possible interaction effect between change in physical state interoception and anxiety

background alexithymia wa found to be associated with a variety of somatic complaint including somatoform pain symptom this study addressed the question of whether the different facet of alexithymia are related to response in heat pain stimulation and it interrelation with level of everyday pain a assessed by self report method in the study sensitivity to heat pain wa assessed in 50 healthy female participant alexithymia facet were assessed by the toronto alexithymia scale pain threshold and tolerance were determined using a testing the limit procedure participant furthermore rated subjective intensity and unpleasantness of tonic heat stimulus 45 5 47 5 degree c on visual analog scale and on a questionnaire possible confounding with temperature sensitivity and mood wa controlled everyday pain wa assessed by self report addressing everyday pain frequency intensity and impairment experienced over the last 2 month result main result were that the facet of alexithymia were differentially associated with pain perception the affective scale difficulty in describing feeling wa associated with hyposensitivity to pain a indicated by higher pain tolerance score furthermore everyday pain frequency wa related to increased alexithymia value on the affective scale difficulty in identifying feeling whereas higher value on the cognitive alexithymia scale externally oriented thinking were related to lower pain impairment and intensity conclusion we conclude that the different facet of alexithymia are related to alternation in pain processing further research on clinical sample is necessary to elucidate whether different aspect of alexithymia act a a vulnerability factor for the development of pain symptom

background vulnerability stress model postulate that social stress trigger psychotic episode in vulnerable individual however experimental evidence for the proposed causal pathway is scarce and the translating mechanism are insufficiently understood the study assessed the impact of social exclusion on paranoid belief in a quasi experimental design and investigated the role of emotion regulation er a a vulnerability indicator and emotional response a a putative translating mechanism method participant fulfilling criterion for clinical high risk of psychosis chr n 25 control with anxiety disorder ac n 40 and healthy control hc n 40 were assessed for dysfunctional eg rumination catastrophizing blaming and functional er strategy eg reappraising accepting refocusing they were then exposed to social exclusion during a virtual ball game cyberball and assessed for change in self reported emotion and paranoid belief result the chr sample showed a significantly stronger increase in paranoid belief from before to after the social exclusion than both control group this wa accounted for by lower level of functional and higher level of dysfunctional er compared to hc and by a stronger increase in self reported negative emotion in the chr group compared to ac and hc conclusion the result confirm the role of negative emotion on the pathway from social stressor to psychotic symptom and indicate that both the use of dysfunctional er strategy and difficulty in employing functional strategy add to explaining why people at risk of psychosis respond to a social stressor with increased paranoia

objective the study report the prevalence of disruptive behavior in a help seeking sample of young child across a diverse range of clinical diagnosis based on icd 10 method the eyberg child behavior inventory ecbi a parent rating scale of disruptive behavior wa completed on 310 child 2 11 year at three child and adolescent psychiatry clinic in three german state bavaria hesse lower saxony the majority of child were outpatient result mean intensity score of disruptive behavior differed significantly by diagnostic group with the lowest rating within a community sample and increasingly higher score in child with a diagnosis from the internalizing spectrum those with pervasive developmental disorder and finally those with externalizing disorder e g hyperkinetic disorder conduct disorder seventy percent of the clinical sample compared to only 17 of the community sample exceeded the normative cut off score of 111 indicating that disruptive behavior are common in young german child seeking help for different mental health problem conclusion these finding support the research domain criterion approach by showing that disruptive behavior cross our current diagnostic label and may need to be assessed and conceptualized in treatment planning even in child without a primary diagnosis from the externalizing spectrum

although the observation and assessment of psychotherapeutic competence are central to training supervision patient care quality control and life long practice structured instrument are used only occasionally in the current study an observation based tool for the assessment of core cbt skill acc wa translated into german and adapted and it psychometric property were pilot evaluated competence of therapist in training wa assessed in a random sample of n 30 video on cognitive behavioural therapy including patient diagnosed with hypochondriasis two of three raters independently assessed the competence demonstrated in the entire active treatment session n 60 in our sample internal consistency wa excellent and interrater reliability wa good convergent validity cognitive therapy scale and discriminant validity helping alliance questionnaire were within the expected range the acc total score did not significantly predict the reduction of symptom of hypochondriasis and a one factorial structure of the instrument wa found by providing multiple opportunity for feedback self reflection and supervision the acc may complement current tool for the assessment of psychotherapeutic competence and importantly support competence based training and supervision

sensory processing and attention allocation are shaped by threat but the role of trait anxiety in sensory processing a a function of threat predictability remains incompletely understood therefore we measured steady state visual evoked potential ssveps a an index of sensory processing of predictable and unpredictable threat cue in 29 low la and 29 high ha trait anxious participant during a modified npu paradigm followed by an extinction phase three different contextual cue indicated safety n predictable p or unpredictable threat u while foreground cue signalled shock in the p condition only all participant allocated increased attentional resource to the central p threat cue replicating previous finding importantly la individual exhibited larger ssvep amplitude to contextual threat u and p than to contextual safety cue while ha individual did not differentiate among contextual cue in general further ha exhibited higher aversive rating of all context compared to la these result suggest that high trait anxious individual might be worse at discriminating contextual threat stimulus and accordingly overestimate the probability and aversiveness of unpredictable threat these finding support the notion of aberrant sensory processing of unpredictable threat in anxiety disorder a this processing pattern is already evident in individual at risk of these disorder

background patient with borderline personality disorder bpd feel ostracized even when they are included this might be due to a biased processing of social participation in bpd we examined whether patient with bpd also process social overinclusion in a biased manner i e whether they feel ostracized even when the degree of social participation is increased method an eeg compatible version of cyberball wa used to investigate the effect of inclusion and overinclusion 33 v 45 ball receipt on perceived ostracism need threat and p3 amplitude an eeg indicator for expectancy violation twenty nine patient with bpd 28 patient with social anxiety disorder sad and 28 healthy control hc participated result the p3 amplitude wa enhanced for patient with bpd and sad compared to hcs independent of condition both patient group reported more perceived ostracism relative to hcs in the inclusion but not in the overinclusion condition only patient with bpd reported stronger need threat in both condition conclusion the eeg result imply that being socially included violates the expectation of patient with bpd irrespective of the actual degree of social participation however when overincluded patient with bpd no longer feel ostracized except for need threat patient with sad might show a comparable bias in the processing of social participation a patient with bpd

adequate defensive responding is crucial for mental health but scientifically not well understood specifically it seems difficult to dissociate defense and approach state based on autonomic response pattern we thus explored the robustness and threat specificity of recently described oculomotor dynamic upon threat in anticipation of either threatening or rewarding stimulus in human while visually exploring naturalistic image participant 50 per experiment expected an inevitable no or avoidable shock experiment 1 or a guaranteed no or achievable reward experiment 2 that could be averted or gained by a quick behavioural response we observed reduced heart rate bradycardia increased skin conductance pupil dilation and globally centralized gaze when shock were inevitable but more pronouncedly when they were avoidable reward trial were not associated with globally narrowed visual exploration but autonomic response resembled characteristic of the threat condition while bradycardia and concomitant sympathetic activation reflect not only threat related but also action preparatory state independent of valence global centralization of gaze seems a robust phenomenon during the anticipation of avoidable threat thus instead of relying on single readout translational research in animal and human should consider the multi dimensionality of state in aversive and rewarding context especially when investigating ambivalent conflicting situation

neuroimaging study have revealed partially shared neural substrate for both the actual experience of pain and empathy elicited by the pain of others we examined whether prior pain exposure increased neural activity in the anterior midcingulate cortex amcc and bilateral anterior insula ai a a correlate of empathy for pain participant n 64 32 woman 32 men viewed picture displaying exposure to pressure pain pain picture and picture without any cue of pain neutral picture prior to the experiment half of the participant were exposed to the same pain stimulus a the one seen in the pain picture pain exposure condition the other half had no such experience touch exposure condition a balanced sex ratio wa kept to investigate possible sex difference in the region of interest analysis participant of the pain exposure condition showed decreased activity in the right ai and the amcc relative to participant of the touch exposure condition while in men no difference were found in relation to their exposure condition woman with pain exposure showed decreased activity in the amcc and additionally in bilateral ai based on the entire sample whole brain analysis revealed stronger activation in the retrosplenial cortex dorsomedial prefrontal cortex and medial prefrontal cortex in the pain exposure condition in conclusion prior pain exposure did not increase but decreased activity in region regularly associated with empathy for pain however pain experience increased activity in region associated with memory retrieval perspective taking and top down emotion regulation which might facilitate empathizing with others

purpose this study aimed to analyze the association between the importance of several reason to follow a vegan diet and the degree of orthorexic eating behavior in a sample of vegan individual n 65 53 8 woman age m 28 22 sd 9 13 year bmi m 22 91 sd 3 44 kg m 2 result the result reveal that orthorexic eating behavior is associated with the importance of the underlying motif health esthetic and healing whereas animal welfare politics and ecology are not linked to orthorexia conclusion hence this study reveals that a vegan lifestyle is not per se associated with orthorexic eating behavior but rather that it varies with the underlying motivation for following a vegan diet

background and objective the look into the mirror represents a typical trigger situation for people with body dysmorphic concern mirror exposure on the other hand is commonly used in the treatment of body dysmorphic disorder even though little is known about it precise effect this study aimed to investigate cognitive affective process related to mirror gazing method a total of 125 individual screening for body dysmorphic concern n bdd 56 negative n bdd 69 participated in a laboratory study using a guided 10 min mirror gazing task participant were randomized to one of two experimental condition a non judgmental and judgmental description of the own body during mirror gazing distress self hostile cognition and post event processing were assessed after the task and at follow up result participant with body dysmorphic concern showed higher value regarding subjective appearance distortion stress induced by the exposure distress self hostile cognition and post event processing compared to the symptom negative group the two condition did not yield differential effect limitation the short duration of the mirror gazing and the only internal description of the body may have contributed to a missing effect for the approach conclusion the result indicate the importance of cognitive and affective process in reaction to mirror exposure they support the cognitive model of bdd and suggest post event processing a a relevant factor requiring further investigation in future research

objective while cross sectional study underline that child and parent factor in pediatric chronic pain are reciprocally related so far little is known on their prospective relationship especially in treatment context this study aim to analyze direction of influence between child and parental outcome using data from an intervention study method the sample covered 109 family with child aged 7 13 year diagnosed with functional abdominal pain fap child outcome included pain and impairment and parental outcome covered caregiver specific distress including both parental personal time burden i e le time available for personal need and emotional burden due to child s pain i e increased worry cross lagged panel analysis examined the direction of the relation between child and parental outcome across time pretreatment t1 post treatment t2 and 3 month follow up and 12 month follow up t3 t4 result first a significant improvement over time in all measure wa observed cross lagged effect were found for le parental personal time burden at t2 predicting both le pain beta 0 254 p 004 and le impairment beta 0 150 p 039 at t3 higher baseline pain wa predictive for higher parental emotional burden after treatment beta 0 130 p 049 and reversely for le emotional burden at 12 month follow up beta 0 261 p 004 conclusion addressing parental personal time burden in fap treatment might possibly support the improvement on the child level replication of result in larger sample is warranted to gain more insight into the direction of influence and in that way to optimize treatment for pediatric fap

hyperactive error related brain activity ha been found in individual with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd generalized and social anxiety a well a depression and ha been proposed a a transdiagnostic marker the specific phenotype to which it is related is still debated and anxious apprehension threat sensitivity and checking have been proposed a promising candidate to validate the idea that hyperactive performance monitoring is shared by anxiety and anxiety related disorder and to refine our knowledge about it specificity data from further anxiety and anxiety related disorder are required we examined performance monitoring in 24 participant with health anxiety and 24 healthy participant further we compared result to performance monitoring data from 24 patient with ocd taken from a previously published study riesel et al 2014 the three group were matched with regard to age gender and level of education the error related and correct related negativity ern crn derived during a flanker task served a neural indicator of performance monitoring participant with health anxiety showed enhanced ern amplitude compared to healthy control and did not differ from ocd patient in ern the health anxiety and healthy control group did not differ in crn amplitude while ocd patient showed enhanced crn amplitude the result suggest that health anxiety is characterized by hyperactive error monitoring that seems to represent a common information processing dysfunction in health anxiety and ocd this validates the idea that hyperactive error monitoring cut across diagnosis and seems to be a transdiagnostic trait shared by individual that are highly sensitive to the commission of error

introduction depression in child and adolescent is still underdiagnosed valid and brief screening tool for these age group are missing objective for child and adolescent in particular we developed the screening tool child s and desteen and assessed their validity a opposed to established instrument method both screener were validated in a paediatric 228 child 316 adolescent and a clinical sample 77 child 87 adolescent gold standard for validation were icd 10 diagnosis of a depressive episode or dysthymia based on a structured interview using receiver operating characteristic analysis the area under the curve auc and the cut offs with the highest sum of sensitivity and specificity were computed in addition it wa examined whether the instrument differed significantly in validity measure result point prevalence were 5 3 child and 9 8 adolescent in paediatric care and 23 5 and 26 1 in clinical care the 8 item child s yielded auc of 98 and 93 in the paediatric and in the clinical sample sensitivity were 100 and 94 with specificity of 87 and 78 the abbreviated 6 item desteen showed an auc of 95 in both setting sensitivity were 100 and 91 in the paediatric and in the clinical sample specificity were 82 and 89 being even shorter the two screening tool performed equally well or better than the established instrument conclusion the child s and the desteen discriminate well between depression and depression like symptom in somatic disease a well a between depression and other form of mental disorder valid and brief they can both be recommended for usage in paediatric and clinical setting

background sleep disorder and vitamin d deficiency are highly prevalent health problem few study examined the effect of vitamin d concentration on objectively measured sleep with high methodological quality and temporal proximity previous analysis within the life adult study suggested that a lower concentration of serum vitamin d wa associated with both shorter and later night sleep however no conclusion about underlying mechanism could be drawn we addressed the question whether this relationship is explained by the presence of depressive syndrome which are linked to both vitamin d deficiency and sleep disturbance method it wa investigated whether the association of vitamin d concentration and night sleep parameter is mediated or moderated by depressive symptomatology we investigated a subset n 1252 of the community sample from the life adult study in which sleep parameter had been objectively assessed using actigraphy based on which two sleep parameter were calculated night sleep duration and midsleep time serum 25 oh d concentration were measured using an electrochemiluminescence immunoassay depressive symptomatology wa evaluated with the centre for epidemiological study depression scale the mediation effect wa analyzed by using hayes process macro tool for spss for window result the depressive symptomatology wa neither significantly associated with night sleep duration nor midsleep time the association between vitamin d concentration and night sleep duration midsleep time through mediation by depressive symptomatology were not significant corresponding moderator analysis were also non significant conclusion the association between vitamin d concentration and night sleep parameter sleep duration and midsleep time seem to be neither mediated nor moderated by depressive symptomatology

recent evidence confirms that emotion can trigger executive attentional control participant resolve conflict faster when encountering emotionally negative or positive stimulus this effect is accompanied by an enlarged conflict negativity in event related brain potential erps and activation of the ventral anterior cingulate cortex acc in fmri here we tested whether temperament the trait effortful control and subclinical factor anxiety depression can influence the emotional modulation of executive attention these factor correlated with conflict processing in six experiment that utilized different conflict task flanker simon and different type of emotional stimulus visual auditory participant high in effortful control and low in anxiety and depression responded faster to conflict processing in emotional stimulus showed an enhanced erp conflict negativity and additional activation in the ventral acc the data show that temperamental effortful control depression and anxiety are related to the influence of emotion on executive attention and it underlying neural correlate

overactive performance monitoring indexed by greater error related brain activity ha been frequently observed in individual with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd similar alteration have been found in individual with major depressive and generalized anxiety disorder the main objective wa to extend these finding by investigating performance monitoring in individual with social anxiety disorder sad and to evaluate the specificity of performance monitoring change in ocd event related potential were used to examine error related brain activity during a flanker task in 24 individual with ocd 24 individual with sad and 24 healthy control with no history of neurological or psychiatric disorder error related negativity ern and correct related negativity served a electrophysiological indicator for performance monitoring enhanced ern wa expected for both clinical group but differential association with clinical symptom were explored ern amplitude were larger in individual with ocd and sad than in healthy control correlational analysis did not reveal significant association between ern and clinical symptomatology in ocd but a significant correlation with depressive symptom wa found in the sad group these finding further strengthen the idea that overactive performance monitoring is independent of clinical symptom in ocd furthermore it may also represent a transdiagnostic vulnerability indicator although the relationship with clinical symptom observed in the sad group need additional evaluation

the objective of this study were to investigate the naturalistic effectiveness of routine inpatient treatment for patient with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd and to identify predictor of treatment outcome a routinely collected data set of 1 596 ocd inpatient m 33 9 year sd 11 7 60 4 female having received evidence based psychotherapy based on the cognitive behavioral therapy cbt in five german psychotherapeutic clinic wa analyzed effect size hedge g were calculated for several outcome variable to determine effectiveness predictor analysis were performed on a subsample n 514 m 34 3 year sd 12 2 60 3 female for this purpose the number of potential predictor wa reduced using factor analysis followed by multiple regression analysis to identify robust predictor effect size of various outcome variable could be classified a large g 1 34 of ocd symptom change predictor of change in ocd and depressive symptom were symptom severity at admission and general psychopathological distress in addition patient with higher social support and more washing compulsion benefited more from treatment subgroup analysis showed a distinct predictor profile of change in compulsion and obsession the result indicate that an evidence based psychotherapy program for ocd can be effectively implemented in routine inpatient care in addition to well established predictor social support and washing compulsion in particular were identified a important positive predictor specific predictor profile for change in obsession and compulsion are discussed

rejection sensitivity r is defined a the disposition to anxiously expect readily perceive and overreact to social rejection cue aim of the two study presented in this paper wa to develop and administer an instrument to ass r in a german sample of healthy pre adolescent a well a in a clinical sample the english child s rejection sensitivity questionnaire crsq wa translated adapted and presented to a non clinical sample n 128 study i to identify psychometric property of the instrument in study ii the resulting questionnaire wa completed by a mixed clinical sample n 50 difference in result between sample and the relation between rejection sensitivity and mental distress were investigated the resulting german version of the questionnaire crsq german fragebogen zur zurückweisungsempfindlichkeit für kinder und jugendliche fze k showed good psychometric property difference between sample provide insight into the diversity of the construct rejection sensitivity

background somatoform disorder are characterized by multiple recurring symptom that resemble physical illness but defy medical explanation psychological model suggest that catastrophizing misinterpretation of harmless physical symptom play a key role however the question of whether such bias predict somatoform related symptom and the onset of somatoform disorder ha not been adressed hence the aim of the present study wa to further advance our understanding of the role of catastrophizing misinterpretation in somatoform disorder method in the present study we used data from the dresden predictor study n 1538 in which an epidemiologic sample of young german woman wa tested at two time point approximately 17 month apart each participant completed a diagnostic interview an interpretation questionnaire for somatoform and hypochondriacal symptom and three measure of such symptomatology somatization subscale of the symptom checklist 90 revised scl 90 r whiteley index wi body sensation questionnaire bsq result at follow up 33 woman were diagnosed with new onset of lifetime somatoform disorder result showed that catastrophizing misinterpretation assessed at baseline were predictive of somatoform related symptom at follow up i e symptom assessed with the wi and bsq moreover catastrophizing misinterpretation were predictive of new onset of somatoform disorder even after controlling for general threat related misinterpretation and index of somatoform symptom i e scl 90 r and bsq conclusion this is the first prospective longitudinal study to demonstrate that catastrophizing misinterpretation have incremental validity a predictor of future somatoform related symptomatology and somatoform disorder

overeating behavior is supposedly a major contributing factor to weight gain and obesity binge eating disorder bed with reoccurring episode of excessive overeating is strongly associated with obesity learning model of overeating behavior and bed assume that mere confrontation with food lead to a conditioned response that is experienced a food craving accordingly individual with obesity and bed were shown to have high trait food craving to date little is known about difference in state food craving and cue reactivity at the sight of palatable food in individual with obesity and bed compared to individual with obesity without bed therefore the aim of our study wa to examine difference in cue induced state and trait food craving in people with obesity with and without bed we found that all aspect of food craving were more prevalent in individual with obesity and bed than in individual without bed by implementing a food cue reactivity paradigm our result show that individual with obesity with bed have more cue induced craving than individual with obesity without bed moreover these cue induced craving in individual with obesity and bed were highest for high fat and high sugar food a opposed to low calorie food thus our result emphasize the role of increased cue reactivity and craving at the sight of palatable food in individual with obesity and bed hence our finding support etiological model of conditioned binge eating and are in line with intervention targeting cue reactivity in bed

in compound hierarchical stimulus also known a navon figure a global precedence effect gpe can reliably be observed for both letter and non letter however when presentation condition sufficiently resemble those of reading the gpe for letter ha occasionally been found to disappear we corroborate this effect in a study with a large group of participant in addition in between two session participant were trained in associating the non letter with either phonological or non phonological sound we reasoned that learning distinctive phonological association might be akin to the acquisition of letter knowledge this might eliminate the gpe also for the non letter however the gpe persisted for the trained non letter in both condition the large number of participant in this study revealed additional effect in the letter condition which enabled further insight in the processing dissociation between letter and non letter shape

objective childhood trauma is highly prevalent and can have a negative impact on the development of socioemotional process resulting in a higher vulnerability for mental disorder in adulthood previous study have associated the severity of childhood trauma with deficit in social functioning such a a negative attention bias suggesting altered social information processing a a mechanism underlying the association between childhood trauma and transdiagnostic psychopathology method in a cross sectional setup with a total of 103 participant 26 with major depressive disorder mdd 24 with posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd 22 with somatic symptom disorder sdd and 31 healthy volunteer hv this study applied eye tracking in an emotion recognition paradigm reaction time accuracy and gaze behavior were analyzed for 4 different facial expression a a function of self reported childhood trauma and diagnosis the aim wa to investigate to what extent emotion processing is associated with a childhood trauma b psychopathology and c respective interacting effect result patient showed higher reaction time and error rate overall in classifying emotion than hvs especially for the recognition of anger and fear individual with a diagnosis of ptsd and mdd were particularly slow in their response to these emotion higher score of reported childhood trauma were associated with faster response for classifying anger and fear and slower initiation of eye movement for ssd mdd and hvs for anger conclusion these finding indicate that childhood trauma may contribute to attentional and information processing bias relevant for social interaction identifying individual social deficit offer implication for tailored therapeutic intervention psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

objective risky behaviour seriously impact the life of adult patient with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd such behaviour have often been attributed to their exaggerated reward seeking but dysfunctional anticipation of negative outcome might also play a role method the present study compared adult patient with adhd n 28 with matched healthy control n 28 during anticipation of monetary loss versus gain while undergoing functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri and skin conductance recording result skin conductance wa higher during anticipation of loss compared to gain in both group affective rating of predictive cue did not differ between group adhd patient showed increased activity in bilateral amygdala left anterior insula region of interest analysis and left temporal pole whole brain analysis compared to healthy control during loss versus gain anticipation in the adhd group higher insula and temporal pole activation went along with more negative affective rating conclusion neural correlate of loss anticipation are not blunted but rather increased in adhd possibly due to a life history of repeated failure and the respective environmental sanction behavioural adaptation to such loss however might differentiate them from control future research should study whether negative affect might drive more risk seeking than risk avoidance

objective emotional eating ha been associated with high emotional reactivity suppression of negative emotion and inhibitory control difficulty the current study aimed to address the association of these factor and their combined effect on emotional eating method twenty eight participant conducted an emotional go nogo task including picture of neutral negative and positive scene and an additional emotion suppression condition electroencephalographic eeg activity wa recorded continuously emotional eating and habitual emotion suppression were assessed through questionnaire emotional reactivity to affective picture wa measured through a visual analogue scale and the amplitude of the electrophysiological late positive potential lpp inhibition parameter were assessed behaviorally i e commission error and through event related potential of the eeg i e n2 p3 amplitude result the trait questionnaire data revealed that emotional eating wa not correlated with habitual emotion suppression during the emotional go nogo paradigm higher emotional eating score were positively related to higher lpp amplitude in response to negative affective scene inhibitory control capacity were not related to emotional eating while watching neutral or negative picture but higher emotional eating score were associated with more commission error when negative emotion were suppressed discussion emotional eating tendency seem to be related to higher reactivity when confronted with negative affective information and inhibitory control deficit may arise especially when an effort is made to suppress these negative emotion therefore a focus on adaptive emotion regulation in treatment of emotional eating seems to be important solely targeting inhibitory control capacity may not be sufficient in order to help people with emotional eating to regulate their food intake

previous research in patient with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd ha indicated performance decrement in working memory wm and response inhibition however underlying neural mechanism of wm deficit are not well understood to date and empirical evidence for a proposed conceptual link to inhibition deficit is missing we investigated wm performance in a numeric n back task with four wm load condition during functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri in 51 patient with ocd and 49 healthy control participant who were matched for age sex and education additionally a stop signal task wa performed outside the mri scanner in a subsample on the behavioral level a significant wm load by group interaction wa found for both accuracy p 0 02 and reaction time measure p 0 03 indicating increased reaction time a well a reduced accuracy specifically at high wm load 3 back in patient with ocd whole brain analysis of fmri data identified neural correlate of a load dependent wm decrement in ocd in the supplementary motor area sma and the inferior parietal lobule ipl within the ocd sample sma activity a well a n back performance were correlated with stop signal task performance result from behavioral and fmri analysis indicate a reduced wm load dependent modulation of neural activity in ocd and suggest a common neural mechanism for inhibitory dysfunction and wm decrement in ocd

the study examined processing difference for facial expression happy angry or neutral and their repetition with early p1 n170 and late p3 event related potential erps in young child n 33 eeg wa recorded while child observed sequentially presented pair of facial expression which were either the same repeated trial or differed in their emotion novel trial we also correlated erp amplitude difference with parental and child measure of socio emotional competence emotion recognition empathy p1 amplitude were increased for angry and happy a compared to neutral expression we also detected larger p3 amplitude for angry expression a compared to happy or neutral expression repetition effect were evident at early and late processing stage marked by reduced p1 amplitude for repeated v novel happy expression but enhanced p3 amplitude for repeated v novel facial expression n170 amplitude were neither modulated by facial expression nor their repetition none of the repetition effect were associated with measure of socio emotional competence taken together negative facial expression led to increased neural activation in early and later processing stage indicative of enhanced saliency to potential threating stimulus in young child processing of repeated facial expression seem to be differential for early and late neural stage reduced activation wa detected at early neural processing stage particularly for happy face indicative of effective processing for an emotion which is most familiar within this age range contrary to our hypothesis enhanced activity for repeated v novel expression independent of a particular emotion were detected at later processing stage which may be linked to the creation of new memory trace early and late repetition effect are discussed in light of developmental and perceptual difference a well a task specific load

objective association between androgen and depressive symptom were mostly reported from cross sectional and patient based study study design main outcome measure longitudinal data from 4 110 participant of the study of health in pomerania were used to ass sex specific association of baseline total and free testosterone androstenedione and sex hormone binding globulin with incident depressive symptom and cognitive status at 5 and 10 year follow up result despite sex specific difference in depressive symptom prevalence at baseline woman 17 4 men 8 1 cross sectional analysis showed no association between sex hormone and depressive symptom in age adjusted longitudinal analysis total testosterone wa associated with incident depressive symptom relative risk at 5 year follow up 0 73 95 confidence interval 0 58 0 92 similarly age adjusted analysis showed a positive association between sex hormone binding globulin and cognitive status in men beta coefficient per standard deviation 0 44 95 confidence interval 0 13 0 74 in woman age adjusted association of androstenedione with baseline depressive symptom relative risk 0 88 95 confidence interval 0 77 0 99 were found none of the observed association remained after multivariable adjustment conclusion the present population based longitudinal study revealed inverse association between sex hormone and depressive symptom however the null finding after multivariable adjustment suggests that the observed association were not independent of relevant confounders including body mass index smoking and physical inactivity furthermore the low number of incident endpoint in our non clinical population based sample limited the statistical power and reduced the chance to detect a statistically significant effect

purpose mild depression ha been shown a a precursor and a a consequence of low back pain even in early phase of acute or subacute pain chronic daily life stress a well a dysfunctional pain related cognition such a thought suppression t seem to play a role in the pain depression cycle however the mechanism of these association are le understood experimentally induced t conceived a the attempt to directly suppress sensation such a pain ha been shown to paradoxically cause a delayed and non volitional return of the suppressed thought and sensation and to increase affective distress these dysfunctional process are supposed to increase under high cognitive load such a high stress method in the present cross sectional study we for the first time sought to examine a possible interaction between habitual t and stress on depression in n 177 patient with subacute low back pain slbp using the following questionnaire subscale thought suppression from avoidance endurance questionnaire beck depression inventory and kiel interview of subjective situation a three way anova wa conducted with two group of t high low stress high low and sex a independent factor and depression a dependent result result indicated a significant three way interaction with highest depression score in female patient showing high t and high stress overall main effect for sex and stress indicated higher depression in woman and in highly stressed patient conclusion our finding support the hypothesis that t heightens depressive mood under condition of high cognitive load especially in female patient with slbp indicating a special vulnerability for depressive mood in woman with slbp

in this study we investigated whether illusionary body ownership over artificial hand and non corporeal object modulates pain perception previous research ha yielded to mixed result but ha separated painful stimulation used to test pain perception from the stimulation that wa used to induce the illusion here we used a variant of the rubber hand illusion rhi paradigm and induced the illusion directly via a combination of visual and painful stimulus we presented heat pain stimulus at the real hand and visual stimulus beneath a rubber hand part1 or a glass ball part2 illusion rating were higher and pain rating were lower in the synchronous compared to the asynchronous condition in both part of the experiment this study demonstrated the successful induction of a body illusion using a new visual thermal method with painful stimulus we showed that the rhi and interestingly also the glass ball ha an analgesic effect on the perception of the heat pain stimulus our data suggests that induced ownership over artificial limb but also over non corporeal object can reduce the perceived pain perception this might be mediated via a partial referral of the perceived location of pain or respectively a distribution of pain over 2 location perspective this article present a new visual thermal method with painful stimulus for the induction of the rubber hand illusion an illusionary body ownership over artificial hand and non corporeal ha an analgesic effect on the perception of pain similar approach might be useful to alleviate chronic pain but need further testing

the present eye tracking study investigates whether individual with different level of contamination fear are more likely to focus their attention on disgusting stimulus to explore them or to pull their attention away to avoid them ninety two nonclinical participant with varying degree of contamination fear performed a dot probe task eye tracking methodology wa employed to record gaze pattern during the task in each trial participant looked at two picture disgust neutral fear neutral or neutral neutral participant were further asked about the content of the picture and the confidence of their answer the result show that reaction time were slower and fixation were longer and more frequent for disgust target compared with fear and neutral target which wa further amplified in individual with high contamination fear however image detail of disgusting picture were remembered le correctly than detail of fearful picture these finding confirm the idea that attention on disgusting stimulus is maintained further the finding indicate that disgust is processed more superficially and might also be related to disgust associated uncertainty and ambiguity the result may help to understand the difficult to change nature of disgust which could be relevant to habituation and extinction process in exposure therapy psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

background motivation to change ha been proposed a a prerequisite for behavioral change although empirical result are contradictory traumatic experience are frequently found amongst patient in alcohol treatment but this ha not been systematically studied in term of effect on treatment outcome this study aimed to clarify whether individual trauma load explains some of the inconsistency between motivation to change and behavioral change method over the course of two month in 2009 55 patient admitted to an alcohol detoxification unit of a psychiatric hospital were enrolled in this study at treatment entry we assessed lifetime trauma load and motivation to change mode of discharge wa taken from patient file following therapy we tested whether trauma load moderate the effect of motivation to change on dropout from alcohol detoxification using multivariate method result 55 4 dropped out of detoxification treatment while 44 6 completed the treatment age gender and day in treatment did not differ between completers and dropout patient who dropped out reported more traumatic event type on average than completers treatment completers had higher score in the urica subscale maintenance multivariate method confirmed the moderator effect of trauma load among participant with high trauma load treatment completion wa related to higher maintenance score at treatment entry this wa not true among patient with low trauma load conclusion we found evidence that the effect of motivation to change on detoxification treatment completion is moderated by trauma load among patient with low trauma load motivation to change is not relevant for treatment completion among highly burdened patient however who a priori have a greater risk of dropping out a high motivation to change might make the difference this finding justifies targeted and specific intervention for highly burdened alcohol patient to increase their motivation to change

objective power posing involves the adoption of an expansive bodily posture this study examined whether power posing could benefit individual with anorexia nervosa an and woman with normal weight in regard to interoceptive ability and affective state method participant included 50 inpatient and outpatient with an a well a 51 normal weight woman interoceptive accuracy iacc measured by the heartbeat tracking task and interoceptive sensibility is measured by confidence rating were assessed at baseline after a single power posing session and after 1 week of daily training also the short term effect of power posing on subjective feeling of dominance pleasantness and arousal were investigated result both group increased in their iacc after one power posing session also there wa a significant main effect of time on feeling of dominance and pleasantness in the short term woman with an displayed lower level of is dominance and pleasantness a well a higher level of arousal than woman without an discussion these finding suggest that power posing ha the potential to increase iacc subjective feeling of power and pleasant affect in the short term further research should investigate which mechanism foster the effectiveness of this intervention to tailor it to the need of woman with an

objective abundant research point to the central role of body image disturbance in the occurrence of eating disorder ed while emotional arousal ha been identified a a trigger for binge eating in bulimia nervosa bn empirical knowledge on the influence of emotion on body image in individual with bn is scarce the present study sought to experimentally examine effect of a positive and negative emotion induction on body dissatisfaction and selective attention towards negatively valenced body part among people with bn method in a randomized controlled cross over design happiness and sadness were induced by film clip one week apart in woman with bn n 23 and non ed control n 26 after the emotion induction participant looked at their body in a full length mirror while their attentional allocation wa recorded with the help of a mobile eye tracker participant repeatedly rated their momentary body dissatisfaction result induction of happiness led to a significant decrease in self reported body dissatisfaction furthermore attentional bias higher gaze duration and frequency towards the most disliked body part relative to the most liked body part wa significantly greater in the sadness than happiness condition in bn no significant effect of emotion induction on gaze duration and gaze frequency during mirror exposure were found for control discussion in line with assumption of current model on ed finding support the notion that emotional state influence the body image of patient with bn

a growing body of research aim at solving what is often referred to a the stimulus percept problem in olfactory perception although computational effort have made it possible to predict perceptual impression from the physicochemical space of odor study with large psychophysical datasets from non expert remain scarce following previous approach we developed a physicochemical odor space using 4094 molecular descriptor of 1389 odor molecule for 20 of these odor we examined association with perceived pleasantness intensity odor quality and detection threshold obtained from a dataset of 2000 naive participant our result show significant difference in perceptual rating and we were able to replicate previous finding on the association between perceptual rating and the first dimension of the physicochemical odor space however the present analysis also revealed striking interindividual variation in perceived pleasantness and intensity additionally interaction between pleasantness intensity and olfactory and trigeminal qualitative dimension were found to conclude our result support previous finding on the relation between structure and perception on the group level in our sample of non expert raters in the challenging task to relate olfactory stimulus and percept the physicochemical odor space can serve a a reliable and helpful tool to structure the high dimensional space of olfactory stimulus nevertheless human olfactory perception in the individual is not an analytic process of molecule detection alone but is part of a holistic integration of multisensory input context and experience

clark and well prominent model of social anxiety disorder sad assumes that cognitive variable such a negative expectation or dysfunctional cognition play a central role in the symptomatology of sad in contrast to adult it is le clear how well the cognitive model can be applied to child and adolescent a network analysis with seven node wa conducted to explore the importance of cognitive variable and their interaction with symptom of sad based on n 205 child and adolescent 8 18 year m 11 54 year cognitive variable had a high but differential impact within the positively connected network of sad dysfunctional cognition were most strongly connected within the network dysfunctional cognition a predicted by clark and well model seem to act a a hub affecting several symptom the association between negative expectation and avoidance indicates that negative expectation may particularly contribute to the maintenance of sad

background asylum seeking child and adolescent ascs resettled to western country show elevated level of psychological distress while research on the mental health of ascs is increasing le is known about their day to day living experience such a their daily mood sleep pattern and post migration factor moreover no examination in situ using smartphone assisted ecological momentary assessment ema ha been conducted up to now among ascs furthermore we do not know if screening measure succeed in reflecting the daily mood of ascs experienced in everyday life method we undertook a smartphone assisted ema study over a two week period with 3 measurement a day participant were n 40 ascs from 10 different country who had resettled to germany they completed standardized questionnaire screening for history of trauma and clinical symptom post traumatic stress symptom depression and anxiety that were carried out in interview like setting and they participated in the subsequent ema where they rated mood sleep parameter and post migration factor on a daily basis multilevel model of clinical symptom daily mood and sleep parameter were computed based on a total of 680 measurement result the multiply traumatized and highly distressed participant reported different level of discrimination and various social activity and contact in the ema the overall compliance rate wa shown to be 40 5 higher pt and anxiety score were associated with lower level of daily mood and poorer outcome of some sleep parameter depression score were not associated with any of the variable assessed in the ema conclusion smartphone assisted ema among ascs resettled to germany proved to be implementable despite a rather low compliance rate not only do ascs show high symptom level they are also affected by these symptom in their daily life the result emphasize the need for concise screening and psychological treatment for this high risk population limitation include the convenient nature of the sample and the lack of a comparison group

background indicator of increased error monitoring are associated with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd a shown in electroencephalography and functional magnetic resonance imaging study a most study used strictly controlled sample excluding comorbidity and medication it remains open whether these finding extend to naturalistic setting thus we assessed error related brain activity in a large naturalistic ocd sample we also explored which activity pattern might qualify a vulnerability endophenotypes or protective factor for the disorder to this aim a sample of unaffected first degree relative of patient with ocd wa also included method participant 84 patient with ocd 99 healthy control participant and 37 unaffected first degree relative of patient with ocd completed a flanker task while blood oxygen level dependent response were measured with functional magnetic resonance imaging aberrant error related brain activity in patient and relative wa identified result patient with ocd showed increased error related activity in the supplementary motor area and within the default mode network specifically in the precuneus and postcentral gyrus unaffected first degree relative showed increased error related activity in the bilateral inferior frontal gyrus conclusion increased supplementary motor area and default mode network activity in patient with ocd replicates previous study and might indicate excessive error signal and increased self referential error processing increased activity of the inferior frontal gyrus in relative may reflect increased inhibition impaired response inhibition in ocd ha been demonstrated in several study and might contribute to impairment in suppressing compulsive action thus increased inferior frontal gyrus activity in the unaffected relative of patient with ocd may have contributed to protection from symptom development

sleep disturbance and anxiety disorder exhibit high comorbidity level but it remains unclear whether sleep problem are cause or consequence of increased anxiety to experimentally probe the aetiological role of sleep disturbance in anxiety we investigated in healthy participant how total sleep deprivation influence fear expression in a conditioning paradigm in a fear conditioning procedure one face stimulus conditioned stimulus c wa paired with electric shock whereas another face stimulus wa not unpaired stimulus c fear expression wa tested the next morning using the two face stimulus from the training phase and a generalization stimulus i e a morph between the c and c stimulus between fear conditioning and test participant were either kept awake in the laboratory for 12 hr n 20 or had a night of sleep at home n 20 irrespective of stimulus type subjective threat expectancy but not skin conductance response were enhanced after sleep deprivation relative to regular sleep these result suggest that sleep disturbance may play a role in anxiety disorder by increasing perceived threat

active facebook use is positively linked to facebook addiction fa there is no significant link between passive facebook use and fa active facebook use contributes to the experience of facebook related flow in the longer term facebook flow serf a an antecedent of fa particularly individual with enhanced depression symptom are at risk for fa the present study investigated the link of active and passive facebook use facebook flow and depression symptom with facebook addiction fa data of 127 german facebook user m age sd age 25 10 7 03 range 18 58 were assessed at two measurement time point over a period of three month first measurement t1 second measurement t2 via online survey fa t2 wa significantly positively linked to active facebook use t1 facebook flow t1 and depression symptom t1 it relationship with passive facebook use t1 wa non significant facebook flow t1 positively mediated the association between active facebook use t1 and fa t2 in contrast active facebook use t1 did not serve a a mediator between facebook flow t1 and fa t2 given the non experimental design of the present study only hypothetical conclusion on causality can be drawn current result demonstrate that active facebook use could contribute to the experience of flow that serf a an antecedent of fa this is particularly relevant for individual with enhanced depression symptom the finding should be made a subject of discussion in education and prevention program and in therapeutic context

background and objective attentional process have been suggested to play a crucial role in resilience defined a positive adaptation facing adversity however research is lacking on association between attentional bias to positive and threat related stimulus attentional control and trait resilience method data stem from the follow up assessment of a longitudinal study investigating mental health and related factor among german soldier trait resilience wa assessed with the connor davidson resilience scale and attentional control with the attentional control scale a subset of n 198 soldier also completed a dot probe task with happy neutral and threatening face result attentional control wa positively related to trait resilience result revealed no association between both attentional bias and trait resilience however there wa a negative association between attentional bias to threat and trait resilience when attentional control wa low and a positive association between attentional bias to threat and trait resilience when attentional control wa high no such association were found for attentional bias to positive stimulus limitation generalizability to other population may be limited since we exclusively focused on male soldier also the cross sectional design doe not allow for causal conclusion conclusion finding suggest that attentional processing may promote trait resilience future research on preventive intervention should consider these finding

background recently the international classification of disease 11th revision icd 11 ha introduced a paradigm shift in personality disorder conceptualization the novel icd 11 personality disorder model comprises a dimensional assessment of personality dysfunction and five maladaptive personality trait domain maladaptive personality play a central role in eating pathology yet relation between the icd 11 personality disorder model and eating pathology are to date unclear thus this study aimed to explore the bivariate incremental and interactive association of the icd 11 personality disorder model component with eating pathology domain method a predominantly female 85 sample of 888 german speaking community adult completed validated self report measure of personality dysfunction the icd 11 personality trait domain and five eating pathology domain drive for thinness bulimia body dissatisfaction orthorexia binge eating bivariate and hierarchical regression model were used to investigate bivariate incremental and interactive relation between the icd 11 personality disorder model component and eating pathology result personality dysfunction and the icd 11 personality trait domain showed statistically significant bivariate relation with eating pathology additionally personality dysfunction and most icd 11 personality trait domain displayed incremental link with eating pathology finally the relation of the icd 11 personality trait domain with eating pathology were largely independent of the severity of personality dysfunction conclusion this study indicated that all icd 11 personality disorder model component are uniquely linked to eating pathology beyond maladaptive personality trait domain the strong and incremental relation of personality dysfunction with eating pathology have potential implication for theory building further research using longitudinal design is needed to evaluate causal link between the icd 11 personality disorder model component and eating pathology the international classification of disease 11th revision icd 11 contains a novel personality disorder model we explored how this model s component i e personality dysfunction five maladaptive personality trait relate to eating pathology the model component were significantly and complementarily related to a drive for thinness bulimia body dissatisfaction orthorexia and binge eating hence the icd 11 personality disorder model may potentially prove helpful in better understanding individual difference in eating pathology eng

purpose the aim of this study wa to examine the effectiveness of a combined cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia cbt i and hypnotherapy for insomnia ht i program for insomnia patient with or without additional depression regarding depressive symptom and various sleep parameter patient and method a sample of 63 patient suffering from insomnia received a six session sleep intervention which combined cognitive behavioral and hypnotherapeutical element due to violating exclusion criterion data of 37 patient were analyzed ten patient had insomnia comorbid with depression whereas 27 patient had insomnia only sleep diary were implemented to measure various sleep parameter whereas depressive symptomatology wa assessed with the anxiety and depression scale and symptom checklist 90 r at baseline before and after the intervention a well a at 3 month follow up result depressive symptom decreased from pre to post measurement and follow up for patient with insomnia comorbid with depression whereas score of patient with only insomnia remained relatively on a low level both group showed a significant increase of sleep efficiency and a significant decrease of the duration of wake after sleep onset however only patient with insomnia and depression revealed a significant reduction of sleep onset latency and a higher level of regeneration nondepressive insomniac on the other hand showed a significant increase of performance from post measurement to follow up for both group no change over time wa found for number of wake after sleep onset total sleep time mood in the morning and evening conclusion combining cbt i and ht i is effective in reducing depressive symptom and improving sleep therefore nonresponders to other form of therapy eg pharmacological interpersonal or cognitive behavioral therapy might benefit from the combined cbt i ht i intervention

while previous study successfully identified the core neural substrate of the animal subtype of specific phobia only few and inconsistent research is available for dental phobia these finding might partly relate to the fact that typically visual stimulus were employed the current study aimed to investigate the influence of stimulus modality on neural fear processing in dental phobia thirteen dental phobics dp and thirteen healthy control hc attended a block design functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri symptom provocation paradigm encompassing both visual and auditory stimulus drill sound and matched neutral sinus tone served a auditory stimulus and dentist scene and matched neutral video a visual stimulus group comparison showed increased activation in the insula anterior cingulate cortex orbitofrontal cortex and thalamus in dp compared to hc during auditory but not visual stimulation on the contrary no differential autonomic reaction were observed in dp present result are largely comparable to brain area identified in animal phobia but also point towards a potential downregulation of autonomic outflow by neural fear circuit in this disorder finding enlarge our knowledge about neural correlate of dental phobia and may help to understand the neural underpinnings of the clinical and physiological characteristic of the disorder

social pain is an emotional reaction to social exclusion which ha been widely investigated in experimental setting we developed the social pain questionnaire spq and examined it factor structure reliability and construct validity we constructed a 46 item pool that covered a broad range of situation related to social pain using three different subsamples online convenience sample n 623 representative sample n 2531 clinical sample of outpatient seeking psychotherapy n 270 we reduced the item pool to 10 item for the final spq scale paying particular attention to content validity and factorial structure convergent divergent and discriminant validity were assessed using standardized measure of related construct and group difference for the final 10 item version a good factorial structure and reliability were found convergent validity wa supported by correlation with related instrument of interpersonal sensitivity attachment style depression and social anxiety the representative and clinical sample differed significantly in social pain the spq is an economic self report measure with solid psychometric property our data support the factorial construct and convergent validity the spq can be used to clarify the role of social pain in mental disorder and to incorporate intervention targeted towards social pain in psychotherapeutic setting

background and objective this study evaluated the effectiveness of a telephone based cognitive behavioral therapy for family caregiver of people with dementia in existing health care provision structure research design and method two hundred seventy three family caregiver of people with dementia were randomly assigned to receive the intervention or usual care usual care included unrestricted access to community resource intervention group participant received twelve 50 min session of individual cognitive behavioral therapy by trained psychotherapist within 6 month symptom of depression emotional well being physical health symptom burden of care coping with the care situation and challenging behavior were assessed after the intervention ended and at a 6 month follow up intention to treat analysis using latent change model were applied result intention to treat analysis showed improved emotional well being gamma 9 59 p 001 fewer symptom of depression gamma 0 23 p 043 fewer physical health symptom gamma 0 25 p 019 improved coping with the care situation gamma 0 25 p 005 and the behavior of the care recipient gamma 0 23 p 034 compared with usual care effect for coping gamma 0 28 p 006 and gamma 0 39 p 001 respectively and emotional well being gamma 7 61 p 007 were also found at follow up discussion and implication the cbt based telephone intervention increased mental and physical health a well a coping ability of family caregiver of people with dementia the intervention can be delivered by qualified cbt therapist after an 8 h training session in existing health care provision structure

reliability and validity of the opd ca conflict questionnaire in an adolescent inpatient sample abstract abstract the opd ca conflict questionnaire opd ca cq ass intrapsychic conflict according to the operationalized psychodynamic diagnosis in childhood and adolescence opd ca 2 in a simple and time efficient way the questionnaire exists in two version a a self report measure for adolescent and a an informant report measure for therapist we examined the psychometric criterion of the questionnaire internal consistency construct validity convergent validity in a sample of adolescent inpatient overall result were heterogeneous some scale of the questionnaire seem to be suitable for assessing the corresponding intrapsychic conflict while others require a critical review particularly the conflict scale closeness v distance and submission v control need revision

background and objective cognitive behavioural model postulate that individual with bdd engage in negative appearance related appraisal and affect external representation of one s appearance are thought to activate a specific mode of processing characterized by increased self focused attention and an activation of negative appraisal and affect method the present study used a think aloud approach including an in vivo body exposure to examine body related cognition and affect in individual with bdd n 30 a compared to individual with major depression n 30 and healthy control n 30 participant were instructed to think aloud during baseline exposure and follow up trial result individual with bdd verbalized more body related and more negative body related cognition during all trial and reported higher degree of negative affect than both control group a weaker increase of positive body related cognition during exposure a stronger increase of sadness and anger after exposure and higher level of post event processing were specific process in individual with bdd limitation individual with major depression were not excluded from the bdd group this is associated with a reduction of internal validity a the two clinical group are somewhat interwoven key finding need to be replicated conclusion the finding indicate that outcome such a negative appearance related cognition and affect are specific to individual with bdd an external representation of one s appearance activates a specific mode of processing in bdd manifesting itself in the absence of positive body related cognition increased anger and sadness and high level of post event processing these specific process may contribute toward maintenance of bdd psychopathology

depression is associated with abnormality in pattern of information processing particularly in the context of processing of interpersonal information the present study wa designed to investigate the difference in depressive individual in cortical processing of facial stimulus when neutral face were presented in a context that involved information about emotional valence a well a self reference in 21 depressive patient and 20 healthy control event related potential erps were recorded during the presentation of neutral facial expression which were accompanied by affective context information that wa either self or other related across condition depressive patient showed larger mean p100 amplitude than healthy control furthermore mean late positive potential lpp amplitude of depressive patient were larger in response to face in self related than in other related context in addition irrespective of self reference mean lpp response of depressive patient to face presented after socially threatening sentence were larger compared with face presented after neutral sentence result regarding self reference supported result of previous study indicating larger mean amplitude in self related condition finding suggest a general heightened initial responsiveness to emotional cue and a sustained emotion processing of socially threatening information in depressive patient
