a deficit in emotion recognition ha been suggested to underlie conduct problem although several study have been conducted on this topic so far most concentrated on male participant the aim of the current study wa to compare recognition of morphed emotional face in girl with conduct problem cp with elevated or low callous unemotional cu v cu trait and a matched healthy developing control group cg sixteen girl with cp cu 16 girl with cp cu and 32 control mean age 13 23 year sd 2 33 year were included video clip with morphed face were presented in two run to ass emotion recognition multivariate analysis of variance with the factor group and run wa performed girl with cp cu needed more time than the cg to encode sad fearful and happy face and they correctly identified sadness le often girl with cp cu outperformed the other group in the identification of fear learning effect throughout run were the same for all group except that girl with cp cu correctly identified fear le often in the second run compared to the first run result need to be replicated with comparable task which might result in subgroup specific therapeutic recommendation

objective this study examined the widely held but insufficiently studied hypothesis of autonomy disturbance in anorexia nervosa method a total sample of 112 participant comprising patient with acute anorexia nervosa an woman recovered from anorexia nervosa rec clinical control cc and healthy control hc completed measure of dependency and intimacy striving a well a measure of frustration of these same striving result in comparison to hc and cc an showed a stronger motivation to avoid dependency and lower striving for intimacy compared with hc but not with cc an also showed stronger frustration of the same motif whereas rec did not differ from an regarding avoidance of dependency they reported lower frustration of dependency avoidance i e le actual experience of dependency finally rec reported higher intimacy motivation a well a better satisfaction of intimacy motivation a compared with an conclusion the present finding suggest that a pronounced motive of avoiding dependency may be a vulnerability factor for anorexia nervosa that is disorder specific and trait like frustration of this motive seem to be associated with psychopathology

objective predictive processing approach to belief updating in depression propose that depression is related to more negative and more precise prior also belief updating is assumed be negatively biased in comparison to normative bayesian updating there is a lack of efficient method to mathematically model belief updating in depression method we validated a novel performance belief updating paradigm in a nonclinical sample n 133 participant repeatedly participated in a non self related emotion recognition task and received false feedback effect of the feedback manipulation and difference in depressive symptom on belief updating were analysed in bayesian multilevel analysis result belief were successfully manipulated through the feedback provided depressive symptom were associated with more negative updating than normative bayesian updating but result were influenced by few case no evidence of biased change in belief or overly precise prior wa found depressive symptom were associated with more negative updating of generalised performance belief conclusion there wa cautious support for negatively biased belief updating associated with depressive symptom especially for generalised belief the content of the task may not be self relevant enough to cause strong bias further explication of bayesian model of depression and replication in clinical sample is needed

threat detection play a vital role in adapting behavior to changing environment a fundamental function to improve threat detection is learning to differentiate between stimulus predicting danger and safety accordingly aversive learning should lead to enhanced sensory discrimination of danger and safety cue however study investigating the psychophysics of visual and auditory perception after aversive learning show divergent finding and both enhanced and impaired discrimination after aversive learning have been reported therefore the aim of this web based study is to examine the impact of aversive learning on a continuous measure of visual discrimination to this end 205 participant underwent a differential fear conditioning paradigm before and after completing a visual discrimination task using differently oriented grating stimulus participant saw either unpleasant or neutral picture a unconditioned stimulus u result demonstrated sharpened visual discrimination for the u associated stimulus c but not for the unpaired conditioned stimulus c importantly this finding wa irrespective of the u s valence these finding suggest that associative learning result in increased stimulus salience which facilitates perceptual discrimination in order to prioritize attentional deployment

face to face social interaction are characterized by the reciprocal exchange of facial emotion between interaction partner typically facial emotional expression have been studied in passive observation paradigm while interactive mechanism remain unknown in the current study we investigate how sending a facial emotional expression influenced the evaluation of an emotional expression received in return sixty eight participant were cued to direct a facial emotional expression happy angry neutral towards a virtual agent in front of them the virtual agent then responded with either the same or another emotional expression happy angry evaluation of the response expression wa measured via rating of valence and arousal a well a emg recording of the m corrugator supercilii and the m zygomaticus major result revealed a significant interaction between the emotion of the initial facial expression and the response expression valence of happy response expression were increased when participant had initially displayed a smile compared to a neutral expression or a frown this wa also reflected in the emg response initiating an interaction with a smile increased zygomaticus activation for happy relative to angry response expression compared to when the interaction wa initiated with a frown in contrast no interplay of the initial and the response expression wa observed in the corrugator these finding demonstrate that smiling or frowning at another person can modulate socio emotional processing of subsequent social cue therefore the present study highlight the interactive nature of facial emotional expression

background in europe men have lower rate of attempted suicide compared to woman and at the same time a higher rate of completed suicide indicating major gender difference in lethality of suicidal behaviour the aim of this study wa to analyse the extent to which these gender difference in lethality can be explained by factor such a choice of more lethal method or lethality difference within the same suicide method or age in addition we explored gender difference in the intentionality of suicide attempt method and finding method design epidemiological study using a combination of self report and official data setting mental health care service in four european country germany hungary ireland and portugal data basis completed suicide derived from official statistic for each country 767 act 74 4 male and assessed suicide attempt excluding habitual intentional self harm 8 175 act 43 2 male main outcome measure and data analysis we collected data on suicidal act in eight region of four european country participating in the eu funded ospi europe project www ospi europe com we calculated method specific lethality using the number of completed suicide per method 100 number of completed suicide per method number of attempted suicide per method we tested gender difference in the distribution of suicidal act for significance by using the chi2 test for two by two table we assessed the effect size with phi coefficient phi we identified predictor of lethality with a binary logistic regression analysis poisson regression analysis examined the contribution of choice of method and method specific lethality to gender difference in the lethality of suicidal act finding main result suicidal act fatal and non fatal were 3 4 time more lethal in men than in woman lethality 13 91 regarding 4106 suicidal act versus 4 05 regarding 4836 suicidal act the difference being significant for the method hanging jumping moving object sharp object and poisoning by substance other than drug median age at time of suicidal behaviour 35 44 year did not differ between male and female the overall gender difference in lethality of suicidal behaviour wa explained by male choosing more lethal suicide method odds ratio or 2 03 95 ci 1 65 to 2 50 p 0 000001 and additionally but to a lesser degree by a higher lethality of suicidal act for male even within the same method or 1 64 95 ci 1 32 to 2 02 p 0 000005 result of a regression analysis revealed neither age nor country difference were significant predictor for gender difference in the lethality of suicidal act the proportion of serious suicide attempt among all non fatal suicidal act with known intentionality nfsai wa significantly higher in men 57 1 1 207 of 2 115 nfsai than in woman 48 6 1 508 of 3 100 nfsai chi2 35 74 p 0 000001 main limitation of the study due to restrictive data security regulation to ensure anonymity in ireland specific age could not be provided because of the relatively low absolute number of suicide in the irish intervention and control region therefore analysis of the interaction between gender and age could only be conducted for three of the four country attempted suicide were assessed for patient presenting to emergency department or treated in hospital an unknown rate of attempted suicide remained undetected this may have caused an overestimation of the lethality of certain method moreover the detection of attempted suicide and the registration of completed suicide might have differed across the four country some suicide might be hidden and misclassified a undetermined death conclusion men more often used highly lethal method in suicidal behaviour but there wa also a higher method specific lethality which together explained the large gender difference in the lethality of suicidal act gender difference in the lethality of suicidal act were fairly consistent across all four european country examined male and female did not differ in age at time of suicidal behaviour suicide attempt by male were rated a being more serious independent of the method used with the exception of attempted hanging suggesting gender difference in intentionality associated with suicidal behaviour these finding contribute to understanding of the spectrum of reason for gender difference in the lethality of suicidal behaviour and should inform the development of gender specific strategy for suicide prevention

objective persistent dysfunctional expectation seem to be core feature of mental disorder the aim of this study wa to develop a questionnaire that ass mechanism responsible for the consistency of dysfunctional expectation process before i e assimilation and after i e immunization expectation violating experience have been considered design the immunization scale ims is constructed and validated with the help of an explorative efa and confirmatory factor analysis cfa in two conducted study material and method for the first study the initially formulated 75 item version wa completed online by 230 range 18 69 participant from a convenience sample for the second study 299 range 18 62 participant completed the reduced scale at the first measurement point 75 participant thereof also 1 month later for validity and reliability analysis participant in both study provided demographic information the beck depression inventory bdi ii the depressive expectation scale de the beck anxiety inventory bai and the german version of the acceptance and action questionnaire fah ii result the initial 75 item were reduced to 23 item the efa revealed three main factor namely negative expectation assimilation and cognitive immunization the three factor structure could be confirmed in study 2 by the cfa reliability measure showed an excellent internal consistency for the entire ims a very good test retest reliability wa found significant correlation resulted between the ims and de bdi ii bai and fah ii the highest for de and fah ii conclusion psychometric property of the ims are promising future study should verify the reliability and validity measure in other population sample the ims can be very useful in expectation research especially in the examination of expectation focused therapy

pathological health anxiety refers to the medically unfounded fear of suffering from a severe illness difference in cognitive process related to attention memory and evaluation of health threat have been hypothesized to underlie pathological health anxiety in no study however have researcher systematically and simultaneously assessed different cognitive bias on the basis of the idea that multiple cognitive bias simultaneously contribute to psychopathology the combined cognitive bias hypothesis we compared 88 patient with pathological health anxiety 52 patient with depressive disorder and 52 healthy participant on their performance in several cognitive task involving health threatening content individual with pathological health anxiety showed a stronger attentional bias to health threat related information more negative explicit but not implicit evaluation of health threat and biased response behavior in light of health threat the result suggest that stronger binding between feeling of arousal and health threatening information in working memory might be crucial for the higher salience of health threatening content in pathological health anxiety

abstract background although intrusion are the hallmark symptom of posttraumatic stress disorder there is still limited knowledge about the process that contribute to the development of intrusion here we used the well established trauma film paradigm tfp to investigate how expectation about the intensity and controllability of intrusion influence their occurrence method 90 healthy participant underwent the tfp before they were randomized to one of three condition manipulating their expectation about intrusion positive expectation group negative expectation group control group the primary outcome wa the frequency and severity of intrusive memory a assessed with an intrusion diary over seven day result the tfp wa well implemented a indicated by significant post film anxiety and a substantial number of intrusion reported for the subsequent week the three group did not differ in their expectation about intrusion and relatedly in their experience of intrusion a mediation analysis revealed that the influence of post film anxiety on intrusive memory wa fully mediated by expectation conclusion despite the failure of the expectation manipulation the result of the mediation analysis support the hypothesis that post film expectation influence the formation of intrusive memory suggesting that intrusion may result from maladaptive dynamic between emotional and cognitive process following trauma like experience

objective this study aimed to develop a self report questionnaire for the assessment of attack related fear in migraine and to determine it factor structure a well a it psychometric property by the primary analysis of a cross sectional survey s data background high fear of attack in migraine increase the burden of disease and is assumed to have a negative impact on the course of the disease little is known about the structure and dimensionality of attack related fear and a valid instrument for the comprehensive assessment is lacking method based on a literature search and interview with person with migraine a well a with experienced practitioner a 46 item self report questionnaire the fear of attack in migraine inventory fami wa developed a cross sectional online survey comprising an assessment of diagnostic criterion of migraine and a battery of questionnaire including the fami wa conducted n 387 person with migraine 364 387 94 1 woman m 40 9 sd 13 1 year migraine without aura 153 387 39 5 migraine with aura 85 387 22 0 and chronic migraine 149 387 38 5 result item selection led to 29 item for the fami exploratory factor analysis resulted in three clearly interpretable factor fear of negative consequence attention and anticipation fear avoidance a confirmatory factor analysis yielded an acceptable to good model fit chi 2 3 1328 84 p 0 001 chi 2 df 3 55 rmsea 0 085 srmr 0 073 cfi 0 98 and tli 0 97 reliability wa good fear avoidance omega 0 85 attention and anticipation omega 0 88 to excellent fear of negative consequence omega 0 91 correlational analysis confirmed the convergent validity of the fami conclusion the fami appears suitable and promising for the assessment of attack related fear in migraine research and clinical care

brain derived neurotrophic factor bdnf ha a crucial role in activity dependent synaptic plasticity and learning and memory the human functional single nucleotide bdnf rs6265 val66met polymorphism ha been found to be associated with alteration in neural bdnf release and function correlating with altered emotional behavior here we investigated for the first time the hypothesis that this polymorphism in human modulates the context dependency of conditioned fear response applying a new paradigm examining generalization of cued fear across context 70 participant stratified for bdnf val66met polymorphism were guided through two virtual office context in which briefly illuminated blue and yellow light served a cue in the fear context one light conditioned stimulus c but not the other light c wa associated with an electric shock unconditioned stimulus u in the safety context both light were presented too but no u wa delivered during the test phase light were presented again both in learning context and in a novel generalization context without any u all participant showed clear fear conditioning to the c in the fear context a indicated by potentiation of startle response and report of fear no fear reaction were found for the c in the safety context importantly generalization of fear response indicated by the potentiation of startle response to the c compared with the c in the novel context wa evident only in the met carrying group these are the first result to provide evidence in human that bdnf modulates the generalization of fear response such context dependent generalization process might predispose met carrier for affective and anxiety disorder

background positive mental health pmh ha been shown to confer resilience against suicide ideation however it is unclear whether pmh also buffer the relationship between suicide ideation and suicide attempt the current study aimed to determine whether pmh moderate the association between lifetime suicide ideation and lifetime suicide attempt method a total of 199 psychiatric inpatient with lifetime suicide attempt female n 109 age m 37 56 sd 14 38 range 18 81 were interviewed on lifetime suicide ideation behavior and completed a measure on pmh result pmh moderated the impact of lifetime suicide ideation on lifetime suicide attempt for those individual who reported high level of pmh the rate of lifetime suicide attempt wa reduced even when experiencing frequent episode of lifetime suicide ideation limitation given the cross sectional nature of the data conclusion on causality should be handled carefully conclusion pmh seems to confer resilience and should be taken into account when assessing individual for suicide risk

background perinatal marker of prenatal development are associated with offspring psychiatric symptom however there is little research investigating the specificity of perinatal marker for the development of specific disorder this study aimed to explore if perinatal marker are specifically associated with adolescent substance use disorder suds method adolescent participant from two study center one for sud patient n 196 and one for general psychopathology n 307 were recruited for participation since the sud participant presented with a number of comorbid disorder we performed a 1 on 1 matching procedure based on age gender and specific pattern of comorbid disorder this procedure resulted in n 51 participant from each group from all participant and their mother we recorded perinatal marker mode of birth week of completed pregnancy birth weight apgar score after 5 min a well a intelligence quotient iq the sud sample additionally filled out the youth safe report ysr a well a the pq 16 and the dudit we aimed to distinguish the two group sud sample v general psychiatric sample based on the perinatal variable via a logistic regression analysis additionally linear regression were performed for the total group and the subgroup to ass the relationship between perinatal variable and iq ysr dudit and pq 16 result the perinatal variable were not able to predict group membership x 2 4 4 77 p 312 cox snell r 2 0 053 odds ratio indicated a small increase in probability to belonging to the general psychiatric sample instead of the sud sample if birth wa completed via c section after bonferroni correction the linear regression model showed no relation between perinatal marker and iq p 60 r 2 0 068 ysr p 09 r 2 0 121 dudit p 65 r 2 0 020 and pq 16 p 73 r 2 0 021 conclusion perinatal marker were not able to distinguish sud patient from patient with diverse psychopathology this pattern contradicts previous finding perhaps because our chosen marker reflect general process instead of specific mechanistic explanation future study should take care to investigate specific prenatal marker and associate them with psychopathology on the symptom level

objective hypertension is often treated pharmacologically yet adherence is poor belief about antihypertensive medicine i e the necessity concern framework ncf are valuable for explaining adherence therefore a model structure is transferred from hypercholesterolemia to hypertension assuming a mediating role of the ncf method patient with hypertension n 273 were surveyed online about demographic health and treatment related factor control belief necessity and concern belief about their medication and adherence the data were analyzed using structural equation modeling sem result necessity wa positively beta 0 26 p 0 009 and concern wa negatively beta 0 51 p 0 020 associated with adherence the ncf mediated the influence of background variable on adherence necessity wa associated with comorbidity beta 0 36 p 0 001 treatment time beta 0 19 p 0 004 emotionally supportive doctor patient communication beta 0 12 p 0 045 side effect beta 0 16 p 0 013 personal control beta 0 13 p 0 022 and treatment control beta 0 29 p 0 001 concern wa associated with side effect beta 0 38 p 0 001 and belief about medicine in general being harmful beta 0 61 p 0 001 the model fit wa acceptable rmsea 0 61 conclusion the transferred adherence model with the necessity concern framework a a mediating factor wa confirmed in hypertension explaining more variance than previous approach 23 practice implication a personalized emotionally supportive doctor patient communication could be key to addressing belief about medicine and therefore to increasing adherence

objective empirical finding on self serving bias amongst psychotherapist are inconsistent we tested in a large naturalistic data set if therapist are prone to illusory superiority when estimating their patient outcome and whether this effect is buffered by therapist effectiveness method a post hoc analysis with n 69 therapist who treated n 1080 patient wa conducted therapist and patient mean rating for therapeutic improvement in the clinical global impression scale cgi were compared using a multilevel modelling approach we further investigated the relation between the patient therapist divergence in the cgi and actual therapeutic change in the global severity index gsi of the brief symptom inventory and in the satisfaction with life scale swls result rating in the cgi did not show significant difference between patient and therapist assessment of therapeutic change lower estimation by therapist compared to patient self report were associated with greater therapeutic change in gsi and swls conclusion therapist on a whole did not seem to be prone to illusory superiority when assessing therapeutic outcome contrary the more modest the therapist estimation of therapeutic outcome wa the greater the actual therapeutic change

objective gilles de la tourette syndrome gts is a neuropsychiatric condition characterized by motor and vocal tic there is undoubtedly basal ganglion involvement which are also important for cognitive process including performance monitoring and interference resolution we investigated these function in adult patient with gts compared to healthy control hcs method we compared a group of n 23 adult patient with gts to n 27 hc on a flanker task during an eeg recording reaction time and error rate were recorded a well a n2 and n e ern amplitude the n2 is an index of interference resolution the n e ern is a negative fronto central component occurring when participant make mistake result patient reaction time were enhanced on incongruent trial compared to hc electrophysiological data revealed more frontal component a well a significantly increased n e ern amplitude in patient with gts compared to hc p 0 026 conclusion altered electrophysiological correlate of error processing in adult patient with gts compared to hc cannot be attributed to differential error probability potentially patient recruit compensatory resource from frontal network to maintain behavioural performance significance this study give further insight into cognitive deficit of patient with gts and the underlying neural process of these function

importance electroconvulsive therapy ect is one of the most effective treatment for severe depression however biomarkers that accurately predict a response to ect remain unidentified objective to investigate whether certain factor identified by structural magnetic resonance imaging mri technique are able to predict ect response design setting and participant in this nonrandomized prospective study gray matter structure wa assessed twice at approximately 6 week apart using 3 t mri and voxel based morphometry patient were recruited through the inpatient service of the department of psychiatry university of muenster from march 11 2010 to march 27 2015 two patient group with acute major depressive disorder were included one group received an ect series in addition to antidepressant n 24 a comparison sample wa treated solely with antidepressant n 23 both group were compared with a sample of healthy control participant n 21 main outcome and measure binary pattern classification wa used to predict ect response by structural mri that wa performed before treatment in addition univariate analysis wa conducted to predict reduction of the hamilton depression rating scale score by pretreatment gray matter volume and to investigate ect related structural change result one participant in the ect sample wa excluded from the analysis leaving 67 participant 27 men and 40 woman mean sd age 43 7 10 6 year the binary pattern classification yielded a successful prediction of ect response with accuracy rate of 78 3 18 of 23 patient in the ect sample and sensitivity rate of 100 13 of 13 who responded to ect furthermore a support vector regression yielded a significant prediction of relative reduction in the hamilton depression rating scale score the principal finding of the univariate model indicated a positive association between pretreatment subgenual cingulate volume and individual ect response montreal neurological institute mni coordinate x 8 y 21 z 18 z score 4 00 p 001 peak voxel r 0 73 furthermore the analysis of treatment effect revealed a increase in hippocampal volume in the ect sample mni coordinate x 28 y 9 z 18 z score 7 81 p 001 that wa missing in the medication only sample conclusion and relevance a relatively small degree of structural impairment in the subgenual cingulate cortex before therapy seems to be associated with successful treatment with ect in the future neuroimaging technique could prove to be promising tool for predicting the individual therapeutic effectiveness of ect

objective the aim of the study wa to examine whether preoperative psychological intervention targeting patient expectation are capable of influencing the biological stress response after coronary artery bypass graft cabg surgery and could thus improve recovery after heart surgery method randomized controlled trial with assessment 10 day before surgery after psychological intervention day of hospital admission but before surgery postoperative 6 8 day later and at follow up 6 month after surgery eligible patient n 124 scheduled for elective on pump cabg or cabg with valve replacement surgery were approached before hospital admission standard medical care smc wa compared with two additional preoperative psychological intervention a an expectation manipulation intervention to optimize patient expectation about course and outcome or b supportive therapy containing the same amount of therapeutic attention but without specifically focusing on expectation postoperative plasma adrenaline noradrenaline and cortisol level were a secondary outcome of our study primary outcome patient disability 6 month after surgery and other secondary patient reported or clinical outcome were reported elsewhere result expectation manipulation intervention 3 68 ln pg ml 95 confidence interval 3 38 3 98 p 015 and supportive therapy 3 70 ln pg ml 95 confidence interval 3 38 4 01 p 026 led to significantly lower postoperative adrenaline level compared with smc 4 26 ln pg ml 95 confidence interval 3 99 4 53 only there were no treatment effect of the preoperative intervention for noradrenaline p 90 or cortisol p 30 higher postoperative adrenaline level predicted disability 6 month after surgery r 258 p 018 conclusion in addition to smc preoperative psychological intervention seem to buffer psychobiological stress response and could thus facilitate recovery from cabg surgery patient postoperative stress response could be an important factor for explaining trajectory of long term outcome clinical trial registration www clinicaltrials gov nct01407055

theoretical model and previous research suggest that post event processing pep after social situation maintains social anxiety disorder sad to date little is known about pep in childhood a critical period for disorder development or about possible positive effect of cognitive behavioral therapy cbt on pep in child child with sad n 71 aged 9 13 year and healthy control n 55 participated in a social stress task trier social stress test for child tsst c which wa repeated in child with sad after either 12 session of cbt or a waiting period pep wa assessed daily with regard to both valence and frequency a well a in more detail regarding specific negative and positive ruminative thought 1 week after each tsst c daily pep after the tsst c wa more frequent and more negative in child with sad compared to healthy control in particular during the first 2 day after the tsst c after cbt treatment child with sad reported more positive pep but not le negative pep compared to child in the waitlist control group the current study suggests that negative pep in child with sad is most pronounced in the first day following social stress group based cbt seems to be effective in building up positive cognition after social stress in child but developing specific intervention targeting negative pep immediately after a social stressor may be necessary to further increase treatment efficacy

background most survivor of mass violence live in low and middle income country lmics we conducted a meta analysis of randomized controlled psychotherapy trial for adult posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd and or depression in lmics method we included 18 clinical trial 3 058 participant in which 25 and 18 treatment arm measured symptom of ptsd and depression respectively result active treatment for ptsd yielded a large aggregated pre post effect size g 1 29 95 ci 0 99 1 59 and a small to medium effect size at posttreatment when compared to control condition g 0 39 95 ci 0 24 0 55 effect size were similar for pretreatment versus follow up g 1 75 95 ci 1 17 2 32 and in comparison to waitlist at follow up g 0 93 95 ci 0 56 1 31 active treatment for depression produced large pre post g 1 28 95 ci 0 96 1 61 and controlled effect size posttreatment comparison to control condition g 0 86 95 ci 0 54 1 18 conclusion our finding suggest that psychological intervention can effectively reduce symptom of ptsd and depression in lmics future research need to focus on cost effective intervention that are likely to be disseminated to the large number of war survivor in lmics

background and objective research on virtual reality exposure therapy vret ha demonstrated good treatment efficacy with regard to several anxiety disorder yet there is lack of knowledge about the value of integrating interaction between client and virtual human in vret such interaction might prove effective in treating psychological complaint that involve social interaction such a social anxiety method a vret system specifically designed to expose client with social anxiety disorder to anxiety provoking social situation wa applied to 16 and 18 individual with high and low level of social anxiety respectively participant engaged in two exposure session in several free speech dialogue with virtual human while being monitored by a therapist result participant with high level of social anxiety reported significantly lower level of social anxiety three month after exposure to two virtual reality interaction session than before treatment p 0 01 in the group with low level of social anxiety no significant change of social anxiety wa reported between pre treatment and follow up additionally participant in both group reported higher self efficacy three month after treatment than before treatment p 0 001 conclusion these finding indicate that virtual reality technology that incorporates social interaction may be successfully applied for therapeutic purpose

motivated by the recent replicability crisis we tested replicability of functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri group activation in two independent sample an identical behavioral and fmri test battery for the longitudinal investigation of stress resilience mechanism wa developed for the mainz resilience project marp and conducted in a discovery n 54 and a replication sample n 103 the test battery consisted of a stress reactivity task a reward sensitivity task a fear conditioning and extinction paradigm two volitional reappraisal task and an emotional interference inhibition task replicability of group activation wa tested with the jaccard index and the intra class correlation icc overall we observed good to excellent replicability of activation at the whole brain level only a minority of contrast showed unsatisfactory replicability replicability at the level of individual region of interest roi wa generally lower task with stronger activation in the discovery sample showed better replicability

body image disturbance is associated with several mental disorder previous research on body image ha focused mostly on woman largely neglecting body image in men moreover only a small number of study have conducted gender comparison of body image over the lifespan and included participant aged 50 year and older with regard to measurement body image ha often been assessed only in term of body dissatisfaction disregarding further aspect such a body appreciation or the importance of appearance the aim of this cross sectional study wa to explore different aspect of body image in the general german speaking population and to compare men and woman of various age participant completed an online survey comprising questionnaire about body image body dissatisfaction importance of appearance the number of hour per day participant would invest and the number of year they would sacrifice to achieve their ideal appearance and body appreciation were assessed and analyzed with respect to gender and age difference we hypothesized that body dissatisfaction and importance of appearance would be higher in woman than in men that body dissatisfaction would remain stable across age in woman and that importance of appearance would be lower in older woman compared to younger woman body appreciation wa predicted to be higher in men than in woman general and generalized linear model were used to examine the impact of age and gender in line with our hypothesis body dissatisfaction wa higher in woman than in men and wa unaffected by age in woman and importance of appearance wa higher in woman than in men however only in men did age predict a lower level of the importance of appearance compared to men woman stated that they would invest more hour of their life to achieve their ideal appearance for both gender age wa a predictor of the number of year participant would sacrifice to achieve their ideal appearance contrary to our assumption body appreciation improved and wa higher in woman across all age than in men the result seem to suggest that men s and woman s body image are dissimilar and appear to vary across different age

introduction defeat and entrapment are transdiagnostic construct that play an important role in the development of depression anxiety suicidality and trauma associated mental disorder the present study aimed at presenting and validating a first german version of the defeat scale d d material and method through a web based survey n 480 participant were recruited 74 female m age 28 5 sd age 11 1 range 18 80 year 14 2 reported to currently suffer from a mental disorder 8 5 reported at least one lifetime suicide attempt all participant filled in the d d the entrapment scale the rasch based depression screening the depressive symptom inventory suicidality subscale the suicidal behavior questionnaire revised the childhood trauma screener and the questionnaire generalized anxiety disorder 2 factorial validity wa investigated through a unidimensional confirmatory factor analysis cfa moreover internal consistency convergent validity correlation with the other measured construct and criterion validity suicidality were examined result one residual correlation between 2 item that are inversely coded had to be allowed to reach a satisfying fit to the unidimensional model rmsea 0 077 tli 0 94 nfi 0 93 cfi 0 95 item loading 0 56 the d d sumscore correlated highly with depression r 0 87 entrapment r 0 83 and suicidality r 0 70 and moderately with the other construct participant with suicidal thought or behavior in the past showed higher d d score than participant without suicidality discussion the unidimensional structure of the english version could be confirmed in the d d after allowing for a residual correlation between two inversely coded item correlation with the other measured construct give support for the validity of the d d criterion validity of the instrument is supported by it relation to suicidality it remains open whether defeat and entrapment are 2 distinct construct in the current study in accordance with the literature both showed a very high intercorrelation conclusion this study report on the validation of a german version of the defeat scale d d for the first time that show good psychometric characteristic in term of internal consistency and validity

background recent evidence ha shown that chronic back pain cbp can lead to functional alteration in the circuitry underlying the cognitive control of pain thought suppression t is a common type of cognitive control of pain previous research ha shown that t ha paradoxical effect that may increase the awareness of pain pain related t may also increase individual attention to pain which may also increase pain sensation but thus far the relationship between pain related t and structural brain alteration is unknown method in this study we investigated a group of 30 patient 6 month after lumbar disc surgery by applying voxel based morphometry vbm to identify brain region correlated with t score result since pain related t ha been positively correlated with depression all calculation were controlled for depression and age vbm revealed a negative correlation between the t score and regional grey matter volume gmv in the left superior temporal gyrus lstg and the left middle temporal gyrus l mtg which is part of the left temporoparietal junction l tpj in addition a mediation analysis revealed a significant mediation effect of the pain related t on the association between gmv of the left tpj and reported pain intensity in the last 7 day conclusion these finding are consistent with previous research on the dysfunctional cognitive control of pain and may therefore provide potential insight into the neural substrate of obstructive cognitive control in chronic low back pain with a special emphasis on pain related t significance the link between pain related thought suppression and brain morphology may provide a new perspective on the understanding of cognitive control of pain in chronic low back pain which may help improve cognitive behavioural therapy

emotion effect in event related potential erps during reading have been observed at very short latency of around 100 to 200 m after word onset the nature of these effect remains a matter of debate first it is possible that they reflect semantic access which might thus occur much faster than proposed by most reading model second it is possible that associative learning of a word s shape might contribute to the emergence of emotion effect during visual processing the present study addressed this question by employing an associative learning paradigm on pronounceable letter string pseudowords in a learning session letter string were associated with positive neutral or negative valence by mean of monetary gain loss or zero outcome crucially half of the stimulus were learned in the visual modality while the other half wa presented acoustically allowing for experimental separation of associated valence and physical percept in a test session one or two day later acquired letter string were presented in an old new decision task while we recorded erps behavioural data showed an advantage for gain associated stimulus both during learning and in the delayed old new task early emotion effect in erps were limited to visually acquired letter string but absent for acoustically acquired letter string these result imply that associative learning of a word s visual feature might play an important role in the emergence of emotion effect at the stage of perceptual processing

background macro level factor mf such a wealth justice and freedom measured with objective country level indicator objective mf for instance the gross domestic product gdp have been investigated in relation to health and well being but rarely in connection with depression anxiety and stress subsumed a poor mental health also a combination of different objective mf and of how individual perceive those mf subjective mf ha not been taken into consideration in the present study we combined subjective and objective measure of wealth justice and freedom and examined their relationship with poor mental health method population based interview were conducted in france germany poland russia spain sweden u k and u s a n approximately 1000 per country gdp gini coefficient justice index and freedom index were used a objective mf whereas subjective mf were perceived wealth justice and freedom measured at the individual level poor mental health wa assessed a a combination of symptom of depression anxiety and stress result in a random intercept model gini coefficient and freedom index were significant positive country level and perceived wealth justice and freedom significant negative individual level predictor of symptom of poor mental health conclusion multiple subjective and objective mf should be combined to ass the macrosystem s relationship with poor mental health more precisely the relationship between mf and poor mental health indicates that the macrosystem should be taken into account a relevant context for mental health problem too

aim suicide ideation ha increased since the outbreak of covid 19 in many country the present longitudinal study investigated potential predictor of suicide ideation subject and method data of 406 participant from germany age m 27 69 sd 6 88 were assessed via online survey in spring 2020 baseline bl and in spring 2021 follow up fu result the current result reveal a significant increase in symptom of depression anxiety and stress between 2020 and 2021 positive mental health pmh sense of control and physical health significantly decreased depression symptom bl pmh bl and consciously enhanced physical activity since the pandemic outbreak fu significantly predicted 12 month suicide ideation fu in a moderated mediation analysis the positive relationship between depression and suicide ideation wa significantly mediated by pmh consciously enhanced physical activity significantly moderated the negative association between pmh and suicide ideation conclusion the context of covid 19 could negatively impact mental health and physical health this might increase the risk for suicide ideation however pmh and physical activity might serve a protective factor the protective effect of physical activity could be especially important in people with high depression symptom and low pmh such a clinical patient potential way of how pmh and physical activity could be enhanced in the covid 19 context to prevent suicide ideation are discussed

attentional bias play an important role in the development and maintenance of obsessive compulsive disorder ocd previous study using reaction time task in ocd have produced inconsistent result this is the first study to measure attentional bias in patient with several subtypes of ocd using eye tracking twenty eight patient with ocd and 21 healthy control were assessed using a free viewing paradigm incorporating contamination related checking related and neutral stimulus attentional pattern were measured using an eye tracker a possible vigilance bias wa assessed using entry time and a possible maintenance bias wa assessed using dwell time patient with checking related symptom of ocd showed a maintenance bias but no vigilance bias in regard to checking related compared to neutral stimulus no difference in attention were found in patient with contamination related symptom internal validity is restricted due to a high overlap between subgroup the lack of negative not ocd related control stimulus and the absence of a clinical control group patient with checking related symptom of ocd showed a maintenance bias to checking related stimulus due to methodological limitation the result should be considered preliminary and need to be replicated before firm conclusion can be drawn

group loyalty is highly valued however little is known about young child s loyal behavior this study tested whether 4 and 5 year old n 96 remain loyal to their group even when betraying it would be materially advantageous child and four puppet were allocated to novel group two of these puppet either in group or out group member then told child a group secret and urged them not to disclose the secret another puppet not assigned to either group then bribed child with sticker to tell the secret across age child were significantly le likely to reveal the secret in the in group condition than in the out group condition thus even young child are willing to pay a cost to be loyal to their group

this study investigates if anodal transcranial direct current stimulation tdcs of area above the motor cortex c3 influence the quantity and quality of spontaneous motor imagery experienced in rem sleep a randomized triple blinded design wa used combining neurophysiological technique with a tool of quantitative mentation report analysis developed from cognitive linguistics and generative grammar the result indicate that more motor imagery and more athletic motor imagery is induced by anodal tdcs in comparison to cathodal and sham tdcs this insight may have implication beyond basic consciousness research motor imagery in rem sleep ha been hypothesized to serve the rehearsal of motor movement which benefit later motor performance electrophysiological manipulation of motor imagery in rem sleep could in the long run be used for rehabilitative tdcs protocol benefitting temporarily immobile clinical patient especially those who cannot perform specific motor imagery task such a dementia patient infant with developmental and motor disorder and coma patient

objective this two group randomised controlled trial evaluates the feasibility of an acceptance and commitment therapy act based internet intervention for diabetes distress in people with diabetes type 1 or type 2 participant were assigned to a guided self help intervention eg or waitlist control group cg setting recruitment took place following an open recruitment strategy including different diabetes centre self help group and social medium platform participant eligibility criterion comprised being 18 year of age or older self reported diagnosis of type 1 or type 2 diabetes internet access sufficient german language skill and written informed consent intervention actondiabetes is an internet based and mobile based intervention and comprises an introduction and seven module one module per week processing time about 45 60 min intervention content are based on act primary and secondary outcome measure participant were assessed before and 8 week after randomisation primary outcome wa feasibility trial recruitment acceptability potential group difference in diabetes distress and other outcome at follow up were analysed using linear regression model with baseline value a predictor all analysis were based on an intention to treat principle potential negative effect were analysed on per protocol basis result from october 2017 to april 2018 n 42 people with diabetes consented and were randomised eg n 21 cg n 21 forty three per cent of the eg completed all treatment module within 8 week across module formative user feedback revealed that content could be optimised regarding comprehensibility 34 individualisation 20 and text amount 21 overall 57 of participant dropped out prior to full treatment completion there were reduction of diabetes distress in the eg d 0 65 p 0 042 conclusion modification of the intervention content according to the user feedback will be performed to further improve acceptability mechanism to foster intervention adherence should be considered for lowering the attrition rate actondiabetes is feasible for the implementation in a confirmatory trial trial registration number who international clinical trial registry platform via the german clinical trial register drks drks00013193

abstract aim to examine whether personality trait predict the course of addictive behaviour in general and whether predictive association differ between non substance related nr and substance related sr addictive behaviour methodology we recruited 338 individual 19 27 y 59 female from a random community sample with nr sr or no dsm 5 addictive disorder predictor were the big five personality trait neo ffi and reward and punishment sensitivity bi ba questionnaire outcome were the slope of addictive behaviour i e quantity frequency and number of dsm 5 criterion over three year bayesian multiple regression were used to analyse the probability for each hypothesis result the evidence that higher neuroticism lower conscientiousness lower agreeableness higher extraversion lower openness higher reward sensitivity and lower punishment sensitivity predict increased addictive behaviour over time wa overall moderate to high 69 to 99 and varied by trait and outcome predictive association were mostly higher for nr compared with sr addictive behaviour conclusion personality trait predict the course of addictive behaviour but association were only about half a large a expected while some personality trait such a lower conscientiousness predict increase in both nr and sr addictive behaviour over time others such a lower punishment sensitivity seem to specifically predict increase in nr addictive behaviour

cognitive emotion regulation strategy are important component of cognitive behavioral therapy cbt additionally up regulation and difficulty in the down regulation of negative feeling are associated with mental disorder however little is known about the lasting effect of cognitive emotion regulation strategy on emotional experience and associated neural activation therefore this study investigated immediate and prolonged effect of emotion regulation using cognitive reappraisal and distraction on subjective report and it neural correlate twenty seven healthy female took part in a 2 day functional magnetic resonance imaging study they were instructed to either up regulate or down regulate their negative feeling using a situation focused cognitive reappraisal strategy to distract themselves by imagining a specific neutral situation or to passively look at repeatedly presented aversive and neutral picture re exposure to the same stimulus without a regulation instruction wa conducted one day later self reported negative feeling and blood oxygen level dependent response served a main outcome variable a expected the result show successful immediate up or down regulation of negative feeling by cognitive reappraisal and down regulation of negative feeling by distraction furthermore these change in negative feeling were correlated with amygdala activation a lasting effect on emotional experience associated with stronger ventromedial prefrontal cortex activation wa found for down regulation of negative feeling via cognitive reappraisal compared to distraction down regulation via cognitive reappraisal led to reduced negative feeling and stronger dorso and ventrolateral prefrontal cortex response one day later while cognitive reappraisal and distraction are both effective strategy during active regulation only cognitive reappraisal had a lasting effect these finding might have implication for cbt

the present study evaluates a brief cross cultural scale that map a wide range of social resource useful in large scale assessment of perceived social support the brief perceived social support questionnaire fragebogen zur sozialen unterstutzung kurzform mit sechs item f sozu k 6 wa examined in representative and university student sample from the united state n representative 3038 germany n representative 2007 n student 5406 russia n representative 3020 n student 4001 and china n student 13 582 cross cultural measurement invariance testing wa conducted in both representative and student sample across country score on the f sozu k 6 demonstrated good reliability and strong model fit for a unidimensional structure in all sample with the exception of poor model fit for german student the score on f sozu k 6 correlated negatively with score on depression anxiety and stress measure and positively with score on positive mental health measure norm for gender and age group were established separately based on each representative sample cross cultural measurement invariance testing found partial strong measurement invariance across three general population sample and three student sample furthermore a simulation study showed that the amount of invariance observed in the partial invariance model had only a negligible impact on mean comparison psychometric finding across diverse cultural context supported the robustness and validity of the f sozu k 6 for cross cultural epidemiologic study psycinfo database record c 2019 apa all right reserved

maltreatment by parent can be conceptualized a pathogenic escalation of a disturbed parent child relationship that have devastating consequence for child s development and mental health although parental psychopathology ha been shown to be a risk factor both for maltreatment and insecure attachment representation these factor joint contribution to child psychopathology ha not been investigated in a sample of burundian refugee family living in refugee camp in western tanzania the association between attachment representation maltreatment and psychopathology were examined by conducting structured interview with 226 child aged 7 to 15 and both their parent structural equation modeling revealed that child s insecure attachment representation and maltreatment by mother fully mediated the relation between maternal and child psychopathology model fit comparative fit index cfi 0 96 root mean square error of approximation rmsea 0 05 a direct association between paternal and child psychopathology wa observed model fit cfi 0 96 rmsea 0 05 the finding suggest a vicious cycle wherein an insecure attachment to a mother suffering from psychopathology may be linked to child s risk to be maltreated which may reinforce insecure representation and perpetuate the pathogenic relational experience intervention targeting the attachment relationship and parental mental health may prevent negative child outcome

summary study have shown that people with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd have impairment in spatial working memory swm performance however it remains unclear whether this deficit represents a cognitive endophenotype preceding symptom or a correlate of ocd we investigated swm in 69 people with ocd 77 unaffected first degree relative of people with ocd and 106 healthy control participant taking age effect into account swm performance wa best in healthy control intermediate in relative and worst in ocd participant however since performance did not differ significantly between healthy control and relative our study doe not fully support swm performance a a core cognitive endophenotype of ocd

successful parenting requires constant inferring of affective state especially vital is the correct identification of facial affect previous study have shown that infant face are processed preferentially compared to adult face both on the behavioural and the neural level this study specifically investigates the child evoked neural response to affective face and their modulation by motherhood and attention to affect to do so we used a paradigm to measure neural response during both explicit and implicit facial affect recognition far in mother and non mother using child and adult face increased activation to child compared to adult face wa found for mother and non mother in face processing area bilateral fusiform gyrus and area associated with social understanding bilateral insulae and medial superior frontal gyrus when pooling implicit and explicit affect recognition furthermore this child evoked activation wa modulated by motherhood with an increase in mother compared to non mother in the left precuneus additionally explicitly recognising the affect increased child evoked activation in the medial superior frontal gyrus in both mother and non mother these result suggest preferential treatment of affective child over adult face modulated by motherhood and attention to affect

intact executive function are characterized by flexible adaptation to task requirement while these effect are reduced in internalizing disorder furthermore a executive function play an important role in emotion regulation deficit in executive function may contribute to symptom generation in psychological disorder through increased emotional interference thus the present study investigated transfer effect of a three week executive control training on adaptation to task difficulty and emotional interference in healthy participant n 24 to further explore the training s suitability for clinical application to ass the adaptation to task difficulty the proportion congruency effect on behavioral data response time error rate and erp measure n2 crn wa assessed in a flanker task with varying frequency of incompatible trial 25 75 to quantify emotional interference flanker stimulus were superimposed on neutral or negative picture replicating previous result the training increased interference control a indexed by decreased response time and error rate increased n2 amplitude and decreased crn amplitude in incompatible trial after training proportion congruency effect were weaker than expected and not affected by the training intervention the training lead to a shift in the time point of emotional interference before training negative picture lead to a reduction in crn amplitude while after training this reduction wa observed for the n2 this pattern illustrates that the training lead to a change in task processing mode from predominant response related cognitive control to predominant stimulus related cognitive control n2 indicating a proactive processing mode

the wijma delivery expectancy experience questionnaire is a frequently used measure in the context of childbirth there are two version with identical item for use during pregnancy version a fear of childbirth and postpartum version b subjective experience respectively the original author report that the measure is unidimensional but since very different factor structure have been found with different language version in this study i tested the previously found factor structure in a sample of 338 german new mother with confirmatory factor analysis a none showed an adequate fit i conducted an exploratory factor analysis which yielded six factor with satisfactory internal consistency

abstract cognitive model stress the importance of cognitive belief domain cbd for the pathogenesis of obsessive compulsive disorder ocd however the relative contribution of responsibility and metacognition core aspect of cbd to oc symptom is not fully understood yet furthermore two subcomponents of overestimation of threat oet overestimation of the personal probability unrealistic pessimism and overestimation of the general risk of negative event require clarification first we investigated the relative contribution of responsibility and metacognition to oc symptom second we hypothesized that ocd patient overestimate the personal risk and display unrealistic pessimism thirty four ocd patient and 34 healthy control completed the obsessive belief questionnaire obq and the unrealistic optimism questionnaire uo responsibility significantly predicted obsessive symptom after controlling for metacognition in contrast to previous finding responsibility is not fully explained by metacognition finally our result confirm unrealistic pessimism in ocd even after controlling for depression

objective dysfunctional expectation are considered to be core feature of various mental disorder the aim of the study wa to develop the depressive expectation scale de a a depression specific measure for the assessment of dysfunctional expectation whereas previous research primarily focused on general cognition and attitude the de ass 25 future directed expectation originally 75 item which are situation specific and falsifiable design and method to evaluate the psychometric property of the de the scale wa completed by 175 participant with and without severe depressive symptom in an online survey participant additionally completed the patient health questionnaire module for depression phq 9 and anxiety gad 7 people experiencing depressive symptom were informed about the study with the help of self help organization result reliability analysis indicated excellent internal consistency of the scale an exploratory factor analysis revealed four factor social rejection social support mood regulation and ability to perform the de sum score strongly correlated with the severity of depressive symptom the de sum score also significantly correlated with symptom of generalized anxiety conclusion the de wa shown to have excellent reliability validity analysis were promising a the de item are situation specific and falsifiable they can be tested by the individual using behavioural experiment and may therefore facilitate cognitive restructuring thus a structured assessment of patient expectation with help of the de can provide a basis for intervention within cognitive behavioural treatment of depression practitioner point assessing situation specific expectation in patient experiencing depressive symptom can provide a basis for the conduction of behavioural experiment to test patient expectation for the use of behavioural experiment therapist should choose those dysfunctional expectation which a patient strongly agrees on to modify patient expectation they should be exposed to situation where the discrepancy between patient expectation and actual situational outcome can be maximized the depressive expectation scale can be completed repeatedly to monitor a patient s progress within cognitive behavioural treatment

background a four level community based intervention aiming simultaneously to improve the care for depression and to prevent suicidal behavior ha been implemented in the german city munich aim change in suicide rate in munich during 2009 2014 were analyzed with respect to a 10 year baseline the same wa true for a control region cologne and germany minus munich method the intervention included training of primary care provider a public awareness campaign training of community facilitator and support for patient and relative analysis included repeated measure generalized linear model result in munich the suicide rate significantly decreased during the intervention period compared to baseline percentage change 15 0 p 001 198 compared to 222 suicide per year difference in the change for munich and the change for the control location cologne 1 7 p 71 and germany minus munich 6 2 p 09 were not significant limitation data on suicide attempt were unavailable conclusion in munich a clinically and statistically significant decrease in suicide rate wa found this change wa numerically but not significantly larger than in the control region the result are promising however because of low suicide base rate and limited power no strong conclusion can be drawn concerning suicide preventive effect of the intervention

background posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd is characterized by impairment in extinction learning and social behaviour which are targeted by trauma focused cognitive behavioural treatment tf cbt the biological underpinnings of tf cbt can be better understood by adding biomarkers to the clinical evaluation of intervention due to their involvement in social functioning and fear processing oxytocin and arginine vasopressin might be informative biomarkers for tf cbt but to date this ha never been tested objective to differentiate the impact of traumatic event exposure and ptsd symptom on blood oxytocin and vasopressin concentration further to describe course of ptsd symptom oxytocin and vasopressin during an internet based tf cbt and explore interaction between these parameter method we compared oxytocin and vasopressin between three group of active and former male service member of the german armed force n 100 ptsd patient n 39 deployed healthy control who experienced a deployment related traumatic event n 33 and non deployed healthy control who never experienced a traumatic event n 28 ptsd patient underwent a 5 week internet based tf cbt we correlated ptsd symptom with oxytocin and vasopressin before treatment onset further we analysed course of ptsd symptom oxytocin and vasopressin from pre to post treatment and 3 month follow up a well a interaction between the three parameter result oxytocin and vasopressin did not differ between the group and were unrelated to ptsd symptom ptsd symptom were highly stable over time whereas the endocrine parameter were not and they also did not change in mean oxytocin and vasopressin were not associated with ptsd symptom longitudinally conclusion mainly due to their insufficient intraindividual stability single measurement of endogenous oxytocin and vasopressin concentration are not informative biomarkers for tf cbt we discus how the stability of these biomarkers might be increased and how they could be better related to the specific impairment targeted by tf cbt

post stroke depression psd is the most common psychiatric condition after stroke affecting one third of survivor despite identification of meaningful predictor knowledge about the interplay between these factor remains fragmentary general self efficacy gse is closely linked to psd yet direction and magnitude of this relationship remains unclear the author assessed the relationship between gse and depression during the first two year post stroke while controlling for stable inter individual difference using continuous time ct structural equation modelling sem patient of two german rehabilitation centre n 294 mean age 63 78 year sd 10 83 were assessed six week after ischemic stroke and at four follow ups covering two year gse scale and geriatric depression scale gd were used to ass gse and depression ct analysis revealed significantly higher within person cross effect of gse on gd a 21 29 than vice versa a 12 17 maximal cross lagged effect emerged six month post stroke our result show that decreasing gse led to increasing depressiveness and only to a smaller extent vice versa this suggests that fostering gse by strengthening perceived control after stroke can counter psd emersion and exacerbation six month post stroke when patient face social re integration programme focusing on gse could potentially help to prevent later psd

abstract tele tandem is a telephone based cognitive behavioral therapy cbt intervention for dementia caregiver which incorporates resource activation a a superordinate heuristic we investigated whether tele tandem increased the utilization of psychosocial resource in dementia caregiver to this end 273 dementia caregiver were randomly assigned to receive the tele tandem intervention n 139 or usual care n 134 compared to the control group at posttest caregiver in the intervention group had utilized more resource related to well being and coping with daily hassle treatment effect on the utilization of resource related to social support were only marginally significantly greater at posttest for caregiver with higher baseline resource utilization treatment effect were not maintained at 6 month follow up result indicate that tele tandem can successfully activate the psychosocial resource of dementia caregiver

introduction there ha been growing interest in a better understanding of the etiology of compulsive sexual behavior csb it is assumed that facilitated appetitive conditioning might be an important mechanism for the development and maintenance of csb but no study thus far ha investigated these process aim to explore group difference in neural activity associated with appetitive conditioning and connectivity in subject with csb and a healthy control group method two group 20 subject with csb and 20 control were exposed to an appetitive conditioning paradigm during a functional magnetic resonance imaging experiment in which a neutral stimulus c predicted visual sexual stimulus and a second stimulus c did not main outcome measure blood oxygen level dependent response and psychophysiologic interaction result a a main result we found increased amygdala activity during appetitive conditioning for the c v the c and decreased coupling between the ventral striatum and prefrontal cortex in the csb v control group conclusion the finding show that neural correlate of appetitive conditioning and neural connectivity are altered in patient with csb the increased amygdala activation might reflect facilitated conditioning process in patient with csb in addition the observed decreased coupling could be interpreted a a marker for impaired emotion regulation success in this group

background feeling of doubt and perseverative behaviour are key symptom of obsessive compulsive disorder ocd and have been linked to hyperactive error and conflict signal in the brain while enhanced neural correlate of error monitoring have been robustly shown far le is known about conflict processing and adaptation in ocd method we examined event related potential during conflict processing in 70 patient with ocd and 70 matched healthy comparison participant focusing on the stimulus locked n2 elicited in a flanker task conflict adaptation wa evaluated by analysing sequential adjustment in n2 and behaviour i e current conflict effect a a function of preceding conflict result patient with ocd showed enhanced n2 amplitude compared with healthy control further patient showed stronger conflict adaptation effect on reaction time and n2 amplitude thus the effect of previous compatibility wa larger in patient than in healthy participant a indicated by greater n2 adjustment in change trial i e ic ci a a result of stronger conflict adaptation in patient n2 amplitude were comparable between group in incompatible trial following incompatible trial conclusion larger n2 amplitude and greater conflict adaptation in ocd point to enhanced conflict monitoring leading to increased recruitment of cognitive control in patient this wa most pronounced in change trial and wa associated with stronger conflict adjustment in n2 and behaviour thus hyperactive conflict monitoring in ocd may be beneficial in situation that require a high amount of control to resolve conflict but may also reflect an effortful process that is linked to distress and symptom of ocd

cognitive control cc over emotional distraction is of particular importance for adaptive human behaviour and is associated with activity in the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc deficient cc e g presenting a negativity bias ha been suggested to underlie many of the core symptom of major depression md and is associated with impairment of dlpfc function correspondingly enhancement of dlpfc activity with anodal transcranial direct current stimulation tdcs can ameliorate these impairment in patient with md here we tested the hypothesis that a reduction of dlpfc activity by cathodal tdcs induces cc deficit thus triggering a depression like negativity bias in healthy subject twenty eight individual participated in a double blinded balanced randomized crossover trial of cathodal 1 ma 20 min and sham tdcs applied to the left dlpfc to ass cc we conducted a delayed response working memory dwm task and an arithmetic inhibition task ait with picture of varying valent content negative neutral positive during and immediately after stimulation cathodal tdcs led to impaired cc specifically over negative material a assessed by reduced response accuracy in the dwm and prolonged response latency in the ait hence the current study support the notion that left dlpfc is critically involved in cc over negative material together with previously reported beneficial anodal effect it indicates that the hypoactivation of left dlpfc cause deficit in cc over negative material which is a possible aetiological mechanism of depression

objective asylum seeker often suffer from medically unexplained symptom that affect their quality of life qol the present study is the first to investigate the extent to which somatic symptom and the b criterion for the dsm 5 somatic symptom disorder ssd are associated with the qol of asylum seeker living in germany method in 144 asylum seeker somatic symptom phq 15 b criterion for ssd symptom of posttraumatic stress pd depressive symptom phq 9 post migration living difficulty pmld and qol eurohis were assessed cross sectionally multiple regression in the total sample and in group of somatic symptom severity mild moderate and severe were conducted to examine the association between somatic symptom and b criterion with qol result sleep problem and pain were the most frequently reported somatic symptom sixteen 11 participant met one b criterion 24 17 met two and 84 58 met all three criterion qol correlated negatively with somatic symptom r 0 56 p 001 and with the existence of at least one b criterion r 0 24 p 001 in the total sample stronger depressive and somatic symptom were related to lower qol adjusted r 2 0 53 while the b criterion were not in person with severe somatic symptom severity the b criterion behavior wa associated with lower qol conclusion in addition to stronger somatic and depressive symptom the psychological b criterion behavior seems to play an important role in the lower qol of asylum seeker with severe somatic symptom

objective body and food related information are thought to activate cognitive bias and contribute to the maintenance of eating disorder ed approach avoidance bias may play an important role in the maintenance of dietary restriction and excessive food intake therefore the present study aimed to examine approach avoidance bias toward food and body stimulus in individual with anorexia nervosa an bulimia nervosa bn and healthy control hc method the study included 42 individual with an 24 individual with bn and 38 hcs we used two implicit approach avoidance task aat to ass approach avoidance bias participant completed a food aat high calorie v low calorie food and a body aat thin v normal weight body additionally explicit rating of food and body stimulus were assessed result there were no significant group x stimulus x direction interaction in the implicit food aat or implicit body aat in explicit rating individual with an and bn reported le urge to eat and more regret if they ate high calorie and low calorie food individual with an and bn rated normal weight body a le normal weight le attractive and le desirable than hcs there were no group difference in explicit rating of the thin body discussion we did not find evidence for biased approach avoidance tendency toward food or body stimulus in individual with an or bn future study are necessary to understand conflicting finding regarding approach avoidance bias toward food and body stimulus in individual with ed

introduction since numerous study have found that exposure to early life stress lead to increased peripheral inflammation and psychiatric disease it is thought that peripheral immune activation precedes and possibly mediates the onset of stress associated psychiatric disease despite early study ifngamma ha received little attention relative to other inflammatory cytokine in the context of the pathophysiology of affective disorder neuroimaging endophenotypes have emerged recently a a promising mean of elucidating these type of complex relationship including the modeling of the interaction between environmental factor and genetic predisposition here we investigate the gxe relationship between early life stress and genetic variant of ifngamma on emotion processing method to investigate the impact of the relationship between genetic variant of ifngamma rs1861494 rs2069718 rs2430561 and early life stress on emotion processing a sample of healthy adult n 409 undergoing an emotional face paradigm in an fmri study were genotyped and analysed information on early life stress wa obtained via childhood trauma questionnaire ctq result a positive association between early life stress and amygdala reactivity wa found specifically the main effect of genotype of rs1861494 on amygdala reactivity indicates a higher neural response in c allele carrier compared to t
