homozygote while we did not find main effect of rs2069718 and rs2430561 importantly interaction analysis revealed a specific interaction between ifngamma genotype rs1861494 and early life stress affecting amygdala reactivity to emotional face resulting from a positive association between ctq score and amygdala reactivity in c allele carrier while this association wa absent in t homozygote conclusion our finding indicate that firstly the genetic variant of ifngamma rs1861494 is involved with the regulation of amygdala reactivity to emotional stimulus and secondly that this genetic variant moderate effect of early life stress on emotion processing these finding reiterate the importance that inflammatory gene play in the interaction with early life stress and the regulation of emotion processing

abstract background well established scale for the observation based assessment of psychotherapy competence encompass multiple domain require extensive rater training and are rather cost intensive objective to develop a comprehensive but easy to administer instrument for the observation based assessment of basic communication and counseling skill in both real and simulated patient encounter the clinical communication skill scale cc method we investigated the content validity and applicability of this scale we then presented video of simulated therapy session conducted by a competent v noncompetent therapist online to n 209 layperson and psychology student result result suggested a one factorial solution internal consistency wa excellent α 94 for most aspect convergent validity with established scale wa moderate to high the cc effectively differentiated between both level of skill conclusion the cc appears to be a feasible reliable and valid instrument nonetheless it psychometric criterion should be investigated further in clinical sample with licensed therapist and in other language

enhancing the reduction of avoidance may optimize treatment for anxiety disorder past research focused on boosting fear extinction to reduce avoidance however with limited success directly extinguishing avoidance may be more promising this preregistered study tested the impact of incentive and instruction for non avoidance compared to passive fear extinction on long term avoidance and fear reduction on day 1 participant acquired conditioned fear and avoidance to a conditioned stimulus c paired with an aversive outcome next incentive or instruction encouraged non avoidance to the c which wa no longer reinforced by a u regardless of avoidance incentive and instruction group in a third group avoidance wa unavailable and the c wa passively presented in absence of the u passive fear extinction group on day 2 avoidance retention and reinstatement and return of fear were tested in the short term incentive and instruction strongly reduced avoidance with similar fear reduction compared to passive fear extinction importantly incentive and instruction were linked to lower long term avoidance retention avoidance reinstatement wa evident in all group but avoidance remained higher after passive fear extinction finally incentive yielded a lower return of threat expectancy thus targeting avoidance instead of fear better reduced long term avoidance and for incentive the return of fear especially incentive could be a promising add on to exposure

the endocannabinoid system ha been implicated in the regulation of the stress response fear memory formation and inflammatory process posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd can result from exposure to extreme stress and is characterized by strong associative memory for the traumatic event experienced furthermore an elevated physical disease risk ha been observed in ptsd likely to be mediated by inflammatory process therefore altered endocannabinoid regulation can be expected in individual with ptsd however attempt to ass ptsd associated difference in the endocannabinoid system from human blood sample have provided inconsistent result possibly due to fluctuating level of endocannabinoids in hair these neuromodulators are accumulated over time and thus give access to a more stable and reliable assessment we therefore investigated ptsd associated difference in hair concentration of endocannabinoids n acyl ethanolamides palmitoylethanolamide pea oleoylethanolamide oea and stearoylethanolamide sea in 38 rebel war survivor from northern uganda suffering from ptsd and n 38 healthy rebel war survivor without current and lifetime ptsd ptsd diagnosis and symptom severity were assessed in structured clinical interview employing the posttraumatic diagnostic scale pd a significant group difference wa observed for oea with ptsd patient showing reduced hair concentration regression analysis further revealed strong negative relationship between all investigated n acyl ethanolamides and symptom severity of ptsd the observed reduction in endocannabinoids might account for the increased inflammatory state a well a for the failure to extinguish fear memory observed in ptsd our finding add to the accumulating evidence suggesting the endocannabinoid system a a target for pharmacological enhancement of exposure based psychotherapy for ptsd

occupational stress is a crucial risk factor for the development of somatic and mental disorder and for the reduction of overall well being acceptance and commitment therapy act is an established treatment in clinical practice and it use a a non clinical workplace intervention proliferated in recent year this study provides an up to date meta analysis on how face to face act intervention affect occupational stress a well a psychological distress psychological flexibility and well being random effect meta analysis were conducted exploring act s efficacy concerning the four construct sub group analysis and meta regression were performed to investigate individual workplace related and treatment effect a total of 17 study including 860 participant allocated to act condition and 736 participant allocated to control condition were extracted act outperformed control condition passive and active control regarding psychological distress hedge g 0 38 95 ci 0 57 0 19 psychological flexibility g 0 33 95 ci 0 13 0 54 and well being g 0 24 95 ci 0 02 0 47 at post treatment and regarding stress g 0 22 95 ci 0 41 0 04 psychological flexibility g 0 31 95 ci 0 16 0 47 and well being g 0 26 95 ci 0 03 0 49 at follow up additional analysis revealed act to be most effective for office employee while showing little to no effect for health care worker finding demonstrate act to be an effective treatment to reduce psychological distress and stress and to increase psychological flexibility and general well being in a non clinical workplace setting an application for employee working in an office setting appears to be most promising

several method that are promising for studying the neurophysiology of fear conditioning e g eeg meg require a high number of trial to achieve an adequate signal to noise ratio while electric shock and white noise burst are among the most commonly used unconditioned stimulus u in conventional fear conditioning study with few trial it is unknown whether these stimulus are equally well suited for paradigm with many trial here n 32 participant underwent a 260 trial differential fear conditioning and extinction paradigm with a 240 trial recall test 24 h later and neutral face a conditioned stimulus in a between subject design either white noise burst n 16 or electric shock n 16 served a u and intensity were determined using the most common procedure for each u i e a fixed 95 db noise burst and a work up procedure for electric shock respectively in addition to differing u type group also differed in closely linked u associated characteristic e g calibration method stimulus intensity timing subjective rating arousal valence skin conductance and evoked heart period change i e fear bradycardia indicated more reliable extinction resistant and stable conditioning in the white noise burst versus electric shock group in fear conditioning experiment where many trial are presented white noise burst should serve a u

background and objective cognitive theory suggest that cognitive bias may be related and together influence the anxiety response however little is known about the interrelation of cognitive bias task and whether they allow for an improved prediction of fear related behavior in addition to self report this study simultaneously addressed several type of cognitive bias in child to investigate attention bias interpretation bias memory bias and fear related association their interrelation and the prediction of behavior method eighty one child varying in their level of spider fear completed the spider anxiety and disgust screening for child and performed two emotional stroop task a free recall task an interpretation task including size and distance indication an affective priming task and a behavioral assessment test result we found an attention bias interpretation bias and fear related association but no evidence for a memory bias the bias showed little overlap attention bias interpretation bias and fear related association predicted unique variance in avoidance of spider interpretation bias and fear related association remained significant predictor even when self reported fear wa included a a predictor limitation child were not seeking help for their spider fear and were not tested on clinical level of spider phobia conclusion this is the first study to find evidence that different cognitive bias each predict unique variance in avoidance behavior furthermore it is also the first study in which we found evidence for a relation between fear of spider and size and distance indication we showed that this bias is distinct from other cognitive bias

parenting requires mother to read social cue and understand their child it is particularly important that they recognise their child s emotion to react appropriately for example with compassion to sadness or compersion to happiness despite this importance it is unclear how motherhood affect woman s ability to recognise emotion associated with facial expression in child using video of an emotionally neutral face continually and gradually taking on a facial expression associated with an emotion we quantified the amount of information needed to match the emotion with the facial expression mother needed more information than non mother to match the emotion with the facial expression both mother and non mother performed equally on a control task identifying animal instead of emotion and both group needed le information when recognising the emotion associated with facial expression in adolescent than pre schoolers these result indicate that mother need more information for to correctly recognise typically associated emotion in child facial expression but not for similar task not involving emotion a possible explanation is that child facial expression associated with emotion may have a greater emotional impact on mother than non mother leading to task interference but possibly also to increased compassion and compersion

abstract for many people facebook use ha become part of daily life earlier research hypothesized that one reason for the high popularity of this social platform is it association with subjective well being and specific personality trait in the present study self report data and objective data from facebook page of 328 facebook user were analyzed result revealed a significant positive association of active facebook use with subjective happiness and narcissism it relationship with depression symptom wa significantly negative furthermore active facebook use significantly positively mediated the positive link between narcissism and happiness this finding contributes to the understanding why narcissistic individual who usually search for attention and admiration to increase their self esteem often engage in intensive active facebook use

deficient emotion regulation ha been proposed a a crucial pathological mechanism in bipolar disorder bd we therefore investigated emotion regulation impairment in bd the related neural underpinnings and their etiological relevance for the disorder twenty two euthymic patient with bipolar i disorder and 17 unaffected first degree relative of bd i patient a well a two group of healthy gender age and education matched control n 22 17 respectively were included participant underwent functional magnetic resonance imaging while applying two different emotion regulation technique reappraisal and distraction when presented with emotional image bd patient and relative showed impaired downregulation of amygdala activity during reappraisal but not during distraction when compared with control this deficit wa correlated with the habitual use of reappraisal the negative connectivity of amygdala and orbitofrontal cortex ofc observed during reappraisal in control wa reversed in bd patient and relative there were no significant difference between bd patient and relative a being observed in bd patient and unaffected relative deficit in emotion regulation through reappraisal may represent heritable neurobiological abnormality underlying bd the neural mechanism include impaired control of amygdala reactivity to emotional stimulus and dysfunctional connectivity of the amygdala to regulatory control region in the ofc these are thus important aspect of the neurobiological basis of increased vulnerability for bd

background reduced sensitivity to reward a well a the tendency to maintain dysfunctional expectation despite expectation disconfirming evidence cognitive immunization are considered core feature of various mental disorder it is therefore important for clinical research to have paradigm that are suitable to study these phenomenon we developed a new experimental paradigm to study explicit expectation change after prior expectation induction and violation it validity is tested by applying the paradigm to healthy individual material and method in the main part of the study experiment 1 we examined whether it is possible to change healthy individual sample size 56 task specific and generalized performance expectation through expectation disconfirming experience we used a high difficulty performance task to induce initially negative expectation regarding participant ability to successfully work on that unknown task in the second part of the study the difficulty of the test wa lowered in one experimental condition in order to disconfirm the negative expectation of the first part while the other group continued with high test difficulty to confirm the negative expectation we measured the participant s explicit performance expectation before and after completing the test in experiment 2 sample size 57 we investigated the impact of different test instruction on expectation change using the same paradigm a in experiment 1 we added an immunization inhibiting manipulation for one group and an immunization enhancing manipulation for the other group result in experiment 1 we were able to show that individual changed their expectation according to variation of task difficulty adding instruction to manipulate cognitive immunization inhibited expectation change regardless of condition experiment 2 conclusion our approach allowed u to examine the effect of implicitly acquired performance expectation on explicit verbalized expectation change the new experimental paradigm used in this study is suitable to induce performance expectation and to examine expectation change among healthy individual experiment 1 instruction to enhance or inhibit cognitive immunization process both inhibited expectation change experiment 2 the result are discussed within the context of current model of expectation change cognitive immunization and reward sensitivity

background available smartphone based intervention for depression predominantly use evidence based strategy from cognitive behavioral therapy cbt but patient engagement and reported effect size are small recently study have demonstrated that smartphone based intervention combining cbt with gamified approach avoidance bias modification training aamt can foster patient engagement and reduce symptom of several mental health problem objective based on these finding we developed a gamified smartphone based intervention mentalis phoenix mt phoenix and hypothesized the program would both engage patient and produce preliminary evidence for the reduction of depressive symptom method to test this hypothesis we evaluated mt phoenix in a randomized controlled pilot trial including 77 individual with elevated depression score patient health questionnaire 9 score 5 participant were either instructed to train for 14 day with mt phoenix or assigned to a waitlist control condition engagement with the intervention wa measured by assessing usage data the primary outcome wa reduction in depressive symptom severity at postassessment result data from this pilot trial show that participant in the intervention group used the smartphone based intervention for 46 of all day 6 4 14 and reported a significantly greater reduction of depressive symptom than did participant in the control condition f 1 74 19 34 p 001 with a large effect size d 1 02 effect were sustained at a 3 month follow up conclusion a gamified smartphone based intervention combining cbt with aamt may foster patient engagement and effectively target depressive symptom future study should evaluate the effectiveness of this intervention in a phase 3 trial using clinical sample moreover the intervention should be compared to active control condition trial registration german clinical trial registry drks00012769 http tinyurl com 47mw8du7

background overgeneralization of fear is a pathogenic marker of anxiety and stress related disorder and ha been linked with perceptual discrimination deficit reduced fear inhibition and prefrontal hyporeactivity to safety signaling stimulus we aimed to examine whether behavioral and neural pattern of fear generalization are influenced by the fear inhibiting ventromedial prefrontal cortex vmpfc method three group of healthy participant received excitatory n 27 inhibitory n 26 or sham n 26 transcranial direct current stimulation of the vmpfc after a fear conditioning phase and before a fear generalization phase we obtained a dependent variable fear rating and unconditioned stimulus expectancy rating perceptual aspect of fear generalization perceptual discrimination pupil dilation and source estimation of event related field elicited by conditioned and generalization stimulus result after inhibitory compared with excitatory and sham vmpfc stimulation we observed reduced performance in perceptual discrimination and le negative inhibitory gradient in frontal structure at midlatency and late time interval fear and unconditioned stimulus expectancy rating a well a pupil dilation remained unaffected by stimulation conclusion these finding reveal a causal contribution of vmpfc reactivity to generalization pattern and suggest that vmpfc hyporeactivity consequent on inhibitory vmpfc stimulation may serve a a model for pathological process of fear generalization reduced discrimination impaired fear inhibition via frontal brain structure this encourages further basic and clinical research on the potential of targeted brain stimulation to modulate fear generalization and overgeneralization

the psychological health of people who elect to surgically alter the embodied self is often questioned this study examines characteristic and goal of 546 people who elect aesthetic surgery compared with 264 people who are interested in it and 1 135 population comparison assessment included demographic attractiveness body image importance depression social phobia joy general health life satisfaction and open ended and standard goal surgery and interested group were more likely than the population to be female and younger have lower income and lower body mass index and have higher body image importance the surgery group reported lower general attractiveness life satisfaction and joy but also lower depression and higher overall health than the general population there were no difference in social phobia overall people obtaining and interested in cosmetic surgery appeared generally psychologically healthy the most frequent goal wa to feel better about in one s own body overtly social or unrealistic goal were uncommon

reduced physical activity is considered a key feature of major depressive disorder mdd however research directly comparing non depressed control and patient yielded mixed finding in contrast to most previous research this study compared objective a well a subjective activity level of individual with mdd with non depressed control and used an ambulatory assessment method moreover we investigated whether objective and subjective measure of activity could predict mood on two consecutive day physical activity of 35 mdd patient and 36 non depressed control participant were assessed objectively using an accelerometer and subjectively with hourly ecological momentary assessment during the same assessment participant mood wa monitored no significant difference between mdd patient and control participant in objective and most of the subjective activity measure were observed we found significant association between objective and subjective measure of activity in non depressed a well a in mdd patient objective but not subjective measure of activity predicted subsequent mood our result support the notion that the association between mdd and activity level is complex and depends on moderating factor

cognitive bias research draw upon the notion that altered information processing is key for understanding psychological functioning and well being however little attention ha been paid to the question of whether the frequently used experimental paradigm hold adequate psychometric property the present study examined the psychometric property of three widely used cognitive bias task the approach avoidance task aat the visual dot probe task and the implicit association test iat approach attentional and association bias towards valenced stimulus were repeatedly measured at five different time point in a sample of 79 healthy young adult two different device were used for assessment a personal computer pc and a touchscreen based tablet reliability estimate included internal consistency and temporal stability validity wa inferred from convergence across different behavioral task and correlation between bias score and self reported psychological trait reliability ranged widely amongst task assessment device and measurement time point while the dot probe task appeared to be completely unreliable bias score obtained from the pc based version of the aat and both pc and touchscreen version of the iat showed moderate reliability almost no association were found across information processing task or between implicit and explicit measure cognitive bias research should adopt a standard practice to routinely estimate and report psychometric property of experimental paradigm investigate feasible way to develop more reliable tool and use task that are suitable to answer the precise research question asked

basic research ha shown that the motoric system i e motor action or stable posture can strongly affect emotional process the present study sought to investigate the effect of sitting posture on the tendency of depressed individual to recall a higher proportion of negative self referent material thirty currently depressed inpatient either sat in a slumped depressed or in an upright non depressed posture while imagining a visual scene of themselves in connection with positive or depression related word presented to them on a computer screen an incidental recall test of these word wa conducted after a distraction task result of a mixed anova showed a significant posture x word type interaction with upright sitting patient showing unbiased recall of positive and negative word but slumped patient showing recall biased towards more negative word the finding indicate that relatively minor change in the motoric system can affect one of the best documented cognitive bias in depression practical implication of the finding are discussed

a reciprocal relationship between repetitive negative thinking rnt and negative affect na ha been found in various type of psychopathology recent study have suggested that the magnitude of this association can vary across time and individual which may inform future psychopathology here we explored how these dynamic and interplay are manifested in student and general population using a statistical clustering algorithm across three experience sampling data set our clustering analysis consistently identified two group of individual one group had a higher bidirectional association between rnt and na and also higher inertia than the other group furthermore a prospective analysis revealed that the group with the higher bidirectional association is at risk of developing depressive symptom during the 3 month follow up period if they had experienced high level of na over the experience sampling phase these finding suggest that the dysfunctional affective and cognitive dynamic would be a promising target of preventive intervention

objective thus far most application in precision mental health have not been evaluated prospectively this article present the result of a prospective randomized controlled trial investigating the effect of a digital decision support and feedback system which includes two component of patient specific recommendation a a clinical strategy recommendation and b adaptive recommendation for patient at risk for treatment failure method therapist patient dyad n 538 in a cognitive behavioral therapy outpatient clinic were randomized to either having access to a decision support system intervention group n 335 or not treatment a usual n 203 first treatment strategy recommendation problem solving motivation oriented or a mix of both strategy for the first 10 session were evaluated second the effect of psychometric feedback enhanced with clinical problem solving tool on treatment outcome wa investigated result the prospective evaluation showed a differential effect size of about 0 3 when therapist followed the recommended treatment strategy in the first 10 session moreover the linear mixed model revealed therapist symptom awareness and therapist attitude and confidence a significant predictor of an outcome a well a therapist rated usefulness of feedback a a significant moderator of the feedback outcome and the not on track outcome association however no main effect were found for feedback conclusion the result demonstrate the importance of prospective study and the high quality implementation of digital decision support tool in clinical practice therapist seem to be able to learn from such system and incorporate them into their clinical practice to enhance patient outcome but only when implementation is successful psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

background current model suggest that a variation in the promoter region of the serotonin transporter gene 5 httlpr is associated with altered amygdala reactivity not only towards negative but also towards positive stimulus which ha been neglected in the past this association may possibly convey an elevated vulnerability for psychopathology like abuse craving and relapse since appetitive conditioning is a crucial mechanism in the pathogenesis of these psychiatric disorder the identification of specific factor contributing to interindividual variation is important method in the present study n 86 an appetitive conditioning paradigm wa conducted in which a neutral stimulus c wa associated with appetitive stimulus while a second stimulus c predicted their absence subject were genotyped according to the 5 httlpr genotype result a the main result we report a significant association between the 5 httlpr genotype and hemodynamic response individual with the s allele displayed elevated conditioned bilateral amygdala activity in contrast to l l allele carrier further increased hemodynamic response in s allele carrier were also found in the extended emotional network including the orbitofrontal cortex the thalamus and the ventral striatum conclusion the present finding indicate an association of the 5 httlpr and altered conditioned response in appetitive conditioning further the finding contribute to the ongoing debate on 5 httlpr dependent hemodynamic response pattern by emphasizing that s allele carrier are not exclusively biased towards fearful but also towards positive stimulus in conclusion our result imply that s allele carrier might be better described a hyper reactive towards salient stimulus which may convey vulnerability for the development of psychiatric disorder

negative expectation have been highlighted a a key mechanism in the maintenance and recurrence of depression nonetheless no study ha investigated currently depressed individual expectation about their future mood so far this is surprising given that experience of sustained negative mood and lack of positive mood are the hallmark symptom of depression the present study thus assessed depressed individual expectation about their future mood and examined whether these expectation are accurate or negatively biased the study used experience sampling methodology esm to contrast participant expectation with their actually experienced sad and happy mood within a 4 day period at the end of this period participant recalled their past mood all variable were assessed in 30 clinically depressed individual and 37 matched healthy control a well a in 56 undergraduate student with a wide range in depressive symptom result revealed that clinically depressed individual held negatively biased expectation about their future mood they expected more sad and le happy mood than they actually experienced in contrast healthy individual showed realistic expectation about their future mood depressed individual also demonstrated a negative mood recall bias finally individual expectation and memory were more closely linked to depression status than their actually experienced mood although negative mood is the hallmark symptom of depression the expectation and memory of negative mood may be even more central for the understanding of depression psycinfo database record c 2019 apa all right reserved

abstract background people with depression maintain negative expectation despite disconfirming positive experience by reappraising or discarding novel positive information referred to a cognitive immunisation a second body of literature suggests that negative mood can negatively affect information processing bridging these two line of research the present study examined the interplay of cognitive immunisation and negative mood in the context of expectation modification method in a student sample n 152 we used a well established experimental paradigm to examine the adjustment of performance expectation in response to positive performance feedback and it relation to depressive symptom in a 2 2 design participant received either a negative mood induction a cognitive immunisation manipulation both or no further manipulation result participant from all experimental group revised their previous expectation significantly in line with positive performance feedback however depressive symptom were a negative predictor of expectation adjustment and a moderation analysis indicated that this effect wa particularly pronounced if participant underwent the negative mood induction conclusion consistent with previous work depressive symptom were associated with a reduced ability to integrate positive information furthermore our result suggest that the activation of negative mood in people with elevated level of depression may hamper learning from new positive experience

several model that attempt to explain stigmatization of people with mental illness emphasize the relevance of social categorization however research on illness based social category ha been limited to explicit self report measure in this study we explored whether implicit social categorization based on mental illness label can be assessed with the who said what wsw paradigm in this paradigm participant have to allocate a large number of statement to individual who belong to different social group e g mentally ill v healthy due to the amount of statement error in allocation are to be expected a disproportionate amount of erroneous allocation to individual within a social group is interpreted to indicate implicit social categorization in three study we 1 pilot tested a wsw paradigm for mental illness categorization n 24 2 replicated these finding in an independent larger sample n 85 and 3 aimed to rule out alternative explanation for the implicit categorization effect with a modified wsw task and novel stimulus material n 137 we found consistent implicit categorization effect with overall medium to large effect size range 0 41 d 1 01 implicit component of mental illness based social categorization can be assessed with the wsw paradigm future research need to explore the interrelation of implicit categorization implicit v explicit stigmatization and discriminating behavior

child with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd are impaired in social adaptation and display deficit in social competence deficient emotion recognition ha been discussed to underlie these social problem however comorbid conduct problem have not been considered in the majority of study conducted so far and the influence of medication on emotion recognition ha rarely been studied here emotion recognition performance wa assessed in child with adhd without medication compared with child with adhd under stimulant medication and a matched control group in order to rule out confounding by externalizing symptom child with comorbid conduct problem were excluded video clip with neutral face developing a basic emotion happiness sadness disgust fear and anger were presented in order to ass emotion recognition result indicated between group difference neither concerning the number of correctly identified emotion nor concerning reaction time and their standard deviation thus we suggest that adhd per se is not associated with deficit in emotion recognition

mindfulness based intervention are effective at improving sexual dysfunction in woman yet the mechanism of action are le clear our objective wa to investigate the impact of three mindfulness exercise on woman s sexual response forty nine woman participated in a laboratory session involving a series of 5 min exercise and erotic film they completed three mindfulness based exercise and a mental imagery task genital and subjective arousal were measured continuously during erotic film and genital arousal wa measured during the exercise a focus on the genitals led to greater genital arousal during the exercise a focus on sensation in the body and on the genitals wa associated with greater subjective sexual arousal during erotic film effect were small in size taken together the focus of attention during a mindfulness practice may differentially affect genital and subjective sexual arousal and ha implication for woman experiencing difficulty in different aspect of sexual response

childhood adversity ca increase the risk of subsequent mental health problem adolescent social support from family and or friend reduces the risk of mental health problem after ca however the mechanism of this effect remain unclear and we speculate that they are manifested on neurodevelopmental level therefore we investigated whether family and or friendship support at age 14 and 17 function a intermediate variable for the relationship between ca before age 11 and affective or neural response to social rejection feedback at age 18 we studied 55 adolescent with normative mental health at age 18 26 with ca and therefore considered resilient from a longitudinal cohort participant underwent a social feedback task in the magnetic resonance imaging scanner social rejection feedback activated the dorsal anterior cingulate cortex and the left anterior insula ca did not predict affective or neural response to social rejection at age 18 yet ca predicted better friendship at age 14 and age 18 when adolescent with and without ca had comparable mood level thus adolescent with ca and normative mood level have more adolescent friendship support and seem to have normal mood and neural response to social rejection

avoidance of trauma related stimulus is a key feature of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd however avoidance ha almost exclusively been investigated with explicit measure targeting more strategic aspect of behavior the aim of the present study wa to examine automatic avoidance in older individual displaced a child at the end of world war ii with n 22 and without ptsd n 26 and in non traumatized control participant n 23 with an approach avoidance task aat participant were instructed to respond to the color gray brown of trauma related neutral and control picture by pushing or pulling a joystick group did not differ significantly a to their behavioral tendency towards trauma related picture thus there wa no evidence for automatic avoidance in individual with ptsd however high vigilance wa associated with stronger implicit avoidance towards trauma related picture in the ptsd group several explanation for the non significant result a well a implication and limitation of the present finding are discussed

current cognitive behavioral model on the etiology of eating disorder propose low self esteem to be causally linked with body image disturbance thus the aim of the present study wa to experimentally test the influence of state self esteem on actual body dissatisfaction in binge eating disorder bed twenty six woman with bed were assigned to either a positive or negative implicit manipulation of self esteem thereafter participant actual body dissatisfaction and emotion were measured prior to and after a one minute mirror exposure main result reveal that after the negative compared to the positive self esteem manipulation body dissatisfaction wa significantly lower both prior to and after the mirror exposure by contrast no effect of the self esteem manipulation were found on emotional rating in line with prediction by current cognitive behavioral model the result yield some evidence of the deteriorating effect of low self esteem on body dissatisfaction in bed

background child maltreatment pose a risk to child and adolescent mental health and may also affect cognitive functioning also harsh discipline ha been frequently associated with mental health problem however within society in which harsh disciplinary method are culturally normed and highly prevalent le is known about the association between harsh punishment mental health problem and cognitive functioning method in a cross sectional study we conducted structured clinical interview with a sample of tanzanian primary school student assessing exposure to harsh discipline maltreatment and abuse chronology of exposure internalizing problem strength and difficulty questionnaire child s depression inventory and working memory corsi blocktapping task school performance wa measured by using the exam grade in 4 core subject the 409 child 52 boy had a mean age of 10 5 year range 6 15 result using structural equation modeling a strong relationship wa found between harsh discipline and internalizing problem beta 47 which were related to lower working memory capacity beta 17 and school performance beta 17 conclusion the present study suggests that harsh discipline is closely linked to child s internalizing mental health problem which are in turn associated with lower cognitive functioning and school performance given the high rate of harsh discipline experienced by child in east african home and elsewhere the finding of the present study emphasize the need to inform the population at large about the potentially adverse consequence associated with harsh discipline

body checking bc is not only inherent to the maintenance of eating disorder but is also widespread among healthy female according to etiological model while bc serf a an affect regulating behavior in the short term in the longer term it is assumed to be disorder maintaining and also produce more negative affect the present study therefore aimed to empirically examine the proposed longer term consequence of increased bc in an online study n 167 woman tracked their daily amount of bc over a total of 7 day following a 1 day baseline assessment of typical bc participant were asked to check their body in an typical manner for 3 day and with a 3 fold increased frequency for 3 day before and after each bc episode the impact of bc on affect eating disorder symptom general pathology and endorsement of different function of bc wa assessed participant showed longer term consequence of increased bc in term of increased negative affect and general pathology while eating disorder symptom remained unaffected in the case of typical bc participant showed decreased general pathology and anxiety furthermore the endorsement of a higher number of bc function led to increased negative affect and an increased amount of typical bc the finding support the theoretically assumed role of maladaptive bc in maintaining negative emotion in the longer term however though requiring replication our finding of positive effect of typical bc call into question the overall dysfunctionality of bc among non clinical woman who are not at risk of developing an eating disorder

lt b gt lt i gt background lt i gt lt b gt there is evidence that outpatient psychotherapy is effective in treating mental disorder however 5 10 of the patient get worse during treatment lt b gt lt i gt patient and method lt i gt lt b gt this randomised controlled trial investigates the effect of systematic feedback of patient progress to therapist on the outcome of psychotherapy a total of 230 adult patient were randomly assigned to three condition progress monitoring with feedback progress monitoring without feedback no progress monitoring subsequently they were treated with cognitive behavioral therapy in an outpatient clinic feedback wa based on three self report questionnaire questionnaire for the evaluation of psychotherapeutic change fep 2 outcome questionnaire oq 30 and assessment for signal case asc variance analysis with repeated measurement were conducted to verify whether feedback enhances treatment outcome lt b gt lt i gt result lt i gt lt b gt there were no statistical difference between the three condition with regard to sociodemographic and disease relevant variable patient impairment improved significantly in all three group but there were no significant difference between group moreover feedback had no differential effect on patient without initial improvement n 49 lt b gt lt i gt discussion and conclusion lt i gt lt b gt in our study collective patient progress feedback to therapist had neither a global nor a differential effect on treatment outcome in order to better demonstrate a potential feedback effect future study should aim for a higher frequency of feedback measure therapist attitude towards such feedback system and use clinical support tool

objective worry about health threatening effect of potential health hazard of modern life e g electric device and pollution represent a growing phenomenon in western country yet little is known about the cause of this growing special case of affective risk perception termed modern health worry mhw the purpose of this study is to examine a possible role of biased medium report in the formation of mhw design in two experiment we investigated whether typical television report affect mhw in study 1 130 participant were randomly assigned to a film on idiopathic environmental intolerance iei or a control film about cystic fibrosis in study 2 82 participant were randomly assigned to either a film on the danger of electromagnetic field or a control condition main outcome measure increase in mhw after sensational medium report result in study 1 only participant high on the personality trait of absorption revealed increased mhw after watching the iei film in study 2 specifically worry about radiation were found to be elevated after watching the film on the danger of electromagnetic field compared to the control film conclusion the result of both study reveal a significant and specific influence of sensational short mass medium report on mhw the influence of potential moderator such a absorption remains to be clarified

background cognitive immunisation against disconfirmatory evidence i e devaluing expectation disconfirming information through cognitive mechanism ha recently been discussed a an obstacle to the revision of dysfunctional belief in mental disorder such a depression yet it is unclear whether cognitive immunisation is also involved in belief updating in non clinical sample method using a three group modulation protocol promotion v inhibition of cognitive immunisation v control group we examined how cognitive immunisation influence belief updating in response to performance feedback in three non clinical sample in experiment 1 n 99 and 2 n 93 participant received unexpectedly negative feedback whereas participant from experiment 3 n 118 received unexpectedly positive feedback depressive symptom and dispositional optimism were examined a additional predictor of belief updating result in all experiment participant adjusted their expectation in line with the feedback received but this effect wa not influenced by the cognitive immunisation manipulation in experiment 3 expectation change remained stable over 2 week depressive symptom were associated with a reduced integration of positive feedback but not with an increased sensitivity to negative feedback conclusion whereas previous research ha shown that cognitive immunisation contributes to persistent belief in clinical population the present finding suggest that it doe not affect belief updating in non clinical sample supplementary information the online version contains supplementary material available at 10 1007 s10608 021 10256 y

previous study have shown an attentional bias towards social feature during free viewing of naturalistic scene this social attention seems to be reflexive and able to defy top down demand in form of explicit search task however the question remains whether social feature continue to be prioritized when peripheral information is limited thereby reducing the influence of bottom up image information on gaze orienting therefore we established a gaze contingent viewing paradigm in which the visual field wa constrained and updated in response to the viewer s eye movement participant viewed social and non social image that were randomly allocated to a free and a gaze contingent viewing condition while their eye movement were tracked our result revealed a strong attentional bias towards social feature in both condition however gaze contingent viewing altered temporal and spatial dynamic of viewing behavior additionally recurrent fixation were more frequent and closer together in time for social compared to non social stimulus in both viewing condition taken together this study implies a predominant selection of social feature when bottom up influence are diminished and a general influence of social content on visual exploratory behavior thus highlighting mechanism of social attention

the covid 19 pandemic ha called worldwide for strong governmental measure to contain it spread associated with considerable psychological distress this study aimed at screening a convenience sample in germany during lockdown for perceived vulnerability to disease knowledge about covid 19 symptom of depression and anxiety and behavioral response in an online survey 1358 participant completed the perceived vulnerability to disease scale pvd the patient health questionnaire phq 4 and questionnaire on knowledge about covid 19 and self perceived change in behavior in response to covid 19 lower and upper quartile of the pvd were used to classify individual into low and high pvd a confirmatory factor analysis supported three factor representing risk preventive and adaptive behavior a behavioral response to covid 19 lockdown a structural equation model showed that the score of the knowledge scale significantly predicted the self reported increase in adaptive and preventive behavior the score in the pvd subscale perceived infectability predicted a self reported increase in preventive behavior whereas the germ aversion score predicted a self reported increase in preventive and a decrease in risk behavior the score in phq 4 predicted a higher score in the perceived infectability and germ aversion subscales and a self reported decrease in adaptive behavior low medium and high pvd group reported distinct pattern of behavior knowledge and mental health symptom this study show that perceived vulnerability to disease is closely linked to preventive behavior and may enhance adaptation to covid 19 pandemic

threat can derive from our physical or social surroundings and bias the way we perceive and interpret a given situation they can be signaled by peer through facial expression a expressed anger or fear can represent the source of perceived threat the current study seek to investigate enhanced attentional state and defensive reflex associated with contextual threat induced through aversive sound presented in an emotion recognition paradigm in a sample of 120 healthy participant response and gaze behavior revealed difference in perceiving emotional facial expression between threat and safety condition response were slower under threat and le accurate happy and neutral facial expression were classified correctly more often in a safety context and misclassified more often a fearful under threat this unidirectional misclassification suggests that threat applies a negative filter to the perception of neutral and positive information eye movement were initiated later under threat but fixation change were more frequent and dwell time shorter compared to a safety context these finding demonstrate that such experimental paradigm are capable of providing insight into how context alters emotion processing at cognitive physiological and behavioral level such alteration may derive from evolutionary adaptation necessary for biasing cognitive processing to survive disadvantageous situation this perspective set up new testable hypothesis regarding how such level of explanation may be dysfunctional in patient population

abstractin evaluation study on couple relationship enhancement cre program researcher are encouraged to also investigate which couple benefit from program participation the author qualified 104 university student to offer an evidence based cre program up to a 15 month follow up the participating couple n 234 reported a significant decrease in unsolved relationship conflict a 2 day long intensive training led to better result compared with a weekly format regarding dropout couple with lower pretest satisfaction rating reported significant improvement over time whereas couple with initial higher rating reported no change or a deterioration further predictor were identified the finding should be taken into account in future research

background social anxiety disorder sad and body dysmorphic disorder bdd are characterized by fear of negative evaluation by others related to one s own incompetence or flawed appearance respectively previous research ha shown that individual with sad and bdd exhibit difficulty identifying facial expression and interpretive bias for threat in social situation the current study aimed at further investigating social cognition in sad bdd and mentally healthy control 35 individual per group respectively further 35 individual with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd a a clinical control group not characterized by evaluation fear were included method the movie for the assessment of social cognition masc wa applied it consists of 45 video sequence depicting interaction among four people at a dinner party participant are instructed to evaluate each scenario with respect to the character emotion thought and intention from a bystander perspective i e other referent context result only the socially anxious group sad and bdd were overall le accurate than the other group in correctly interpreting the social situation whereas no difference wa obtained between the ocd and the control group further analysis indicated that the sad and bdd group were le accurate in identifying other people s thought and intention whereas again no difference wa observed between the ocd and control group in addition the sad group wa le accurate in inferring thought and intention than the ocd group interestingly the group did not differ with respect to identifying other people s emotion conclusion these result mostly confirm existing cognitive behavioral model of sad and bdd emphasizing that biased interpretation of what others think or intend is one of the key factor maintaining social anxiety and appearance related concern our study show that this bias generalizes to social situation in which individual take a third person observer perspective

day to day life involves the perception of event that resemble one another for the sufficient encoding and retrieval of similar information the hippocampus provides two essential computational process pattern separation refers to the differentiation of overlapping memory representation whereas pattern completion reactivates memory based on noisy or degraded input evidence from human and rodent study suggest that pattern separation specifically relies on neuronal ensemble activity in hippocampal subnetworks in the dentate gyrus and ca3 although a role for ca1 in pattern separation ha been shown in animal model it contribution in the human hippocampus remains elusive in order to elucidate the contribution of ca1 neuron to pattern separation we examined 14 patient with an acute transient global amnesia tga a rare self limiting dysfunction of the hippocampal system showing specific lesion to ca1 patient pattern separation performance wa tested during the acute amnestic phase and follow up using an established mnemonic similarity test patient in the acute phase showed a profound deficit in pattern separation p 05 a well a recognition memory p 001 that recovered during follow up specifically patient tested in a later stage of the amnesia were le impaired in pattern separation than in recognition memory considering the time dependency of lesion associated hippocampal deficit in early and late acute stage of the tga we showed that the pattern separation function recovered significantly earlier than recognition memory our result provide causal evidence that hippocampal ca1 neuron are critical to pattern separation performance in human

background missing action completion signal are assumed to trigger repetitive behavior and feeling of the action not being right this proposal is based mostly on individual s self report here we investigated the influence of experimentally manipulated action completion experience and the obsessive compulsive oc trait of incompleteness on behavioral and neurophysiological measure of action inhibition method action completion wa manipulated in an adapted go nogo task and oc trait incompleteness wa assessed in healthy participant more commission error and faster response were expected after missing action completion especially for individual with high oc trait incompleteness the inhibition related event related potential erps n200 and p300 were also measured result high oc trait incompleteness led to more error following omitted and faster response during commission error following incongruent outcome furthermore lower n200 wa associated with worse response inhibition and high oc trait incompleteness wa associated with reduced n200 but not reduced p300 amplitude these finding provide evidence that trait like feeling of incompleteness may underlie maladaptive action repetition and impaired inhibitory control a observed in ocd

negative interpretation is thought to be crucial in the development and maintenance of depression recently developed cognitive bias modification paradigm intending to change these bias towards a more optimistic interpretation tendency cbm i seem to offer new promising implication for cognitive therapy innovation this study aimed to increase our knowledge of the underlying mechanism of action of imagery based cbm i in the context of depressed mood we therefore compared the efficacy of cbm i requiring participant to imagine standardized positive resolution to a novel more active training version that required participant to generate the positive interpretation themselves fifty four participant were randomly allocated to 1 standardized cbm i 2 self generation cbm i or 3 a control group outcome measure included self report mood measure and a depression related interpretation bias measure both positive training variant significantly increased the tendency to interpret fresh ambiguous material in an optimistic manner however only the standardized imagery cbm i paradigm positively influenced mood

objective individual with low socioeconomic status s have significantly higher prevalence rate of mental disorder than those with higher s but are le likely to receive treatment study from the united state show that individual with higher s are more likely to be offered a therapy place than those with low s in germany where the public health care system is without financial barrier study on access to treatment are lacking method the present study investigated whether the s of person seeking psychotherapeutic help in germany influence psychotherapist decision to provide access to treatment for this purpose 504 licensed outpatient psychological psychotherapist participated in an online study in which they read a series of case vignette and rated how likely they would be to offer treatment in each case s wa operationalized by occupation and language use additionally we investigated whether treatment offer were affected by the disorder and the gender of the help seeker the therapist socioeconomic background and other characteristic in interaction with s bonferroni corrected multifactorial repeated measure analysis of variance anova and mixed anova were calculated result help seeker with low s were 4 1 le likely to be offered treatment than those with moderate to high s f 1 503 115 64 p 0 000 eta 2 0 187 the influence of s on the probability of a therapy place offer varied significantly depending on the patient s disorder p 0 000 s had a greater effect for bulimia than for depression and social anxiety disorder overall the effect wa small eta 2 0 026 no significant interaction between the gender of potential client and s wa found p 0 062 the influence of s on treatment accessibility varied depending on the therapeutic method for which the therapist wa licensed and on the social status of the district in which the therapist s practice wa located the therapist s socioeconomic background parental s did not interact with the potential client s s conclusion therapist bias contributing to unequal access to treatment for individual with low s and other characteristic can aggravate mental health care disparity even though the effect we found were relatively modest awareness of the association between s and offer of therapy place might help practitioner to reflect on their own selection practice

practicability barrier hinder dissemination of exposure smartglass device may enable therapist to guide exposure from their own office smartglass guided exposure wa positively evaluated adverse event were minimal smartglass guided exposure resulted in strong within session fear reduction exposure is a highly effective treatment for pathological fear and anxiety but rarely used in routine care issue of practicability and lack of therapist in rural area are main barrier for the dissemination of exposure smartglass device may enable therapist to guide exposure from their own office via real time feedback and may thereby increase practicability the present study explored the technological usability and clinical feasibility of smartglass guided exposure in a behavioral approach test in spider fearful individual n 40 fearful individual were asked to start the smartglass themselves and established a connection to a therapist who guided the exposure test from afar clinical severity of spider fear wa assessed via questionnaire technological usability wa assessed with established measure of usability user experience and user acceptance exploratory individual characteristic of exposure were collected e g within session fear reduction duration safety behavior overall fearful individual 94 9 and therapist 100 were able to establish a connection usability of smartglass guided exposure wa evaluated a positive within session fear reduction wa large d 1 91 adverse event were minimal there were however some association between exposure characteristic and usability evaluation e g lower user friendliness and exposure duration two case example further highlight chance and risk of smartglass guided exposure these finding provide first evidence that smartglass guided exposure could be useful in exposure therapy smartglass guided exposure may ultimately help to increase practicability of exposure and increase dissemination also in rural area these finding are promising for future research on the long term outcome of evidence based exposure in treatment seeking patient

the spreading of covid 19 ha led to panic buying all over the world in this study we applied an animal model framework to elucidate change in human purchasing behavior under covid 19 pandemic condition purchasing behavior and potential predictor were assessed in an online questionnaire format n 813 multiple regression analysis were used to evaluate the role of individually perceived threat of covid 19 anxiety related personality trait trait anxiety intolerance of uncertainty and the role of medium exposure in predicting quantity and frequency of purchasing behavior high level of perceived threat of covid 19 were associated significantly with a reported reduction in purchasing frequency b 24 p 001 and an increase in the quantity of product bought per purchase b 22 p 001 these result are comparable to observed change in foraging behavior in rodent under threat condition higher level of intolerance of uncertainty b 19 p 001 and high extend of medium exposure b 27 p 001 were positively associated with perceived threat of covid 19 and an increase in purchasing quantity this study contributes to our understanding of aberrated human purchasing behavior and aim to link finding from animal research to human behavior beyond experimental investigation

arousal and the way it is coped with are relevant to the emergence of psychotic symptom heart rate variability hrv stem from autonomic response to environmental demand such a stress and is an index of physiological arousal adaptability and homeostatic reflex forming autonomic balance a randomized controlled between subject trial that compared hrv biofeedback bf to an active relaxation and to a waiting control condition wa conducted in a sample with attenuated subclinical psychotic symptom n 84 a 20 min intervention wa preceded and followed by repeated assessment of stress response change score of the post stress period were analyzed using anova for hrv subjective stress perceived control and state paranoia a expected bf participant showed greater improvement in perceived control than waiting control p 0 006 however no group difference occurred in hrv paranoid symptom or subjective stress in exploratory analysis in a subset of participant who were breathing per protocol the expected effect were found for total hrv and state paranoia thus this trial of hrv bf for people with attenuated psychotic symptom indicates that the intervention may hold potential if conducted per protocol to reach this longer training might be inevitable future study are needed to further elucidate efficacy and applicability of hrv bf in clinical sample

background borderline personality disorder bpd is commonly proposed to be characterized by an enhanced sensitivity for emotional stimulus in the present study we investigated whether bpd patient show a superior detection of emotional facial expression relative to healthy control the detection of emotional information in the environment represents an important facet of emotional sensitivity sampling and method twenty patient with bpd were compared with 25 healthy control the participant were presented a rapid continuous stream of neutral and randomly inserted emotional facial expression and were asked to report the presentation of an emotional facial stimulus after each trial availability of cognitive resource wa manipulated via two different task demand result the participant with bpd performed significantly better in the detection of positive and negative facial expression compared to the healthy control false alarm rate did not differ significantly between the two group conclusion the bpd participant showed an enhanced detection of emotional expression that might be related to the emotional disturbance they experience in particular we will discus the role of this superior emotion detection in combination with previously reported deficit in the labeling of emotional state for the understanding of emotional instability in bpd

meta analysis reveal that homework compliance is associated with a better treatment outcome however little is known about the process that could be responsible for patient compliance with homework it ha been proposed that therapist competence in particular with respect to reviewing homework is highly relevant for homework compliance the present study is a secondary analysis of a randomized controlled trial altogether 54 patient with recurrent depressive disorder currently in remission who were treated with maintenance cognitive therapy mct were considered one videotaped treatment session of each patient wa randomly selected and therapist competence general competence and specific competence in setting and reviewing homework wa assessed by 2 independent raters furthermore both patient and therapist view of the therapeutic alliance were evaluated by questionnaire in this therapy session homework compliance considering quantitative a well a qualitative aspect in the following session wa evaluated by 2 additional raters these 2 raters were blinded regarding the rating of the therapeutic competence in a multilevel path analysis model a significant association between the therapeutic competence in reviewing homework and homework compliance wa detected while the therapeutic alliance and several patient characteristic were not associated with homework compliance we found no relationship between homework compliance and treatment outcome our result demonstrate that a specific therapeutic competence i e competence in reviewing homework is associated with patient compliance with homework and therefore provides further empirical evidence of the importance of therapist competence in the psychotherapeutic process

background network analysis ha gained increasing attention a a new framework to study complex association between symptom of post traumatic stress disorder ptsd a number of study have been published to investigate symptom network on different set of symptom in different population and the finding have been inconsistent objective we aimed to extend previous research by testing whether difference in ptsd symptom network can be found in survivor of type i single event sudden and unexpected high level of acute threat v type ii repeated and or protracted anticipated trauma with regard to their index trauma method participant were trauma exposed individual with elevated level of ptsd symptomatology most of whom 94 were undergoing assessment in preparation for ptsd treatment in several treatment centre in germany and switzerland n 286 with type i and n 187 with type ii trauma we estimated bayesian gaussian graphical model for each trauma group and explored group difference in the symptom network result first for both trauma type our analysis identified the edge that were repeatedly reported in previous network study second there wa decisive evidence that the two network were generated from different multivariate normal distribution i e the network differed on a global level third explorative edge wise comparison showed moderate or strong evidence for specific 12 edge edge which emerged a especially important in distinguishing the network were between intrusion and flashback highlighting the stronger positive association in the group of type ii trauma survivor compared to type i survivor flashback showed a similar pattern of result in the association with detachment and sleep problem type ii type i conclusion our finding suggest that trauma type contributes to the heterogeneity in the symptom network future research on ptsd symptom network should include this variable in the analysis to reduce heterogeneity

obesity is one of the greatest public health challenge in the world with childhood prevalence rate between 20 26 and numerous associated health risk the aim of the current study wa to analyze the 11 year follow up data of the ulm birth cohort study ubcs to identify whether abnormal eating behavior pattern especially restrained eating predict body mass index bmi at 11 year of age and to explore other factor known to be longitudinally associated with it of the original ubcs n 422 child 40 of the original sample and their parent participated in the 11 year follow up bmi at age 8 and 11 a well a information on restrained eating psychological problem depressive symptom lifestyle and iq at age 8 were assessed partial least square structural equation modeling pls sem wa used to predict child s bmi score at age 11 pls sem explained 68 of the variance of bmi at age 11 with bmi at age 8 being the most important predictor restrained eating via bmi at age 8 a well a parental bmi had further weak association with bmi at age 11 no other predictor wa statistically significant since established overweight at age 8 already predicts bmi score at age 11 longitudinally obesity intervention should be implemented in early childhood

background body image dissatisfaction bid is related to an increased risk for various health issue including descreased health related quality of life hrqol the development of problematic eating behavior and obesity previous research indicates that emotional intelligence is one important factor related to bid in adult whether this is the case in child remains yet unknown taking this into consideration the aim of this study wa to explore the relationship between bid and trait based emotion intelligence tei a well a hrqol in female and male primary school child material and method tei and bid were assessed via self report a well a hrqol via parental report in a large sample of 991 primary school child 429 girl within the baden wurttemberg study which evaluated the effectiveness of the health prevention programm join the healthy boat in southwestern germany result our finding demonstrated the interrelation between higher level of tei and lower level of bid among girl and boy positive association were found between better hrqol better intrapersonal and stress management abilites subscales of tei and lower bid a reflected by parental and self report conclusion our result reveal an interconnectivity between tei bid and better hrqol in female and male primary school child although the observed correlation were rather small they nervertheless support the idea that tei consists a key factor for the self regulation of health related behavior prevention program could benefit from including process that sough to improve aspect of emotional intelligence such a intrapersonal interpersonal ability and adaptability a an effort of preventing problematic habit or lifestyle that could lead to disordered eating behavior a well a to obesity in middle childhood

fear and anxiety are crucial for adaptive responding in life threatening situation whereas fear is a phasic response to an acute threat accompanied by selective attention anxiety is characterized by a sustained feeling of apprehension and hypervigilance during situation of potential threat in the current literature fear and anxiety are usually considered mutually exclusive with partially separated neural underpinnings however there is accumulating evidence that challenge this distinction between fear and anxiety and simultaneous activation of fear and anxiety network ha been reported therefore the current study experimentally tested potential interaction between fear and anxiety fifty two healthy participant completed a differential fear conditioning paradigm followed by a test phase in which the conditioned stimulus were presented in front of threatening or neutral contextual image to capture defense system activation we recorded subjective threat u expectancy physiological skin conductance heart rate and visuocortical steady state visual evoked potential response to the conditioned stimulus a a function of contextual threat result demonstrated successful fear conditioning in all measure in addition threat and u expectancy rating cardiac deceleration and visuocortical activity were enhanced for fear cue presented in threatening compared with neutral context these result are in line with an additive or interactive rather than an exclusive model of fear and anxiety indicating facilitated defensive behavior to imminent danger in situation of potential threat

social interaction requires fast and efficient processing of another person s intention in face to face interaction aversive or appetitive action typically co occur with emotional expression allowing an observer to anticipate action intention in the present study we investigated the influence of facial emotion on the processing of action intention thirty two participant were presented with video clip showing virtual agent displaying a facial emotion angry v happy while performing an action punch v fist bump directed towards the observer during each trial video clip stopped at varying duration of the unfolding action and participant had to recognize the presented action naturally participant recognition accuracy improved with increasing duration of the unfolding action interestingly while facial emotion did not influence accuracy there wa a significant influence on participant action judgement participant were more likely to judge a presented action a a punch when agent showed an angry compared to a happy facial emotion this effect wa more pronounced in short video clip showing only the beginning of an unfolding action than in long video clip showing near complete action these result suggest that facial emotion influence anticipatory processing of action intention allowing for fast and adaptive response in social interaction

the behavioral activation for depression scale bad wa developed to measure core concept of behavioural activation for depression a number of study mostly based on analogue sample have provided initial support for the bad in the present study we examined the psychometric property of the german version of the scale more broadly including change sensitivity and clinical treatment data a mixed sample of student n 312 and depressed outpatient in partial remission undergoing cognitive behavioural group treatment for depressive rumination n 59 wa examined to analyze construct validity a set of theoretically relevant construct such a perseverative thinking distraction and mindfulness wa also assessed result indicated good psychometric property additional evidence for construct validity of the total scale and subscales and adequate fit of the data to the original factor structure furthermore the bad proved to be sensitive to change in participant undergoing treatment for depression copyright c 2015 john wiley son ltd key practitioner message behavioural activation ba is an effective treatment for patient suffering from unipolar depression the behavioral activation for depression scale bad can be used to measure core element of the ba treatment rationale it is useful to track change in activation within treatment the bad is available in different language and ha shown to posse good psychometric property

the ability to regulate emotion is essential for psychological well being therefore it is particularly important to investigate the specific dynamic of emotion regulation in a new approach we developed a novel paradigm the script based reappraisal test srt to measure the process involved in reappraisal especially reappraisal inventiveness i e the ability to create multiple and differing reappraisal the aim of this study wa twofold 1 experimentally validate the srt and 2 investigate whether reappraisal inventiveness increase reappraisal effectiveness healthy student n 143 completed the srt in this task we presented everyday emotional situation in textual form and instructed participant to either decrease negative emotion by generating different reappraisal reappraisal trial or react naturally control trial to the situation after each trial participant indicated their affective state sam and typed in their reappraisal thought within subject analysis showed significantly le negative affect and arousal in reappraisal trial compared to control trial indicating a successful emotion regulation through reappraisal contrary to our hypothesis reappraisal inventiveness and reappraisal effectiveness were not related the theoretical and practical implication are discussed in the light of a person by situation approach

social anxiety disorder sad is associated with continual social stress in everyday life two physiological component of stress are the hypothalamus pituitary adrenal axis a captured by cortisol reactivity and the autonomous nervous system a captured by salivary alpha amylase saa reactivity in child with sad initial evidence point to dysregulated physiological stress reactivity for both system furthermore hardly any study have assessed stress reactivity twice including exploring possible change after cognitive behavioral therapy cbt child with sad n 65 aged 9 13 year and healthy control hcs n 55 participated in a social stress task trier social stress test for child tsst c which wa repeated with child with sad after either 12 session of cbt or a waiting period to explore possible habituation or sensitization effect before treatment child in the sad and hc group did not differ in their cortisol stress reactivity toward the tsst c but did differ in their saa response with a more pronounced response in the sad group after treatment child with sad in the waitlist group differed from child with sad in the cbt group by showing stronger cortisol reactivity and a higher responder rate indicative of a possible sensitization to stress no difference wa found for saa future research should compare child with sad and hc child concerning the effect of repeated stress on sensitization
