aggression is a prominent interpersonal dysfunction of individual with borderline personality disorder bpd in bpd aggression is predominantly reactive in nature often triggered by frustration provocation or social threat and is associated with intense anger and an inability to regulate this strong negative emotion building on previous research we were interested in investigating negative emotionality in general and anger in particular in woman with bpd before and after frustration induction to achieve this 60 medication free woman with bpd and 32 healthy woman rated the intensity of negative emotion angry frustrated upset embarrassed nervous before and after performing a titrated mirror tracing task which reliably induces frustration and distress a expected woman with bpd reported significantly greater intensity of negative emotion before and after frustration than healthy woman specifically they showed a significantly stronger frustration induced increase in anger while other negative emotion remained unaffected by frustration induction this anger increase wa significantly related to aggressive behavior reported in the 2 week prior to the experiment a well a to the level of frustration experienced in the experiment itself but not with emotion dysregulation the current data confirm the important role of frustration induced anger independent of emotion dysregulation in bpd in particular with regard to aggression a prominent interpersonal dysfunction of this disorder these finding underline the importance of intervention with particular focus on anger

attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd is one of the most common neurodevelopmental disorder with significant and often lifelong effect on social emotional and cognitive functioning influential neurocognitive model of adhd link behavioral symptom to altered connection between and within functional brain network here we investigate whether network based theory of adhd can be generalized to understanding variation in adhd related behavior within the normal i e clinically unaffected adult population in a large and representative sample self rated presence of adhd symptom varied widely only 8 out of 291 participant scored in the clinical range subject specific brain network graph were modeled from functional mri resting state data and revealed significant association between nonclinical adhd symptom and region specific profile of between module and within module connectivity effect were located in brain region associated with multiple neuronal system including the default mode network the salience network and the central executive system our result are consistent with network perspective of adhd and provide further evidence for the relevance of an appropriate information transfer between task negative default mode and task positive brain region more generally our finding support a dimensional conceptualization of adhd and contribute to a growing understanding of cognition a an emerging property of functional brain network

background preoperative anxiety is prevalent and ha harmful effect on postoperative outcome however to date it is still unclear i to what extent patient perceive preoperative anxiety a emotionally distressful ii whether patient would welcome support from anesthesiologist in coping with their anxiety and iii whether anxiety score are useful for everyday clinical practice to determine patient need for support method 1082 patient scheduled to undergo elective procedure under general anesthesia were eligible for this cross sectional study carried out at a university hospital preoperative anxiety resulting in emotional distress and patient desire for anesthesiologist support in coping with their anxiety were assessed dichotomously no v yes and analyzed descriptively the intensity of anxiety wa evaluated using the amsterdam preoperative anxiety and information scale range 4 20 association between the intensity of anxiety and the resulting desire for support were analyzed using logistic regression receiver operating characteristic analysis were performed to identify anxiety level that best predict desire for support result among the 1000 537 female m sd 57 18 year subject evaluated 493 318 65 female reported anxiety anxiety wa associated with emotional distress in 320 65 and desire for support in 291 59 patient increased preoperative anxiety level were associated with higher rate of desire for support b 0 270 odds ratio 1 31 95 ci 1 22 1 41 an anxiety score 9 wa best to predict a desire for support sensitivity 0 861 specificity 0 724 however desire for support wa even present in some patient with lowest anxiety score 5 or 6 conclusion all patient undergoing surgery should be screened for preoperative anxiety and the resulting desire for support to be able to determine who would welcome support anxiety scoring tool do not seem to be useful to identify these patient by helping patient experience le preoperative anxiety anesthesiologist may not only reduce patient emotional distress but also have a positive impact on postoperative outcome trial registration german clinical trial register drks 00013319 23 november 2017

objective knowledge of patient in session experience that lead to symptom change in psychotherapy is limited this study aim to investigate the within and between patient relationship between three in session process in psychotherapy coping skill therapeutic relationship quality and emotional involvement and symptom change on a session by session level method participant n 1550 with various disorder including primarily depression and anxiety were treated with cbt in a german outpatient clinic symptom distress wa assessed before each session and patient in session experience were assessed at the end of each session using session report person mean centering wa applied to disaggregate within and between patient within and between patient process score were tested in multilevel model a predictor of next session symptom change result on a within patient level better session specific coping skill better therapeutic alliance and deeper emotional involvement were followed by next session symptom improvement in a combined model only coping skill specifically predicted next session symptom change additionally these coping skill were especially helpful when combined with a better therapeutic relationship quality on a between patient level better therapeutic alliance and more coping skill were associated with lower symptom score during treatment while deeper emotional involvement wa associated with higher symptom score testing these between patient effect in a combined model left only coping skill the more the greater symptom improvement and emotional involvement the deeper the le symptom improvement a significant predictor these two also exhibited a combined effect on symptom change on the between patient level discussion the result highlight the importance of a thorough disaggregation of within and between patient variability in psychotherapy process outcome research a well a the consideration of several potentially important time varying covariates while coping skill showed to be the most central for subsequent symptom change therapeutic relationship quality only seemed to be a facilitative factor in enhancing these effect but wa not sufficiently helpful on it own

learning account of addiction and obesity emphasize the persistent power of pavlovian reward cue to trigger craving and increase relapse risk while extinction can reduce conditioned responding pavlovian relapse phenomenon the return of conditioned responding following successful extinction challenge the long term success of extinction based treatment translational laboratory model of pavlovian relapse could therefore represent a valuable tool to investigate the mechanism mediating relapse although so far human research ha mostly focused on return of fear phenomenon to this end we developed an appetitive conditioning paradigm with liquid food reward in combination with a 3 day design to investigate the return of appetitive pavlovian response and the involved neural structure in healthy subject pavlovian conditioning day 1 wa assessed in 62 participant and a subsample n 33 further completed extinction day 2 and a reinstatement test day 3 conditioned responding wa assessed on explicit pleasantness rating and implicit measure reaction time skin conductance heart rate startle response and reinstatement effect were further evaluated using fmri we observed a return of conditioned responding during the reinstatement test evident by enhanced skin conductance response accompanied by enhanced bold response in the amygdala on an individual level psychophysiological reinstatement intensity wa significantly anticorrelated with ventromedial prefrontal cortex vmpfc activation and marginally anticorrelated with enhanced amygdala vmpfc connectivity during late reinstatement our result extend evidence from return of fear phenomenon to the appetitive domain and highlight the role of the vmpfc and it functional connection with the amygdala in regulating appetitive pavlovian relapse

listener are sensitive to a speaker s individual language use and generate expectation for particular speaker it is unclear however how such expectation affect online language processing in the present eeg study we presented thirty two participant with auditory sentence stimulus of two speaker speaker differed in their use of two particular syntactic structure easy subject initial sov structure and more difficult object initial osv structure one speaker the sov speaker had a high proportion of sov sentence 75 and a low proportion of osv sentence 25 and vice versa for the osv speaker participant were exposed to the speaker individual language use in a training session followed by a test session on the consecutive day erp result show that early stage of sentence processing are driven by syntactic processing only and are unaffected by speaker specific expectation in a late stage however an interaction between speaker and syntax information wa observed for the sov speaker condition the classical p600 effect reflected the effort of processing difficult and unexpected sentence structure for the osv speaker condition both structure elicited different response on frontal electrode possibly indexing effort to switch from a local speaker model to a global model of language use overall the study identifies distinct neural mechanism related to speaker specific expectation

background previous research ha shown that anxiety syndrome are highly prevalent among university student effective treatment are needed to reduce the burden of anxiety in this population powerful posture have been found to impact affective state a well a interoception i e the ability to perceive inner bodily signal however no previous study ha compared the effect of powerful and neutral posture in regard to anxiety and interoceptive ability method the first part of the study measured the single session effect of adopting powerful v neutral posture on student n 57 interoceptive ability and state anxiety the second part of the study measured the effect of adopting powerful or neutral posture twice daily for two week on individual interoceptive ability and trait anxiety result state anxiety decreased in both condition whereas interoceptive accuracy only increased in the power posing condition after a single session interoceptive accuracy increased in both group after two week of training limitation the study included no comparison to a condition where individual adopted their natural i e usual bodily posture conclusion embodiment intervention that include element of adopting an open or expansive bodily posture whilst maintaining a self focus can help to reduce state anxiety and improve interoceptive accuracy in student population power posing doe not seem to be superior to holding a neutral posture to improve interoceptive accuracy or anxiety one reason therefore could be that both condition include the manipulation of self focus and a postural change that diverges from individual normal posture

objective mirror exposure me is a therapeutic technique to improve body image disturbance however evidence on the effectiveness of different form of me in clinical population is lacking the present study therefore analysed effect of me on trait like and state measure of body image in patient with anorexia nervosa an and bulimia nervosa bn method the present study therefore analysed effect of me on trait like and state measure of body image in patient with anorexia nervosa an and bulimia nervosa bn in total 47 inpatient underwent 3 me session guided by a therapist with instruction to exclusively verbalise positively about their whole body participant completed questionnaire on trait like eating pathology and body image at the start and end of the study and instrument on state affect and body satisfaction were administered directly before and after each me session subjective physiological arousal and emotional valence relating to each body part were assessed within each session result the result indicate significant improvement in eating pathology and body image regarding trait like measure in patient with an and bn concerning state measure negative affect significantly decreased and body satisfaction increased during me physiological arousal decreased and positively valenced emotion relating to the various body part increased conclusion these finding suggest that positively verbalising about one s body during me improves eating pathology body image affect and subjective physiological arousal and thus seems to be an effective form of me

the dual representation model of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd brewin gregory lipton burgess psychological review 117 210 232 2010 argues that intrusion occur when people fail to construct context based representation during adverse experience the present study tested a specific prediction flowing from this model in particular we investigated whether the efficiency of temporal lobe based spatial configuration learning would account for individual difference in intrusive experience and physiological reactivity in the laboratory participant n 82 completed the contextual cuing paradigm which ass spatial configuration learning that is believed to depend on associative encoding in the parahippocampus they were then shown a trauma film afterward startle response were quantified during presentation of trauma reminder picture versus unrelated neutral and emotional picture ptsd symptom were recorded in the week following participation better configuration learning performance wa associated with fewer perceptual intrusion r 33 p 01 but wa unrelated to physiological response to trauma reminder image p 46 and had no direct effect on intrusion related distress and overall ptsd symptom r 12 p 29 however configuration learning performance tended to be associated with reduced physiological response to unrelated negative image r 20 p 07 thus while spatial configuration learning appears to be unrelated to affective responding to trauma reminder our overall finding support the idea that the context based memory system help to reduce intrusion

lt b gt lt i gt background lt i gt lt b gt participant for efficacy study on internet based intervention ibi are recruited through self selected convenience sampling or targeted external invitation comparison are necessary to determine how recruitment strategy influence sample composition such comparison consequently yield potential for evaluating which condition are more probable to fulfill ibi s promise to be an effective treatment option for underserved population lt b gt lt i gt method lt i gt lt b gt a comparison of sociodemographic and clinical characteristic of differently recruited participant in an ibi for mild to moderate depression wa made 1 individual on sick leave due to an affective disorder who were informed about the ibi by their health insurance lt i gt n lt i gt 308 and 2 individual who self selected to participate e g after seeing information on the ibi in print medium lt i gt n lt i gt 699 lt b gt lt i gt result lt i gt lt b gt compared to the self selected group the externally selected group wa older le educated spent le time on the internet had a le positive attitude towards ibi and comprised more men group did not differ in initial symptom severity in treatment symptom change or previous psychotherapeutic experience lt b gt lt i gt conclusion lt i gt lt b gt the result indicate that larger share of underserved subpopulation e g le educated older male le internet savvy begin an ibi treatment when the insurer informs them about the ibi recruitment source doe not influence efficacy

difficulty in emotion regulation er are present in psychotic disorder but their precise nature is not yet fully understood and it is unclear which difficulty are unique to psychosis compared with other disorder this study investigated whether er difficulty in psychosis are more prominent for the ability to modify emotion or for the ability to tolerate and accept them furthermore it investigated whether er difficulty occur for sadness anxiety anger and shame likewise er skill were assessed in participant with psychotic disorder n 37 participant with depression n 30 and healthy control n 28 using the emotion regulation skill questionnaire that asks participant to rate the intensity of different emotion over the past week and the skill employed to handle each of them compared with healthy control participant with psychosis showed reduced skill related to awareness understanding and acceptance of potentially distressing emotion but not in the ability to modify them these difference remained significant after controlling for depression participant with psychosis showed reduced er skill in regard to all of the assessed emotion compared with the healthy control despite the fact that they only reported sadness a being significantly more intense the participant with depression showed a similar pattern of er skill to the psychosis sample although with a tendency towards even more pronounced difficulty it is concluded that psychosis is characterized by difficulty in using specific er skill related to awareness understanding and acceptance to regulate anger shame anxiety and sadness these difficulty are not unique to psychosis but nevertheless present a promising treatment target key practitioner message the participant with psychosis found it more difficult to be aware of their emotion to understand them and to accept them than the healthy control group however they reported equal skill when it came to actively modifying emotion the difficulty in emotion regulation reported by the participant with psychosis were comparable with those reported by the participant with depression and they occurred for all type of negative emotion likewise the difficulty in using specific er skill related to awareness understanding and acceptance are a promising target for psychological treatment of psychosis intervention that are aimed specifically at increasing these skill need to be further developed

background due to language barrier interpreter are crucial for refugee care in the country of resettlement however interpreter are often faced with distressing working condition such a precarious work circumstance lack of supervision or exposure to their client traumatic experience recent study examining interpreter mental health focussed primarily on secondary traumatic stress the present study aimed to gain a better understanding of psychological distress and exhaustion among interpreter in refugee care by examining these factor in the work context a well a their possible work related correlate method an online survey wa carried out in germany which included several standardized questionnaire regarding distress work and client related exhaustion job satisfaction and trauma exposure bsi 18 cbi j htq pcl 5 interpreter were recruited primarily through psychosocial treatment centre and interpreter pool in germany result in total 164 interpreter were included in the analysis the participant showed increased psychological distress and around 7 screened positive for posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd in an exploratory regression analysis younger age beta 25 p 004 emerged a correlate of psychological distress whereas dissatisfaction with payment beta 21 p 04 and a higher amount of traumatic content beta 22 p 001 were associated with work related exhaustion and dissatisfaction with recognition wa associated with client related exhaustion beta 35 p 001 conclusion the result point to increased stress level among interpreter for refugee moreover they indicate that interpreter distress is primarily correlated with work related circumstance thus suggesting the need for a greater work related support structure for interpreter

background within the integrated motivational volitional model of suicidal behavior entrapment that consecutively lead to hopelessness is considered a a proximal risk factor for suicidal ideation entrapment can refer to both external and internal circumstance whereby result of recent study indicate that internal entrapment play a more important role than external entrapment in the development of suicidal ideation it ha been considered that to escape internal entrapment might be more complicated than to change external circumstance however it remains unclear whether the greater effect of internal entrapment on suicidal ideation is due to greater feeling of hopelessness therefore the aim of this study wa to address this research gap and to examine the effect of internal and external entrapment on hopelessness and suicidal ideation method n 454 participant from a community sample 75 female aged between 18 and 73 year m 29 91 sd 11 56 conducted a cross sectional online survey all participant were assessed for suicidal ideation hopelessness and internal a well a external entrapment pearson product moment correlation and two mediation analysis were conducted result all construct were significantly correlated for both internal and external entrapment an effect on suicidal ideation wa found both effect were partially mediated by hopelessness this mediation wa larger for external entrapment the completely standardized indirect effect used to compare the mediation model wa larger for external entrapment than for internal entrapment conclusion hopelessness mediated the association between external entrapment a well a internal entrapment and suicidal ideation this effect wa larger for external entrapment

the covid 19 pandemic and related containment measure are affecting mental health especially among patient with pre existing mental disorder the aim of this study wa to investigate the effect of the first wave and it aftermath of the pandemic in germany march july on psychopathology of patient diagnosed with panic disorder social anxiety disorder and specific phobia who were on the waiting list or in current treatment at a german university based outpatient clinic from 108 patient contacted forty nine patient 45 37 completed a retrospective survey on covid 19 related stressor depression and change in anxiety symptom patient in the final sample n 47 reported a mild depression and significant increase in unspecific anxiety d 41 panic symptom d 85 and specific phobia d 38 while social anxiety remained unaltered pandemic related stressor like job insecurity familial stress and working in the health sector were significantly associated with more severe depression and increase in anxiety symptom high pre pandemic symptom severity anxiety depression wa a risk factor whereas meaningful work and being divorced separated were protective factor explained variance 46 5 of change in anxiety and 75 8 in depressive symptom in line with diathesis stress model patient show a positive association between stressor and symptom load health care system are requested to address the need of this vulnerable risk group by implementing timely and low threshold intervention to prevent patient from further deterioration

modulating emotional response to virtual stimulus is a fundamental goal of many immersive interactive application in this study we leverage the illusion of illusory embodiment and show that owning a virtual body provides mean to modulate emotional response in a single factor repeated measure experiment we manipulated the degree of illusory embodiment and assessed the emotional response to virtual stimulus we presented emotional stimulus in the same environment a the virtual body participant experienced higher arousal dominance and more intense valence in the high embodiment condition compared to the low embodiment condition the illusion of embodiment thus intensifies the emotional processing of the virtual environment this result suggests that artificial body can increase the effectiveness of immersive application psychotherapy entertainment computer mediated social interaction or health application

background this randomized controlled trial examines the relative efficacy of a disorder specific treatment program trennungsangstprogramm fur familien taff english separation anxiety family therapy for child suffering from separation anxiety disorder sad in comparison with a general anxiety program method sixty four child aged 8 13 with sad and their parent were assigned either to a 16 session disorder specific sad treatment program including parent training and classical cognitive behavioral therapy cbt component taff or to a general child focused 16 week comparison group coping cat cc without any parent training diagnosis and parent cognition were assessed at baseline and at follow ups global success rating were collected at end of treatment and at follow up rating for anxiety impairment distress and life quality were collected at baseline 1 again after a 4 week waiting period repeatedly throughout treatment at 4 week and at 1 year follow up result the response rate no sad diagnosis at 4 week follow up among the 52 treatment completers wa 87 5 v 82 1 taff v cc intent to treat 67 7 v 69 7 at 1 year follow up the response wa 83 3 versus 75 taff v cc intent to treat 64 5 v 63 6 difference were nonsignificant result from rating scale indicated improvement for both group across time point and assessment area with few between group difference and some small effect favoring the taff program both treatment program yielded a reduction in parental dysfunctional belief conclusion result indicate a slight advantage of the taff program over a general child based treatment for sad however these difference were le strong than hypothesized indicating that the inclusion of parent training doe not add large effect to classical child based cbt in school age child with sad psycinfo database record c 2013 apa all right reserved

background during the corona pandemic increased rate of embitterment have been found in the general population a embitterment occurs reactive to trigger related to experienced negative event and a people were steadily exposed to pandemic related information the research question arises can embitterment be triggered by pandemic related information in form of infection rate displayed in figure method within an experimental design we investigated whether a figure presenting infection rate in an aggravated manner seemingly strong infection increase and then stable course experimental group eg n 138 lead to stronger embitterment increase a compared to a figure presenting infection rate seemingly stable control group cg n 155 accompanying characteristic with potential influence on embitterment have been assessed wisdom general belief in a just world perceived injustice event during the pandemic result in contrast to the experimental hypothesis the eg decreased in embitterment after reading the aggravated infection rate figure whereas the cg rested stable people with higher wisdom score had a lower embitterment level after watching the infection data there wa no association between perceived pandemic related injustice event and embitterment after watching the infection data belief in a just world slightly decreased over the course in both group discussion by mean of pandemic related data presentation embitterment affect can be changed contradictory to expectation the aggravated presentation led to a reduction of embitterment this example show that even simple but specific information presentation can induce change in state affect and this happens independently from other relevant characteristic such a perceived injustice event during pandemic or general belief in a just world professional who present event related data in public should explain these data and be aware that information and data presentation may relevantly impact on people affect

the differentiation of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd and autism spectrum disorder asd pose a clinical challenge in child overlap of psychopathological and cognitive finding ha been found for both disorder in addition some child suffer from both disorder the social communication questionnaire scq is a screening instrument for asd symptom which indicates the presence of asd in a rapid and economic way however validity to differentiate asd and adhd a differential or comorbid diagnosis ha not been studied here the differential validity wa compared in group of child with asd adhd asd adhd and typically developing td child and iq 70 roc analysis indicated an excellent differentiation between asd and td with roc auc 941 and between asd adhd with roc auc 993 the optimal cutoff wa below the originally recommended one of 15 the differentiation between child with asd with roc auc 982 or without adhd roc auc 864 and adhd alone also showed acceptable differential validity and here the optimal cutoff corresponded to the recommended taken together the scq can be recommended a a screening instrument for a first differentiation between child with asd and typically developing child a well a child with adhd

retrospective and experimental data demonstrate the importance of emotion regulation er in the maintenance of binge episode in binge eating disorder bed the current study tested whether mood and er prospectively influence binge episode in individual with bed via ecological momentary assessment ema individual with bed n 79 completed two week of ema each sampling point consisted of a series of question pertaining to participant mood er and eating behaviour successful application of adaptive er strategy predicted subsequent abstinence while rumination predicted subsequent binge episode however neither successful application of adaptive er nor maladaptive er moderated the association between negative mood and probability of binge episode this naturalistic study emphasizes the importance of promoting the successful application of adaptive er skill and cessation of rumination in treatment intervention designed to decrease the occurrence of binge episode in bed

background conduct problem cp comprise abnormal behavior associated with aberrant aspect of affective empathy a well a learning however behavioral measure for affective empathy are challenging and previous result concerning learning in patient with cp are inconsistent method nineteen boy with cp and 24 typically developing td boy aged 11 17 year m 14 34 sd 1 93 participated in the study an ultimatum game wa applied in order to elicit the feeling of like or dislike towards the opponent for a subsequent gambling task which wa played by the opponent other condition and by the participant themselves self condition functional mri data were recorded throughout the experiment result in accordance with the model of insensitivity to punishment hypo activation of the left amygdala left anterior insula ventral medial prefrontal cortex mpfc and bilateral temporo parietal junction tpj wa observed a a response to losing in participant with cp during the self condition callous unemotional cu trait correlated negatively with activation of amygdala and right tpj during the other condition td participant showed activation in brain area associated with theory of mind right tpj left ifg and affect regulation right dlpfc rather than area associated with affective empathy this pattern wa not found in adolescent with cp moreover and independently of individual characteristic of their opponent adolescent with cp demonstrated reward associated activation ventral striatum observing others win which wa positively correlated with cu trait this may be interpreted in line with the theory of reward dominance conclusion the current study provides support for the theory of abnormal learning processing in adolescent with cp which yield implication for further research a well a clinical practice the gambling task did not activate affective empathy network but wa specific for cognitive empathy inhibition and affect regulation

here we tested the feasibility of a new paradigm developed to investigate the mechanism of exposure therapy the protocol wa previously developed for the use with adult and optimized to closely model the mechanism underlying exposure i e extinction learning we adapted this paradigm for the use with child and tested it feasibility in child and adult participant we used an aversive acoustic unconditioned stimulus u picture based rating scale and a child oriented instruction practice procedure result indicate robust fear acquisition extinction and reinstatement on a self report u expectancy and on a physiological startle reflex level we found evidence for the paradigm sensitivity to age and anxiety dependent individual difference in fear learning and extinction we conclude that the present paradigm is capable of modeling the key mechanism of exposure therapy that is extinction learning and can be accomplished with child adolescent and adult rendering it promising to bridge the gap between experimental protocol and treatment across the lifespan

although the link between androgen and depression is well established in adult the effect of cofactor on this association are le clearly understood particularly in youth epidemiological cohort study of adolescent in dresden germany analysis comprised data of 985 individual assessed at baseline and of 512 individual at 1 year follow up we investigated multivariable regression model for cross sectional and longitudinal association of hair testosterone dehydroepiandrosterone dhea and their cortisol ratio with 12 month diagnosis of major depressive disorder mdd and mdd without any anxiety disorder assessed with standardized diagnostic interview dia x 5 and with dimensional depression score phq 9 promis separately for male and female the potential moderating effect of social support wa determined cross sectional analysis yielded inverse association of testosterone and dhea with mdd and mdd without any anxiety disorder in male in cross sectional and longitudinal analysis baseline ratio cortisol dhea wa significantly inversely associated to promis depression in male only cross sectional association for ratio cortisol dhea and promis depression remained significant after bonferroni holm correction no robust association were observed in female participant social support exerted no consistent moderating effect on the investigated association the present observational cohort study showed no consistent association of hair androgen concentration with depressive disorder in adolescent however finding provide some support for the association between the cortisol dhea ratio and depression in male longitudinal research design in large sample are needed to understand the interplay between androgen depression and developmental and social factor in youth

face recognition usually take place in a social context where face are surrounded by other stimulus these can act a distracting flanker which impair recognition previous work ha suggested that flanker expressing negative emotion distract more than positive one however the various negative emotion differ in their relative impact and it is unclear whether all negative emotion are equally distracting we investigated the impact of three negative angry fearful sad and one positive happy facial flanker condition on target recognition in an emotion discrimination task we examined the effect of the receiver s gender and the impact of two different temporal delay between flanker and target onset a stimulus onset asynchrony is assumed to affect distractor strength participant identified and rated the emotional intensity of target face surrounded by either face emotional and neutral or non face flanker target face were presented either simultaneously with the flanker or delayed by 300 m contrary to our hypothesis negative flanker did not exert stronger distraction effect than positive or neutral flanker however happy flanker reduced recognition performance result of a follow up experiment with a balanced number of emotion category one positive one negative and one neutral flanker condition suggest that the distraction effect of emotional flanker depends on the composition of the emotion category additionally congruency effect were found to be valence specific and overruled by threat stimulus female responded more quickly and rated target in happy flanker a le intense this indicates a gender difference in emotion processing with greater sensitivity to facial flanker in woman target were rated a more intense when they were presented without a temporal delay possibly due to a stronger flanker contrast these three experiment show that an exceptional processing of threat related flanker stimulus depends on emotion category composition which should be considered a mediating factor when examining emotional context effect

the aim of this study wa to analyze the impact of maternal postpartum depression and or anxiety disorder according to dm iv on maternal self confidence throughout infancy and early childhood exploratively association between maternal attachment insecurity and maternal self confidence at pre school age were examined the sample n 54 of this prospective longitudinal study wa comprised of n 27 woman with postpartum depression and or anxiety disorder according to dsm iv criterion and n 27 healthy woman without present or history of mental health disorder or psychotherapy data wa collected in the postpartum period m 60 08 day and at pre school age m 4 7 year subject were recruited between 2004 and 2011 in south germany data revealed a significant difference in maternal self confidence between clinical and control group at child s pre school age woman with postpartum depression and or anxiety disorder scored lower on maternal self confidence than healthy control but only if they had current scid diagnosis or partly remitted symptom according to explorative analysis maternal attachment insecurity turned out to be the strongest predictor of maternal self confidence at pre school age besides maternal mental health status the result emphasize the impact of attachment insecurity and maternal mental health regarding maternal self confidence leading to potential adverse long term consequence for the mother child relationship attachment based intervention taking maternal self confidence into account are needed

abstract background emotion regulation is assumed to be impaired in psychosis patient with psychotic disorder pd self report to use reappraisal le frequently than healthy control hc but it is uncertain whether they are also le successful in applying reappraisal moreover it ha not been investigated whether the habitual use of reappraisal is associated with the ability to use reappraisal successfully method to address these question pd n 60 a clinical control group of patient with anxiety disorder ad n 40 and hc n 40 completed questionnaire on habitual emotion regulation and alexithymia performed test on neurocognitive functioning and jumping to conclusion bias and were subjected to an emotion regulation paradigm in which they were asked to down regulate induced anxiety and sadness result no difference were found between pd and hc regarding the habitual use of reappraisal but pd reported to use reappraisal more frequently than ad all group were able to down regulate anxiety and sadness via reappraisal following instruction the habitual use of reappraisal and the reduction of anxiety and sadness after instruction were uncorrelated conclusion these finding question the common assumption that pd use reappraisal le often or le successfully at least under laboratory condition pd do not appear to be impaired in reducing negative affect via reappraisal successfully

abstract background cognitive decline is considered a fundamental component in schizophrenia abnormality in fronto striatal thalamic fst sub circuit are present in schizophrenia and are associated with cognitive impairment however it remains unknown whether abnormality in fst sub circuit are present before psychosis onset this may be elucidated by investigating young adult with 22q11 2 deletion syndrome 22q11ds of whom 30 will develop schizophrenia in adulthood in 22q11ds cognitive decline most pronounced in verbal iq viq precedes the onset of psychosis and those who develop psychosis diverge more strongly from a typical cognitive trajectory based on these finding study of young adult with 22q11ds without overt psychosis but with prodromal symptom may increase our understanding of cognitive manifestation and early pathology in fst sub circuit in schizophrenia here we examined white matter wm tract in fst sub circuit especially those involving dorsolateral dlpfc and ventrolateral prefrontal cortex vlpfc and their association with viq in young adult with 22q11ds with and without prodromal symptom method we compared fractional anisotropy fa axial diffusivity ad and radial diffusivity rd in tract of the fst sub circuit in 21 individual with 22q11ds with prodromal symptom age m 21 43 and 30 individual without prodromal symptom age m 20 73 to 30 healthy control age m 20 89 two tensor tractography wa applied to reconstruct wm fiber tract of the whole brain followed by applying the white matter query language wmql method to select tract between striatum and thalamus with the rostral middle frontal gyrus rmfg and inferior frontal gyrus ifg representing dlpfc and vlpfc this yielded four tract of interest thalamus rmfg thalamus ifg striatum rmfg and striatum ifg tract additionally correlation between the dmri measure and score on viq were performed result fa wa significantly increased while rd wa significantly decreased in most wm tract in both 22q11ds group when compared to healthy control in the whole 22q11ds group viq correlated negatively with fa in the right thalamus ifg tract r 0 336 p 018 while rd correlated positively with viq in the right thalamus ifg tract r 0 290 p 043 in individual with 22q11ds such that increased fa and decreased rd were associated with a lower viq we followed up on the result in individual with 22q11ds with prodromal symptom to determine whether the presence of prodromal symptom drove the correlation viq correlated significantly with fa r 0 491 p 0 024 fdr adjusted 0 048 and significantly at trend level with rd r 0 487 p 0 025 fdr adjusted 0 050 in the right thalamus ifg tract in individual with 22q11ds with prodromal symptom discussion microstructural abnormality in brain wm tract connecting the thalamus and the striatum with prefrontal cortex are present in young adult with 22q11ds with and without prodromal symptom compared to healthy control these abnormality are associated with the individual cognitive performance in viq in individual with 22q11ds with prodromal symptom and therefore emphasize the potential involvement of the fst sub circuit in schizophrenia while change in fst circuitry have been reported in patient with schizophrenia we observed that change in fst circuitry are also present in young adult with 22q11ds at risk for but without psychotic symptom our result suggest that psychosis onset in 22q11ds may be associated with a complex pattern of wm alteration furthermore cognitive abnormality especially in viq present an important preclinical risk factor for psychosis in 22q11ds

abstract in five study we evaluated the psychometric property of a revised german version of the state self esteem scale ss heatherton amp polivy 1991 in study 1 the result of a confirmatory factor analysis on the original scale revealed poor model fit and poor construct validity in a student sample that resembled those in the literature thus a revised 15 item version wa developed i e the ss r and thoroughly validated study 2 showed a valid three factor structure performance social and appearance and good internal consistency of the ss r correlation between subscales of trait and state se empirically supported the scale s construct validity temporal stability and intrapersonal sensitivity of the scale to naturally occurring event were investigated in study 3 intrapersonal sensitivity of the scale to experimentally induced change in state se wa uncovered in study 4 via social feedback acceptance v rejection and performance feedback positive v negative in study 5 the scale s interpersonal sensitivity wa confirmed by comparing depressed and healthy individual finally the usefulness of the ss r wa demonstrated by assessing se instability a calculated from repeated measure of state se

background suicide ideation is a prerequisite for suicide attempt however the majority of ideators will never act on their thought it is therefore crucial to understand factor that differentiate those who consider suicide from those who make suicide attempt aim our aim wa to investigate the role of protective factor in differentiating non ideators suicide ideators and suicide attempter method inpatient without suicide ideation n 32 were compared with inpatient with current suicide ideation n 37 and with inpatient with current suicide ideation and a lifetime history of suicide attempt n 26 regarding positive mental health self esteem trust in higher guidance social support and reason for living result non ideators reported more positive mental health social support reason for living and self esteem than suicide ideators and suicide attempter did no group difference were found regarding trust in higher guidance suicide ideators and suicide attempter did not differ regarding any of the study variable limitation result stem from a cross sectional study of suicide attempt thus neither directionality nor generalizability to fatal suicide attempt can be determined conclusion various protective factor are best characterized to distinguish ideators from nonsuicidal inpatient however the same variable seem to offer no information about the difference between ideators and attempter

although several study have shown that one acute bout of physical exercise can reduce state anxiety in healthy sample study that examine this effect in subclinical and clinical sample are still rare and have found mixed result in the present study we investigated the effect of a single session of acute exercise on state anxiety in a subclinical sample with moderate to high anxiety sensitivity potential mediator including self efficacy self esteem mindfulness subjective vitality rumination and emotional competency were explored participant n 88 with moderate to high anxiety sensitivity were assigned randomly to either an active group n 44 or a control group n 44 state anxiety and the mediator variable were assessed before and after the intervention state anxiety wa reduced from baseline to post intervention but no difference wa found between group exploratory analysis suggested that in the active intervention condition a reduction in state anxiety wa partly mediated by an increase in positive affect and mediated by an increase in subjective vitality one acute bout of exercise might not be enough to decrease state anxiety in subclinical individual with moderate to high anxiety sensitivity however the result of this study suggest that positive affect and subjective vitality could be two mechanism that might explain the beneficial effect of exercise on anxiety this should be further investigated in future study exercise doe not reduce state anxiety more than a control condition positive affect and subjective vitality mediate the reduction of state anxiety one bout of exercise is not sufficient to reduce anxiety in a subclinical sample

study examining the natural course of borderline personality disorder bpd over the life span have yielded declining prevalence rate in older age group however there is evidence that different bpd symptom have different longitudinal pattern with impulsivity decreasing with advancing age and negative affect remaining stable into late adulthood however since all study dealt with treated clinical sample of bpd patient it is not yet known whether this represents the natural course of bpd symptom or just mirror difference in treatability of these symptom the author addressed this issue by investigating a nonclinical population and compared prevalence of bpd impulsivity and depressivity in various age group from adolescence to late adulthood n 2 488 all individual were assessed by standardized clinical interview syndromal and subsyndromal bpd rate sharply decreased between adolescent and young adult and remained stable thereafter whereas the same course wa found for impulsivity depressivity increased between young middle aged and older adult the present result support the hypothesis that age related decrease in bpd diagnosis might be attributable to declining level of impulsivity whereas the persistence of a subsyndromal bpd might be attributable to an enduring negative affect

background neuroimaging study have demonstrated that the actual experience of pain and the perception of another person in pain share common neural substrate including the bilateral anterior insular cortex and the anterior midcingulate cortex a many fmri study include the exposure of participant to repeated similar stimulus we examined whether empathic neural response were affected by habituation and whether the participant prior pain experience influenced these habituation effect method in 128 trial four run 62 participant 31 woman 23 0 4 2 year were shown picture of hand exposed to painful pressure pain picture and unexposed neutral picture after each trial the participant rated the pain of the model prior to the experiment participant were either exposed to the same pain stimulus pain exposure group or not touch exposure group in order to ass possible habituation effect linear change in the strength of the bold response to the pain picture relative to the neutral picture and in the rating of the model s pain were evaluated across the four run result although the rating of the model s pain remained constant over time we found neural habituation in the bilateral anterior midinsular cortex the posterior midcingulate extending to dorsal posterior cingulate cortex the supplementary motor area the cerebellum the right inferior parietal lobule and the left superior frontal gyrus stretching to the pregenual anterior cingulate cortex the participant s prior pain experience did neither affect their rating of the model s pain nor their maintenance of bold activity in area associated with empathy interestingly participant with high trait personal distress and fantasy tended to show le habituation in the anterior insula conclusion neural structure showed a decrease of the bold signal indicating habituation over the course of 45 minute this can be interpreted a a neuronal mechanism responding to the repeated exposure to pain depiction which may be regarded a functional in a range of context

preclinical evidence indicates that the endocannabinoid system is involved in neural response to reward this study aimed to investigate association between basal serum concentration of the endocannabinoids anandamide aea and 2 arachidonylglycerol 2 ag with brain functional reward processing additionally a personality measure of reward dependence wa obtained brain functional data were obtained of 30 right handed adult by conducting fmri at 3 tesla using a reward paradigm reward dependence wa obtained using the subscale reward dependence of the tridimensional personality questionnaire tpq basal concentration of aea and 2 ag were determined in serum analyzing the fmri data for aea and 2 ag ancovas were calculated using a full factorial model with condition reward control loss control and concentration for aea and 2 ag a factor regression analysis were conducted for aea and 2 ag on tpq rd score a whole brain analysis showed a significant interaction effect of aea concentration by condition positive v negative within the putamen x 26 y 16 z 8 f13 51 tfce 1 54 771 68 k 70 p fwe 0 044 resulting from a positive association of basal aea concentration and putamen activity to rewarding stimulus while this association wa absent in the loss condition aea concentration were significantly negatively correlated with tpq reward dependence score r spearman 0 56 p 0 001 these result show that circulating aea may modulate brain activation during reward feedback and that the personality measure reward dependence is correlated with aea concentration in healthy human volunteer future research is needed to further characterize the nature of the lipid influence on reward processing the impact on reward anticipation and outcome and on vulnerability for psychiatric disorder

aim the aim of the study wa to evaluate the psychometric property of the 13 item pathological buying screener pb 1 in a clinical sample method the pb wa administered to a total sample of 413 treatment seeking patient buying shopping disorder n 151 gambling disorder n 59 alcohol dependency n 60 other mental disorder anxiety depressive eating somatoform disorder n 143 factor structure wa tested in the total sample using confirmatory factor analysis cfa reliability wa determined by mean of cronbach s alpha group comparison were used to determine to which degree the pb discriminates between patient with bsd and other clinical group the bsd group completed a battery of other measure to explore convergent and divergent validity a subgroup n 29 answered the pb before and after psychotherapy to investigate sensitivity to change a receiver operating characteristic roc curve analysis with pb data of patient with buying shopping disorder and those from a previous community sample 1 wa performed to define a cut off point for buying shopping disorder result the cfa showed a good model fit for both a one factor and a two factor structure with the subscales loss of control consequence 10 item and excessive buying behavior 3 item the subscales were highly intercorrelated r 0 92 a hierarchical regression analysis with another bsd measure a dependent variable did not indicate an own incremental validity of the subscale excessive buying behavior good convergent divergent and discriminative capacity wa obtained for the pb total score at it recommended cut off point of 29 the pb ha a sensitivity of 98 and a specificity of 94 7 conclusion the finding indicate good psychometric property of the pb and suggest that the pb total score can be used in clinical setting

cyberbullying ha regularly been shown to be associated with suicide ideation behavior the present study investigated whether positive mental health i e high level of emotional cognitive and psychological well being buffer the association between cyberbullying and suicide ideation behavior a total of 225 student completed measure of cyberbullying suicide ideation behavior and positive mental health positive mental health fully mediated the association between cyberbullying and suicide ideation behavior positive mental health seems to confer resilience and should be taken into account in clinical and preventive program for student population

enhanced self focused attention sfa and negative attentional bias nab towards social cue are characteristic hallmark of social anxiety it is essential to investigate these two attentional phenomenon under socially relevant situation using comparable stimulus in the present study individual with high social anxiety hsa n 32 and low social anxiety lsa n 29 were compared according to their attention toward self related stimulus and toward positive neutral and negative feedback related stimulus video stimulus of moving indicator of self anxiety status and positive neutral and negative feedback from an audience were presented during an impromptu speech task high anxiety condition and a re watching phase low anxiety condition eye movement in response to the different stimulus served a readout for attentional preference an interaction effect suggested that the hsa group directed more attention to self related stimulus relative to other stimulus and the lsa group only during the high anxiety condition the lsa group exhibited a general attentional preference toward positive feedback especially during the low anxiety condition meanwhile only the total duration of fixation on positive feedback negatively correlated with subjective anxiety rating our result point to increased sfa rather than nab in hsa individual under social threat

objective the incidence of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality in premenopausal woman is comparatively low but increase sharply after menopause the principal aim of this study wa to determine whether woman with ascending aortic disease aad have a different reproductive history from that of an age matched control group method in this retrospective study woman who had undergone ascending aortic aneurysm ascaa repair between 2000 and 2010 were asked to complete a questionnaire concerning risk factor and reproductive history data from 142 woman with aad were evaluated and a subgroup n 64 with ascaa 5 cm wa analyzed and compared to an age matched random control group without known aortic disease result almost all woman were menopausal at the time of the questionnaire 98 4 v 90 6 ascaa 5 cm subcohort v control p 0 12 and all subject presented with a comparable age of menarche 13 7 2 6 year v 14 2 1 8 year ascaa 5 cm subcohort v control log rank 0 04 p 0 84 however mean menopausal age wa significantly lower in the case subcohort than in control 48 1 4 8 year v 50 6 5 8 year ascaa 5 cm subcohort v control log rank 8 35 p 0 004 and reproductive life span wa correspondingly shorter 34 2 5 2 year v 36 2 5 7 year p 0 04 furthermore hypertension wa more prevalent in woman with ascaa 5 cm compared to control 89 1 v 61 9 ascaa 5 cm subcohort v control p 0 001 conclusion woman who experience menopause at an earlier age than the regional mean could profit from screening for cardiovascular disease in general and particularly for aad screening would enable early aneurysm detection and could therefore reduce morbidity and mortality

purpose early onset of behavioral disorder is predictive of long term adverse outcome there are some indicated and selective early prevention program for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd one of the most common behavioral disorder in childhood and adolescence the purpose of this paper is to present a universal preschool program for preventing the development of adhd related symptom for child aged three to six design methodology approach a total of 413 preschool child experimental group eg 193 control group cg 220 and their teacher participated in the study child in the eg were randomized to two condition universal intervention behavior modification bm 99 v additional adhd specific element bm attention training bm at 94 to evaluate effect of a universal intervention v additional adhd specific element the universal intervention trained general behavior modification bm technique to enhance start behavior i e following color based rule positive participation in activity enhancement of skill related to attentional function and to extinguish stop behavior i e hyperactive behavior such a uncontrolled running around disturbing others quarreling etc these technique were based on published intervention program phelan and schonour 2004 the at consisted of thirteen teacher led 45 minute based session in a small group format with an introductory play activity 15 minute picture based at task task analysis action planning action reappraisal a social interaction game and a game to enhance perception of visual auditory olfactory haptic and gustatory sens to determine effect the strength and difficulty questionnaire sdq and the behavior rating for preschooler vbv were used a high risk group with high score on those measure wa analyzed separately finding child in all three group did not differ significantly at baseline in all relevant variable adhd symptom measured with the sdq and vbv socio economic status s gender age mancova f 10 796 1 732 p 0 07 and none of the child had a diagnosis of adhd after training participation child in the eg showed significantly le adhd related problem behavior compared to child in the cg f 8 1 506 2 717 p 0 006 this wa especially so for the high risk group f 4 754 2 60 p 0 035 multi level analysis revealed significant influence of age gender and s on post training symptom rating sdq t statistic 3 03 p 0 003 vbv 3 6 t statistic 4 151 p lt 0 001 research limitation implication this is a quasi experimental study since due to time restriction half the preschool did not want to participate in the experimental study thus participating child were not randomly assigned to the experimental and control condition though child were randomly assigned to two different treatment within the intervention group eg1 eg2 due to the design of the study and to ensure high participation rate only preschool teacher rated child s behavior though the predictive value of teacher adhd symptom exceeds parental one finally inclusion of parent training element would most probably enhance effect practical implication general bm technique are easily taught and seem to positively influence child s adhd related symptom while not harming child without such symptom since study showed that after a bogus instruction teacher expected child to exhibit adhd symptom and rated them a more disturbed rosenthal effect a universal approach is le stigmatizing and possibly more effective especially when intervention start early in life before symptom result in full diagnosis social implication this study established positive universal effect and moderate to large effect for the subgroup of high risk child with adhd related symptom general behavior management in preschool might thus be a possible strategy for preventive intervention of adhd related symptom originality value the is one of the first study on a preventive adhd preschool program general bm technique of this study were easily taught and implemented and showed positive effect since selective and indicated intervention depend on high program fidelity are harder to implement and related to higher cost general bm technique a introduced in this study might be an option for universal prevention strategy for adhd related symptom in preschool setting

background a new approach of psychological intervention prior to stress aiming to optimize expectation may have beneficial effect on a person s health status by reducing physiological stress the purpose of this experiment wa to determine whether a brief psychological intervention designed to optimize personal control expectation prior to acute stress would affect perceived and biological stress responsiveness in comparison to two more established intervention fostering gratitude or distraction in a healthy sample method 74 healthy participant were randomized to one of three psychological intervention prior to stress i writing about way to influence stress to optimize personal control expectation expectation ii writing a gratitude letter gratitude iii or a distraction writing task distraction after completing the intervention the maastricht acute stress test wa administered to induce psychosocial and physiological stress assessment took place at baseline post intervention 15 min writing task and after stress induction additional salivary assessment 15 and 30 min after stress main outcome were expectation emotion perceived stress salivary cortisol and alpha amylase personality trait eg optimism were assessed at baseline result expectation specifically increased personal control expectation p 016 d 72 and gratitude specifically increased gratitude p 026 d 68 expectation and distraction led to lower cortisol concentration after stress induction than gratitude time x group interaction p 001 d 88 we detected no intervention effect on alpha amylase or perceived stress optimism moderated intervention effect on cortisol p 023 d 74 conclusion brief psychological intervention aiming to optimize expectation or distraction prior to stress reduce the cortisol response in healthy participant after an acute stressor

background the association between total testosterone t and depression mostly relies on single sex hormone assessment and remains inconclusive thus we investigated the comparative predictive performance of baseline t and change in t with development of depressive symptom and incident depressive episode method we used data from 6493 primary care patient 2653 men and 3840 woman of the detect study diabetes cardiovascular risk evaluation target and essential data for commitment of treatment including four year follow up repeated immunoassay based measurement of serum t and depressive symptom assessed by the depression screening questionnaire dsq cross sectional and longitudinal association of baseline t and one year change in t with prevalent and incident depression were investigated using age and multivariable adjusted regression model result baseline t showed no association with prevalent or incident depressive symptom and episode in both sex in men a positive change in t higher t at one year follow up compared to baseline wa associated with a lower burden of depressive symptom beta coefficient per unit change in t 0 17 95 ci 0 31 to 0 04 and lower risk of incident depressive symptom odds ratio per unit change in t 0 84 95 ci 0 72 0 98 at four year follow up in woman the association of t change with incident depressive episode wa rendered non significant after multivariable adjustment discussion the present study observed a sex specific inverse association of t change but not baseline t with increased depressive symptom burden in men future study should ass longitudinal change in sex hormone status a predictor of adverse health outcome related to low t

objective even though people suffering from high level of food craving are aware of the negative consequence of binge eating they cannot resist automatic action tendency i e approach bias towards food cue that operate outside conscious control may contribute to this dysfunctional behavior the present study aimed to examine whether people with high level of food craving show a stronger approach bias for food than those with low level of food craving and whether this bias is associated with cue elicited food craving method forty one individual reporting either extremely high or extremely low level of trait food craving were recruited via an online screening and compared regarding approach bias towards visual food cue by mean of an implicit stimulus response paradigm i e the food approach avoidance task state level of food craving were assessed before and after cue exposure to indicate food cue reactivity result a expected high food cravers showed stronger automatic approach tendency towards food than low food cravers also in line with the hypothesis approach bias for food wa positively correlated with the magnitude of change in state level of food craving from pre to post cue exposure in the total sample discussion the finding suggest that an approach bias in early stage of information processing contributes to the inability to resist food intake and may be of relevance for understanding and treating dysfunctional eating behavior

theoretical model and preceding study have described age related alteration in neuronal activation of frontoparietal region in a working memory wm load dependent manner however to date underlying neuronal mechanism of these wm load dependent activation change in aging remain poorly understood the aim of this study wa to investigate these mechanism in term of effective connectivity by application of dynamic causal modeling with bayesian model selection eighteen healthy younger age 20 32 year and 32 older 60 75 year participant performed an n back task with 3 wm load level during functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri behavioral and conventional fmri result replicated age group by wm load interaction importantly the analysis of effective connectivity derived from dynamic causal modeling indicated an age and performance related reduction in wm load dependent modulation of connectivity from dorsolateral prefrontal cortex to inferior parietal lobule this finding provides evidence for the proposal that age related wm decline manifest a deficient wm load dependent modulation of neuronal top down control and can integrate implication from theoretical model and previous study of functional change in the aging brain

objective according to the predictive processing theory of somatic symptom generation body sensation are determined by somatosensory input and central nervous prediction about this input we examined how expectation shape prediction and consequently bodily perception in a task eliciting illusory sensation a laboratory analogue of medically unexplained symptom method using the framework of signal detection theory the influence of sham wi fi on response bias c and somatosensory sensitivity d for tactile stimulus wa examined using the somatic signal detection task ssdt a healthy student sample n 83 completed the ssdt twice sham wi fi on off in a randomized order after watching a film that promoted adverse health effect of electromagnetic field result when expecting a wi fi signal to be present participant showed a significantly more liberal response bias c p 010 etap2 0 08 for tactile stimulus in the ssdt a evidence of a higher propensity to experience somatosensory illusion no significant alteration of somatosensory sensitivity d p 76 etap2 0 002 wa observed conclusion negative expectation about the harmfulness of electromagnetic field may foster the occurrence of illusory symptom perception via alteration in the somatosensory decision criterion the finding are in line with central tenet of the predictive processing account of somatic symptom generation this account proposes a decoupling of percept and somatosensory input so that perception becomes increasingly dependent on prediction this biased perception is regarded a a risk factor for somatic symptom disorder

objective result from clinical trial indicate that internet based psychological pain intervention are effective in treating chronic pain however little is known about patient acceptance of these program and how to positively influence patient intention to engage in them therefore the present study aimed 1 to ass patient acceptance of internet based intervention and 2 to examine whether patient acceptance can be increased by an acceptance facilitating intervention method a total of 104 patient with chronic pain from 2 pain unit were randomly allocated to an intervention group ig and a no intervention control group cg the ig wa shown a short informational video about internet based psychological pain intervention before receiving a questionnaire on patient acceptance of internet based psychological pain intervention and predictor of acceptance performance expectancy effort expectancy social influence facilitating condition internet usage and internet anxiety the cg filled out the questionnaire immediately patient acceptance wa measured with a 4 item scale sum score ranging from 4 to 20 result baseline acceptance of internet based intervention wa reported a low sum score 4 9 by 53 8 moderate 10 to 15 by 42 3 and high 16 to 20 by 3 9 of the patient with chronic pain in the cg the ig showed a significantly higher acceptance m 12 17 sd 4 22 than the cg m 8 94 sd 3 71 with a standardized mean difference of d 0 81 95 ci 0 41 1 21 all predictor variable were significantly improved in the ig compared with the cg except for internet usage conclusion patient with chronic pain display a relatively low acceptance of internet based psychological pain intervention which can be substantially increased by a short informational video

abstract the short form of the general procrastination scale gps k klingsieck amp fry 2012 lay 1986 is a reliable self report scale measuring general procrastination the presumed one dimensional factor structure of the scale however ha never been examined thus the purpose of this representative study were to examine it dimensionality and factorial invariance across age and sex and to provide norm value of the german general population the gps k wa administered to a representative community sample n 2 527 age range 14 95 year a confirmatory factor analysis cfa wa conducted to explore convergent validity standardized scale of distress and life satisfaction were used measurement invariance across sex and age wa tested the cfa revealed an unsatisfactory model fit of the presumed unidimensional factor structure of the gps k therefore a 5 item one dimensional version of the scale wa suggested general procrastination scale screening gps s correlation between gps s distress and reduced life satisfaction provide evidence on it convergent validity the one dimensional gps s can be assumed to be scalar invariant across sex and for participant older than 29 year the scale can be administered in only a few minute providing an economic screening for research and practice

functional imaging data in adult patient with anorexia nervosa an support a dysfunctional signal in the ventral striatum a neural signature of an in the present study development of this signal wa investigated with the prediction that a characteristic pattern of ventral striatal signalling will be shown in response to cue associated with food restriction that reflects the evolvement of starvation dependence over time the signal wa assessed in adolescent patient with an whose duration of illness wa about five time shorter relative to the adult sample during functional magnetic resonance imaging subject were required to estimate weight of body image underweight normal weight overweight and to process each stimulus in a self referring way relative to age matched young healthy control underweight stimulus were already associated with greater activity of the ventral striatum and processing of normal weight stimulus elicited already reduced signalling subjective preference showed exactly the same pattern of result relative to adult an the present data reveal a developing dysfunctional signal that if untreated will essentially contribute to the maintenance of an we discus putative mechanism that may play a crucial role in the development of an and also deduce new hypothesis about the involvement of the midbrain dopamine system of which illness related alteration may contribute to the development of an

background the depression module of the patient health questionnaire phq 9 is a wide spread self report instrument for the assessment of depression with compelling psychometric characteristic when relying on classical test theory assumption this study aimed at evaluating whether the phq 9 may be interpreted a a dimensional scale measuring depression severity in the elderly general population using rasch analysis with special emphasis on it unidimensional structure and differential item functioning dif due to gender age and the presence of somatic multimorbidity method a representative sample of the elderly german general population n 1631 age 60 85 year 53 5 female filled in the phq 9 a questionnaire about chronic medical condition and a demographic data sheet unidimensionality and psychometric property of the phq 9 were ascertained applying confirmatory factor analysis cfa and rasch analysis result result revealed substantial violation of the unidimensionality of the scale item 8 retardation or agitation had to be eliminated and multiple residual correlation were added gender related dif emerged for two item and three item showed insufficient rasch model fit limitation the large sample lead to high statistical power that might technically increase the probability of detecting model misfit or dif the sampling procedure lead to a possible underestimation of morbidity due to the exclusion of those elderly patient living in nursing home conclusion result suggest that when applied in the elderly general population the phq 9 should be interpreted in term of a diagnostic algorithm for classificatory decision about a dsm iv based probable diagnosis of depression rather than a a dimensional scale

introduction farmer have a high risk for depression mdd preventive measure targeting this often remotely living population might reduce depression burden the study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of personalized telephone coaching in reducing depressive symptom severity and preventing mdd in farmer compared to enhanced treatment a usual tau method in a two armed pragmatic randomized controlled trial n 314 with post treatment at 6 month farming entrepreneur collaborating family member and pensioner with elevated depressive symptom phq 9 5 were randomized to personalized telephone coaching or tau the coaching wa provided by psychologist and consists on average of 13 7 session a 48 min 15 over 6 month the primary outcome wa depressive symptom severity qids sr16 result coaching participant showed a significantly greater reduction in depressive symptom severity compared to tau d 0 39 whereas reliable symptom deterioration wa significantly lower in the intervention group compared to tau no significant group difference were found for reliable improvement and in depression onset further significant effect in favor of the intervention group were found for stress d 0 34 anxiety d 0 30 somatic symptom d 0 39 burnout risk d 0 24 0 40 and quality of life d 0 28 discussion limiting we did not apply an upper cutoff score for depressive symptom severity or controlled for previous mdd episode leaving open whether the coaching wa recurrence relapse prevention or early treatment nevertheless personalized telephone coaching can effectively improve mental health in farmer it could play an important role in intervening at an early stage of mental health problem and reducing disease burden related to mdd trial registration number and trial register german clinical trial registration drks00015655
