objective the present study aimed to investigate if eating disorder patient differ in specific personality trait depending on a positive screening of food addiction fa and to find a model to predict fa in eating disorder patient using measure of personality and impulsivity method two hundred seventy eight patient having an eating disorder self reported on fa impulsivity personality eating and general psychopathology patient were then split into two group depending on a positive or negative result on the fa screening analysis of variance wa used to compare mean between the two group stepwise binary logistic regression wa used to obtain a predictive model for the presence of fa result patient with fa had lower self directedness and more negative urgency and lack of perseverance than patient not reporting addictive eating the probability of fa can be predicted by high negative urgency high reward dependence and low lack of premeditation conclusion eating disorder patient who have more problem to pursue task to the end and to focus on long term goal seem to be more likely to develop addictive eating pattern

background recent research suggests that dysfunctional expectation are a particularly important subtype of cognition in depression however it is unclear whether depressive symptom are related to the presence of negative expectation the absence of positive expectation or both method using hierarchical linear regression analysis the present study examined the predictive value of positive situation specific expectation negative situation specific expectation dispositional optimism and dysfunctional attitude for depressive symptom 8 week later in a nonclinical sample n 157 it also examined whether the relationship between dispositional optimism and dysfunctional attitude with depressive symptom is mediated through situational expectation result cross sectionally depressive symptom were more strongly associated with the presence of negative expectation than with the absence of positive expectation in the longitudinal and mediation analysis none of the cognitive variable had significant association with depressive symptom at follow up beyond the strong influence of baseline depressive symptom conclusion the presence of negative expectation wa cross sectionally more strongly associated with depressive symptom than a lack of positive expectation presumably due to higher variability in negative expectation in this nonclinical sample the longitudinal and mediation analysis failed to find significant incremental effect of any of the cognitive variable because baseline depression explained the largest proportion of variance

cognitive model assume that social anxiety is associated with and maintained by biased information processing leading to change in attention allocation which can be measured by examining eye movement however little is known about the distribution of attention among positive neutral and negative stimulus during a social task and the relative importance of positive versus negative bias in social anxiety in this study eye movement subjective state anxiety and psychophysiology of individual with high trait social anxiety hsa and low trait social anxiety lsa were measured during a speech task with a pre recorded audience the hsa group showed longer total fixation on negative stimulus and shorter total fixation on positive stimulus compared to the lsa group we observed that the lsa group shifted attention away from negative stimulus whereas the hsa group showed no differential attention allocation the total duration of fixation on negative stimulus predicted subjective anxiety rating these result point to a negative bias a well a a lack of a positive bias in hsa individual during social threat

background the present study aimed to investigate difference in variable of positive mental health pmh i e emotional psychological and social well being and negative mental health nmh i e somatoform complaint depressiveness social stress and insomnia between clinical inpatient who use the social platform facebook and those who do not use facebook furthermore the link between duration of daily facebook use and mental health should be considered method in two subsamples of inpatient of a psychosomatic rehabilitation clinic in germany facebook user n 336 facebook non user n 265 use of facebook pmh and nmh were assessed via a computer survey result facebook user had significantly higher value of three variable of nmh i e depressiveness social stress and insomnia and significantly lower value of pmh than facebook non user duration of daily facebook use wa significantly negatively associated with pmh and significantly positively with all variable of nmh limitation given the cross sectional study design current data do not imply causality conclusion current result indicate that facebook use is negatively associated with pmh and positively with nmh in clinical inpatient thus future research should investigate whether and how facebook use may have a negative effect on the recovery process of the inpatient

understanding factor driving vaccine hesitancy is crucial to vaccination success we surveyed adult n 2510 from february to march 2021 across five site australia 502 germany 516 hong kong 445 uk 512 usa 535 using a cross sectional design and stratified quota sampling for age sex and education we assessed willingness to take a vaccine and a comprehensive set of putative predictor predictive power wa analysed with a machine learning algorithm only 57 4 of the participant indicated that they would definitely or probably get vaccinated a parsimonious machine learning model could identify vaccine hesitancy with high accuracy i e 82 sensitivity and 79 82 specificity using 12 variable only the most relevant predictor were vaccination conspiracy belief various paranoid concern related to the pandemic a general conspiracy mentality covid anxiety high perceived risk of infection low perceived social rank lower age lower income and higher population density campaign seeking to increase vaccine uptake need to take mistrust a the main driver of vaccine hesitancy into account

background and objective previous research suggests that rumination act a a mediating mechanism in the association between depression and drinking motif particularly drinking to cope a well a negative alcohol related consequence in this study we tested the connection between depressive symptom rumination drinking motif alcohol consumption and alcohol related problem in a clinically depressed population n 209 method structural equation modeling wa used to test the model specification were based on the result of a previously evaluated model in a sample of college student result the complex model showed a significant positive association between depressive symptom and rumination drinking motif enhancement and coping were linked to more negative alcohol related consequence in a simplified model pronounced depressive symptom were associated with both increased ruminative thinking and more negative alcohol related problem rumination wa connected with stronger drinking motif combined in one general factor which were again associated with alcohol consumption and alcohol related problem limitation the use of self report measure to determine diagnostic validity conclusion in a clinically depressed sample depressive symptom were linked to increased negative alcohol related consequence this association wa partially explained by rumination and drinking motif however rumination wa le relevant than previous study suggested

objective the aim of this study wa to create a czech translation of the perceived stress scale ps to ass it psychometric property on a representative sample of the czech general adult population and to compare the original 14 item version ps 14 with the shortened 10 item ps 10 and four item ps 4 version sample and setting two pilot study were conducted to create the final czech translation of the scale n 365 and n 420 the final version of the czech ps wa administered to a sample of the czech general adult population n 1725 of whom 981 were woman m 44 32 sd 12 8 the beck depression inventory bdi ii or the state trait anxiety inventory stai were administered alongside the ps to a part of the sample a retest measurement after 14 day wa conducted n 159 statistical analysis using the confirmatory factor analysis the one factor two factor and bifactor model were compared the internal consistency stability in time and convergent validity of the scale a well a the known group difference were assessed the three version of the ps were compared result the confirmatory factor analysis supported the bifactor model of the ps 14 and ps 10 and the two factor model of the ps 4 all version of the scale showed good internal consistency and stability in time there wa a moderate to strong positive correlation between the ps and the bdi ii and stai difference based on age sex education level and situational factor were found overall the ps 10 showed the best psychometric property of all three version of the scale study limitation the sample consisted mostly of highly educated respondent

a considerable proportion of young adult studying at university have a mental disorder previous research ha shown a negative relationship between various religiosity and psychopathology measure with different strength of this correlation depending on the religiosity measure the aim of the present study is to investigate the strength of association between religious attitude and depression anxiety and stress in iranian university student thirty three student from two iranian university filled in the religious attitude scale for university student rasus the beck depression inventory ii bdi ii and the depression anxiety and stress scale das 42 religious attitude correlate negatively with all psychopathological variable with a moderate effect size e g with bdi ii r 47 p 006 when dividing the sample in low v high religious people there were significantly more student without depression symptom in the high religious attitude group than in the low group

one in two people suffering from mental health problem develop such distress before or during adolescence research ha shown that distress can predict itself well over time yet little is known about how well resilience factor rf i e those factor that decrease mental health problem predict subsequent distress therefore we investigated which rf are the best indicator for subsequent distress and with what accuracy rf predict subsequent distress we examined three interpersonal e g friendship and seven intrapersonal rf e g self esteem and distress in 1130 adolescent at age 14 and 17 we estimated the rf and a continuous distress index using factor analysis and ordinal distress class using factor mixture model we then examined how well age 14 rf and age 14 distress predict age 17 distress using stepwise linear regression relative importance analysis a well a ordinal and linear prediction model low brooding low negative and high positive self esteem rf were the most important indicator for age 17 distress rf and age 14 distress predicted age 17 distress similarly the accuracy wa acceptable for ordinal low moderate high age 17 distress class 62 64 but low for linear model 37 41 crucially the accuracy remained similar when only self esteem and brooding rf were used instead of all ten rf ordinal 62 linear 37 correctly predicting for about two in three adolescent whether they have low moderate or high distress 3 year later rf and particularly brooding and self esteem seem to predict subsequent distress similarly well a distress can predict itself a assessing brooding and self esteem can be strength focussed and is time efficient those rf may be promising for risk detection and translational intervention research

objective most of the observed association of generalized anxiety disorder gad social anxiety disorder sad and major depressive disorder mdd with cortisol concentration came from clinical and adult study sample with inconsistent finding partly due to method variance we examined cross sectional and longitudinal association between gad sad and mdd with saliva and hair cortisol a well a hair cortisol change in a population based sample of adolescent and young adult considering relevant co factor design epidemiological cohort study in dresden germany data of 1050 individual mean age 17 2 year assessed at baseline 11 2015 12 2016 and of 605 individual assessed at 1 year follow up fu1 are used method multivariable regression model were implemented to ass cross sectional and longitudinal association of dsm 5 defined 12 month diagnosis of gad sad and mdd with short term saliva cortisol cortisol awakening response car and area under the curve auc a total cortisol and long term hair cortisol cortisol index multivariable model were adjusted for age or tanner stage waist circumference tobacco and alcohol consumption physical inactivity and hair cortisol dependent confounder sex specific analysis were additionally conducted result cross sectional analysis revealed positive association between sad and baseline saliva cortisol in multivariable model car beta coefficient 0 12 95 ci 0 01 0 23 but could not be confirmed after adjusting for tanner stage or comorbid depression cross sectional analysis concerning gad and mdd in the full baseline sample yielded no significant association sex specific linear model revealed a significant inverse cross sectional association between mdd beta coefficient 2 21 95 ci 3 64 0 79 a well a sad beta coefficient 2 21 95 ci 4 03 0 38 with baseline hair cortisol in male but not in female in longitudinal analysis no significant association were found in the fully adjusted model except for a positive association between hair cortisol change between baseline and fu1 and fu1 sad or 1 07 95 ci 1 02 1 12 conclusion result confirmed sex specificity and the role of pubertal development in the association between cortisol with sad and mdd while no association emerged regarding cortisol and gad future research in adolescent focusing on the role of cortisol in the pathogenesis of anxiety and depressive disorder would benefit from considering factor like sex specificity and puberty development a well a comorbidity

according to the control value theory of achievement emotion the influence of cognitive activation teaching strategy on student effective use of cognitive and meta cognitive cmc learning strategy is mediated by control appraisal e g self efficacy and achievement emotion i e enjoyment and boredom however there is limited and contrasting empirical evidence to support this assertion despite claim of cross cultural and domain consistency the present study wa aimed at examining the multiple mediational role of self efficacy and achievement emotion on the relationship between perceived cognitive activation during instruction and four cmc learning strategy among ugandan biology student data were collected using anonymous questionnaire from 587 50 6 female tenth grade student with a mean age of 17 year sd 1 16 from 10 secondary school in uganda we tested the mediation hypothesis in separate model with each cmc learning strategy indirect effect from cognitive activation through self efficacy and or enjoyment to cmc learning strategy were all significant confirming their mediational role there were significant p 0 001 direct effect from cognitive activation to self efficacy β 0 41 enjoyment β 0 26 and cognitive learning strategy i e rehearsal β 0 30 organisation β 0 30 and elaboration β 0 33 self efficacy and enjoyment fully mediated the relationship between cognitive activation and metacognition except for self efficacy direct effect to or from boredom were not significant clearly instructional strategy in biology that stimulate thought among learner are relevant for increasing effective use of any one of cmc learning strategy

background and objective negative distorted self image nsi allegedly maintain social anxiety in adult suffering from social anxiety disorder sad these nsi are activated in feared social situation and are often linked to past socially traumatic event however because empirical evidence on the presence and characteristic of such nsi in adolescent suffering from sad is limited the aim of the present study is to examine the nature of nsi in adolescent sad patient method using a semi structured interview 31 adolescent with a primary diagnosis of sad and 31 healthy adolescent ha who were matched for age and gender completed a questionnaire set assessing the characteristic of nsi social anxiety and depression result relative to the ha group those suffering from sad reported experiencing nsi significantly more frequently more vividly and with greater distress no significant difference between the group emerged regarding a link between the nsi and an autobiographical event however nsi were reported a more often having an observer perspective in the sad a compared to the ha group hierarchical regression analysis revealed that certain characteristic of the nsi predict social anxiety beyond the influence of depression in adolescent with sad discussion nsi seem to be an important feature of adolescent sad and phenomenological comparable to nsi in adult suffering from sad conclusion specific intervention aiming to correct nsi which have proven to be highly effective in adult should be developmentally adapted and evaluated in future study

introduction a an especially burdensome experience childhood maltreatment cm can have lifelong consequence on the mental health and wellbeing of an individual well into adulthood we have previously reported that cm constitutes a central risk factor not only for the development of mental problem but also for facing additional psychosocial risk endangering healthy development of mother and offspring throughout life e g financial problem intimate partner violence substance use this study wa designed to replicate these finding in a larger independent study cohort method in this cross sectional replication study an independent cohort of 533 healthy postpartum woman wa interviewed within seven day after parturition cm experience were assessed retrospectively using the german version of the childhood trauma questionnaire ctq and current psychosocial risk factor for child welfare were assessed using the konstanzer index kindex result of all woman 16 1 experienced emotional and 10 1 physical abuse 28 5 emotional neglect 9 4 physical neglect and 10 3 experienced sexual abuse most importantly the higher the cm load the more psychosocial stressor existed in woman s life in particular woman with higher cm load had a higher risk for mental health problem intimate partner violence financial problem and a higher postnatal stress load conclusion in an independent sample this study replicated the previous finding that cm and psychosocial risk factor for child welfare were strongly associated in a dose response manner our result emphasize the higher vulnerability of woman with a cm history in the postpartum period to avoid negative consequence for mother and child a regular and evidence based screening for cm and psychosocial risk factor during pregnancy and puerperium is needed to identify at risk mother early during pregnancy and to provide appropriate support hence our finding highlight the mandatory requirement for an interdisciplinary collaboration of gynecological practice hospital and midwife along with psychologist and psychotherapist and child and youth welfare service

cognitive reappraisal and expressive suppression two major emotion regulation strategy are differentially related to emotional well being the aim of this study wa to test the association of individual difference in these two emotion regulation strategy with gray matter volume of brain region that have been shown to be involved in the regulation of emotion based on high resolution magnetic resonance image of 96 young adult voxel based morphometry wa used to analyze the gray matter volume of the a priori region of interest including amygdala insula dorsal anterior cingulate and paracingulate cortex medial and lateral prefrontal cortex pfc and their association with cognitive reappraisal and expressive suppression usage a well a neuroticism a positive association of cognitive reappraisal with right and tendentially left amygdala volume and of neuroticism with left amygdala volume marginally significant wa found expressive suppression wa related to dorsal anterior cingulate paracingulate cortex and medial pfc gray matter volume the result of this study emphasize the important role of the amygdala in individual difference in cognitive reappraisal usage a well a neuroticism additionally the association of expressive suppression usage with larger volume of the medial pfc and dorsal anterior paracingulate cortex underpins the role of these region in regulating emotion expressive behavior

early life maltreatment elm pose a risk for the development of insecure attachment and depression over the life span depending on the type of maltreatment physical sexual emotional neglect and it severity the aim of this study wa to investigate the influence of elm and lifetime depression on adult insecure attachment in a female sample n 188 consisting of n 81 woman with elm and n 107 without elm woman with elm reported significantly higher score on insecure attachment than woman without elm a significant interaction effect for elm x lifetime depression wa found contradictory to the hypothesis woman with elm but without lifetime depression scored highest on avoidant attachment differing significantly from woman with elm and lifetime depression even though the severity of elm wa higher among woman with elm and lifetime depression and they experienced significantly more severe neglect and sexual abuse but not physical or emotional abuse regression analysis revealed that elm wa the only predictor of avoidant attachment explaining 15 5 of the variance result underline the strong influence of elm on adult attachment and are of special importance for prevention and intervention program

obsessive compulsive symptom ocs in patient with schizophrenia are a common co occurring condition often associated with additional impairment a subgroup of these patient develops ocs during treatment with second generation antipsychotic sgas most importantly clozapine and olanzapine so far little is known about possible neural mechanism of these sgas which seem to aggravate or induce ocs to investigate the role of sga treatment on neural activation and connectivity during emotional processing patient were stratified according to their monotherapy into two group group i clozapine or olanzapine n 20 group ii amisulpride or aripiprazole n 20 we used an fmri approach applying an implicit emotion recognition task group comparison showed significantly higher frequency and severity of comorbid ocs in group i than group ii task specific activation wa attenuated in group i in the left amygdala furthermore functional connectivity from left amygdala to right ventral striatum wa reduced in group i reduced amygdala activation wa associated with ocs severity recent literature suggests an involvement of an amygdala cortico striatal network in the pathogenesis of obsessive compulsive disorder the observed differential activation and connectivity pattern of the amygdala might thus indicate a neural mechanism for the development of sga associated ocs in patient with schizophrenia further neurobiological research and interventional study are needed for causal inference

difficulty in anger control and anger related aggressive outburst against others are frequently reported by patient with borderline personality disorder bpd although male sex is a known predictor for aggression hardly any study ha addressed the neural correlate of deficient anger control in male patient with bpd building on previous report in female bpd we investigated the involvement of lateral antero and dorsal prefrontal cortex in the control of fast emotional action and it relation to self reported tendency to act out anger 15 medication free male patient with bpd and 25 age and intelligence matched healthy men took part in a social approach avoidance task in the mr scanner this task allows the measurement of neural correlate underlying the control of fast behavioral tendency to approach happy and avoid angry face hypothesis driven region of interest and exploratory whole brain analysis were used to test for activation of antero and dorsolateral prefrontal region and their relation with the amygdala during emotional action control a well a their association with self reported anger out in male patient with bpd and healthy volunteer male patient with bpd showed reduced anterolateral prefrontal activation during emotional action control compared to healthy volunteer furthermore anger out wa negatively related to antero and dorsolateral prefrontal activation while it wa positively related to amygdala activity in male patient with bpd the current result suggest the involvement of antero and dorsolateral prefrontal region in controlling and overriding fast emotional action deficit in lateral prefrontal emotion control seem to be a common neural mechanism underlying anger related aggression this article is part of the special issue entitled current status of the neurobiology of aggression and impulsivity

the objective wa a psychometric examination of a german translation of the child s somatization inventory csi and it parent version p csi and a replication of the item selection process of walker et al in j pediatr psychol 34 430 440 5 for their revised version to create shorter german version based on a school sample of 1 539 parent and 731 child we explored the psychometric property and dimensionality of the original and a shortened revised version a clinical sample of 70 parental report served a an additional sample walker et al s item selection could be largely replicated dimensionality differed between sample and version original v revised but original dsm iii symptom cluster could mostly be identified symptom intensity wa associated with age and mental health internal consistency test retest and inter rater reliability were good both german version the csi and the p csi can be regarded a a useful screening instrument for somatic complaint in child

background the present study aim to delineate the role of preexisting depression for change in common mental health problem during the covid 19 pandemic method using mixed effect linear regression model we analyzed data on the course of depressive patient health questionnaire 2 and anxiety generalized anxiety disorder 2 symptom a well a loneliness three item ucla loneliness scale in a subset of the socio economic panel study a large and nationally representative household panel study from germany participant were assessed during the first covid 19 wave in germany march 31 to july 4 2020 n 6 694 and prospectively followed up at the peak of the second covid 19 wave january 18 to february 15 2021 n 6 038 result overall anxiety and depressive symptom decreased whereas loneliness increased from the first to the second covid 19 wave however depressive symptom increased and the surge in loneliness wa steeper in those with versus without clinically relevant depressive symptom in 2019 or a history of a depressive disorder before the covid 19 pandemic anxiety symptom remained stable throughout the pandemic in individual with versus without clinically relevant depressive symptom in 2019 pre pandemic depression wa associated with overall higher depressive and anxiety symptom and loneliness across both assessment the stringency of lockdown measure did not affect the result conclusion our finding suggest that individual with a history of depressive symptom before the covid 19 pandemic are at increased risk to experience an escalation of mental health problem due to the covid 19 pandemic therefore they might particularly profit from targeted prevention and early intervention program

study design cross cultural translation and psychometric testing objective the purpose of the present study wa to examine reliability and validity of a cross cultural adaption of the german quebec back pain disability scale qbpds in a context of a randomized controlled trial evaluating the effectiveness of graded in vivo exposure in chronic low back pain patient background the qbpds is one of the most widely used disease specific disability questionnaire in particular for cognitive behavioral treatment with a clear focus on behavioral aspect such a graded in vivo exposure the qbpds provides an ascertained strategy with a sound conceptual basis and excellent quality criterion nevertheless there is conflicting evidence concerning factor structure and a german adaption is missing method the cross cultural adaption followed international guideline psychometric testing wa performed using data from 180 participant with chronic low back pain the psychometric analysis included internal consistency convergent and divergent validity exploratory factor analysis wa used to determine the underlying factor structure result the qbpds showed strong psychometric property with high internal consistency for the full scale alpha 0 94 and good convergent and divergent validity the factor analysis revealed a four factor solution bending ambulation brief effortful movement and long lasting posture conclusion the translation and cross cultural adaption of the qbpds into german wa successful the german version proved to be a valid and reliable instrument and is well suited for use in the context of an exposure based psychological treatment

background a routinely collected dataset wa analyzed 1 to determine the naturalistic effectiveness of inpatient psychotherapy for depression in routine psychotherapeutic care and 2 to identify potential predictor of change method in a sample of 22 681 inpatient with depression pre post and pre follow up effect size were computed for various outcome variable to build a probabilistic model of predictor of change an independent component analysis generated component from demographic and clinical data and bayesian efa extracted factor from the available pre test post test and follow up questionnaire in a subsample n 6377 to select the best fitted model the bic of different path model were compared a bayesian path analysis wa performed to identify the most important factor to predict change result effect size were large for the primary outcome and moderate for various secondary outcome almost all pretreatment factor exerted significant influence on different baseline factor several factor were found to be resistant to change during treatment suicidality agoraphobia life dissatisfaction physical disability and pain the strongest cross loading were observed from suicidality on negative cognition from agoraphobia on anxiety and from physical disability on perceived disability limitation no causal conclusion can be drawn directly from our result a we only used cross lagged panel data without control group conclusion the result indicate large effect of inpatient psychotherapy for depression in routine clinical care the direct influence of pretreatment factor decreased over the course of treatment however some factor appeared stable and difficult to treat which might hinder treatment outcome finding of different predictor of change are discussed

while diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder fifth edition dsm 5 section iii and icd 11 international classification of disease 11th revision both allow for dimensional assessment of personality pathology the model differ in the definition of maladaptive trait in this study we pursued the goal of developing a short and reliable assessment for maladaptive trait which is compatible with both model using the item pool of the personality inventory for dsm 5 pid 5 to this aim we applied ant colony optimization algorithm in english and german speaking sample comprising a total n of 2 927 this procedure yielded a 34 item measure with a hierarchical latent structure including six maladaptive trait domain and 17 trait facet the personality inventory for dsm 5 brief form plus pid5bf while latent structure reliability and criterion validity were ascertained in the original and in two separate validation sample n 849 n 493 and the measure wa able to discriminate personality disorder from other diagnosis in a clinical subsample result suggest further modification for capturing icd 11 anankastia

background and objective basic research suggest behavioral strategy for interferencing the reconsolidation of fear memory to be a promising approach in reducing clinical fear however first clinical study revealed mixed result highlighting the need to identify boundary condition we experimentally tested the specific hypothesis that post retrieval threat exposure prevents context renewal usually observed in protocol without fear memory reactivation method in a preliminary investigation forty three individual with claustrophobic fear reactivated the individual phobic memory or not during a guided emotional imagery task and then performed standardized threat exposure to provide new information for updating the original memory during retests seven and 28 day later the context wa different from that during treatment in half of the subject result in those who were guided the fear memory wa successfully reactivated a indexed by increased skin conductance level scl during the imagery of personal scene relative to neutral scene during retests the subject of the memory non activation group showed a return of reported fear after context change that however wa not observed after post retrieval exposure in line autonomic arousal scl decreased over time in the memory reactivation group only if the context changed during retest limitation limited sample size and the inclusion of an analog sample reduce the generalizability of the result conclusion the reactivation of fear memory prior to treatment through guided imagery of past personal phobic situation prevented contextual renewal of phobic fear which wa observed in those subject without reactivation of memory

background and objective improving memory for the content of therapy session might increase the effect of psychological intervention previous study showed that healthy individual who took a memory test retrieval of studied material showed better long term memory retention than individual who restudied rehearsal the material the aim of the current study wa to find out whether we can translate these finding to a subclinical setting method individual with moderate level of distress were randomized into retrieving n 46 or rehearsing n 49 four weekly session of online problem solving therapy pst session recall problem solving skill and distress were measured at baseline three day after each session and at one week follow up result retrieval led to overall higher recall but this difference disappeared when controlling for the time spent on retrieval versus rehearsal retrieval did not lead to better problem solving skill or le distress compared to rehearsal baseline working memory performance moderated the effect of condition on recall after controlling for the time spent on retrieval versus rehearsal the effect of retrieval compared to rehearsal on recall wa larger for individual with lower working memory performance limitation the sample mostly consisted of university student with overall high working memory score conclusion this study provided the first evidence that retrieval of the content of pst session may lead to better session recall compared to rehearsal of the pst session in individual with a low working memory score implication for the use of cognitive support strategy within a therapeutic setting are discussed

objective recent model of anorexia nervosa an emphasise the role of reduced emotion recognition ability era in the development and maintenance of the disorder however methodological limitation impede conclusion from prior research the current study try to overcome these limitation by examining era with an audio visual measure that focus strictly on multimodal nonverbal cue and allows to differentiate between era for different emotion category method forty woman with an and 40 healthy woman completed the geneva emotion recognition test this test includes 83 video clip in which 10 actor express 14 different emotion while saying a pseudo linguistic sentence without semantic meaning all clip contain multimodal nonverbal cue i e prosody facial expression gesture and posture result patient with an showed poorer era than the healthy control group d 0 71 particularly regarding emotion of negative valence d 0 26 furthermore a lower body weight r 0 41 and longer illness duration rho 0 32 were associated with poorer era in the an group conclusion using an ecologically valid instrument the finding of the study support illness model emphasising poor era in an directly addressing era in the treatment of an with targeted intervention may be promising

recent animal and human research indicates that stress around the time of encoding enhances long term memory for emotionally arousing event but neural evidence remains unclear in the present study we used the erp old new effect to investigate brain dynamic underlying the long term effect of acute pre encoding stress on memory for emotional and neutral scene participant were exposed either to the socially evaluated cold pressure test secpt or a warm water control procedure before viewing 30 unpleasant 30 neutral and 30 pleasant picture two week after encoding recognition memory wa tested using 90 old and 90 new picture emotional picture were better recognized than neutral picture in both group and related to an enhanced centro parietal erp old new difference 400 800 m during recognition which suggests better recollection most interestingly pre encoding stress exposure specifically increased the erp old new effect for emotional unpleasant picture but not for neutral picture these enhanced erp old new difference for emotional unpleasant scene were particularly pronounced for those participant who reported high level of stress during the secpt the result suggest that acute pre encoding stress specifically strengthens brain signal of emotional memory substantiating a facilitating role of stress on memory for emotional scene

introduction pain catastrophizing pc the increased attention to harmful aspect of pain magnification and the belief of low controllability helplessness ha been shown to be important in the maintenance of pain a growing research on structural alteration in chronic pain revealed an association between pc and brain area that are involved in affective and cognitive pain processing however little is known about a differential effect of the component magnification and helplessness objective the aim of this study wa to identify brain region associated with overall pc and with the single component of magnification and helplessness method we investigated 29 patient 6 month after lumbar disk surgery using voxel based morphometry magnification and helplessness were assessed with subscales of the avoidance endurance questionnaire aeq overall pc wa computed using the sum score the structural brain imaging data were preprocessed and analyzed using spm8 and vbm8 multiple regression analysis were performed with pc scale a predictor and depression a covariate result pain catastrophizing wa significantly associated with cortical gray matter in brain area involved in processing attentional sensory and affective aspect of pain including the left posterior cingulate cortex supplementary motor area and medial frontal gyrus in addition we provide preliminary evidence for brain structure association related to magnification and helplessness conclusion this study provides evidence for pc related structural alteration in patient with low back pain which are consistent with finding from previous research in different chronic pain disorder this study is the first to evaluate brain change related to differential domain of pc

fear generalization is a critical function for survival in which an organism extract information from a specific instantiation of a threat e g the western diamondback rattlesnake in my front yard on sunday and learns to fear and accordingly respond to pertinent higher order information e g snake live in my yard previous work investigating fear conditioning in human ha used functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri to demonstrate that activity pattern representing stimulus from an aversively conditioned category c are more similar to each other than those of a neutral category c here we used fmri and multiple aversively conditioned category to ask whether we would find only similarity increase within the c category or also similarity increase between the c category using representational similarity analysis we correlated several model to activity pattern underlying different brain region and found that following fear conditioning between category and within category similarity increased for the c category in the insula superior frontal gyrus sfg and the right temporal pole when specifically investigating fear generalization these between and within category effect were detected in the sfg these result advance prior pattern based neuroimaging work by exploring the effect of aversively conditioning multiple category and indicate an extended role for such region in potentially representing supracategorical information during fear learning

most widely used stress induction procedure such a the tsst and the cold pressor test require considerable effort and overhead in term of preparation logistics and staff recruitment moreover while known to reliably induce hpa axis activation especially when combined with social self threat most conventional laboratory stressor cannot be flexibly adapted to elicit either a mainly autonomic or an additional endocrine stress response being a promising alternative approach a new version of the isometric handgrip test enriched by a social evaluative component wa evaluated in the present study on two consecutive session forty participant 20 woman performed a handgrip task at both 45 stress and 10 control of maximum voluntary isometric contraction lasting for 3min during the stress test continuous visual feedback on performance wa given participant in the social evaluative condition 50 were observed and evaluated by a previously unknown person of the opposite sex whereas in the standard condition feedback wa provided via a computer monitor cardiovascular measure heart rate blood pressure a well a additional index of autonomic reactivity skin conductance heart rate variability were registered before during and after stress induction moreover change in salivary cortisol and in subjective well being were assessed relative to control significant increase in cardiovascular and sympathetic activity were found irrespective of experimental group importantly however additional social evaluation resulted in elevated cortisol level furthermore evidence for reduced vagal tone during sustained socially evaluated handgrip emerged in conclusion the socially evaluated handgrip test represents a versatile time efficient method to induce stress in small laboratory setting

the sexual excitation sexual inhibition inventory for woman sesii w is a self report questionnaire for assessing propensity of sexual excitation se and sexual inhibition si in woman according to the dual control model of sexual response these two factor differ between individual and influence the occurrence of sexual arousal in given situation extreme level of se and si are postulated to be associated with sexual problem or risky sexual behavior psychometric evaluation of the original scale yielded two higher order and eight lower order factor a well a satisfactory to good construct validity and reliability the present study wa designed to ass the psychometric property of a german version of the sesii w utilizing a large convenience sample of 2206 woman confirmatory factor analysis showed a satisfactory overall model fit with support for the five lower order factor of se arousability sexual power dynamic smell partner characteristic setting and the three lower order factor of si relationship importance arousal contingency and concern about sexual function additionally the scale demonstrated good convergent and discriminant validity internal consistency and test retest reliability the german sesii w is a sufficiently reliable and valid measure for assessing se and si in woman hence it use can be recommended for future research in germany that investigates woman s sexual behavior and experience

background affective dysfunction are common in patient with parkinson s disease but the underlying neurobiological deviation have rarely been examined parkinson s disease is characterized by a loss of dopamine neuron in the substantia nigra resulting in impairment of motor and non motor basal ganglion cortical loop concerning emotional deficit some study provide evidence for altered brain processing in limbic and lateral orbitofrontal gating loop in a second line of evidence human premotor and inferior parietal homologs of mirror neuron area were involved in processing and understanding of emotional facial expression we examined deviation in brain activation during processing of facial expression in patient and related these to emotion recognition accuracy method 13 patient and 13 healthy control underwent an emotion recognition task and a functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri measurement in the emotion hexagon test participant were presented with blend of two emotion and had to indicate which emotion best described the presented picture blended picture with three level of difficulty were included during fmri scanning participant observed video clip depicting emotional non emotional and neutral facial expression or were asked to produce these facial expression themselves result patient performed slightly worse in the emotion recognition task but only when judging the most ambiguous facial expression both group activated inferior frontal and anterior inferior parietal homologs of mirror neuron area during observation and execution of the emotional facial expression during observation response in the par opercularis of the right inferior frontal gyrus in the bilateral inferior parietal lobule and in the bilateral supplementary motor cortex were decreased in patient furthermore in patient activation of the right anterior inferior parietal lobule wa positively related to accuracy in the emotion recognition task conclusion our data provide evidence for a contribution of human homologs of monkey mirror area to the emotion recognition deficit in parkinson s disease

facial threat is associated with change in limbic activity a well a modification in the cortical face related n170 it remains unclear if task irrelevant threat modulates the response to a subsequent facial stimulus and whether the amygdala s role in early threat perception is independent and direct or modulatory in 19 participant crowd of emotional face were followed by target face and a rating task while simultaneous eeg fmri were recorded in addition to conventional analysis fmri informed eeg analysis and fmri dynamic causal modeling dcm were performed fearful crowd reduced eeg n170 target face amplitude and increased response in a fmri network comprising insula amygdala and inferior frontal cortex multimodal analysis showed that amygdala response wa present approximately 60 m before the right fusiform gyrus derived n170 dcm indicated inhibitory connection from amygdala to fusiform gyrus strengthened when fearful crowd preceded a target face result demonstrated the suppressing influence of task irrelevant fearful crowd on subsequent face processing the amygdala may be sensitive to task irrelevant fearful crowd and subsequently strengthen it inhibitory influence on face responsive fusiform n170 generator this provides spatiotemporal evidence for a feedback mechanism of the amygdala by narrowing attention in order to focus on potential threat

in this study the author explored whether attachment insecurity moderate the effect of adverse childhood experience on stress reactivity in the context of borderline personality disorder bpd participant were 113 woman 39 with bpd 15 with some bpd criterion present 59 without any bpd symptom who participated in the trier social stress test saliva sample were collected before and after the stressor and assayed for salivary alpha amylase saa and cortisol adverse childhood experience were measured using the childhood trauma questionnaire and attachment by the experience in close relationship revised questionnaire result revealed that attachment avoidance and a combination of more adverse childhood experience and attachment insecurity resulted in higher saa level and difference in reactivity to the stressor interaction between attachment anxiety and adverse childhood experience were related to blunted cortisol reactivity the result suggest that the influence of adverse childhood experience on stress regulation in bpd may be moderated by attachment related regulatory process

with the exception of a recently published study and the analysis provided in the test manual structural validity is mostly uninvestigated for the german version of the wechsler intelligence scale for child fifth edition wisc v therefore the main aim of the present study wa to examine the latent structure of the 10 wisc v primary subtests on a bifurcated extended population representative german standardization sample n 1 646 by conducting both exploratory efa n 823 and confirmatory cfa n 823 factor analysis on the original data since no more than one salient subtest loading could be found on the fluid reasoning fr factor in efa result indicated a four factor rather than a five factor model solution when the extraction of more than two suggested factor wa forced likewise a bifactor model with four group factor wa found to be slightly superior in cfa variance estimation from both efa and cfa revealed that the general factor dominantly accounted for most of the subtest variance and construct reliability estimate further supported interpretability of the full scale intelligence quotient fsiq in both efa and cfa most group factor explained rather small proportion of common subtest variance and produced low construct replicability estimate suggesting that the wisc v primary index were of lower interpretive value and should be evaluated with caution clinical interpretation should thus be primarily based on the fsiq and include a comprehensive analysis of the cognitive profile derived from the wisc v primary index rather than analysis of each single primary index

background despite association of sex hormone in woman with increased cardiometabolic risk and mortality the clinical correlate of altered sex hormone concentration in woman are le clearly understood we investigated a broad range of clinical correlate of sex hormone in woman from a large population based sample method data from 2560 woman from two cohort of the study of health in pomerania were used stepwise multivariable regression model were implemented to investigate a broad range of behavioral socio demographic and cardiometabolic clinical correlate related to total testosterone tt free testosterone ft androstenedione asd dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate dheas estrone e1 estradiol e2 and sex hormone binding globulin shbg result waist circumference and bmi beta coefficient 0 03 95 ci 0 04 0 03 were inversely related to shbg and bmi wa positively related to tt beta coefficient 0 005 95 ci 0 001 0 009 ft e1 and e2 smoking wa positively related to tt beta coefficient 0 04 95 ci 0 01 0 06 asd and ft systolic blood pressure tt beta coefficient 0 002 95 ci 0 001 0 003 hypertension tt beta coefficient 0 05 95 ci 0 003 0 11 low density lipoprotein ldl cholesterol tt beta coefficient 0 02 95 ci 0 01 0 05 and total cholesterol tt beta coefficient 0 03 95 ci 0 01 0 05 were positively related to tt and asd finally type 2 diabetes mellitus t2dm and metabolic syndrome mets were positively related to ft but inversely related to shbg conclusion our population based study with sex hormone concentration measured by liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry revealed association between clinical correlate including waist circumference smoking cohabitation systolic blood pressure cholesterol and mets with sex hormone thus sex hormone and shbg may play a role in the cardiovascular risk profile of woman

the present study aimed to investigate facebook addiction disorder fad in a german student sample over a period of one year while mean fad level did not increase during the investigation period a significant increase wa shown in the number of participant reaching the critical cutoff score fad wa significantly positively related to the personality trait narcissism and to negative mental health variable depression anxiety and stress symptom furthermore fad fully mediated the significant positive relationship between narcissism and stress symptom which demonstrates that narcissistic people can be specifically at risk to develop fad present result give a first overview of fad in germany practical application for future study and limitation of present result are discussed

background though several questionnaire on self care and regimen adherence have been introduced the evaluation do not always report consistent and substantial correlation with measure of glycaemic control small ability to explain variance in hba1c constitutes a significant limitation of an instrument s use for scientific purpose a well a clinical practice in order to ass self care activity which can predict glycaemic control the diabetes self management questionnaire dsmq wa designed method a 16 item questionnaire to ass self care activity associated with glycaemic control wa developed based on theoretical consideration and a process of empirical improvement four subscales glucose management gm dietary control dc physical activity pa and health care use hu a well a a sum scale s a a global measure of self care were derived to evaluate it psychometric quality 261 patient with type 1 or 2 diabetes were assessed with the dsmq and an established analogous scale the summary of diabetes self care activity measure sdsca the dsmq s item and scale characteristic a well a factorial and convergent validity were analysed and it convergence with hba1c wa compared to the sdsca result the item showed appropriate characteristic mean item total correlation 0 46 0 12 mean correlation with hba1c 0 23 0 09 overall internal consistency cronbach s alpha wa good 0 84 consistency of the subscales were acceptable gm 0 77 dc 0 77 pa 0 76 hu 0 60 principal component analysis indicated a four factor structure and confirmed the designed scale structure confirmatory factor analysis indicated appropriate fit of the four factor model the dsmq scale showed significant convergent correlation with their parallel sdsca scale gm 0 57 dc 0 52 pa 0 58 hu n a s 0 57 and hba1c gm 0 39 dc 0 30 pa 0 15 hu 0 22 s 0 40 all correlation with hba1c were significantly stronger than those obtained with the sdsca conclusion this study provides preliminary evidence that the dsmq is a reliable and valid instrument and enables an efficient assessment of self care behaviour associated with glycaemic control the questionnaire should be valuable for scientific analysis a well a clinical use in both type 1 and type 2 diabetes patient

in psychosis the alleged increased subjective stress sensitivity is reflected in abnormal physiological arousal such a higher heart rate elevated skin conductance level decreased vagal activity and unusual cortisol level despite ongoing research possible mechanism that explain the interplay between the phenomenological i e subjective stress and symptom and psychophysiological process are not thoroughly understood building on the model of neurovisceral integration by thayer and lane 2000 that focus on regulative mechanism we postulate that emotion regulation will be associated with vagal activity and with both subjective and physiological stress in the present analysis we used data from a baseline relaxation period including a 5 minute assessment of heart rate variability hrv salivary cortisol and momentary subjective stress rating from a sample of 19 participant with psychosis mean age 40 9 sd 11 1 36 8 female emotion regulation modification skill were assessed for specific emotion i e stress and arousal anxiety anger sadness shame if these were present during the previous week vagal hrv wa significantly and moderately associated with emotion regulation both stress parameter i e cortisol subjective stress were significantly associated with emotion regulation but not with hrv we provide preliminary support for the notion that emotion regulatory process represent a crucial link between phenomenological and psychophysiological phenomenon in psychosis a potential model that ascribes emotion regulation a central role in the restoration of homeostasis is discussed future study are needed to verify it generalizability and predictive value

background up to now little is known about higher order cognitive ability like social cognition and social problem solving ability in alcohol dependent patient however impairment in these domain lead to an increased probability for relapse and are thus highly relevant in treatment context method this cross sectional study assessed distinct aspect of social cognition and social problem solving in 31 hospitalized patient with alcohol use disorder aud and 30 matched healthy control hc three ecologically valid scenario based test were used to gauge the ability to infer the mental state of story character in complicated interpersonal situation the capacity to select the best problem solving strategy among other le optimal alternative and the ability to freely generate appropriate strategy to handle difficult interpersonal conflict standardized test were used to ass executive function attention trait empathy and memory and correlation were computed between measure of executive function attention trait empathy and test of social problem solving result aud patient generated significantly fewer socially sensitive and practically effective solution for problematic interpersonal situation than the hc group furthermore patient performed significantly worse when asked to select the best alternative among a list of presented alternative for scenario containing sarcastic remark and had significantly more problem to interpret sarcastic remark in difficult interpersonal situation conclusion these specific pattern of impairment should be considered in treatment program addressing impaired social skill in individual with aud

the covid 19 pandemic and it preventive measure had adverse consequence for mental health however knowledge of mental health trajectory across the pandemic is limited this study investigated the mental health level and change among university student during the pandemic and lockdown in germany a well a their associated factor we surveyed student mental health n 363 68 female with the patient health questionnaire phq 8 and the generalized anxiety disorder scale gad 7 during the first easing phase july 2020 time 1 and the second lockdown november 2020 time 2 cut off score from the gad 7 and phq 8 were used to determine clinically relevant symptom and to define trajectory group sociodemographic and pandemic related data were assessed e g coping with academic life social contact a well a loneliness stress repetitive negative thinking quality of life and perceived social support paired t test multiple regression and repeated measure anova were applied mean and prevalence rate for symptom of depression 38 8 and anxiety 25 6 did not differ between time 1 and time 2 and most student were asymptomatic on the phq 8 44 4 and the gad 7 56 3 across the pandemic feeling of loneliness significantly increased from time 1 to time 2 d 0 30 0 47 0 13 with higher symptom level in symptomatic group at time 2 and greater increase in the asymptomatic group level of stress repetitive negative thinking quality of life and social support did not differ during the pandemic at time 1 loneliness and repetitive negative thinking were associated with anxiety and depressive symptom anxiety and depressive symptom were prevalent among student and increased level of loneliness during the pandemic were associated with elevated symptom and differing trajectory further research using representative and larger sample should determine the long term impact of the pandemic on mental health and loneliness to identify vulnerable student and offer adequate support

the covid 19 pandemic ha brought about great change to the everyday life of the population in germany social distancing working from home and other measure to contain the pandemic are essentially dominating everyday life with data from the corona health app study we analysed the quality of life of the adult population in germany during the covid 19 pandemic and identified possible risk factor for a poor quality of life in the app based survey carried out between july and december 2020 1 396 respondent woman 46 5 men 52 7 diverse 0 9 mean age mean 42 0 year standard deviation 13 4 provided information on their quality of life using the world health organization quality of life questionnaire whoqol bref univariate and multivariate regression wa used to examine difference in quality of life between different group of people during the covid 19 pandemic and their association with selected predictor in summary woman younger person and job seeker or those who saw their work hour reduced or who could not pursue their regular job presented a lower quality of life in individual area of life than the respective reference group on the other hand a setting that combine working from home and at the regular workplace a well a living together with other people showed partly positive association with quality of life the result have implication for public health intervention a they highlight group requiring closer attention and sufficient support service

background and objective nocebo hyperalgesia i e increased pain sensitivity based on expectation can be induced by conditioning but is supposed to be mediated by conscious expectation although recent evidence point to the feasibility of subliminal conditioning of nocebo hyperalgesia with masked face face processing might be a special case and the practical implication of subliminal conditioning remain questionable this study aimed to implicitly condition nocebo hyperalgesia using supraliminal cue method implicit differential nocebo conditioning n 48 healthy participant wa implemented by coupling high and low painful electric stimulus to varying visual stimulus that only differed in the symmetry asymmetry of one component c c and contained further distracting component in the test phase only the low painful stimulus followed both c to test for conditioned nocebo effect in intensity and aversiveness rating and electrodermal activity a behavioral contingency test and a post experimental questionnaire assessed contingency awareness result a conditioned effect emerged in the aversiveness p 036 eta 2 0 09 but not in the intensity rating p 195 while controlling for contingency awareness further increased skin conductance level in response to c emerged irrespective of contingency awareness p 014 eta 2 0 13 no conditioned response in skin conductance response emerged p 872 limitation expected effect only emerged in part of the outcome variable conclusion the result support the notion that implicit conditioning of nocebo hypoalgesia is feasible using a novel experimental conditioning design with supraliminal stimulus presentation although further research is needed so far implicitly conditioned nocebo effect might have been underestimated despite vast clinical implication

background because overgeneralization of fear is a pathogenic marker of anxiety disorder we investigated whether pretreatment level of fear generalization in spider phobic patient are related to their response to exposure based treatment to identify pretreatment moderator of treatment success method a total of 90 patient with spider phobia completed pretreatment clinical and magnetoencephalography assessment one session of virtual reality exposure therapy and a posttreatment clinical assessment based on the primary outcome 30 symptom reduction in self reported symptom they were categorized a responder or nonresponders in a pretreatment magnetoencephalography fear generalization paradigm involving fear conditioning with 2 unconditioned stimulus ucs we obtained fear rating ucs expectancy rating and event related field to conditioned stimulus c c c and 7 different generalization stimulus on a perceptual continuum from c to c result before treatment nonresponders showed behavioral overgeneralization indicated by more linear generalization gradient in fear rating analysis of magnetoencephalography source estimation revealed that nonresponders showed a decline of their inhibitory frontal activation to safety signaling c and generalization stimulus compared with c over time while responder maintained these activation at early 300 m and late processing stage conclusion result provide initial evidence that pretreatment difference of behavioral and neural marker of fear generalization may act a moderator of later response to behavioral exposure stimulating further research on fear generalization a a potential predictive marker our finding are an important first step in the attempt to identify patient who may not benefit from exposure therapy and to personalize and optimize treatment strategy for this vulnerable patient group

the extent to which emotionally significant stimulus capture visual attention remains elusive because a preference for reporting or choosing emotionally significant stimulus could mimic attentional capture by these stimulus we conducted two prior entry experiment to disentangle whether phobic and fear relevant stimulus capture attention or merely produce a response bias in spider fearful participant prior entry denotes the effect that attended stimulus are perceived earlier than unattended stimulus a indicated by temporal order judgment we presented phobic spider fear relevant snake and neutral stimulus in pair with varying temporal onset the participant task wa to indicate which stimulus wa presented first experiment 1 or second experiment 2 in the first experiment spider fearful but not control participant indicated that they had perceived spider a occurring earlier in time suggesting a prior entry effect for spider in this group but surprisingly in the second experiment spider fearful participant indicated more frequently that they had seen spider a being presented second this finding rule out a genuine prior entry effect and instead suggests a strong preference for the response option associated with the feared animal this response bias may result from a hypervigilance toward the feared stimulus and contribute to maintaining avoidance behavior in individual with specific phobia

for every health behavior readiness to engage is a necessary and crucial foundation for following conversation intervention or behavior change the present study aim to support a one factor structure for the readiness for end of life conversation reolc scale berlin et al 2021 in a population of cancer patient n 295 for validation purpose data of patient participating in a screening development study at a university clinic wa used model adequacy wa analyzed with structural equation modelling and controlled for with goodness of fit index χ2 test srmr rrmsea discriminant and convergent validity were assessed with correlation of reolc and psychological or health behavior measure factor structure wa supported with good fit index discriminant validity and convergent validity readiness correlated significantly with age and reported death anxiety the reolc scale is a reliable instrument to ass cancer patient readiness for end of life conversation future study may further address moderating and mediating effect of socio demographic medical and psychological factor the assessment of readiness may further indicate anxiety level of cancer patient and enables practitioner to provide intervention accordingly however in a clinical setting and especially for patient with a palliative prognosis end of life care conversation may need to be introduced early

background mental health problem resulting from persecution and forced migration are very common among refugee and asylum seeker and evolve into a major public health challenge in hosting society language barrier often prevent timely access to appropriate health care leading to chronic trajectory and abortive social integration tool for multilingual screening and assessment could be of great benefit for this particularly vulnerable population a well a for policy maker this study aimed at testing the reliability feasibility and usability of the multi adaptive psychological screening software map a newly developed audio computer assisted self interview software acasi for touchscreen device for screening purpose in a clinical setting method in a randomized cross over design including both map and paper pencil clinician administered interview 30 treatment seeking refugee completed clinical measure and a feasibility questionnaire to rate the user interface of map five professional performed given task in map and completed usability questionnaire for the administration interface result result showed no difference between the two assessment modality with regard to symptom score the finding suggest good feasibility and usability of map in traumatized refugee the administration via map wa significantly shorter than the paper pencil interview conclusion map may be a cost effective flexible and valid alternative to interpreter based psychometric screening and assessment

hyperactive error monitoring is a robust neurocognitive characteristic in obsessive compulsive disorder ocd yet relatively little is known about the flexibility and potential moderator of error monitoring in ocd the current study investigates error monitoring in 30 healthy participant and 28 patient with ocd using a flanker task in 2 condition either emphasizing speed or accuracy result indicate that no group difference is observable in error related negativity ern under the accuracy focused condition both group show an ern attenuation in the speed condition however this reduction is larger in healthy control leading to pronounced group difference in the speed focused condition similarly receiver operating characteristic analysis yield an area under the curve auc of 62 in the accuracy focused condition whereas under speed instruction an auc of 85 suggests a marked increase in classification accuracy behavioral result and result from a drift diffusion model of decision making indicate a more cautious response strategy and le adaptability to experimental manipulation in ocd overall result suggest that the observed increase in error related neural activity in ocd might stem from a reduced flexibility and diminished ability to disengage from an accuracy oriented error avoidant response style further the present result suggest that emphasizing speed in experimental instruction may lead to a better neural differentiation between patient with ocd and healthy control which ha important implication for the use of the ern a a risk indicator psycinfo database record c 2019 apa all right reserved

abstract in this study we investigated whether the use of smartphone game while reading a text reduces learning performance or reading speed we also examined whether this is affected by push notification ninety three student were randomly assigned to three learning condition in the gaming group g participant played a game app for 20 s at 2 min interval while reading in one subgroup the game app sent push notification gn in the other subgroup no notification gn were sent in the control group c participant did not play a game after the reading participant took a multiple choice quiz we compared quiz score and reading time of the group g and c and within the gaming group gn gn and observed no difference since the statistical non significance of these test doe not entail the absence of an effect we conducted equivalence test which did not demonstrate equivalence either the experiment ensured high internal validity yet remained inconclusive reason for the similarity of performance in all group could be non specific exercise effect all participant owned a smartphone low similarity between the task low variance of participant ability and motivation high achieving low adhd score or low game complexity future research should address these question

introduction and objective experiential avoidance is a core process variable in the concept of acceptance and commitment theory act and ha been connected to various disorder a widely used instrument for the measurement of experiential avoidance is the acceptance and action questionnaire ii aaq ii recently a pain specific version for chronic pain patient wa introduced in the netherlands aaq ii p high score indicate strong pain related experiential avoidance the aim of the current study wa to measure pain related experiential avoidance in a sample of chronic pain patient using the german translation of the aaq ii p and to analyze it psychometric quality method after a forward backward translation procedure of the aaq ii and adaptation to the pain context a sample of n 168 patient from a multidisciplinary pain center answered the german version of the aaq ii p additional questionnaire were administered to measure specific construct of interest chronic pain grade cpg pain catastrophizing pc health related quality of life sf 12 psychopathology hads d personality bfi k and mindfulness kims s reliability factorial validity and construct validity of the aaq ii p were identified result the aaq ii p had high internal consistency alpha 0 89 and the one factor solution explained 61 of the total variance correlation to personality and mindfulness subscales were low maximum r 0 44 with neuroticism and r 0 43 with acceptance high correlation were shown for catastrophizing r 0 75 depression r 0 73 and anxiety r 0 66 also there wa a substantial correlation to health related quality of life specifically the psychological total scale r 0 58 discussion and conclusion the german aaq ii p ha good reliability regarding factorial structure and construct validity it is highly comparable to the original version direction and magnitude of the relationship to adjacent construct mostly measure up to our expectation chronic pain patient inclined to pain related experiential avoidance tend to indicate more pain catastrophizing and show restricted quality of life regarding psychological variable apparently pain related experiential avoidance can be relevant for popular target variable in psychotherapy

nonmaleficence is a key ethical value of research among vulnerable population trauma focused research typically includes detailed interview about traumatic life event and post traumatic symptom this raise concern about causing distress and harm for the affected individual we aimed to determine the immediate effect of trauma focused interview on participant wellbeing we developed the brief distress and harm scale dh7 for the assessment of current symptom of distress and urge to harm oneself or others using data from 332 iraqi and syrian child and both of their parent n 996 we assessed these symptom before and after participating in trauma focused interview result showed that the mean level of self reported distress and harm impulse were significantly decreased among adult and child rather than increased immediately after the interview once measure to safeguard case at risk are carefully implemented in research the potential benefit of participating in trauma focused interview outweigh the risk for individual potential implication of the result for ethical review board evaluating trauma focused study are discussed

using a multi informant approach we assessed 914 child mean age 12 58 year standard deviation sd 1 43 and 893 caregiver 98 3 per cent female mean age 40 07 year sd 11 46 in tanzania result showed that 93 3 per cent n 828 893 of caregiver reported using violent discipline while 91 0 per cent n 832 914 of the child experienced it in their family further 95 0 per cent n 868 914 and 93 7 per cent n 853 914 of student experienced violent discipline by teacher and peer violence at school respectively in a multilevel path model child s mental health problem standardised regression coefficient β 0 192 ci 0 130 0 255 p 0 001 were associated with their experience of violent discipline in family caregiver own childhood experience of violent discipline 𝛽 0 169 ci 0 105 0 232 p 0 001 their positive attitude towards violent discipline 𝛽 0 228 ci 0 166 0 290 p 0 001 and mental health problem 𝛽 0 175 ci 0 113 0 237 p 0 001 were associated with their use of violent discipline violent discipline in family significantly correlated with violent discipline by teacher correlation coefficient r 0 413 ci 0 354 0 472 p 0 001 and peer violence r 0 354 ci 0 294 0 415 p 0 001 implying child s polyvictimisation

anxiety disorder patient were repeatedly found to overestimate the association between disorder relevant stimulus and aversive outcome despite random contingency such an illusory correlation ic might play an important role in the return of fear after extinction learning yet little is known about how this cognitive bias emerges in the brain in a functional magnetic resonance imaging study 18 female patient with spider phobia and 18 healthy control were exposed to picture of spider mushroom and puppy followed randomly by either a painful electrical shock or nothing in advance both patient and healthy control expected more shock after spider picture importantly only patient with spider phobia continued to overestimate this association after the experiment the strength of this ic wa predicted by increased outcome aversiveness rating and primary sensory motor cortex activity in response to the shock after spider picture moreover increased activation of the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc to spider picture predicted the ic these result support the theory that phobia relevant stimulus amplify unpleasantness and sensory motor representation of aversive stimulus which in turn may promote their overestimation hyper activity in dlpfc possibly reflects a pre occupation of executive resource with phobia relevant stimulus thus complicating the accurate monitoring of objective contingency and the unlearning of fear
