what we see influence our emotion technology often mediates the visual content we perceive visual angle is an essential parameter of how we see such content it operationalizes visible property of human computer interface however we know little about the content independent effect of visual angle on emotional response to audiovisual stimulus we show that visual angle alone affect emotional response to audiovisual feature independent of object perception we conducted a 2 2 3 factorial repeated measure experiment with 143 undergraduate student we simultaneously presented monochrome rectangle with pure tone and assessed valence arousal and dominance in the high visual angle condition arousal increased valence and dominance decreased and lightness modulated arousal in the low visual angle condition pitch modulated arousal and lightness affected valence visual angle weight the affective relevance of perception modality independent of spatial representation visual angle serf a an early stage perceptual feature for organizing emotional response control of this presentation layer allows for provoking or avoiding emotional response where intended

police officer are exposed to a high amount of work effort in their everyday employment this increase their risk of developing emotional exhaustion the key symptom of the burnout syndrome previous research suggests that leadership climate is important for employee health and thus might be protective against emotional exhaustion this study investigated whether a positive leadership climate prevents emotional exhaustion and buffer the negative impact of work effort in police officer data from a cross sectional health survey in a german police department n 570 were used to test the assumption result of the hierarchical linear regression analysis showed that high work effort wa correlated with high level of emotional exhaustion and positive leadership climate wa associated with low level of emotional exhaustion furthermore both predictor variable interacted indicating a buffer effect of a positive leadership climate under stressful working condition this is the first study to show both direct and indirect protective effect of a positive leadership climate in police officer in police work stressful working condition such a high work effort are hard to avoid thus it is crucial to promote preventive factor such a a positive leadership climate to protect police officer health suggestion of how police supervisor and department might establish a positive leadership climate are presented

in the ongoing coronavirus disease 2019 covid 19 pandemic medium report have caused anxiety and distress in many in some individual feeling distressed by information may lead to avoidance of information which ha been shown to undermine compliance with preventive health behavior in many health domain e g cancer screening we set out to examine whether feeling distressed by information predicts higher avoidance of information about covid 19 avoidance hypothesis and whether this in turn predicts worse compliance with measure intended to prevent the spread of covid 19 compliance hypothesis thus we conducted an online survey with a convenience sample n 1 059 79 4 female and assessed distress by information information avoidance and compliance with preventive measure furthermore we inquired about participant information seeking behavior and medium usage their trust in information source and level of ehealth literacy a well a generalized anxiety we conducted multiple linear regression analysis to predict distress by information information avoidance and compliance with preventive measure overall distress by information wa associated with better compliance however distress wa also linked with an increased tendency to avoid information avoidance hypothesis and this reduced compliance with preventive measure compliance hypothesis thus distress may generally induce adaptive behavior in support of crisis management unless individual respond to it by avoiding information these finding provide insight into the consequence of distress by information and avoidance of information during a global health crisis these result underscore that avoiding information is a maladaptive response to distress by information which may ultimately interfere with effective crisis management consequently we emphasize the need to develop measure to counteract information avoidance

background a biased perception of physiological hyperreactivity to social evaluative situation is crucial for the maintenance of social anxiety disorder sad alteration in interoceptive accuracy iac when confronted with social stressor may play a role for sad in child we expected a biased perception of hyperarousal in child with sad before treatment and consequently a reduced bias after successful cognitive behavioral therapy cbt method in two center 64 child with the diagnosis of sad and 55 healthy control hc child both 9 to 13 year participated in the trier social stress test for child tsst c which wa repeated after child with sad were assigned to either a 12 week group cbt n 31 or a waitlist condition n 33 perception of and worry about physiological arousal and autonomic variable heart rate skin conductance were assessed after each tsst c all child further completed a heartbeat perception task to ass iac result before treatment child with sad reported both a stronger perception of and more worry about their heart rate and skin conductance than hc child while the objective reactivity of heart rate did not differ additionally child with sad reported heightened perception of and increased worry about trembling throughout the tsst c compared to hc child but reported increased worry about blushing only after the stress phase of the tsst c compared to hc child child with and without sad did not differ in iac contrary to our hypothesis after treatment child in the cbt group reported heightened perception of physiological arousal and increased worry on some parameter after the baseline phase of the tsst c whereas actual iac remained unaffected iac before and after treatment were significantly related conclusion increased self reported perception of physiological arousal may play a role in childhood sad and could be an important target in cbt however further study should examine if this is an epiphenomenon a temporarily occurring and necessary condition for change or indeed an unwanted adverse intervention effect

background computerized version of well established measurement such a the phq 9 are widely used but data on the comparability of psychometric property are scarce objective our objective wa to compare the interformat reliability of the paper and pen version with a computerized version of the phq 9 in a clinical sample method 130 participant with mental health disorder were recruited during psychotherapeutic treatment in a mental health clinic in a crossover design they all completed the phq 9 in both the computerized and paper and pen version in randomized order result the internal consistency wa comparable for the computer alpha 0 88 and paper version alpha 0 89 and highly significant correlation were found between the format r 0 92 phq 9 total score were not significantly different between the paper and the computer delivered version there wa a significant interaction effect between format and order of administration for the phq 9 indicating that the first administration delivered slightly higher score limitation in order to reduce the required effort for the participant we did not ask them to fill out anything but the phq 9 once in paper and once in computer version conclusion our finding suggest that the phq 9 can be transferred to computerized use without affecting psychometric property in a clinically meaningful way

abstract although awareness of the importance of reconciliation in post conflict society ha grown in recent decade validated measure assessing victim attitude toward reconciliation are lacking to fill this gap the readiness to reconcile inventory rri wa developed and it factor structure and aspect of construct validity were psychometrically tested in two independent sample of survivor of the khmer rouge regime in cambodia exploratory factor analysis in a sample of n 247 survivor identified a 13 item three factor internal structure of the rri that wa confirmed by confirmatory factor analysis in an independent sample of n 830 survivor of the khmer rouge regime all rri subscales showed good internal consistency cronbach s αs from 80 to 83 multiple group analysis established configural metric and scalar invariance across sex the rri thus demonstrated good reliability and fulfilled some aspect of construct validity it is a time effective and easy to administer instrument for assessing readiness to reconcile in victim of war and conflict

difficulty in controlling emotional impulse is a crucial component of borderline personality disorder bpd that often lead to destructive impulsive behaviour against others in line with recent finding in aggressive individual deficit in prefrontal amygdala coupling during emotional action control may account for these symptom to study the neurobiological correlate of altered emotional action control in individual with bpd we asked medication free anger prone female patient with bpd and age and intelligence matched healthy woman to take part in an approach avoidance task while lying in an mri scanner the task required controlling fast behavioural tendency to approach happy and avoid angry face additionally before the task we collected saliva testosterone and self reported information on tendency to act out anger and correlated this with behavioural and functional mri fmri data we included 30 patient and 28 control in our analysis patient with bpd reported increased tendency to act out anger and were faster in approaching than avoiding angry face than with healthy woman suggesting deficit in emotional action control in woman with bpd on a neural level controlling fast emotional action tendency wa associated with enhanced activation in the antero and dorsolateral prefrontal cortex across group healthy woman showed a negative coupling between the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex and right amygdala whereas this wa absent in patient with bpd specificity of result to bpd and sex difference remain unknown owing to the lack of clinical control group and male participant the result indicate reduced lateral prefrontal amygdala communication during emotional action control in anger prone woman with bpd the finding provide a possible neural mechanism underlying difficulty with controlling emotional impulse in patient with bpd

introduction the need for social distancing to reduce the spread of covid 19 is accompanied by an increase of social medium use smu many people engage in intensive online activity to find information about the current covid 19 situation and to interact about it with other user the present study investigated the extent of smu a covid 19 information source and it relationship with stress symptom and burden caused by the pandemic in germany and italy method cross national longitudinal germany n 501 3 month period and cross sectional italy n 951 data on covid 19 information source stress symptom and burden caused by covid 19 were collected via online survey result about 50 of the german sample and about 60 of the italian sample frequently used sm a covid 19 information source cross sectional analysis in both country revealed that smu is positively associated with stress symptom and experienced burden moreover stress symptom mediated the link between smu and burden this wa also confirmed by longitudinal analysis in germany burden assessed three month after smu and stress symptom limitation the mostly female and relatively young sample composition limit the generalizability of present finding only two european country were investigated conclusion the present finding reveal a potential negative impact of enhanced smu on individual mental health state and behavior additionally they emphasize the significance of a conscious and cautious use of sm a information source specifically during the pandemic

attention bias for food could be a cognitive pathway to overeating in obesity and restrained eating yet empirical evidence for individual difference e g in restrained eating and body mass index in attention bias for food is mixed we tested experimentally if temporarily induced health versus palatability mindset influenced attention bias for food and whether restrained eating moderated this relation after manipulating mindset health v palatability experimentally food related attention bias wa measured by eye movement em and response latency rl during a visual probe task depicting high calorie food and non food restrained eating wa assessed afterwards a significant interaction of mindset and restrained eating on rl bias emerged beta 0 36 t 58 2 05 p 0 045 a health mindset a compared to a palatability mindset attenuated attention bias for high caloric food only in participant with higher eating restraint no effect were observed on em bias the current result demonstrate that state difference in health versus palatability mindset can cause attenuated attention bias for high calorie food cue in participant with higher eating restraint our finding add to emerging evidence that state difference in mindset can bias attention for food above the influence of trait difference

background in recent year armed conflict in the middle east have resulted in high rate of exposure to traumatic event despite the increasing demand of mental health care provision ongoing violence limit conventional approach of mental health care provision internet based intervention for posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd have proved feasible and effective in western country but their applicability and efficacy in war and conflict region remains unknown objective this study investigated the efficacy of a cognitive behavioral internet based intervention for war traumatized arab patient with focus on iraq method a total of 159 individual with ptsd participated in a parallel group randomized trial participant were randomly allocated by a computer generated sequence to a treatment group n 79 or a waiting list control group n 80 the treatment group received 2 weekly 45 minute cognitive behavioral intervention via internet over a 5 week period 10 session in total the primary outcome wa recovery from posttraumatic stress symptom result posttraumatic stress symptom were significantly reduced from baseline to posttreatment intention to treat analysis in the treatment group relative to the control group f1 157 44 29 p 001 d 0 92 treatment effect were sustained at 3 month follow up completer analysis indicated that 29 of 47 patient 62 in the treatment group had recovered from posttraumatic stress symptom at posttreatment reliable change and posttraumatic stress diagnostic scale score 20 versus 1 patient 2 in the control group or 74 19 95 ci 9 93 585 8 p 001 indicating that the chance of recovering wa 74 19 time higher in the treatment than in the control group conclusion the result indicate even in unstable and insecure setting with ongoing exposure to human right violation through war and dictatorship people with posttraumatic stress symptom benefit from a cognitive behavioral treatment provided entirely through the internet this method of delivery could improve patient access to humanitarian aid in the form of e mental health service trial registration australian new zealand clinical trial registry actrn12611001019998 http www anzctr org au trial registration trialreview aspx id 347505 archived by webcite at http www webcitation org 6wto4hcdh

background the sexual interest and desire inventory female sidi f is a clinician administered scale that allows for a comprehensive assessment of symptom related to hypoactive sexual desire dysfunction hsdd a self report questionnaire may facilitate le socially desirable responding and a time and resource are scarce in many clinical and research setting a self report version wa developed sexual interest and desire inventory female self report sidi f sr aim to ass the psychometric property of the sidi f sr and to investigate the agreement between the sidi f and sidi f sr method a total of 170 woman mage 37 sd 11 range 20 69 with hsdd answered the sidi f administered by a clinical psychologist via telephone first followed by the sidi f sr delivered a an internet based questionnaire a subset of 19 woman answered the sidi f sr twice over a period of 14 week outcome convergent validity of the sidi f sr wa assessed via correlation with the desire subscale of the female sexual function index and the female sexual distress scale revised internal consistency and test retest reliability a well a intraclass correlation and predictor of absolute agreement between sidi f and sidi f sr were examined result test retest reliability wa good r 0 74 convergent validity wa low but comparable between sidi f and sidi f sr internal consistency of the sidi f sr wa acceptable alpha 0 76 and comparable to the sidi f alpha 0 74 when correction for the restriction of range were applied internal consistency of the sidi f sr increased to 0 91 there wa high agreement between sidi f and sidi f sr icc 0 86 on average woman scored about one point higher indicated more desire in the self report v the clinician administered scale clinical implication the sidi f sr can be used in setting where time and resource are limited whether the clinical cutoff point for the sidi f is adequate for the sidi f sr ha yet to be determined strength and limitation large sample of diverse woman with hsdd lack of control group ie healthy control woman with other sexual dysfunction conclusion the sidi f sr showed promising psychometric property in a sample of woman with hsdd velten j hirschfeld g meyers m et al psychometric property of a self report version of the sexual interest and desire inventory female sidi f sr j sex med 2021 18 990 995

objective psychosocial treatment for chronic abdominal pain in childhood or adolescence are effective but time consuming and hardly available in the present study gut directed hypnotherapy gdht and unspecific hypnotherapy uht were compared to evaluate the feasibility and efficacy of a hypnotherapeutic self help intervention participant and method child adolescent between 6 and 17 year of age with chronic abdominal pain were randomized to gdht or uht the treatment period wa 12 week each measurement were performed before and after treatment the primary outcome wa a pain diary analysis wa carried out a per protocol result of 45 participant included 13 were lost to follow up thirty two participant 14 ghdt 18 uht were analyzed dropout had higher pain severity completers in both condition showed good adherence and a similar decrease in day with pain and pain duration pain intensity decreased only in the uht condition eleven participant two gdht nine uht achieved clinical remission 80 improvement and 13 participant seven gdht six uht improved significantly 30 80 conclusion result suggest a high efficacy of standardized home based hypnotherapy for child adolescent with abdominal pain child adolescent with high pain severity are at risk of dropping out the uht condition showed slight evidence of superiority but condition were equivalent on most outcome taken together self help approach based on hypnotherapy could close a treatment gap and prevent chronification

recent evidence suggests that while reflectance information including color may be more diagnostic for familiar face recognition shape may be more diagnostic for unfamiliar face identity processing moreover event related potential erp finding suggest an earlier onset for neural processing of facial shape compared to reflectance in the current study we aimed to explore specifically the role of facial shape and color in a familiarity decision task using pre experimentally familiar famous and unfamiliar face that were caricatured either in shape only color only or both full shape color by 15 30 or 45 we recorded accuracy mean reaction time and face sensitive erps performance data revealed that shape caricaturing facilitated identity processing for unfamiliar face only in the erp data such effect of shape caricaturing emerged earlier than those of color caricaturing unsurprisingly erp effect were accentuated for larger level of caricaturing overall our finding corroborate the importance of shape for identity processing of unfamiliar face and demonstrate an earlier onset of neural processing for facial shape compared to color

introduction the most prevalent psychotherapy school are psychodynamic pdt and cognitive behavior therapy cbt there are no scientific guideline on which type of patient should be treated by which therapist and how they can find the best one part of the answer can be derived from data on who is treated in which way objective objective of this study wa to compare patient in routine pdt and cbt to describe similarity and difference in regard to patient status and treatment material and method a research psychotherapist visited 73 cognitive behavior therapist and 58 psychodynamic psychotherapist in their office and asked them to report about the last case they had seen there were 188 cbt and 134 pd case report result there were no significant difference in socio demographic between pdt and cbt patient the average number of treatment session so far wa significantly higher in pdt than cbt there were longer duration of illness more parallel medical treatment and higher rate of sick leave in cbt patient while assessment of capacity with the mini icf app showed no difference more participation restriction were found in cbt patient correspondingly there were more sociomedical intervention especially in regard to work conclusion the difference between pdt and cbt may be explained by the fact that pdt requires analytical capability on the side of the patient which may exclude patient with social problem while cbt is coping oriented which allows the inclusion of all kind of patient still in both treatment mode complex patient are treated with multidimensional intervention

background several study identified low subjective feeling of power in woman with anorexia nervosa an however little is known about implicit power motif and the discrepancy between explicit feeling of power and implicit power motif in an aim the study investigated the discrepancy between explicit feeling of power and implicit power motif and it relationship to anxiety in patient with an method fifty three outpatient and inpatient with an and 48 participant without an were compared regarding subjective feeling of power and anxiety explicit power investigated with the personal sense of power scale trait focus and a visual analog scale state focus implicit power motif investigated with the multi motive grid mmg and trait anxiety measured with the state trait anxiety inventory stai were assessed result explicit feeling of power state and trait level were lower in patient with an compared to non an participant no difference in implicit power motif were found when comparing the group against each other however looking at the group separately woman with an had similar level of implicit fear of losing power and hope for power whereas woman without an had significantly lower fear of losing power than hope for power focusing on discrepancy between powerful feeling and power motif result were mixed depending on the subscale of the mmg lastly discrepancy between implicit power motif and explicit feeling of power were positively correlated with trait anxiety in an patient conclusion these finding underline that individual with an display significantly lower explicit feeling of power however they show similar implicit power motif compared to individual without an the discrepancy between explicit feeling of power and implicit power motif is related to anxiety in an and may represent a vulnerability factor to illness maintenance

anxious apprehension and anxious arousal are central transdiagnostic anxiety dimension and have been linked to divergent pattern of frontal and parietal alpha asymmetry the present study examined the relationship between alpha asymmetry and anxiety dimension in 130 individual whose electroencephalogram eeg wa recorded at rest we applied a 2 anxious apprehension low v high x 2 anxious arousal low v high design to contrast brain lateralization in four group result revealed that anxious apprehension wa associated with more left than right frontal brain activity in the lower alpha band an effect driven by decreased right frontal activity exploratory analysis showed more left than right brain activity at central site associated with anxious apprehension parietal activity wa not lateralized a a function of anxiety dimension taken together the current result support that anxious apprehension is associated with more left than right frontal and central activity and suggest a broader distribution of alpha asymmetry associated with anxious apprehension than previously thought

the human fear conditioning paradigm is a widely used procedure to study anxiety however merely thinking about the aversive outcome is typically not measured in this procedure this is surprising because thinking of an aversive event is of clinical relevance e g in the form of intrusion and theoretical interest we present two preregistered study that a included thinking of an aversive outcome a an additional dependent variable and b compared several intervention to reduce it we found that mere thinking of an aversive outcome could be successfully conditioned among the participant who showed successful acquisition extinction training wa le successful in reducing it than counterconditioning presenting new additional outcome also proved effective to reduce thought about the initial outcome when the new outcome were positive stimulus including thinking of the aversive outcome a an additional dependent variable may serve to enhance the understanding of anxiety related disorder and inform their treatment

importance despite the high prevalence evidence based treatment for abuse related posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd in adolescent have rarely been studied objective to examine whether developmentally adapted cognitive processing therapy d cpt is more effective than a wait list condition with treatment advice wl ta among adolescent with ptsd related to childhood abuse design setting and participant this rater blinded multicenter randomized clinical trial stratified by center enrolled treatment seeking adolescent and young adult aged 14 21 year with childhood abuse related ptsd at 3 university outpatient clinic in germany from july 2013 to june 2015 with the last follow up interview conducted by may 2016 of 194 patient 88 were eligible for randomization intervention participant received d cpt or wl ta cognitive processing therapy wa enhanced by a motivational and alliance building phase by including emotion regulation and consideration of typical developmental task and by higher session frequency in the trauma focused core cpt phase in wl ta participant received treatment advice with respective recommendation of clinician and were offered d cpt after 7 month main outcome and measure all outcome were assessed before treatment baseline approximately 8 week after the start of treatment after the end of treatment posttreatment and at the 3 month follow up the primary outcome ptsd symptom severity wa assessed in clinical interview clinician administered ptsd scale for child and adolescent for dsm iv cap ca secondary outcome were self reported ptsd severity depression borderline symptom behavior problem and dissociation result the 88 participant 75 85 female had a mean age of 18 1 year 95 ci 17 6 18 6 year in the intention to treat analysis the 44 participant receiving d cpt 39 89 female demonstrated greater improvement than the 44 wl ta participant 36 82 female in term of ptsd severity mean cap ca score 24 7 95 ci 16 6 32 7 v 47 5 95 ci 37 9 57 1 hedge g 0 90 this difference wa maintained through the follow up mean cap ca score 25 9 95 ci 16 2 35 6 v 47 3 95 ci 37 8 56 8 hedge g 0 80 treatment success wa greatest during the trauma focused core phase the d cpt participant also showed greater and stable improvement in all secondary outcome with between group effect size ranging from 0 65 to 1 08 at the posttreatment assessment eg for borderline symptom 14 1 95 ci 8 0 20 2 v 32 0 95 ci 23 8 40 2 hedge g 0 91 conclusion and relevance adolescent and young adult with abuse related ptsd benefited more from d cpt than from wl ta treatment success wa stable at the follow up and generalized to borderline symptom and other comorbidities trial registration german clinical trial register identifier drks00004787

the recent outbreak of the coronavirus disease covid 19 ha plunged country across the world into crisis both in the general population and in specific subgroup such a infected people or health care worker study have reported increased symptom of anxiety depression and stress however the reaction of individual with mental disorder to covid 19 have largely been neglected the present study therefore aimed to investigate the perceived impact of covid 19 and it psychological consequence on people with mental disorder in this online survey participant were asked to evaluate their disorder specific symptom perceived psychosocial stress and behavior related to covid 19 in the current situation and retrospectively before the spread of covid 19 the study included participant with self identified generalized anxiety disorder gad panic disorder and agoraphobia pa illness anxiety disorder ia social anxiety disorder sad depression dp obsessive compulsive disorder ocd body dysmorphic disorder bdd eating disorder ed schizophrenia spectrum and other psychotic disorder sp other non specified mental disorder other a well a mentally healthy control hc the result of bayesian parameter estimation suggest that the symptom severity of dp gad ia and bdd ha deteriorated a a reaction to covid 19 across all mental disorder and hc self reported psychosocial stress level were higher during the outbreak of covid 19 compared to before a reduced frequency of social contact and grocery shopping wa found for all participant people with self identified mental disorder showed higher personal worry about covid 19 and a higher fear of contagion with covid 19 than did hc according to our finding covid 19 may reinforce symptom severity and psychosocial stress in individual with mental disorder in time of pandemic special support is needed to assist people with mental disorder and to prevent symptom deterioration

abstract background interpretation bias are suggested to be transdiagnostic phenomenon but have rarely been compared across different disorder and current concern method we investigated explicit decision based and more implicit reaction time based interpretation bias in individual with body dysmorphic disorder bdd n 29 social anxiety disorder sad n 36 generalized anxiety disorder gad n 22 and non clinical control nc n 32 using an adapted word sentence association paradigm wsap result result indicated that interpretation bias occurred transdiagnostically while content specific bias pattern varied meaningfully across group bdd and sad shared explicit and more inconsistently implicit interpretation bias for appearance related and social situation the gad group exhibited an explicit and implicit negative interpretation bias for general situation and an additional implicit lack of positive bias mechanistic wiener diffusion model analysis revealed that interpretation bias pattern were mainly driven by speeded information uptake potentially mirroring disorder specific associative memory organization conclusion these finding have important implication for understanding interpretation bias a both etiological and treatment factor

background while witnessing the suffering of other people result in personal distress it is not clear whether regulating others emotion in such situation also come at an emotional cost for the observer method this study included 62 subject and used a newly developed functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri paradigm to investigate mechanism of self and other emotion regulation via reappraisal while the subject and an interaction partner outside the scanner were facing the same distressing situation simultaneously the relationship between distress level and individual difference in emotional and cognitive empathy were also assessed result we found that individual exhibited especially high level of personal distress when relating with a partner while both being exposed to aversive photograph and that especially highly empathetic individual were prone to such personal distress moreover when engaging in social emotion regulation personal distress wa reduced in the observer at a similar rate a in self emotion regulation fmri analysis revealed increased activation for other v self emotion regulation in the precuneus and the left temporo parietal junction which are commonly engaged in social cognition furthermore this activation wa associated with lower self reported stress and decreased sympathetic autonomic activity while regulating others precuneus activation exhibited a distinctive functional connectivity profile with parietal emotion regulation region conclusion this study demonstrates benefit of actively regulating another person s emotion for reducing one s own distress and identifies the precuneus a an important node for social emotion regulation given the novelty of the study design the result are of exploratory and preliminary nature

theoretical model consider difficulty in emotion regulation er a central trans diagnostic phenomenon across the spectrum of eating disorder ed however there is a lack of study directly comparing ed subtypes regarding er problem furthermore patient with anorexia nervosa restricting type an r and patient with an binge purge type an bp have usually been merged into one overall an group in previous research on er in order to overcome these limitation of previous study the present study investigated specific er difficulty in 120 patient with different ed subtypes including an r an bp bulimia nervosa bn and binge eating disorder bed a compared to 60 healthy normal weight control nwc and 29 healthy over weight control owc all ed subtypes reported greater difficulty in er ed subtypes did not differ regarding most domain of er except bed showing le severe er difficulty in some domain in addition an bp but not bn reported greater impulse control difficulty than an r and bed the finding underscore the relevance of er difficulty in ed and support the trans diagnostic view of er difficulty being present across the whole spectrum of ed in addition the present result suggest that certain domain of er may be linked more closely to certain ed subtypes than to others

aim the covid 19 outbreak ha severely impacted people s mental health the present experimental study investigated how to reduce this negative effect by a combination of two intervention subject and method participant n total 642 were user of social medium in germany for two week the social medium group n 162 reduced it social medium use smu by 30 minute daily the physical activity group n 161 increased it physical activity by 30 minute daily the combination group n 159 followed both instruction and the control group n 160 did not get specific instruction online survey assessed variable of smu physical activity mental health covid 19 burden and lifestyle at six measurement time point up to six month after the intervention result in the experimental group addictive smu depression symptom and covid 19 burden decreased while physical activity life satisfaction and subjective happiness increased all effect were stronger and more stable in the combination group in the longer term smoking behavior decreased in the social medium group only conclusion thus the conscious combination of le smu and more physical activity lead causally to more psychological resilience against negative pandemic impact and to higher level of mental health over six month prevention program could improve their effectiveness by integrating the time and cost efficient intervention separately or in combination supplementary information the online version contains supplementary material available at 10 1007 s10389 022 01751 x

motivation and attention constitute major determinant of human perception and action nonetheless it remains a matter of debate whether motivation effect on the visual cortex depend on the spatial attention system or rely on independent pathway this study investigated the impact of motivation and spatial attention on the activity of the human primary and extrastriate visual cortex by employing a factorial manipulation of the two factor in a cued pattern discrimination task during stimulus presentation we recorded event related potential and pupillary response motivational relevance increased the amplitude of the c1 component at approximately 70 m after stimulus onset this modulation occurred independently of spatial attention effect which were evident at the p1 level furthermore motivation and spatial attention had independent effect on preparatory activation a measured by the contingent negative variation and pupil data showed increased activation in response to incentive target taken together these finding suggest independent pathway for the influence of motivation and spatial attention on the activity of the human visual cortex

pavlovian learning mechanism are of great importance both for model of psychiatric disorder and treatment approach but understudied in obsessive compulsive disorder ocd using an established pavlovian fear conditioning and reversal procedure we studied skin conductance response in 41 patient with ocd and in 32 matched healthy control participant within both group fear acquisition and reversal effect were evident when comparing group patient showed impaired differential learning of threatening and safe stimulus consistent with previous research in contrast to prior finding differential learning impairment were restricted to fear acquisition and not observed in the reversal stage of the experiment a previous and present fear reversal experiment in ocd differed in the use of color coding to facilitate stimulus discrimination the study converge to suggest that differential learning of threatening versus safe stimulus is impaired in ocd but manifest itself differently depending on the difficulty of the association to be learned when supported by the addition of color patient with ocd previously appeared to acquire an association early but failed to reverse it according to changed contingency in absence of such color coding of stimulus our data suggest that patient with ocd already show differential learning impairment during fear acquisition which may relate to finding of altered coping with uncertainty previously observed in ocd impaired differential learning of threatening versus safe stimulus should be studied further in ocd in order to determine whether impairment in differential learning predict treatment outcome in patient and whether they are etiologically relevant for ocd

social anxiety disorder sad are among the most prevalent mental disorder lifetime prevalence 7 12 with high impact on the life of an affected social system and it individual social system member we developed a manualized disorder specific integrative systemic and family therapy isft for sad and evaluated it feasibility in a pilot randomized controlled trial rct the isft is inspired by helm stierlin s concept of related individuation developed during the early 1980s which ha since continued to be refined it integrates solution focused language social network diagnostics and genogram work a well a resource and problem orientation for both case conceptualization and therapy planning post milan symptom prescription to fluidize the presented symptom is one of the core intervention in the isft theoretically the ifst is grounded in radical constructivism and cybern ethic multi directional partiality and a both and attitude toward a disorder specific v non disorder specific therapy approach sad is understood from the viewpoint of social system theory especially in adaptation to a socio psycho biological explanatory model of social anxiety in a prospective multicenter assessor blind pilot rct we included 38 client with sad icd f40 1 liebowitz social anxiety scale lsas sr 30 18 patient participated in the isft and 20 patient in cognitive behavioral therapy cbt age m 36 year sd 14 within group simple effect intention to treat analysis showed significant reduction in social anxiety lsas sr isft d 1 67 cbt d 1 04 while intention to treat mixed design anova demonstrated the advantage of isft d 0 81 per protocol analysis supported these result the remission rate based on blind diagnostician rating wa good to satisfactory structured clinical interview scid 78 in st 45 in cbt p 0 083 this ha yet to be verified in a subsequent confirmatory rct the article will present the isft rationale and manual including a special focus on multi person setting and the central finding from our pilot rct

according to theory of addictive behavior approach and attentional bias toward smoking related cue play a crucial role in tobacco dependence several study have investigated these bias by using various paradigm in different sample type however this heterogeneity make it difficult to compare and evaluate the result the present study aimed to address this problem via i a structural comparison of different measure of approach avoidance and a measure of smoking related attentional bias and ii using within one study different representative sample in the context of tobacco dependence three measure of approach avoidance were employed an approach avoidance task aat a stimulus response compatibility task src and a single target implicit association test st iat to ass attentional bias a modified stroop task including smoking related word wa administered the study included four group n 58 smoker n 57 non smoker n 52 cravers and n 54 ex smoker we expected to find strong tobacco related approach bias and attentional bias in smoker and cravers however the general pattern of result did not confirm these expectation approach response assessed during the aat and src did not differ between group moreover the stroop did not show the expected interference effect for the st iat cravers had stronger approach association toward smoking related cue whereas non smoker showed stronger avoidance association however no such difference in approach avoidance association were found in smoker and ex smoker to conclude these data do not provide evidence for a strong role of implicit approach and attentional bias toward smoking related cue in tobacco dependency

the opd conflict questionnaire background to date no self report measure is available to ass mode of coping with unconscious conflict according to operationalized psychodynamic diagnosis opd the opd conflict questionnaire opd cq developed here thus intends to close this gap method to select the item for the opd cq expert rating and psychometric criterion based on a sample of 534 person were combined result the opd cq comprises 66 item with which active and passive mode of coping with six conflict a well a defended perception of conflict and emotion can be assessed some of the scale had a rather low internal consistency an investigation of the factor structure of the opd cq scale revealed five factor that could be meaningfully interpreted the opd cq scale showed expected correlation with other clinically relevant instrument in addition we showed the incremental validity of the opd cq scale regarding the prediction of psychological distress and life satisfaction above and beyond structural deficit discussion the result provide important clue toward developing and validating the opdcq the first version presented here should be considered preliminary

objective diagnosis of personality disorder pd must rely on judgment of observer either clinician or acquaintance because personality disorder are primarily defined in term of maladaptive interpersonal behavior little is known however about how closely acquaintance judgment of pd trait relate to self report of theoretically relevant big five trait or directly observed behavioral outcome in interpersonal situation the present study examines association between judgment of the 10 pd trait provided by close acquaintance self report of pd relevant big five personality trait and observed interpersonal behavior across three different three person laboratory interaction i e unstructured chat cooperative task competitive game method the sample consisted of 256 undergraduate student 130 female m age 19 83 sd 1 25 four unacquainted observer independently rated participant behavior from video recording result in line with previous work informant report of pd trait demonstrate strong convergent validity with relevant self reported big five trait a identified by lynam widiger 2001 directly observed behavior is meaningfully associated with acquaintance judgment and self report of pd relevant trait and the association between these judgment and behavior are strongest for trait associated with histrionic and schizoid pd vector correlation between behavioral profile associated with informant and self report show that both assessment have similar behavioral correlate association between pd trait rating and behavior appeared to differ a a function of gender with male showing more and stronger correlation conclusion informant rating of pd trait are impressively accurate converging both with self report of relevant trait and directly observed interpersonal behavior therefore a comprehensive understanding of pd and associated trait can be augmented by information from multiple acquaintance who have the opportunity to observe how an individual interacts with others on a daily basis across diverse context

the covid 19 pandemic ha severe consequence for physical a well a mental well being in time of restricted social contact online self help program offer a low threshold first aid to cope with the psychological burden this current study evaluates the online self help protocol covid feel good in a german sample the multicentric study wa designed a a single cohort with a waiting list control condition the convenience sample consisted of 38 german individual who experienced at least two month of restriction during the covid 19 pandemic the 7 day self help protocol included the vr video secret garden a well a a social or cognitive exercise each day general distress depression anxiety stress and hopelessness were assessed a primary outcome social connectedness and fear of coronavirus were measured a secondary outcome result showed a significant decrease in all primary outcome except for hopelessness furthermore the result indicated a significant improvement in social connectedness treatment effect on general distress depression stress and anxiety persisted for two week after participation the present study indicates that vr based self help protocol can mitigate the psychological burden associated with the pandemic supporting recent finding

emotion regulation in the ongoing presence of a threat is essential for adaptive behavior threatening situation change over time and a a consequence require a fine tuned dynamic regulation of arousal to match the current state of the environment construct such a cognitive flexibility heart rate variability and resilience have been proposed a resource for adaptive emotion regulation especially in a moment to moment fashion nevertheless none of these construct ha been empirically related to the dynamic regulation of arousal a it unfolds over the course of a prolonged threatening episode here we do so by placing participant in a threatening and evolving immersive virtual environment called room 101 while recording their skin conductance subsequently participant rated their subjective arousal continuously over the course of the experience participant who had shown greater cognitive flexibility in a separate task i e fewer task switching cost when switching to evaluating the valence of positive stimulus showed better regulation of physiological arousal skin conductance level during le threatening phase of room 101 individual with higher trait resilience and individual with higher resting heart rate variability showed more regulation in term of their subjective arousal experience the result indicate that emotional cognitive and physiological flexibility support nuanced adaptive regulation of objective and experienced arousal in the ongoing presence of threat furthermore the result indicate that these form of flexibility differentially affect automatic and objective versus reflective and subjective process

perfectionism is a multidimensional personality trait whose facet differentially relate to indicator of psychological functioning such a global self esteem there ha been some theoretical disagreement whether perfectionism affect global self esteem or vice versa this question merit renewed attention due to increasing effort to prevent the development of maladaptive perfectionism facet in adolescent in addition recent research ha indicated a role of self esteem for predicting personality development this study aimed to clarify the longitudinal relation of multidimensional perfectionism and global self esteem a sample of 707 early adolescent participated in two measurement point two year apart global self esteem positively predicted personal standard negatively predicted doubt about action and did not predict concern over mistake beyond baseline perfectionism facet did not longitudinally predict global self esteem these finding provide the first evidence for a role of global self esteem in perfectionism development addressing early adolescent self esteem may aid in preventing the development of maladaptive perfectionism facet

objective to determine a the prevalence of rome iii abdominal pain related functional gastrointestinal disorder in a western community sample of child b their association with sociodemographic factor and c whether child fulfilling rome iii abdominal pain diagnosis show higher rate of psychological distress and somatization method data were collected from parent of 6 10 year old child who were recruited from 22 public grammar school in germany a total of 1537 questionnaire were included in the analysis abdominal pain related functional gastrointestinal disorder were diagnosed on the basis of questionnaire response by rome iii criterion further somatic complaint a well a emotional and behavioral problem were assessed result in total 7 7 of child aged 6 10 year fulfilled the criterion for at least one rome iii abdominal pain related functional gastrointestinal disorder according to their parent the most prevalent diagnosis were irritable bowel syndrome 4 9 and functional abdominal pain 2 0 assigned diagnosis were not associated with sociodemographic factor we could confirm that abdominal pain related functional disorder especially irritable bowel syndrome were strongly associated with somatization and emotional problem in community conclusion rome iii abdominal pain related functional gastrointestinal disorder are a common health problem in child and are even in community strongly associated with other somatic complaint and psychological distress

purpose orthorexia nervosa is defined a the fixation on health conscious eating behaviour and ha recently been discussed a a new variant of disordered eating the aim of the present study wa to analyse orthorexic eating behaviour in an inpatient treatment sample of female anorexic to investigate the relation between anorexic and orthorexic eating behaviour method female anorexic patient with low n 29 and pronounced n 13 orthorexic eating behaviour a well a a matched control group composed of healthy female n 30 were compared with regard to several aspect of disordered eating hypochondriacal trait food consumption frequency and fulfilment of basic psychological need in term of eating orthorexic eating behaviour wa assessed using the dusseldorfer orthorexie skala result fulfilment of basic psychological need with respect to autonomy and competence is higher in anorexic individual with pronounced orthorexic eating behaviour compared to patient with low orthorexic eating behaviour furthermore patient with pronounced orthorexic eating behaviour state eating healthy food regardless of calorie content more often no difference wa found for hypochondriacal trait and eating disordered symptom in general conclusion orthorexic eating behaviour enhances self perception of eating behaviour a autonomous and competent indicating that it might serve a a coping strategy in anorexic individual further research is needed to investigate if this tendency in food selection strategy lead to positive effect in the long term

avoidance habit potentially contribute to maintaining maladaptive costly avoidance behavior that persist in the absence of threat however experimental evidence about costly habitual avoidance is scarce in two experiment we tested whether extensively trained avoidance impairs the subsequent goal directed approach of reward healthy participant were extensively trained to avoid an aversive outcome by performing simple response to distinct full screen color stimulus after the subsequent devaluation of the aversive outcome participant received monetary reward for correct response to neutral object picture which were presented on top of the same full screen color these approach response were either compatible or incompatible with habitual avoidance response notably the full screen color were not relevant to inform approach response in experiment 1 participant were not instructed about post devaluation stimulus response reward contingency accuracy wa lower in habit incompatible than in habit compatible trial indicating costly avoidance whereas reaction time did not differ in experiment 2 contingency were explicitly instructed accuracy difference disappeared but reaction time were slower in habit incompatible than in habit compatible trial indicating low cost habitual avoidance tendency these finding suggest a small but consistent impact of habitual avoidance tendency on subsequent goal directed approach costly habitual responding could however be inhibited when competing goal directed approach wa easily realizable

suicidal ideation is a major risk factor for suicidal behavior and ha recently been shown to be fluctuating in study applying ecological momentary assessment emas the aim of this study are to introduce a reliable and valid item set for assessing suicidal ideation and relevant proximal risk factor that can be used in future ema study within suicidology additionally we provide data on the ability of the item to capture moment to moment variability and discus feasibility aspect of ema study on suicidal ideation in a clinical sample psychiatric inpatient diagnosed with a depressive disorder n 74 rated a set of 28 item measuring suicidal ideation thwarted belongingness perceived burdensomeness depression anxiety hopelessness and positive affect 10 time per day on 6 consecutive day in addition these construct were assessed by self report questionnaire before and after the ema period intraclass correlation and mean squared successive difference were calculated a indicator of item variability reliability wa calculated at the prompt within person and the person between person level applying an approach based on multilevel factor analysis convergent validity wa assessed by correlating the ema score with a self report questionnaire measuring the same construct all item demonstrated moment to moment variability and substantial within person variance moreover all item and scale except those assessing anxiety showed satisfying reliability at the prompt and the person level and correlation indicated convergent validity of the ema item set compliance with the emas wa excellent 89 7 researcher are encouraged to apply this useful tool in future ema study in the field of suicidology psycinfo database record c 2018 apa all right reserved

what we see is the result of an efficient selection of cue in the visual stream in addition to physical characteristic this process is also influenced by emotional salience of the cue previously we showed in spider phobic patient that fear related picture gain preferential access to consciousness in binocular rivalry we set out to replicate this in an independent unselected sample and examine the relationship of this perceptual bias with a range of symptom cluster to this end we recruited 79 participant with variable degree of fear of spider to induce binocular rivalry a picture of either a spider or a flower wa projected to one eye and a neutral geometric pattern to the other eye participant continuously reported what they saw we correlated index of perceptual dominance first percept dominance duration with individual fear of spider and with score on specific symptom cluster of fear of spider i e vigilance fixation and avoidance coping overall higher fear of spider correlate with more predominace of spider picture in addition this perceptual bias is uniquely associated with avoidance coping interestingly this demonstrates that a perceptual bias which is not intentionally controlled is linked with an instrumental coping behavior that ha been implicated in the maintenance of pathological fear

background chronic depression is characterized by a high degree of early life trauma psychosocial impairment and deficit in social cognition undisturbed recognition and processing of facial emotion are basic prerequisite for smooth social interaction intranasal application of the neuropeptide oxytocin ha been reported to enhance emotion recognition in neuropsychiatric disorder and healthy individual we therefore investigated whether oxytocin modulates attention to emotional face in patient with chronic depression method in this double blind randomized controlled study 43 patient received a single dose of oxytocin or placebo nasal spray and were tested while fulfilling a facial dot probe task we assessed reaction time to neutral probe presented at the location of one of two face depicting happy angry or neutral expression a a prime result when comparing reaction time to the congruent prime and probe at the same location with incongruent presentation of facial emotion neither the placebo nor oxytocin group showed an attentional preference for emotional facial expression in term of a threat bias however oxytocin treatment did reveal two specific effect it generally reduced the allocation of attention towards angry facial expression and it increased sustained attention towards happy face specifically under condition of heightened awareness i e trial with longer prime conclusion we investigated a heterogeneous group of medicated male and female patient we conclude that oxytocin doe modulate basic factor of facial emotion processing in chronic depression our finding encourage further investigation assessing the therapeutic potential of oxytocin in chronic depression trial registration eudra ct 2010 020956 69 date registered 23 february 2011

purpose although anecdotal report suggest a relation between orthorexic eating behavior and symptom of somatoform disorder this issue ha not yet been investigated the aim of this study wa to compare orthorexic eating behavior and other characteristic of disordered eating behavior in patient with somatoform disorder to a sample of healthy control method 31 patient with somatoform disorder and 30 matched control completed eight questionnaire i a the dusseldorf orthorexia scale three scale of the eating disorder inventory 2 eating attitude test 26 multidimensional inventory of hypochondriacal trait attitude towards body and health questionnaire and screening for somatoform disorder result the patient displayed higher level of orthorexic eating behavior drive for thinness body dissatisfaction bulimia and dieting than the control group in both group orthorexic eating behavior wa associated with higher level of somatization in eating and health habit the control group showed an association of orthorexic eating behavior with catastrophizing cognition and the perceptual component of health anxiety conclusion the result support the hypothesis of a connection between orthorexic eating behavior and somatoform disorder however patient with somatoform disorder do not seem to be at particular risk for orthorexia future study should investigate cause for the relationship between orthorexic eating behavior and characteristic of somatoform disorder in sample of healthy individual level of evidence level v descriptive study with matched control group

this study explored the facebook addiction disorder fad in germany of the 520 participant 6 2 percent reached the critical polythetic cutoff score and 2 5 percent reached the critical monothetic cutoff score fad wa significantly positively related to facebook use frequency the personality trait narcissism a well a depression and anxiety symptom but also to subjective happiness it association with resilience wa significantly negative furthermore facebook use frequency partly mediated the positive relationship between narcissism and fad current result provide a first overview of fad in germany they demonstrate that fad is not only the consequence of excessive facebook use the positive relationship between fad and happiness contributes to the understanding of the mechanism that are involved in the development and maintenance of fad and partly explains earlier inconsistency practical application for future study and limitation of present result are discussed

introduction deficit in social skill can be an important modulating factor in the development and progress of various mental disorder however limited resource in inpatient care often impede effective social skill training this study investigates the feasibility of a blended group training for social skill sst in an inpatient psychiatric setting method and analysis for this one group pretest posttest trial inpatient with a diagnosed mental disorder were recruited participation in the blended sst lasted four week and took place within usual inpatient psychiatric care the blended intervention comprised four face to face group session and three complementary online module within four week assessment took place before t1 and after t2 the training feasibility outcome use acceptance satisfaction implementability into usual psychiatric inpatient care and effectiveness outcome regarding social skill were assessed result n 15 participant were recruited most patient completed all questionnaire 93 and all module of the blended sst concept 60 all participant 100 would recommend the blended intervention to a friend regarding social skill exploratory analysis revealed a non significant medium sized effect cohen s d 0 5 95 ci 0 3 to 1 25 p 0 08 discussion this trial show that a blended care sst is feasible for the use in acute psychiatric inpatient care setting although the ward were acute with high turnover and change of inpatient 60 of participant were treated per protocol over four week overall the evidence on blended care concept in psychiatric care setting is extremely poor to date hence this trial should encourage intensified blended inpatient psychiatric care research

aim to develop a psychometric measure of diabetes acceptance method an item pool wa developed and pilot tested using a sample of 220 people with diabetes item selection resulted in the 20 item diabetes acceptance scale da 606 people with diabetes were then cross sectionally assessed with the da to evaluate it reliability validity and clinical utility concurrent measurement included diabetes related coping fqci diabetes distress paid 5 depressive symptom phq 9 quality of life eq 5d self management dsmq glycaemic control hba 1c and complication result internal reliability wa high cronbach s alpha 0 96 factorial and criterion related result supported validity higher diabetes acceptance score correlated with more functional coping style lower distress and depression level higher treatment adherence better glycaemic control and better quality of life all p 001 person with low diabetes acceptance 22 of the sample were four time more likely to have hba 1c value over 9 0 75 mmol mol two time more likely to be diagnosed with long term complication and each over two time more likely to have had episode of severe hypoglycaemia and ketoacidosis in the past year the prevalence of major depression in this group wa fivefold increased all p 05 conclusion the da is a reliable and valid tool to measure diabetes acceptance it may help identify patient with significant problem of accepting diabetes a putative high risk group in need of tailored care and support

abstract theoretical background the covid 19 pandemic ha changed the daily life of student completely study indicated that psychology student may be le stressed during the pandemic than other student this study compare psychology student and student from other discipline regarding their mental health alcohol consumption and partnership after the third wave of the covid 19 pandemic method the study sample consisted of n 127 psychology student and n 579 student from other discipline at the tu braunschweig in germany who participated in an online survey in june july of 2021 to analyze the difference between the psychology student and student from other discipline after the third wave we calculated t test chi² test and u test separately for female and male student result significantly fewer female psychology student were above the cut off value for clinically relevant depressive symptom 31 5 p lt 001 cramer s v 32 and anxiety symptom 22 2 p lt 001 cramer s v 27 than other female student depressive symptom 66 1 anxiety symptom 41 9 the small sample of male psychology student showed similar tendency while female psychology student rated their general health and life satisfaction higher than other female student male psychology student were le concerned about their professional future than their respective counterpart no difference were found concerning alcohol consumption and partnership conclusion we found indication that psychology student especially female student are le psychologically distressed after the third wave than student from other discipline better mental health knowledge could be an explanation for this

background dysfunctional expectation are considered to be core feature of mental disorder and in particular major depression the aim of the present study wa to integrate two important type of expectation into the cognitive model of depression situation specific dysfunctional expectation sde and dispositional optimism do it wa hypothesized that the influence of both do and intermediate belief ib on depressive symptom would be mediated via sde method we examined 95 individual age m 40 7 68 1 female with a diagnosed major depressive disorder from two inpatient clinic and one outpatient clinic measurement used in the study included the depressive expectation scale dysfunctional attitude scale life orientation test revised and beck s depression inventory ii relationship between the construct were analyzed using path analytic model with bias corrected bootstrapping confidence interval result result indicate that the effect of ib on depressive symptom wa fully mediated via sde while the effect of do on depressive symptom wa partly mediated via sde ib and do moderately correlated with each other limitation due to the cross sectional design of the study it is not possible to draw unambiguous conclusion regarding the causality of the suggested relationship conclusion the present study stress the crucial role of dysfunctional expectation for major depression moreover it reveals that sdes a expectation with a high level of situational specificity may pose an important link between global cognition and depressive symptom given this situational specificity sdes are amenable to disconfirmation through behavioral experiment and may therefore be a promising target for cognitive behavioral intervention

this article present the development and the preliminary validation of the sport competition rumination scale scrs the scrs is designed to measure ruminative thought referring to competition related problem in athlete it is an adapted version of an existing rumination scale in which we have changed the context for sport specific purpose the scrs consists of eight item which capture key characteristic of rumination e g repetitiveness intrusiveness in the competitive context in two study we investigated it construct validity in term of it factorial validity and it position within a nomological network data collected from 355 athlete nstudy1 157 nstudy2 198 revealed a good factorial validity for the scale across sample the scrs showed a good internal consistency moreover moderate relation to established rumination measure from clinical and general psychology supported it position in the nomological network in addition the scrs showed low to moderate relation to different general a well a sport specific anxiety measure the present study provides an important preliminary evidence for a useful reliable and ecological measure of rumination about competition related problem lay summary repetitive and intrusive thought rumination are a prominent topic in psychology due to the strong relation to depression individual well being and various performance parameter however little research ha focused on rumination in the context of sport here we describe the development of a sport specific rumination measure for the competitive context implication for practicethe scrs is a questionnaire to tap repetitive intrusive thought related to competition the scrs is a reliable and easy to complete measure which help to track performance limiting thought

rationale this study aimed to test how expectation and anxiety sensitivity influence respiratory and autonomic response to caffeine objective the current study investigated the effect of expected v unexpected caffeine ingestion in a group of person prone to the anxiety provoking effect of caffeine high anxiety sensitive person that is person scoring at least one sd above the mean on the anxiety sensitivity index peterson and reiss 1992 a compared to low anxious control method autonomic arousal heart rate skin conductance level respiratory responding expired co2 minute ventilation and subjective report were assessed in high and low anxiety sensitive participant immediately after beverage consumption and at absorption peak 30 min post consumption in four separate session during which either coffee expectation of caffeine or bitter lemon soda no expectation of caffeine wa crossed with 4 mg kg caffeine v no drug result high and low anxiety sensitive person showed comparable autonomic arousal and symptom report to caffeine which wa modulated by expectation i e greater for coffee respiratory responding co2 decrease minute ventilation increase wa more accentuated when caffeine wa both expected and administered in the low anxiety sensitive group but more accentuated when caffeine wa unexpectedly administered in the high anxiety sensitive group autonomic arousal and respiratory effect were observable within a few minute after caffeine administration and were most pronounced at maximum absorption conclusion the result highlight the modulating role of expectancy in respiratory responding to caffeine in low v high anxiety sensitive person and might have important implication for the better understanding of unexpected panic attack

generalization of fear is considered an important mechanism contributing to the etiology and maintenance of anxiety disorder although previous study have identified the importance of stimulus discrimination for fear generalization it is still unclear to what degree overt attention to relevant stimulus feature might mediate it magnitude to test the prediction that visual preference for distinguishing stimulus aspect are associated with reduced fear generalization we developed a set of facial stimulus that wa meticulously manipulated such that pair of face could either be distinguished by looking into the eye or into the region around mouth and nose respectively these pair were then employed a c and c in a differential fear conditioning paradigm followed by a generalization test with morphs in step of 20 shock expectancy rating indicated a moderately curved fear generalization gradient that is typical for healthy sample but it shape wa altered depending on individual attentional deployment particpants who dwelled on the distinguishing facial feature faster and for longer period of time exhibited le fear generalization although both pupil and heart rate response also showed a generalization gradient with pupil diameter and heart rate deceleration increasing a a function of threat these response were not significantly related to visual exploration in total the current result indicate that the extent of explicit fear generalization depends on individual pattern of attentional deployment future study evaluating the efficacy of perceptual training that aim to augment stimulus discriminability in order to reduce over generalization seem desirable psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

deficient self control lead to shortsighted decision and incurs severe personal and societal cost although neuroimaging ha advanced our understanding of neural mechanism underlying self control the ecological validity of laboratory task used to ass self control remains largely unknown to increase ecological validity and to test a specific hypothesis about the mechanism underlying real life self control we combined functional mri during value based decision making with smartphone based assessment of real life self control in a large community sample n 194 result showed that an increased propensity to make shortsighted decision and commit self control failure both in the laboratory task a well a during real life conflict wa associated with a reduced modulation of neural value signal in the ventromedial prefrontal cortex in response to anticipated long term consequence these result constitute the first evidence that neural mechanism mediating anticipation of future consequence not only account for self control in laboratory task but also predict real life self control thereby bridging the gap between laboratory research and real life behavior

background woman who belong to the age group emerging adulthood 18 to 29 year are vulnerable to mental health issue and suicide related outcome objective this study investigated potential predictor of suicide related outcome in female emerging adulthood and compared them to older woman design and method data of 2537 woman from russia group 18 to 29 year n 1123 group 29 year n 1414 on lifetime suicide related outcome problematic social medium use daily stress depression and anxiety symptom and positive mental health were assessed via online cross sectional survey result the younger group spent significantly more time on social medium use than the older group it had significantly higher level of daily stress problematic social medium use depression and anxiety symptom and suicide related outcome the older group showed significantly higher level of positive mental health only in the younger group problematic social medium use significantly mediated the relationship between daily stress and suicide related outcome in a moderated mediation analysis positive mental health significantly moderated the association between problematic social medium use and suicide related outcome specifically the higher the positive mental health level the le close the link between both variable conclusion the current result reveal that young woman in russia could be at enhanced risk for daily stress problematic social medium use and low level of mental health the interaction between these variable could foster suicide related outcome public governmental communication in russia should call attention to potential negative impact of intensive social medium use

objective individual with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd often suffer from impairment in social functioning this study investigates difference in empathy compassion and theory of mind tom in individual with ocd a a possible cause for social functioning deficit design sixty four individual diagnosed with ocd and 62 healthy individual completed a naturalistic behavioural task empatom and a self report measure interpersonal reactivity index iri method three preregistered repeated measure analysis of variance anova result people with ocd exhibited higher empathy level namely increased sharing of others suffering in the empatom task and reported more distress iri compared with healthy individual furthermore no difference in compassion empatom between both group emerged although people with ocd reported more concern for others iri compared with healthy individual concerning the tom no group difference were detected neither in the behavioural task nor self report conclusion by investigating ocd with diverse scientific practice we shed light on the higher level of empathy exhibited by individual with ocd which are relevant for clinical practice and our understanding of ocd symptomatology practitioner point people with obsessive compulsive disorder show higher level of empathy that is the increased sharing of others suffering compared with healthy individual in both a traditional self report and a naturalistic task regarding compassion that is caring for others their self reported compassion wa higher in people with ocd in theory of mind that is cognitively understanding the situation of another person no difference have been found neither at self report nor in a naturalistic task compared with healthy individual independent of traditional intervention it could prove useful to improve emotion regulation skill so people with ocd learn to cope with empathic distress furthermore it might strengthen the treatment gain and lower dropout rate if the social mind and consequently social relationship become a topic in the treatment and prevention of ocd
