objective having access to bodily signal is known to be crucial for differentiating the self from others and coping with negative feeling the interplay between bodily and emotional process develops in adolescence where vulnerability is high a negative affect state often occur that could hamper the integration of bodily input into the self aim of the present study in healthy adolescent wa to examine whether a disturbed emotional awareness described by the alexithymic construct could trigger a higher malleability in the sense of body ownership method fifty four healthy adolescent aged between 12 to 17 year participated in this study the strength and difficulty questionnaire sdq and the screening psychischer storungen im jugendalter were used to ass emotional distress and conduct problem alexithymia wa assessed by the ta 20 the rubber hand illusion wa implemented for examining the malleability of body ownership result a higher body illusion wa found to be connected with difficulty in describing feeling moreover a higher degree of self reported conduct and emotional problem a assessed by the sdq were associated with a more pronounced body illusion further finding revealed an association between emotional distress and the emotional alexithymia subscales difficulty in identifying feeling and difficulty in describing feeling conclusion our finding emphasize a close link between the sense of body ownership and emotional awareness a assessed by emotional facet of the alexithymic trait we suggest that in adolescent with higher malleability of body ownership a vicious circle might occur where affect and integration of different proprioceptive signal regarding the body become more entangled

although memory of past experience is crucial for the ability to transfer knowledge to new situation surprisingly little research ha directly investigated the relationship between memory and generalization the present study sought to investigate how the perceptual memory of a trained stimulus influence generalization to similar stimulus forty participant underwent a fear conditioning procedure on day 1 and separate memory recall and generalization test on day 2 we focused on two aspect of perceptual memory namely memory bias i e over or underestimation of stimulus magnitude and uncertainty we found that memory bias predicted the pattern of generalized self reported expectancy rating and psychophysiological response fear potentiated startle response memory uncertainty wa measured in two way self reported uncertainty rating and variability in stimulus recall we found that higher level of self reported memory uncertainty corresponded with a broader generalization gradient on u expectancy while greater variability in memory recall wa associated with a broader generalization gradient on fear potentiated startle response taken together our finding suggest that memory is an important determinant of generalized behavior and illustrate the need to account for these interindividual difference in perceptual memory when examining the generalization of learned response

background suicide specific rumination ha been shown to be associated with lifetime suicide attempt a well a suicide intent and might be an important risk factor for the transition from suicidal ideation to suicidal behavior based on this background the wording of the item of an often used self report measure assessing core characteristic of rumination wa adapted to ass specifically suicide specific rumination method the entire study sample comprised n 1689 participant from the german healthcare sector a total of 721 participant with a history of suicidal ideation 68 female m age 30 63 sd age 8 41 range 18 81 year who had completed five measure assessing suicide specific rumination suicidal ideation depression hopelessness and resilience were included for the present examination factorial validity exploratory efa to determine the appropriate number of factor and confirmatory factor analysis cfa after randomly splitting of the sample to validate the efa solution construct validity and reliability were evaluated result the efa revealed a one factor solution consisting of four item which could be confirmed within a cfa rmsr 0 006 rmsea 0 039 cfi 0 999 tli 0 998 internal consistency wa excellent with cronbachs alpha 0 93 construct validity wa given with moderate to high positive correlation with suicidal ideation 0 76 depression 0 55 and hopelessness 0 38 and negative correlation with resilience 0 31 participant with recent suicidal ideation and or lifetime suicide attempt reported significantly more suicide specific rumination than those with only lifetime suicidal ideation conclusion a new 4 item measure for suicide specific rumination wa developed and could be shown to be a reliable and valid instrument in a large german sample result emphasize the potential importance of suicide specific rumination for the understanding of trajectory of suicidal ideation and suicide risk assessment

background research ha revealed that negative expectation impact depressive symptom however research on the change of dysfunctional expectation in depression is lacking so far therefore the present research aimed to fill this gap by testing the hypothesis that people with the major depressive disorder mdd contrary to healthy individual maintain their expectation despite experience that positively disconfirm expectation further it wa hypothesized that cognitive immunization a cognitive reappraisal of the disconfirming evidence is a mechanism underlying the persistence of expectation method in study 1 we compared individual with mdd n 58 to healthy individual n 59 participant worked on the same performance test and received standardized feedback that either confirmed or disconfirmed their initial performance expectation in study 2 we investigated the effect of cognitive immunization on expectation change among 59 individual reporting elevated level of depression by varying the appraisal of expectation disconfirming feedback result result from study 1 show that in the expectation disconfirming condition healthy individual changed their expectation whereas individual with mdd did not no such difference between the two group wa found for expectation confirming feedback result from study 2 indicated that varying cognitive immunization impacted expectation change thus suggesting a crucial role of cognitive immunization in expectation change conclusion these two study indicated that individual suffering from depression have more difficulty in changing their expectation after disconfirming experience than do healthy individual and cognitive immunization might be a core mechanism underlying expectation persistence therefore psychotherapeutic intervention should aim to inhibit cognitive immunization process to enhance expectation change

stage of change could be driving force to activate the realization of therapeutic factor and symptom change consequently the aim of the present study were to investigate whether the stage of change concept is valid in group therapy setting shown by factor analysis internal consistency and criterion validity a total of 377 patient completed measure of stage of change symptom change and therapeutic factor a confirmatory factor analysis replicated the stage of change factor for group therapy related to the criterion validity stage of change demonstrated only low non significant association with symptom change but some stage of change were significant predictor of certain therapeutic factor further research is needed to explore whether a stronger focus on motivational stage of change could help to intensify the realization of therapeutic factor in group therapy

objective transportation of good on railway is increasing and the majority of the increased number of freight train run during the night transportation noise ha adverse effect on sleep structure affect the heart rate hr during sleep and may be linked to cardiovascular disease freight train also generate vibration and little is known regarding the impact of vibration on human sleep a laboratory study wa conducted to examine how a realistic nocturnal railway traffic scenario influence hr during sleep design case control setting healthy participant participant 24 healthy volunteer 11 men 13 woman 19 28 year spent six consecutive night in the sleep laboratory intervention all participant slept during one habituation night one control and four experimental night in which train noise and vibration were reproduced in the experimental night 20 or 36 train with low vibration or high vibration characteristic were presented primary and secondary outcome measure polysomnographical data and ecg were recorded result the train exposure led to a significant change of hr within 1 min of exposure onset p 0 002 characterised by an initial and a delayed increase of hr the high vibration condition provoked an average increase of at least 3 bpm per train in 79 of the participant cardiac response were in general higher in the high vibration condition than in the low vibration condition p 0 006 no significant effect of noise sensitivity and gender wa revealed although there wa a tendency for men to exhibit stronger hr acceleration than woman conclusion freight train provoke hr acceleration during sleep and the vibration characteristic of the train are of special importance in the long term this may affect cardiovascular functioning of person living close to railway

vulnerable narcissism and grandiose narcissism share the core of the narcissistic self but are considered a separate form of this personality trait while previous research mainly focused on the mechanism that connect grandiose narcissism and addictive use of the social platform facebook it remained unclear why individual with enhanced level of vulnerable narcissism are at risk to develop facebook addiction fa the present study investigated the link between vulnerable and grandiose narcissism anxiety symptom and fa in a sample of 327 facebook user age m sd 23 67 3 96 range 18 56 both form of narcissism were positively related to anxiety symptom and fa moreover the association between both form of narcissism and fa wa partly mediated by anxiety symptom result enter new territory by revealing hidden similarity between vulnerable and grandiose narcissist emphasizing that similar mechanism might explain their enhanced risk to develop addictive tendency of facebook use these finding should be considered when assessing individual at risk for fa and when developing therapeutic intervention program to deal with problematic use of social platform

objective spirit possession is a phenomenon frequently occurring in war torn country it ha been shown to be an idiom of distress entailing dissociative symptom however it association with trauma exposure and trauma related disorder remains unclear this study aimed to explore subjective disease model and the relationship between pathological spirit possession and trauma related disorder in the eastern democratic republic of the congo method seventy three formerly possessed person 74 female mean age 34 year referred by traditional and spiritual healer were interviewed about their experience of pathological spirit possession trauma exposure posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd symptom depressive symptom shame and guilt psychotic symptom somatic complaint and the impairment of psychosocial functioning result the most common disease model for pathological spirit possession wa another person having sent the spirit mostly a family member or a neighbor out of jealousy or conflict over resource significant correlation were found between spirit possession over lifetime and ptsd symptom severity feeling of shame and guilt depressive symptom somatic complaint and psychotic symptom spirit possession during the preceding 4 week wa associated with ptsd symptom severity impairment of psychosocial functioning and psychotic symptom severity conclusion the result of this study indicate that pathological spirit possession is a broad explanatory framework for various subjectively unexplainable mental and physical health problem including but not limited to trauma related disorder understanding pathological spirit possession a a subjective disease model for various mental and physical health problem may help researcher and clinician to develop culturally sensitive treatment approach for affected individual psycinfo database record

background there have been numerous study investigating the relationship between nonsuicidal self injury nssi and suicidality on the one side nssi is an important risk factor for suicidality including suicidal thought and behavior on the other side it ha been suggested that one function of nssi might be a a coping mechanism that can help individual in the short term avoid suicide the present study investigated the relationship between suicidality and nssi in female inpatient adolescent focusing on nssi a an anti suicide strategy method subject were 56 female adolescent aged 12 18 year m 15 95 year sd 1 27 recruited from different inpatient child and adolescent psychiatric unit all participant fulfilled the dsm 5 research criterion for nonsuicidal self injury disorder nssi d to ass suicidality nssi d and current and past diagnosis a structured clinical interview wa conducted result nssi a a short term coping strategy for avoiding suicide wa indicated by one third 32 1 of the participant before participant engaged in nssi the anti suicide function wa reported more frequently than reducing interpersonal problem d 59 getting relief from negative emotion and inducing positive feeling were reported at the same frequency a avoiding suicide before nssi participant engaging in nssi to avoid suicide and those reporting other function did not significantly differ regarding other nssi characteristic suicidality or psychopathology result indicate that the anti suicide function significantly predicts the duration of current suicidal ideation beta 557 conclusion this study provides preliminary support for the idea that nssi is frequently used by female adolescent with nssi d to avoid suicide given the high co occurrence of nssi and suicidality our result underline the importance of clinical assessment of suicidality and several nssi function including the anti suicide function in adolescent with nssi

the present study examines a broad range of longitudinal predictor of dimensional positive mental health pmh and negative mental health nmh using data from the boom study participant were drawn from university student sample in germany 1 608 russia 677 and china 12 057 a structural equation model wa conducted with four group of predictor and pmh nmh a criterion outcome five of the six salutogenic predictor were predictive of both positive mental health positively and negative mental health a measured by depression negatively pathogenic predictor anxiety and depression were related to future depression but not to positive mental health stress at baseline wa related to both future positive mental health negatively and future depression positively being male in this study wa associated with increased future depression result hold across germany russia and china result support the conceptualization of positive and negative mental health a related but independent dimension across three culture

human neuroimaging research suggests the existence of one core network for the subjective valuation of reward including the striatum and orbitofrontal cortex however there is little research on the neural representation of subjective reward value of visual sexual stimulus v and on the role of these subjective valuation in the development of related addictive behavior here we investigate how neural reactivity to v is connected to individual preference using functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri during the fmri scan 72 men viewed different v film clip rating regarding valence and sexual arousal were collected and used a parametric modulators in the fmri analysis subject also filled out questionnaire on self reported symptom of problematic pornography use ppu firstly we found that neural reactivity towards v clip in the nucleus accumbens caudate nucleus and orbitofrontal cortex wa positively correlated with individual rating of the respective v in all subject second the strength of the association between neural activity and sexual arousal rating wa positively correlated with self reported symptom of ppu the first result suggests a precise appraisal of v according to individual preference in established reward valuation region secondly stronger neural differentiation based on preference in participant with more ppu symptom indicates an increased importance of v preference fit in these individual this heightened correspondence between individual liking and neural activity may facilitate ppu development by increased signaling of incentive salience thus boosting motivation to seek out and respond to these preferred stimulus

to date only little is known about the self directed perception and processing of subtle gaze cue in social anxiety that might however contribute to excessive feeling of being looked at by others using a web based approach participant n 174 were asked whether or not briefly 300 m presented facial expression modulated in gaze direction 0 degree 2 degree 4 degree 6 degree 8 degree and valence angry fearful happy neutral were directed at them the result demonstrate a positive linear relationship between self reported social anxiety and stronger self directed perception of others gaze direction particularly for negative angry fearful and neutral expression furthermore faster responding wa found for gaze more clearly directed at socially anxious individual 0 degree 2 degree and 4 degree suggesting a tendency to avoid direct gaze in sum the result illustrate an altered self directed perception of subtle gaze cue the possibly amplifying effect of social stress on biased self directed perception of eye gaze are discussed

background primary care physician pcp play a crucial role for guideline oriented intervention in patient with depression objective based on a diagnostic screening questionnaire this study investigates the sensitivity of pcp to recognize patient with depression a well a the factor facilitating recognition and concordant diagnostic decision method in a cross sectional epidemiological study in six region of germany 3563 unselected patient filled in questionnaire on mental and physical complaint and were diagnostically evaluated by their pcp n 253 the patient report on an established depression screening questionnaire dsq which allows the approximate derivation of an icd 10 depression diagnosis were compared with the physician diagnosis n 3211 in a subsample of discordant case a comprehensive standardized clinical diagnostic interview dia x cidi wa applied result on the study day the prevalence of icd 10 depression wa 14 3 according to the dsq and 10 7 according to the physician diagnosis half of the patient identified by dsq were diagnosed with depression by their physician and two third were recognized a mental disorder case more severe depression symptomatology and the persistent presence of main depression symptom were related to better recognition and concordant diagnostic decision diagnostic validation interview confirmed the dsq diagnosis in the majority of the false negative case indication for at least a previous history of depression were found in up to 70 of false positive case conclusion given the high prevalence of depression in primary care patient there is continued need to improve the recognition and diagnosis of these patient to assure guideline oriented treatment

in their line of duty emergency medical service em personnel are exposed to chronically stressful working condition and recurrent traumatic event which increase their risk for detrimental health outcome here we investigated whether this risk is due to altered regulation of the hypothalamus pituitary adrenal hpa axis and the endocannabinoid system therefore 1 cm hair strand were collected from a cohort of 72 german em personnel in order to measure concentration of cortisol endocannabinoids i e anandamide aea 2 arachidonoylglycerol 2 ag and n acylethanolamines i e stearoylethanolamide sea oleoylethanolamide oea and palmitoylethanolamide pea rank correlation analysis were conducted to test association of cortisol endocannabinoid and n acylethanolamine concentration with the em personnel s workload lifetime trauma exposure and mental and physical health problem we found a negative correlation between cortisol and 2 ag concentration in hair higher hair cortisol wa associated with higher workload reported traumatic stress during childhood and later in life a well a more severe depressive and physical stress symptom were associated with elevated 2 ag sea oea and pea concentration future longitudinal research need to address the prospect of tracing biomolecular marker of glucocorticoid endocannabinoid and n acylethanolamine activity a a predicting value of the long term course of mental and physical well being

background childhood attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd ha been associated with childhood and adult obesity and stimulant use with delayed childhood growth but the independent influence are unclear no longitudinal study have examined association of adhd diagnosis and stimulant use on bmi trajectory throughout childhood and adolescence method we used longitudinal electronic health record data from the geisinger health system on 163 820 child age 3 to 18 year in pennsylvania random effect linear regression model were used to model bmi trajectory with increasing age in relation to adhd diagnosis age at first stimulant use and stimulant use duration while controlling for confounding variable result mean sd age at first bmi wa 8 9 5 0 year and child provided a mean sd of 3 2 2 4 annual bmi measurement on average bmi trajectory showed a curvilinear relation with age there were consistent association of unmedicated adhd with higher bmi during childhood compared with those without adhd or stimulant younger age at first stimulant use and longer duration of stimulant use were each associated with slower bmi growth earlier in childhood but a more rapid rebound to higher bmi in late adolescence conclusion the study provides the first longitudinal evidence that adhd during childhood not treated with stimulant wa associated with higher childhood bmi in contrast adhd treated with stimulant wa associated with slower early bmi growth but a rebound later in adolescence to level above child without a history of adhd or stimulant use the finding have important clinical and neurobiological implication

a deficit in emotion regulation is thought to be a a trans diagnostic factor of mental disorder canadian and german clinical sample completed several self report measure including the emotional dysregulation scale multi group confirmatory factor analysis indicated at least partial measurement invariance psychometric property were found to be appropriate and result can be compared cross nationally a deficit in emotion regulation is thought to be a trans diagnostic factor of several mental disorder and is mostly assessed by using self report measure comparing value and result cross nationally presupposes that these score are based on the invariance of psychometric property the present study aim to compare the psychometric property and the factorial invariance of the emotional dysregulation scale ed scale cross nationally analysis were based on data of treatment seeking canadian and german clinical sample n 144 n 115 they were diagnosed using structured clinical interview and completed self report measure we calculated reliability and validity index in order to determine the factorial invariance configural metric scalar and residual invariance we conducted several multi group confirmatory factor analysis for both sample cronbach s α s proved to be excellent convergent divergent and discriminant validity were supported comparing increasingly stringent model test of measurement invariance indicated at least partial measurement invariance these finding suggest that the ed scale operates in a similar fashion among english and german speaking clinical sample therefore we conclude that the psychometric property of the ed scale are appropriate and that result can be compared cross nationally future research should examine the measurement invariance in different culture and ethnic minority group

this study investigates the interpretative bias in spider phobia with respect to rapid visuomotor processing we compared perception evaluation and visuomotor processing of ambiguous schematic stimulus between spider fearful and control participant stimulus were produced by gradually morphing schematic flower into spider participant rated these stimulus related to their perceptual appearance and to their feeling of valence disgust and arousal also they responded to the same stimulus within a response priming paradigm that measure rapid motor activation spider fearful individual showed an interpretative bias i e ambiguous stimulus were perceived a more similar to spider and rated spider like stimulus a more unpleasant disgusting and arousing however we observed no difference between spider fearful and control participant in priming effect for ambiguous stimulus for non ambiguous stimulus we observed a similar enhancement for phobic picture a ha been reported previously for natural image we discus our finding with respect to the visual representation of morphed stimulus and to perceptual learning process

according to psychodynamic and cognitive model of obsessive compulsive disorder ocd anger and aggression play an important role in the development and maintenance of the disorder sub clinical sample with ocd have reported higher anger and anger suppression patient with checking related symptom of ocd showed a le aggressive self concept a assessed by an implicit association test iat this study assessed anger and aggressiveness self concept in ocd a well a possible mediator of the link between ocd and aggressiveness a total of 48 patient with ocd and 45 healthy control were included measure included the state trait anger expression inventory ii and an aggressiveness self concept iat agg iat an inflated sense of responsibility non acceptance of emotion and social desirability were tested a mediator a expected patient with ocd reported higher trait anger and anger suppression compared to healthy control contrary to hypothesis the aggressiveness self concept agg iat did not differ between group the inflated sense of responsibility mediated the relationship between group and anger suppression non acceptance of negative emotion mediated the relationship between group and trait anger a well a anger suppression however comorbidities and medication may account for some effect in anger suppression elevated trait anger and anger suppression in ocd patient could be explained by dysfunctional belief or maladaptive emotion regulation strategy emotion regulation therapy might help to enhance awareness and acceptance of emotion and possibly improve treatment outcome

maladaptability particularly of autonomic activity is described a a central component of vulnerability stress model for the pathogenesis of psychotic symptom investigating heart rate variability hrv a an index of autonomic adaptability is thus likely to improve our understanding of psychosis in clinically vulnerable group for psychosis it is unclear whether maladaptability is already evident moreover to investigate specificity direct comparison to other mental disorder are required in the present study we analyzed 3 min of resting state heart rate hrv and negative affect in 130 participant consisting of participant with psychotic disorder psy n 44 clinical high risk for psychosis chr n 22 anxiety disorder anxiety control ac n 29 and healthy control hc n 35 ancovas controlling for age revealed significant group difference for both investigated vagal hrv parameter which were reduced in psy compared to hc the high frequency domain hrv in psy wa also lower than in chr and in a non significant trend than in ac also anova for heart rate and negative affect revealed significant increase in psy compared to hc exploratory analysis of medication effect showed moderate dosage association with heart rate and high frequency hrv thus in the present study the activity of the autonomic nervous system wa altered in psychosis but not in an at risk group a potential specificity of the effect can be speculated in contrast to anxiety disorder future study should investigate the predictive value of hrv for increased stress sensitivity or transition to clinical symptom a well a the implication for daily threat perception and symptom maintenance

objective periodontal disease is associated with a wide range of psychosocial risk factor disease related tooth loss ha been associated with an increase in depressive symptom in cross sectional study however while depression is a known risk factor for the outcome of chronic disease it remains unclear if tooth loss can also predict depressive symptom over the course of treatment aim of the current pilot study wa to test to what extend the number of teeth predict depressive symptom several year later method tooth status of 310 patient with chronic and aggressive periodontitis wa evaluated at the beginning of a specialized university based outpatient treatment we assessed depressive symptom with the patient heath questionnaire phq on average 13years later regression analysis were used to relate initial number of teeth to self reported depression score result fewer teeth at the beginning of the treatment were related to higher score of depressive symptom even when controlling for several covariates conclusion tooth loss is a potential risk factor for the development of depression in periodontal disease further longitudinal study that control for initial depressive symptom are needed to identify disease mechanism

background the covid 19 pandemic and it associated lockdown measure impacted mental health worldwide however the temporal dynamic of causal factor that modulate mental health during lockdown are not well understood objective we aimed to understand how a covid 19 lockdown change the temporal dynamic of loneliness and other factor affecting mental health this is the first study that compare network characteristic between lockdown stage to prioritize mental health intervention target method we combined ecological momentary assessment with wrist worn motion tracking to investigate the mechanism and change in network centrality of symptom and behavior before and during lockdown a total of 258 participant who reported at least mild loneliness and distress were assessed 8 time a day for 7 consecutive day over a 213 day period from august 8 2020 through march 9 2021 in germany covering a no lockdown and a lockdown stage covid 19 related worry information seeking perceived restriction and loneliness were assessed by digital visual analog scale ranging from 0 to 100 social activity wa assessed on a 7 point likert scale while physical activity wa recorded from wrist worn actigraphy device result we built a multilevel vector autoregressive model to estimate dynamic network to compare network characteristic between a no lockdown stage and a lockdown stage we performed permutation test during lockdown loneliness had the highest impact within the network a indicated by it centrality index ie an index to identify variable that have a strong influence on the other variable moreover during lockdown the centrality of loneliness significantly increased physical activity contributed to a decrease in loneliness amid the lockdown stage conclusion the covid 19 lockdown increased the central role of loneliness in triggering stress related behavior and cognition our study indicates that loneliness should be prioritized in mental health intervention during lockdown moreover physical activity can serve a a buffer for loneliness amid social restriction

we examined the long term efficacy of mindfulness based cognitive therapy mbct compared to a psychoeducation group a an active control condition in patient with obsessive compulsive disorder ocd with residual symptom of ocd after cognitive behavioral therapy a total of 125 patient were included in a bicentric interviewer blind randomized and actively controlled trial and were assigned to either an mbct group n 61 or a psychoeducation group n 64 patient demographic characteristic and the result from our previous assessment have already been reported kulz et al 2019 at the 12 month follow up the completion rate wa 80 ocd symptom were reduced from baseline to follow up assessment with a large effect but no difference wa found between group exploratory analysis showed that a composite score of time occupied by obsessive thought distress associated with obsessive thought and interference due to obsessive thought differed between group in the per protocol analysis with a stronger reduction in the mbct group at the 12 month follow up the two group showed a similar reduction of symptom however preliminary evidence indicates that mbct ha a superior effect on some aspect of ocd this should be replicated in future study

background attachment insecurity is a prominent risk factor for the development and course of psychiatric and psychosomatic disorder the experience in close relationship revised ecr r questionnaire is a widely used self report to ass attachment related anxiety and avoidance however it length ha the potential to restrict it use in large multi instrument study the aim of this study wa to develop and evaluate a brief version of the ecr r and provide norm value for the german population method a screening version of the original ecr r wa developed through principal component analysis of datasets from several previous study in a representative sample of 2428 randomly selected individual from the german population we compared fit index of different model by mean of confirmatory factor analysis cfa we investigated the convergent validity of the screening version in an independent convenience sample of 557 participant correlation between the short and the full scale were investigated in a re analysis of the original german ecr r evaluation sample result cfa indicated a satisfactory model fit for an eight item version ecr rd8 the ecr rd8 demonstrated adequate reliability the subscales correlated a expected with another self report measure of attachment in an independent sample individual with higher level of attachment anxiety but especially higher level of attachment avoidance were significantly more likely to not be in a relationship across all age group correlation between the short and the full scale were high conclusion the ecr rd8 appears to be a reliable valid and economic questionnaire for assessing attachment insecurity in addition the reported population based norm value will help to contextualize future research finding

background there ha been increasing research on posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd following childbirth in the last two decade the literature on predictor of who develops posttraumatic stress symptom ps suggests that both vulnerability and birth factor have an influence but many study measure predictor and outcome simultaneously objective in this context we aimed to examine indirect and direct effect of predictor of ps which were measured longitudinally method we assessed woman within the first day n 353 6 week and 12 month n 183 after having given birth to a healthy infant the first assessment included question on demographic pregnancy and birth experience the second and third assessment contained screening for postpartum depression ptsd and general mental health problem a well a assessing social support and physical well being we analysed our data using structural equation modelling technique n 277 result our final model showed good fit and wa consistent with a diathesis stress model of ps woman who had used antidepressant medication in the 10 year before childbirth had higher ps at 6 week independent of birth experience subjective birth experience wa the early predictor with the highest total effect on later ps interestingly a probable migration background also had a small but significant effect on ps via more episiotomy the null result for social support may have been caused by a ceiling effect conclusion given that we measured predictor at different time point our result lend important support to the etiological model namely that there is a vulnerability pathway and a stress pathway leading to ps ps and other psychological measure stayed very stable between 6 week and 1 year postpartum indicating that it is possible to identify woman developing problem early highlight of the article our result are consistent with a diathesis stress model vulnerability antidepressant use in the previous 10 year influenced posttraumatic stress symptom at 6 week and 1 year independently of stress birth related variable the strongest predictor of posttraumatic stress symptom 1 year postpartum wa posttraumatic stress symptom 6 week postpartum this mean that woman who develop problem could be identified during routinely offered postpartum care woman with a probable migration background experienced more ps 1 year after the birth which wa an indirect effect through more episiotomy and more ps after 6 week

suicide ideation is a prerequisite for suicide attempt however the majority of ideators will never act on their thought it is therefore crucial to understand what differentiates those who consider suicide from those who attempt suicide the aim of this study wa to investigate the role of different aspect of capability for suicide fearlessness about death subjective pain tolerance objective pain persistence in differentiating suicide ideators from suicide attempter single attempter from multiple attempter and recent attempter from distant attempter a total of 308 psychiatric inpatient 53 6 female age m 36 92 sd 14 30 suffering from suicide ideation with or without lifetime suicide attempt were compared regarding fearlessness about death subjective pain tolerance and objective pain persistence assessed with a pressure algometer no difference in fearlessness about death subjective pain tolerance and objective pain persistence were found in suicide ideators v attempter single v multiple attempter and recent v distant attempter it might be presumed that fearlessness about death subjective pain tolerance and objective pain persistence do not offer useful information for the differentiation between suicide ideators and attempter however there are several limitation to take into account further effort is needed to understand more clearly what differentiates suicide ideators from suicide attempter

post stroke depression psd is the most frequent psychiatric condition after stroke with a prevalence of approximately 33 in the general population depression is consistently reported to be more frequent in woman than in men evidence about gender difference in psd remains inconclusive and it is unknown if established risk factor exert gender specific influence the author examined gender difference in psd prevalence persistence and influence of established risk factor using chi 2 and welch s t test and continuous time structural equation modelling ct sem patient n 301 from the longitudinal berlin psd study were assessed six week baseline and up to four time during the first 2 5 year post stroke using dsm 5 depression criterion and the geriatric depression scale gd established risk factor were assessed at baseline woman showed higher psd prevalence and severity at baseline p 01 but not thereafter p 43 ct sem analysis revealed that known risk factor predicted depression yet predictive value and persistence did not differ between gender our result showed that established psd risk factor influence both gender to a similar extent and that in contrast to depression in the general population gender difference in psd prevalence and severity disappeared within six month post stroke thus for reason yet to be deciphered gender difference in psd appear to be time dependent after stroke

objective this study contributes to the quantitatively large yet narrow in scope research on body image in gay men by assessing whether gay and heterosexual men systematically differ on various dimension of body image disturbance and associated pathology i e eating disorder and body dysmorphic disorder symptom moreover we examined the influence of general everyday discrimination experience and involvement with the gay community on body image method n 216 men n 112 gay men n 104 heterosexual men participated in an online survey measuring the discrepancy between self rated current and ideal body fat muscularity drive for leanness muscularity and thinness body satisfaction body related avoidance and checking appearance fixing overall body image disturbance eating disorder and body dysmorphic disorder pathology general everyday discrimination experience and involvement with the gay community result gay men showed a greater discrepancy between self rated current and ideal body fat higher drive for thinness body related avoidance appearance fixing overall body image disturbance eating disorder and body dysmorphic disorder pathology and lower body appreciation than heterosexual men all p 05 contrary to expectation everyday discrimination experience were more strongly associated with body image disturbance and eating disorder body dysmorphic disorder pathology in heterosexual men than in gay men all p 05 gay community involvement wa not associated with any body image disturbance ed or bdd aspect in gay men all p 20 discussion the result suggest greater body image disturbance in gay men than in heterosexual men regarding cognition emotion behavior and perception a well a higher eating disorder and body dysmorphic disorder pathology the result also suggest the dilemma of a thin yet muscular body ideal in gay men surprisingly discrimination experience and involvement with the gay community did not explain difference in body image disturbance gay men may have become resilient to discrimination over time and body ideal might differ across gay sub community

individual suffering from body integrity dysphoria bid have the longstanding desire for amputation bid a or palsy bid p most finding on mental aspect of bid are based on self report from sufferer the aim of this pilot study is to examine cognitive and affective process beyond what is accessible by self report therefore n 5 bid a n 3 bid p sufferer n 22 healthy control and n 8 patient with body dysmorphic disorder a further group with a strong desire for body modification were tested selective attention bias eye tracking tendency towards false memory drm paradigm and lack of affective involvement in the unwanted body part induction and destruction of a rubber hand foot illusion were examined descriptive comparison of the group showed that bid a sufferer fixated amputation stump faster and longer than any other group and showed a reduced fear response when the body illusion wa destroyed there wa no indication of a higher tendency towards false memory in either bid group due to the small sample size these result cannot be generalized however finding showed that bid symptom and underlying process can be accessed in more way than through self report moreover result indicate that bid a sufferer selective attention and affective involvement differ from people not desiring an amputation understanding these process may help developing an etiological model identifying subtypes and deriving treatment approach

objective although the relationship between insecure attachment pattern and eating disorder ed psychopathology ha repeatedly been demonstrated the underlying mechanism of this association are not fully understood therefore the current study aimed to examine personality functioning defined a an impairment in self and interpersonal functioning a a mediator between attachment insecurity and ed psychopathology method in a representative population based sample n 2508 age range 14 92 year ed symptomatology personality functioning and attachment insecurity anxiety and avoidance were assessed besides descriptive uni bivariate analysis path analysis wa used to test a mediation model while controlling for the effect of age gender mental distress and bmi result ed symptomatology wa associated with lower level of personality functioning r 0 22 and higher level of attachment anxiety r 0 14 but did not correlate with attachment avoidance r 0 02 path analysis revealed that personality functioning fully mediated the effect of attachment anxiety on ed symptomatology the indirect effect via personality functioning beta 0 04 p 001 accounted for 77 of the total effect fit index were excellent sensitivity analysis revealed that the main result were mainly applicable to woman and the middle age group conclusion the present finding contribute to the growing body of research using dimensional conceptualization of personality functioning suggesting that it provides an informative overarching framework for understanding and treating ed psychopathology finding indicate that underlying individual difference e g with respect to insecure attachment configuration have relevant implication for symptom manifestation potential clinical implication and avenue for future research are discussed

the outbreak of covid 19 and national restriction to slow down it spread have significantly changed people s everyday life many people engage in intensive social medium use smu to stay up to date about the pandemic the present study investigated the extent of smu a source of covid 19 information and it relationship with anxiety and the experienced burden caused by the pandemic in spain of the 221 participant 52 5 reported to frequently use sm a information source the use of other information source such a print and online newspaper report television report and official governmental online site wa not associated with anxiety and burden caused by the current covid 19 situation however smu wa significantly positively linked to both variable moreover anxiety significantly mediated the relationship between smu and the experienced burden the finding show the potential negative effect of smu on individual emotional state and behavior during the pandemic they emphasize the significance of an accurate and conscious use of sm specifically during extraordinary circumstance such a the covid 19 outbreak

interoception is the sense of the body s physiological state both the ability to accurately perceive bodily signal and the self reported sensibility for the body were assumed to be reciprocally associated with negative affect up to now the specific interplay between dimension of interoception and negative affect remains largely unknown we investigated the interplay of cardioceptive accuracy assessed by a heartbeat tracking task facet of interoceptive sensibility a measured by the multidimensional assessment of interoceptive awareness and trait anxiety a measured by the trait version of the state trait anxiety inventory across two study n 243 using a network analytic approach the resulting network structure suggested a relationship between interoceptive sensibility and trait anxiety through the tendency to evaluate one s own body a trustworthy interoceptive accuracy showed no considerable association to other variable the finding question the relevance of cardiac interoceptive accuracy for trait anxiety in healthy population association of several interoceptive variable and trait anxiety ta were studied central and marginal facet of interoceptive sensibility is were identified is and ta were negatively linked over the appraisal of the own body a trustworthy cardioceptive accuracy showed no relevant association with facet of is or ta

objective this study conducted a simulation study for computer adaptive testing based on the aachen depression item bank adib which wa developed for the assessment of depression in person with somatic disease prior to computer adaptive test simulation the adib wa newly calibrated method recalibration wa performed in a sample of 161 patient treated for a depressive syndrome 103 patient from cardiology and 103 patient from otorhinolaryngology mean age 44 1 sd 14 0 44 7 female and wa cross validated in a sample of 117 patient undergoing rehabilitation for cardiac disease mean age 58 4 sd 10 5 24 8 woman unidimensionality of the itembank wa checked and a rasch analysis wa performed that evaluated local dependency ld differential item functioning dif item fit and reliability cat simulation wa conducted with the total sample and additional simulated data result recalibration resulted in a strictly unidimensional item bank with 36 item showing good rasch model fit item fit residual 2 5 and no dif or ld cat simulation revealed that 13 item on average were necessary to estimate depression in the range of 2 and 2 logits when terminating at se 0 32 and 4 item if using se 0 50 receiver operating characteristic analysis showed that theta estimate based on the cat algorithm have good criterion validity with regard to depression diagnosis area under the curve 78 for all cut off criterion conclusion the recalibration of the adib succeeded and the simulation study conducted suggest that it ha good screening performance in the sample investigated and that it may reasonably add to the improvement of depression assessment

purpose of review recent research suggests that expectation might be a particularly important subgroup of cognition in major depression the present study aimed to further specify the role of situation specific dysfunctional expectation sdes in the development of depressive symptom it wa hypothesized that the effect of intermediate belief and dispositional optimism on depressive symptom would be mediated via sdes recent finding we examined 125 student age m 22 05 sd 4 00 74 6 woman using a longitudinal design with a 1 year follow up questionnaire used in the study included the depressive expectation scale dysfunctional attitude scale life orientation test and beck s depression inventory when considering sdes at baseline a mediator variable neither intermediate belief nor dispositional optimism had significant direct effect on depressive symptom instead their effect were fully mediated via sdes when considering sdes at the follow up a the mediator variable sdes partly mediated the effect of intermediate belief and dispositional optimism on depressive symptom summary the study provides further evidence for a cognitive mediational model suggesting that sdes mediate the effect of rather global belief such a intermediate belief and dispositional optimism on depressive symptom due to their high level of situational specificity sdes might be an effective target for cognitive behavioural intervention

both obsessive compulsive disorder and subclinical obsessive compulsive oc symptom seem to be associated with hyperactive error related brain activity the current study examined performance monitoring in subject with subclinical oc symptom using a new task with different level of difficulty nineteen subject with high and 18 subject with low oc characteristic performed a random dot cinematogram rdc task with three level of difficulty the high and low oc group did not differ in error related negativity ern correct related negativity crn and performance irrespective of task difficulty the amplitude of the ern decreased with increasing difficulty whereas the magnitude of crn did not vary ern and crn approached in size and topography with increasing difficulty which suggests that error and correct response are processed more similarly these result add to a growing number of study that fail to replicate hyperactive performance monitoring in individual with oc symptom in task with higher difficulty or requiring learning together with these finding our result suggest that the relationship between oc symptom and performance monitoring may be sensitive to type of task and task characteristic and cannot be observed in a rdc that differs from typically used task in difficulty and the amount of response conflict

abstract relevance of emotional information varies with self involvement the current study wa undertaken to test whether subtle facial self resemblance is sufficient to affect attentional and affective processing of complex socio emotional picture face digitally manipulated to resemble the participant final sample n 21 own versus unfamiliar control face form and color morphs were presented in picture of emotionally evocative social interaction that is threat versus sex scene at stimulus onset asynchrony soas of either 300 m or 3 000 m after picture onset startle response were elicited by acoustic white noise burst 50 m 105 db and recorded at the orbicularis oculus via electromyography emg the majority of participant remained unaware of the morphing manipulation and awareness did not affect the principal result a indexed by inhibition of startle at short lead interval and by picture evoked heart rate deceleration facial self resemblance modulates effect of motivational salience in a context sensitive way increasing prepulse inhibition with threat related but not erotic cue overall the present study suggests that visual cue of general motivational significance and of self relevance are integrated in a fast presumably automatic manner

the present study aimed to investigate the everyday emotional dynamic of depressed individual especially the role of emotional inertia emotional context insensitivity and emotional variability and instability using ecological momentary assessment 40 currently depressed individual and 40 healthy control reported on their current emotional state and current activity 10 time a day for 4 consecutive day there were no difference in the dynamic of positive affect pa between depressed and healthy subject depressed participant negative affect na however wa found to be more inert than in healthy control while at the same time being more variable and more reactive to positive event there wa also an association between emotional instability and depression but this wa rendered nonsignificant when analysis were controlled for emotional variability altogether emotional dynamic of na appear to be more prominently disturbed in depression compared to pa result support earlier finding on na emotional variability a well a inertia in depressed patient in addition there wa some evidence for a mood brightening effect in depression psycinfo database record c 2020 apa all right reserved

background stress related alteration in the regulation of several endocrine system including the hypothalamus pituitary adrenal hpa and gonadal hpg ax and the endocannabinoid system are proposed to be involved in the etiology of major depressive disorder mdd therefore this study examines whether altered concentration of glucocorticoid testosterone endocannabinoids and related n acylethanolamines accumulated in hair are present in mdd method female participant range 19 59 mdn 30 5 year were recruited including n 21 with a current mdd episode and n 27 nondepressed control without any current mental disorder weight standardized sample of 3 cm hair segment were analyzed which equal to three month of retrospectively assessed biomarkers in hair concentration of cortisol cortisone testosterone endocannabinoids i e anandamide aea 2 arachidonylglycerol 2 ag and selected n acylethanolamines i e stearoylethanolamide sea oleoylethanolamide oea palmitoylethanolamide pea were measured using mass spectrometry result female mdd patient exhibited lower cortisol and cortisone level in hair than nondepressed control whereas the hair concentration of endocannabinoids n acylethanolamines and testosterone did not differ between the group conclusion our result add to the heterogeneous body of finding on alteration in hair stored glucocorticoid and endocannabinoids in mdd a in previous study there wa no evidence of altered testosterone concentration in the hair of mdd patient larger and longitudinal study are needed to comprehensively explore the overall picture of endocrine alteration in mdd

background many neonatal observational pain assessment tool are available their application in clinical setting however ha been limited a further difficulty for decision maker may be to choose among the variety of available tool the appropriate one s for their patient aim of the present study were 1 to compare two commonly cited neonatal pain assessment tool the neonatal facial coding system revised nfcs r and the child and infant s postoperative pain scale chipps with regard to their psychometric quality and 2 to explore intuitive clinician rating by relating them to the tool item method three coder applied both pain assessment tool to video of 44 neonate who were videotaped while undergoing a painful and a stressful procedure clinician rated the pain neonate experienced on a numerical rating scale analysis of variance and regression analysis were used to investigate whether tool could discriminate between the procedure and whether tool item were predictor of intuitive clinician rating result interrater reliability internal consistency and relative convergent validity were high for both assessment tool both tool discriminated between painful and stressful situation equally well roughly one third of variance in clinician intuitive rating could be explained by item of each tool however no single item wa found to be a significant predictor conclusion both pain assessment tool performed equally well regarding psychometric comparison therefore clinical utility need to be considered when having to choose possibility of improvement for both tool were identified cue clinician base their intuitive pain judgement need to be further investigated significance psychometric comparison of neonatal assessment tool provide useful information that can help health care professional to choose among tool and researcher to improve them both tool compared here performed psychometrically equally well their clinical utility however can be improved for example by providing a manual chipps and training opportunity

background alexithymia is a risk factor for major depressive disorder mdd and ha been associated with diminished treatment response neuroimaging study have revealed structural aberration of the anterior cingulate cortex and the fusiform gyrus in healthy control with high level of alexithymia the present study tried to corroborate and extend these result to patient with mdd compared with healthy control method we investigated the relationship between alexithymia depression and grey matter volume in 63 patient with mdd mean age standard deviation 42 43 yr 11 91 33 female and 46 healthy control 45 35 yr 8 37 22 female we assessed alexithymia using the toronto alexithymia scale we conducted an alexithymia x group analysis of covariance we used a region of interest approach including the fusiform gyrus and anterior cingulate cortex and conducted whole brain analysis using voxelbased morphometry result our analysis revealed a significant alexithymia x group interaction in the fusiform gyrus left pfwe 0 031 right pfwe 0 010 higher alexithymia score were associated with decreased grey matter volume in patient with mdd pfwe 0 009 but with increased grey matter volume of the fusiform gyrus in healthy control pfwe 0 044 we found no significant main effect in the region of interest analysis limitation owing to the naturalistic nature of our study patient with mdd and healthy control differed significantly in their alexithymia score conclusion our result showed the fusiform gyrus a a correlate of alexithymia we also found difference related to alexithymia between patient with mdd and healthy control in the fusiform gyrus our study encourages research related to the transition from risk to mdd in people with alexithymia

several meta analysis to date have confirmed the efficacy of attentional bias modification abm in shifting reaction time away from threatening stimulus reducing anxiety symptom and buffering against stressor vulnerability the reliability of reaction time difference however ha been found to show unacceptable psychometric property in this study we tested the impact of an extensive dot probe abm procedure consisting of close to 7000 trial concurrently with behavioral and electrophysiological measure within a large sample of over 100 highly socially anxious participant result indicated that the n2pc component demonstrates superior internal consistency and more statistical power in detecting attentional bias and their modification than reaction time rt difference rts were neither indicative of an attentional bias before abm nor of a modification over time in contrast the n2pc indexed both an initial attentional preference for threatening stimulus and an alteration of this relationship after training outcome were not specific for attentional training away from threat but also occurred in the no contingency control procedure casting doubt on the theoretic underpinnings of abm electrophysiological measure are an important complement to the abm literature and should be further utilized to ass attentional bias with excellent reliability

teacher judgment of student academic achievement are not only affected by the achievement themselves but also by several other characteristic such a ethnicity gender and minority status in real life classroom achievement and further characteristic are often confounded we disentangled achievement ethnicity and minority status and examined whether the achievement of ethnic minority student is judged according to the predominant expectation expectation hypothesis and whether teacher judgment accuracy is influenced by student ethnicity or their minority status ethnicity hypothesis or minority hypothesis we conducted 4 experimental study with a computer simulation the simulated classroom in study 1 and 2 with n 34 and n 30 participant we implemented turkish study 1 and asian student study 2 a minority in contrast to the expectation hypothesis the expectation attributed to the achievement of ethnic minority student did not bias teacher judgment in both study we found greater judgment accuracy for ethnic minority student thereby probing the ethnicity hypothesis in study 3 with n 48 participant we further disentangled ethnicity and minority using german student a minority student thus probing the minority hypothesis again minority student were judged more accurately implementing gender male v female a the minority characteristic in study 4 with n 52 participant yielded the same result minority student were judged more accurately therefore supporting the minority hypothesis thus classroom characteristic need to be considered in research on teacher judgment accuracy to clarify the influence of individual student characteristic and composition effect beyond individual effect psycinfo database record c 2017 apa all right reserved

face mask are now worn frequently to reduce the spreading of the sars cov 2 virus their health benefit are undisputable but covering the lower half of one s face also make it harder for others to recognize facial expression of emotion three experiment were conducted to determine how strongly the recognition of different facial expression is impaired by mask and which emotion are confused with each other in each experiment participant had to recognize facial expression of happiness sadness anger surprise fear and disgust a well a a neutral expression displayed by male and female actor of the radboud face database on half of the 168 trial the lower part of the face wa covered by a face mask in all experiment facial emotion recognition fer wa about 20 worse for masked face than for unmasked one 68 correct v 88 the impairment wa largest for disgust followed by fear surprise sadness and happiness it wa not significant for anger and the neutral expression a predicted participant frequently confused emotion that share activation of the visible muscle in the upper half of the face in addition they displayed response bias in these confusion they frequently misinterpreted disgust a anger fear a surprise and sadness a neutral whereas the opposite confusion were le frequent we conclude that face mask do indeed cause a marked impairment of fer and that a person perceived a angry surprised or neutral may actually be disgusted fearful or sad respectively this may lead to misunderstanding confusion and inadequate reaction by the perceiver

firefighter are frequently exposed to highly stressful potentially traumatic event ptes more than 50 however show no significant elevation in trauma related symptomatology e g depression in the past self compassion ha been discussed to promote psychological and behavioral flexibility that is vital to a successful adaptation to ptes the goal of this study wa to understand whether and how self compassion may alleviate personal suffering in the face of ptes we hypothesized that individual who encounter their profession related affective experience with greater self compassion show lower level of depressive symptom because self compassion buffer process that perpetuate negative affectivity in response to ptes i e self critical tendency male firefighter n 123 completed self report questionnaire about the severity of current depressive symptom prior traumatic duty related event and the self compassion scale that ass two distinct factor self criticism and self compassion a stepwise regression model wa employed to examine differential and interactive contribution of self criticism and self compassion to symptom of depression across the cumulative range of exposure to ptes our result indicate that the positive association between self criticism and depression is buffered by enhanced level of self compassion this moderation however only emerged for firefighter with substantial amount of ptes experience in the past the present work provides insight into protective effect of self compassion in the face of cumulative ptes it suggests that particularly for severely trauma exposed firefighter self compassion may confer resilience that is act a a protective factor from the development of depressive symptom finding are discussed in light of counseling implication psycinfo database record

background objective suicide ideation is common in depressed patient however no study to date have examined whether pretreatment suicide ideation is associated with poorer outcome after cognitive behavioral therapy for adult depression method 475 depressed outpatient age m 39 9 year sd 11 71 60 2 female took part in a pre treatment and a post treatment assessment pre treatment suicide ideation measured with the bdi suicide item wa considered a a predictor of treatment outcome controlling for age gender number of attended therapy session a well a pre treatment depression severity result hierarchical regression revealed that age gender number of completed therapy session and depression severity at baseline could explain 25 of the variance in post treatment bdi score adding suicide ideation significantly improved the amount of variance explained to 27 treatment outcome were worse for patient with more severe depression suicidal patient patient receiving more therapy session and older patient conclusion suicide ideation added only little incremental variance to the prospective prediction of post treatment depression severity depressed patient with suicide ideation can attain almost a good treatment outcome a patient without suicide ideation which is a clinically encouraging result

background generalized anxiety disorder gad is difficult to recognize and hard to separate from major depression md in clinical setting biomarkers might support diagnostic decision this study used machine learning on multimodal biobehavioral data from a sample of gad md and healthy subject to differentiate subject with a disorder from healthy subject case classification and to differentiate gad from md disorder classification method subject with gad n 19 md without gad n 14 and healthy comparison subject n 24 were included the sample wa matched regarding age sex handedness and education and free of psychopharmacological medication binary support vector machine were used within a nested leave one out cross validation framework clinical questionnaire cortisol release gray matter gm and white matter wm volume were used a input data separately and in combination result questionnaire data were well suited for case classification but not disorder classification accuracy 96 40 p 001 56 58 p 22 the opposite pattern wa found for imaging data case classification gm wm 58 71 p 09 43 18 p 66 disorder classification gm wm 68 05 p 034 58 27 p 15 and for cortisol data 38 02 p 84 74 60 p 009 all data combined achieved 90 10 accuracy p 001 for case classification and 67 46 accuracy p 0268 for disorder classification conclusion in line with previous evidence classification of gad wa difficult using clinical questionnaire data alone particularly cortisol and gm volume data were able to provide incremental value for the classification of gad finding suggest that neurobiological biomarkers are a useful target for further research to delineate their potential contribution to diagnostic process

food restriction and weight loss have been proposed to represent pathogenic mechanism of emotion regulation in anorexia nervosa an however there is a lack of study empirically examining this hypothesis therefore the present study compared 25 woman with an and 25 healthy control woman hc regarding spontaneous emotional processing of autobiographic memory participant idiographic memory of sad autobiographic event were analyzed using computerized quantitative text analysis a an unobtrusive approach of nonreactive assessment compared to hc an patient retrieved more negative but a comparable number of positive emotion moreover the lesser the body weight in an patient the lesser negative emotion they retrieved irrespective of current level of depressive symptom and duration of illness no such association wa found in hc these preliminary finding are in line with model of an proposing that food restriction and weight loss may be negatively reinforced by the alleviation of aversive emotional response

accident caused by human error illustrate the fragility of cognitive processing and it coordination by executive function against stress to better understand how core executive function change over time influence each other and are affected by chronic stress exposure a prospective cohort study wa conducted from 2016 to 2019 five hundred sixteen german adult aged 25 55 year mean age education age 38 0 11 3 year 67 female 94 occupied 20 smoker completed at least one internet based biannual assessment of response inhibition updating and set shifting using a go nogo spatial 2 back and number letter task respectively chronic stress exposure wa indicated by self report on the perceived stress scale ps and hair cortisol concentration hcc statistical analysis were performed by multivariate stochastic differential equation modeling all indicator of executive function task specific rts in target trial or their contrast to nontarget trial and chronic stress showed intraindividual stability over time 12 to 63 of their variance wa attributable to trait influence with respect to lagged mutual association faster go nogo target rts predicted faster number letter target rts later in time while faster number letter target rts predicted higher hcc later in time both with maximum effect size of d approximately 0 1 standard deviation however ps wa not predictive of later hcc and vice versa none of the chronic stress indicator significantly predicted indicator of executive function at subsequent time point these finding suggest that set shifting is capable of modulating the body s physiological response to chronic stress exposure whereas executive function appear comparably robust against chronic stress exposure psycinfo database record c 2021 apa all right reserved

background a healthy lifestyle can be beneficial for one s mental health thus identifying healthy lifestyle choice that promote psychological well being and reduce mental problem is useful to prevent mental disorder the aim of this longitudinal study wa to evaluate the predictive value of a broad range of lifestyle choice for positive mental health pmh and mental health problem mhp in german and chinese student method data were assessed at baseline and at 1 year follow up sample included 2991 german m age 21 69 sd 4 07 and 12 405 chinese m age 20 59 sd 1 58 university student lifestyle choice were body mass index frequency of physical and mental activity frequency of alcohol consumption smoking vegetarian diet and social rhythm irregularity pmh and mhp were measured with the positive mental health scale and a 21 item version of the depression anxiety and stress scale the predictive value of lifestyle choice for pmh and mhp at baseline and follow up were assessed with single group and multi group path analysis result better mental health higher pmh and fewer mhp at baseline wa predicted by a lower body mass index a higher frequency of physical and mental activity non smoking a non vegetarian diet and a more regular social rhythm when controlling for baseline mental health age and gender physical activity wa a positive predictor of pmh smoking wa a positive predictor of mhp and a more irregular social rhythm wa a positive predictor of pmh and a negative predictor of mhp at follow up the good fit of a multi group model indicated that most lifestyle choice predict mental health comparably across sample some country specific effect emerged frequency of alcohol consumption for example predicted better mental health in german and poorer mental health in chinese student conclusion our finding underline the importance of healthy lifestyle choice for improved psychological well being and fewer mental health difficulty effect of lifestyle on mental health are comparable in german and chinese student some healthy lifestyle choice i e more frequent physical activity non smoking regular social rhythm are related to improvement in mental health over a 1 year period

objective the study aimed at analyzing association between grawe s general mechanism of change and young s early maladaptive schema em method therefore 98 patient completed the scale for the multiperspective assessment of general change mechanism in psychotherapy sacip the young shema questionnaire short form revised ysq s3r and diverse outcome measure at the beginning and end of treatment result our result are important for clinical application a we demonstrated strong predictive effect of change mechanism on schema domain using regression analysis and cross lagged panel model conclusion resource activation experience seem to be especially crucial in fostering alteration in em a this change mechanism demonstrated significant association with several schema domain future research should investigate these aspect in more detail using observer based micro process analysis

previous research suggests that state anxiety may sway political attitude however previous experimental procedure induced anxiety using political context e g social or economic threat in a pre registered laboratory experiment we set out to examine if anxiety that is unrelated to political context can influence political attitude we induced anxiety with a threat of shock paradigm void of any political connotation all participant were instructed that they might receive an electric stimulus during specified threat period and none during safety period participant were randomly assigned to one of two condition political attitude implicit and explicit were assessed under safety in one condition and under threat in the other psychometric a well a physiological data skin conductance heart rate confirmed that anxiety wa induced successfully however this emotional state did not alter political attitude in a bayesian analytical approach we confirmed the absence of an effect our result suggest that state anxiety by itself doe not sway political attitude previously observed effect that were attributed to anxiety may be conditional on a political context of threat

background abnormality in fronto striatal thalamic fst sub circuit are present in schizophrenia and are associated with cognitive impairment however it remains unknown whether abnormality in fst sub circuit are present before psychosis onset this may be elucidated by investigating 22q11 2 deletion syndrome 22q11ds a genetic syndrome associated with a 30 risk for developing schizophrenia in adulthood and a decline in verbal iq viq preceding psychosis onset here we examined white matter wm tract in fst sub circuit especially those in the dorsolateral dlpfc and ventrolateral prefrontal cortex vlpfc sub circuit and their association with viq in young adult with 22q11ds method diffusion mri scan were acquired from 21 individual with 22q11ds with prodromal symptom of schizophrenia 30 individual with 22q11ds without prodromal symptom and 30 healthy control mean age 21 2 year wm tract were reconstructed between striatum and thalamus with rostral middle frontal gyrus rmfg and inferior frontal gyrus ifg representing dlpfc and vlpfc respectively fractional anisotropy fa and radial diffusivity rd were used for group comparison viq wa assessed and association with the diffusion measure were evaluated result fa wa significantly increased and rd decreased in most tract of the dlpfc and vlpfc sub circuit in 22q11ds verbal iq score correlated negatively with fa and at trend level positively with rd in the right thalamus ifg tract in 22q11ds with prodromal symptom conclusion while abnormality in fst sub circuit are associated with schizophrenia we observed that these abnormality are also present in 22q11ds individual with prodromal symptom and are associated with verbal performance in the right thalamus ifg tract
