background methodological problem of existing research such a the application of unstandardized treatment in heterogeneous sample ha hampered clear conclusion about the extent and direction to which allelic variation of the serotonin transporter gene linked polymorphic region 5 httlpr is associated with a differential response to psychological treatment the present study aimed to investigate the effect of the 5 httlpr genotype on treatment outcome under highly standardized environmental condition method we treated 222 medication free adult highly fearful of spider dental surgery or blood injury and injection with a highly standardized exposure based 1 session treatment and genotyped them for the 5 httlpr participant subjective fear wa assessed before immediately after treatment and at 7 month of follow up result there were no difference between 5 httlpr genotype in treatment outcome effect at the immediate posttreatment assessment however we observed a highly significant genotype x treatment effect p 0 004 at the 7 month follow up fear level of homozygous s allele carrier differed from those heterozygous p 0 026 and homozygous p 0 012 for the l allele compared to posttreatment assessment ll allele carrier exhibited a further fear decrease at the follow up assessment in contrast s allele carrier displayed a strong return of fear conclusion result suggest that genetic variation of the serotonin transporter is associated with differential stability of inhibitory learning process potentially reflecting heightened susceptibility for context related process that facilitate a return of fear in s allele carrier if replicated result suggest the 5 httlpr might represent a biomarker for the long term outcome of brief exposure based fear treatment and might inform genotype based selection of psychotherapeutic intervention

interoception describes the ability to perceive internal bodily signal previous research found a relationship between interoceptive accuracy iacc and cardiovascular outcome during or after acute stress so far the association between iacc and long term stress ha not been investigated although this would be important to identify a starting point to prevent long term stress to address this idea in the current study we examined the relationship between iacc and long term stress which wa assessed with different questionnaire and biological marker including cortisol and dehydroepiandrosterone dhea furthermore we investigated self regulation a a mechanism linking iacc to long term stress the sample consisted of 98 participant to measure iacc participant completed the heartbeat perception task perceived long term stress and self regulation were assessed via an online questionnaire moreover hair sample were taken from 65 participant to determine long term stress with cortisol and dhea a well a the ratio of both result showed that iacc wa positively related to dhea and weakly negatively related to the other indicator of long term stress except for the nonsignificant relationship to the indicator cortisol and stress experience due to negative event furthermore these relationship were mediated by participant enhanced self regulation thus our result suggest that enhanced self regulation could be a mechanism explaining why iacc is associated with long term stress

the interpersonal psychological theory of suicide posit that elevated pain tolerance is necessary to engage in suicidal behaviour it is assumed that suicidal intent only lead to lethal or near lethal suicide attempt when an individual ha the capability to persist the pain involved in dying the aim of this study wa to ass whether objective pain persistence moderate the association between suicide intent and lethality of a recent suicide attempt ninety seven inpatient who were hospitalized due to a recent suicide attempt were interviewed regarding lifetime suicide attempt a well a their most recent suicide attempt method of attempt intention to die medical risk of death probability of an intervention and physical condition following the attempt were inquired pain persistence wa examined using a pressure algometer contrary to the expectation pain persistence did not moderate the association between suicide intent and lethality of a recent suicide attempt that is medical risk of death probability of an intervention or physical condition following the attempt future study are needed to examine method specific pain persistence for suicidal behaviour in a longitudinal study design

background while depression after stroke is common and stroke prevalence globally increase in working age population the role of return to work rtw in the pathogenesis of post stroke depression psd remains unclear this study examined if rtw is linked to psd within the first year after ischemic stroke independently from established risk factor method stroke survivor n 176 in their working age 65 year recruited from two rehabilitation clinic were assessed for established risk factor pre stroke depression activity of daily living stroke severity cognitive impairment and social support rtw and depressive symptom geriatric depression scale gd 15 were assessed six and twelve month post stroke multivariate regression analysis were used to ass the cross sectional and longitudinal relationship between rtw and gd 15 while controlling for established psd risk factor result successful rtw wa independently associated with lower gd 15 at both measurement occasion p 05 next to the absence of pre stroke depression and higher social support stroke severity predicted gd 15 at twelve month the predictive value of six month rtw for subsequent depressive symptom beyond the influence of established risk factor wa s 1 73 p 09 discussion rtw wa independently associated with psd in young stroke survivor within the first year post stroke and exerted a marginally significant effect on subsequent depression our study highlight the relevance of rtw for young stroke survivor psd beyond the influence of established risk factor further assessment examining to what extent fostering rtw contributes to mental well being after stroke might be promising for psd prevention next to evident beneficial economic effect

abstract objective the purpose of this study wa to compare the self and observer rating of capacity limitation in patient with neurological condition research on this topic is relevant for assessing the patient ability to participate in work and social life and improving collaborative patient clinician relationship method the self and observer rating of capacity limitation in a sample of n 245 patient with neurological condition from a rehabilitation facility were compared and assessed using the short rating of activity limitation and participation restriction in mental disorder according to the international classification of functioning disability and health mini icf app and the equivalent self rating questionnaire mini icf app s result paired sample t test revealed significant difference between the self and observer rating for six out of 13 capacity dimension on average the patient rated the capacity dimension adherence to regulation planning and structuring of task professional competency and endurance a significantly le limited in comparison to the observer small to medium effect size the self rating for limitation of contact with others and self care were only marginally higher than the observer rating conclusion the finding show that psychological capacity limitation occur in patient with neurological condition in clinical practice limitation in each capacity dimension and discrepancy in patient and clinician rating should be thoroughly assessed this is especially relevant in patient with neurological condition who have a potential tendency to underestimate or deny their disability

background exposure to potentially adverse event might intensify thinking about different comparison standard in relation to one s own well being objective to examine how frequently survivor of a recent potentially traumatic event use different comparison standard to evaluate their current well being method a survey with 223 participant directly or indirectly exposed to a vehicle ramming attack wa conducted symptom of post traumatic stress disorder ptsd and depression quality of life and the sum score of the frequency of different type of comparison standard were assessed the latter consisted of temporal counterfactual social dimensional and criterion based comparison result in total 98 of participant reported some form of comparative thinking during the last two week the most frequent comparison type were temporal and dimensional comparison with 94 and 87 of participant reporting them respectively notably comparative thinking predicted unique variance in ptsd symptom over and above depressive symptom conclusion the result suggest that comparative thinking may be a significant factor in understanding psychological distress following exposure to aversive event replication of the result in larger sample and using longitudinal and experimental design is clearly necessary

facial expression provide insight into a person s emotional experience to automatically decode these expression ha been made possible by tremendous progress in the field of computer vision researcher are now able to decode emotional facial expression with impressive accuracy in standardized image of prototypical basic emotion we tested the sensitivity of a well established automatic facial coding software program to detect spontaneous emotional reaction in individual responding to emotional picture we compared automatically generated score for valence and arousal of the facereader fr noldus information technology with the current psychophysiological gold standard of measuring emotional valence facial electromyography emg and arousal skin conductance sc we recorded physiological and behavioral measurement of 43 healthy participant while they looked at pleasant unpleasant or neutral scene when viewing pleasant picture fr valence and emg were both comparably sensitive however for unpleasant picture fr valence showed an expected negative shift but the signal differentiated not well between response to neutral and unpleasant stimulus that were distinguishable with emg furthermore fr arousal value had a stronger correlation with self reported valence than with arousal while sc wa sensitive and specifically associated with self reported arousal this is the first study to systematically compare fr measurement of spontaneous emotional reaction to standardized emotional image with established psychophysiological measurement tool this novel technology ha yet to make stride to surpass the sensitivity of established psychophysiological measure however it provides a promising new measurement technique for non contact assessment of emotional response

background and objective dermatologist are increasingly confronted with patient affected by body dysmorphic disorder bdd bdd is characterized by excessive preoccupation with one or more perceived defect s or flaw s in physical appearance which are not observable or appear slight to others so far there have been only few study examining the prevalence of bdd in dermatological outpatient in addition the need for psychotherapeutic support in dermatological outpatient with body dysmorphic concern ha not yet been systematically examined the objective of the present study wa therefore to investigate the frequency of body dysmorphic concern a well a social adaptation and the need for psychotherapeutic support in the aforementioned patient group patient and method a total of 252 dermatological outpatient seen at a german university hospital were consecutively enrolled and examined using the dysmorphic concern questionnaire the social adaptation self evaluation scale and the german version of the university of rhode island change assessment scale result 7 9 of all outpatient unselected sample showed positive test result suggesting clinically relevant body dysmorphic concern patient with clinically relevant body dysmorphic concern exhibited poor social adaptation contrary to expectation these patient revealed a high motivation for change indicating the necessity for psychotherapeutic support conclusion our finding confirm previous prevalence rate of bdd in dermatological outpatient and highlight the need for providing psychotherapeutic support to dermatological patient

objective patient with anorexia nervosa an often show difficulty in the perception expression and regulation of emotion and a strong avoidance of aversive feeling according to psychobiological model dietary restraint and accompanying weight loss may serve a a maladaptive mechanism of emotion regulation by attenuating aversive emotional state in an thereby contributing to the maintenance of the disorder method twenty seven woman with an and 26 age matched healthy woman were shown short film clip to elicit fear sadness amusement and neutral emotional state eyeblink startle response wa measured by electromyography in reaction to startle eliciting acoustic stimulus presented 12 time binaurally during each film clip result a compared to healthy control patient with an showed a blunted startle response to the fear but not to the sadness eliciting stimulus discussion the finding support the assumption that underweight is associated with attenuated emotional reactivity to fear eliciting material in an this is in line with the hypothesis that starvation and low body weight constitute a maladaptive mechanism of emotion regulation in an contributing to the maintenance of the disorder

individual response to behavioral treatment of anxiety disorder vary considerably which requires a better understanding of underlying process in this study we examined the violation and change of threat belief during exposure from 8 484 standardized exposure record of 605 patient with different anxiety disorder learning indicator were derived expectancy violation a mismatch between threat expectancy before exposure and threat occurrence expectancy change a difference between original and adjusted expectancy after exposure and prediction error learning rate a extent to which expectancy violation transferred into change throughout session high threat expectancy but low occurrence and adjusted expectancy indicated successful violation and change of threat belief by exposure expectancy violation change and learning rate substantially varied between patient not expectancy violation itself but higher learning rate and expectancy change predicted better treatment outcome successful exposure thus requires expectancy violation to induce actual expectancy change supporting learning from prediction error a transdiagnostic mechanism underlying successful exposure therapy

with limited resource exploring new opportunity is crucial for survival exploring novel option however come at the cost of uncertainty therefore there is a trade off between exploiting option with a known beneficial outcome and exploring novel option with a potentially higher gain computational model have suggested that novelty may promote exploratory behavior by inducing a so called novelty bonus through reward related process so far few study have provided behavioral evidence for such a novelty bonus in this study we aimed to investigate whether spatial novelty can stimulate exploratory behavior experiment 1 and whether age novelty seeking and reduced action radius or social interaction due to covid 19 restriction influenced the exploration exploitation trade off experiment 2 in both experiment we employed a novel paradigm in which participant made binary decision between food item while on rare trial a surprise option wa presented result from experiment 1 are in line with a novelty bonus with spatial novelty promoting exploratory behavior in experiment 2 we found that exploratory behavior declined with age high novelty seeker made more exploratory choice than low novelty seeker and participant with a smaller action radius made fewer exploratory choice these finding are consistent with previous finding in animal and prediction from computational model

distorted cognitive processing ha been found among survivor of child maltreatment however different type of abuse and neglect may bring about difference in emotion and attention processing the present study aimed to detect differential association between various type of childhood maltreatment and attentional bias in facial emotion processing a non clinical sample wa recruited on university campus and consisted of 67 individual with varying degree of maltreatment in an evaluative conditioning task image of face with neutral emotional expression were either associated with short video of intense negative statement or associated with neutral video subsequently these face were used a stimulus in a face in the crowd recognition task in which the familiar face had to be recognized within a crowd of unfamiliar neutral face in multiple linear regression analysis controlling for the intercorrelatedness of type of maltreatment differential relationship between type of maltreatment and attentional bias were found while emotional abuse wa associated with faster detection of negatively associated face emotional neglect wa associated with an impaired recognition of familiar stimulus regardless of the emotional content result indicated that interindividual difference in cognitive bias may be due to the activation of diverse cognitive schema based on differential experience of maltreatment

because threatening situation often occur in a similar manner the generalization of fear to similar situation is adaptive and can avoid harm to the organism however the overgeneralization of fear to harmless stimulus is maladaptive and assumed to contribute to anxiety disorder thus elucidating factor that may modulate fear over generalization is important based on the known effect of acute stress on learning which are at least partly due to noradrenergic arousal we investigated whether stress may promote fear overgeneralization and whether we could counteract this effect by reducing noradrenergic arousal in a placebo controlled double blind between subject design 120 healthy participant underwent a fear conditioning procedure on day 1 approximately 24 hour later participant received orally either a placebo or the beta adrenergic receptor antagonist propranolol and were exposed to a stress or control manipulation before they completed a test of fear generalization skin conductance response a well a explicit rating data showed a successful acquisition of conditioned fear on day 1 and a pronounced fear generalization 24 hour later although physiological data confirmed the successful stress manipulation and reduction of noradrenergic arousal the extent of fear generalization remained unaffected by stress and propranolol the absence of a stress effect on fear generalization wa confirmed by a second study and a bayesian analysis across both data set our finding suggest that acute stress leaf fear generalization process intact at least in a sample of healthy young individual

explanatory model ascribe to arousability a central role for the development of psychotic symptom thus a disposition to hyperarousal i e increased arousal predisposition ap may serve a an underlying vulnerability indicator for psychosis by interacting with stressor to cause symptom in this case ap stress response and psychotic symptom should be linked before the development of a diagnosable psychotic disorder we conducted a cross sectional online study in a population sample n 104 m age 27 7 year sd 11 2 range 18 70 participant rated their ap and subclinical psychotic symptom participant reported their stress level before and after two stress induction including an arithmetic and a social stressor the participant with an increased ap generally felt more stressed however ap wa not associated with the specific stress response a expected positive psychotic symptom were significantly associated with ap but this wa not mediated by general stress level it association to subtle nonclinical psychotic symptom support our assumption that ap could be a vulnerability indicator for psychosis the trait is easily accessible via a short self report and could facilitate the identification of people at risk and be a promising target for early stress management further research is needed to clarify it predictive value for stress response

the impairment in social functioning of patient with psychotic disorder is mainly driven by motivational negative symptom with a widely unknown etiology building on the well confirmed link between specific social risk factor and psychosis the current study tested the postulated effect of immediate social exclusion on the development of motivational negative symptom and the association of repeated social exclusion experience with demotivating belief in a community sample n 84 repeated social exclusion experience and demotivating belief were assessed at baseline we randomized the participant to either an exclusion or an inclusion condition of a virtual ball tossing game motivation and anticipatory pleasure were measured before and after the manipulation via self report and via a behavioral effort paradigm we found a significant multivariate effect of social exclusion on self reported motivation f 4 79 4 25 p 01 eta2 18 but not on behavioral effort f 1 82 1 24 p 27 eta2 02 repeated social exclusion wa significantly associated with demotivating belief r 58 p 01 and negative symptom r 43 p 001 our finding support the notion that reduced motivation anticipatory anhedonia and demotivating belief can be understood a motivational and cognitive consequence of social exclusion we also discus the implication for psychological intervention and for further research on the etiology of negative symptom

systemic therapy considers the complex dynamic of relational factor and resource contributing to psychological symptom negative maintaining factor have been well researched for people suffering from alcohol use disorder aud however we know little about the complex dynamic of these negative factor and resource we interviewed fifty five participant suffering or fully remitted from alcohol use disorder in this cross sectional study m 52 year 33 female the interview focused on relational factor e g social support and social negativity referring to a support social network and a craving social network csn the csn included all significant others who were associated with craving situation we compared the network characteristic of the group suffering from alcohol use disorder n 38 to a fully remitted control group n 17 the abstinent group with full remission named on average fewer individual in the csns they had lower social negativity mean score in the support social network compared to the non remitted group d 0 74 in the csn the mean score of social support were significantly higher than the median for both group d 2 50 these finding reveal the complex interplay of relational pattern contributing to the etiology maintenance and recovery from alcohol use disorder a successful recovery can be linked to increased social resource and reduced relation associated with craving however craving associated relation represent an important source of social support future research should investigate this ambivalence for the systemic perspective on the explanation and treatment of alcohol use disorder

background the association between child s exposure to family violence and poor academic outcome is well established le is known about how exposure to violence in the school context i e by teacher and by peer affect academic functioning moreover the role of child s mental health problem in this link ha hardly been examined objective we examined direct and indirect association between child s experience of violence by teacher and peer and child s mental health and school functioning while controlling for child s experience of parental violence participant using a multistage random sampling approach we obtained a representative sample of 914 student 50 5 girl m age 12 58 year from 12 primary school in tanzania method in structured interview student experience of violence and mental health problem were assessed student academic performance and absenteeism were documented using school record association were examined using structural equation modeling result experience of more teacher and peer violence were each significantly associated with higher externalizing problem teacher beta 0 27 95 ci 0 12 0 47 peer beta 0 17 95 ci 0 07 0 32 higher externalizing problem were significantly associated with poorer academic performance beta 0 13 95 ci 0 23 0 02 implying significant indirect association between student experience of teacher violence beta 0 04 95 ci 0 08 0 01 and peer violence beta 0 02 95 ci 0 05 0 01 and their academic performance via externalizing problem conclusion exposure to violence at school may impair child s academic performance indirectly by increasing attention and behaviour problem further investigation in longitudinal study and implementation of intervention to reduce violence in school are indicated

background and objective previous study using modified version of the affect misattribution procedure amp payne cheng govorun stewart 2005 have revealed that there is an implicit negative evaluation bias of illness related information in patient with hypochondriasis hyp which might be a maintaining feature of hyp however there is no evidence on whether this bias might be targeted successfully by effective treatment such a exposure therapy et or cognitive therapy ct this is the first study to examine the change in negative implicit evaluation in a randomized controlled trial including individual ct and et compared to a wait list control group for hyp method an amp with illness symptom and neutral prime wa used in 70 patient with hyp before and after treatment wait list respectively result there wa no significant change in negative implicit affective evaluation in both ct and et compared to wait list however comparison between the two active treatment revealed an interaction effect that only for ct were the affective reaction on illness a well a symptom related prime trial but not neutral prime significantly more positive at post compared to pre treatment in ct but not in et the reduction of implicit negative evaluation bias regarding symptom related prime wa significantly related to the reduction of self reported health anxiety limitation the small subsample size for ct and et in comparison to wait list prohibit the detection of smaller effect conclusion formal cognitive restructuring is necessary for reducing implicit negative evaluation bias in hyp but the latter is not a prerequisite for reducing health anxiety thus the importance of the negative implicit evaluation bias for the maintenance of hyp remains questionable

objective the aim wa to examine the applicability and efficacy of an internet based low threshold psychological intervention for family caregiver with care associated stress method 23 participant were treated in a pilot study with cognitive behavioural and systemic oriented short term intervention sociodemographic a well a psychopathological data were collected at two time point pre post result data show moderate to high level of psychological stress at baseline one way repeated measure analysis of variance show a significant decrease in care associated distress stress anxiety and depressive symptom a well a a significant increase in self efficacy at posttreatmnt conclusion the presented data indicate an effective online based intervention for family caregiver

objective investigating the concordance of prolonged grief disorder pgd criterion that have been recently introduced to the 5th text revision of the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder dsm 5 tr and the international classification of disease 11th revision icd 11 method n 193 treatment seeking bereaved adult were assessed with the prolonged grief disorder 13 9 interview data were examined in term of a diagnostic rate for pgddsm 5 tr and pgdicd 11 including increase of the pgdicd 11 accessory symptom threshold pgdicd 11 x and time criterion pgdicd 11 12 month b dimensionality c the frequency with which single pgd symptom occur and d concurrent validity in term of psychological symptom and loss related characteristic result the diagnostic rate of pgddsm 5 tr 52 wa significantly lower than that of pgdicd 11 76 and agreement between the two criterion set wa moderate kappa 0 51 95 ci 0 47 0 55 increasing the pgdicd 11 accessory symptom threshold did not improve the diagnostic agreement in contrast increasing the icd 11 time criterion led to almost perfect agreement between pgdicd 11 12 month and pgddsm 5 tr kappa 0 91 95 ci 0 89 0 93 confirmatory factor analysis result indicated a one factor model fit best for both pgddsm 5 tr and pgdicd 11 emotional pain symptom e g guilt were predominantly reported by patient with a pgdicd 11 diagnosis while attachment disturbance symptom e g identity disruption were reported more often by patient with a pgddsm 5 tr diagnosis conclusion despite methodological limitation of this study result indicate discordance in pgddsm 5 tr and pgdicd 11 regarding diagnostic rate and single symptom occurrence while the factor structure is similar change in the icd 11 time criterion could reduce these difference psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

background given the high prevalence of clinically relevant premenstrual symptom and the associated impairment there is a need for effective treatment initial evidence suggests cognitive behavioural therapy cbt a an effective treatment for premenstrual dysphoric disorder pmdd the aim of the current randomized clinical trial wa to evaluate an internet based cbt icbt to reduce the burden of pmdd method in all 174 woman with pmdd were recruited via newspaper article flyer and social medium they were randomized to a treatment group tg n 86 or waitlist control group cg n 88 woman of the tg received an 8 week therapist guided icbt data were assessed before and after treatment waiting and 6 month after intervention with prospective symptom diary and questionnaire in the premenstrual phase treatment effect and moderator were analysed using hierarchical linear modelling result significant time x group interaction effect on functional impairment and psychological impairment impact on everyday life symptom intensity and symptom disability in favour of the tg indicated the efficacy of the treatment follow up assessment demonstrated treatment effect to be stable until 6 month after treatment additionally significant interaction with moderator variable were found in the tg higher level of active coping and lower level of support seeking coping were associated with stronger improvement in interference in everyday life and symptom intensity in addition lower level of perceived stress were associated with stronger improvement in functional impairment conclusion the icbt wa highly effective in reducing the burden of pmdd it appears to be particularly important to address coping style and stress management in the treatment

previous research in patient with phobia showed that the administration of glucocorticoid reduces fear in phobic situation and enhances exposure therapy glucocorticoid underlie a daily cycle with a peak in the morning and low level during the evening and night the aim of the present study wa to investigate whether exposure is more effective when conducted in the morning when endogenous cortisol level are high sixty patient meeting dsm iv criterion for specific phobia animal type were randomly assigned to one session exposure treatment either at 08 00 a m high cortisol group or at 06 00 p m low cortisol group participant returned for a posttreatment assessment one week after therapy and a follow up assessment three month after therapy both group showed good outcome but patient treated in the morning exhibited significantly le fear of spider in the behavioral approach test bat and a trend for lower score on the fear of spider questionnaire fsq than patient treated in the evening this effect wa present at posttreatment and follow up our finding indicate that exposure therapy is more effective in the morning than in the evening we suggest that this may be due to higher endogenous cortisol level in the morning group that enhance extinction memory

background extinction of conditioned fear represents an important mechanism in the treatment of anxiety disorder return of fear after successful extinction or exposure therapy in patient with anxiety disorder might be linked to poor temporal or contextual generalization of extinction due to individual difference in brain structural connectivity the goal of this magnetic resonance imaging study wa therefore to investigate the association of context dependent extinction recall with brain structural connectivity method diffusion tensor imaging wa used to determine the fractional anisotropy a a measure of white matter structural integrity of fiber tract connecting central brain region of the fear and extinction circuit uncinate fasciculus cingulum forty five healthy men participated in a two day fear conditioning experiment with fear acquisition in context a and extinction learning in context b on the first day extinction recall in the extinction context a well a renewal in the acquisition context and a novel context c took place one day later result renewal of conditioned fear skin conductance response in the acquisition context wa associated with higher structural integrity of the hippocampal part of the cingulum conclusion enhanced structural integrity of the cingulum might be related to stronger hippocampal modulation of the dorsal anterior cingulate cortex a region important for modulating conditioned fear output by excitatory projection to the amygdala this finding underpins the crucial role of individual difference in the structural integrity of relevant fiber tract for context dependent extinction recall and return of fear after exposure therapy in anxiety disorder

a rescue worker are regularly confronted with potentially traumatising on duty event they have an increased risk to develop trauma related mental and physical health impairment including post traumatic depressive and somatic symptom for this high risk group it could be of particular importance to experience their occupational burden a manageable meaningful and coherent this mindset called sense of coherence may be a potential resilience factor against the development of mental and physical health problem in a cross sectional cohort of 102 rescue worker mdn qd age 26 0 8 5 age range 18 61 including 36 woman we investigated whether higher value on the revised sense of coherence scale soc r predicted lower post traumatic depressive and somatic symptom in addition we evaluated the factor structure of the soc r using confirmatory factor analysis linear regression indicated that higher soc r but particularly manageability score were associated with le post traumatic beta 31 p 009 depressive beta 44 p 001 and somatic symptom beta 36 p 002 furthermore we found that all symptom score significantly increased with occupational and private life trauma exposure the soc r s factor structure wa replicated comprising the three subscales manageability reflection and balance however the soc r s convergent factor validity wa rather low in the present sample taken together a high sense of coherence and in particular a high manageability conviction wa observed a resilience factor for high risk group that are frequently exposed to potentially traumatic event future study might investigate whether strengthening the sense of coherence could be one building block in an effective prevention program for maintaining long term health in risk group

background binge eating disorder bed and major depressive disorder mdd following bariatric surgery are significant predictor for le post operative weight loss and or weight regain however cognitive behavioral therapy cbt addressing these disorder following surgery ha not been investigated so far objective this study examined feasibility of a short term cbt based on evidence based manual for bed and mdd that were adapted to patient following bariatric surgery and investigated it effectiveness in improving weight loss outcome psychopathology and psychosocial functioning material and method in an uncontrolled proof of concept study the cbt manual wa piloted in n 7 patient who had undergone roux en y gastric bypass surgery at least 6 month before weight loss eating disorder psychopathology depressive symptom and self esteem were assessed using clinical interview and self report questionnaire at pre treatment post treatment and in a 3 month follow up result a significant reduction of body weight wa found a well a medium to large effect in the improvement of eating disorder psychopathology depressive symptom and self esteem from pre treatment to post treatment were found most of those change remained stable during the 3 month follow up period study retention wa 71 4 conclusion feasibility and effectiveness of cbt were documented for patient with bed or mdd following bariatric surgery adaptation of the study procedure for proof of efficacy in randomized controlled study are discussed

disgust ha recently been characterized a a low urgency emotion particularly compared to fear the aim of the present study is to clarify whether behavioral inhibition during disgust engagement is characteristic of a low urgency emotion and thus indicates self imposed attentional avoidance in comparison to fear therefore 54 healthy participant performed an emotional go no go task with disgust and fear relevant a well a neutral picture furthermore heart rate activity and facial muscle activity on the fear specific m corrugator supercilli and the disgust specific m levator labii were assessed the result partially support the temporal urgency hypothesis of disgust the emotion condition significantly differed in emotional engagement and in the facial muscle activity of the m levator labii a expected however contrary to our expectation no difference between the emotion condition regarding behavioral inhibition a well a heart rate change could be found furthermore individual with a higher trait disgust proneness showed faster reaction and higher activity of the m levator labii in response to disgust stimulus the result show that different trait level influence attentional engagement and physiological parameter but have only a small effect on behavioral inhibition

in this study the usability and applicability of a mindfulness based online administered gamified short term intervention for people suffering from internet gaming disorder is investigated in a subclinical sample n nbsp nbsp 49 within a four week intervention program room2respawn participant were randomly allocated to a gamified condition experimental or a neutral condition control participant were provided with three intervention session per week consisting of psychoeducation on internet gaming disorder and mindfulness exercise most of the intervention content ha been adopted from a group therapy intervention to an online platform the 39 nbsp participant who participated over the course of the whole intervention rated the usability of the online intervention overall and across all measure a good or very good there wa no evidence for beneficial effect of gamification on motivation when compared with rating from a control condition area of improvement and study limitation are discussed due to an easy applicability and very good usability room2respawn show potential to develop into a low threshold treatment option which after rework need to be put to test on a sample showing clinical symptom of pathological internet gaming nbsp key word mindfulness internet gaming gamification internet gaming disorder usability applicability

objective placebo being prescribed with full honesty and disclosure i e open label placebo olp have been shown to reduce symptom burden in a variety of condition with regard to allergic rhinitis previous research provided inconclusive evidence for the effect of olp possibly related to a separate focus on either symptom severity or symptom frequency overcoming this limitation of previous research the present study aimed to examine the effect of olp on both the severity and frequency of allergic symptom method in a randomized controlled trial patient with allergic rhinitis n 74 were randomized to olp or treatment a usual tau because of the covid 19 pandemic olp wa administered remotely in a virtual clinical encounter participant took placebo tablet for 14 day the primary outcome were the severity and frequency of allergic symptom the secondary end point wa allergy related impairment result olp did not significantly improve symptom severity over tau f 1 71 3 280 p 074 eta2 0 044 but did reduce symptom frequency f 1 71 7 272 p 009 eta2 0 093 and allergy related impairment more than tau f 1 71 6 445 p 013 eta2 0 083 reflecting medium to large effect the use of other antiallergic medication did not influence the result conclusion although olp wa able to lower the frequency of allergic symptom and allergy related impairment substantially it effect on symptom severity were weaker the remote provision of olp suggests that physical contact between patient and provider might not be necessary for olp to work

context and objective association between sex hormone and sleep habit originate mainly from small and selected patient based sample we examined data from a population based sample with various sleep characteristic and the major part of sex hormone measured by mass spectrometry design setting and participant we used data from 204 men and 213 woman of the cross sectional study of health in pomerania trend main outcome and measure association of total t tt and free t androstenedione asd estrone estradiol e2 dehydroepiandrosterone sulphate shbg and e2 to tt ratio with sleep measure including total sleep time sleep efficiency wake after sleep onset apnea hypopnea index ahi insomnia severity index epworth sleepiness scale and pittsburgh sleep quality index were assessed by sex specific multivariable regression model result in men age adjusted association of tt odds ratio 0 62 95 confidence interval ci 0 46 0 83 free t and shbg with ahi were rendered nonsignificant after multivariable adjustment in multivariable analysis asd wa associated with epworth sleepiness scale beta coefficient per sd increase in asd 0 71 95 ci 1 18 to 0 25 in woman multivariable analysis showed positive association of dehydroepiandrosterone sulphate with wake after sleep onset beta coefficient 16 95 ci 0 03 0 28 and of e2 and e2 to tt ratio with epworth sleepiness scale additionally free t and shbg were associated with ahi in multivariable model among premenopausal woman conclusion the present cross sectional population based study observed sex specific association of androgen e2 and shbg with sleep apnea and daytime sleepiness however multivariable adjusted analysis confirmed the impact of body composition and health related lifestyle on the association between sex hormone and sleep

abstract peripheral emotion theory suggest a crucial role of interoception for emotion perception which in turn facilitates emotion regulation laboratory study found positive relation between interoceptive accuracy and perceived emotion intensity and arousal study in natural setting are largely missing but seem important by virtue of emotional experience and regulation diversity on hundred seven participant underwent a cardiovascular interoceptive accuracy task afterwards participant provided detailed information on perceived emotion and emotion regulation strategy in an ecological momentary assessment ema multilevel model were calculated in consideration of valence emotion intensity arousal intensity of body sensation and emotion regulation success were modeled a a function of centered interoceptive accuracy interoceptive accuracy did not predict any emotion perception criterion lower accuracy wa related to a slightly stronger decrease of perceived arousal after regulation difference in emotion category intensity and sample collection might explain divergence to laboratory study

while decade of research have investigated and technically improved brain computer interface bci controlled application relatively little is known about the psychological aspect of brain computer interfacing in 35 healthy student we investigated whether extrinsic motivation manipulated via monetary reward and emotional state manipulated via video and music would influence behavioral and psychophysiological measure of performance with a sensorimotor rhythm smr based bci we found increased task related brain activity in extrinsically motivated rewarded a compared with nonmotivated participant but no clear effect of emotional state manipulation our experiment investigated the short term effect of motivation and emotion manipulation in a group of young healthy subject and thus the significance for patient in the locked in state who may be in need of a bci remains to be investigated

research on behavioural activation ba for depression assumes that increasing the rate of rewarding activity lead to reduced depressive mood although the efficacy of ba treatment ha been convincingly demonstrated assumption referring to the mechanism underlying this effect have not been tested decisively yet the behavioural activation scale for depression and the beck depression inventory ii were administered over 8 week in 161 reliably diagnosed patient with unipolar depression who underwent ba treatment in group time lagged association between behavioural activity on depression at subsequent assessment 1 week later and vice versa were modelled a with multilevel model and b dynamic panel model that eliminate shared constant factor and allow for reverse causation e g depression affecting subsequent activation in the model for activation on depression both activation and depression changed significantly model based within effect size for activation 70 and for depression 75 higher activation and lower depression predict each other over time mixed effect time lagged model but this association disappears in dynamic causal model change pattern were only analysed within a time frame of 1 week smaller time interval were not investigated there were no objective observational data of activity pattern in the present study increased behavioural activity and reduced depressive mood co occur on the week scale they predict each other across time but this may be due to shared cause only

interoceptive threat play a crucial role in the etiology of panic disorder pd while body sensation may become conditioned stimulus c when paired with such interoceptive threat cue conditioning the environment in which such interoceptive threat occur may also be learned a a predictor of threat context conditioning suffocation fear sf might facilitate these associative learning process if threat of suffocation become relevant a unconditioned stimulus u to investigate whether sf affect associative learning during such respiratory threat we used mild dyspnea a c that predicted the occurrence of strong dyspnea u in one context predictable wa not related to the occurrence of the u in another context unpredictable or wa presented in a different context safe in which no u wa delivered startle eyeblink response and subjective report were assessed in 34 participant during learning individual reporting high sf showed a clear potentiation of the startle response during the interoceptive c predicting the occurrence of interoceptive threat u such startle potentiation wa not observed when the c remained unpaired safe or unpredictable context moreover high sf person also showed a significant startle potentiation to the threatening context when the c did not predict the onset of the u no such learning effect were observed for low sf individual the data support the view that defensive response mobilization can be triggered by cue but also by context that predict the occurrence of interoceptive threat if these threat are relevant for the individual supporting learning account for the development of pd

anodal transcranial direct current stimulation tdcs of the prefrontal cortex ha repeatedly been shown to improve working memory a patient with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd are characterized by both underactivation of the prefrontal cortex and deficit in working memory that correlate with clinical symptom it is hypothesized that the modulation of prefrontal activity with tdcs in patient with adhd increase performance in working memory and reduces symptom of adhd to test this hypothesis fifteen adolescent with adhd 12 16 year old three girl and 12 boy were treated according to the randomized double blinded sham controlled crossover design with either 1 ma anodal tdcs over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex or with the sham protocol 5 day each with a 2 week pause between these condition anodal tdcs caused a significant reduction in clinical symptom of inattention and impulsivity in adolescent with adhd compared to sham stimulation the clinical effect were supported by a significant reduction in inattention and hyperactivity in a standardized working memory test qbtest the described effect were more pronounced 7 day after the end of stimulation a fact which emphasizes the long lasting clinical and neuropsychological change after tdcs this study provides the first evidence that tdcs may reduce symptom of adhd and improve neuropsychological functioning in adolescent and point on the potential of tdcs a a form of treatment for adhd

background exercise efficaciously reduces disorder specific symptom of psychiatric disorder the current study aimed to examine the efficacy of a group exercise intervention on global symptom severity and disorder specific symptom among a mixed outpatient sample method group of inactive outpatient waiting for psychotherapy with depressive disorder anxiety disorder insomnia and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder were randomized to a manualized 12 week exercise intervention combining moderate to vigorous aerobic exercise with technique for sustainable exercise behaviour change n 38 female 71 1 n 27 m age 36 66 or a passive control group n 36 female 75 0 n 27 m age 34 33 primary outcome were global symptom severity and disorder specific symptom measured with the symptom checklist 90 revised and pittsburgh sleep quality index pre and post treatment secondary outcome wa the self reported amount of exercise physical activity exercise and sport questionnaire measured pre treatment intermediate and post treatment intention to treat analysis were conducted using linear mixed model linear regression were conducted to examine the effect of the change of exercise behaviour on the change of symptom result the intervention significantly improved global symptom severity d 0 77 p 007 depression d 0 68 p 015 anxiety d 0 87 p 002 sleep quality d 0 88 p 001 and increased the amount of exercise d 0 82 p 001 compared to the control group post treatment difference between group were significant for depression d 0 63 p 031 sleep quality d 0 61 p 035 and the amount of exercise d 1 45 p 001 across both group the reduction of global symptom severity wa significantly predicted by an increase of exercise b 35 p 012 conclusion the exercise intervention showed transdiagnostic efficacy among a heterogeneous clinical sample in a realistic outpatient setting and led to sustained exercise behaviour change exercise may serve a an efficacious and feasible transdiagnostic treatment option improving the existing treatment gap within outpatient mental health care setting trial registration the study wa registered on clinicaltrials gov id nct03542396 25 04 2018

abstract aim alcohol dependency is characterized by alcohol related interpretation bias ibs individual with high level of alcohol consumption generate more alcohol related than alcohol unrelated interpretation in response to ambiguous alcohol related cue however a response bias could be an alternative account meaning that individual with high level of alcohol consumption generate more alcohol related ibs because of a greater baseline tendency to endorse alcohol related response method to test this alternative explanation the present study employed a homograph priming task reliability of which wa also examined the sample included 577 clinically diagnosed alcohol dependent inpatient and 61 control inpatient participant completed a homograph priming task prime homograph with and without an alcohol related meaning target word alcohol and soft drink before commencing their behavioral cognitive treatment at a rehabilitation clinic result contrary to our expectation we did not find an enhanced priming effect in alcohol dependent inpatient moreover there wa no correlation between the priming score and level of harmful drinking audit score conclusion the data provide limited support for the existence of alcohol related ibs possibly because of the low reliability of the priming task the feature of the task and the study s design

background and objective post traumatic stress disorder ptsd is accompanied by altered autobiographical memory am of the traumatic incident itself a well a of non trauma related event several study have shown that trauma exposed individual developing ptsd have a reduced capacity to access specific past event that are not related to the traumatic event compared to those who do not develop ptsd however one study including a group of elderly adult did not find significant difference in am between ptsd and non ptsd participant the present study investigated whether ptsd is associated with impaired am of trauma related and non trauma related memory in the elderly method forty four elderly participant displaced during childhood from former german territory after the end of world war ii wwii were examined this group comprised 19 participant with and 25 participant without ptsd these participant were compared to 23 non traumatized non displaced elderly participant result ptsd non ptsd and non traumatized participant do not differ significantly in their ability to recall specific memory of their past moreover participant with ptsd did not recall more trauma related memory than non ptsd participant limitation the traumatized participant reached for assessment might represent the most resilient individual which might constrain generalizability of our result to other trauma population conclusion this study confirms preliminary evidence that ptsd is not associated with am impairment in the elderly we suggest that aging may alter the relationship between trauma and am impairment in traumatized participant with ptsd which need to be confirmed by longitudinal study

background whereas the majority of bereaved person recover from their grief without professional assistance a minority develops pathological grief reaction etiological model postulate that dysfunctional cognition may perpetuate such reaction the grief cognition questionnaire gcq ass thought after bereavement in nine interrelated domain a short form gcq sf with four domain is often used however an evaluation of the psychometric property of the gcq sf and it utility compared to the gcq is lacking and these instrument have not been validated in german method german bereaved person time since loss 35 3 34 6 month responded to an online survey containing the gcq measure of grief severity grief rumination symptom of depression and anxiety and optimism and pessimism 585 participant 18 78 year 88 woman were included item analysis and confirmatory factor analysis were conducted correlation between the gcq and gcq sf and grief rumination optimism and pessimism assessed construct validity criterion related validity wa assessed by comparing whether the correlation of the gcq and the gcq sf with grief severity wa higher than with anxious and depressive symptom logistic regression and receiver operator characteristic roc compared the questionnaire on their ability to predict probable prolonged grief caseness icg 25 time since loss 6 month result internal consistency for both questionnaire were identical and excellent alpha 0 96 confirmatory factor analysis obtained a satisfactory fit for model with nine and four correlated subscales and respective higher order factor model the gcq and the gcq sf correlated higher with grief severity than with other measure of psychopathology the logistic regression showed a significant association between the gcq sf and prolonged grief caseness of the remaining subscales of the gcq only one subscale others contributed to the prediction the roc analysis showed nearly identical area under the curve conclusion the translated gcq and gcq sf demonstrated very good psychometric property the correlation with grief severity highlight the questionnaire clinical relevance the questionnaire possessed identical diagnostic specificity and sensitivity whenever a timesaving assessment of the most typical grief specific cognition is important the gcq sf represents an alternative to the gcq the original gcq may still be superior when a more detailed description of a bereaved person s cognition is desirable

difficult situation in psychotherapy and how therapist deal with them objective in theory and research it is assumed that therapeutic competence are especially relevant in difficult situation in the present study we collected and categorized situation that psychotherapist subjectively evaluated a difficult additionally we inspected therapist reaction to these situation and considered correlation between situation and reaction method in an online survey 101 therapist described difficult situation and their corresponding reaction the report were analyzed by qualitative content analysis mayring 2015 and resulted in two category system for the difficult situation and the reaction result difficult situation reached from everyday conflict to extreme situation e g threat the most frequent difficult situation were in context of therapeutic frame aspect of disorder and critic demand accusation of patient the most frequent reaction concerned therapeutic frame external help and supportive intervention we found significant correlation between difficult situation due to aspect of disorder and asking for external help conclusion although category were sometimes difficult to isolate and few cognitive behavioral therapist participated the collection of difficult situation can be of help for therapist and their training

background to investigate the powerful placebo effect in antidepressant drug trial and their mechanism recent pioneering experimental study showed that expectation manipulation combined with an active placebo attenuated induced sadness in the present study we aimed at extending these finding by assessing the psychophysiological response in addition to mere self report method one hundred and thirteen healthy female student were randomly assigned to a drug expectation group active placebo positive treatment expectation placebo expectation group active placebo no treatment expectation or a no treatment group no placebo no treatment expectation after placebo intake sadness wa induced by self deprecating statement using the velten method combined with sad music including a rumination phase sadness wa measured using the positive and negative affect schedule expanded form panas x heart rate and skin conductance were assessed continuously result after mood induction and after rumination self reported sadness wa significantly lower and skin conductance level wa significantly higher in the drug expectation group than in the no treatment group the mood induction wa further accompanied by a heart rate deceleration within all group limitation generalizability is limited by sample selectivity and focusing on sadness a a symptom of depression exclusively conclusion expectation induced placebo effect significantly influenced sadness correlated change in autonomic arousal and not only subjectively reported sadness indicating that placebo effect in the context of affect are not merely due to subjective response bias the systematic modification of treatment expectation could be utilized in clinical practice to optimize current therapeutic approach to improve mood regulation

the relevance of a phobia based conceptualization of fear for individual with chronic pain ha been much debated in the literature this study investigated whether patient with highly fearful chronic low back pain show distinct physiological reaction pattern compared with le fearful patient when anticipating aversive back pain related movement we used an idiosyncratic fear induction paradigm and collected 2 different measure of autonomic nervous system activation and muscle tension in the lower back we identified 2 distinct psychophysiological response pattern one pattern wa characterized by a moderate increase in skin conductance interbeat interval ibi increase and muscle tension increase in the lower back this response wa interpreted a an attention reaction to a moderately stressful event the other pattern found in 58 of the participant wa characterized by a higher skin conductance response ibi decrease and muscle tension increase in the lower back according to bradley and lang defense cascade model this response is typical of a fear reaction participant showing the psychophysiological pattern typical of fear also had elevated score on some self report measure of component of the fear avoidance model relative to participant showing the reaction pattern characteristic of attention this study is the first to provide psychophysiological evidence for the fear avoidance model of chronic pain

objective the number of student using prescription drug to improve cognitive performance ha increased within the last year there is first evidence that the expectation to receive a performance enhancing drug alone can result in improved perceived and actual cognitive performance suggesting a substantial placebo effect in addition expecting a placebo can result in lower perceived and actual cognitive performance suggesting a nocebo effect yet the underlying mechanism of these effect remain to be elucidated the aim of our study wa to investigate whether the expectation of receiving a performance increasing drug or a performance impairing drug lead to change in actual and perceived cognitive performance compared to a control group without expectation manipulation method a total of n 75 healthy adult were recruited for an experiment to try cognitive performance modulating drug a participant s actual cognitive performance alertness working memory sustained attention and divided attention using the standardized test of attentional performance tap a well a their performance expectation were assessed participant were randomly assigned in equal number to either receiving a placebo performance increasing nasal spray modafinil or a nocebo performance impairing nasal spray vividrin r or no nasal spray natural history after placebo nocebo nasal spray administration cognitive performance wa reassessed subsequent to the second assessment participant rated their perceived change in cognitive performance a well a adverse symptom result unlike hypothesized a positive or negative performance expectation did not result in change in actual performance corresponding to the induced expectation participant in the placebo modafinil group rated their perceived change in cognitive performance subsequent to the application of the nasal spray significantly better d 1 16 compared to the nocebo vividrin r group additionally participant who expected to receive modafinil felt le tired than participant in the vividrin r group d 0 96 conclusion manipulation of performance expectation affect the perceived change in performance and tiredness but not the actual cognitive performance in healthy adult this may explain why college student use such drug despite their little impact on actual cognitive functioning

this study tested whether the structure of affect observed on the basis of between person bp difference is equivalent to the affect structure that organize the variability of affective state within person wp over time further aim were to identify individual difference in the degree of divergence between the wp and bp structure and examine it association to dispositional and contextual variable neuroticism extraversion well being and stress in 100 daily session 101 younger adult rated their mood on the positive and negative affect schedule variability of five negative affect item across time wa so low that they were excluded from the analysis we thus worked with a modified negative affect subscale wp affect structure diverged reliably from the bp structure with individual difference in the degree of divergence difference in the wp structural characteristic and the degree of divergence could be predicted by well being and stress we conclude that bp and wp structure of affect are not equivalent and that bp and wp variation should be considered a distinct phenomenon it would be wrong for example to conceive of positive and negative affect a independent at the wp level a suggested by bp finding yet individual difference in wp structural characteristic are related to stable bp difference and the degree to which individual affect structure diverge from the bp structure can provide important insight into intraindividual functioning copyright 2014 european association of personality psychology

vulnerability stress model implicate that alteration of the autonomous nervous system contribute to the development of psychosis previous research ha found autonomic arousal alteration in psychotic disorder and at risk individual that are not explained by medication alone to test whether these alteration are associated with the extent of an individual s vulnerability and whether they are specific to psychosis we compared participant with psychosis n 23 first degree relative of individual with psychosis n 21 and healthy participant with attenuated positive symptom n 23 to participant with depression n 24 and healthy control n 24 at rest skin conductance level wa assessed and photoplethysmography wa applied to measure time and frequency domain heart rate variability hrv univariate and multivariate analysis of covariance with perceived stress and psychophysiological value a dependent variable showed significant between group difference for perceived stress p 010 heart rate p 022 time domain hrv index all p 027 and vagal activity p 017 group difference in sympathetic activity were nonsignificant p 069 in an additional analysis with medication a a second between group factor the physiological between group difference remained significant or trend significant all p 060 with the exception of sympathetic activity participant with psychosis exhibited more extreme arousal than the control group first degree relative and participant with attenuated symptom showed comparable autonomic activity to healthy control thus the hypothesized association of an alteration of arousal and vulnerability to psychosis wa not confirmed however particularly low time domain hrv wa found for psychosis with significant difference to healthy control all p 007 and to depression all p 004 with the latter indicating a specificity to psychosis

individual avoid stimulus which are associated with aversive experience to preserve safety however behavioral avoidance also cause impairment and prevents the individual from attaining positive reward little is known about the link between fear acquisition and the development of behavioral avoidance in the presence of potential reward therefore two experiment investigated the impact of fear conditioning on a subsequent gambling task in an experimental group n 30 advantageous choice higher reward probability were linked to a fear relevant stimulus that wa associated with an aversive unconditioned stimulus u during fear conditioning conditioned stimulus c a disadvantageous choice lower reward probability wa however linked to a safe stimulus that wa never associated with the u c in a control group n 25 fear conditioning wa followed by a similar gambling task with novel stimulus a second experiment focused on individual predictor of avoidant decision n 81 compared with the control group individual in the experimental group avoided the advantageous c choice despite fewer gain the predictor analysis further clarified that avoidant decision were pronounced in highly trait anxious participant who exhibited higher fear response on the other hand finding also indicated a reduction in absolute avoidance across the task combined these finding demonstrate that fear conditioning can lead to avoidant decision making especially in vulnerable individual the resulting cost parallel impairment caused by behavioral avoidance such an emotional decision making style may be a link between aversive experience and the development of habitual pathological avoidance introducing reward for approach however may counteract avoidant decision

the aim of this study wa to identify the long term quality of life after severe burn injury in a prospective longitudinal design n 265 burn patient were examined 6 12 24 and 36 month after burn injury a multilevel approach wa used to measure stability and change in self reported health status besides injury related variable self report instrument included measure of quality of life psychological distress personality and specific burn outcome measure fitting of unconditional growth model indicated that there wa significant intra and inter individual variation in self reported physical and mental health short form 12 over the course of 3 year participant reported on average a slight improvement of physical quality of life physical health wa mainly predicted by mobility and level of burn severity variance in mental health status wa mainly predicted by gender mobility neuroticism level of depression and posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd related avoidance thus mobility i e simple ability seems a crucial variable for overall quality of life an early identification and treatment of patient with high level of depression and ptsd related avoidance may contribute to better mental health

objective very brief exposure to masked image of spider stimulus can facilitate approach behaviour towards spider in fearful subject we hypothesized that a similar effect might occur for fear of food in patient with anorexia nervosa an possibly offering a new treatment approach with advantage over other method of food exposure method patient with an n 60 were randomly assigned to one of three experimental condition and received a single session of exposure to either masked and very briefly presented food image clearly visible food image or masked non food image i e household item effect of the three exposure condition on fear of food and food avoidance were examined result contrary to our expectation very brief food cue exposure wa not superior to the control condition regarding fear of food and approach behaviour towards food immediately after the intervention and body mass index four week later conclusion this finding suggests important difference between fear of food in an and specific phobia such a fear of spider the absence of an effect reveals limitation of the very brief exposure method which might be better suited for evolutionarily relevant threat stimulus

to date no longitudinal study have evaluated the predictive value of the two factor of the dual control model sexual excitation se and sexual inhibition si for future sexual function the aim of the present study were to investigate the association between se si and sexual function and estimate their predictive value for future sexual function in a sample of woman overall 2 214 woman participated in a web based survey that assessed se si and sexual function a well a symptom of depression the one and two year follow up survey included 396 and 382 participant respectively correlational analysis and hierarchical regression analysis were conducted to analyze the relationship between predictor and outcome variable four factor of se arousability partner characteristic sexual power dynamic and setting and two factor of si concern about sexual function and arousal contingency a well a symptom of depression and partnership status were significant predictor of concurrent and future sexual function several subscales of se and si contributed to the prediction of future sexual function above and beyond prior sexual function level our study provides the first supportive evidence for the assumption of the dual control model that propensity for low se and high si influence future sexual function

the goal of this study wa to examine the effect of cognitive bias modification training for interpretation cbm i in socially anxious adolescent with mild intellectual disability mid a total of 69 socially anxious adolescent with mid were randomly assigned to either a positive or a neutral control cmb i training training included five session in a 3 week period and each session consisted of 40 training item adolescent in the positive training group showed a significant reduction in negative interpretation bias on the two interpretation bias task after training compared to adolescent in the control training group furthermore in contrast to the control training group adolescent in the positive training reported a significant reduction of their social anxiety symptom 10 week post training

elevated anxiety in obsessive compulsive disorder ocd ha been linked to cortico limbic hyperactivation whereas hyperarousal of the autonomous nerve system an ha inconsistently been found we investigate an functioning during symptom provocation with individually tailored ocd relevant picture in 14 unmedicated patient and 14 control and link it to activation in brain area involved in an regulation in addition to ocd trigger aversive and neutral control stimulus were included both group showed increased skin conductance and heart rate change to aversive control stimulus whereas only patient demonstrated augmented skin conductance response to ocd trigger overall an hyperarousal in patient relative to control wa found at trend level activity in limbic and paralimbic area in ocd patient wa increased to both generally aversive and ocd relevant stimulus whereas dorsolateral prefrontal cortex dlpfc hyperactivation covarying with cardiac response in patient but not in control wa present for disorder relevant trigger only despite the small study group these preliminary finding suggest an hyperactivity during ocd symptom provocation that could reflect arousal to the perceived threatening value of ocd trigger and might mediate elevated anxiety

emotion regulation er via cognitive reappraisal ha been shown to be superior to the use of expressive suppression regarding several aspect of mental well being however a cultural perspective suggests that the consequence of emotional suppression may be moderated by cultural value in order to examine whether this also applies to clinical sample we investigated healthy and depressed german woman and healthy and depressed turkish immigrant living in germany group were compared in term of frequency of er strategy cognitive reappraisal and expressive suppression and with which different aspect of mental well being the same are associated healthy turkish immigrant exhibited a greater er balance frequent use of suppression plus frequent use of reappraisal which wa associated with more positive outcome of expressive suppression in turkish than in german woman none of these difference were found in patient sample both of which showed a greater use of emotional suppression than cognitive reappraisal result suggest that the cultural moderation of the link between emotional suppression and well being is associated with a greater er balance in healthy turkish individual depressed turkish patient may not profit from suppression due to their more rigid use of it

background dialectical behaviour therapy for posttraumatic stress disorder dbt ptsd which is tailored to treat adult with ptsd and co occurring emotion regulation difficulty ha already demonstrated it efficacy acceptance and safety in an inpatient treatment setting it combine element of dbt with trauma focused cognitive behavioural intervention objective to investigate the feasibility acceptance and safety of dbt ptsd in an outpatient treatment setting by therapist who were novice to the treatment we treated 21 female patient suffering from ptsd following childhood sexual abuse csa plus difficulty in emotion regulation in an uncontrolled clinical trial method the clinician administered ptsd symptom scale cap the davidson trauma scale dts the borderline section of the international personality disorder examination ipde and the borderline symptom list bsl 23 were used a primary outcome for secondary outcome depression and dissociation were assessed assessment were administered at pretreatment post treatment and six week follow up result improvement wa significant for ptsd a well a for borderline personality symptomatology with large pretreatment to follow up effect size for completers based on the cap cohens d 1 30 dts d 1 50 ipde d 1 60 and bsl 23 d 1 20 conclusion the outcome suggests that outpatient dbt ptsd can safely be used to reduce ptsd symptom and comorbid psychopathology in adult who have experienced csa

rumination about body weight figure a well a food is common in patient with anorexia nervosa an and may be a maintenance factor of the disorder while rumination can generally be considered a a cognitive affective process food related rumination may be driven primarily by a physiological response to undernutrition in the current longitudinal study we integrate ecological momentary assessment of rumination and affect and a a biological marker of undernutrition plasma leptin level collected from 33 an patient at the very acute stage and again after short term weight restoration patient answered short questionnaire six time per day over two week analysis via hierarchical linear modelling confirmed that rumination is closely linked to affect in an before and after weight restoration rumination about food decreased during weight restoration and wa correlated with leptin level in contrast rumination about body weight figure wa not linked to leptin persisted after weight gain and showed stronger connection with affect this suggests that rumination about body weight figure seems to be a cognitive affective aspect of the disorder but food related rumination may need to be considered from a physiological perspective it is possible that food related ruminative thought reflect a physiological symptom induced by undernutrition similar to well described leptin associated change in physical activity
