it is assumed that patient with psychosis have difficulty indicating clinical symptom accurately in self reported measure the present study investigated the ability of self rating scale to detect symptom of depression in patient with psychosis and aimed at identifying demographic clinical and neurocognitive factor that predict the discordance between self rating and observer rating inpatient and outpatient with psychosis n 118 were assessed for depression by applying two observer rating and two self rating scale we found reasonable correlation score between the rating by patient and observer range r 0 50 0 57 in half of the patient 49 2 the self rating corresponded well with the rating of clinician patient who rated their depressive symptom a le severe than the clinician demonstrated more negative symptom such a blunted affect and poor affective rapport patient who rated their depression symptom a being more severe were characterized by more self reported general psychopathology the concordance rate indicate that self rating of depression can be a valid additional tool in clinical assessment of patient with psychosis however clinician should be attentive to the fact that some patient might have a general tendency to over report symptom and that patient with negative symptom tend to be rated a more depressed in observer rating compared with self assessment

the number of academic student ha risen but there are difference between academic study and vocational training the fit of one s capacity to the demand is important for education success this study investigates what contributes to high school student perception of academic study a being highly attractive a total of 108 high school student prefinal class were asked for their last school grade school related anxiety self efficacy procrastination psychomental capacity according to mini icf app s and to which degree academic study were attractive for them a brief informatory description of either vocational training or academic study wa randomly given followed by again asking for the attractiveness perception of study especially high school student with higher achievement in social science who perceive themselves strong in self efficacy and low in procrastination tend to perceive academic study a even more attractive information about the alternative option vocational training doe not change the attractiveness perception

food craving fc peak are highly context dependent and variable accurate prediction of fc might help preventing disadvantageous eating behavior here we examine whether data from 2 week of ecological momentary assessment ema questionnaire on stress and emotion active ema aema alongside temporal feature and smartphone sensor data passive ema pema are able to predict fcs 2 5 h into the future in n 46 individual a logistic prediction approach with feature dimension reduction via best item scale that is cross validated weighted informative and transparent biscwit wa performed while overall prediction accuracy wa acceptable passive sensing data alone wa equally predictive to psychometric data the frequency of which single predictor were considered for a model wa rather balanced indicating that aema and pema model were fully idiosyncratic

this study explores the difference in child emotion regulation er and parenting between a heterogeneous clinical sample clins and a community sample coms we hypothesized that parent of the clins would report more dysfunctional child er and more dysfunctional parenting regarding the child s negative emotion than parent of the coms further we aimed to predict child er by parenting behavior parent er and mental health parent of child and adolescent aged 6 18 year seeking treatment at an outpatient clinic were compared to a matched sample of parent in a coms n 57 each group a predicted the child in the clinical group were reported to use le reappraisal and more suppression than coms child no difference wa found in dysfunctional emotion parenting between the group reappraisal in parent and supportive reaction to negative emotion predicted reappraisal in child no predictor wa found for child suppression child emotion regulation and parent psychopathology were not associated these result could suggest new element for prevention and intervention program with parent concerning their own emotion regulation and their reaction to negative emotion in child

health and well being have been related to macro level factor such a income income inequality or socioeconomic status with regard to the increasing burden of disease due to mental disorder worldwide the association between the macrosystem and mental distress should be further explored too in this context the subjective evaluation of the macrosystem might play an important role in the present exploratory study we assessed symptom of depression anxiety and stress a well a perceived wealth justice and freedom in population based survey in spain france germany poland russia sweden the united kingdom and the united state of america n approximately 1000 per country the swedish sample presented the lowest symptom rating of depression anxiety and stress and the highest self rated health the result also indicated that the subjective evaluation of the macrosystem matter in respect to mental distress the complete model including the control variable country gender age and education and perceived wealth justice and freedom predicted depression anxiety and stress symptom explained 8 of the variance of each symptom cluster the present result encourage research to consider the macrosystem and the subjective evaluation of macro level factor a a relevant component in biopsychosocial model of mental distress

the covid 19 pandemic greatly disrupted our daily life worldwide people were confronted with health financial and existential fear or trauma like experience recent study have identified an increase in stress anxiety and fear symptom in connection with the pandemic furthermore fear learning process are central mechanism in the development and maintenance of anxiety disorder patient commonly show impairment not only in fear learning but also in it generalization thus pandemic related anxiety may constitute a risk factor for both enhanced fear acquisition and generalization in a pre registered online study with a final sample of 220 healthy university student we investigated whether participant with higher covid 19 related anxiety covid anxiety show impaired fear learning and generalization for this purpose we used a differential fear conditioning paradigm with a traumatic film clip a the unconditioned stimulus u and collected u expectancy a the main measure of interest participant with high covid anxiety show a tendency toward poorer discrimination between the reinforced conditioned stimulus c and the unreinforced conditioned stimulus c during acquisition and significantly poorer discrimination pattern during generalization furthermore participant with high covid anxiety show greater general fear throughout the whole experiment our result show that the subjective effect of the covid 19 pandemic on psychological well being are associated with impairment in both fear learning and fear generalization a expected high covid anxiety lead to poorer performance in stimulus discrimination and greater level of fear which might contribute to a higher risk of anxiety disorder german clinical trial register drks00022761

empathy allows u to share emotion and encourages u to help others it is especially important in the context of parenting where child s wellbeing is dependent on their parent understanding and fulfilment of their need to date little is known about difference in empathy response of parent and non parent using stimulus depicting adult and child in pain this study focus on the interaction of motherhood and neural response in area associated with empathy mother showed higher activation to both adult and child in pain in the bilateral anterior insulae key region of empathy for pain additionally mother more strongly activated the inferior frontal superior temporal and the medial superior frontal gyrus difference between adult and child stimulus were only found in occipital area in both mother and non mother our result suggest a stronger neural response to others in pain in mother than non mother regardless of whether the person is a child or an adult this could indicate a possible influence of motherhood on overall neural response to others in pain rather than motherhood specifically shaping child related response alternatively stronger response to others in pain could increase the likelihood for woman to be in a relationship and subsequently to have a child

background major depressive disorder mdd ha a major impact on public health reduction of depression burden in general population is of greatest importance and might be achieved by implementation of depression prevention measure into routine care we evaluate an online prevention measure a part of a national project aiming to reduce depression in the occupational group of green profession method this two armed pragmatic rct n 360 evaluates the effectiveness of a tailored internet based intervention imi program compared to enhanced treatment a usual the imi program entailed access to one of six guided imis each focusing on different symptom area depressive mood with optional comorbid diabetes perceived stress insomnia panic and agoraphobia and harmful alcohol consumption eligible were entrepreneur spouse family member and pensioner in green profession with adequate insurance status and at least subthreshold depression phq 5 primary outcome wa depressive symptom severity qids sr16 at 9 week post treatment t1 various secondary outcome were assessed at t1 result a small effect of depression reduction d 0 28 95 ci 0 50 to 0 07 wa found at t1 favouring the imi program beta 0 22 95 ci 0 41 to 0 02 p 033 categorical analysis indicated a reduced risk of potential mdd with nntb 28 11 adherence to the imi program at t1 wa exceptionally low limitation result are limited to green profession and representativeness might be restricted by self selection of participant conclusion depression burden in green profession can be reduced by this online prevention measure yet short term effectiveness is restricted by low adherence rate trial registration german clinical trial registration drks00014000 registered 09 april 2018

objective while study mainly provide positive evidence for the efficacy of internet delivered cognitive behavioral therapy icbt for various persistent somatic symptom it remains largely unclear for whom these intervention work or not this exploratory analysis aimed to identify moderator for the outcome between icbt for somatic symptom distres and a waitlist control group wl in a vulnerable target group of emerging adult method based on data from a randomized controlled trial on 156 university student with varying degree of somatic symptom distress who were allocated to either an eight week therapist guided icbt isoma or to the wl we examined pretreatment demographic characteristic health related variable e g somatic symptom duration mental distress e g depression anxiety and cognitive emotional factor emotional reactivity somatosensory amplification a candidate moderator of the outcome somatic symptom distress assessed by the patient health questionnaire phq 15 from pre to posttreatment result somatosensory amplification assessed by the somatosensory amplification scale ssa moderated the outcome in favor of isoma b 0 17 se 0 08 p 0 031 i e higher pretreatment somatosensory amplification wa associated with better outcome in the active compared to the control intervention no significant moderation effect were found among demographic characteristic health related variable or mental distress conclusion our finding suggest that an internet delivered cbt for somatic symptom distress should be preferred over no active treatment particularly in individual with moderate to high level of somatosensory amplification which a a next step should be tested against further treatment and in clinical population trial registration german clinical trial register drks00014375

background and objective the aim of this study wa to test the effect of individual schema therapy st for patient with chronic depression method using a multiple baseline single case series design patient with chronic major depressive disorder n 25 first entered a 6 24 week baseline phase this phase functioned a a no treatment control condition then patient started a 12 week exploration phase during which symptom and underlying schema were explored this phase functioned a an attention control condition next patient received up to 65 session of individual st the beck depression inventory ii bdi ii and the quick inventory of depressive symptomatology qids were the primary outcome measure the bdi ii wa assessed once a week during all phase of the study resulting in 100 repeated assessment per participant on average mixed regression analysis wa used to contrast change in symptom during the intervention with change in symptom during the baseline and exploration control phase result when compared to the no treatment control period the intervention had a significant large effect on depressive symptom cohen s d bdi ii 1 30 cohen s d qids 1 22 effect on secondary continuous outcome were moderate to large limitation the small sample size and lack of a control group conclusion these finding provide evidence that st might be an effective treatment for patient with chronic depression

abstract work overload is highly related to mental health issue online social medium are often used to escape the feeling of overload in the current study 291 employee from various job sector completed an online survey related to work overload addictive social medium use smu and mental health i e depression symptom life satisfaction work overload wa significantly positively associated with addictive smu r 0 209 p lt 0 001 and depression symptom r 0 190 p lt 0 001 the relationship between work overload and life satisfaction wa significantly negative r 0 175 p lt 0 001 moreover addictive smu significantly mediated the association between work overload and depression symptom total effect p 0 002 direct effect p 0 052 and the association between work overload and life satisfaction total effect p 0 006 direct effect p 0 064 the present result reveals that high work overload could foster addictive smu that could impact employee mental health therefore the attention of employee and employer should be attracted to the potential negative consequence of intensive smu the integration of measure such a a temporary social medium detox and enhanced physical activity in the policy of various organization could be an important step to protect employee mental health and to maintain their productivity

the study investigated the effect of unintentional learning of semantically unrelated word pair on event related brain potential two experiment were conducted in whose acquisition phase participant listened to five pair of semantically unrelated word each pair being repeated twenty time in the test phase of experiment 1 these old pair were presented mixed with new pair containing other word in the test phase of experiment 2 a third condition wa added in which the first word in a pair wa one of the word presented during acquisition but the second word wa new in both experiment the second word in new word pair elicited an n400 and a late 550 1000 m frontal positivity the amplitude of the n400 to new second word in experiment 2 wa significantly larger when the first word in the pair wa an old previously learnt word a compared with the condition in which both first and second word were new the result indicate that in addition to a repetition effect unintentional learning of word pair result in building new association between previously unrelated word

this article introduces the freely available bochum emotional stimulus set besst which contains picture of body and face depicting either a neutral expression or one of the six basic emotion happiness sadness fear anger disgust and surprise presented from two different perspective 0 degree frontal view v camera averted by 45 degree to the left the set comprises 565 frontal view and 564 averted view picture of real life body with masked facial expression and 560 frontal and 560 averted view face which were synthetically created using the facegen 3 5 modeller all stimulus were validated in term of categorization accuracy and the perceived naturalness of the expression additionally each facial stimulus wa morphed into three age version 20 40 60 year the result show high recognition of the intended facial expression even under speeded forced choice condition a corresponds to common experimental setting the average naturalness rating for the stimulus range between medium and high

strong evidence link the 5 httlpr genotype to the modulation of amygdala reactivity during fear conditioning which is considered to convey the increased vulnerability for anxiety disorder in s allele carrier in addition to amygdala reactivity the 5 httlpr ha been shown to be related to alteration in structural and effective connectivity the aim of this study wa to investigate the effect of 5 httlpr genotype on amygdala reactivity and effective connectivity during fear conditioning a well a structural connectivity a measured by diffusion tensor imaging dti to integrate different classification strategy we used the bi allelic s allele v l l allele group a well a the tri allelic low functioning v high functioning classification approach s allele carrier showed exaggerated amygdala reactivity and elevated amygdala insula coupling during fear conditioning c c compared with the l l allele group in addition dti analysis showed increased fractional anisotropy value in s allele carrier within the uncinate fasciculus using the tri allelic classification approach increased amygdala reactivity and amygdala insula coupling were observed in the low functioning compared with the high functioning group no significant difference between the two group were found in structural connectivity the present result add to the current debate on the influence of the 5 httlpr on brain functioning these difference between s allele and l l allele carrier may contribute to altered vulnerability for psychiatric disorder

patient with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd experience interpersonal difficulty potentially linked to impaired social cognition we aimed to investigate social problem solving strategy in adult with adhd nineteen patient with adhd and 20 healthy control were assessed with a scenario based battery gauging the ability to understand other people s mental state to recognize interpersonal conflict and to generate and identify optimal i e both socially sensitive and practically effective solution to these conflict furthermore measure of socioemotional and executive functioning were administered patient and control performed on a similar level with respect to theory of mind the generation of the best solution to problematic social situation and the selection of the optimal solution out of alternative however in a fluency task patient generated fewer optimal solution while the number of only socially sensitive only practically effective or irrelevant solution wa comparable in both group the overall ability to freely generate problem solution wa not linked to executive functioning or trait empathy but better generation ability were related to lower social interaction anxiety in the patient only this suggests impaired generation fluency of optimal interpersonal conflict solution in patient with adhd which might contribute to higher level of anxiety in social interaction

proceeding from a biophysical network model the present study hypothesized that glutamatergic neurotransmission across the nmda receptor nmdar play a key role in visual perception and it modulation by acute stress to investigate these hypothesis behavioral and electroencephalographic eeg indicator of partial report task processing were assessed in twenty four healthy young men who randomly received a non competitive nmdar antagonist 0 8 mg kg dextromethorphan dxm or a placebo and concurrently accomplished a stress induction mast or control protocol in three consecutive session saliva sample served to quantify cortisol response to the mast whereas a passive auditory oddball paradigm wa implemented to verify the impact of dxm on the eeg derived mismatch negativity component mmn dxm administration significantly increased mmn amplitude but not salivary cortisol concentration by contrast concurrent mast exposure significantly reduced mmn latency but also increased cortisol concentration with regard to eeg indicator dxm administration reduced visually evoked 30hz to 50hz and induced occipital gamma band activity 70hz to 100hz which wa partly compensated by additional mast exposure however neither the intervention nor eeg activity were significantly associated with behavioral partial report sensitivity in summary the present data suggest that glutamatergic neurotransmission across the nmdar is only one among many determinant of intact visual perception accordingly therapeutic dos of dxm and their inhibitory modulation by stress probably yield more pronounced electroencephalographic a compared with behavioural effect

this study aimed to evaluate four main prediction of the interpersonal psychological theory of suicide ipts the importance of perceived burdensomeness pb thwarted belongingness tb hopelessness h and capability for suicide c for passive active suicide ideation suicide intent and suicide attempt n 308 psychiatric inpatient admitted due to severe suicidality 53 6 female n 165 age m 36 82 sd 14 30 range 18 81 completed self report measure of tb pb h c and suicide ideation a well a interview on suicide intent and suicide attempt tb and pb were associated with passive active suicidal ideation whereas the three way interaction pb tb and h wa not associated with active suicide ideation fearlessness about death in conjunction with active suicidal ideation wa not associated with suicide intent and the interaction of pb tb and c wa neither predictive of recent suicide attempt status nor lifetime number of suicide attempt given the cross sectional nature of the data conclusion on causality should be handled carefully the result challenge the theoretical validity of the ipts and it clinical utility at least within the methodological limitation of the current study yet finding underscore the importance of pb in understanding suicidality

abstract background only recently ha interoception been discussed a a common risk factor for psychopathology recent approach distinguish between the ability to accurately perceive interoceptive accuracy and the propensity to attend interoceptive attention to internal signal objective to examine the latent structure of self reported interoceptive accuracy and attention and their relationship to psychopathology method we used a confirmatory factor analysis to clarify the latent structure of interoceptive accuracy and attention structural equation modeling wa utilized to determine relationship between both ability with internalizing and somatoform symptomatology according to the hitop model kotov et al 2017 data from n 619 person from the german general population were analyzed result interoceptive attention showed significant positive relationship with all psychopathological trait r 221 to r 377 whereas interoceptive accuracy wa negatively associated with internalizing symptomatology r 106 conclusion the present finding indicate that personal belief about interoceptive ability have different influence on psychopathological development

achieving social functioning and achieving social competence are two main objective of psychosocial intervention for people suffering from schizophrenia the present preliminary study present a novel approach of social skill training sst based on the proposal of kopelowicz et al kopelowicz a liberman r p and zarate r 2006 schizophr bull 32 1 s12 23 that link the treatment to seven specific target behaviour social perception social information processing responding and sending skill affiliative skill interactional skill and behaviour governed by social norm thirty one stabilised outpatient were randomly assigned to one of two group sst n 13 or treatment a usual n 18 tau case management medication adherence psychotherapy leisure engagement and family support and were assessed at baseline in cognitive performance clinical symptomatology social cognition and psychosocial functioning these outcome were evaluated across post treatment and at the 6 month follow up appointment sst subject showed improvement in psychopathology social discomfort social cognition self regulation statement during interaction social withdrawal interpersonal communication and quality of life compared with the tau group at the 6 month follow up result were maintained for negative symptom social discomfort and some functioning outcome neuropsychological variable were also examined a mediator of benefit from skill training result support the efficacy of the brief sst for outpatient with schizophrenia and show the need to implement empirically supported intervention in mental health service to enhance patient social functioning and quality of life

background approximately half of all asylum seeker suffer from trauma related disorder requiring treatment among them posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd depression anxiety and somatic symptom there is a lack of easily accessible low threshold treatment taking the cultural background into account culturally adapted cbt ca cbt is a well evaluated transdiagnostic group intervention for refugee using psychoeducation meditation and yoga like exercise objective an uncontrolled pilot study with male farsi speaking refugee from afghanistan and iran wa conducted to investigate feasibility with this ethnic group a group for which no previous cbt trial have been reported method the participant were nine farsi speaking male refugee with m i n i dsm iv diagnosis comprising ptsd major depressive disorder and anxiety disorder treatment component were adapted to the specific cultural framework of perception of symptom cause idea of healing and local therapeutic process before and after 12 week of treatment the primary outcome wa assessed using the general health questionnaire ghq 28 secondary outcome measure were the posttraumatic checklist patient health questionnaire somatic symptom scale world health organization quality of life questionnaire whoqol bref affective style questionnaire asq and emotion regulation scale er result seven participant completed treatment in the completer analysis improvement were found on almost all questionnaire large effect size were seen for the ghq 28 d 2 0 whoqol bref scale d 1 0 2 3 asq tolerating subscale d 2 2 and er d 1 7 with respect to feasibility cultural adaptation seemed to be a crucial mean to promote effectiveness conclusion ca cbt may reduce general psychopathological distress and improve quality of life improvement in emotion regulation strategy may mediate treatment effect more support should be provided to enhance coping with the uncertainty of asylum status and stressful housing condition ca cbt appears to be a promising transdiagnostic treatment serving a an initial low threshold therapy in a stepped care approach

reinterpretation and distancing are two cognitive reappraisal tactic used to regulate one s emotion in response to emotion eliciting stimulus or situation relatively le is known about their differential lasting effect on emotional responding and related neural correlate this functional magnetic resonance imaging study investigated 85 healthy female participating in a 2 day cognitive emotion regulation experiment on the first day participant were instructed to passively look at reinterpret or distance from repeatedly presented aversive picture one week later they were re exposed to the same stimulus without regulation instruction in order to ass lasting effect the main outcome measure comprised rating of negative feeling and blood oxygen level dependent response lasting effect for reinterpretation compared with looking at aversive picture during passive re exposure 1 week later were reflected in stronger activation of the left amygdala the ventromedial prefrontal cortex vmpfc and reduced negative feeling neither distancing compared with looking at aversive picture nor reinterpretation compared with distancing did result in significant effect during re exposure these finding indicate that reinterpretation lead to reduced negative feeling 1 week later which might be mediated by inhibitory vmpfc activation or stronger positive emotion during re exposure however the missing difference compared with distancing question the specificity of the result and the mechanism underlying these two cognitive reappraisal tactic

a tendency to overestimate threat ha been shown in individual with ocd we tested the hypothesis that this bias in judgment is related to difficulty in learning probabilistic association between event thirty participant with ocd and 30 matched healthy control completed a learning experiment involving 2 variant of a probabilistic classification learning task in the neutral weather prediction task rainy and sunny weather had to be predicted in the emotional task danger of an epidemic from virus infection had to be predicted epidemic prediction task participant with ocd were a able a control to improve their prediction of neutral event across learning trial but scored significantly below healthy control on the epidemic prediction task lower performance on the emotional task variant wa significantly related to a heightened tendency to overestimate threat biased information processing in ocd might thus hamper corrective experience regarding the probability of threatening event

with the increasing availability and importance of data the human visual system serf a a critical tool for analysis of pattern trend and relation among those data building on recent translational visual search work in domain like baggage screening e g mitroff et al 2015 and radiology e g wolfe 2016 we explored how different way of representing data value can lead to efficient or inefficient visual processing of the relation between the value in a data pair we asked participant to find a particular relation among the opposite relation e g small large value pair among large small under a variety of common and manipulated data encoding method bullet graph one value a a bar the other a a threshold dash through the bar line graph connected dash graph area graph dash graph line placed where the top of bar in a bar graph would be adjacent bar and separated bar display were divided into quadrant containing 1 5 data pair each for a total set size of 4 20 item participant were asked to quickly indicate which quadrant contained the target data pair the choice of data depiction led to enormous difference in processing efficiency for relation between value ranked fast to slow in the order listed above from flat search slope line graph medium search slope of 69 m pair dash graph and severely steep search slope of 115 m pair separated bar graph one of the most ubiquitous encoding type visual search for relation can be strikingly serial but performance can improve substantially with small change to display exploring visual search and relation processing in the context of data visualization display may provide a rich case study for both basic research on the mechanism of search but also concrete guideline for the student and scientist who use vision to process and convey pattern in data meeting abstract presented at v 2017

this study investigates the predictor of outcome in a secondary analysis of dropout and completer data from a randomized controlled effectiveness trial comparing cbtp to a wait list group lincoln et al 2012 eighty patient with dsm iv psychotic disorder seeking outpatient treatment were included predictor were assessed at baseline symptom outcome wa assessed at post treatment and at 1 year follow up the predictorxgroup interaction indicate that a longer duration of disorder predicted le improvement in negative symptom in the cbtp but not in the wait list group whereas jumping to conclusion wa associated with poorer outcome only in the wait list group there were no cbtp specific predictor of improvement in positive symptom however in the combined sample immediate cbtp the delayed cbtp group baseline variable predicted significant amount of positive and negative symptom variance at post therapy and 1 year follow up after controlling for pre treatment symptom lack of insight and low social functioning were the main predictor of drop out contributing to a prediction accuracy of 87 the finding indicate that higher baseline symptom severity poorer functioning neurocognitive deficit reasoning bias and comorbidity pose no barrier to improvement during cbtp however in line with previous predictor research the finding imply that patient need to receive treatment earlier

objective several study report increased reward sensitivity towards food in overweight individual by contrast data is inconclusive with respect to response inhibition in overweight individual without binge eating disorder bed hence the latter wa addressed in the present study in a group of overweight obese female with and without bed and a normal weight control group without eating disorder method a group of woman with bed n 29 a group of overweight woman without bed n 33 and normal weight female n 30 participated in a pictorial priming paradigm with food item relevant prime and office utensil neutral prime and color blob neutral prime a stimulus increased response priming effect i e priming with switch between stimulus category were taken a indicator of deficient behavioral inhibition result priming effect for neutral prime were moderate and comparable across all group however prime associated with the food task set lead to increased priming effect in both overweight group but effect were comparable for overweight obese participant with and without bed discussion result suggest that early response inhibition in the context of food is impaired in overweight individual compared to normal weight individual

fear learning is a crucial process in the pathogeneses of psychiatric disorder which highlight the need to identify specific factor contributing to interindividual variation we hypothesized variation in the serotonin transporter gene 5 httlpr and stressful life event sle to be associated with neural correlate of fear conditioning in a sample of healthy male adult n 47 subject were exposed to a differential fear conditioning paradigm after being preselected regarding 5 httlpr genotype and sle individual difference in brain activity a measured by functional magnetic resonance imaging fmri skin conductance response and preference rating were assessed we report significant variation in neural correlate of fear conditioning a a function of 5 httlpr genotype specifically the conditioned stimulus c elicited elevated activity within the fear network amygdala insula thalamus occipital cortex in subject carrying two copy of the 5 httlpr s allele moreover our result revealed preliminary evidence for a significant gene by environment interaction such a homozygous carrier of the 5 httlpr s allele with a history of sle demonstrated elevated reactivity to the c in the occipital cortex and the insula our finding contribute to the current debate on 5 httlpr x sle interaction by investigating crucial alteration on an intermediate phenotype level which may convey an elevated vulnerability for the development of psychopathology

while the efficacy of cognitive behavioral treatment cbt approach for childhood functional abdominal pain fap is well established for child outcome only a few study have reported on parent specific outcome this randomized controlled pilot trial analyzed effect of a group cbt on maternal variable i e pain related behavior worry and self efficacy a well a general psychosocial strain method the sample constituted of 15 mother in the intervention group ig and 14 mother in the waitlist control group wlc outcome measure were assessed pre treatment post treatment and at three month follow up result analysis revealed significant large change in maladaptive maternal reaction related to the child s abdominal pain in the ig compared to the wlc i e reduced attention d 0 95 medical help seeking d 0 92 worry d 1 03 a well a a significant increase in behavior that encourage the child s self management d 1 03 in addition maternal self efficacy in dealing with a child s pain significantly increased in the ig a well d 0 92 treatment effect emerged post treatment and could be maintained until three month follow up there were no effect on general self efficacy and maternal quality of life conclusion while these result are promising and underline the efficacy of the cbt approach for both the child and mother further study including long term follow ups are warranted

purpose accumulating evidence suggests an association between patient expectation and treatment success across various type of pain treatment expectation among treatment caregiver however are often neglected despite international treatment guideline only a small minority of chronic pain patient undergo psychological intervention therefore our aim wa to explore expectation among treatment receiver and caregiver especially concerning their attitude towards psychological pain treatment method two hundred ten potential treatment receiver n 85 individual suffering from chronic low back pain clbp n 125 healthy control and 237 caregiver n 75 physician n 64 psychotherapist n 98 physiotherapist provided rating of expected treatment success for standardized vignette describing patient suffering from clbp and undergoing a pharmacological psychological or multimodal pain management program result individual suffering from clbp generally had lower treatment expectation than healthy control both psychotherapist and physician had higher treatment expectation from their own individual treatment approach all participant expected the multimodal approach to be most effective the psychological approach wa expected to be more effective than the pharmacological approach except for the physician who expected both treatment approach to be equally effective conclusion there is an urgent need to clarify under which circumstance and how patient expectation can be altered among individual suffering from clbp our result appear to encourage the implementation of multimodal and psychological pain management approach across various setting we invite clinician to reflect whether their own expectation are in line with the recommendation in international treatment guideline

purpose up to 20 of total knee arthroplasty tka patient remain dissatisfied with chronic pain a the most frequently named cause a pilot study wa conducted to ass the progression of peri operative pain intensity and the parallel development of different psychological factor and coping strategy a well a correlation indicating potential inter relationship method pain psychological impairment fesv be and coping strategy fesv bw were assessed before and after tka day 5 to 31 patient were stratified according to the presence or absence of peri operative pain improvement decreasing pain group 1 69 n 36 persisting pain group 2 31 n 16 group 2 wa additionally tested with the toronto alexithymia scale ta and screening for somatoform disorder som result pain intensity in group 1 decreased from significantly higher pre operative level to significantly lower value at 31 day post operatively whereas group 2 did not show significant change concurrently the psychological impairment parameter anxiety an significantly decreased and the pain coping parameter relaxation significantly increased in group 1 but not in group 2 whereas pre operative pain wa positively and significantly correlated with an throughout time in group 2 it wa negatively correlated with relaxation at day 29 in group 1 concerning ta and som considerable percentage of the participant in group 2 37 5 and 68 75 respectively showed value 50 of those in normal control conclusion parallel or anti parallel and partially correlated development of pain improvement and parameter of psychological impairment or coping strategy after tka suggest a pre operative screening with tool like the fesv be and bw or ta and som questionnaire in order to classify individual for peri operative mental training

blended therapy is a new approach combining advantage of face to face psychotherapy and internet and mobile based intervention acceptance is a fundamental precondition for it implementation the aim of this study wa to ass 1 the acceptance of psychotherapist towards blended therapy 2 the effectiveness of an acceptance facilitating intervention afi on psychotherapist acceptance towards blended therapy and 3 to identify potential effect moderator psychotherapist n 284 were randomly assigned to a control cg or an intervention group ig the ig received a short video showing an example of blended therapy the cg an attention placebo video both group received a reliable online questionnaire assessing acceptance effort expectancy performance expectancy facilitating condition social influence and internet anxiety between group difference were examined using t test and mann whitney test exploratory analysis wa conducted to identify moderator psychotherapist in cg showed mixed baseline acceptance towards blended therapy low 40 moderate 33 high 27 ig showed significantly higher acceptance compared to cg d 27 pone sided 029 low 24 moderate 47 high 30 bootstrapped confidence interval were overlapping performance expectancy d 35 effort expectancy d 44 and facilitating condition d 28 were significantly increased p 05 no effect on social influence and internet anxiety were found p 05 exploratory analysis indicated psychodynamic oriented psychotherapist profiting particularly from the afi blended therapy is a promising approach to improve healthcare psychotherapist show mixed acceptance which might be improvable by afis particularly in subpopulation of initially rather skeptical psychotherapist forthcoming study should extend the present study by shifting focus from attitude to the impact of different form of afis on uptake

negative effect of psychotherapy nep include side effect malpractice and unethical behavior it setting specific frequency and predictor are mostly unknown the two presented study aim to investigate nep and it predictor systematically across different treatment setting in study 1 n 197 patient of a german outpatient center were recruited on average 3 76 year after the termination of psychotherapy in study 2 data from n 118 patient of two german inpatient clinic were collected at admission t 0 discharge t 1 and 9 month follow up t 2 all participant evaluated the negative effect of their previous out or inpatient psychotherapy with the inventory for the balanced assessment of negative effect in psychotherapy and a priori hypothesized predictor at least one side effect wa reported by 37 3 of inpatient t 2 and 15 2 of outpatient at least one case of malpractice and unethical behavior wa reported by 28 8 of inpatient t 2 and 7 1 of outpatient inpatient reported significantly more side effect u 14347 z 4 70 p 0 001 r 0 26 and malpractice and unethical behavior u 14168 z 5 21 p 0 001 r 0 29 than outpatient rate of severe malpractice in the form of breaking confidentiality and physical and sexual abuse were le than 1 in both setting predictor of side effect were prior experience with psychotherapy and current interpersonal difficulty in the outpatient setting and higher motivation for psychotherapy t 0 in the inpatient setting predictor of malpractice and unethical behavior were younger age in the outpatient setting and poor therapeutic alliance prior negative experience with malpractice and unethical behavior and higher outcome expectation in the inpatient setting nep are common in both in and outpatient setting inpatient are at higher risk for the nep than outpatient to safeguard patient wellbeing the systematic assessment and distinction of side effect and malpractice and unethical behavior should gain more attention in research and clinical practice

objective the aim of this study wa to evaluate the role of resource oriented variable such a self efficacy locus of control loc and post traumatic growth ptg in predicting treatment response in older adult with post traumatic stress method fifty eight older adult with subsyndromal or greater severity of war associated post traumatic stress disorder ptsd symptom completed a randomized controlled internet based cognitive behavioural therapy cbt with immediate and delayed treatment group assessment of ptsd severity and resource oriented variable of self efficacy loc and ptg were conducted at baseline post treatment and at a 6 month follow up result result revealed that pre treatment score on measure of internal loc and ptg predicted ptsd symptom severity at post treatment even after controlling for initial ptsd at a 6 month follow up internal loc continued to predict ptsd symptom severity in addition repeated measure analysis of variance revealed that relative to older adult with low internal loc and ptg older adult with high internal loc and ptg respectively did not differ with respect to initial ptsd severity but they showed a more pronounced response to treatment conclusion these finding suggest that greater locus of control and post traumatic growth is associated with greater improvement in ptsd symptom following internet based cbt assessment of these construct may be useful in identifying trauma survivor who are most likely to respond to cbt practitioner point greater internal locus of control and post traumatic growth is associated with greater improvement in ptsd symptom following internet based cbt older adult with initial high internal locus of control and post traumatic growth respectively did not differ with respect to initial ptsd severity but they showed a more pronounced response to treatment it could be assumed that patient with initial functional appraisal could benefit easier and faster from a trauma focused cognitive behavioural therapy compared to individual with lower internal locus of control and post traumatic growth

chronic pain ha high prevalence rate and is one of the top cause of year lived with disability the aim of the present study wa to evaluate the long term effect of a multimodal day clinic treatment for chronic pain the sample included 183 chronic pain patient 114 female and 69 male 53 3 9 8 year who participated in a four week multimodal day clinic treatment for chronic pain the patient average current pain intensity nrs sensory and affective pain pain perception scale and depression and anxiety hads were assessed at pre and posttreatment a well a at three follow ups one month six month and twelve month after completion of the treatment multilevel model for discontinuous change were performed to evaluate the change of the outcome variable improvement from pretreatment to posttreatment and from pretreatment to all follow ups emerged for pain intensity nrs 0 54 d 0 74 affective pain pain perception scale 0 24 d 0 47 depression hads 0 38 d 0 53 and anxiety hads 0 26 d 0 43 all p 0 05 sensory pain a assessed with the pain perception scale did not show any significant change patient suffering from chronic pain benefited from the multimodal pain treatment up to twelve month after completion of the treatment

abstract background research on gender difference ha found that woman relate to negative voice hearing experience with more negative emotion and report more distress due to voice which may be rooted in difference in relating to voice this study used a robust methodology and a large sample to explore gender difference in relating to voice and voice distress method matched sample of male n 124 and female n 124 voice hearer were drawn from a survey for secondary analysis voice severity e g frequency or loudness voice distress and different type of dysfunctional i e passive or aggressive and functional assertive relating were measured group comparison mediation model and network analysis were calculated result female voice hearer reported more severe voice more voice distress more passive and le assertive relating mediation and network analysis yielded evidence for pathway from gender to voice distress via relating and via difference in voice severity conclusion gender difference in the emotional impact of voice can be partially explained by relating behavior psychological intervention for voice hearing could be optimized by exploring the influence of gender in the emergence of distressing voice nevertheless gender difference need to be treated a one of several different possible mechanism when working with individual patient

abstract background human constantly compare their attribute to different reference frame according to the theoretical framework of the general comparative processing model such comparison may be perceived a aversive i e appraised a threatening the motif of the comparer or appetitive i e appraised a consonant with or positively challenging the motif however we lack a measure that adequately capture multi standard comparison method considering appearance related comparison a a relevant comparison domain we introduce the comparison standard scale for appearance cs a that ass appearance related social temporal counterfactual criterion based and dimensional upward and downward comparison regarding their a frequency b perceived discrepancy and c engendered affect we administered the cs a to 1121 participant along with measure of appearance social comparison body satisfaction physical self concept self esteem well being and depression result a two factor model aversive and appetitive comparison fit the data better than a bifactor model with an additional general domain factor comparative thinking the validity of the cs a wa supported by correlation with external validators beyond appearance social comparison and body satisfaction aversive comparison displayed higher association with most outcome than appetitive comparison conclusion overall the cs a offer a psychometrically sound and useful measure of multi standard comparison

about 90 of all mild alzheimer dementia ad case experience neuropsychiatric symptom although some research ha supported the effectiveness of specific psychotherapeutic approach for mild ad there are only few attempt to evaluate a multi component treatment programme this randomized controlled trial evaluates the effect of an integrative psychotherapy approach on the health of patient with mild ad and their caregiver it consists of 25 weekly session including eight module goal setting psychoeducation engagement in pleasant activity cognitive restructuring live review behavior management intervention for the caregiver and couple counselling 50 participant and their caregiver have been randomized to either the cbt based intervention group cbt or to the control group which received treatment a usual tau before and after the treatment phase participant have been assessed follow ups took place at 6 and 12 month post treatment the primary outcome wa depression in the patient with ad the secondary outcome measure were apathy other neuropsychiatric symptom functional ability quality of life and quality of the relationship to the caregiver cbt reduced depression significantly more than tau interaction f 5 3 p 05 with a moderate to large effect size d 0 76 there were also a significant advantage for cbt with regard to apathy f 4 7 p 05 d 0 71 and quality of the relationship to the caregiver f 4 3 p 05 d 0 77 there wa no advantage with regard to other neuropsychiatric symptom functional ability and quality of life the result are very encouraging and stimulate an adequately powered multi center study

replay of hippocampal neural representation during sleep is thought to promote system consolidation of declarative memory how this reprocessing of memory during sleep affect the hippocampal representation itself is unclear here we tested hippocampal stimulus processing i e pattern separation before and after period of sleep and wakefulness in human female and male participant pattern separation deteriorated across the wake period but remained stable across sleep p 0 013 with this sleep wake difference being most pronounced for stimulus with low similarity to target p 0 006 stimulus with the highest similarity showed a reversed pattern with reduced pattern separation performance after sleep p 0 038 pattern separation performance wa positively correlated with sleep spindle density slow oscillation density and theta power phase locked to slow oscillation sleep presumably by neural memory replay shape hippocampal representation and enhances computation of pattern separation to subsequent presentation of similar stimulus significance statement the consolidation of hippocampus dependent memory is causally related to reactivation during sleep of previously encoded representation here we show that reactivation based consolidation process during sleep shape the hippocampal representation itself we studied the effect of sleep and wakefulness on pattern separation i e orthogonalization of similar representation and completion performance i e recall of a memory in light of noisy input that are essential cognitive element of encoding and retrieval of information by the hippocampus our result demonstrate that pattern separation wa stabilized after sleep but diminished after wakefulness we further showed that pattern separation wa related to eeg oscillatory parameter of non rem sleep serving a marker of sleep dependent memory consolidation and hippocampal reactivation

defeatist performance belief dpbs are associated with the severe impairment in functioning of patient with negative symptom of schizophrenia this association ha been found to be mediated by amotivation a core aspect of negative symptom although causality is assumed longitudinal evidence for this is lacking the current study aimed to extend previous finding by investigating both cross sectional and longitudinal association between dpbs motivational impairment and functioning in a sample of patient with psychotic disorder n 58 we hypothesized that dpbs would be related to functioning in cross sectional and longitudinal analysis and that this link would be mediated by motivational impairment data wa assessed at baseline and post treatment in a trial on the effect of cognitive behavior therapy for psychosis at baseline amotivation mediated the association between dpbs and functioning from baseline to post treatment reduction of amotivation wa associated with improvement of functioning significantly whereas reduction of dpbs wa unrelated to improvement in functioning or amotivation the finding suggest that improvement in amotivation account for favorable treatment outcome in regard to functioning but question the causal role of dpbs in negative symptom and functioning

background this study investigated whether pattern of impulsive decision making i differ between individual with dsm 5 substance use disorder sud or non substance related addictive disorder nd and healthy control and ii predict the increase of sud and nd severity after one year method in a prospective longitudinal community study 338 individual 19 27 year 59 female were included in one of three group sud n 100 nd n 118 or healthy control n 120 group difference in four impulsive decision making facet were analyzed with the bayesian prior delay discounting mean 0 37 variance 0 02 probability discounting for gain and for loss each 0 16 0 02 and loss aversion 0 44 0 02 sud and nd severity were assessed at baseline and after 1 year n 312 92 predictive association between decision making and sud nd severity change were analyzed with the bayesian prior mean 0 25 variance 0 016 result compared with control the sud group displayed steeper delay discounting and lower probability discounting for loss the nd group displayed lower probability discounting for loss posterior probability 98 sud symptom increase after 1 year wa predicted by steeper delay discounting and lower loss aversion nd symptom increase by lower probability discounting for loss and lower loss aversion posterior probability 98 there wa low evidence for predictive relation between decision making and the quantity frequency of addictive behaviour discussion impulsive decision making characterizes sud and nd and predicts the course of sud and nd symptom but not the engagement in addictive behaviour strength of evidence differed between different facet of impulsive decision making and wa mostly weaker than a priori expected

for the realm of visual cue it ha been well documented that attention is preferentially oriented toward emotionally relevant cue preliminary evidence suggests that emotional cue from other sensory modality may also steer visual attention toward emotional picture however more research is needed to elucidate the mechanism that are involved therefore a novel design wa used to investigate whether emotional sound promote attentional orientation toward emotional picture to this end 48 participant viewed pair of picture with either neutral or unpleasant content in a free viewing paradigm in addition neutral or unpleasant sound were presented either on the left hand or on the right hand side of the monitor eye movement were recorded a an index of visual spatial attention toward the picture most interestingly position and valence of the sound independently modulated visual orienting towards unpleasant picture for initial capture and sustained attention orienting towards unpleasant picture wa significantly enhanced when any sound wa heard on the same side a the unpleasant picture in addition unpleasant sound irrespective of the side boosted leftward bias of initial attention toward emotionally congruent picture taken together this study clearly show that emotional auditory cue guide visual spatial allocation of attention specifically to emotionally congruent picture psycinfo database record c 2021 apa all right reserved

background the latency to reparation of interactive mismatch interactive repair is argued to regulate infant distress on a psychobiological level and maternal anxiety disorder might impair infant regulation sampling and method a total of 46 dyad 19 mother with an anxiety disorder 27 control were analyzed for association between interactive repair and infant cortisol reactivity during the face to face still face paradigm 3 4 month postpartum missing cortisol value n 16 were imputed analysis were conducted on both the original and the pooled imputed data result interactive repair during the reunion episode wa associated with infant cortisol reactivity original data p 0 01 pooled data p 0 01 but not maternal anxiety disorder p 0 23 additional stepwise regression analysis found that latency to repair during play p 0 01 an interaction between distress during the first trimester of pregnancy and latency to repair during reunion p 0 01 and infant self comforting behavior during the reunion episode p 0 04 made independent contribution to cortisol reactivity in the final regression model conclusion this is the first study demonstrating that interactive repair is related to infant psychobiological stress reactivity the lack of a relation to maternal anxiety disorder may be due to the small sample size however this result emphasizes that infant respond to what they experience and not to the maternal diagnostic category

flavor perception is to a large extent determined by olfaction and person who lost their sense of smell consequently complain about strongly reduced enjoyment of food the retronasal olfactory function is especially important for flavor appreciation the aim of this study wa to compare retronasal function across different culture and to develop a test that is applicable across culture identification of 39 retronasal applied odor probe wa tested in a total of 518 participant of seven country 292 of them were healthy and 226 exhibited a smell disorder a retest wa performed with 224 of the healthy participant furthermore all participant were tested for orthonasal threshold identification and discrimination ability significant cultural difference in identification ability were found in 92 of the probe the 20 probe that could be identified above chance in healthy participant of all country and that could differentiate between patient and control were selected for the final retronasal test this test wa well able to differentiate between control and patient in different country and showed a good coherence with the orthonasal test r 0 80 and a good retest reliability r 0 76 furthermore it is age independent the strong cultural difference observed in retronasal identification underline the necessity to develop a culturally independent instrument this retronasal test is easy to apply and can be used across different country for diagnostics and clinical research

introduction infant body odor is subjectively pleasant to parent and activates reward area in the brain hence body odor perception might contribute to parental bonding however it is unknown whether the perceived pleasantness of child s body odor varies over the course of a child s development method two hundred and thirty five parent m 36 9 year sd 7 3 were asked to ass the personal odor pleasantness of their child n 367 m 9 3 year sd 6 4 result odor pleasantness wa found to decrease a a function of child s age neither sex of the parent nor sex of the child contributed significantly to this effect conclusion we propose that the effect of age related change on personal odor pleasantness reflects olfactory modulation of parental child relationship implication our study suggests that perception of young child s personal odor a pleasant may contribute to bonding and thereby caretaking which is needed to a lesser degree after puberty than before

the theory of reasoned action tora ha been proposed a a framework for cyberbullying prevention design targeting attitude and norm in this study effect of a long 10 weekly session and a short one day four session cyberbullying prevention program based on the tora were compared with a control group over 9 month longitudinal data from 722 student mean age 13 36 on cyberbullying somatic symptom attitude and norm were analyzed within a structural equation model participation in the long intervention group significantly reduced cyberbullying d 0 584 and somatic symptom d 0 316 no between group difference emerged for attitude and norm developmental trajectory and association were found to be a suggested by tora in both cross sectional and change score analysis

background bereavement can result in severe mental health problem including persistent severe and disabling grief symptom termed complicated grief grief rumination i e repetitive thought about the cause and consequence of the loss is a malleable cognitive risk factor in adjustment to bereavement the utrecht grief rumination scale ugrs wa recently developed to ass grief rumination the present study aimed to develop and validate a german version of the ugrs method an online survey including measure of demographic and loss related variable grief rumination ugrs depressive rumination brooding and reflection and symptom of depression anxiety and complicated grief wa administered online among 159 person 87 woman who had lost a first degree relative in the past three year ugrs item analysis a confirmatory factor analysis and association of grief rumination with brooding reflection and symptom level were performed result the internal consistency of the ugrs wa good the confirmatory factor analysis obtained a good fit for a model with five correlated grief rumination subscales the ugrs contributed uniquely to the prediction of complicated grief symptom even when controlling for symptom of anxiety and depression brooding reflection and demographic and loss related variable discriminant validity of the ugrs wa demonstrated by the fact that higher ugrs score were found in participant with a higher likelihood of receiving a diagnosis of complicated grief d 1 60 conclusion the translated ugrs showed very good psychometric property and the correlation with maladaptive ruminative style and complicated grief symptom demonstrated the clinical relevance of grief rumination limitation concerning generalisability of the result are discussed

background many author regard counseling self efficacy cse a important in therapist development and training the purpose of this study wa to examine the factor structure reliability and validity of the german version of the counselor activity self efficacy scale revised case r method the sample consisted of 670 german psychotherapy trainee who completed an online survey we examined the factor structure by applying exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis to the instrument a a whole result a bifactor exploratory structural equation modeling model with one general and five specific factor provided the best fit to the data omega hierarchical coefficient indicated optimal reliability for the general factor acceptable reliability for the action skill revised a r factor and insufficient estimate for the remaining factor the case r scale yielded significant correlation with related measure but also with therapeutic orientation conclusion we found support for the reliability and validity of the german case r however the subdomains except a r should be interpreted with caution and we do not recommend the case r for comparison between psychotherapeutic orientation

child with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder adhd are characterized by symptom of inattention impulsivity and hyperactivity neurophysiological correlate of adhd include change in the p3 component of event related brain potential erps motivated by recent advance towards a more dimensional understanding of adhd we investigate whether adhd related erp marker relate to continuous variation in attention and executive functioning also in typically developing child erps were measured while 31 school child 9 11 year completed an adapted version of the continuous performance task that additionally to inhibitory process also isolates effect of physical stimulus salience child with higher level of parent reported adhd symptom did not differ in task performance but exhibited smaller p3 amplitude related to stimulus salience furthermore adhd symptom were associated with the variability of neural response over time child with higher level of adhd symptom demonstrated lower variability in inhibition and salience related p3 amplitude no effect were observed for erp latency and the salience related n2 by demonstrating that adhd associated neurophysiological mechanism of inhibition and salience processing covary with attention and executive functioning in a child community sample our study provides neurophysiological support for dimensional model of adhd also temporal variability in event related potential is highlighted a additional indicator of adhd requiring further investigation

uncontrollable compared with controllable painful stimulation can lead to increased pain perception and activation in pain processing brain region but it is currently unknown which brain area mediate this effect when pain is controllable the lateral prefrontal cortex pfc seems to inhibit pain processing although it is unclear how this is achieved using fmri in healthy volunteer we examined brain activation during controllable and uncontrollable stimulation to answer these question in the controllable task participant self adjusted temperature applied to their hand of pain or warm intensity to provoke a constant sensation in the uncontrollable task the temperature time course of the controllable task were replayed yoked control and participant rated their sensation continuously during controllable pain trial participant significantly downregulated the temperature to keep their sensation constant despite receiving the identical nociceptive input intensity rating increased during the uncontrollable pain trial this additional sensitization wa mirrored in increased activation of pain processing region such a insula anterior cingulate cortex and thalamus further increased connectivity between the anterior insula and medial pfc mpfc in the uncontrollable and increased negative connectivity between dorsolateral pfc dlpfc and insula in the controllable task were observed this suggests a pain facilitating role of the mpfc during uncontrollable pain and a pain inhibiting role of the dlpfc during controllable pain both exerting their respective effect via the anterior insula these result elucidate neural mechanism of context dependent pain modulation and their relation to subjective perception significance statement pain control is of uttermost importance and stimulus controllability is an important way to achieve endogenous pain modulation here we show differential effect of controllability and uncontrollability on pain perception and cerebral pain processing when pain wa controllable the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex downregulated pain evoked activation in important pain processing region in contrast sensitization during uncontrollable pain wa mediated by increased connectivity of the medial prefrontal cortex with the anterior insula and other pain processing region these novel insight into cerebral pain modulation by stimulus controllability have the potential to improve treatment approach in pain patient

objective deficit in explicit learning and memory have consistently been reported in adult adhd but it is le clear whether these deficit reflect deficient attentional process or specific dysfunction in memory process study on implicit learning and memory which are le dependent on the allocation of attention have rarely been conducted on adult adhd method we implemented a modified serial reaction time task that involves distracting stimulus to investigate implicit sequence learning in 32 adult participant with adhd and in 32 matched healthy control participant result the participant with adhd revealed unimpaired implicit learning performance but they made significantly more error than the control participant there wa no evidence for impaired error monitoring in the participant with adhd reflected by a comparable degree of double error and post error slowing in the two group conclusion reduced efficiency of the inhibition of incorrect response in implicit sequence learning support previous finding of impaired behavioral inhibition in adult adhd

background many study have previously compared the prevalence or sample mean of distress and mental health problem from before to during the covid 19 pandemic while result on change at the individual level and regarding multiple outcome measure are demanded method this online study investigated individual change in stress and mental health from before the covid 19 pandemic to the first lockdown in adult from southeastern germany this region wa selected a it wa where sars cov 2 wa first documented in germany and also due to the implementation of strict stay at home order and social contact prohibition from april 10 27 2020 we collected state measure and their clinical relevance for the subareas of perceived stress worry tension joy and demand we also collected information regarding the following mental health problem depression anxiety pathological worry posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd and health anxiety a well a retrospective measure of how participant felt they have changed in comparison to before the pandemic ranging from worse to better result the analytical sample comprised 396 adult participant on average participant experienced increase in worry tension and lack of joy and increase in mental health problem but a decrease in demand perceived increase in symptom of depression 26 0 and ptsd 25 5 were significantly more frequent than in symptom of anxiety particularly acute fear and panic 5 6 pathological worry 9 8 and health anxiety 7 3 p 001 one per 10 participant 10 4 reported an increase in depressive symptom and nearly two per 10 18 4 an increase in ptsd symptom and additionally showed a clinically relevant symptom strain during lockdown interestingly mainly non specific ptsd symptom associated with a general stress reaction were experienced to be increased conclusion the finding suggest a dissociation of perceived change in subareas of stress and mental health with a particular experience of increase in depressive and general stress symptom and a decrease in external demand this point to a need for a more differentiated view on the impact of the covid 19 pandemic on stress and mental health and for targeted intervention for mental health problem arising frequently during the pandemic

previous research ha shown that food deprivation enhances the acoustic startle reflex when it is elicited during presentation of visual food cue frustrative nonreward may explain this effect since visual food cue are also rated to be more appetitive and arousing during food deprivation however the impact of menstrual cycle and sex on this effect remains unclear and it is also not known whether this effect is influenced by hunger and motivation to eat according to a within study design 20 healthy woman in different menstrual cycle phase and 14 healthy men participated twice in normal and food deprived condition after 18 h of food deprivation acoustic startle wa attenuated by appetitive nonfood foreground picture but enhanced by presentation of food picture no difference between menstrual cycle phase and sex appeared the effect correlated with hunger change suggesting that motivational factor play a role

in phobic individual behavioral response to phobia related cue are facilitated and brain response are augmented it ha rarely been investigated whether this preferential processing is accompanied by an altered conscious perception of phobia related cue we used binocular rivalry to investigate conscious perception of phobia related cue in phobic individual 21 spider phobic patient and 20 non anxious control participant viewed picture of spider or flower each paired with a neutral pattern under condition of binocular rivalry spider phobic patient more often reported that they saw spider picture a the first percept and the total duration of seeing spider percept wa significantly longer in patient than in non anxious participant a second experiment wa conducted to rule out that these difference were caused by different response criterion result support the validity of self report in experiment 1 in sum predominance of phobia related cue in binocular rivalry provides evidence that phobia related cue gain preferential access to visual awareness in phobic individual

background and objective mental disorder have been related to aberration in using novel positive information to revise established negative belief previous research used to make a binary distinction between belief confirming v disconfirming information but recently it ha been examined how varying level of positive information is used to update belief the present study aimed to replicate a recent finding suggesting that positive information that deviate to a large extent from people s prior expectation raise doubt about the credibility of new information and therefore hardly lead to change in expectation method in a heterogenous sample n 144 participant were provided with slightly positive moderately positive or extremely positive information in relation to their prior expectation about other people s behaviour result replicating previous research the present study found that expectation change wa greatest for moderately positive information it also provided evidence for a possible mechanism underlying the inverse u shaped relationship between the positivity of new information and change in expectation extremely positive information wa devalued through defensive cognitive strategy referred to a cognitive immunisation limitation unlike previous research the belief update task used in this study did not show any association with depressive symptom so it is questionable how suitable it is to study biased belief updating in depression conclusion unlike traditional learning model the present result suggest a tipping point above which the discrepancy between expectation and outcome is suspiciously large so that the degree of expectation change decrease

reward for approaching a feared stimulus may compete with fear reduction inherent to avoidance and thereby alter fear and avoidance learning however the impact of such competing reward on fear and avoidance acquisition ha rarely been investigated during acquisition participant chose between one option c option associated with a neutral stimulus followed by an aversive unconditioned stimulus u and another option c option associated with another neutral stimulus followed by no u n 223 randomized into three group in a subsequent test no more us occurred in one group competing reward were established by linking the c option to high reward and the c option to low reward during acquisition and test reward group in a second group reward were present during acquisition but discontinued during test initial reward group in a third group reward were completely absent no reward group without competing reward significant avoidance wa acquired and persisted in the absence of the u competing reward attenuated avoidance acquisition already after the first experience of the aversive u avoidance remained attenuated even when reward were discontinued during test reward did however not change the level of fear response to the c u expectancy skin conductance finally reward did not change the level of fear reduction during test which wa however experienced earlier summarized reward for approaching aversive event do not buffer fear acquisition but can prevent avoidance this damping of avoidance may initiate fear extinction
