larger wind turbine are developed to harvest greater amount of wind energy this development increase the dilemma between ensuring aviation safety through obstruction light and reducing citizen annoyance and possible stress effect caused by obstruction light in this study a unique danish sample is contrasted with a combined german swiss sample stronger stress effect due to the light for the danish sample compared to the german swiss study were found an issue that could be related to the specific technical and site condition the prevalence of strongly annoyed resident wa low significant factor for predicting obstruction light annoyance stress were identified including perceived fairness consideration of the interest of the community landscape change annoyance stress number of visible wind turbine and age it is recommended to enhance the planning process to reduce the stress among citizen e g through improved communication and to enhance the participation of resident in a way that allows for a meaningful consideration of people s concern stress effect from obstruction light at wind turbine are assessed obstruction light can induce strong stress effect under certain condition perceived fairness and stress during planning process are significant predictor distance to wind turbine is not correlated with obstruction light annoyance stress

it wa recently proposed that healthy orthorexia heor and orthorexia nervosa orne should be differentiated the aim of the present study wa to analyze whether the two dimension of orthorexia can be considered new eating style or basically equivalent to restrained eating behavior two sample of university student sample 1 n 460 sample 2 n 509 completed the teruel orthorexia scale tos the dutch eating behavior questionnaire debq and the positive and negative affect schedule panas factor analysis with the tos and debq item together revealed an adequate fit for the preexisting five factor solution tos orne and heor debq restrained eating emotional eating and external eating this result point out that these factor are conceptually distinguishable moreover we tested whether the different eating style presented different pattern of correlation with gender body mass index bmi and age and whether orne and heor predicted positive and negative affect after controlling for restrained emotional and external eating whereas restrained and emotional eating were higher for woman and increased with bmi in both sample heor and orne presented much lower association with these variable orne wa positively related to negative affect and negatively to positive affect whereas heor wa positively related to positive affect again this result support the assumption that orne is a new variant of disordered eating whereas heor could possibly be seen a a protective behavior

patient with borderline personality disorder bpd show deficit in reward guided decision making and learning the present study examined risk taking behavior in combination with feedback processing eighteen bpd patient and 18 healthy control performed a probabilistic two choice gambling task while an electroencephalogram wa recorded option differed in risk but were identical in expected value and outcome probability the feedback related negativity frn and the feedback related p300 were analyzed healthy control preferred low risk over high risk option whereas bpd patient chose both option with equal probability frn amplitude were reduced in bpd but effect of feedback valence and risk did not differ between group this suggests attenuated outcome processing in the anterior cingulate cortex but intact reward prediction error signaling furthermore the modulation of the feedback related p300 with feedback valence and risk wa smaller in bpd patient and decreased p300 amplitude were associated with increased behavioral risk taking behavior these finding could relate to the reduced ability of bpd patient to learn and adequately adjust their behavior based on feedback information possibly due to reduced significance of negative feedback

the outbreak of covid 19 required the re organization of everyday life while some people accepted this challenge other experienced the current situation a a heavy burden that impedes the adaptation to the new life condition the present study investigated factor that can impact the level of burden caused by covid 19 burden depression symptom and frequency of physical activity e g jogging cycling were assessed via online survey in overall 1 931 people from four country germany n 625 italy n 936 russia n 230 spain n 140 similar result pattern were found in all country specific sample burden by covid 19 wa significantly positively associated with depression symptom while it wa significantly negatively linked to physical activity moreover physical activity buffered the association between depression symptom and burden the present cross national finding emphasize the protective effect of physical activity specifically in time of covid 19 this issue should be addressed in governmental program to longitudinally protect mental and physical health and to enhance the willingness to adhere to the anti covid 19 measure among the population

dysfunctional expectation are a particularly important subset of cognition that influence the development and maintenance of various mental disorder this study aimed to develop and validate a scale to ass dysfunctional expectation in posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd the posttraumatic expectation scale ptes in a cross sectional study 70 ptsd patient completed the ptes the posttraumatic cognition inventory ptci a well a measure of the severity of symptom of ptsd and depression the result show that the ptes ha excellent internal consistency and correlate significantly with the ptci and ptsd symptom severity a regression analysis revealed that the ptes explained variance of ptsd symptom severity above the ptci supporting the incremental validity of the ptes while the original version of the ptes comprises 81 item short scale were constructed using the biscuit best item scale that are cross validated unit weighted informative and transparent method the current finding provide preliminary psychometric evidence suggesting that the ptes is an internally consistent and valid novel self report measure in patient with ptsd however conclusion about the psychometric property of the ptes are limited because of the absence of criterion related validity factor structure evidence variability over time response to intervention and test retest reliability future research should use the ptes in large scale longitudinal study to address these aspect to further validate the scale

different individual respond differently to emotional stimulus in their environment therefore to understand how emotion are represented mentally will ultimately require investigation into individual level information here we tasked participant with freely arranging emotionally charged image on a computer screen according to their subjective emotional similarity yielding a unique affective space for each participant and subsequently sought external validity of the layout of the individual affective space through the five factor personality model neuroticism extraversion openness to experience agreeableness conscientiousness assessed via the neo five factor inventory applying agglomerative hierarchical clustering to the group level affective space revealed a set of underlying affective cluster whose within cluster dissimilarity per individual wa then correlated with individual personality score these cluster based analysis predominantly revealed that the dispersion of the negative cluster showed a positive relationship with neuroticism and a negative relationship with conscientiousness a finding that would be predicted by prior work such result demonstrate the non spurious structure of individualized emotion information revealed by data driven analysis of a behavioral task and validated by incorporating psychological measure of personality and corroborate prior knowledge of the interaction between affect and personality future investigation can similarly combine hypothesis and data driven method to extend such finding potentially yielding new perspective on underlying cognitive process disease susceptibility or even diagnostic prognostic marker for mental disorder involving emotion dysregulation

background social anxiety is thought to be strongly related to maladaptive emotion regulation er a social anxiety symptom accumulate in family we hypothesize that maladaptive er is also more prevalent in family with anxious child thus we analyze difference in emotion regulation of both child and mother in relation to social anxiety a well a both their er strategy in dealing with anxiety further a positive relation between child and maternal er strategy is assumed method child aged 9 to 13 year with social anxiety disorder sad n 25 and healthy control hc n 26 a well a their mother completed several measure of social anxiety and trait er strategy towards anxiety a er of child is still in development age is considered a covariate result sad child and their mother reported more maladaptive er strategy than hc dyad maternal maladaptive er wa related negatively to child adaptive er which wa further moderated by the child s age discussion maladaptive er strategy seem to contribute to the exacerbation of social anxiety in both mother and child mother reporting maladaptive er may have difficulty supporting their child in coping with social anxiety while simultaneously also experiencing heightened level of anxiety deeper understanding of interactional process between mother and child during development can assist the comprehension of factor maintaining sad implication for future research and possible consequence for intervention are discussed

importance evidence based treatment for major depressive disorder mdd are not very successful in improving functional and health outcome attention ha increasingly been focused on the prevention of mdd objective to evaluate the effectiveness of a web based guided self help intervention for the prevention of mdd design setting and participant two group randomized clinical trial conducted between march 1 2013 and march 4 2015 participant were recruited in germany from the general population via a large statutory health insurance company ie insurance funded by joint employer employee contribution participant included 406 self selected adult with subthreshold depression centre for epidemiologic study depression scale score 16 no current mdd according to diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder fourth edition text revision criterion intervention all participant had unrestricted access to usual care visit to the primary care clinician and were randomized to either a web based guided self help intervention cognitive behavioral and problem solving therapy supported by an online trainer n 202 or a web based psychoeducation program n 204 main outcome and measure the primary outcome wa time to onset of mdd in the intervention group relative to the control group over a 12 month follow up period a assessed by blinded diagnostic raters using the telephone administered structured clinical interview for dsm iv axis disorder at 6 and 12 month follow up covering the period to the previous assessment result among 406 randomized patient mean age 45 year 73 9 woman 335 82 completed the telephone follow up at 12 month fifty five participant 27 in the intervention group experienced mdd compared with 84 participant 41 in the control group cox regression analysis controlling for baseline depressive symptom severity revealed a hazard ratio of 0 59 95 ci 0 42 0 82 p 002 at 12 month follow up the number needed to treat to avoid 1 new case of mdd wa 5 9 95 ci 3 9 14 6 conclusion and relevance among patient with subthreshold depression the use of a web based guided self help intervention compared with enhanced usual care reduced the incidence of mdd over 12 month further research is needed to understand whether the effect are generalizable to both first onset of depression and depression recurrence a well a efficacy without the use of an online trainer trial registration german clinical trial registry identifier drks00004709

sleep problem are a common complaint among adult in university student international study showed prevalence rate between 4 7 and 36 2 for sleep difficulty and 2 3 of student report nightmare previous study show that nightmare are often associated with insomnia and mental strain but also with gender the goal of this study wa to outline nightmare association with sleep disturbance and mental strain a well a self efficacy among university student an amount of 2196 student 70 9 woman mean age 24 16 year participated in the study sleep characteristic nightmare mental strain and self efficacy were assessed by self report questionnaire analysis revealed that more than 24 3 of surveyed student suffered from nightmare 18 5 reported nightmare more often than once a week and 5 8 suffered from nightmare at least 3 time a week moreover nightmare were associated with symptom of insomnia and low self efficacy wa significantly associated with an increased rate of nightmare besides a total of 52 of student reported fitful sleep

background dysfunctional expectation are considered core characteristic of major depressive disorder mdd and should be focused in psychotherapy dysfunctional expectation are especially pronounced in the interpersonal area social expectation in the present study we examine the effect of unexpected social inclusion expectation violation on the change of generalized and specific depression typical social expectation method we conducted an online study to investigate the impact of social inclusion after a period of social exclusion unexpected social inclusion on social expectation change sample size 144 in a non clinical sample depressive symptom were assessed via self reporting participant took part in two round of the online ball game cyberball in the first round all participant were socially excluded by their two co player acquisition of negative social expectation in the second round participant were either once more excluded expectation confirmation or included equally expectation violation by the same co player specific and generalized social expectation were assessed after each round result specific and generalized social expectation increased following expectation violation even though depressive symptom were related to lower level of social expectation we found that depressive symptom did not moderate expectation change after positive expectation violation conclusion in the present experimental setup including the use of the online ball game cyberball the establishment and change of social expectation can be experimentally manipulated under the given circumstance and in a non clinical sample negative expectation can be updated after unexpected positive experience regardless of the number of depressive symptom the result are discussed in the context of current model of major depressive disorder mdd expectation change and cognitive behavioral therapy

objective this article report on the test retest reliability and sensitivity to change of a set of brief dimensional self rating questionnaire for social anxiety disorder sad d specific phobia sp d agoraphobia ag d panic disorder pd d and generalized anxiety disorder gad d a well a a general cross cutting anxiety scale cross d which were developed to supplement categorical diagnosis in the diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder 5th edition dsm 5 method the german version of the dimensional anxiety scale were administered to 218 student followed up approximately 2 week later study 1 and 55 outpatient 23 with anxiety diagnosis followed up 1 year later study 2 probable diagnostic status in student wa determined by the dia x m cidi stem screening questionnaire ssq in the clinical sample diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorder 4th edition dsm iv diagnosis were assessed at time 1 using the dia x m cidi at time 2 the patient version of the clinical global impression improvement scale cgi i wa applied to ass change result good psychometric property including high test retest reliability were found for the dimensional scale except for sp d in outpatient improvement at time 2 wa associated with significant decrease in pd d gad d and cross d score discussion major advantage of the scale include that they are brief concise and based on a consistent template to measure the cognitive physiological and behavioral symptom of fear and anxiety further replication in larger sample is needed given it modest psychometric property sp d need refinement conclusion increasing evidence from diverse sample suggests clinical utility of the dimensional anxiety scale

background we examined whether the difficulty of patient with somatoform disorder sfds in integrating medical reassurance can be altered by preventing patient from devaluing reassuring information through defensive cognitive strategy method patient with sfd n 60 patient with major depression n 32 and healthy volunteer n 37 watched a videotaped doctor s report which provided medical reassurance for gastroenterological complaint subsequently participant were asked about their perception of the report in the sfd sample patient appraisal of the reassuring wa experimentally modulated in one condition doubt about the validity of the doctor s diagnostic assessment were triggered in another condition the devaluation of medical reassurance wa blocked through underscoring the validity of the doctor s diagnostic assessment and a control condition received no manipulation result a evident on all outcome variable patient with sfd had more difficulty integrating medical reassurance than depressed and healthy people within the sfd sample participant from the experimental condition blocking the devaluation of medical reassurance rated the likelihood of an undetected serious disease to be significantly lower than the other two condition they also reported le emotional concern and a lower desire to seek the opinion of another doctor conclusion by comparing patient with sfd to both a healthy and a clinical control group the current study suggests that the difficulty in processing reassuring medical information is a specific psychopathological feature of sfd furthermore our result suggest that the integration of medical reassurance can be improved by preventing patient from devaluing reassuring information through dismissive cognitive strategy psycinfo database record c 2023 apa all right reserved

objective this study examined the effectiveness of manualized cognitive therapy mct following the clark well approach versus non manualized cognitive behavioral treatment a usual cbtau for social anxiety disorder sad in routine practice method forty eight private practitioner were recruited within a multi center trial and either received training in manualized ct for sad or no such training practitioner treated 162 patient with sad in routine practice n 107 completers n 57 for mct n 50 for cbtau social anxiety symptom liebowitz social anxiety scale lsas and secondary measure were assessed before treatment at treatment hour 8 15 and 25 at end of treatment a well a 6 and 12 month after treatment result patient in both group showed significant reduction of sad severity after treatment d 1 91 mct and d 1 80 cbtau within group effect size intent to treat analysis lsas observer rating which remained stable at follow up there were no difference between group in term of symptom reduction and treatment duration conclusion the present trial confirms the high effectiveness of cbtau and mct for sad when practitioner conduct the treatment in routine practice additional training in the ct manual did not result in significant between group effect on therapy outcome explanation for this unexpected result are discussed

background post stroke depression psd is a severe condition affecting about 30 of stroke survivor within a five year period after stroke post stroke functional impairment fi and social support are associated with psd it is inconclusive whether one of the factor post stroke fi and psd show a stronger predictive value on the respective other over time the aim of the present study were to 1 investigate the relationship between psd fi and social support of stroke patient in a 3 year prospective design and 2 address methodological shortcoming of previous study method we investigated 174 stroke survivor and assessed psd with a structured clinical interview and a dimensional symptom rating scale we conducted regression analysis and applied the approach of multiple imputation mi for missing data due to dropout during follow up result psd prevalence wa 32 2 in the acute phase after stroke individual with a psd in this phase revealed a fivefold higher risk for psd 3 year later fi in the acute phase did not additionally contribute to the prediction of psd at follow up compared to individual without psd in the acute phase individual with psd had an increased risk for fi at follow up limitation regarding sample characteristic design and dropout are discussed conclusion result indicate that psd rather than fi represents a crucial risk factor for negative long term consequence regarding physical and psychological health after stroke post stroke treatment might be optimized by a routine assessment of psd and fi after stroke and considering the result for personalized treatment option

the rising burden of mental and behavioral disorder ha become a global challenge murray et al 2012 measurement invariant clinical instrument are necessary for the assessment of relevant symptom across country the present study tested the measurement invariance of the 21 item version of the depression anxiety and stress scale das lovibond lovibond 1995b in poland russia the united kingdom u k and the united state of america u s telephone interview were conducted with population based sample npl 1003 nru 3020 nu k 1002 nu s 1002 the das 21 show threshold measurement invariance comparison of latent mean did not indicate difference between u k and u s sample however polish and russian sample reported more depressive symptom compared with u k and u s sample the russian sample had the highest level of anxiety symptom and the polish sample demonstrated the highest stress level the das 21 can be recommended to meaningfully compare the relationship between variable across group and to compare latent mean in polish russian and english speaking population psycinfo database record

there is an ongoing debate a to whether traumatization also affect the close relative of trauma survivor who have symptom of ptsd although many study provide evidence favoring a transgenerational transmission other study have not found evidence to support this idea the present study examined whether adult offspring of individual exposed to trauma during forced displacement with n 22 and without ptsd n 24 exhibit an implicit avoidance of stimulus related to the parental trauma compared to child of non trauma exposed control participant n 23 using an approach avoidance task aat offspring participant were requested to push i e avoidance or pull i e approach displacement related and neutral picture whereby response direction depended on a non affective dimension color of the picture result suggest that the offspring of non ptsd participant exhibit implicit avoidance of displacement related stimulus this rather unexpected finding might either indicate resilience amongst offspring of ptsd participant or that offspring of non ptsd participant are particularly affected if these result were to replicate they suggest that implicit avoidance tendency amongst the offspring of trauma exposed participant might partially contribute to their heightened ptsd vulnerability longitudinal study are needed to elucidate whether implicit avoidance tendency are associated with increased stress vulnerability

the dual control model of sexual response proposes two factor sexual excitation se and sexual inhibition si that aim to predict sexual behavior and response while se and si are described a stable trait that influence sexuality related outcome such a sexual function or sexual risk taking only a few study have presented data on the stability of these factor the aim of this study wa to evaluate the temporal stability of se and si and to investigate whether change in sexual function or partnership status influence se and si in a longitudinal sample of woman to address these research question the sexual excitation sexual inhibition inventory for woman sesii w wa administered five time over the course of 4 year the sesii w includes two main scale of se and si which consist of five arousability partner characteristic sexual power dynamic smell and setting and three subscales concern about sexual function arousal contingency relationship importance respectively data from 553 woman m age 31 38 year sd 10 25 range 18 67 who participated in at least two assessment point were included in this study bivariate correlation between baseline and the fifth follow up assessment indicated a high temporal stability of se and si in woman 47 r 71 a series of generalized linear model were conducted to investigate the impact of time change in sexual function partnership status and change in partnership status on se and si partner characteristic se that showed small increase over time across different subscales improvement in sexual function were associated with higher se and lower si change in partnership status and partnership status itself were predictor of one se and three si related scale this study suggests a relatively high temporal stability of se and si in woman and support the dual control model s assertion that both factor are stable individual trait certain life event such a a new partnership or sexual difficulty may however impact time stability of both factor

this large scale study examined the development of time based prospective memory pm across childhood and the role that working memory updating and time monitoring play in driving age effect in pm performance one hundred and ninety seven child aged 5 to 14 year completed a time based pm task where working memory updating load wa manipulated within individual using a dual task design result revealed age related increase in pm performance across childhood working memory updating load had a negative impact on pm performance and monitoring behavior in older child but this effect wa smaller in younger child moreover the frequency a well a the pattern of time monitoring predicted child s pm performance our interpretation of these result is that process involved in child s pm may show a qualitative shift over development from simple nonstrategic monitoring behavior to more strategic monitoring based on internal temporal model that rely specifically on working memory updating resource we discus this interpretation with regard to possible trade off effect in younger child a well a alternative account

extinction learning is considered an important underlying process of successful treatment of posttraumatic stress disorder ptsd however sleep disturbance may impede this learning process current account postulate that sleep facilitates encoding by promoting neural plasticity during slow wave sleep sw based on this hypothesis we tested whether early night sleep with high amount of sw facilitates subsequent extinction learning and recall sixty three participant took part in a trauma adapted fear conditioning experiment one group received a three hour sleep opportunity in the early night half whereas the other group stayed awake thereafter both group underwent extinction training and a return of fear test retention wa assessed after another sleep opportunity in both group linear mixed effect model and bayesian inference did not support the hypothesis of strengthened fear extinction by prior early night sleep subsequent exploratory analysis in contrast point to a role of rapid eye movement sleep in promoting successful fear extinction learning further confirmatory research should re investigate these effect and their implication for the treatment of ptsd

bullying victimization by peer is highly prevalent in childhood and adolescence there is convincing evidence that victimization is associated with adverse mental health consequence in contrast it ha been found that perpetrator suffer no adverse mental health consequence these finding originate from western country such a germany but have rarely been investigated in collectivistic society such a china furthermore it ha been rarely studied whether positive intrapersonal characteristic e g personal resilience and self efficacy and interpersonal positive resource e g social support may mediate the impact of bullying on mental health the current study used a path analytic model to examine firstly whether previous bullying experience both victimization and perpetration are associated with current positive and negative mental health in university student and secondly whether these influence are mediated by social support resilience and self efficacy the model wa tested in 5 912 chinese and 1 935 german university student it wa found that in both country higher victimization frequency wa associated with lower level of social support personal resilience and self efficacy which in turn predicted poorer mental health moreover and only in china perpetration wa negatively associated with social support and personal resilience but not self efficacy in contrast in the german sample perpetration experience wa found to enhance one s self efficacy and the later wa associated with better mental health the result support a mediation model in which social support personal resilience and self efficacy partially mediate the influence of victimization on mental health in both country for the relationship between perpetration and mental health self efficacy wa the only full mediator in germany whereas in china both social support and personal resilience were partial mediator in conclusion peer victimization ha adverse effect on mental health in both germany and china only in china however is perpetration also associated with adverse mental health outcome in contrast getting ahead by bullying in an individualistic society such a germany is associated with increased self efficacy and mental health the difference found between an individualistic country and a collectivistic country have important implication for understanding and planning intervention to reduce bullying

it ha been debated whether working memory wm performance is modulated by the valence of the stimulus that are being processed a recent meta analysis revealed that at the behavioral level and in individual without mental health problem mean level performance difference in wm task with neutral versus affective condition are small to negligible we took this finding an important step further by employing a psychometric approach this is an important refinement of previous work because even in the absence of mean level difference differential processing of affective versus nonaffective information may still be occurring we examined whether at the construct level 2 latent wm factor could be distinguished in capturing the processing of neutral and affective stimulus respectively applying confirmatory factor analysis n 183 university student to a battery of 18 task 3 n back paradigm crossed with 3 stimulus type and neutral v affective valence the 2 factor correlated perfectly this result wa replicated when neutral stimulus were analyzed together with either positive or negative stimulus based on individual difference the processing of affective versus nonaffective stimulus in wm therefore cannot be distinguished at least not in a student sample of younger adult psycinfo database record c 2022 apa all right reserved

background and objective comorbidity between major depressive disorder mdd and alcohol use disorder aud is highly prevalent but reason for this association are unclear rumination may activate metacognitive belief that contribute to the development and maintenance of rumination and depression negative metacognitions can further lead to other dysfunctional coping strategy i e consumption of alcohol we examined whether alcohol reduces state metacognitions rumination and other disorder specific process in a group of individual suffering from mdd method in an experiment with three randomized condition we investigated whether the consumption of alcohol placebo or no alcohol orange juice affect meta cognition depressive symptom and or psychophysiological variable while participant ruminate result voluntary rumination increased self reported sadness tension and rumination tensed facial muscle and increased heart rate but did not affect state metacognitions and heart rate variability the consumption of alcohol did not influence rumination metacognitions depressive or psychophysiological measure limitation we recruited a depressed population but excluded pathological alcohol use due to ethical consideration conclusion we found no evidence that alcohol consumption affect rumination metacognitions and other disorder specific process in mdd however rumination had a negative effect on various depression specific process although it did not activate negative state metacognitions

background and objective negative evaluation process play a pivotal role in the development and maintenance of depressive symptom however it remains to be understood whether evaluation process in depression are impaired by maladaptive goal setting method in a non clinical sample n 50 of individual with high bdi ii score 13 29 and low bdi ii score 0 3 level of depressive symptom goal setting prior to working on a cognitive task wa measured goal feasibility wa experimentally manipulated using an easy and a difficult version of the task result when goal feasibility wa low a high level of depressive symptom wa associated with setting unattainable goal whereas individual with low level of depressive symptom adjusted their goal to a lower more realistic level when task difficulty increased individual with high level of depressive symptom initially adhered to significantly higher goal so that their performance failed to meet their self set standard after depressed individual revised their goal downwards their subsequent performance on the task also worsened limitation the use of a non clinical sample with self reported depressive symptom limit the generalizability of our finding to a clinical population future research would benefit from the use of a larger sample with patient suffering from clinical depression conclusion the finding support the notion that negative evaluation process in depressed individual might be linked with their tendency to generate intractable conflict between self set inappropriate high goal and their own capacity to perform however the finding need to be confirmed in clinical sample to draw conclusion about the role of goal setting in negative evaluation process in depression

objective psychopathy is characterized by severe deficit in emotion processing and empathy these emotional deficit might not only affect the feeling of own emotion but also the understanding of others emotional and mental state the present study aim on identifying the neurobiological correlate of social cognitive related alteration in psychopathy method we applied a social cognitive paradigm for the investigation of face processing emotion recognition and affective theory of mind tom to 11 imprisoned psychopath and 18 healthy control functional magnetic resonance imaging wa used to measure task related brain activation result while showing no overall behavioural deficit psychopathy wa associated with altered brain activation psychopath had reduced fusiform activation related to face processing related to affective tom psychopath had hypoactivation in amygdala inferior prefrontal gyrus and superior temporal sulcus area associated with embodied simulation of emotion and intention furthermore psychopath lacked connectivity between superior temporal sulcus and amygdala during affective tom conclusion these result replicate finding of alteration in basal face processing in psychopathy in addition they provide evidence for reduced embodied simulation in psychopathy in concert with a lack of communication between motor area and amygdala which might provide the neural substrate of reduced feeling with others during social cognition

objective in the past decade variation in outcome between therapist i e therapist effect have become increasingly recognized a an important factor in psychotherapy le is known however about what account for difference between therapist the present study investigates the possibility that therapist basic therapy related interpersonal skill may impact outcome method to examine this psychotherapy postgraduate trainee completed both an observer and an expert rated behavioral assessment the therapy related interpersonal behavior trib trib score were used to predict trainee outcome over the course of the subsequent five year result result indicate that trainee with more positively rated interpersonal behavior assessed in the observer rated group format but not in a single expert rated format showed superior outcome over the five year period this effect remained controlling for therapist characteristic therapist gender theoretical orientation cognitive behavioral or psychodynamic amount of supervision patient s order within therapist s caseload and patient characteristic patient age gender number of comorbid diagnosis global severity and personality disorder diagnosis conclusion these finding underscore the importance of therapist interpersonal skill a a predictor of outcome and source of therapist effect the potential utility of assessing therapist and therapist in training interpersonal skill are discussed

introduction acquired patella baja is often characterized by painful limitation of knee joint range of motion and anterior knee pain akp only few study have evaluated the effectiveness of surgical treatment in term of patient reported outcome measure prom s and sport activity thus the goal of this study wa to ass prom s and sport activity after proximalization tibial tubercle osteotomy p tto in patient with symptomatic patella baja method between 2016 and 2018 a case series of 11 patient male female 4 7 age 48 12 year were treated by p tto and were retrospectively evaluated after a mean of 33 7 month range 24 51 month the tegner activity score and the kujala anterior knee pain scale were used in addition to a visual analogue scale va 0 10 regarding self reported knee joint function and intensity of akp radiographic assessment included the measure of patellar height using the caton deschamps cd and blackburne peel bp index result postoperatively both the cd and the bp index increased to normality p 0 0001 p 0 0012 knee joint flexion improved from 100 32 degree preoperatively to 123 14 degree postoperatively p 0 0235 akp decreased from 6 5 2 1 point preoperatively to 3 7 2 1 point postoperatively p 0 0061 this wa accompanied by a significant increase in self reported knee joint function from 1 8 1 2 point preoperatively to 6 8 2 3 point postoperatively p 0 0001 and an increase of the tegner activity score from 1 8 1 6 point preoperatively to 3 9 1 5 point postoperatively p 0 0074 although the kujala score improved significantly by an average of 31 55 point p 0 001 overall score result remained reduced at 65 6 17 9 point at final follow up conclusion p tto yielded significant improvement in term of akp subjective knee joint function and sport activity however the overall kujala score result remained reduced indicating that surgical correction of patellar height is not sufficient to relieve all patient complaint in addition the incidence of postoperative complication wa high

objective the vigilance avoidance theory postulate a specific threat related pattern of attention deployment characterized by initial orientation towards fear evoking stimulus and subsequent directing of attention away from them the current eye tracking study wa the first to examine the applicability of the theory for patient with eating disorder who perceive their own body a a highly aversive threat evoking stimulus method n 56 female adolescent with anorexia nervosa an and n 43 healthy control hc aged 13 18 viewed own body picture while their eye movement were recorded relative fixation time on self defined unattractive body area were compared between the group by sequencing the overall presentation time of 6 000 m into six interval a 1 000 m result participant with an showed a significantly stronger attentional bias for unattractive body area than hc within the time interval 1 2 and 3 however for interval 4 5 and 6 no significant group difference occurred within the an group the bias for unattractive body area wa significantly stronger in interval 1 compared to interval 4 5 and 6 whereas within the hc group a stable pattern of attention deployment emerged in an early attention deployment wa positively correlated with the negative affect reported after photo presentation discussion the early vigilance in an and the subsequent decrease in attention to unattractive body part is in line with our assumption however no indication of attentional avoidance wa found the current finding partially support the vigilance avoidance theory for the exposure to one s own body in adolescent with an

research from the u s described a decrease of subjective well being and an increase of online medium use in young adult today the present study investigated whether similar trend occur in germany data of overall 1985 university freshman four cohort 2016 n 658 2017 n 333 2018 n 562 2019 n 432 were collected by online survey in the year 2016 to 2019 the comparison of the four cohort revealed a significant increase of depression anxiety and stress symptom a well a of the use of social platform from 2016 to 2019 in contrast positive mental health pmh significantly decreased over the year no significant change of the gaming behavior were found a slight significant positive relationship occurred between the negative variable of well being and online medium use the association between pmh and online medium use wa significantly negative thus cohort trend found in the u s can at least rudimentarily be replicated in germany young adult in 2019 seem to have lower level of well being and to engage in more use of social platform than older cohort

background defeat and entrapment have been shown to be of central relevance to the development of different disorder however it remains unclear whether they represent two distinct construct or one overall latent variable one reason for the unclarity is that traditional factor analytic technique have trouble estimating the right number of cluster in highly correlated data in this study we applied a novel approach based on network analysis that can deal with correlated data to establish whether defeat and entrapment are best thought of a one or multiple construct method explanatory graph analysis wa used to estimate the number of dimension within the 32 item that make up the defeat and entrapment scale in two sample an online community sample of 480 participant and a clinical sample of 147 inpatient admitted to a psychiatric hospital after a suicidal attempt or severe suicidal crisis confirmatory factor analysis cfa wa used to test whether the proposed structure fit the data result in both sample bootstrapped exploratory graph analysis suggested that the defeat and entrapment item belonged to different dimension within the entrapment item two separate dimension were detected labelled internal and external entrapment defeat appeared to be multifaceted only in the online sample when comparing the cfa outcome of the one two three and four factor model the one factor model wa preferred conclusion defeat and entrapment can be viewed a distinct yet highly associated construct thus although replication is needed result are in line with theory differentiating between these two construct

purpose subjective social status ss reflects individual perceived position in a social hierarchy low ss is associated with several mental health impairment the aim of this cross sectional study wa to examine if unemployed individual report lower ss in germany national ss and lower ss in their social community local ss than employed individual moreover the relationship between unemployment ss and mental health wa examined patient and method 113 unemployed and 1117 employed individual from a representative german panel provided information on their national and local ss their monthly income and their mental health ss wa assessed with the german version of the macarthur scale mental health wa measured using the mental component scale mc of the sf 12 result unemployed individual reported significantly lower national ss local ss and mental health compared to employed participant mediational analysis suggest that the negative effect of employment status on mental health wa explained via a reduction of national ss local ss did not mediate the association of employment status and mental health conclusion unemployment is associated with lower ss and reduced mental health the perceived position relative to others in the country ie national ss mediates the association between employment status and mental health
